We loved seeing the zebras and giraffes right outside our balcony (mostly early in the morning or in the evening), and there are ostriches, flamingos, okapi, and many other animals to view throughout the resort. The rooms were a bit smaller than we would have liked, but the thrill of being so close to the animals made up for that. We were too busy to really take advantage of everything the resort had to offer, but there are great restaurants, including Boma (loved the buffet dinner!), and a nice shop, fitness area, and pool. Having a fridge in the room was handy, and Disney resorts just started providing free wireless internet, which was a real bonus. A terrific experience for all ages - we'd stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful”
Reviews.Author: sunshine123456790
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have stayed at Jambo House 3 times now and we truly love it. It's wonderful. The atmosphere, the animals, the pool, the lobby, the staff, the wonderful restaurants - it's all fabulous! I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else, i love this place. Worth every penny and we can't wait to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “A bit of Africa in Florida”
Reviews.Author: DebSylvania_Ohio
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Kidani Village last stay and loved it. I always say that I would love to forgo the Parks and just enjoy the hotel. Nice porch seating areas for viewing the animals. A lot less hustle and bustle than Jambo House. Underground parking was convenient. The studio has a kitchenette and nice for cereal, toast and coffee in the morning. I love the layout of the bathroom, I think it is a bit larger than most of the Disney hotels. It is perhaps the most peaceful of all the Disney hotels. Very nice service.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Disney Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: SLFam
Reviews.Content: Just wrapped up a 5-night stay in a Grand Villa at Kidani Village. This was our first stay at the Animal Kingdom resort and I think this was our favorite resort so far out of the 5 or 6 places we have stayed at WDW. The villa was amazing. 3 huge bedrooms and 4 full baths, as well as 2 living areas and a full kitchen/dining room. And the Savannah views were the icing on the cake. We spent hours sitting out on our balconies (2 levels of them) watching zebras, giraffes and other animals grazing below us. Had we not already had park tickets, we could have easily just hung out in the room for days. We did spend almost a full day at the pool area. The kids had a total blast. It wasn't as crowded as earlier reviews have indicated, although there didn't seem to be anything stopping non-guests from hanging out there. The front desk staff assured us that only guests could get in, but I'm not sure exactly how that was supposed to work, given that the gates didn't require you to use a card to get in. We did try to bypass the regular bus one morning (they were super packed, since the whole state of TX has the same Spring Break) by grabbing a cab one morning. REALLY BAD IDEA! They don't drop you off in front of the park (Magic Kingdom) - they drop you off at the monorail/ferry center, where you have to wait forever to get on one or the other. Take my advice, just wait for the bus - even if you have to take the next one, you'll still save time and $20. If you are able, highly recommend staying here. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great show, but lacking substance”
Reviews.Author: Victaflyer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is large, we booked a Savanna Room, but on check we could not be given a king room. Explanation was that most King rooms had been converted to rooms suitable for disabled and therefore we couldn't have one! This is a big hotel, spread out over a lot of grounds. our room was a good 10 mins walk to reception and another 5 mins to get the car. The room itself was nice, very clean and well up to four star standard. All the staff give you the "Disney" treatment and whilst not Kruger or Tsavo, was great to see the animals from the room balcony and some real effort to follow the African theme. Restaurants are pricy, but the snack bar by the pool was good. There is free Internet, but is slow and very flaky, dropping out frequently. Probably ok for email, but forget loading APP's or music. Good AT&T signal in room. Great for families, but expensive for what it is, couldn't recommend for couples and it put us off staying at another Disney resort, there are just too many better hotels that great value - but if you want the full Disney experience and don't mind the poor value; you should love it.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it for the money”
Reviews.Author: Glen201
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there.stayed in a studio room was clean but very small.beds were horrible pillows were tiny.you would think in a resort hotel like this the beds would be good.my kids had a pull out bed to sleep on funny thing it said on it made just for Disney that's a joke horrible.The room service was bad came back at 2 and room wasn't made up.last thing pool area was nice but pool keep getting closed almost every hour for something with the water quality . I have stayed in many Disney resorts and would never stay here again.oh an if you need a late check out that's not happening. Thanks Glen

Reviews.Title: “A Unique Disney Experience”
Reviews.Author: SharoncPerera
Reviews.Content: The highlight about this hotel is the ability to closely view wildlife from the comfprts of the room. Every morning Giraffes and Zebra's are seeing grazing and by night time we can see ostriches hiding their heads and sleeping. Overall, it was a wonderful experience. The rooms were also spacious and clean. The interior decorations of the rooms were given great detail. Also, the free parking facility for Hotel residents helped us a lot when we visited the disney parks. Wonderful hotel for families. Also the service is extremly friendly and helpful never a word of complain. Only minor mistake is the room service which is just ok with nothing extravagent. But, overall good experience. Will be sure to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Club Level lived up to expectations. Great 6 day stay at AKL!”
Reviews.Author: BrunoBenevolo
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at AKL with our kids (4 and 5 years). Karen the Club Concierge was charming and informative. The morning Club breakfast was great for an early start. We had Club Level rooms with Arusha Savannah views on the fourth floor, next to an observation point, and it was great to see giraffes, zebra, kudus wandering peacefully below (obviously doesn't compare to an adult safari experience in the Kruger, but a good introduction for children). Cleaning staff were friendly and the room was Ok in size for two adults and two children with two sinks in the bathroom. The hotel lobby is beautiful. We were using a Deluxe Dining plan and had a wonderful meal at Jiko's. We had no issue with bus transportation, having to wait at most for 10 minutes. Even when coming back from the Magic Kingdom terrace fireworks buffet at night, we did not face a lengthy queue. I would only recommend hiring a car if you are going to be visiting other parks outside of Disney during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: SandyK
Reviews.Content: Added an additional day onto our trip and got a one stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. We were very impressed with the lobby and outdoor areas. Just beautiful. The room was clean, but it was smaller than the room we had at the Yacht Club. We only spent a few hours in the room as we had spent all day at the park and had to leave mid morning the next day. But our experience at the Animal Kingdom Lodge was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “a real treat”
Reviews.Author: ConnecticutDivegirl
Reviews.Content: Loved it !!! Quiet, relaxing. You'd never know you were at Disney. Could just stay there. The savanna is lovely, lots of animals. We took the wild africa trek at the animal kingdom park and that really enhanced our visit. If you have an Aruschia view room, choose a room on the 2nd floor for the best view of the animals as your view will be obstrusted by trees on the higher floors. Talk to the african ambassadors too. Our goal was an african experience and I think we got it, with american luxury.

Reviews.Title: “The Animals might not be worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Spottedprincess
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Kidani during the Princess Half Marathon weekend. Seeing the animals each day was wonderful. I don't think it was a good trade off for a good nights sleep though. I was in a studio. I could hear the others in each villa next to me so clearly that at times I forgot I was traveling alone. The lay out of the villas is such that the tile kitchen area connects to the adjoining villas tile kitchen area, so the sound travels very well. Too well! To add to the noise factor the hallways echo very badly. So even normal voices are loud in the villas. Then when you have excited, tiried kids running the halls pasted midnight, ( it is Disney however) you can forget having a restful sleep. You must keep your shades drawn for privacy because there are cameras facing the balcony and animals. The rooms are very dark. Then to have to keep the curtains drawn unless you are totally decent added to the " cave" feeling. The room service was great.take note too that depending on where your room is you might have to walk a mile or more to catch the buses to the parks. No kidding! I used my running mileage tracker to measure it. Next time I'll stay somewhere else and take a bus over to view the animals.

Reviews.Title: “Jambo House, Grand Villa”
Reviews.Author: Napanut
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Disney and we were originally booked to stay at Coronado a Disney Moderate Resort. We were updgraded based on our party size and were transferred to Disney's Deluxe Resort Animal Kingdow. The BEST desicion we ever made. The resort was beautiful the grounds and the accomdations were top of the line. The resteraunt BOMA was fantastic and the activities that they have for the kids was great. Be aware that this resort is the farthest from the Parks and the buses tend to run late and take longer. So allow yourself plenty of time for this.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific family option”
Reviews.Author: KristinWA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Animal Kingdom for 5 days and splurged to get the villa, and we're so glad we did. It had plenty of room for us to spread out, a full kitchen that was stocked with utensils and dishes plus pots and pans, a huge bathroom, and a washer dryer (which was so great with smaller kids). We stayed at the Jambo house and got a savanna view. This was really a highlight for our 8 year old. He went on our balcony every day and have us reports on the animals. We had rented a car and parking is free at the hotel and in the parks. It was nice not having to rely on the buses, plus we could go offsite for meals at times. We had room service and ate in Boma, which was good but pricey for picky little eaters. The poolside service was more reasonable and we ate breakfast one morning at Mara, a nice self-serve place on the pool level. There are two pools, one that is smaller but has a big slide and the other is a bigger pool with smaller slide. If you don't stay in the main lodge, it's a bit is a schlep to the room but that's about the only issue with the whole hotel. While the villas cost more, the kitchen and washing machine were really welcome amenities after a long trip. We will definitely stay here next time!

Reviews.Title: “I had high expectations and I wasn't disappointed”
Reviews.Author: super-fan24
Reviews.Content: We were there for the week and loved it. Kids loved waking up in the morning to giraffes, zebras, and many other animals grazing outside our patio (the savannah view rooms are fantastic, but costly). The staff was great and everyone was actively trying to make every experience better. I had two negative remarks: -The shuttle service to the parks starts at Kidani Village and then goes to Jambo House before going on to the parks. Returning from the parks, they go in the same order. The problem with this is that the shuttle fills up at Kidani and then upon the return, they exit the bus first. Buses were very crowded and the trips felt long and difficult. -The rooms are small. My family of four was packed in tightly. Otherwise, a great experience despite the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: tellemarie
Reviews.Content: I only spent two nights in the lodge (Jambo) house, but I'm definitely making this my new home resort. The lobby itself is worth the rate! I arrived very early (around 11am) and immediately my room was ready and I was greeted at the curb by a concierge. My first room was not what I had wanted though (I'm a solo traveler and they had put me in a room with a queen and bunk beds!) but after a quick trip to the front desk they switched my room immediately! The second room was spectacular. I "only" had a view of some of the roofs and the pool, but it was absolutely beautiful. It definitely didn't feel like Florida! Wifi was great (and free!), beds much more comfortable than the value and mods, and it seemed to be much more centrally located than the Port Orleans resorts. I think the longest route we had from the hotel was around 10 minutes. Great timing when you're on a bus! The bathroom is absolutely wonderful, I wish I could have taken it home! On the website the design of the room seems really busy, like it's "too much", but it's definitely not in person. It's a very beautiful room and I definitely made use of it. I also did the "Private Dining" that AKL offers. The food was great (except for the bacon), they brought anything I really could have wanted for the meal, as well as biscuits which is definitely something most in-room dining doesn't offer! They were prompt with delivery and prompt with pick up of the dishes as well. They even let me keep the tea kettle in the room since I was still drinking the tea! Overall I'm obviously very happy with the resort. I never encountered an unfriendly cast member (except for those that were out on the savannah, but they may have just been having a bad day as at Kidani they were very welcoming) and the service was top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Disney Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Kevin R
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this lodge with our two kids (5 and 7). The hotel was very clean, very theme based (lots to see), and it had a great pool area. The staff was SUPER friendly and helpful. The best part was looking out our balcony off our room to see giraffes, zebras, and ostriches walking around the grounds. Nice surprise and real entertainment for the kids. Also great access to the Animal Kingdom and other parks via bus or car. My only complaint would be about the food options. There was a fast food place/deli, a formal restaurant, and an all you can eat place ($36 adult?). The food itself was good but it would have been nice to have an affordable family style restaurant where everyone could sit and eat - but again overall it was a great place to stay. Very grateful for the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for first time visitors to the World”
Reviews.Author: Jackie M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at AKL the 3rd week of March 2011. It was amazing. We are a family of 3 and the rooms were comfortable and quiet. We loved the savanah view. It was really nice to sit on the balcony and watch the zebras and giraffes grazing while my son and husband napped in the afternoon. The beds were very comfortable. Just the right balance of softness and firmness. I also loved the amenities that come with staying at a deluxe resort. A nice variety of toiletries in the room and the variety of restaurants and activities if you spend any time at your resort. The pool and pool slide were great for my young son. I enjoyed dining at Boma as well. We had a family breakfast while there and they have the standard breakfast fare but they also have some more interesting dishes for you to try. If you love animals and want to spend some down time away from the parks, this is the perfect resort.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mad101
Reviews.Content: In saying that the workmanship and design fantastic, staff were great management not so great. We enjoyed the Safari entertaining and informative, the meal after was delicious. We booked a two bedroom villa, which they are nice but we did have some issues here which we are still trying to get resolved through guest relations. Which management should have solved or had better skills. I personally would not stay there again but at another Disney Property, but that is my opinion and I know by reading many reviews other people love it. We however left the Disney property due to management and went to Portifino at Universal Studios and loved it. We also stayed at the Polynesian and loved it there also. It was a shame but we walked away feeling very disheartened with Disneyworld although we did have some fantastic times before, in saying that we are still in the process of working things out with guest relations who have been helpful. The poor rating is due to the management issue it does not really reflect the good size rooms the day to day staff and the view overlooking the animals which was all fantastic. Again though the rooms a little dark too my personal tastes but they are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort”
Reviews.Author: trip252
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge on several occasions the last time was Nov 2011 and we love it> we are DVC members so have also stayed SSR, Boardwalks,Beach Club Villas Caribean Beach and Port Orleans (We are Disney fanatics)> All the resorts have their own special features but we love AKL. it is the ambience of the hotel > that lobby when you arrive is amazing. It is a little away from some of the parks but the buses are frequent and you dont notice. There are only two bus stops so you dont have the lots of stops that you have at the Boardwalks etc. We had an amazing breakfast at Boma and dinner twice at Sanaa which was excellent. We are from England so stay for 2 weeks and never tire of this hotel and the lovely views of the animals. I must say for DVC members that although some of the rooms are bigger at Kidami a DVC part of AKL i much prefer Jambo for the Lobby and proximity to Mara. You can use both pools and both are excellent my Grandson aged 4 loved the childrens fun area at the pool at Kidami.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Enchanting!”
Reviews.Author: Zero2hide
Reviews.Content: We just LOVED this hotel. Typical high quality Disney standard, (which others are still trying to unsuccessfully meet.) African theme is tastefully accomplished, staff were genuine, restaurants authentic. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, value and closer than you think to it all.”
Reviews.Author: wc1208
Reviews.Content: The first thing I thought of before booking was that the distance to the parks was going to handicap our trip, but actually had great bus service and did not hamper our trip at all. We stayed in a standard room and although it was a bit of a walk to the lobby, which we all know how much walking you will do here, it was a beautiful place to stay. You can view the animals from the walkways and make sure to look each morning as you will notice different ones. The staff was knowledgeable about the animals as well as the parks. Our room was very clean, the pool was huge with a nice water slide and movies too. We are heading back this May and will be staying there again. Hint, did you know that you can do your room check-in from your computer in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, beautiful lobby, great views of animals, rooms only average...”
Reviews.Author: xuscotty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a vacation in September. The hotel is great with a breathtaking lobby, beautiful overall design, and wonderful amenties. The room itself was very average, linens clean but nothing to write home about. The overall look and feel of the place makes up for the average room. I would definitely recommend especially for animal lovers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Cambridgegal67
Reviews.Content: This is a really brilliant hotel. We had one week here. We had 3 rooms and although I had booked pool rooms, we were upgraded to savannah rooms. We (and the children) never got bored of the animals. The rooms are beautifully decorated. We loved having a fridge in the room to store fruit and drinks. We were also fortunate to have got a free dining plan for the week for 9 of us from Virgin Holidays. That was a huge saving. The staff were all superb. The only downfall was the 'pigs-ear' of getting a table at the Boma restaurant. You have to book at least 24hrs in advance and even then you are kept waiting for a table. My daughter got married at Cypress Grove whilst we are the Lodge.We had ordered 6 red roses from the garden and despite many calls to the front desk-they never arrived. That was a shame but we didnt complain because we were lucky to have had the upgrade. We ate at Sanaa restaurant after the wedding and it was a perfect decision. We had a few extras thrown in for us and an african band playing. The food was excellent and certainly better then Boma or Jiko. Jiko was a bitter disappointment. Very expensive and very bland.A rather grumpy waiter too. But having said that, the whole restaurant is brilliant. there are plenty of things for the children to see and do and all the rangers around the animals spend endless hours talking to them. We enjoyed the tales round the fire too. We went on to do the Disney Cruise and then a villa in Kissimee, the hotel was the best. I would definitely recommend it for all ages.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: MsFleurDeLis
Reviews.Content: Love the hotel! Love having the animals right outside our balcony. The grandchildren really enjoyed the pool and the night vision! Room was a little small for three adults and two small children.

Reviews.Title: “Guest Service”
Reviews.Author: EliciaMarie
Reviews.Content: I got very sick half way through the trip. I was very upset that I couldn't go to the park. I was waiting outside for the bus to take me to the medi-centre and one of the employees asked me what was wrong. She gave me a hug and asked for my room number. The hug alone made me feel better, but when I got back to my room, she had left an autographed picture of Minnie Mouse, a Disney picture frame and a magnet. She made my day.

Reviews.Title: “Admittedly, I'm particular but I try to like everything.”
Reviews.Author: Bella A
Reviews.Content: First trip to wdw and chose to stay on property so we could take advantage of extended park hours for guests. I love clean, comfortable and luxurious accommodations and tried to select the nicest hotel here. The grounds are lovely, the animals are fantastic, the lobby is beautiful. However, the rooms are 3 star at best. It wreaks of cleaning solution masking what I think is urine, the sheets and pillows are sub par, the bed creaks, the bathroom is small and has hair in it, attention to detail is lacking in the hallways and rooms, there are no screens on the windows and the vending machines don't sell water. We're staying in a club room, but it's closed for the night. I want it to be great, I would willingly pay for great, but this is just okay.

Reviews.Title: “You feel at home”
Reviews.Author: dalytravels
Reviews.Content: At the moment you walk into the lobby you feel welcome. The warm colors and right amount of sunlight fills the space and you know you are on vacation. The quick service food space called the Mara has just the right amount of healthy food and snacks. The zebras, giraffes and other animals can be viewed from multiple areas around the resort. When the sun goes down, ask to use the night vision goggles so you can see the animals. The pool is always clean and the pool deck is spotless. The rooms are spacious for all your luggage. Housekeeping was really good and came right away if you needed anything. The phones were picked up promptly by the front desk. The Bell Stand cast members were very accomodating, courteous and friendly. I had no problem with cell service or using my ipad. Restaurants in the hotel are beautiful and the food is really good. They had some organized activities for children and we especially liked the marshmellow roast on an open fire near the pool in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time Again”
Reviews.Author: AmericasGreat
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay and it was even better than the first. More expensive now but worth all the money spent. Excellent experience. Kids loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing retreat”
Reviews.Author: Aubreyek
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 8 days at AKL with our 4 year old and 6 week old daughters. Knowing we would be taking it a little bit easier this trip with a little one, I booked AKL hoping to have a wonderful place to relax. It absolutely lived up to our expectations. We had an Arusha Savannah view and my daughter loved watching all of the animals. Our favorite was the baby giraffe and of course, the zebras. Pros: Great views, Fantastic restaurants (Boma is awesome), great pool Cons: It's bus access to all parks. Unfortunately, the bus left us waiting quite a few times going back and forth to Magic Kingdom. Nothing like taking an hour and a half from the time you leave the park to the time you get back to your hotel in the middle of the day for a nap. Not fun. I would also describe our room as VERY humid, even in February.We had to open the balcony doors while we slept because it would get so stuffy.

Reviews.Title: “No Complains!”
Reviews.Author: EMMW232431
Reviews.Content: This was our first time visiting Disney and staying in a resort on site. We had a group of 11. Some ordered a pool view room and we chose a standard to avoid noise of the pool. Turned out we had the best view from our balcony: animals strolling around our backyard and we had the upclose and personal view of them. Kids were thrilled. We stayed at room 2516 so any rooms close by and on that side, you will get a 'Savanna' view, without having to upgrade. The lobby is more beautiful than it's in pictures. Boma is a great place to enjoy African buffet. But always a long line up. Room is clean. We had enjoyed different animal towels every day. Beds were comfortable. Really, for a good night sleep after a long hot day out, there isn't anything else we could ask for. The only things is that it took over 30 minutes sometimes to bus to Magical Kingdom. But with the views and everything, it worths the stay. We also walked to Kidani Village for dinner at Sanna. Excellent experience. Saw more animals while waiting for our seats. Food was great.

Reviews.Title: “The cleaners suck and they stole my medical review book”
Reviews.Author: estherpmd
Reviews.Content: my medical review book for my licencing exam was stolen by the cleaners from the room. I left it on the table, they cleared the table and stole or disposed of the book on Thursday 23rd Febuary 2012. They did not even do a good job cleaning and were very rude when I asked them if they could clean the room while I was in the room on Wednesday 22nd Febuary....I have my medical board exam in 1 week and my Medical review book is gone...This is my life. I am so disappointed. I made so many notes and wrote mnemonics and stuff that would come on the exam ...months of notes/ imp info added to this book. I never took that book out of that room its a very colorful book full of pictures.... I personally feel it was stolen spitefully. I did nothing to deserve this. Esther Raja

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: 2banonymous1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for half of a trip to Disney World between the end of December 2011 and the beginning of January 2012. We wanted a Savannah view room and wanted the bunk beds so that our kids would each have their own bed (and we wouldn't have to hear them complain about one kicking the other or hogging the bed). This room was very nice, and we probably wouldn't have noticed anything except that we stayed at the Floridays for the other half of our trip. The rooms at the Floridays were 1/3 to 1/5 of the price of the Animal Kingdom Lodge and we had what seemed like four times as much space. The savannah view bunk bed room at the Animal Kingdom Lodge is your average-size hotel room. But, by the time you squeeze a bunk bed in it, along with a queen bed, there was barely any room for the four of us to move. I'm glad we didn't stay here the entire time. It would have been very cramped. We did the Wanyama Safari for dinner one night. It is loads of fun and is only available to AKL guests. Even our 8 and 10 year-old picky eaters loved it (especially the bottomless Shirley Temples and endless plates of homemade mac and cheese). This alone made staying at AKL worth it. On the Wanyama Safari, you get a "private safari" with 8 to 10 people and your own guide through the entire AKL properties. Then, you eat a wine pairing dinner at Jiko and even get personal attention from the chef. So, if you do decide to stay at the AKL, you have to try the Wanyama Safari.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Aaron M
Reviews.Content: Always love staying at this hotel. Service is 5 star and the whole property is beautiful. The price needs to come down a bit, same with the buffet. Walking distance from Animal Kingdom was a plus as well!

Reviews.Title: “An experience...”
Reviews.Author: RRM1020
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Animal Kingdom Lodge is an experience. Get a savana room if you could, just seeing animals as you wake up in the morning or nocturnal animals going for a stroll at night. The set up is fascinating. You do get a feeling of being in Africa while at the hotel. A bit far from the parks but close enough for a quick bus ride. We never waited more than 10-15 minutes for a bus. The hotel lobby and restaurants were very nice especially the bar on the second floor. I wasn't impressed by our dinner at Boma. Limited menu and wine selection. Just our taste but lively and a nice looking restaurant. We wish we had reserved a day to hang out at the hotel as they do a good job with children activities. We highly recommend a stay here at least once! Will definitely return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Mary V
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at Disney's Beach Club resort but our family decided to try something different. We stayed on the concierge floor. As soon as we arrived we were escorted to a separate floor to be checked in. Our room looked over the savannah where we saw a few animals almost all of the time. Most of the concierge rooms are located on a different level from the food but it was a very quick walk. On our first day we were given a AK photo album to put our vacation photos into. The hotel lobby is beautiful though you have to get used to the 'darkness' of the entire hotel (the lights are kept low). We also took part in the Sunrise Safari which you can only take if you stay on the concierge level; that was a great experience. The two main restaurants were extremely expensive; we never ate there. Also we felt the pool was not as good as the pool at the Beach Club. Buses are the only mode of transportation to the parks but we never had more than a ten minute wait and the buses were never crowded. I would recommend this hotel to be experienced at least once.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel..cooler animals..ok staff”
Reviews.Author: bludaizie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jambo House. Checking in was a breeze and the staff were all nice. However, we found that the staff would promise certain things w/a smile and then fail to deliver the end result. It was my sons first birthday and we asked for a cake and some cheese, crackers and such be delivered to our room at a certain time. This did not happen. We then called down twice to no avail. Finally after fussing it was brought up a few hours later and almost my sons bed time. Bummer. The decor was really cool and loved the guys playing the drums around the resort, it took you away to Africa with every beat. Our room had a balcony that overlooked the wild animals which was cool. Almost like you were at your own private zoo sitting in your robe. Our favorite part! The pools were pretty hectic and very loud but I suppose you'd expect that from a Disney resort. The shuttle that took us to the Magic Kingdom was very handy. Not having to mess w/your car and parking at the different venues and such was a nice plus.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views. Very quiet.”
Reviews.Author: mholden25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Jambo House and checked in online. When we arrived it took maybe 3 minutes and we were off to our room. Every time we looked out the balcony we saw animals. The hotel is decorated with an amazing African theme. The pool is a zero entry with a twisty slide and two hot tubs. The rooms were very quiet. We only heard others guests outside our room once. The bus system to the parks and downtown disney run like clockwork and are easy to navigate and very easy to sit back and enjoy the ride. Cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Bibbidiboo
Reviews.Content: Your experience with this amazing hotel starts in the lobby as you check in, breath-taking does not begin to describe it. Staff very attentive right down to the Swahili greeting ( Jambo) and nothing was too much trouble. The attention to detail raised this hotel above many other Disney hotels. The view of the Savannah from the room was the icing on the cake. The room was in excellent decorative order and the African theme was carried out throughout though in a very subdued manner. We will definitely return, in fact we have already booked for this year and this will be our 5th stay. We love everything about it from the fantastic buffet food in Boma to the wonderful dining experience in Jiko's. So go on spoil yourself - you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “I'm Going to Disney World....”
Reviews.Author: April G
Reviews.Content: I am new to Trip Advisor, but have really relied on other's opinions recently when booking our next trip. I decided to write a review on this resort as well. We actually had booked our Disney trip at the All-Star Movie resort, which is a a lower end resort that is themed around Disney movies. We checked in online 10 days prior to our arrival date and had made all the reservations, dinig plans and our schedule for each day and which park to be at. On our way to the park (we drove to Disney), we received a call we had been upgraded. Sounding too good to be true, we verified by caling back into Disney and found out we had in fact been upgraded to a Queen, bunk bed suite at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. I can still see the hallways, lobby, pool and hear the sounds. It was a great resort with plenty to do when you got back from the parks. Pool was open until midnight every night, which was a must for my kids (ages 6 and 7 at the time). The african buffet was unusual, but the kids buffet there was very tasty (nuggest, spaghetti, fries). Never found out what our final rate would have been had we paid for the upgrade, but I am sure it would have been worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay with plenty of exercise”
Reviews.Author: GoodGirl_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel features the first class amenities that Disney resorts are known for. The rooms are reasonably spacious and offer views of the animals in their habitats. The rooms and common areas are decorated in an African jungle theme. The restaurants' offerings are prepared with the African theme also. I did not like that our room was a really long walk from the lobby. It was difficult to find healthy food options for our toddler, but that is a problem throughout Disney, so not really a reflection on AKL. All considered the accommodations were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Magical Resort with an exotic safari feel”
Reviews.Author: OntarioTravelExec
Reviews.Content: We recently visited the Disney deluxe resort, Animal Kingdom Lodge. It was a wonderful experience and definitely lived up to its classification of a 'deluxe' resort in almost every way. From the moment we pulled up to the parking attendant, we were treated to some of the famed Disney special service. The attendant knew somehow that it was our anniversary and also had the pronunciation to our name correct (our name, while common sounding, has an unusual spelling). Upon arrival at the gorgeous, African inspired resort we were met by a very friendly lady who showed us to the express check-in line. We were able to get our room early and enjoyed the kids playground and viewing the pink flamingos while we waited. We also enjoyed lunch at the Mara- they have great flatbread pizzas. Our room, while pretty and colourful, was a bit small with the two queen beds. The bathroom area was nice, as was the balcony, but the actual living space was the only disappointment of the whole hotel. Disney's Animal Kingdom lodge was a wonderful hotel. The service was excellent, the hotel is very clean and beautifully maintained and the added elements of having a safari like mini zoo surrounding it was really special. It is neat to see a giraffe as you are walking from your room to the pool through one of the many large windows. The restaurants at Animal Kingdom Lodge - Jambo house are really nice and we walked up to the other part of the resort - Kidani Village for dinner at Saana - and it was the best meal we had the whole time at Disney - dinner while looking at Zebras 20 feet from your table - a magical evening for sure. The pool and gift shop are great as well and kids can watch movies at night beside or in the pool. They have two great hot tubs too to enjoy. Tips - subscribe to the insiders Disney newsletter a few months before you are hoping to book a Disney trip at - www.mousesavers.com - this site sends you insider tips about 1x a month and i learned through one of the newsletters that Disney had a 'free meal plan' promotion. This saved us about $800 in meals and we ate like Kings for the whole time we were there with only paying for a couple of breakfasts. Another tip is to use the disney.com Mom's panel advice - great advice when booking Disney hotels. You can also make dinner reservations for any Disney restaurant on the Disney website - much more convenient than by phone and do this as early as you can to avoid disappointment. Also i recommend taking the Disney bus transport rather than your rental car if you have one. We took our car the first day and it was more of a hassle than the Disney bus system which runs very smoothly. It is not far from this hotel to any of the Disney parks. It was a wonderful hotel and I very highly recommend it to anyone looking for a great time, especially if you enjoy animals. Our two boys had a fantastic time!

Reviews.Title: “Best resort at Disney”
Reviews.Author: SGJH
Reviews.Content: For our honeymoon we decided to take my 10 year old son and go to Disney. We chose Animal Kingdom Lodge with the meal plan and we were extremely happy. Jamba House, the lobby, was beautiful. The view from our room was special - the view was of Zebra's, Elands, Pelicans and more. The staff were exceptionally nice and the restaurants were great. The restaurants had an African/Indian influence and their menus stood out and their food delicious. We had a rental car and were surprised to find out we did not have to pay for parking at the lodge or at any of the other resorts and parks. There is a day care available after 4:30 everyday which allowed for some private time. This was a very memorable trip.

Reviews.Title: “A Magical Trip”
Reviews.Author: ljsoper
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a savannah room at the WDW Animal Kingdom. The rooms were spacious and clean. The balcony overlooked the savannah where we enjoyed the giraffes, zebras, and other animals feeding and roaming about! It was relaxing and beautiful! The service was excellent. The food court was typical of the Deluxe resort food courts. The resort itself offers many relaxing areas to watch the animals, a nice campfire to enjoy, and a beautiful big pool! We stayed there with our family which was a total of 3 rooms, and there were absolutely no complaints the entire trip! Thank you Disney for another magical trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Up Close and Personal”
Reviews.Author: FoodKnight1
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing property to take your children. I would not call this a romantic venue, but for a family vacation that is "different," this property cannot be beat. Wild (although the animals on property are domesticated and many born in captivity) animals, including giraffes, zebras, large birds, roam the grounds. One is not allowed to 'mingle" but they are close enough to be observed. A safari is offered where guests are taken out onto the preserve where the animals are very close to the open air vehicle in which you ride. No lions or tigers on this tour though. For that, you must take the safari ride at the Animal Kingdom Theme Park. The guides are very knowledgeable and very nice about answering any manner of question. The restaurants are fine. There is an authentic African cuisine restaurant that deserves a try. The South African wines are also very good.

Reviews.Title: “would not recommend.”
Reviews.Author: r s
Reviews.Content: The rooms are cramped. The decor is too dark and lighting too little. Even though we paid for a savannah view room depending on the location of the room you may not see any animals. all animals we saw while on the property were from the common viewing areas not our room. in fact in mornings there was a lot of hihgway noise on the balcony you did not feel like you were in a nice savannah like setting at all. Our expereince with staff was not ver good. They were not knowledgable about where things were located in the hotel...everytime i called front desk to ask anything i was put on hold for a long time while they supposedly went to ask someone for the answer. it wasnt all bad. we enjoyed the pool. poolside staff were good and so were the staff at campfire and night viewing locations. the grounds are clean and the restaurants are good but overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “I will never forget our experience”
Reviews.Author: Laenee
Reviews.Content: The shining star of Disney's AKL is not the animals, but the staff. We enjoyed every conversation, activity and communication in the 9 days we stayed. Many of the cast members are from Africa and can tell you all about their lives back home and the animals they encounter on a daily basis. We loved seeing all the animals surrounding us at every turn. We did not pay for a Savannah room, but got a great room with a view of the animals that wasn't Savannah - kind of a smaller, less scenic Savannah, though with regular visits from an Ostrich, zebras and the pelicans. If we wanted to see the Savannah with our coffee, we just walked out our door and across the hallway to the huge deck with rocking chairs overlooking the entire vista. (room #2253) Make sure you tell them if you are celebrating anything as we mentioned that this would be a trip with my mom and her grandkids, mom is very sick with cancer and we were celebrating her. Wow, did they celebrate her. The first two nights they left her cards and notes and chocolate desserts and a stuffed tiger and a mug and decorative african art, just because I told them we were celebrating mom. Really kind of Disney. There were a couple small complaints: 1) the standard rooms could use a little updating. the furniture is a little tired/ chipped, and the bathrooms are small (don't cut your toe on the door when you open it, step behind the toilet). I was a little disappointed on the room size for the price. Also, this place is HUGE. Always ask to be near the lobby. "Near" means being only 0.5 miles away from your car in the parking lot. The lobby, by the way, is UNBELIEVABLE Overall, we were thrilled and enjoyed a trip of a lifetime here. I couldn't have asked for more from the staff. Staying on premise is worth it for the luxury hotels and the unique experiences. But if your budget is lower, offsite has much more bang for your buck. Oh, and get a rental car, it is so much easier. Ours was a Jetta for $110 for the 8 days. don't forget to check out the pools at both resorts! The Kidani pool is smaller but kids area is more extensive and a better slide. The Jambo house pool is larger, slide is nice but smaller and there isn't a sprayground there, but they do have a 1 foot deep kiddie pool for the babies. Finally, make sure you take a day off from the parks to enjoy the pool and all the awesome free activities at the hotel. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “The Distinction of Disney”
Reviews.Author: jocar23
Reviews.Content: One of the many perks of living in Central Florida is being so close to the most popular resort vacation destination; Walt Disney World. What is a once in a lifetime vacation for many families for me has become the consistent weekend getaway. What amazes me most about Disney is its ability to be amazingly fresh and unique. This was the case in my first stay at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge (AKL) this past weekend. A bit more secluded than other resorts on property, the AKL is tucked away adjacent to Disney's Animal Kingdom theme park. The resort is broken out into two sections; Jambo House and Kidani Village. Jambo House is the original center of the resort with Kidani Village recently opening as a home base for Disney Vacation Club members. I was fortunate to have a savannah view room in the Jambo House on the second floor. The Jambo House will serve as the basis for this review. As expected with Disney, the detailed theming is evident from the moment one walks in. The Jambo House appears to be a large "hut" with straw roofing and tree bark walls. The lobby was overwhelmingly beautiful with displays of authentic African artistry and lavish theming. The backside of the lobby is a large open window with outstanding view into the savannah. This is where Disney hits it out of the park. Where else can you stay in this region where you can walk outside and see beautiful African animals roaming around this beautiful landscape? Check in service was fantastic as is the norm with Disney. The person checking me in was a new employee with a tag labeled "earning my ears" which I thought was cute. Upon receiving my check information I made the long hall to my room (placed in the last section of the building). Yes this could be a long walk so if you would like to avoid don't hesitate to request a room closer to the lobby. One thing I have learned with Disney resorts is that luxury is not the key. While their rooms are not designed as five star rooms, they do offer small touches with theming and distinction that brings out their uniqueness. We had a room overlooking the savanah and were fortunate to see an abundance of animals from the balcony. Again, you won't get this kind of experience outside of Disney. The amenities at AKL were really a standout point. The pool was of really nice size complete with a slide which all the kiddies seemed to enjoy. A hot tub was located adjacent to pool partially secluded under several trees. I have to say on a chilly evening, this was the ticket. The fitness area blew me away with plenty of machines and free weights. I'm not one for working out during a getaway but having the option is always a plus. AKL is home to two popular Disney restaurants; Boma and Jiko. Boma is the buffet-type restaurant open for breakfast and dinner. Boma is more on the casual side but definitely a unique experience. Jiko is the higher grade restaurant with a more intimate atmosphere. If you are feeling really adventurous, hop over to the Kidani Village for Sanaa, an african themed full service restaurant. For those that are looking for quick dining, don't fret as a food court called Mara is available adjacent to the pool area. Here you can grab a quick burger, pizza, or other snacks. There are no bigger perks to staying on Disney property than extra magic hours at the theme parks and free transportation. Although AKL has a relatively remote location within Disney borders, their bus service is one of the better I have experienced. The resort only has two stops (one for Jambo and other for Kidani) and is really not a very long bus ride to the other theme parks. Remember though that wait times are a very variable issue and anything can either prolong or expedite your transportation around the resort. Number of guests, traffic issues, & luck all have impacts on wait times for transportation. AKL is part of Disney's deluxe resort category. Understand that the emphasis here is not on overall luxury but uniqueness of experience. Sometimes because of the pricing we are expecting to be staying in the Waldorf Astoria. Two different experiences!!! Think about this when staying at Disney; what is the driver behind the cost? What you get at a place like AKL is something you won't get elsewhere. It is a family experience that will stick out from other hotel stays and at the end of the day, we all want distinction. Hotel stays will vary based on the necessity of your trip. If you decide to stay in AKL, take some time to enjoy this unique experience. A day off from the parks at this place will really make that expense worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “African Themed Luxury”
Reviews.Author: rikrax
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Animal Kingdom Lodge in February. It's a beautiful property and the room we had (a 1-bedroom vacation villa) was spacious and comfortable. We are members of the Disney Vacation Club, and I am not sure if these types of rooms are available for general booking. We had a pool view room in the Jambo House main lodge (not Kidani Village). The pool is beautiful (I did not use it). There are two spa-hot tubs, which I did use and found it very relaxing. There are several wildlife viewing areas on the property, and we did see some exotic animals quite easily. At one of the viewing areas they allow you to borrow some night-vision binoculars in the evening and that's kinda fun to do. Looks just like you see on TV - greenish glow but you can see the animals who prefer darkness. There are two seated restaurants, a fast food type place, a gift shop and sundries store. We have eaten at all three places, and the food is excellent - plentiful and delicious. There are choices for the adventurous (African cuisine) and not-so-adventurous (American style options). Desserts are to die for. At Boma, try the Zebra Domes, their signature dessert. As with many Disney restaurants, the food is rather pricey, but you do get good quality and quantity. Staff has been pleasant and efficient. Really, I have no complaints, and I would stay here again easily.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge delivers”
Reviews.Author: jerry814
Reviews.Content: Never stayed there before but heard a lot about it. Spent the $ for a "Savannah" view from the room. Having coffee watching all kinds of animals out there in the morning. Utterly unique experience.

Reviews.Title: “Much nicer then expected”
Reviews.Author: Audrey H
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Orlando, half of which at the AKL. This is my first time at Disney and I didn't know what to expect. But, I ended up really enjoying the AKL. If you do stay here, I recommend having a car. Since this property is further away, it makes getting around a lot easier. What I really liked about this hotel is that it wasn't over the top Disney. Everything was very subtle and the service was excellent. What made this hotel different were the animals. We didn't get a savannah room since we anticipated spending most of our time in the parks. But, we saw plenty of animals from the common viewing areas. It was really neat to see the animals all around the back of the park. The restaurants were all high quality. I wasn't expecting anything from the food but I was pleasantly surprised that they met my standards. Boma, Jiko and Sanaa (next door) were all excellent. Our quick breakfast at Mara was also delicious. The rooms were on the smaller side. I had requested a king bed but we were given two queens. When I called to see I could get this changed, I was told that there was only a disabled room with a low bed on the first floor available. I decided to pass. But, I kept crashing into the footpost of the bed because there wasn't as much space to walk around it. The worst was the bathroom. The toilet and tub were in a separate room. This was tiny. To close the door, you had to walk behind it in order to shut it. The shower was also really weak. It was difficult to rinse the shampoo out because there was no water pressure in the shower itself. Overall, I did really like this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at an affordable price for a Deluxe Disney Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MishLyn
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is great if you are traveling with children. I was surprised at how new it felt compared to some of the other Disney Hotels that I have visited. There is a heated pool, playground, arcade, multiple restaurants, etc. They also have various activities for kids throughout the week. Our kids got to decorate cookies one afternoon which they loved. You can request a pack-n-play at no additional charge if you need one. It's not uncommon to hear the sound of music coming from drums which my kids liked to dance to. There are also overlook areas at the back if the Hotel where you can see various animals. We liked the fact that there was a quick service restaurant at the Hotel that served everything from a Latte and muffins/cereal to pizza and burgers for dinner. The rooms were super clean and comfortable and the Hotel staff was very friendly. Overall we had a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “a great 2 night stay”
Reviews.Author: james m
Reviews.Content: my wife and i decided to stay here after we got back from a cruise. it was soooo awesome. Giraffes feet away, Zebras grazing. We ate at Jiko and just amazing food...I highly recommend the duck entree. We had great weather, saw tons of wildlife and everyone was so helpful explaining facts about each creature. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but prefer the Port Orleans French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: FlyGirlToronto
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the AKL. Very nice resort and great amenities. Great to have a room with a view to see the animals. View / no view depends what you are looking for when choosing a resort and how much time you anticipate spending in your room. Many places to sit and view the animals all over the hotel. Yes the hallways are dark, but that goes with the theme and really not sure why people are complaining about this. Do agree however that the walk can be very long if you are towards the end away from the lobby. If you have mobility issues I would recommend advising the staff when you book as this long walk would be difficult for some people. Pool excellent. Only saw one family (from Quebec) the whole week doing the "reserve the best spot with the towel on the lounger". Everyone else, considerate, polite, friendly etc. Great slide the kids spent most of the day on that. Food was quite good. Breakfast buffet excellent and dinner too but not much for the kids in the evening. Quick service food good but after a few days gets old seeing the same choice every day and limited choice for the kids. Buses to the parks very regular and the ride to MK about 15min. Not peak season when we were there so always managed to get a seat. Longest wait is the bus to downtown Disney, we just missed it so ended up waiting 30min for the next one. Nice activities for the kids throughout the day. Staff were really good with the kids. Parade in the evening was a big hit. Staff in general- the ones that were good were REALLY GOOD but the others for the most part were very indifferent the concierge being the most unhelpful considering that was her job. Seem to be a number of staff members in training during our stay. All in all a good hotel and amenities of a deluxe resort are nice but we would not stay here again. Prefer the Port Orleans and would go there next time.

Reviews.Title: “I expected more!”
Reviews.Author: travelpartner72
Reviews.Content: Just spent a short time at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. I think they expect that every visitor is a potential member of Al-Qaeda. Check-in was a full 20 minutes. Then buying tickets for the park, another 20 minutes. And they did it wrong, marking a child's ticket as an adult. What's the big deal? When you get to the park in addition to the bag check, adults have to do a finger print scan. Total Nonsense. I went back to fix this at the front desk but when I realized it was a learning experience for all employees and would take 1/2 an hour, I gave up. The staff kept blaming the database. Food is rather inferior in anything but the best resort restaurants. Yet, you will pay top dollar. Sanaa was a good experience. Chicken was very dry but still okay, shrimp very good. I haven't been to Disney in 23 years. It's so bureaucratic. I want to spend time in the park NOT at the hotel front desk!

Reviews.Title: “A resort worthy of a trip to Disney!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyofFiveNJ
Reviews.Content: The Animal Kingdom Lodge at Disney is our most favorite place to stay on Disney property. Although you do have to take a bus to get to any parks, the resort makes up for all of that. Our most recent stay at this resort was in January of 2012 for Disney's Marathon weekend. The decor in the Lodge is warm and welcoming. The lobby is vast with huge windows in the back overlooking the savannah. The colors are mostly browns, tans, and oranges - very muted. The lighting isn't very bright in the hallways but fits in with the overall feeling. In the lobby you there is a fireplace and down one level to the right you will find the Victoria Falls Lounge. There is an indoor waterfalls to fit the entire theme of this lounge. Go down one more level and you will find two very popular eating places Jiko (The Cooking Place - a more formal place to enjoy dinner) and Boma (an informal buffet open for breakfast and dinner) You can exit the lobby and go outside to a welcoming firepit complete with rocking chairs and many viewing areas to enjoy the animals out on the savannah. You will usually find a cast member by the animals who knows quite a bit about the animals and their habits. Take the time to talk to one of these staff members. Many of them are from Africa and have some interesting stories to share. Our room was on the Disney Vacation Club Level and we had a studio suite which consisted of one Queen bed and a pull out sofa. Only my husband and myself were on this trip so the room was just the right size. The double sinks have their own section apart from the toilet and bathtub/shower. We also had a small area with a fridge, microwave, and toaster. Our room had a view of the savannah. During the colder times, you will not always see a lot of animals out and about. This is especially true in the early colder mornings. We did not spot one animal any morning of our stay but we were always up pretty early and it was still cold outside by Florida standards. Our room was spotless and the bed was very comfortable. There was a small balcony outside of our room with two chairs where we were able to view some animals during the warmer afternoon hours when they were out and about. By the pool, you will find Mara - a quick service place to eat. There is also a bar by the pool. The excersise room is state-of-the art. Seriously good for a hotel - like a small well stocked gym and kept very clean. Even if you don't have a room with a savannah view, you can still enjoy the animals as there are many public viewing areas along each of the floors for guests to use. Each time we stay in this resort, we feel relaxed and transported to something out-of-the-ordinary. If you are traveling with children be sure to ask about some of the special programs they hold throughout the day. I have seen children do rubbings of animals, learn how to recognize animal prints, and other assorted things to go along with the Animal Kingdom theme.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort for animal lovers, just not very Disneyish in theme.”
Reviews.Author: damnws6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (24 and 25 years old) stayed there a week from 1/25/12-2/1/12. First, let me mention that we are Florida Residents and Annual Passholders, so we did get a discounted rate for the hotel (especially it being value season!). We originally requested a king bed, savanna view on the 2nd floor. Check-in was fine, however they couldn't get us a king or a 2nd floor room, but said it would be available the next day. First night we were on the 4th floor in a savanna room (directly across Kidani Village's Sanaa restaurant. My wife saw some animals and thought it was great. The next day we were transfered to a Arusha Savanna view on the 2nd floor by Zebra's Trail (king bed)! THIS VIEW WAS AMAZING! My wife loved the animals and the animal keeper saw her out on the balcony and put the lettuce in the trees right by our window so she could have a closer view of the giraffes. Very nice. Rooms are pretty normal hotel rooms, nothing fantasy or 'Disney' about it, but they are clean. The hotel itself is very clean, you won't smell the animals. The lobby in beautiful, however I feel it was missing the 'Disney' touch. Where is Mickey in Safari gear or any character paintings? The only Mickey and Disney items are in the hotel shop. Staff was very friendly, my wife just discovered pin trading and she annoyed everyone there, but they did it with a smile lol. The property is beautiful and you can see the animals on countless places (they have observation decks with binoculars and even night vision goggles at night). Some restaurants also have a view of the Savanna. Boma was great for BREAKFAST as it's a buffet and was responsibly priced. We had the dinner buffet there once, it was pretty good, but nothing to repeat. We had breakfast 5 out of the 7 days at Boma though. Breakfast would be fine for children, but the dinner was lacking in the kid's food department. We tried Sanaa the first night, the food wasn't bad at all, but it's not our thing (very African/Indian type style), so we didn't enjoy it too much. Also it was packed so it took us a while to get served. The menu is decently sized but if your not adventurous in your food, then you might want to pass. They apparently do accommodate children as I saw a few eating a pizza, however if we had kids I don't think we would take them there. It's not too kid friendly. We passed on Jiko because of the menu, as the only thing we would really have wanted was the Filet Mignon which was $43. The Mara is there quick service downstairs, we ate there for lunch a few times and to get snacks. It's easily the best place to eat if you have kids, they have burgers, sandwiches, pizza, milks, cereal, salads, etc. The food was very very good. If you buy the souvenir cup, you can have free refills at the restaurant the entire trip. NOTE: Room Service is only until midnight and the Mara closes at 11:30, during that 30 minute time, the R.S. menu is very limited. Don't bother unless you want a special desert or shrimp, I ordered a burger the first night and then the next night I went to the Mara. Same burger, $7 more if you order through Room Service. SO make the walk if you can. The pool is nice and we went in once, but it was way too cold. The hot tub is nice as well. As for the bus system, we went during a time that wasn't really busy, but the longest ride took maybe 20 minutes? We didn't mind it at all. We used the buses the entire trip. My parents and my two younger sisters (13 and 15) came by to see the room and the animals; the animals were a huge hit! They loved it. We are actually planning on saying at Kidani Village later this year! Overall this is a wonderful property. I liked it, my wife LOVED it. Seeing the animals outside your balcony is very cool, but I prefer the whole Disney experience, which I thought was lacking some in the hotel. IF this is for adults and teenagers, definitely go, if you have small children that won't get a huge kick out of the animals, or will get bored after 25 minutes or so, then go to another Disney property

Reviews.Title: “Come for the animals...”
Reviews.Author: shimmydamper
Reviews.Content: Checked-in here for a 2 night break following 2 nights at the Wilderness Lodge. Theming here is excellent and broadly designed in the same style as Wilderness Lodge (same architect apparently)! After having had such an overwhelmingly friendly greeting at Wilderness, I was a little underwhelmed here. Nevertheless, the Lodge is beautiful and interestingly laid out over a number of floors. The killer attraction here however is having the animals literally outside your window! We booked a standard view which gave us a limited view Savannah view as the hotel was not busy. The pool is nice but think the pool at the Kidani villas is better, especially for children due the splash zone! Ate at Boma which was excellent but leave plenty of room! Annoyingly they won't take same day reservations at the desk but you can still make same day reservations online (odd!!)!! Events are very ecologically/animal focused which is great as presumably that's why you came here! Rooms are nice and well themed but not necessarily as deluxe as you would get for the same price elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Disney Magic and Safari trip all in one.”
Reviews.Author: ecrescia
Reviews.Content: This is a HUGE hotel, as everything Disney... One of my kids is an animal lover and we planned a short stay at this hotel to be able to do the Wanyama Safari experience (only for guests at the Animal Kingdom Lodge and Vilas and only to up to12 guests each day. We paid a little extra to have Club Level access and it was nice to have the Club lounge area to go for breakfast and drinks/snacks during the day. When you stay at this hotel you can visit any of the Disney parks with free parking, even on the day you check out. Rooms are smaller than at other hotels in the US, but comfortable. We had a balcony and could watch some of the animals from there. The hotel has plenty of activities and areas and I wish I had more time to explore and enjoy all they offered. My kids went to the kids crafts room (Simba Cubhouse) and enjoyed doing crafts there. As you would expect from any place Disney, you have to pay for every little thing you do. We loved staying at this hotel, the safari theme is well rendered throughout the hotel. True, the lobby, swimming pool and lounges are nicer than the rooms. But also true that you shouldn't plan to spend much time in your room anyway. :)

Reviews.Title: “Another Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: a_bells
Reviews.Content: Just came home from another amazing week at the AKL. This is my second review so I will try to keep it a little shorter and you can see my review history if you are interested in the original. Several people marked it as helpful. The resort itself it stunning. The lobby, restaurants, hallways - all breathtaking in their design. The amount of handcarved woodwork is astonishing. It really became much more amazing this time around as we spent more time at the resort and I really had a chance to appreciate it this time around. There are folks that complain about the rooms and say this isn't a 5 start resort, but I beg to differ. I too, travel. This is nothing like a typical 5 star resort like a Ritz or a Penninsula, etc. It doesn't have shiny modern design and finishings. This is a themed resort. A Safari theme - and if you really take the time to look around and appreciate all of it - particularly the architecture, finishes and lush grounds around the pool, you will see why it truly is 5 star. The rooms themselves may not seem 5 star. I mean, some have bunkbeds for heavens sake - but still, they are very nice. My take on this is that EVERY room in Disney is comparable from a value - deluxe. It is the resort itself that makes a room value, mod., deluxe. Advice - If this is your first trip, and money is at all a consideration. Go ahead and stay at a value resort and please don't feel you are missing out. A first visit to Disney is OVERWHELMING. There is so much to see or do, you could never do it all in a week, and you will find yourself leaving early and coming back late every day. We did this even with small children, taking advantage of the family/child centers available at each park to take breaks, change diapers, do feedings, etc. You won't even have a chance to appreciate the resort and depending upon the package and the number of people in your party, a value package could be nearly half the price. This was our third trip and we finally were able to spend more time at the resort and really did appreciate it and use the amenities, making it worth it. Savannah versus Standard. Both times we have stayed here we booked standards and were upgraded to Savannah. I think this has to do with arriving on Tuesdays. Most people arrive on a Saturday. There are likely way more people that book standard than they actually have rooms for. By the time Tuesday arrives I'm guessing those rooms are filled and that is why we have received the upgrade. Yeah for us. Take that information for what it is worth. The Mara - Am I crzazy or has the menu VASTLY improved here? Honestly, we ditched some of our sit down meals on the dining plan and ate here a few times instead. The food is amazing and there is a TON of it as they throw in desert. Don't miss it. Boma is also amazing. LOVED their breakfast AND Dinner. Save money with the dining plan: Yes, it is already paid for (or free, depending on the package you booked), but you will still pay tip - and this adds up. Tip at breakfast is much less than it is for dinner. On several days we used our sit down meal for breakfast which honestly kept us full until mid-late afternoon. Used a snack credit at the park (sometimes) and did a quick service at night back at the hotel or at the park. Something to consider, especially if you don't have advance reservations for sit down dinners which may or may not be hard to get into without them. Back to AKL. We saw lovely animals outside the room every day, it was incredibly clean, the bathroom was tiny but the shower was great. The rooms are nice and beautifully decorated but there isn't much dresser space - 2 drawers and a smaller nightstand drawer, bus service was great (It was January, however), the distance from Magic Kingdom wasn't a bother, the pool is phenomenal as are the grounds surrounding it, they do fun things like art and craft projects for the kids/families during the day, roast marshmallows by the fire pit near the pool, have night vision goggles to view the animals at night - it was fantastic. Again, it IS expensive. If money isn't an issue go and ENJOY! If you are watching your dollars go and enjoy one of their lovely value or moderate resorts, your vacation will be magical. It is ALL Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Dreamn18
Reviews.Content: We took a quick trip to Orlando last weekend Jan. 27 and 28, 2012. It was 6 pm when we arrived and were shocked to find out our room wasn't ready yet. The check in was a very long process after which we headed to the bar to wait for a text that our room was ready. The text never came, I went back to the front desk at 7:15 and was told it was ready. At $575 a night - the room should be ready before 7pm! They must have rushed to clean it since I found someone else's laundry in the washer! Anyway the experience improved dramatically after that. The 1 bedroom condo overlooked the Savannah and was very nice. The bathroom was clean and nicely laid out. We were pleased by the view of zebras, giraffes and other animals in the morning. Disney parks are always fun. This time of year even though it was a weekend the parks were not crowded and the lines were minimal. Very nice time all and all.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, long bus rides”
Reviews.Author: amytz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and 3 year old for 4 nights. When you walk into the lobby, you are truly impressed by the beauty and grandeur. Disney really went all out to give you the "wow factor" when you walk into this place. The pool was huge and looked very kid-friendly (although, we didn't have time to enjoy it). Boma (african-themed buffet) was fabulous. We had a savanna room and were happy we payed the extra money to get the view. We saw plenty of animals at all different times of the day. We had a room with 2 queen beds and were a little disappointed in the size. It's kind of tight for a "luxury" resort. There are double sinks with a separate bathroom. The bathroom had very poor lighting. Housekeeping did a great job daily. My biggest complaint would probably be the bus rides. They seemed pretty long to all resorts (except AK). I haven't stayed in a Disney resort for 7 years, so I can't really make a comparison, but it took around 20 minutes to get to and from the parks. This felt pretty long at the end of the day when you're dragging a stroller and a crabby 3 year-old. Overall, I would definitely recommend this resort to anyone. It is a very unique and beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great, As Usual”
Reviews.Author: ebsimp
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December 2011 on a family trip. As usual, Disney thought of everything. The only part we didn't enjoy was the walk from the lobby to our room; the room was towards the end of one wing and the only way in and out of the building is through the lobby. Making that walk with kids is a little tough, BUT our room faced the animals which our kids loved! It was really cool to wake up in the morning, pull the curtains back and see Giraffes feeding. The in house bar was great for a little down time for my father-in-law and I away from kids. The buffet restaraunt was great! They have some "native" foods, but be adventurous, TRY EVERYTHING! They still have plenty favorites for picky kid eaters. Pool was awesome, as was the playground that's a little "hidden" behind the pool area. Make sure to take advantage of the animal learning programs for kids. We missed one where kids could feed the flamingos (acutally everyone did....the "teacher" said no one showed up); Staff could have done a better job of making guests aware. Of course the parks were great as always, Animal Kingdom, MK, Epcot, MGM, can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Great Lodge, Great Food”
Reviews.Author: RainSeattleMom
Reviews.Content: Things I loved: decor, animals (I did not get tired of them ever), simba club for kids so parents could eat alone at night, bunkbead, animal view from balcony, comfortable beds and pillows, hot water, pool w/lifeguards until 7p, and restaurants. I can't believe the complaints I've read on here - I had no problems. I never tired of my view. I had great wifi. Everything was clean and disney standards. And the FOOD WAS OVER THE TOP YUMMY! Unless people are afraid to try african/indian, it was amazing! They bent over backwards to make whatever my kids wanted at Sanna; we've eaten at three restaurants & I hope to try the fourth tomorrow! Things that kept me from rating five stars: it is pretty compact (ie. only two drawers for clothes, and the bathroom is tight when closing the door. Also, I was towards the end of the resort so it was quite a walk to the shuttle, but not a big deal for me & we found a quick route to the pool and meals. Shuttles were great half the time, and slow the other half the time; can't beat free. Late Jan/ early Feb is a good time to come to avoid crowds, and have nice weather.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: cpapat
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here 2nd week in January 2012 for 7 nights, my husband, myself, 2 grown sons, 24 and 21 years old. We had a 1 bedroom suite on the concierge floor. Everything about this hotel was great. The 1 bedroom suite consists of a separate bedroom with king bed that was very comfortable. There was a very spacious bathroom, with the shower and toilet in a separate room from the vanity. Our sons slept in the livingroom on a queen sleeper and sleeper chair. They are both approx 6'3" and they fit on the sleepers fine. They also said that they were quite comfortable. We had a very nice full size dining table and full kitchen. Since we stayed on the concierge floor, we did not use the kitchen at all. This was our first visit to Disneyworld and now we are spoiled and would not want to stay anyplace else. The concierge floor was wonderful. My husband and I would go get coffee early and bring it back to the room to watch the weather for that day and read the free USA Today that was left outside our room each morning. We would get around, then go have a nice breakfast and head out to one of the parks. All four of us would meet for a nice lunch at a different park each day. That was the only meal we needed to purchase. When we got tired, we would head back to our room for a nap, stopping by the concierge for a few snacks and/or drinks. We would have an early dinner with the appetizers on the concierge floor. My husband and I would grab a plate, they always had bottles of wine, too. Then we would take them to our room and sit on our really nice balcony and watch the animals come by. We had a partial view savannah room, but we saw many different animals each day, there was no complaint. We would then head back to the parks or swim at the hotel. The pool, water slide and hot tub were all great. One night we went out to see the animals on the savannah with night vision googles and they also had a bonfire each night where they would roast marshmallows if you wanted. Housekeeping was great, never had a complaint. The room was always very clean and they would leave more than enough clean towels for the 4 of us. We splurged and did the Wanyama Sunset Safari and this was the highlight of our vacation for all four of us. We have wonderful memories of our stay here and had a fabulous family vacation. We look forward to returning and wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with great ambience!”
Reviews.Author: yankeesusa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at animal kingdom lodge in January of 2012. Stayed at the Jambo house side. First thing, the ambience is amazing! You will never forget your visit. First thing you notice is the animal African theme. And of course you can't miss the safari that's right on the property. The rooms are very clean and at least the room I stayed in with bunk beds had a fridge, flat screen tv and bluray player. Our room was on first floor facing the end of the pool area which meant almost no noise except for minor bubble sound from jacuzzi. It was a great little view. I will choose first floor in this area everytime since its close to pool and restaurants. The best thing of staying at Disney is the free transportation to all Disney areas. The pool was awesome. It was big pool with a slide. There is pool bar and 2 jacuzzis. There are plenty of activities for children and adults. Too many to name. 1 for adults and children is night vision goggles at night to view animals on some nights. During the day the giraffes and other animals are easy to see and get real close sometimes. There are also kids activities like face painting and cookie decorating. Overall I love this resort.
