We almost didn't go that many times to the park since resort has so much. The hallways are quiet and staff is friendly and very helpful. I recommend January best time to visit due to park being empty after holidays and Disney offers discounts if booked in advanced. Up to 45% off sometimes. I definitely recommend at least once in your lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “delightful multi-generation family stay”
Reviews.Author: PrincessPalmTree
Reviews.Content: One week at AKL, the full theme park and dining experience and we had a very happy group (ages 9, 11, 37, 38, 58, 64, 69) that was not ready to leave. The good, as always with Disney, was the service of staff that we interacted with, the theming, and the food. Certainly no complaints there. Though the AKL is a wonderful experience, it did feel quite removed from everything else and took some time getting around. We had expected this and planned for it so it did not hinder our plans. However, now that we have stayed there once (and didn't spend nearly as much time as we thought we would watching the animals) we'll probably opt for a deluxe resort with larger rooms next time around. Overall the entire vacation hit the mark with our high Disney expectations. The few things I will mention are just nit-picky little things that kept me from giving it a "5" but certainly did not dampen our overall vacation in any way. My husband and I with the kids had a bunk bed room adjoining with the grandparents in a double queen. Overall the space felt tight. What stood out most as a contributing factor here was that there were only 2 drawers to unload suitcases into for our stay. It has been a few years since I stayed at the Polynesian but I seem to recall there being more individual drawer space. I could be wrong though. Everything in the room was clean and well presented. The kids were a bit disappointed though that for all of the photos of "towel art" online associated with this resort, we only had a flat round "Mickey" on arrival and nothing else for the 7 nights we were there. Regarding the value of this resort, you certainly pay a premium for the theming and it was our choice to do so, and our choice to book rooms that we knew would be pool not Savannah view. I was disappointed however, that in one of the slowest weeks of the season, having booked directly through Disney, our room were on the first floor and the only view we had was of large plants and peeks of pool water. Even one floor up we could have stretched our necks a bit on the balcony to see something, even a non-savannah bird flying by. Another time I would specifically request a higher floor, but then again, another time I would pick a resort that is more central on the property too. Our 9-year-old animal lover went nuts over the close proximity of the roaming wildlife (we basically picked the resort with him in mind) but after checking out all of the viewing areas on day 1 even he had no interest in wandering around again to see what was out and about. As I said really no complaints, just general comments from our group and a truly wonderful and memorable time!

Reviews.Title: “Don't need Savana View”
Reviews.Author: toestrip
Reviews.Content: My wife, 5 year old son and I stayed here and loved it. The pool slide is small, but was perfect for my young one to get acclimated to sliding. The lobby is arguably the prettiest of all the disney properties and has a ton of nooks and cranes to examine. Avoid Boma. It's a buffet that's way overpriced and not worth it. You can get eh little zebra dome cakes at Mara anyway - and they are the best thing about he buffet. Jiko is still the best restaurant in Disneyworld. We ate at Sanaa one night and were impressed - which is tough coming from a new yorker who eats plenty of Indan food regularly. And seeing Giraffs wonder by was a novelty - but a great one. Also the additional pool area at the Kidani village is great. Great water play area too.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JaqueHan
Reviews.Content: So our family has been here once before and we loved it both times!! It was amazing!! We had an awesome room with a full kitchen and everything... He couch bed isn't to comfy but it's not terrible.. And the jets in the jacuzzi need to be either cleaned or replaced... Other than those to things the stay was amazing!!! Oh and they have an AWESOME pool!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, beautiful views from balcony rooms”
Reviews.Author: AvaandCeliasMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the lodge during the first week in December and everything was beautifully decorated for Christmas. We rented a car as this hotel is pretty far from certain parks and bus transportation at the lodge can be slow to arrive. The staff is very sweet and tries to make your stay special. At check in, be sure to mention if you are celebrating an anniversary, etc. during your stay. We had a balcony room which was well worth the upgrade rate. So neat to see girrafes, zebras, etc. in the mornings and early evenings. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “So much fun!”
Reviews.Author: dladomirak
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. The kids loved it, Although, we did not go to the parks, we just enjoyed our time there with all the fun activites, we fell in love with the people from S. Africa who work there, it is our new favorite Disney Hotel. I am not sure I would pay $300 a night and spend all the time at The Parks, But if you want a fun family weekend def. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Curb Appeal cant make up for very average accommodations”
Reviews.Author: FloridaJayBird
Reviews.Content: Wow! what an unbelievably beautiful site the hotel and lobby are. Just really out of this world. Unfortunately, you will be less than thrilled in your room. I get it, its Disney - you should be runnin around spending funny money until your tummy hurts - but as a Florida resident these hotels can be a nice getaway...in theory. I should stop the imagination train and avoid Disney hotels in the future unless kids are involved. Too bad - so easily fixed too - Beds(Mattress/Linens/Mattress), Toilets, Showers and even carpet need to be updated. All in all - I'm not saying the place is a dump, but for the money, it's just waay too expensive for the product - If you can stand it, my advice, stay at the Peabody and drive to Disney next time.

Reviews.Title: “Unique experience and great service”
Reviews.Author: MLwellTravelled
Reviews.Content: Relaxing, interesting, fun, and great service. My husband and I stayed here in March 2011. We had a standard room with Club level. We were able to watch animals from our bedroom window most any hour of the day. We booked the Safari of the grounds with dinner one evening, and it was a lot of fun to get so close to the animals,and find out more about how the Lodge handles, feeds and breeds. The service was great. The club level access was worth it for the breakfasts, snacks and ability to book the Safari. The concierge took care of special needs for me including shipment of pillows to and from the hotel. Only problems - concierge lost original itinerary where I had asked for notification of all the Disney restaurants I had booked regarding my gluten sensitivity, but I just sent again. Also, concierge gave me wrong info about traveling to another Disney property for spa services which caused me to be late for my appointment, and they didn't tell me that I could have booked the same service right in the Animal Kingdom Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Once in a lifetime experience”
Reviews.Author: Rocksteadycrew22
Reviews.Content: Not a disappointment kids loved it, go again, Yep in a heart beat. This is a once in a life time expereince you will never forget. Room was very clean and the staff were as magical as they always are! Pre book dinners if your travelling over Christmas it was a nightmare getting into anywhere Christmas Day for a meal and avoid Magic Kingdom, absolutely mental on Christmas day.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL TRIP !!”
Reviews.Author: coastermom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in AKL for a 4 night 5 day 20th Anniversary trip ... Savannah View room on the 4th floor in Jambo house ... The room first ... Everyday there were animals outside our room and we sat out on the terrace and watched them every morning ... The hotel is amazingly stunning the decor is outstanding in the fact the theme is continued thoughout the resort . Everyone was welcoming and happy .. Bus service was good to all parks and downtown Disney as well the food in the Mara which is like a quick serverice breakfast / lunch / dinner area was good we had Breakfast there Daily except once we went to BOMA for Breakfast which I say eat at at least once !!! Bed was comfy and I would so return here ... or the Beach Club at Disney it was wonderful there too !!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel near Animal Kingdom Park”
Reviews.Author: TOWestonCT
Reviews.Content: Stay in a large, multiple room, suite that overlooked a grassy area where animals roamed freely. Hotel is African themed, and very dark inside. Pool area is Large, but they painted the bottom of the pool to resemble a water hole, and the water looms murky as a result. The surrounding pool area was ok, but not as comfortable as it might have been given the price. Restaurants are factory like with huge groups and lines of people waiting to eat. You still have to take a bus over to the Animal Kingdom Park, which is a little inconvenient. Service was inconsistent. At check in, even though I had a suite for over $1000 per night, I still had to wait in a very long and slow line, with guests asking tons of questions at check in. This is frustrating at 9.00pm with three exhausted kids. For a high end hotel, Disney can do better. The too itself was quite nice, and quiet, but finding it was an adventure, wandering down hallways and walkways. This is a big hotel. I have stayed at the Beach and Yacht club and would stay there over the Animal Kingdom Lodge next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, except the bed.”
Reviews.Author: jiwdurando
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here one night before moving to a different Disney resort. The hotel is great. Tons to look at and tons of things to do. They have valet parking, but it costs a arm and a leg so we didn't use it. Check in went great, we got there around 10:30am and they had our room ready which was awesome! Our room was a Savannah view room, it had two queen beds and a two towel animals. We had a TV, DVD player, refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, hairdryer. Our room had a balcony and you could look out see the animals very close. We saw Zebras and antelope, giraffe, and several other kinds of animals. Our bathroom had a big area with two sinks and counter top, the bathroom itself was very small. I felt claustrophobic when the door was shut. There were two dressers and a place to hang up clothes in the walk way. There was also an iPod dock station and a table and chairs. We ate at Mara and it was OK, just normal quick service meals. We tried to eat at Boma, when we arrived they told us there was no wait time, an hour later we left because we didn't want to wait anymore. We ended up eating outside of Disney World. My daughter took part in some of the activities they have at the hotel we did Medallion rubbing, cookie decorating and then we did some activities at the pool. She LOVED the pool it had a zero entrance, and they had life jackets for the kids. My daughter went down the water slide many times. That night we took part in night vision viewing and the evening parade. Sleeping is a different story, those beds are awful! I had a really hard time sleeping. Pillows aren't worth much either. Check out went great since I opted for easy checkout I didn't have to go to the front desk at all. They emailed my bill to me and I checked it on my phone and made sure it was ok and we left. The only other thing I want to say about this resort is that I don't feel its worth the money I paid for the room. I could have stayed at a different resort for MUCH cheaper and visited this one, which is probably what I will do next time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property!”
Reviews.Author: lv2trvl12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are avid travelers, and have vacatioed all over the world, but have never been so delighted as we were to stay at this amazing hotel! We stayed in the Jambo Lodge in a Savannah view room on the third floor and awoke every day to see various exotic aniamls roaming the property. The room was clean and tastefully decorated, We ate at Boma and thought the variety of food and quality was delicious! The pool area was huge and it was easy to find a quiet area to enjoy the sunshine and hot tub. I have read all the reviews and because they were so positive, that is one of the reasons we chose to stay here, How anyone could find fault is surprising to me, but they probaly aren't experienced travelers. We will definitely recommend the Animal Kingdon Lodge and will be guests again!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive... would stay here again for sure”
Reviews.Author: LeezakFl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night this past weekend with some friends. Our room faced the animal viewing area. In the morning I could see several giraffes and two Ostrich. The room was very clean and well stocked. We stayed in a suite with several bedrooms and bathrooms. All were very nicely decorated and family friendly. The lobby of the hotel is very impressive and there are lots of things to see and do while there. There are multiple places to eat, I just needed a quick breakfast so I went to the quick service spot. $6.50 for a breakfast platter and $2.19 for coffee...overall not to bad considering where its Disney. The pool is very wel done and there is a zero entry area for kids. I went in the hot tub and it was clean and there were plenty of towles out for guesets. Overall a very nice place, somewhere I would return with my family for sure. Treat yourself and give it a try. Everyone I came in contact with was very nice....

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, one of a kind”
Reviews.Author: Mr2j
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Dinsey's Animal Kingdom many times. Typically we stay in the villas, as we are Disney Vacation Club Members. This trip in a one bedroom concierge for our daughter's birthday. At check in, the concierge hosts handed her a bag and it had some great themed gifts. Over $50 in items, totally unexpected, but greatly appreciated! The rooms are always immaculate, the cast always friendly and attentive. The concierge lounge is by far the best on Disney property. We have booked 3 more trips for this year, simply because of the great service.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous environment”
Reviews.Author: eli37
Reviews.Content: We got a room right at the end by the preserve. It's definitely worth the extra 5 minute walk to be able to go out on your balcony in the morning and see the animals! There is an animal that makes a loud noise at the crack of dawn, but I appreciated that because I could go out and see them. Room was clean and nice, although not too spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Not great for price, not a luxury resort”
Reviews.Author: 914newyork
Reviews.Content: Coming from Disneys All Star Sports resort the night before I expected much more jumping from value resort to "luxury" resort. The lobby is impressive however check in is a little confusing as there are no clear cut lines. The lady who checked us in offered us a complimentary upgrade which was very nice. She circled on the map that we would be looking over their larger savannah and would have two queen beds. When we actually got to the room, it was on the opposite side of the savannah and we weren't looking out onto it. To top it off we had 1 bed and a set of bunk beds instead of two queens. The room itself was not impressive; small, rough linens, no sitting space. Everything was clean though (except the phone) which is what I really look for. The breakfast was good but expensive (maybe not for Disney?). The bar was okay, bartender (from ny can't remember his name) was great. The bonfire outside could have been bigger considering it didn't give off any heat and we were freezing. All in all the resort is good, but not for how much they charge a night. Valet needs to be paid cash and the car came back full of pollen (I expected it to be parked covered). Didn't use pools. Personally I won't be back and recommend staying t Waldorf Astoria Orlando or Hilton bonnet creek ( adjacent to Disney and free Disney shuttles too).

Reviews.Title: “Tough one to get to all at Disney if you have small children”
Reviews.Author: cabinfan2
Reviews.Content: Its an ok resort and if you have never seen animals up close pretty cool but if you have small children the transportation isn't too easy for small children ...long bus rides to and from parks get old plus if u have strollers they must be folded and contents lugged to your seat! Poly is way better and more relaxing this place orders on creepy! Stay at the Poly!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Emma C
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights over Christmas 2011, room was amazing, we had a standard room but still had a view of the savanna, giraffes and zebras outside the room were just amazing. Staff and facilities were all excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Food Options for kids”
Reviews.Author: KDeegs423
Reviews.Content: I love Disney and have been a Disney Vacation Club member since 1999. This was my first time staying in this resort. While the amenities were all on par with what I expected, there were very limited food choices for my two kids. Our suite was room 7523 in Kidani Village, and came with a kitchen and dining area, which we ended up using to cook some dinners where we normally would've eaten out on site. Unfortunately, Sanaa (the on site restaurant at Kidani) had only one "American" choice on the kids' menu, and it wasn't one of the few things my 4 year old will eat. Additionally, while my 10 year old is more adventurous in her tastes, she doesn't like Indian food, and it turns out African food has heavy Indian influences. So we ended up with frozen pizza from the on site grocery store. This was disappointing, to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey? You decide.”
Reviews.Author: anole215
Reviews.Content: January 18/19: Jambo House, "Arusha Savanna" Room 3309: OK, even with the season's pass discount, we knew this stay would be expensive. But it was an anniversary celebration and we decided to go for it. (Note that the regular off season rate for their better "Arusha View" was $340 a night; we paid $247.75 total per night.) Booking with the Disney reservations system was seamless. I have to say that the timing for this trip was perfect. Warm days, cool nights, manageable crowds at Animal Kingdom, and a relatively quiet hotel. Off season is good! My first impression of the hotel property completely lived up to expectations. The lobby was breathtakingly beautiful and the grounds were just lovely. Disney certainly knows how to create a dream ... were it not for the tops of nearby Disney hotels peeking over the roofline of the Lodge, you'd swear that you'd been transported to Africa! We were initially given room 2241, which didn't thrill me. It was on the first level and I found it to be a little confining with respect to the view. Go higher if you can; the view will be opened up. Room 3309 was far better ... nice panorama of the Arusha Savanna and the nesting pelicans on the Arusha Rock Overlook. Lots of critters, day and night ... more on that a bit later. Room 3309: Two queen beds. African inspired decor featuring an abundance of thoughtful and attractive details; this was an pleasant hotel room. However, it was definitely on the small side (especially for the inflated price). More than two bodies would be uncomfortably crowded. The bathroom was tiny. If you're already ... uh ... "sitting down," and more than small/average sized, it might be a challenge to close the door! But on the bright side, there's a separate area featuring double sinks and a convevient shelf than runs the entire length of the mirror. More good stuff: Decent "minibar" sized fridge. Cuisinart coffee maker with ample supply of individual coffee packs. And much to my surprise, that Arabican coffee was pretty good. Despite the cooler evening temps, I enjoyed sipping on a cuppa while admiring the animals from my "private balcony seating." About the animals ... you'll find an illustrated "Wildlife Field Guide" list in your room. Believe me; you'll see most of the animals listed, and it's beyond thrilling. Your critter sightings are guaranteed, because food is stategically placed throughout the savanna as well as close to the rooms. What you won't see is any visible evidence that the zebra or ankole cattle or roan antelope passed directly beneath your balcony. The Disney poop patrol is ever vigilant! Bottom line, perhaps the whole experience is somewhat "staged," but who cares? It still works! Some valuable tips: Chat with the uniformed African Cultural Exchange students that you'll find out on the Arusha Rock Overlook. They know everything about the animals and are happy to educate you about their home countries. After dinner, take a comfy seat by the Arusha Rock Fire Pit. You never know who you'll meet! Talking about hotel dining, give the Boma buffet a miss ... it was really disappointing. Noisy, ridiculously overpriced at $32.99 pp, average quality offerings, and a big zero for ambience. Take the Lodge van over to the adjacent Kidani Village. The Sanaa restaurant was a brilliant dining experience, and much, much better priced! The Mara "cafeteria-style" dining option was just fine for breakfast or lunch. I recommend the chicken tikka pita! While you're there, grab a carton of milk (for morning coffee) and a muffin or croissant as well. That way, you can enjoy a relaxed "fuel up" in the morning, while you're getting ready for the theme parks. Not to mention ... more time to admire the animals. So, bottom line, is a stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge worth the inflated price? For us, for this special occasion, I'd have to say yes. You'll have to decide for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “More then a room with a view, a real Adventure”
Reviews.Author: bricomp
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful resort at Disney World and offers so much for families. On our last visit in November 2011 we stayed in a room with a view of the Arusha savanna. We could see zebra, roan antelope, red river hog, giraffe, wildebeest and lots of birds from our balcony, we got lots of photos and video without leaving the resort. We really loved the balcony view and ate a number of breakfasts and snacks while watching the animals. The rooms were comfortable, staff and housekeeping very good. Close to the Animal Kingdom Park. We really love the Mara for quick meals and the Boma buffet for breakfast. If you want to eat at the Boma make sure you make a reservation in advance it is very popular for breakfast and dinner. They also have a wonderful signature spot called the Jiko, great steaks, african dishes and a great selection of wine. The lobby is breath taking and a great place to relax plus it leads out to Arusha rock and you can see the animals on the savanna day or night. They also have a nice fire pit area. We love the zero entry pool and great gift shop. It is a great resort and an adventure of it's own right. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing place to Come Back to”
Reviews.Author: danielleybelle
Reviews.Content: Love this place. All of the restaurants are great, the atmosphere is great, and it's so fun to look out at the "Savannah" (although I have to say that it's a bit more like a zoo than the African bush). A word of caution though- the connecting rooms are very noisy. We could hear our neighbors conversations at night. And it wasn't their fault, they weren't being overly noisy, the walls were just thin. We did get annoyed though when housekeeping was servicing their room and we could hear their (very loud) chatter and (even louder) laughter. It just seemed disrespectful to those who are still trying to sleep at 8:30 am.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best for the money!”
Reviews.Author: travelingcheap
Reviews.Content: First off, I never get my room direct from Disney - hence the title. Instead, I rent from DVC members. AKL is usually available closer to your stay and doesn't run nearly as much as other DVC resorts. I've booked with my agent for nearly half of what it would have cost me to stay at the Wilderness Lodge during the same time. Now the review! The pool area is nice, nothing extraordinary, but movie night at the pool is great if you have kids or you're just a kid at heart. Still, it's a large pool and the view of the Lodge from the Pool (especially at night) is outstanding. The food - Amazing! My wife and I have done Jiko and Boma, loved both. We tried the little cafe (Mara) and didn't care much for it, but that was sort of expected. Rooms - Well themed without being "cartoonish." Our last stay (this was our 3rd) was with a pool view and it was amazingly quiet. The small balcony was nice and the room was clean and comfortable. We stay in Studios and they offer plenty of space. The Service - Always top-shelf!!! Like I said, this was my 3rd stay at AKL and the staff have always been very friendly and helpful. Not one complaint yet. The location - If you don't realize that you're quite a distance from the other resorts/parks, this may be an issue. Due to the distance (except from AK), you may end up waiting a bit for a bus and the ride is a bit longer. Our longest wait was about 30-40 minutes, but later that evening they fixed the problem by having a staffer on hand to make certain that extra buses were made available. Usual wait time for a bus was about 10-15 minutes max. The Resort - From the inside it is very similar to the grandure of the Wilderness Lodge. The lobby is very open and nearly everything is larger than life. The Savannah opens up through the large glass wall at the end of the lobby. This is great place to send the kids during check-in and it's worth a few minutes every day to just walk out and see the animals. If you like being close to the action, Jambo house is your best best. Jiko and Boma are both house in Jambo house and this is the classic lodge/resort. The other building was built for DVC and doesn't offer the restaurant choices or the same feel. I never have a problem recommending the Animal Kingdom Lodge to all of my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed AKL. First Disney Trip”
Reviews.Author: Megan G
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and children. My parents and aunt stayed 3 rooms down. We were on the 4th floor at Kidani with a savanna view. The staff was super friendly all over the resort. Check-in was a breeze and the rooms were ready early. Inside and outside was very clean. We ate at the buffet for breakfast and dinner. I prefeferred the quick service for breakfast (the crossants were amazing). The buffet dinner was great. Its busy and crowded but it only takes a simple call a few hours before to reserve a table. The longest walk in wait was about 25 minutes. I enjoyed trying some ethnic foods. For dessert, the zebra domes are the absolute best thing I have ever tasted (I lost count after 30 or so...hehe) The pools and hot tubs were open 24 hrs and very clean. We rented scooters (ECV) which I would highly recommend for $20 a day (they are $60 in the parks) from Buena Vista Rentals, especially to get to the lobby for morning coffee. That was the only downside to this property. We were across the savanna from the lobby and its quite a hike. The staffs' nametags say where they are from and I really enjoyed talking to the native people from all over Africa, some of their stories are captivating. The beds were super comfy! We were in the 1bd suite with a king bed and the furnishings were beautiful. The sleeper sofa and chair was very easy to pull out and put back. Kidani is smaller then Jambo but the bus picks up and drops off at Kidani first and if you drive or rent a car, Kidani has way better parking. I would say if you are just looking for a place to lay your head, its a little pricey, but if you take the time to relax, explore, and see all this lodge has to offer, its well worth the money. We were a little late to checkout and whlie housekeeping was ready to get in there, they were not rude or pushy and let us take our time. I gave them a nice tip for that. I definately want to return to Disney again and look forward to staying at AKL.

Reviews.Title: “Eating breakfast on the patio watching the animals”
Reviews.Author: JeffCa
Reviews.Content: Aside from the price, a very nice way to end our trip to Disneyworld. We had the Savanah view so we ate 2 breakfasts and 1 dinner on the patio watching the animals. We saw numerous animals even while we were packing. Very nice place if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: KrystaSch
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night, but it was wonderful. We were able to check in a bit early, and the front desk staff was great. A gentleman named Bruce greeted us as soon as we were out of the car and took us over straight away. We asked him for recommendations and he gave us the tip to have dinner at Saana, where even if they have closed the restaurant at 9, they will serve you dinner in the lounge area. The food at Saana was SPECTACULAR. The drums during a birthday celebration were a little bit bothersome, but part of that was probably the fact that we were all so tired from spending the evening in the Universal Park, which was pretty crowded and overwhelming. We had the breakfast buffet downstairs, and it was wonderful. They had a really great turkey and vegetable fritatta and all manner of breakfast foods you may want. The rooms themselves were lovely. The bed was super comfortable, the Savanna view was WELL worth the extra money. Even if you're only briefly in your room, it is kind of an amazing experience having giraffes walk by. Had an issue with the TV signal that was rectified by engineering very quickly. The only thing that was a little disappointing was that we weren't on the monorail, however the buses that took us over to the parks were perfectly fine. However, it was January, and I could see that being a bit of an issue if you visited at a more crowded time of year. Hopefully they increase the bus service to more frequent than every 20 minutes during the peak seasons!!

Reviews.Title: “ALL THE DISNEY MAGIC BUT ONE WORD OF ADVICE”
Reviews.Author: GAJacobs68
Reviews.Content: Keeping with Disney's standard of excellence, there is nothing you can say bad about this place but it is a little pricey. My only recommendation would be save yourself some money by staying in a standard view room. There are places all over the resort to view the animals when they are on display so don't waste your money paying for that experience. Most families are rarely in their room, except to sleep as there is so much to do. So get out of your room and do it, this is what you are going to Disney for anyway. You can really save big by refusing the temptation to spend the extra cash or points on the rooms with a view of the Savannah.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: DWT123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a Savannah view room (Room 2463 - Jambo Lodge) for 2 nights as a treat at the end of our holidayto celebrate our silver wedding anniversary. We both have high expectations when it comes to hotel accomodation and I have a bad back so the quality of the bed is important. Without doubt this was the best hotel stay we have ever had in Orlando and we have been visiting Florida since 1995. The service was impeccable and the room was perfect. Lots of space for two people (with 7 bags) and the bed was very comfortable indeed. We loved the atmosphere of the whole hotel, especially the fire pit in the main lobby area. We used the Disney bus service to get to Animal Kingdom, it was very efficient as well as being a welcome break from driving. The staff could not do enough for you (the bus driver even stopped when he was about to pull out to let us board). I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to friends or family. It is expensive however in this case you really do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Disney Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: 2thdoc73
Reviews.Content: Myself, my wife and two children (son is 10 and daughter is 7) stayed at the Disney Animal Kingdom Lodge from January 6 through January 14, 2012. I have attached some pictures to this review as well. Our room was at the Jambo House of the Animal Kingdom Lodge (as opposed to the Kidani Village of Animal Kingdom Lodge). We made the reservation through AAA back in July 2011. Our room was on the 3rd floor with a bunk bed, 1 queen bed, Savannah view with balcony to view the animals. Initially, we were placed into a room without a bunk bed and had not been made up yet, but we went back to the front desk and got the room we originally booked. We frequented the Mara food place because you could get food to go up until 11:30pm at night. My wife and I are vegetarians so we ordered the flatbread veggie pizza and falafel pita several times. One night we had dinner at the Jiko restaurant which was our fanciest, most expensive meal during our stay. We got hooked on the Jam Jar Sweet Syrah wine with which we had with dinner. Great service at this restaurant and caters to kids as well. The pool at the Jambo House of Animal Kingdom Lodge is large and heated at 82 degrees (I asked the front desk). There are 2 Jacuzzis near the large pool which was great for me and my wife to relax our sore muscles after marching through theme parks each day. The pool hours are 7:00am to midnight each day, however, the waterslide is open from 10:00am to 7:00pm. There were 3 lifeguards on watch when the waterslide was open. I recommend spending the extra money and getting a balcony with a view of the animals. I couldn't imagine having a view of the pool or something else. We rented a car and self parking was free and valet parking was available. The hotel is a Disney resort so there are buses which can take you to any of the theme parks at no extra cost. There were a couple days when we drove our car to theme parks and utilized the AAA "diamond" parking spots available at the theme parks. These AAA diamond parking spots fill up early in the mornings. Checking out of our room was easy. We had a credit card on file and went straight to the airport with our rental car. We had difficulties doing an online for check-in for our airline 24 hours before our flight. Supposedly a printer was down and we couldn't use the kiosk/computer. So we ended up using a computer inside the front desk employee offices to print out our boarding passes. Animal Kingdom Lodge needs to put in a business service area with several computers and printers so their guests can print out airline boarding passes. All in all, it was a fantastic family vacation and highly recommend this hotel for your next DisneyWorld family vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Animals and more animals”
Reviews.Author: Tom K
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for something different or you're an animal lover, then this is the resort for you. As you walk into the lobby, you'll be blown away with the construction. Food was good and the staff was great. Even if you don't have a savannah view, there are plenty of lookouts to see all of the animals from giraffes to zebras. You must rely on bus service for the parks, so you must be patient. The room is a little small for a family, but in most cases it's just a place to sleep. Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A Dream Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Crystal R
Reviews.Content: My parents both were diagnosed with cancer and have been in poor health for the last few years, so we booked a dream vacation, and that is exactly what we got! We are part of Disney's Vacation Club, so we borrowed points and splurged on a three bedroom suite. It was beaultiful. It had a pool table, four big bathrooms, and huge kitchen and dinning area, and well as three large, luxurious bedrooms. We had 3 individual balconies that over looked the savanna. Service was awesome, and it was definiately the best trip we have ever had. We stayed at the Jambo House, and it was so much better than Kidanie Villiage! Kadanie's pool is much smaller, and its father away from everything. It was a little croweded, but all the action is at the Jambo! Live music, art, night time stories, animals galore! You just have to experience it for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat a Disney property!”
Reviews.Author: Maleficent1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom villa, as we are in the vacation club, at Kidani. It was excellent as was to be expected. We had a Savannah view on the 5th floor. We could see giraffes, zebras, ostriches and wildabeasts. Since we are in the dvc, we do not have housekeeping everyday, only every 4 days. That being said, the rooms are always spotless and the service is wonderful! We recently stayed at a Hilton, and for the price we paid expected the same quality. We were highly disappointed. I guess once you are used to the value and excellence of a Disney resort, nothing else compares!

Reviews.Title: “Family Christmas”
Reviews.Author: CR521
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe villa for a few days at the end of December and had a wonderful time. The staff, as always with Disney, was great at this resort. The room was great. Even though we had booked a standard view room we got upgraded to a Savannah view which was really fun. The room comfortably slept five adults/teenagers and it was really nice to have a kitchen. Pool was wonderful. It was surrounded by foliage and really fit into the African theme. I would definitely recommend this resort to any one going to Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: EmLovesCW
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at one of the Deluxe resorts, and we were SO happy that we chose Animal Kingdom Lodge! We had a Savanna view, overlooking the Uzima Savanna. It was absolutely incredible. To be honest, I was skeptical at first on whether we'd even see decent animals, but within a few minutes of walking into our room, we went out on the balcony and saw giraffes, zebras, African cranes, wildebeests and numerous other animals! Throughout our entire stay, there was ALWAYS some type of creature viewable from our balcony. It was absolutely stunning and fascinating! We also really enjoyed that you could go out on Arusha Rock, outside the main lobby, and speak to one of the cast members out there who were happy to provide you with information on the animals, and answer any questions you may have about them. As always at Disney, the customer service was superb. I have always found that no matter where you are at Disney, the cast members are extremely friendly, helpful and professional. This was no exception. The main lobby is simply stunning. It's quite cavernous and when you first walk in your jaw drops just from the sheer size of it. There's plenty of seating, including some by the fire pit where one day we saw some people warming their feet! LOL! The gift shop, off of the main lobby, is excellent, and I bought quite a few items in there. Our room was very nicely appointed, the beds were comfortable, and the bathroom was spacious (two sinks, yay!) and nice. No complaints there. The bus service worked very well for us. The stop was right off of the main lobby. We went during Christmas so we expected it to be busy, but we never had to wait more than 5 or so minutes for a bus and only once did we have to stand during the bus ride. We never moved our car for the entire weekend. We went to two of the restaurants: The Mara, where we ate breakfast every day and lunch one day, and Boma, the buffet. The Mara is nothing special: it's a quick service restaurant where you can get a quick bite. The breakfast was simple but perfect for us. They had eggs, bacon, waffles, the usual. The lunch was a bit questionable. The hamburger we ate one day wasn't very appetizing, but honestly, that day we were so tired that we didn't have the energy to venture out for something else. As for Boma, it was delicious! I am a BIG buffet fan, and this was nice. There were some African themed dishes, but nothing too strange and of course there were items like salad and macaroni and cheese for the less adventurous eaters. ;) We also had a drink up at the Victoria Falls lounge, which was lovely. A word on the prices: obviously, in that this is Disney, everything is overpriced. I think you have to recognize that going in. It's not going to be cheap, they hike up the prices for everything. I think you just have to realize that and deal with it as best you can. It's the price you pay (literally!) for staying on Disney property. It is what it is. The only real complaints I had are very minor and definitely could be overlooked. First, the distance between the lobby and our room was incredible. It was a long walk to the elevator, and then another long walk from the elevator to our room. It's simply how the hotel is designed (obviously because of the savannas), but it did get to be a bit inconvenient at times, especially once when we were in a hurry and I forgot something upstairs. It's not a quick trip up to the room, LOL! All of that said, I would NOT want a room close to the lobby because the lobby was very noisy. I also wouldn't want a room by the pool for the same reason. The savanna view is really the only way to go, in my opinion. My other issue was the noise. It was a bit noisy at times, and sometimes in our room we could hear banging and bumping around in the ceiling. It did not, however, happen all the time nor did it prevent us from sleeping, so again, easily overlooked. All in all, I LOVED this hotel. Great Disney theming, totally unique experience with the savannas, and very convenient with all of the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Giraffes chillin' right off our balcony!!! Lived it!”
Reviews.Author: virginiapt
Reviews.Content: Does Disney know how to throw a vacation or what! We were there at the busiest peak holiday week in history but you'd never known it. The service from check in to check out was perfect. Room spotless. Room service on time and yummy! Maids friendly. Concierge helpful. And the animals would regularly parade in front of our room. The lodge was beautiful. We even asked for and received free a DVD player to watch a Christmas tradition. I don't know how they do it. Great people I guess!

Reviews.Title: “First rate deluxe Disney lodging”
Reviews.Author: debGR
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed for 2 nights at Animal Kingdom Lodge second week Dec 2011. we have also stayed at Yacht Club and Wilderness Lodge, which are also considered deluxe resorts. we loved this lodge. our room overlooked svannah where we saw animals roaming at all hours and enjoyed checking off each animal as we saw them on the wildlife field guide. we saw zebras, giraffes. red river hog, ankole cattle just to name a few. best time to see animals is 7-8am when keepers are puting out their food. lobby of hotel is similar in style to Wilderness Lodge, beautifully decorated with high ceiling. From lobby you are able to walk out to animal viewing area. my favorite feature was the indoor fire pit where you could find guests curled up at all times of the day. also enjoyed Victoria falls Lounge, nice bar area easily accessed from lobby area. i thought counter service restaurant Mara, was the best one we have experienced. there were healthy food choices (chicken pita, salads) and lines moved fast. we were on Disney dining plan and had more than enough food and choices. Addressing other reviewers concerns about Lodge being out ot the way, we did not find this to be a problem. Bus service to parks was prompt and never took more than 25 min to get to destination. Admittedly, the week we there did not appear to be a busy week. Walk to rooms may be considered far if you get a room a good distance from lobby. Just request room closer to lobby. If you have children and are considering a deluxe Disney resort, this would be an excellent choice. being able to sit on your balcony and see animals is a lot of fun. also many, many activities for children and family including scheduled programs, arcade, small playground.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: roxy476
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 11 nights in dec service was terrible. Were without bathroom light for 36 hours when there are 4 people in room this is a big problem requested extra hangers on two occassions they never arrived, coffee was never replaced and cups put back on machine dirty,only received turn down service five nights of our stay. We had a standard room but could not believe how close cars were had to keep curtains closed for entire lenth of stay and could not use balcony. On last day were given extended checkout as had a late long flight, popped out of room and on returning key had been deactivated with all our belongings in the room took over 30mins to be sorted out. Hotel is beautiful but service was really bad. Have previously stayed at swan, port orleans fq, hilton on hpb and service has been better at all of them. Would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent lobby, activities and outstanding pool area”
Reviews.Author: jeremieblust
Reviews.Content: The place is tredmendous, however, don't go in expecting a huge room. You won't get it. The rooms are very clean, dark and full of heavy wood. They are very attractive, but only about 350 square feet. However, the rest of the hotel is wonderful. Lots to do! Build time into your scheudle just to spend a day in this resort if you can. Also, don't forget the night viewing goggles they have for viewing the animals at night, I'm not sure many are aware of this option. The pool area is fantastic, best at Disney in my opinion. Excellent bars aas well if that is your thing.

Reviews.Title: “Memories to last a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: LZfamily
Reviews.Content: A beautiful lodge that is ornate and tons of things to see, and thats just the lobby. Biggest attraction is the animals which come to graze around the lodge. Same/similar animals but seperate location. Rooms are beautiful and the savannah view rooms are great to look out for animals. Like all Disney, a little pricey but worth the memories. tough part is timing ot get to parks and other locations. You wait for disney buses and with kids those waits can be long. Also during peak travel times, buses are full and have to wait for a second one which ads another 15 to 20 minutes. Just be patient and understand the wait time and it is fine. A lovely lodge with great buffet restauruant ofr breakfast. Lots to choose from and kids loved it. Never went for lunch or dinner. May not be for everyone but was worth it to stay at once. To wake up, have som coffee and watch the animals move throught the Savannah was incredible.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: craftyjan
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice at animal kingdom lodge, and would recommend it to any body, it is a fantastic place , clean, friendly staff nothing is to much trouble and the breakfast is huge well worth it, room very authentic and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Home!”
Reviews.Author: Loriel13
Reviews.Content: Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge (hereinafter DAKL) is truly our home away from home. We are DVC members, and therefore, have the choice of staying at Kidani or Jambo. Having stayed at both, we overwhelming prefer Jambo. On our most recent visit, we staying in a studio room right above the checkin area (on the 5th fl though) that overlooked the "Sunset Savannah" (which probably had nice views of the Sunset before Kidani was placed, directly blocking the sunset). This has become our favorite room out of all the ones in which we have stayed. The minuses (lack of pretty sunset view) are diminished by the many pluses. The next time we go, we will not even go to any of the parks - there is really no need to do so. There are so many things to do - it is almost like one of those resorts on unfriendly islands!! Many animals to watch and photograph on several savannah viewing points, night vision goggles to view the animals at night, available safaris, roasting marshmallows at the campfire at night, outdoor movies by the pool under the palm trees, a cozy bar in the pool area also under the palms with reasonably prices drinks, with and without alcohol, African Art scattered about the property, activities for the kids (that frankly I wanted to do too!), a fun, moderately priced counter-service restaurant (The Mara) with themed food and daily specials for routine meals - and Sanaa (in Kidani) for celebratory and reasonably priced meals. Jiko is a bit too pricy for the food served, and Boma is too much like an extraordinarily expensive Vegas buffet (far too much $$$ for people that don't gorge themselves at meals), not to mention FAR too noisy! The Victorian Falls bar is a nice place to sit and people-watch. The lobby of Jambo outshines the lobby of Kidani by many lumens. We could just hang out in the Jambo House lobby for hours - it reminds us of the Grand Californian lobby. The art, the styling, the fireplace, the waterfall...I can go on and on. Regarding transportation to other places - DAKL is farther away from Downtown Disney and all other parks than any other Disney lodging property. Therefore, bus trips are 30-45 minutes minimum to get anywhere. This must be kept in mind when planning breakfasts and dinners - you must leave at least 2 hours before your desired arrival time to assure that you will not be rushed and worry about being late. The bus systems are not the most efficient and need improvement, but, it is free and you do get where you have to go, and when you are on vacation, that is all that matters. I do think that DAKL should have a smaller shuttle than runs only between there and the AK. It would make too much sense. Also, the amount of people in those motorized carts (not wheelchairs - I am referring to the people that park these carts at entrances and walk about freely until it is time for them to go any distance) and their excessively large entourages should be provided specialized transportation vehicles to minimize the delays, arguments and hostility that do occur. Everyone deserves to enjoy themselves, but people should not be allowed to ruin other guests' vacations because of a feeling of entitlement or priority. The beds are divine - I have no idea why some people complain about them - I have had SIX back and neurological surgeries and I slept wonderfully on the bed. The only issue we have had with the room temperatures was when we stayed in a studio in Kidani - there is some sort of automatic climate control in the bathroom area and it kicks on - loudly - every time someone walked nearby. It lead to an excessively cool area in the room - and excessively noisy! The only difficulty we have had on more than one occasion is with housekeeping - we always seem to be shorted on the supplies (bowls, forks, spoons, pillows, etc.) and it takes 2 or 3 calls to get anyone to deliver more to us. These issues are minor and do not dampen our spirits or our love for DAKL. We cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “The only thing that would make this place better would be location.”
Reviews.Author: Garypaul1256
Reviews.Content: This place has an unbelievable feeling when you walk in. The emense size of the lobby says it all. When we got to our one bedroom villa and it was the same. It had a full kitchen with an island and a dining table. This is all open to the living room which has a queen sleeper sofa and a twin sleeper chair. These both have nice mattresses also. The king size bed has its own room seperate from everything. This bed is huge with lovely bedding tobute. In this room is a desk, dresser, armoire, and 2 night stands. It's a nice retreat for parents. There's also a balcouny that is accessible from this room and the loving room. Across the hall from this bedroom is a grand bathroom with a seperate toilet room. There's a huge jetted tub. Make sure you plan ahead it takes a few minutes to fill up. The best thing by far I think was the washer and dryer in the room. I could pack less clothes and leave more room for goodies to go home. If you want a nice room with a view of animals all day this is a place for you. It has a great pool area. The is the size of a football field. Or so it seemed. Not as big of a slide as you would've expected in this size of pool. A kiddie pool which is secluded from the big pool to keep small ones from wondering away in going for a dip. The hottub was also tucked away. I never went to see it. This place had 2 restaurants available. One a sit down menu and the other a buffet with offerings from a African family's dinner table. There is also a quick service place for food which is also a great place to eat. All in all a place I would stay a lot if it was in better proximity to the parks other than Animal Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Jambo House at Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Aretha B
Reviews.Content: My husband, 6 year old and 8 year old daughters stayed at Jambo house from December 24th -31st, 2011. Upon arrival we were greeted by last name by a cast member, Irma. We were taken back by the hospitality of the cast members, ambiance of the decor in Africa style and admired the African collection of art and artifacts. As an educator and teacher of African History and those living in the Diaspora, I was educated and felt so empowered experiencing my homeland and the Motherland, Africa. The children were amazed and enthralled with our Standard view of the Savannah and appreciated completing the animal checklist and fact sheet. The hotel, hallways, and overall decor was breathtaking. The cast members dressed in African attire and may who were from the continent of Africa added to the overall experience of being immersed in Africa. The furniture in the lobby and on the savannah view was amazing. Having a refridgerator was a plus. We loved the balcony and our view ofthe animals. The housekeeping staff were very accomodating. We were hoping that more Disney characters would be visible during our stay. The crafts for the children and African education sessions were great. We loved the arcade and fitness center. The pool was great with the games. On the first day, although we did not have reservations at the BOMA restaurant, we were accomodated and chosen as family of the day and drummed in to the restaurant to open it up. The African drumming and the time that was taken to teach the children the art was awesome. We ate breakfast there twice and dinner twice. We ate at the Mara, my only complaint that the breakfast meal portions (waffles) with the meals werevery small andyou were given only one. Itas a bit pricy forsmall meals. At the BOMA, My only reservation, is that the prices were not posted until the day before we left and the prices are extremely high. The Zawadi gift shop was really nice hoever, the prices of the fod was quite high. The rooms were nice. A few dust bunnies behind the beds andin crevices of the floor can be given more attention. The bed was a bit uncomfortable. I woke up with back aches on the second day. I just learnedhow to adjust. The room temperature was either cold or hot. We loved the laundry room and the television provided. We appreciated the bus transportation which was a great service. Sometimes it was a bit crowded coming back from the park but overall we appreciated the service. We would recommend this resort and definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Park Get-A-Way”
Reviews.Author: kathiewe
Reviews.Content: We have staid at nearly every resort at Walt Disney World and by far one of our favorite resorts is Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge -- Jambo House. In fact, we like it so much that staying here has become a Christmas time vacation tradition. As soon as you walk in the lobby you are taken away from the hustle of the parks to a much more relaxed and comforting place. At Christmas the 5 story tree centers the lobby and takes center stage with a nearby brook, indoor firepit, and 3 tiered restaurant overlook. Walk outside during the day and you are greated by a variety of safari animals or at night by a large cozy campfire. The kid's playground is set in a quiet corner near the pool and hot tub and filled with fun things for the younger set. The restaurant offerings here are diverse and wonderful from the quick service Mara (which has great flatbreads and yummy curry stew) to the grand buffet Boma (come hungry and leave more than satisfied) and elegant signature dinning restaurant Jiko (ask for to be sat in the wine room for a trully romantic evening). Want something extra special -- book the concierge level where the cast members go above and beyond to make your vacation perfect and the on going food options keep you satisfied and happy. Some people complain that Animal Kingdom Lodge is distant from the parks as you need a bus or car to get to all 4 of them, but for us that is a bonus. Its great to escape from all the hustly of the parks and the longest bus ride is Magic Kingdom at only about 20 - 25 minutes. Disney is fun and magical, but sometimes its great to get a-way and relax. Animal Kingdom Lodge is the perfect place to do just that. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Once in a lifetime experience - you won't want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Quality_seek
Reviews.Content: Hotel is reasonable, but is doesn't measure up to the hype. Rooms are average sized, beds were a little squeaky, bathrooms small - in other words an average 4-star. The hotel foyer was spectacular, bit no bars or restaurants in it. The animal reserve was exciting on first viewing, but pretty dull from then on - if you want animals like this go to Africa, not Orlando. As for The Disney parks, get ready To spend most of your time standing in a queue. They are great theme parks, but queuing is central to the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Second time a not as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: Kateluvssun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Animal Kingdom for 4 nights the first week of december. Check in was a total nightmare. None of the things I had added to the acct were rememebered (daughters bday, bunkbeds) but we worked it out. The lady was very nice, but just not trained well enough. We got to our room, and had no room keys in the packet... The rooms hadn't changed at all since we were their in 2006- even the same polyester bedding.lol. But all in all they were still in good condition. The outside viewing area also looked a little run down. They need to add more greenery. It was nice because everyday at 4pm they added leaves to the trees, so the giraffs would wonder over and eat. Kids loved that. We heard the new sister property the Kidani Village is nice because they have mini kitchen and they are brand new. The pool at the Jambo houes (main lodge where we stayed) was pretty nice still, a bit cold. The little kid pool is sad and run down. We did go over the sister property pool at The Kidani Village one day and had a blast. They offer a van every 5 minutes at the bell station. It isn't advertised, but worked great. The pool was so kid friendly with a special area for the little ones. The staff was great about organizing fun things for kids aged 5-10 with music and games. I even had 20 minutes to read my book. The resturant at the hotel at the lodge was so expensive but the food was really good. The buffet was worth it. I just wish they had a side menu for kids. My four year old just wanted something small like noodles and veggies, but you have to pay the $25 for little ones as well. My son was sick in the room, and they kindly brought us soup for free to take back with us. The food at Kidani's resturant was so good too. It was not buffet, and the choices were unique, but we really enjoyed it. They did a special dessert for my daughter which was sweet. Nice wait staff. The food in the cafeteria was well priced for what you got. We shared an entree and the kids did too, and it was plenty. They had a nice selection of wine for $15 (shocked me) so we took a bottle up to the room. The refillable cups are nice so you don't have to keep paying for kids drinks, you can use them all week at both properties. All and all it was a great trip. We left there for a Disney Cruise (which was beyond cool) and that was all very organized by the hotel in terms of luggage, etc. The lobby was just beautiful for Christmas, and because of the time of year, not too crowded anywhere we went. Lastly, the buses. for the most part it was pretty slick. It is a drive to most parks from this property (20 plus minutes). Animal kingdom is the closest obviously. One day we waited 1 hour for the Magic Kingdom bus, and people were so angry. For those of us that didn't throw a fit, they handed out fast pass rides to use later in the day. I felt really bad for the poor man working that day. Next time however, we will stay on one of the closer properties. All and all great 4 days. Disney does know who to keep folks having fun!

Reviews.Title: “Just like on safari”
Reviews.Author: lorjoy
Reviews.Content: Animal Kingdom lodge gives you the luxury of a spa, a wonderful dining experience and the wonder of watching African savannah animals from the balcony of your room. We took an optional "behind the scenes" trip ending in a meal in the Jiko restaurant. It was expensive, but worth the experience of learning about keeping animals happy and healthy in the enclosed environment. The decor of the lodge was in keeping with African design, down to the decorations on the shower curtains. Truly a beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!!!”
Reviews.Author: kimth2
Reviews.Content: Animal Kingdom lodge seems to have one really great positive, and a few negatives. It was a wonderful place to stay. The scenery when you looked out your window was beautiful! Giraffes, zebras, and other animals everywhere. It was amazing to see this sight every morning. Several downfalls though.... it is farther away than any other resort from the Magic Kingdom and Hollywood Studios. (Very close to Animal Kingdom though). We did not think they had enough buses available for the Resort. IF you missed your Magic Kingdom bus, you would have to wait 20 minutes for another one. Even at Downtown Disney, Animal Kingdom folks seemed to wait forever to get a bus compared to the other resorts. Another negative is depending on were your room is located in the resort, you could a walk good mile to get to your room after getting off the bus. (this is not an exaggeration). The was the resort is built, it is like a horse shoe. If you are on the far end, you better not forget anything when you leave in the morning. lol The pool area was fantastic. BUT, as for room service and restaurants located on site.... NOT KID FRIENDLY!!!!!! Very adult meats. Nothing simple like a hotdog, pizza, or fries.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Aim225
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 2 girls to Disney for the 1st time and deceided to stay at AKL because of their bunkbeds our girls wanted to sleep on and it was the best thing we could have done. The resort was wonderful! Our room looked out onto the savanah and we had animals right outside our room everyday! It was unbelievable. The staff was so helpful whenever we had questions or needed help Every night they had movie night in the pool,so much fun to swim and watch a movie on a theater screen at night. The restaurants were great too!! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “another incredible disney hotel”
Reviews.Author: pmomaine
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay at Disney's Animal Kingdom in Nov 2011 and we were blown away as soon as we enterred the lobby. Children sitting on the floor doing rubbings of the beautiful medallions set into the flooring and an amazing array of seating areas to read or just people watch. Walking through the lobby brings you to an outdorr area where campfires are held each night. You are now standing in what seems to be the edge of a safari. We saw zebras, giraffes, and several types of antelopes. On each floor there are also night vision glasses that allow you to watch the animals as they settle down for the night. The rooms are designed and decorated in an African theme and the bed is large and comfy. We had a studio room which was quite large and had a small patio overlooking the pool. If there was any negative at all it was that the room was quite far from the elevator. This complex is quite large and walking around it can take some time. As usual, the Disney cast members were friendly helpful and always smiling. Be forewarned that if you have a member of your party who likes to have the occasional evening cigar, you have only one place to go: beyond the pool, around the corner and near the maintenance area. Food area on site can be quite crazy, so be prepared to go during the off times if possible. All in all, another wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Animal kingdom lodge”
Reviews.Author: Moshe613London
Reviews.Content: Whilst I feel 3 out of 5 maybe slightly harsh I'm unable to give 4 as it translates to very good. The principle problem I had with the hotel is the quality of the food, which is pretty awful! Not only is it awful but it is also expensive, if one is paying as opposed to an inclusive package. The hotel is a winner in that it is a great family hotel and is wonderful for kids - as long as you drive elsewhere for your food.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: genevieve_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with five children aged between four and seventeen at Halloween break. The public areas of the hotel are impressive, the rooms less so. They are adequate but certainly not deluxe. It is cool to look out of the balcony at the animals...... but for about a minute. After that you're just too busy doing the Disney thing. We spent so little time at the hotel that location should have been paramount and the animal kingdom lodge is just too far away from all the parks, except obviously the animal kingdom lodge itself. It took a minimum of thirty minutes to get to the magic kingdom from the hotel via the free shuttle. I would definitely stay at a Disney resort hotel again but I'd pick the cheapest one nearest most parks.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: MelindaDunmore
Reviews.Content: For our New Years Eve visit to Disney, we chose Animal Kingdom and were very happy with the choice. The lobby is dark and very interesting, with real and pretend artifacts all over the place. The pool area is huge and really lushly planted with all sorts of trees and bamboo and such. Our room was very nice, with plenty of space for our things in the large bathroom. The water pressure in the shower was very strong, which my husband and I both loved. The greatest thing about the resort, however, was that outside our balcony we saw 4 giraffes, emu, vultures, zebra, and some other wild animals grazing! That alone did it for me! A true unique experience!

Reviews.Title: “Quite a place, a little pricey. no wi-fi???”
Reviews.Author: Jon G
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Fantastic decor. The visibility and the variety of african animals viewable from the room was really impressive. Good gym. Only two complaints. We ate only at the Mara (quick service restaurant) and while the castmembers were really nice the food itself was nothing special and the selection limited. I've never had a fresh tasting burger at disneyworld, they are obviously pre-cooked, and the one I had at Mara was lukewarm. Probably the most memorable part of Mara was the horrible music constantly playing. I've heard a good deal of African music and a lot of it I like very much but I don't know where they got the CD they were playing. It was was awful, and the CD they had was only about 30 minutes long so you got to hear some of the songs twice each time you ate. My other complaint was that there was no free wi-fi. You're paying so much and they can't even include wi-fi?

Reviews.Title: “Different and Fun”
Reviews.Author: lady2larz
Reviews.Content: The Disney Magical Express is actually just a bus with a long wait-not a horrible option, but no the "magic" promised. The Lodge is quite impressive. We booked the concierge level, and were greeted in the lobby by name and escorted to the club level check-in. Unfortunately, their system had lost our entire reservation and we had to start from the beginning. This took forever, and we we had dinner reservations that were now in danger of being missed. They finally got us another room (though with two Queens, instead of the King we reserved) and we had to pled with them to put our luggage in our room so we could literally run to make our dinner reservation. We made it just in time, and were handed a buzzer and put on the list as were others without reservations. So, we really didn't need to run-would have been nice to know that. After this, everything was wonderful. The room was very nice, and we had lots of animals right off our balcony. The restaurants were also great, and the grounds fabulous. I highly recommend the safari with the chef's table dinner and wine pairing.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel099
Reviews.Content: We loved the Animal Kingdom Lodge, although the service was not what we expect from Disney. The staff at the front desk was awesome as was the staff at the pool. The service provided by the housekeeping staff was not good. For example, we put the bedspread from the one bed on the floor so that our four-year old would not get hurt if she fell out of bed during the night. After the fist night, the. Edspread was never put on the bed again which gave the room an unfinished look. One day the trash was not removed from the trash cans. The occupants of one room down the hall from us put theirs out in the hall which was definitely not appealing. The trash stayed there until the next day. As noted by others, the rooms are small, but we were fine with the size as we spent little time in the room. We highly recommend a room on one of the savannahs, as it is awesome to sit and watch the animals. The pool area is very nice and kept very clean. The lobby is amazing. We're not sure why, but the hallways are kept very cool (freezing actually). All in all, this is a great property.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mayoos S
Reviews.Content: Amazing!!! Wow… what a hotel! We had an awesome time. We did not want to leave. So clean, Food was fantastic. Staff and service was out of this world and every moment was magical. Money well spent. I will stay there again and again. Please don’t miss this opportunity. My kids 10 and 8 had a wonderful time and so did we as parents. The beds are very comfy! Thank you Animal Kingdom

Reviews.Title: “Good start to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Avataarkaap
Reviews.Content: We were a tickled by the idea of two South Africans going all the way to Disney World to stay in an African style lodge, but it worked. It was a fantastic resort, with everything you need. The proximity to the parks and the convenience was awesome. Highly recommended, especially if you are taking the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Safari from the balcony”
Reviews.Author: KhimLee
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Disney World with 2 young kids and we stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge for 4 nights. We did not end up spending that much time at the resort but I can imagine that the children had be kept entertained there for at least a couple of days. The pool with the waterslide was great, the playground accessible and the compound with animals always within sight is a joy to roam. The lodge (Jambo House) was not as new and well-maintained as I expected it to be. The rooms were comfortable but not outstanding - the bunk beds were great though. I love animals and it was real fun being able to spot animals from the balcony. Bear in mind that it takes at least 30 min including waiting time to get from the lodge to Magic Kingdom - we came back for a nap in the afternoon which means we spent a least 2 hours each day in the Disney Express. Of course the ride to Animal Kingdom was much shorter so if you pla to spend most of your time there then staying at the lodge would be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Lifetime of memories”
Reviews.Author: Sobiar
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and usually don't think about a hotel once I'm back home. This one is different. It has left me with some amazing memories. The sight of a giraffe outside my window, the sound of beating drums and singing, the smell of African spices from Boma, the awe inspiring lobby, the fun filled wave pool, the warm welcome each time you return - all bring a smile to my face each time I remember! Have always said I would never stay in the same Disney hotel twice as so many different themed ones to experience but don't think I'd be able to resist staying here again if I ever revisit disneyworld!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shepfamily
Reviews.Content: We actually booked a room at the Coronado Springs Hotel and while the photos are impressive we found the smells both with smokers around the property and the chemicals used in the room for cleaning not to our liking. We had to move. Disney during the Christmas break found us a room at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. Thank you Disney staff! They were wonderful at the Coronado Springs Hotel in finding us a new room. Lots of magic moments including a ride over to help us out to the Animal Kingdom Lodge after a long plane flight and tired children. I can't say enough about their service. They warned us though about the Animal Kingdom Lodge using the same chemicals but it was night and day in what the rooms smelled like and we visited three different rooms at the Coronado Springs Hotel. It was well worth the upgrade. We saw some of the other premium hotels and some of them felt a little dated. The Animal Kingdom Lodge was a welcome respite to the activities of the park. I loved it each time I went into the lobby. It was an impressive lobby done right. This hotel provided us with our own oasis. We spent five nights and never grew tired of the night vision goggles, the great staff, the wonderful food, the drumming and the animals right outside our door. Tips we came to realize on this trip: Ask ahead of time to have your room cleaned with non chemical cleaners. The WDW dining plan will have you put on pounds even if you are walking all day long. We would not due a Disney Dining plan again. The extra shows like the luau and western review are a little dated. We still love character breakfasts with our children. We prefer the intimacy of Disneyland to the size of WDW. If you do plan on going ... budget for cabs. When you figure out the time spent in public transportation contrasted to the cost of the park tickets, hotel and food ... it is a nominal addition to save time, save on walking and cabs just make it easy getting around the park. We budgeted cab fares into our vacation and we are glad we did. The one time we had to take a bus it took over an hour to get to the venue. If I was doing that over 5 days ... it would of put a damper on a wonderful holiday. I would highly recommend the Jambo House in Animal Kingdom Lodge to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort with or without kids”
Reviews.Author: JerseyBrown
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a long weekend in March with the hubby and we both enjoyed it. We will definitely do a do-over!

Reviews.Title: “elevator nightmare.....”
Reviews.Author: JCP_11
Reviews.Content: Warning to all travelers... Don't get stuck with an end room right next to the elevator shaft... My family and I took a 1 week vacation during the Thanksgiving Holiday and we got stuck next to the elevator... At first we did not know what the noise was or where it was coming from but after investigating further it was the result of an elevator in much need of oil... needless to say we barely sleep the first night... The next day we ended up having to change rooms thus interfering with our plans for the day after we had unpacked EVERYTHING.... Luckily the hotel mgmt made things right and ended up giving us a $ 150.00 resort credit ( they did not offer ) as a result of my complaint... dont stay in 5328... you will regret it..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraPifer
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this lodge, in Jambo House, with my daughter and her family. On our previous visit in 2007 we stayed at Grand Floridian. Animal Kingdom lodge was excellent. The only complaint I would have is the transportation issue. We figured of our 9 day stay we spent at least one day total waiting on a bus or riding on a bus. Mostly waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond what we expected”
Reviews.Author: devfam19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge in mid December for four nights. We had visited the lodge before for dinner (Jiko, Boma and Sanaa at the villas) so we knew that the restaurants were great, but the hotel really went beyond our expectations. Customer service was excellent (the staff made us all feel very welcome and our children always got special attention). The Christmas decorations were beautiful and there were a lot of holiday- themed activities for children. Our room was in good condition and was clean. We found the Mara counter service restaurant to be very good as well (flatbreads, salads and breakfasts great - muffins, coffee etc just OK). Our room was a ground level pool view room and it was perfect. The outdoor seating area in these rooms is larger than for those above and the beautiful gardens have matured enough to create a lot of privacy. Our children are young, so this gave us a great spot to relax after they had gone to bed. These rooms have easy access to the pool, The Mara, outdoor movies, nightvision animal viewing, Simba's Club House and are a comfortable walk to the lobby and buses. Overall the hotel is fun for children and relaxing for adults. Transportation to Magic Kingdom and other parks was not a problem for us, eventhough the location is distant. There was one morning that the bus to Animal Kingdom had a mechanical problem, otherwise transportation was great. We have enjoyed staying at a few other Disney properties (Wilderness Lodge, Beach Club, Boardwalk, Coronado Springs and Contemporary) and feel this hotel is a great choice for families - especially compared to some of the more expensive Deluxe resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Geeeeeee3
Reviews.Content: Stay at this hotel if you are in Disney World, you won't regret it. Imagine sitting by the balcony and animals are just outside. Our room was by a watering hole so there was something going on all the time. Ankle-Watusi Cattle (horns can reach up to 8 feet long), zebras, giraffes, bongo, etc. Will definitely go back to AKL.

Reviews.Title: “A Practical Review of Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Andy M
Reviews.Content: Before I go on a Disney trip to a Disney Hotel I've never stayed at, I tend to read tripadvisor reviews, specifically, negative reviews because positive reviews all say the same thing: "oh Disney is so magical," and different variations of that.
