As such, I find negative reviews to be more helpful. This review, however, is not a "negative" review. I am going to give a practical and helpful review to people staying at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. I am going to break it down into various sections for easier comprehension. This was my 50th trip to Disney World, and I have now stayed at all but 2 Disney Hotels, so I think I have a good basis of comparison. The Staff The staff at the AKL was courteous and friendly, as you would expect with a Disney hotel. Occasionally we ran into a less-than-chipper employee, but sometimes people have bad days. The Restaurants There are 3 restaurants at the AKL plus 1 quick service restaurant. The restaurants are overpriced and weird. Boma is a buffet with normal American buffet food, but is very expensive. The other 2 restaurants have African food. It was weird. I'm sure if you're into ethnic food, you'd love these restaurants. I do not. The Animals All else aside, the ONLY reason to stay at the AKL is the novelty of looking out the window and seeing animals. I've read some reviews that said they didn't see any animals. This is B.S. The animals are everywhere. If you walk into the hotel and look out the back window you will see dozens of various animals. Zebras, Wildebeest, Giraffes, etc. If you are worried about seeing enough animals to justify the costs, don't. You will see them. The Room Most of the negative reviews I have read on here complain about the room. Let me set it straight right now. IT IS A HOTEL ROOM! You get either a bed and a pull out couch, or 2 beds. There's a TV, a bathroom, and a closet. I don't know what people expect. It looks just like every other hotel room you have ever stayed in. If you are in your room for more than 2 waking hours per day while in Disney World you are wasting your money anyways. It's just a plain, ordinary hotel room. You sleep shower and change there. That's it. We had a savannah view. Again, I've read several reviews that said people couldn't see any animals from their room. Again, wrong. There were dozens outside our room at all hours of the day, especially at night when we got back from the parks. And if you think that maybe I just had a good room, you are wrong. There are windows in the hallways, every 40 feet or so, on both sides of the hallway, so you can see pretty much the whole savannah. There were always animals outside. If you are paying the small fortune for the room with the savannah view, rest easy, you will see animals. The Pools There are 2 pools. One at the Jambo House and one at the Kidani Village. No matter which house you stay at you get access to both pools. the Kidani Village pool is cooler to look at. The Jambo House pool is boring looking. Just a pool and a slide. But, the bar was nicer at the Jambo House. Both pools are nice. The Transportation As I said at the beginning of this review, I have been to Disney World now 50 times. So, take what I am about to say to heart: There is only 1 real reason to stay at a Disney hotel, and that is their transportation system. Orlando has no shortage of hotels, and there are plenty very close to Disney World. Most just as nice, all a lot cheaper. But, Disney does a phenomenal job making it very difficult for people not staying at their hotels to get to their parks, in order to encourage people to stay at Disney hotels. AKL is far away from the Magic Kingdom, EPCOT Hollywood Studios and Downtown Disney. 20-30 minutes on the bus. It is close to the Animal Kingdom Park (obviously). It takes a long time. It’s not a big deal if you are like me who went on this past trip with 2 adults. We can deal with the long bus ride at the end of the night. But if you have small children, watch out. The busses at the end of the night are crowded (I'll get to that next) and seats are hard to come by. You will be stuck holding your kids the whole bus ride as they sleep in your arms, for the entire 20-30 minute bus ride. I have also read a lot of complaints saying that the buses don't run very often. I did not find this to be true. The buses were a little slower than most other hotel's buses (5 minutes or so on the whole) which does not sound like much, and really it's not. But, the AKL is CROWDED. As it is a very crowded hotel, the lines for the buses at the parks fill up fast. Since the bus lines fill up so fast, it makes every bus very crowded. At the end of the night you will generally have to wait for 2 or 3 buses (depending on the time of year and how crowded the park is). If you have little kids, waiting all that time, and having to stand the whole ride back is not fun. Overall Overall, the AKL is a great hotel. But it's not without its drawbacks. It’s far away and VERY EXPENSIVE. The only reason people book this hotel is the novelty of seeing the animals. Let me tell you, that novelty wears off quickly. My honest assessment is that the AKL is not worth it. So, why would I say the AKL is a "great hotel" and then say it is not worth it? It's simple. This isn't a beach resort, where you stay at the hotel the whole trip. This is Disney World. When you go to Disney World you go for the parks. AKL is not convenient for visiting the parks, except Animal Kingdom. For the kind of money it costs to stay at the AKL you can stay at the Contemporary, Yacht and Beach Club, Wilderness Lodge, Boardwalk, etc. If you want to see the animals, take the safari tour at Animal Kingdom Park, or just go out to the AKL and eat at one of the restraints one night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller0984
Reviews.Content: This hotel really is fab, my husband & I stayed here for 5 nights and the staff were excellent, the rooms were really comfortable, it has an excellent pool, buffet restaurant and a convenient shuttle service to all the parks, waterparks and downtown Disney. The theming is excellent and we loved being able to wake up and look out over the "Serengeti" every morning and seeing the animals.

Reviews.Title: “club level at Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Barbara T
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Jambo House and paid extra for the club floor. Be warned, the club floor is really set up for kids - gold fish, salted nuts, and cookies were pretty much what was served each day - would suggest you buy your own and save the extra cost. In addition the hours were limited - was unable to get coffee early in the morning. However, staff was gracious and efficient. The Sunrise Safari was spectacular - best part of the trip if your interest is animals. Unfortunately, you have to be on the club floor to have the safari option. AKL bed was creaky and bathroom light was very dim. All in all, however, the visit was fun and truly a Disney experience. We were celebrating a birthday and Disney staff made it special. Make sure and tell the staff if you are celebrating a special day..

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: d1971brb
Reviews.Content: Stayed with kids and grandkids at this Disney property just before the Christmas week. Put the kids up at the villas and separated ourselves a tad by staying at the Lodge. The Disney people are very efficient and the luggage system is fantastic. The room was good but not great. The bathroom was very small and there was not a lot of room total. But the amenities are good, and the ability to go out on the balconey and watch zebras et al graze, is the big plus. The property is very noisy, as is the case with all the parks as well. Kids everywhere, but that is what Disney is all about. The room was the one relatively quiet escape spot from the throngs. A nice perk for me was the golf transportation. Most people do not have their own cars, and Disney arranges for you to be picked up by a cab, gratis, and transported to their golf venues. They even pay the tip. Overall, a very nice and expensive vacation, with great attractions, food options, transportation, and services.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SAW60
Reviews.Content: It's a great place to stay. It is great seeing the animals roaming around the savannah, you feel that you are in Africa rather than Florida. The hotel is near Disney's Animal kingdom, so you will have to travel to the other parks but using the disney buses is easy as you are dropped off near to the main entrances. The pool is great, with a gentle slop in to the water. The Mara is ideal for those quick snacks, but if you fancy a buffet style breakfast or dinner then head for the Boma. Here you will find a great selection of food with an african/american spin. Jiko is the high end restaurant at this hotel, it is ideal for those special occasions. The staff are friendly and the shop has a good selection of gifts to tempt you. You will enjoy your stay at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Most Uncomfortable Bed”
Reviews.Author: Yiyi B
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with an Arusha View. We had a great viewing location and the room was close to the lobby. The resort and it amenities are great. However, you can pretty much enjoy all the amenities without being a resort guest. The actual room was horrible. It was always humid and warm. We are from Miami and this was too humid, even for us. The bed was beyond uncomfortable. My husband arnd I both woke up with back aches each night. We actually dreaded going to sleep. The bed linens are poor quality also. The tub/toilet area is tiny and dark. We didn't spend much time in the room. However, after a long day at the park, I just wanted to return to a comfortable bed and a cool room. Also, internet service was terrible. Save your money. Stay somewhere else. You can come to the hotel via the Magical Express and spend the day there for free. Enjoy the free animal viewing, night vision googles, campfire, storytelling, pools, and playground for free. Just don't sleep there.

Reviews.Title: “Animaltastic”
Reviews.Author: Times_A_Wasting
Reviews.Content: Okay, I know, a little korny to say animaltastic, but we really enjoyed ourselves at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. The balconies overlooking the pastures are nice for enjoying the animals any time you are in your room. If you walk around the resort there are various look-out points that sometimes have employees that you can talk with about the animals and their lives at the resort. The Giraffes were my favorite. We had breakfast one morning in the restaraunt and I will be honest that this meal is my only negative experience. It wasn't bad, it just wasn't great, and it was expensive...$50 for just two people. The pool and waterslide at the Resort was enjoyed everyday by the kids. And the water was warm which was nice since we only had time to enjoy the pool in the evenings after spending all day in the park. The architecture and native artifact exhibits throughout the Lodge are fenominal. The ceiling fixtures, amazing. The Lodge even has a guide book you can view that provides great detail on the exhibits and their origins and people. All the staff we encountered seemed more than willing to help answer any question. The on-site store was heavily stocked with just about anything you could want to drink or eat, even wine and beer. Plus it had a huge selection of Disney clothing, gifts and momentos. Not eveyone can afford this kind of experience at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. I will admit it was an expensive portion of our vacation. That said though, it was worth it because of the total experience we had.

Reviews.Title: “more than someplace to stay, a great family experience!”
Reviews.Author: dadloveserin
Reviews.Content: visited the Animal Kingdom with my 4 & 6 year old boys and had an amazing time. With the animals right outside the room, the kids would've been happy to spend the entire vacation at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love everything about this resort...”
Reviews.Author: LDZZZZ
Reviews.Content: As a DVC member that planned a last minute trip, the only property that had any availability was the Animal Kingdom Villas, savannah view. I did not have high expectations because it seems like it's own private island, far away from all the action. Surprisingly, this was the very thing that we loved the most. The hotel itself is stunning...the architecture, the attention to detail, the magnificent cast members, the indoor/outdoor fire pits, the pool, the spa..I could go on & on...Not to mention the animals! It was so cool to wake up early in the morning, sit outside & drink a cup of coffee while watching a giraffe roaming around, practically right in front of you. If you do not have a savannah view, no worries as there are several viewing areas throughout the hotel. As far as it being too far away from everything else, although we had a car, we found it to be fairly close to everything. We will definitely stay here again in the future, especially if we have children with us. Oh, and as for people asking about if it smells at all, absolutely not! The grounds are immaculate. If it were not for the obvious view of the animals, you definitely would not "smell" them. This hotel is worth it. We LOVED it.

Reviews.Title: “Animals! Animals! Animals!”
Reviews.Author: circa1952
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed one night at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. I didn't stay in a savanna room, just an ordinary room. The beds were wonderful! That was without a doubt the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in. I wanted to take it home with me. The next morning I awoke just as the sun was starting to come up. I looked out and saw 4 giraffes outside my window. I got my camera and my tea and went out to sit on the balcony. During the next hour and a half I saw 5 giraffes, 6 antelopes, 6 zebras, 3 ostriches, 4 wildebeest and a East African Crowned Crane (a noisy thing) from my balcony. All the late risers missed the spectacle. It was the best part of my whole trip to Disney. The only negative thing I have to say about the lodge is that it sees as if I had to walk about a half mile from the front desk to my room. Since you have to pass the front desk to go anywhere (the parking lot, restaurants, buses, etc.), I spent a lot of time walking inside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'd walk a mile for the Lobby, Kidani;Animal KIngdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: LPnerdN.C.
Reviews.Content: unless you are in one of the first two mod off the lobby at Kidani, you do walk a mile to the lobby, . If you are that close, you walk a mile to the pool. It's just to darn big with no short cuts to any where. Our stay started Dec 10th and ended-16th 2011 in room 7758 KIdani,savannah view, dedicated two bedroom with excellent animal viewing.All rooms open onto balcony. The master bedroom was a dream. Carpet,King bed was so comfy, clean crisp linens, the bathroom was the size of a small temple. Jacuzzi tub, and a huge glass shower with bench seat and water pressure to die for. Two sinks, large vanity, toilet was in a closet without AC vent, and a mirror on the back of the door, Very strange. but whatever...Plenty of storage in both bedrooms and LG TV's. The rooms have energy saving lights , but not enough wattage. good luck with the make-up ladies. the rooms are darker than what is comfortable at night and early am. IMO. Second bedroom had two queens, carpet, door to balcony, full bathroom and pvt. water-closet, LOL, same complaint there, double vanity. 3rd full bath as you come into the unit, across from the utility closet.Nice to have I guess, but unnessary IMO. I would have rather the extra living space. More on that in a second. The washer dryer were the larger stacked ones we love and they have switched from tide to ALL detergent, for those with allergy concerns.also, vacuum and brooms and mops here as well. We had views off the living area as well. animals almost all the time as there were several feeding stations right off our balcony. WE saw Zebras, Giraffe's, Ankole Cattle, Ostrich, Stork, and many others daily and frequently. it was great, for about 4 days, then the novelty wore off and it became more about the L O N G walk to the lobby or buses. So long, that we only used the bus to animal kingdom, the rest of the time we drove our own car, MUCH easier! We were close to the pool, just down the elevator to the parking garage, down one mod and out and the pool is between Pumba and Timon parking garages. ( all visitor parking is underground and pretty cool.) It sounds wimpy but after walking around the parks all day, to then come back to your hotel and have to schlep a mile to anywhere you might want to go at home base gets OLD even for young legs! About the Kitchen/living space... what there is of it. We had 6 peeps in a room that could sleep 8 plus two crib sleepers... it was over crowded to the extreme. The brand new LG TV was awesome, problem, one love seat that was not too comfy and one chair you'd have to move to see the TV. Table had room to be bigger but sat 4 comfortably, and two stools at the small counter.Stools, without backs, so little kids can't sit there. (There are two highchairs in the room along with a pack and play in each bedroom closet.) After a day at the parks the kids wanted to play with toys or sit and color, it got cramped. The Kitchen is galley style so only one in there at a time, period. there was room for more cupboards on the far wall, but it was empty. No crockpot, ( good thing we brought our own), the plates were small square things the kids could not use and the bowls were all very tiny, so instead of being able to get dressed and ready as the kids ate, you were pouring bowl #2. We cook our main meals there as 300 bucks a day on food is a bit much for us. I can feed all 6 of us for about 30 bucks a day by going to publix, and Disney meal plan is about 39 a day per person! That's one reason why we became DVC members, we cook simple meals, and save money to do other things! Was the trade off worth it, small kitchen and Living space so we could see the animals... yes, for about 4 days. day 5 and 6 became an exercise in patience as we all tried to exist in a space to small for us. THe pool activities were on the hour starting from 1pm -5pm. lots of fun. Community Hall had a couple of crafts going almost all the time and as we always find, the cast members there are fun and great with the kids. But again, by day 4 even the kids were tired of the long walk. Thankfully we were close to the pool, and the weather was ok, so they headed there a couple times and loved the pool, hot tub, and slide! we used online check in, so only had to get our keys and room assignment. they let you pick now. If it's not to busy and we got into our room about 11am. We loved it here, don't get me wrong, it's beautiful, clean, and the animals are worth any other hassle... Next time, we'll stay here 3 days, and at another resort 3 days. For a shorter trip, not sure I'd recommend unless you HAVE to see the animals, try another resort at WDW. Also, FYI the other lodge, Jambo, has a better restaurant offer, but the pool is just ok unless you have really little ones, like 3-4 and they can't swim.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: mullSv
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing! I loved the beautiful decor and background music playing throughout the resort. Lots of balconys(complete with rocking chairs) and places to look out over the animals grazing. The rooms were very nice, super friendly staff, lovely pool, and best part of all...seeing zebras, giraffes, etc right outside. This place is a nice break from the busy parks!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lodge”
Reviews.Author: meishdublinOh
Reviews.Content: Our second visit to Walt Disney World. Our first stay at Animal Kingdom Lodge and we loved it! We stayed at the Jambo house on the fourth floor, the rooms were very nice; the kids had bunk beds and we were able to see the animals every time we stepped onto the balcony. Loved watching the giraffes! We had a club level room and had complimentary breakfast every morning, snacks in afternoon and wine and cheese in the evening. We took advantage of the breakfast but of course we were at the parks throughout the day. The bus service to and from the parks were fine no complaints. We ate at 2 restaurants at AKL, Sanaa which was very good and Boma a buffet which was good too plenty of foods to choose from. We will definitely stay at AKL again!

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge is like a mini safari”
Reviews.Author: brentsf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge and compared to most of the other properties at Disney World, I feel it is one of the best. The setting feels like you are out on a safari in Africa and the hotel grounds fit nicely into that motif. The rooms are very nice, big and decorated accordingly as well. The pool area is great and there are a few dining choices. If there is any flaw, it would be there are not tons of food choices, but you can just hop on the free Disney transportation buses and quickly get to another resort to eat at if you need to. Overall I think you get a nice hotel for the money and if you book a safari room, you are on the exterior of the building where there are real animals that come right up to your balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline B
Reviews.Content: This was one of the more fun hotels I have ever stayed at. Seeing the animals out our window was really unique. Even on an actual safari I took I didn't have that treat! Rooms are large and have cute touches such as a lion king design in the window curtains. Super cute and worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: dkrmjn
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights in Jambo house Dec, 2011. Loved the hotel...beautiful, lots to see and do on site, quiet even though we were on a pool view room. We selected the hotel because we were travelling with grandkids and wanted the bunk beds for them. The rooms were adequately sized and comfortable EXCEPT for the beds. That's actually why I gave 4 stars instead of 5. Since this is one of the "Top Level" of the Disney hotels, I expected a much more comfortable bed. Not to be. The queen we slept in had a hard, lumpy mattress, moderate quality linens. The bunks felt as if the children were sleeping on plywood with a thin mattress on top...come on, Mickey, you can do better! That being said, the rest of the place was fabulous with a great pool, animals roaming the property for the kids to see, night vision goggles. We went over to Kindani Village for dinner at Sanaa restaurant one day and had the tastiest meal and best service of anywhere we ate (including California Grill at Contemporary Resort). The only other downside to this hotel is the location...IF YOU TRAVEL WITH SMALL CHILDREN WHO NEED NAPS this may NOT be the best choice for you as it is the farthest distance to all parks except Animal Kingdom park. Otherwise, stay here and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent pool view at night”
Reviews.Author: 4smiths4pets
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at AKL! We did not book a savanah view and did not regret it at all. My parents spent more time at the resort and less at the parks loved their savanah view, but for us, we were rarely in the room so it did not make sense to spend the extra money on a savanah view. There are plenty of public spaces to check out the animals. We loved the pool, really large and with plenty of area to play in. We thought the food court, Mara was small but good enough for the few times we went there. The walk from your room to the bus can be LONG, so if being close to transporation is important to you, request a room close to the lobby. Pool view rooms are also close to Mara which was a plus. All and all we love it and will go back!

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite Disney hotels”
Reviews.Author: jaimelass
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite Disney hotels and I've stayed at a few. We were upgraded for free to a Savannah view (three rooms total). The view was great! We had a balcony with giraffes and other animals right outside our window. We also had 2 children with us so we got a queen bed and 1 set of bunk beds. It was a very nice and cute surprise. The room was wonderful, very comfy and clean. It was a bit of a walk from the lobby to our room but I'm guessing that is because we had the Savannah view. The service at the hotel is great from dining to housekeeping. The pool was heated and open 24 hours which was great. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. They seem to have good deals all the time at this hotel which is how we were able to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Still my favourite place but mousekeeping is slipping”
Reviews.Author: jjejermaster
Reviews.Content: This is still my favourite place to go but I must be honest and say the "mousekeeping" needs to smarten up. For the price that you pay for this hotel, it is not as clean as what I would expect. Fingerprints on the mirrors, dust behind the toilet bowl, small things like that. What appeared to be coffee stains on the floor in the bathroom. The view from your room is spectacular, seeing the animals up close. The beds are very firm, to the point of being uncomfortable and giving both my husband and myself a sore back. I will always stay at this resort as the entire atmosphere is so "Africian" and you really do feel like you are there. It is pricey and for most part is worth the money but very disappointed that mousekeeping is not what it should be or what I would expect for the money paid. The restaurants on site are the best in Disney, with Jikko leading and Sanaa a very close second. Mara, the quick service is you basic food but good, nothing fancy. If it was not for the hard bed and the mousekeeping this place would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Time, Had By All.”
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during Thanksgiving week, and we had a great time. We were a family of 4, traveling with another family of 4...and at no time did we ever feel stressed out. We stayed on the Club level, which gives you access to the 6th floor lounge, which is incredible. Our kids had cups of gummy bears whenever they asked, desserts were served nightly, and they offered a continental breakfast that served as our first meal of the day. For the adults you had unlimited free wine and beer whenever you wanted it. The kids named it the floor right below Heaven, as all their dreams came true there. We had a great view of the animals every morning and night, which included, giraffes, zebras, wart hogs, and elk. We always ended most of our days at the pool. Which had an OK water slide, as far as my 9 year old was concerned, and they had lifeguards on duty. Food at Jiko was incredible and was worth the 2 Dining Credits. Boma was fine as well, with an extensive buffet. Mara is their Quick Service outlet, and anybody who complains about that, really isn't a very happy person...It's quick service for a reason. The rooms were a bit small, but you really don't spend much time in them. Staff was fine, as we didn't have too much interaction with them as we really didn't need much.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay and relax”
Reviews.Author: jgot
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge on several occasions, but never in late November. The cooler weather does keep the animals in their barns a bit later in the day, so we missed our favorite reason for staying here: Sitting on our balcony and eating breakfast while watching the animals. But the lobby does have an impressive Christmas tree and the food at Jiko remains our favorite at Disney. I might choose this lodge more in the spring and fall, when the animals are likely to be more active. But having the security guards and bellhops welcome you home each time you return, and the always friendly, smiling, helpful staff makes this an amazing place to escape to.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Christie411
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed in a pool view room at Disney's Animal Kingdom lodge. We arrived around 9:30 a.m. from the cruise port and were amazed that a room was ready for check-in. Check-in was efficient. The lobby is spectacular. There are several places to sit and enjoy the surroundings, including a fire pit. The back of the lobby overlooks the savanna. The room was nothing special but much better than the "value" Disney resorts. The room had a small refrigerator and coffee maker. A small balcony overlooked the pool area. Beds were comfortable; more pillows would have been nice. The vanity area was large, but the toilet/tub area was tiny. Mousekeeping was phenomenal! My children were greeted with several towel animals each evening. The room was always cleaned thoroughly. Extra towels and toiletries were left each day. The resort has enough activities to keep children busy for days. We received a list of activities upon check-in and planned accordingly. Activities included crafts by the pool, storytelling by fire pit, s'mores by "campfire," and movies by the pool. The kids didn't want to leave to go to the parks. Buses were convenient and didn't seem any longer than trips to and from other Disney resorts we've visited. Buses are shared with Kidani Village. We used the food court only once. It was ridiculously expensive. Most folks were on the free dining plan at the time, but we were not. We chose to drive to nearby restaurants and keep snacks in the room. I truly loved this resort, but would find it difficult to pay the typical prices. We received an upgrade from a moderate resort. This resort has a great deal to offer, so I wouldn't recommend it for families that plan to spend most of their time at parks.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great visit”
Reviews.Author: toby495
Reviews.Content: Love this Disney resort. You'll feel transported to Africa upon walking in the front door. We stayed for a short four night visit but wish we could have stayed longer! At first thought being on the outskirts of Disney's property was not going to be so nice but, as with most things Disney, the bus system was super! Simple walk between the village resorts. My only complaint was that the resort is sprawling and and can be a bit of a hike if you need to get back to the room for forgotten items. We will absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Animals!”
Reviews.Author: Jason N
Reviews.Content: This is a great Disney Resort. Not only do you get animals when you look out your window but the best in Disney service! A great place to feel like you are a thousand miles away but everything is right in your backyard...pass the lions!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay in Disney World”
Reviews.Author: Parrothead_at_heart
Reviews.Content: We had been wanting to stay at the AKL since visiting it several years ago. While the property is large, it is not as overwhelming as others in WDW. All the staff was great. We checked in very late, but we were checked in quickly, and got to our room. Our luggage came later (Magical Express has its good and bad points), but the bellman brought them up early the next day. We reserved a Savannah view room, and I would honestly say it was not worth the money. The animals were out at sunrise and sunset, and we weren't at the room at those times! Friends staying in a different room said they had lots of animals, so maybe that matters. I would recommend getting the concierge level room. We never paid for a breakfast, and with the drinks and snacks we got through the days we were there, we easily saved more money than the extra cost for the concierge level. Beyond that, it is a Disney property, so it offers great service, a nice pool (great slide!) and good restaurants. We prefer Wilderness Lodge, but the Animal Kingdom Lodge was great!

Reviews.Title: “Animals hit or miss”
Reviews.Author: undinabiker
Reviews.Content: Our first morning and last morning at this hotel were the only times that we saw animals. Bring good bincoulars or at least a 300mm photo lens--the room we were in was far, far away from seeing any real detail. If you want to eat a huge breakfast, go to Boma. HINT: Each station at the buffet is its own line, so just bypass the ones you don't want, or get back in line later for additional items you do want to save some time. Expect to pay a premium. Mara was cafetaria-style and for $10 you get a regular-sized meal quickly, plus you can eat outside poolside. Allot extra time as this resort is also far from the Magic Kingdom--buses run every 20 minutes "or so"--and that "so" can have you waiting curbside for a while if you miss your bus. Expect a 20-minute drive to Magic Kingdom in addition to the bus wait plus another 10-minute delay to teh gate and through security and tickets. Hotel has activities for younger kids like face painting.

Reviews.Title: “The magic has gone!”
Reviews.Author: Oldbaines
Reviews.Content: This used to be my favourite hotel in the whole world. I have stayed here five times in the last ten years. But I have to say that although outwardly the hotel is very impressive, the magic is really fading. We saw cockroaches around the pool area and outside the Mara eating area. I have never seen cockroaches in any other hotel in the States. I note that another reviewer has also noted seeing them. Also the food in the Mara quick service area was often served cold, as if it had been sitting around too long. I am a big Disney fan, but this last trip we saw evidence of a decline in standards across the parks and in the Hotel. Make sure that your food is piping hot before you eat it, or you may be struck down by a stomach bug like our family was. A trip to the emergency room is no fun! On the plus side, this hotel is still amazing to look at, and the closeness to the animals is great for both adults and children.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Billyinda
Reviews.Content: Took my Son for his 21st Birthday treat - it was well worth the scrimping and saving! The lobby is fantastic, the room was mega, being able to look out of the windows and see giraffes, zebras etc was wonderful, the swimming pool was irresistible as were the jaccizi's! You have to make sure you book the restaurant as it very popular. We bought refillable drink cups which were a good investment. AKL is farthest away from the parks - apart from Animal Kingdom - but we used Disney Transport and had no trouble getting around. Definitely made magic memories.

Reviews.Title: “OMG! AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: BarBieeDoLL
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 5 days - the week of Thanksgiving. This place is an absolute breath-taking, amazing, beautiful resort. We were welcomed with a "welcome home" an amazing tour guide named "JOSEPH", I was so overwhelmed with excitement when i arrived, I got emotional. Never have I stayed in such a beautiful place, with amazing decor, and the animals were beyond words can ever say. Was beautifully decorated for christmas, amazing!! Beautiful, clean nice pool and play area for children. Gave me the ultimate Jungle experience. The animal tour guides are from africa and are very knowledgeable about the animals. Beautiful bon fire at night. ABSOLUTELY A MUST STAY!!!! I want to return....

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at Disney World, away from the hussel and bussel of some of the other resorts.”
Reviews.Author: bbeazley
Reviews.Content: There are not many places one can stay that are like Animal Kingdom Lodge. Out each window there is a unique view of creatures from all over Africa. The lobby is a site to see, and the staff is top notch. The only thing to keep in mind is that, except for Animal Kingdom, it is about a 15 - 30 minute bus ride to the parks and to downtown Disney. If you are looking for a place to stay that is away from the crowds, provides an experience that is hard, if not impossible to find without going on a real safari to Africa, and do not mind spending a little extra time I line for and on buses, you should definitely give Animal Kingdom Lodge a try.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, peaceful property”
Reviews.Author: yohagopelo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Jambo House Villas (1 bedroom suite) in November for 3 nights with my husband, mother-in-law and sister-in-law. The room was large, had all the amenities you could ask for and was nicely decorated. The best part was the view - every morning we woke up to zebras, giraffe, and an assortment of other beautiful creatures outside our window. The pool area was lovely and the the pool bar had a great assortment of beverages for poolside lounging. There was marshmallow roasting at fire pits and night vision goggle animal viewing. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Helpful Tip: Since we had a kitchen in the room we ordered groceries online & had them delivered to the hotel. The hotel keeps them refrigerated for you until you check in. We saved tons of money by already having all the beverages we would need, plus all of our breakfast items and snacked. I highly recommend doing this! If we were to come back to Disney we would definitely want to stay in this hotel again. It was really calming to be surrounded by animals and the property was just lovely.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful escape!”
Reviews.Author: lanakoala
Reviews.Content: I can't even begin to count the number of times I've been to the Walt Disney World Resort in Orlando. Given that it's only a few hours from where we live, it's always been a great family-friendly option for a weekend away. In the past, however, we've always stuck with moderate or off-property hotels. This time was different. I saw an on-line ad for Disney's fall hotel sale and promptly called the Disney Reservations Center. The agent was able to secure a room at the AKL for roughly the same price as POFQ. I booked the hotel and couldn't be any happier. Reception: I was so appreciative to be greeted by helpful valets and concierge staff at the entrance to Jambo House. I was happy to have the car off my hands and someone on-hand to give me a quick overview of the property and lead me straight to check-in. My check-in agent was exceedingly professional and courteous and took care of all of my reservation needs promptly. He was even able to accomodate my request for a room near transportation. After a smooth check-in, we took a five-minute walk to our room which was in a really great location- just a flight above the lobby. Room: The room was thoughtfully appointed. I appreciated the attention to detail; however, I quickly noted that the hotel room and appointments were fairly standard. The hotel room did seem a bit small (even for three people) so I was concerned about luggage storage. The closet helped a bit, but the space underneath the sinks was a life-saver. The fridge was as expected- a life-saver :) We also had a standard-sized table which was handy, but it was a little tight with even two people sitting at it. I know that the resort offers room service, but to be honest, I don't know that it would be very comfortable to have a meal in the room. There just wasn't enough space. Property Details/Thoughts The quick-service cafe was pleasant. I liked that the resort arranged to have a staff member to take guests orders, submit a ticket to the cooks, and provide us with beepers. This courtesy made dining all the nicer. All in all we enjoyed our meals here. The food is standard resort-fare; it is American with an African touch. Breakfast was fairly typical. I found the portions to be huge so I ordered a little less than I thought three people would want. That was a good call. Because we were at the parks so much, we did not get to enjoy many of the perks of the property, but I did make some observations: I regret that we did not keep our reservations at the sit-down restaurants. They, like the property, were gorgeous. Also, the gym was very modern and well-maintained. If I could have, I would have brought my exercise clothes. The pool area is very attractive and there is plentiful seating. Do be advised that the recreation facilities are spread out. It was easy to get turned around while on the property. Other Observations: This would be a great hotel for a family who is coming to the resort for several days and who wants to stay at a resort that allows them diversion for when they wish to take a day off from the parks. I say that because there are many, many activities for resort guests to participate in- the schedule comes with your welcome packet. Like I said earlier, the dining and recreation facilities are nice. The arcade is well-maintained and is monitored by security in the evening. Children came with their parents as late as 9:30 or 10pm. They seemed to have a good time while there. Finally, I know there is wildlife viewing. I didn't really learn much about these opportunities, so I can't comment.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay on Disney Property”
Reviews.Author: Darien_and_Ann
Reviews.Content: Our third visit to this hotel and it is still as good as ever. We had booked car park view rooms but got savannah view. We had some key problems at first but they were sorted out easily. Rooms are good, pool is fabulous. Breakfast at counter service at Mara is just ok, breakfast buffet at Boma excellent. Bus journey to Downtown Disney frustratingly long and now all theme park buses call at Kidani Village first on return journey so take longer.

Reviews.Title: “The worst staff”
Reviews.Author: Hiro K
Reviews.Content: After leaving my room I found that I left my belt in my room. I called the hotel and talked with lost and found. They always said we could not look into now, because we have a customer now and would call you back.Then they did not call me back. I called again and again. They never call me back. They are very irresponcible. I have never experienced this kind of unpleasant feeling in my entire life. Food is not good.The price is very expensive but room is very narrow. I will never stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A Zen Oaisis”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaTravelA_Z
Reviews.Content: Incredible experience! We booked a club level room in the main resort for 3 nights in October. From the moment we drove up to the gate, we were made to feel like honored guests. The resort is just amazing and because it maintains low lighting and a respectfully quiet atmosphere for the animals, it feels so serene; a wonderful respite from the hectic parks. The rooms are on the small side of standard, but the savanna view makes up for that. They are dark; but again- so peaceful. We enjoyed the pool area with its hidden whirlpools and easy integration into the savannas. I wandered right up to one of the public savanna views and enjoyed talking with the cultural ambassadors from Africa who were very friendly and eager to teach us about the animals. We ate at Sanaa (Table service) and Mara (Quick Service) which were both excellent. However, we do enjoy Indian and Thai flavors on a regular basis so read the menus first to see if it works for you. Having the club level was very nice; check in was relaxing on the club floor where there was even a wii provided for our sons entertainment. We also enjoyed the light breakfast and could also grab some fruit to go as a snack during our daily adventures and we also utilized their extensive movie collection for our son. There is so much to do at the resort; you could spend a day or so there alone. Bring Binoculars for more up close viewing. However, we saw animals at all times and even sleeping at night. There are plenty of viewing spots so it never felt crowded or 'zoo' like. I cannot say enough about this resort; we will definitley be back

Reviews.Title: “An amazing experience!”
Reviews.Author: anniebodyinNC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our niece and nephew to Disney World for their first time and chose to stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge because it was the resort that neither of us had ever been to. We knew that there would be animals and would be something very different for the kids. We had read reviews that it is far away from everything, but we didn't find that to be a problem for us. Our niece is 5 and our nephew is 9, but both are in school so there was no need for afternoon naps. I can definitely see where if you wanted to go back to the hotel for a nap midday and then return to the parks that it would be difficult if you plan on using the shuttles because it did take about 30-45 minutes to get from there to any of the parks, so you are looking at an hour round trip minimum to leave and come back. At any rate, I think it is definitely worth the experience for the older kids, but maybe not the best place for babies or younger children who need naptime.

Reviews.Title: “Not the usual Disney hotel”
Reviews.Author: #1LakerDad
Reviews.Content: My family had wanted to stay at the AKL since our last trip to WDW. The room on the concierge level was small, constantly damp, dusty and dreary. The lobby of the hotel is very nice, an African version of the Grand Californian. The best part of the hotel is paying a premium for a savanna view, many animals on view a short distance from your room at all times of the day. This property really lacked the Disney feel and hospitality, this was our third trip to WDW and we are annual pass holders at Disneyland so we know what to expect. I just seemed to get the feeling when explaining the various flaws to the concierge agent that they had heard it all before and nothing is going to change. With Disney properties you usually pay a higher price for the Disney treatment, we paid a vey high price for an un-Disney like stay.

Reviews.Title: “No pixie dust”
Reviews.Author: Phun-seekers
Reviews.Content: Disgrace to Disney. It is easy to overlook how bad this property is because of the animals. It's great to sit and watch them from the rooms balcony. However, everything about this property is awful. Cramped rooms, narrow halls make it a hastle to get out of the room when housekeeping is present. VERY poorly managed. Reception staff is great but other staff is borderline rude. No customer service. Stay off WDW property (eg Marriott) for much cheaper rooms and better service.

Reviews.Title: “DISNEY KNOWS HOW TO DO IT”
Reviews.Author: DIVERDICKFl_
Reviews.Content: Disney is a first claas operation. we have been there over 50 times in the last 25 years. This is our 1st time at Animal Kingdom Lodge. Everything was "perfect". We had a pool view, would recommend upgrating to savanah room, where you can observe the animals from your balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Just go you will love it!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah W
Reviews.Content: My husband (30) and I(28) stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge from 22-29 September 2011. It is the best Disney hotel I have stayed at. I must admit I have always wanted to stay here as I love giraffes and whilst visiting in December we ate at Jiko and I fell even deeper in love with the place. We booked a standard view room and I can't fib I was hoping that as it was our anniversary they would upgrade us to a savannah view room based on other reviews I had read. They didn't upgrade us and we had a standard view room on the giraffe trail overlooking the entrance - but hey we can't complain we didn't pay for a savannah view room and lots do! Do I regret not booking a Savannah view? Actually no I don't we were only there for a week so we didn't spend that much time in our room. There are plenty of viewing spots around the hotel and whenever we used them there was never anyone else there anyway - though it was low season. I actually think that even if we had been in a room with a view of the savannah we would have spent more time in the viewing areas as this is not a zoo so the animals roam freely and if there were no animals out we could and did just move to another viewing area. The main viewing areas accessed from around the pool and lobby are lovely and marked on the resort map. There are however lots of viewing balconys along the corridors to the rooms which are not marked. Our room was very close to the lobby about three doors from the stairs or lifts and neither side of this trail has savannah views so we wouldn't have known about this had we not been exploring the hotel. These non-marked viewing areas were almost better but please if you use these be quiet and don't disturb the other guests. The night vision viewing is great and free and will only take about 5 mins from your evening ask about it when you check in. We did notice on our second night that our balcony was above the smoking area which isn't very nice when you are a non smoker but as we were only there a week and had unpacked I didn't raise it so I can't complain about it. We didn't use our balcony for anything other than drying swimsuits (which didn't smell of smoke) but just mentioning it as it may be worth checking if this would bother you. Though there must only be a couple of rooms affected by this. Our room was beautifully appointed with 2 queen beds ,fridge & coffeemaker. The beds and pillows were comfortable and we slept very well though wherever we have stayed at WDW we have slept well as you are on the go all day!!! Shower was powerful, water always hot, room always immaculate, coffee always topped up (though they give you packs with sugar, sweetener, serviettes and stirrers so to avoid waste we just took sachets of sweetner from the food court). I have read reviews that say the rooms are small and dark I strongly disagree. Yes the furniture is a dark colour and the walls aren't white washed so the rooms will be darker if you are used to white washed walls, mirrors and glass everywhere but the rooms feel cosy and luxurious (not minimalistic luxury). This is a hotel room if you want space then book DVC appartments. We have stayed in Pop Century(value) and Port Orleans French Quarter (moderate) and you can see a slight difference in the decor and furnishings as you increase the grade. I have enjoyed all of the places we have stayed at in WDW but I have stayed at them for different reasons. Animal Kingdom Lodge was perfect for just the two of us to spend time together and we got a great deal with a free dining plan. Though it isn't just for couples there were a whole host of things on for kids and you could quite easily stay here for a week with kids and keep them entertained without the need to step foot in the parks. The pool was lovely though quite warm which was great for a quick dip in the evenings, not sure if it would have been great for cooling down on really hot days though. Although if we did visit the pool in the day nowhere seemed to be a particular sun trap so not sure it's ideal for people who just want to lie in the sun. It looks so inviting particularly in the evening when it is lit up. We ate at all 3 dining locations. Jiko the signature restaurant is amazing you could forget you were at Disney it is probably the quietest romantic restaurant there and the food is delicious. We ate a Boma for breakfast, great selection and a perfect place for breakfast on our last day as most days we just had cereal it would have been too much food every other day! The food court Mara is ideal too try the african stew mmmm. We also ate at Saana at Kidani village the food was nice but the view of the Savannah whilst eating was what made the experience great. The buses were great we never waited more than 10 mins for one and the journeys werent that long. The longest journey was Magic Kingdom which varied from 15-20 mins. We were on holiday it was nice to not have to think about driving and if you are impatient and don't like waiting this isn't really the holiday for you because you will queue for pretty much everything - although not very mong in September. Chill out, relax and enjoy your surroundings and secure those memories for ever. The shop by the lobby is great lots of disney souveniers and essentials like milk bread cereals etc. If you can try to spend a part of each day exploring the things the hotel has to offer whether that is getting a glass of wine and sitting by the fire inside or reading a book in the beautiful lobby. It is these things you won't get in value or moderate resorts. Ths staff is great. Service on the whole, even by disney standards, is exceptional (the lady who checked us in was a bit grumpy but once we started chatting to her she lightened up), I would stay here again in heartbeat, yes it is expensive but it is beautiful. If you don't stay here at least visit. We got a great deal for our week and we have decided we would like to visit as many of the properties as we can so are staying at Old Key West in 2012 but I will definately go back and visit Animla Kingdom Lodge because it has a serenity and excitement that other places dont.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice would stay again, It can be for children and adults”
Reviews.Author: Hailey G
Reviews.Content: I am 18 and have loved Disney for as long as I can remember. I live in florida and only about an hour away from Disney but stay at the hotels anyway because they are fun and its a great way to get away from it all. I have read reviews about the Animal Kingdom Lodge and I have a few things to say about them, I have stayed here a number of times, Yes the lobby area is a little dark, BUT you must resize this is part of the vibe and decoration of the place along with the dark wood floors, and if you are going to complain about this, then you are spending way to much time in the lobby and should get to a park or a pool. Another thing, They offer rooms with bunk beds so the children and adults do not have to stay in the same bed, I have seen these rooms and they are the same size as all of the other rooms, so they basically squeeze the bunk bed in there which dose not leave much space BUT, If you are going to complain about that you are spending way to much time in the rooms, they are there to sleep and maybe relax after the parks, not spend your entire vacation, or if you want to I recommend upgrading to a villa. (I have not yet stayed in a villa but will be this Christmas). If your kids want french fries or basic American food the restaurant are not for you, These restaurant are made to be authentic African food. so do not expect that, On the other hand they have a quick service station that does serve that kind of food along with other things for the adults. When it comes to the walk depending on where you are the walk will vary. In the Kidani Village the walk to the MAIN lobby can be far but it has a lobby of its own. it is smaller because there are less rooms in the Kidani Village. they have to fit as many rooms in the hotel as possible so a long walk for some is needed. Animals....They can not be controlled to the point where you will see them outside your room every time you look out. They roam, so if you are exspecting to see them every time you look outside then look someplace else. Some things I loved about it is the lot os so big you can explore it for hours and not get bored. there are tons of things to do and see and you get get to other parks and resort easy. I also love the beds and how quiet it was. ~This is a very nice Hotel and resort , I highly recommend it. I have stayed at almost every disney Resort and its my 2nd Fav, Next to the comtemapary but mostly because I like modern Decor. I hope you will stay here and enjoy it too.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: MARBLES2222
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in almost all the hotels in Disney except this one. The kids had a great time seeing the giraffe and zebras from our room. The main lobby was spectacular and we had a room on the 5th floor right by the long extension bridge that spans across the lobby. You feel like you are in Africa. There are areas outside where you can see all the animals in the savanna. There were guides from Africa all around and would answer any question about there country. The main restuarant Boma was fantastic. They food from Africa and you could sample anything you wanted from stews to meats. As much as you wanted. And the desserts were amazing. The pool was also a favorite with the kids but I would suggest going to the pool at the other village called Kadonni village. Just a short walk over. It was a haven for kids with all types of splashing gizmos to play in.All in all, you won't be disappointed staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Villas - Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Virgin Holidays traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great atmosphere, will be coming back! Great pools, very good restaurants especially Jiko. Lots of facilities for children and adults. we stayed in the kidani village section in a 1 bedroom villa with views over the savannah. We will definitely stay at this hotel again. Rent a car as the buses can get full at peak times and you may have to wait if you plan on using the Disney transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with views of exotic animals from your balcony”
Reviews.Author: marphy17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 days for a business trip with my husband last week. Animal Kingdom Lodge is an African-style resort, offering views of a savanna and 30 species of wildlife from some guest rooms. Our balcony faced this area, so we enjoyed having a coffee there and watching the animals. Species that I recall are zebra, giraffe, Guinea hens and a fascinating animal unlike any we have ever seen - a red river hog (looks like a wart hog). Pool area is very nice & the pool is enormous. Rooms are well-appointed and very well sound-proofed. We were concerned with all the kids in the hotel that we might hear some racket, but we slept soundly & heard no noise. Comfy beds with intricately-carved wooden headboards, double sinks in dressing area, ample bath supplies & linens provided. Lobby area offers great photo ops, as it is quite grand in scale & decorated in the African style. Check-in was a breeze & hotel staff was uniformly friendly and helpful. Catching buses to the theme parks was easy and non-problematic. Can't think of anything negative, except I'm not still there and it's going to snow in Minneapolis in 2 days.

Reviews.Title: “An African Safari in the U.S.!”
Reviews.Author: AnnMarieGottlieb
Reviews.Content: My famly and I have stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge - Kidani Village twice (once last year for a week and again this year for a week). We absolutely love this place! The atmosphere is amazing, the staff is nice, and the animals really make you feel like you're on an African safari. There are two important tips I'd like to share: 1. You must get a room overlooking the animals and not the parking lot 2. Nothing is open past 11:45pm to purchase food or drink, so if you arrive late or are a night owl, be prepared. That is the only complaint I have with this resort - there should defintely be some food available past 11:45. We are from Las Vegas, so are on a different time zone schedule. 11:45 in Florida is only 8:45 our time. When we arrived in the early am hours after a long flight, we were unable to feed the kids, which is obviously a big probelm and something Disney should really address. Other than that the place is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay (Jambo House)”
Reviews.Author: jensparks05
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Animal Kingdom Lodge, Jambo House. Our first was three years ago, so I expected the lodge might be showing more signs of aging, but it did not. Our pool-view room was clean and spacious. From the moment we arrived, service was top notch and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TechPinkLady02
Reviews.Content: We recently took our 1.5 year old daughter to Disney World for the first time and we decided to stay at Animal Kingdom Lodge. What a great choice! She was amazed from the moment we walked through the door. The lobby is just beautiful and unlike anywhere we have ever stayed, the attention to detail is something Disney never misses! The room was great as well, everyday when we returned from the parks she would run to the balcony to see what animals were waiting for her. She would stand and call out for the "baby giraffe" if it wasnt there, it was very cute! The rooms were very nice and spacious enough for the 3 adults and the pack and play for our daughter. The pool area is is also great, its a huge pool and all the kids seemed to be having so much fun. If you are considering staying at Animal Kingdom Lodge I would absolutely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Thuy01
Reviews.Content: We were there for the whole 14 days celebrating our anniversary and our daughter's 5th birthday, it was FAB. We had a room overlooking the savannah on the 4th floor. Couldn't really fault it. They provide little extras such as night time cinema for the kids every night, well equipped play room for toddlers and very nice children friendly pool. Good location to other resorts and parks (best thing is most of the bus stops returning to the hotel are the nearest to parks exists, especially after a long day walking around). Very clean throughout. Will definitely go back there with my kids. Oh....the only negative is they don't have wi-fi. For those that need to use the internet, they only allow 15mins per day per person in one of their small offices.

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: mooreclan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first visit to Disney in October 2011.We had a view over the savannah which our 7 year old was thrilled with.The room was large enough for the 3 of us. The safe was on the small side. The bedroom was clean. We used the pool only a few times and in my opinion was not the warmest. We ate at Boma for breakfast a few times and enjoyed the options available. We only went to Boma for evening meal once and was hugely disapointed, although this could be because it was our first meal after a long journey. The transportation via the bus was quick and efficent. We would stay here again but would probably get more out of the hotel now that we have been to Disney once. We booked This hotel due to our family being able to get the Deluxe Dining plan a lot cheaper as it was in with the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing for a Disney resort”
Reviews.Author: NDwifeandmom
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with our stay at the resort. It began by the front desk not being able to guarantee a time for us to check in, they said they would text us and after waiting for over two hours we decided to go back and demand that they give us a time frame (we were traveling with our two daughters, ages 3 and 1). They fixed the problem by giving us an upgrade. Our disappointment grew when we entered the room. It was small and did not appear to be at all from a luxury resort. The beds were uncomfortable and the bedding was extremely cheap! We were expecting a nice duvet and sheets, but no such luck! The sheets were awfully rough, same as the towels in the bathroom. The coffee pot in the room was dirty and even after we washed it made terrible tasting coffee. On the last night of our trip we purchased a four dollar package of grapes that smelled like fertilizer or some sort of chemical ! I had never experienced such a thing. I couldn't get the smell off my hands. I am thankful I noticed it before feeding them to my children. The transportation to the parks left a lot to be desired. It took us the bus about half an hour to show up. Once again, very disappointed! As much as we enjoyed watching the animals and admired the majestic lobby, the room, the service and the overall experience was not a positive one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: disneymad1955
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge in a savannah room overlooking the Zebras and Giraffes. The rooms are lovely and very roomy. The view is excellent and always changing, you could sit there for hours. In the hotel you have lovely restaurants, we ate at Boma's and Jiko's. Jiko's is very sophisticated and worth paying extra for if it is a special occasion, we celebrated a birthday there and they were so lovey, with a card and cake etc. Boma's is buffet style and the food is excellent, but it does get quite noisy. Transportation from the hotel to the Disney parks is easy and you are able to relax. Wouldnt stay anywhere else in Disney now!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: PhiladelphiaMicromom
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many of the hotels in Disney and AK lodge was one of my favorites. It's a beautiful hotel, has a great pool and facilities and we generally loved the whole experience.The rooms are a nice size. We had a pool view room. My husband and I only went for a long weekend so we were not traveling to parks evereyday. Its a great hotel if you want to just stay at the hotel and enjoy it instead of running to the parks every day. It is a little far away from most of the parks but the transportation system was great when we were there. We dined at Jiko this time and enjoyed it but wouldn't want to eat there all the time. Looking at the animals on the savannahs in the evenings was especially neat as they were all set to rest for the evening. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Hotel in Disney (or ever!)”
Reviews.Author: KRo0203
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Animal Kingdom in late September. I went with my boyfriend, and as a young couple, this place was perfect. The first thing that must be said is this is one of the most beautiful hotels I have ever stayed at. The lobby, common areas, and restaurants are all breathtakingly gorgeous. I have stayed in Disney several times at all stages of my life, and this hotel was by far the best in Disney. I’ll admit when we went to our room (Savannah view, worth every penny), I was a bit disappointed with our view; we seemed to be stuck in a corner. But with a quick phone call, within minutes our luggage was picked up and we were move to probably the best room in the resort (Disney hospitality is the best). There were animals outside our balcony at every minute of the day. We had a hopper past so we spent most of our days at the parks, but from our one day that was spent completely at the resort there was always things to do and see such as activities by the pool, s ’mores by the outdoor fire pit, and movies in the dark by the pool. While it was a bit pricey the afternoon safari through the grounds and dinner at Jiko was amazing. The tour was great and the guide took her time and answered all our questions. We got up close and personal with all the animals. And the dinner at Jiko was AMAZING, you got to taste everything on the menu, it was just course after course after course of delicious food! Being a Disney resort, transportation around Disney was a breeze. No need to rent a car. However, Animal Kingdom Lodge seems to be a bit more removed from some parks, so make sure you leave enough time to get to the parks, some are a good half hour bus ride away. Check out was a breeze. We had a late flight out so we checked out and went to store our bags, but we were quickly informed that you can check in to your flight and check your bags right at the hotel! No need for ANY hassle at the airport, this was fantastic. We checked all our bags so when hopped the bus to the airport the only thing we had to worry about was our carry on. I HIGHLY recommend this resort for everyone, it’s an experience you have to have!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay but $$$$$!!!”
Reviews.Author: firefighteru7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here and its a great place, but we hardly were in the room and we spent most of the time at the park, we didn't even realize until the last day that they fed the animals right outside our window b/c we were never there! Kinda sucks we spent so much and never spent time in the room!!!

Reviews.Title: “Halloween Trip”
Reviews.Author: FHC43910
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge for our first time the end of Oct. Overall the hotel was great. We loved the location of our room, check in was quick and easy, the rooms were very clean and plenty big enough and we had no trouble with buses( this was one thing I was afraid of because of other reviews that I had read). The animals were great to see from the room, we were on the 3rd floor but I would have liked to seen more animals, but understand that there cant be hundreds of them roaming around. We didnt swim but the pool was nice and I seen lifeguards during the day and heard activities going on during the trip. If I have one big complaint is that my daughter got food poisioning from eating at the Mara, something that the rest of us did not eat. We lost 2 days of our trip because of staying in the room and in the middle of the night approx 2 am I had to go to the front desk for help and ask for items in the bathroom and received no compassion or service. I returned to my room and had to wait for housekeeping which did not come until I called again and was not concerned at all. I felt that if we paid what we did for this trip and little care could be received especially at 2 am in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “dream holiday”
Reviews.Author: maggie190736
Reviews.Content: just returned form animal kingdom lodge, its the purfect place to stay, lots of good food, staff ectremley pleasant and animals walking around the hotel, strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Facility & WONDERFUL Service”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGB2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lodge this weekend for a quick visit while family came to town and we had the best time. From the time we arrived until we checked out, the staff was friendly, courteous and helpful. The room was spotless and the views we had were so nice. My granddaughter was thrilled with having the ability to see all the animals the evening we returned to our room and the next morning. Our meals were on the go so we didn't get a chance to eat at all the restaurants but those that we tried were fine. I recommend the hotel and would consider staying here again for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon stay”
Reviews.Author: andrea s
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights and 4 days over labor day weekend. It was beautiful! We were a little leary staying because it was our honeymoon, but we are true kids at heart and we both love animals! It was beautiful waking up to the animals in the morning, since we had a savanna room! The dinners were amazing! The staff was so friendly, nice, and helpful! The two things we ran into was that we wanted a king sized bed and ended up with two queens, which still wasn't that big of a deal, and that the bathroom was pretty small, but again no biggie. The flight transportation was very easy as well! The room was a little small but beautiful and fun! The towels and everything were very good quality. The pool is 24 hours, so if you want to enjoy nightlife at the parks you can come back and relax in the pool too! All in all we loved our stay! If it was a bit more inexpensive, we would come back every year!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was the vacation”
Reviews.Author: venessa9
Reviews.Content: We took our daughter to celebrate her good grades. While we found the room pricey, it was a standard size room, the rest of the resort made up for the price. The pool was so much fun. It had a slide and very spacious. Our favorite part was seeing the animals. It was amazing to see how close we were to the animals. Our daughters loved the experience. We had a lovely dinner at BOMA. The food options were delicious, buffett style. We also ate a great breakfast there. Our biggest recommendation is that they modify the arcade to look like the one at the Pop Century resort or the All Star Movie resort, where you can collect tickets and trade them in for prizes. The store with items from Africa had beautiful selections. Everyone was gracious and helpful. There were different activities at the hotel, movie by the pool, storytelling, etc.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL EVER.”
Reviews.Author: Elise H
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed in this hotel everytime ive been to America(6times).Its an amazing hotel,excellent staff,food was nice,bedrooms were clean,pool was warm.Good for the kids!The bus's are about 10-20 mins depends on where your going but when your on there and excited it only seems like 10 mins!I recommend this hotel to everyone! :D

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: AXH
Reviews.Content: Not sure how does this facility qualifies as deluxe but let me explain what went down on my trip there. I stayed with my wife and 3 year old on an Arusha View room. The lobby of the hotel is really nice, spacious and promises a good experience. That ends when you go to check in. There was nothing wrong with my reservation, but it took the receptionist a good 30 minutes to enter our names in the system and hand us the room keys with a bunch of pamphlets explaining what to expect. We book the package through Expedia and had also the park hopper vouchers which were explained that needed to be handed over at the desk so we can get our park tickets. The receptionist told us after checking with his supervisor that the concierge desk will assist us. So here we go to another line waiting for another 20 minutes even though only two of the three concierges were actually providing service and the third one was staring at some wall behind our backs. Long story short, the concierge explained to us that they do not issue tickets for the parks as they cannot access the system if the tickets were booked through Expedia but we have to go to one of the customer service offices at any park entrance and get the tickets. We did go at one of the office in Downtown Disney and were asked why were we bothered to come all the way here instead of getting the tickets at the concierge desk, I changed subject and moved on. Now let's move to the room...Once we opened it we got stung by a smell comparable only to a pile of mulch. I went immediately outside to complain but returned right back as the room next door opened the door and had the same scent coming out, I guess there was no point requesting to exchange rooms. After 30-45 minutes in the room, you just get used to it to the smell. The balcony view was nice and the little one enjoyed watching zebras and giraffes roaming the grass. That night we went to dine at Boma and were told to wait since we had no reservations, even though the restaurant was half empty and had a row of waiters in line greeting the occasional guest. The food at Boma was good, the buffet has a lot of choices but nothing exceptional, which is OK since they cater mostly to folks that are on dining plans. We did not a have a dining plan as we did not want to limit our choices. Two days in the row we saw cockroaches in the hallway which was not something you expect from a deluxe or high end hotel, especially if you are shelling 300+ USD per night. The bedding was going well with the room, you get a king size bed that has about 6-7 small pillows in a row that look like Swedish meatballs you eat at IKEA - very uncomfortable. The bed sheets were very thin and looked well past their prime time, same thing needs to be said about the towels. The bathroom was spacious and well maintained. We did not try any other restaurant other than the Mara for to go breakfast. The cleaning ladies were very helpful and they were the only four star service that I experienced. The parks had a lot more choices of good food especially Epcot but that will be another review. All in all, I cannot honestly say I will return to this hotel, not worthy the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time ! But Average hotel without an average price tag”
Reviews.Author: Graciexxxx
Reviews.Content: Myself my husband and 2 sons aged 10 and 6 years stayed in this hotel we had a fantastic time overall and the hotel was good , however it didn't quite give enough considering the amount spent and the food choice was limited, rooms were cleaned well but everything seemed quite dark and having animals within the grounds (though lovely) also meant that you were limited as to how far you could venture in the grounds, next time I would come back but would try some where else to stay. Good hotel but not great .

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience aside from the transportation to the parks”
Reviews.Author: Amanda A
Reviews.Content: The Animal Kingdom Lodge is a theme park in itself. My husband and I were traveling with our 2 boys ages 5 &7. The surroundings make you feel relaxed and on vacation especially after coming home from the theme parks. We looked forward to coming back to the room to see what animals were out. Everytime we looked out, we were not disappointed. There were lots of animals right outside from our balcony. We had a room on Zebra Trail with bunk beds.This really added to our trip. We had a great time in the pool and hot tubs. We did the night vision goggles which was really neat. We also had a fabulous meal at Boma. On the downside, the beds and pillows were not comfortable. We had towel animals on our first day but then none after that. We tipped well thinking that they would make the extra effort. The kids look forward to those little extra touches. I found myself dreading the transportation. Starting another day at the parks with standing on a crowded, to the max, bus with people standing in the isle back to back. This is not a good way to start or end a day at the parks. Every bus that comes to the Jaba House is packed with people from the previous stop. I thought going to Hollywood Studios would be a better experience since it is about 6 minutes from the hotel. I timed it when we passed Hollywood Studios on the way back from the Magic Kingdom. To my surprise, the journey to Hollywood Studios is longer since the bus makes a stop at Blizzard Beach before heading to Hollywood Studios. We found that this was the case even if no one on the over-crowded bus was going to Blizzard Beach. The bus stops there on the way back too. We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge last year and found ourselves missing the quick enjoyable boat ride to and from the Magic Kingdom. We never stood on a bus or had any dreadful transportation problems. Next time we will go back to the Wilderness Lodge or a monorail hotel. I am glad that we were able to experience the savannah but convenience to the parks wins out on the next trip.

Reviews.Title: “The straight 411 on this overrated hotel”
Reviews.Author: wskungfuclub
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an Arusha View room with a bunkbed--that's the most expensive upgraded room you can get without staying in a villa--and we were sorely disappointed. First of all, people considering the AKL should distinguish between rating the hotel 5 stars because their vacation experience was great and rating a hotel for what it actually is (amenities, space, comfort, cleanliness, value, etc.). It is very easy to get carried away by the magic of disneyworld and forget that the room you paid a ton of money for is little better than a motel. It's true that when you first enter the AKL you are immersed in the splendor of the lobby and overwhelmed by seeing the animals on the savannah from the viewing decks. It makes you so excited that you initially overlook how ridiculously small and cramped your room is because you head straight for the balcony to checkout the premium savannah view you paid for. You're so excited you tell yourself that soon there will be a giraffe off your balcony and antelope drinking from the pond by your room--even though all you can see are pelicans and can barely make out a zebra well over 100 yards away. But reality quickly sets in.
