The sticker on your sliding glass door that says "don't feed the animals" is unnecessary because you couldn't dump your garbage off your balcony remotely close enough to an animal to notice even if you wanted to. There's NO room to move around in the room and with the bunkbed you feel like you are sleeping in a glorified tent. The bathroom is tiny--the kind of tiny where if you are sitting on the throne the bathroom door can't budge. the fixtures are old and the towels are the same as those found in a holiday inn express--a couple of ours had holes and stains. The carpet is old, the bed is uncomfortable, and the sheets are like sandpaper. Look, it's Disney so I'm not expecting silk or Egyptian cotton, but I expect something better than motel sheets. In my opinion, anyone who thinks the actual hotel accommodations are 4 or 5 stars is either objectively biased by "Disney magic" or has never stayed at a true 4 or 5 star resort. No 4 or 5 star resort should ever have a motel quality room period. The savannah view was 100% disappointing. The kids looked out at all times of the day hoping to see animals and were not impressed. By the second day, they stopped caring and really we ended up paying for a view we didn't really enjoy. Temper your expectations of the savannah view if you stay here. You will get FAR better views at the animal kingdom park itself! Save your money and go on the Kilimanjaro safari and animal trails in the theme park. Having said that, the good points of the hotel include a beautiful lobby, lots of little activities for the kids around the resort, easy access to excellent restaurants, and friendly Disney hotel workers. We had a rental car the entire time which we loved because we never had to wait around for the Disney buses and parking is free at all the theme parks. The drive to the theme parks really isn't bad at all. Disneyworld itself absolutely is a fun, magical place and a must-do if you have kids, but skip the AKL--especially if staying in a NICE room is important to you. Staying there is the one thing I would have changed about our disneyworld vaca.

Reviews.Title: “loved the place”
Reviews.Author: tracyleeLiverpool
Reviews.Content: stayed there in october ,check in was quick lovely lobby did pay for vallet service first day 12 dollars just for convienience,rooms are not big we have 2 daughters 12and 15 most of the time lived out of suitcase.the rooms had a fridge kettle,hairdryer ironing board,towels got changed everyday. we had dining plan which we used in all the restaurants best place if just the 2 of u was jiko it there very relaxing ,boma very busy all the time ,mara ok for being quick and sanna was ok . the pool area was very nice had a slide and was not very deep also went in hot tub. i love the buses only a minute from hotel it didnt stop at any other hotels on way to parks 20 mins to magic kingdom 10 to epcot ,5 to animal kingdom ,15 to hollywood studios stops of to blizzerd beach first 20 mins to downtown disney even though we had a car we used the buses loads .I loved the hotel so did my daughters i would go back tomorrow staff were friendly .

Reviews.Title: “give it a miss!”
Reviews.Author: Mandy w
Reviews.Content: we were eagerly looking forward to our stay here but had become a lttle apprehensive of the mixed reviews, and we were right to be! The hotel is obviously of the African theme nice lobby but very dark in fact the hotel inside is very dark everwhere including the rooms. we had to change our room as it had hardly any view,when the whole point of staying there was to see the animals. tip all rooms close to reception will have limited views of animals, your room needs to be some distance away to see the animals. The rooms are very small and even though this was the best we could pay for without booking a suite i would say the room was a 3* rating at best! The bathroom was tiny with an ineffective shower! whilst it was nice to look out on your tiny balconey to see the animals you will never get an uninterrupted view of the savannah as you will always see the opposite buildings and you are so close to your next door balconey you will never be private you can also have the next doors passing smoke with cigarettes it was very much like a block of flats. you would hear all the flushing of toilets above you and all noise carried. The animals are only what you would get in a zoo infact most were antelope birds and two or three giraffes. The restaurant we walked out of as the plates cutlery and glasses were all filthy without exception! The staff at reception and concierge were indifferent the best service came from valet parking. As with other reviewers do not stay at this hotel without a car as it is so far from all the parks and you have to rely on the infrequent bus service. There are so many other better hotels in the local area and if you want to see the animals go to the park it really was a huge dissapointment!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderul experience, beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nik p
Reviews.Content: We travelled from England to stay in the Animal Kingdom Lodges for 12 nights and I must say we were not disappointed. The staff were very efficient. We had no problems checking into our room and everything was explained well. I could maybe agree with some of the comments, that there wasnt a lot of storage space in our room. As a family of 4 we were struggling to find enought space to put our clothes. Howevere we did take too much! The room was spotlessly clean, in fact the whole hotel was. The beds were fine, although the kids would rather not have shared and we had imagined bunkbeds but it worked out ok. We were not bothered by the small balcony or table for 2 as we spent very little time in our room. We had a limnited view of animlas, but we knew we could always see more from down the corridors or from the overlooks. The food in Jiko was wonderful, Boma was good too and probably the best from oany Disney Dining plan restaurant. I think there were more freshly prepared items here. And mara was adequate. Exactly what you expect from a Disney Quick Service restaurant. All the staff were very polite and helpful in explaining the dining plan options. We took part in many of the childrens cultural activites that were held in the hotel every day. We loved meeting staff members from their native country, mainly Africa. It ws like 2 holidays in one. And great for rainy days! We found the location fine. We werent too far away from any of the Disney parks and the buses were so efficient, arriving every 15-20 minutes. Overall a super holiday only made better by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “7301 the room above the arcade”
Reviews.Author: GaryGriswold
Reviews.Content: They gave us the room above the arcade. You cannot imagine the noise. We called the front desk with no resolution. We went down to the front desk and were told they would close the arcade at 10 pm. It is now 11:05 pm Also, the Disney bus service is terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are definitely not child friendly!”
Reviews.Author: LuanaMiruna
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel mostly for the children, as part of the Disney dream & world; we thought it will be great for the kids to wake up seeing giraffes and zebras. Unfortunately animals did not show up to often as it rained a lot during our stay. The hotel is impressive, too large for our taste (running miles from the room to the shop, restaurants or kids club), but definitely nice and tasteful. So no complaints up to this point. Yet rooms are miserable; small, the beds too high for our 4 year old daughter to escalade, the shower (high wall shower) could not be used by the little one as the water poured in cascades over her, making her nervous and us wet trying to help her, the sink far too high so, again, she could not use it be herself, the bathroom door nearly touching the toilet so she had to figure out how to hide behind the door in order to close it. We asked the reception for a little chair so that she would at least be able to wash her hands and brush her teeth by herself but all we got was a high chair. In addition, we got an empty refrigerator, so we had to run one mile to buy a bottle of water or a juice whenever we needed. Overall service is good, people nice allover the place, but room facilities are terrible!

Reviews.Title: “Good, But Has Been Better”
Reviews.Author: Zife
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here (in Jambo House, the original part of the Lodge) in October 2011. This was our third time at the Lodge, and second time staying Club Level. When we arrived at Animal Kingdom Lodge, the Security Guard took my ID, gave me my parking pass, and Welcomed me Home. That felt nice, it was the first I’d heard it in almost 3 years. He even radioed ahead to let the attendants know that a Club Level guest was arriving. We pulled under the porte-cochere, hopped out of the car, and everyone just stood around looking at us. We started getting all of our luggage out, still, everyone stood looking at us. As we started hauling everything in, someone finally approached us, asked if we were the Brandeaus, and offered to escort us to the Lounge for check-in. Not once were we offered Bell Service, nor any help with our luggage. Once at the Lounge, check-in was a bit of an ordeal. The girl couldn’t figure out how to assign us a room since none were ready (which was understandable, since we were there almost 3 hours before check-in), and once they did figure it all out, they told us we’d have to take our luggage back downstairs to check it with Bell Service. Internally, I almost exploded. I didn’t pay over $400/night to continuously cart my luggage around. Luckily, before the last few things were finalized (and after I’d wandered over to grab some lemonade and a cookie from the food area, yum yum, free food), she corrected herself and offered to have Bell Service come pick up our luggage. We were told we’d get a text when our room was ready. We got the text a few hours later, so off to our room. Two Queens instead of the King I had requested, but we were expecting that. AKL really needs more Club Level King Rooms. The one thing I was not expecting was the lack of Welcome/Birthday Package for Rin that has always been given to us for a special occasion (it has a small gift, note and, in this case, Birthday Pin). Strike... um... 3, I think. We got our luggage, unpacked, and I went back up to the Lounge to get scissors and ask about the package for Rin. It turns out they were behind on delivering them, and by the time I got back to the room, she had received it. Yay! They now give a replica Baobob Tree and AKL Pen. I should mention too that Carmen (the woman that I was dealing with at this point, I think I referred to her as Carmella on a 'live' post) was amazing, and made up for any previous issues. She even gave me three roses out of their flower arrangement to give to Rin as a birthday gift. The only problem with Carmen is that she wasn't there the whole time. Fast forward a few days, and I needed a suit pressed. Housekeeping was amazingly attentive, prices were good, and I had my suit back before the end of the day. After all of the stuff happening on day 1, the rest of our stay was uneventful. Most of the staff I dealt with in the Lounge were really good, Housekeeping kept our room neat and tidy throughout the stay, and as always, the views and general feel of the Lodge was amazing. If I had never stayed here before, or if I had never dealt with the Club Level staff before, I probably would have rated this a 4, or likely 5. However, the issues with the Club Level staff on the first day were enough to bring it down to a 3 for this trip (I sound like a bit of a snob, I know...).

Reviews.Title: “A quiet oasis at the end of the day”
Reviews.Author: Lpfetzer
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge for 3 years in a row. Having experienced many Disney Hotels, we love returning to Animal Kingdom Lodge at the end of the day. The lobby is so peaceful and beautiful. The rooms are a good size, many have views of the savannah. We have stayed in both savannah view and pool view. The pool area is beautifully landscaped so that view is equally enjoyable. Breakfast at Mara is always good, the same as most Disney hotels with counter service. Boma can be a bit crazy at times, but the food is amazing. Many families travel from the parks to eat dinner here and the line can get long. The nice thing is it is a floor below the lobby, so the lobby remains calm and peaceful. The pool is large and fun, the Market Place shop is well stocked with the usual Disney items, but they also carry a nice array of African themed products. One of our favorite activites is the nightly talk by the staff about their native countries in Africa. The storytellers outside at the fire pit and the guides at the savannah with night vision goggles are also great fun. There are plenty of things to do here day and night when you return from the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Add animals, get a 4th star”
Reviews.Author: Dangank
Reviews.Content: Excellent theming, wonderful access to animals (seeing them, that is). Rooms are standard deluxe in terms of size and amenities, and the restaurants in the Lodge are excellent. Our check-in, by "Bruce" was long, bitter, laborious. Weird for Disney. I think that the Animal Kingdom lodge is PERFECT for WDW vets who are looking for something different. Seeing a giraffe at 6 am, on my way to the gym=SUBLIME. N.B. Kidani Village looks really sweet!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family resort”
Reviews.Author: craigfsl
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this resort last week with our little girl, We had a standard view room but still had views of the animals from our balcony which was a wonderful surprise. This resort is farther out than the rest and that made us a bit more nervous wondering about the bus service and time it would take to get places. This however was calmed when we got there and the buses ran very consistent and the waits were short. The average ride was about 20 min to the parks, other than Animal Kingdom, which went by rather quickly. The room it self was nice but maybe a little small to roll a stroller in and out of but that wasn't that big of a deal. The beds were nice but the box springs were a little noisy getting in and out of bed. The resort though was very quiet with only one night of people that were load. The workout room was very nice and the pool area as well was nice and fun for the little one. The quick serve restaurant by the pool left something to be desired but most of them around the parks do the same. All the staff were nice and helpful while we were there and new towels and such were there every day when we came back for a mid day break. would highly recommend this resort for any one and will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “It's Nice, but It's Tight”
Reviews.Author: Mike N
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge, in a room converted from a standard hotel room to a Disney Vacation Club studio villa, and this room did not live up to what was billed to be a Deluxe accomodation. Basically, what Disney Vacation Club did was to take a standard room and add a wetbar. The room is to accomodate four guests, however, it was a tight, two-week, stay for only two of us. The basic layout includes a sofa, queen-sized bed, a table with two chairs, a VERY small bureau and an equally VERY small cabinet for your clothes. There wasn't enough room for two-week's worth of clothes for two adults...let alone if there were kids included. There also was a two-bowl sink area, a seperate bath with tub/shower, in addition to the wetbar. Was this room what we expected for a deluxe room...? No. But it's Disney, and folks want to stay there, so Disney puts together what they think works, and people just have to take what Disney gives them. Yes, there were suppose to be wild animals right outside our room (in Jambo House), but they were usually someplace else when we were in the room. Next time, I think I'll save my money by staying at another resort, and use the savings for the over-priced food there.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: A L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night while on our honeymoon because we couldnt book any longer there as it was sold out. After spending a week in Aruba, ande 2 nights at the Dolphin we were looking forward to staying the night and day of my wife's birthday there. If you're into seeing animals you can see at almost any zoo from far away then thi splace is great, but definitely not worth the money. Well first they must have given our room to someone else and gave us a vacation club room with a different view of the savannah than what we had booked, which hey who cares its our honeymoon and her birthday we were just excited to celebrate. The room wasnt going to be ready for another few hours so we decided to head to the park. We walk down to catch the Bus to Animal Kingdom, when someone tells us that the bus only comes every 20 to 25 minutes. We walk down anyway and find a crowd of people also waiting. By the time the bus comes the bus stop was packed and we had to wait for the second bus to even get a spot to stand up. The way back to the hotel was even worse. The line for the bus stretched almost from the bus stop all of the way to the entrance area and we had to wait for 3 buses just to be crammed into a bus that was filled to capacity. By the time we got back to the hotel we were late to our reservation at JIKO and they told us that missing your reservation was subject to a 50 dollar fee, which we later found out wasnt true. Then we asked the concierge Michele, who was excellent, if there was anything she could do and she helped us and told us that JIKO would have atable ready for us whenever we got down there from changing. We finally recieve our room and it had to be a 10 minute walk from the lobby. This hotel is absolutely huge and everything except for the savannah view was far from the room. Then we get down to JIKO and we tell them that we are there and the concierge called and they told us that we would still have to wait 15 minutes for a table even though the concierge told us otherwise. After waiting we ate and I liked the food, however it wasnt my wife's taste, but I sampled hers and thought it was good also, so on the food front it was good. Then we get our bill for check out and there are 2 fees that cost 22 dollars a piece totalling 50 dollars in fees for one night on top of the almost 400 dollars we spent to stay there one night! So we check out and we leave and head to the parks, this time driving, and when i pulled up my parking permit from the hotel was on the dashboard and they let me through and told me that hotel guests in disney get free parking at the parks. The hotel never ever mentioned this not even once. We would have never taken that horrible bus to the park if we had known that. Anyway I know that this is alot of random rambling on, but let me sum it up by saying try JIKO, but the hotel is severely over rated not worth the money just go on the Animal Kingdom safari to see the animals. PS we planned on buying a vacation club timeshare at the Animal Kingdom Lodge before we even stayed there, we are so glad that we tried it because we will never stay there again, and even though we will probably buy into the Disney Vacation Club in the future this hotel will not be on our list of options.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it!”
Reviews.Author: momtraveler01
Reviews.Content: It is a one of a kind spot. We went all out and got the room overlooking the animal kingdom savanna and had a prime view of giraffes, etc. The lobby and decor is spectacular! I just went with my husband for a splurge night. Would love to go back with the kids they would be amazed. So much to do. The food at the onsite restaurants is incredible too!

Reviews.Title: “AKL: Not Worth It”
Reviews.Author: amanda n
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a total of 10 nights October 2011. We had Savannah View, Concierge Level -Beds Extremely uncomfortable -Very Small Rooms -Gorgeous Pool and fun slide -Pretty Lobby -unknowledgable front desk staff (did not even know what time the slide closed) - The food in the restuarant that was a buffett was not good. -Awesome seeing the animals from your room -Conceirge not worth it unless you are at the resort a lot, but still nice to have. -waited for a bus for over 45 min. 3 different days going 3 different disney parks We were originally booked for 8 nights and decided to leave 2 days early, I called AKL to see a a room was available so that we would not have to move rooms mid vacation (if they didnt have anything it was not a big deal we just would have stayed somewhere else and saved $1000, but we thought if they did it would be nice just to stay in one place the whole time.) After being on hold for over 25 min (which i did not really mind b/c i know they had to check room arrangements) they happily told me that it was not problem they were able to switch some things around so we were able to be in the same room the whole time. When we arrived (4 hours later from a 16hour drive) the lady said oh no you are in this room for these 2 nights and then you need to check out by eleven and we can store your things and then at 3pm you can check into your new room. I said I was on hold with someone for over 25min assuring me that we would not have to move rooms. So, I waited again up at the front desk for over twenty min and they again worked it out so we could be in the same room. We just had to bring our keys up to them after the first 2 nights and get new ones since it was a seperate reservation (crazy, but whatever no big deal just a walk to the lobby). Well, after 2 nights i go up to exchange keys and she says do you have your luggage for me to store? I say no I was told twice we would not have to move......well we did and they were going to move us to another room with a queen bed and bunk beds, i said you're crazy if you think i am going to pack up and move to another small crappy room with bunk beds (me, my boyfriend, and a 3 year old).....so we ended up having to move rooms anyway but at least we got 2 queen beds. You would have no idea these people have been running resorts, parks, restaurants, and everything else for as long as they have. So disorganized. The place was nice yes, the animals were very cool to see but in my opinion this place is almost double the price of other disney resorts, i'd say definitely not worth the money. I love Disney World, but this was not what we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Britishfamily4
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge before and had no hesitation returning there on going back to Disneyworld. The staff are friendly and helpful and both pools are great. Our only gripe was that there are insufficient restaurant facilities to be able to book a table following the hotel's expansion. This needs to be addressed.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Gettysburg_Buff
Reviews.Content: Loved our greeting as soon as we stepped out of our car. Check in was easy, and our room was beautiful- with an excellent view. The staff were helpful and friendly. We enjoyed sitting around the fire pit, looking at all the animals, the pool (we won pool bingo!!). Diana from housekeeping took great care of us...kudos to her! There was only one little clitch...someone's child pulled the fire alarm. The resort handled it very professionally, and were only out of room for a short time. I saw more animals this stay then I have in the past. The Valet is top notch, all friendly and quick...good job! I can't wait to go back to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful setting for our whirlwind tour”
Reviews.Author: webtravelreview
Reviews.Content: I did on-line check in at home hoping for a quick pick up of our Keys. We had no questions just needed to get to our room. The line was a few people deep, but everyone in the On-line line had lots of questions and the process took 25 min. The lady just before me, got an upgraded room which gave me hope, but we got the room we paid for which was fine. AKL really needs to move the people with questions to the other line while those of us who want to get moving and just get keys can. This process didn't work. The whole time we were there, there was always a wait for Concierge, usually just 5 minutes but never just walk up. Our room had a great view of the pool. We were in Zebra Trail 4020. The room was very small. We have 2 girls 8, 10 plus the two of us, we're averaged size people with enough stuff for 8 nights (we packed light) but it was a tight squeeze. For this much money, there should be more storage and more space. The bathroom area was nice plenty of light. The bathtub/toilet area ok that was where it seemed too dark. 4 of us could not fit on the balcony to be seated, which we were bummed about. We had bought stuff for our breakfast in the am but only seating for 2. The table inside was right in the walkway to the balcony. In the am getting bags packed, eating, putting sunscreen, shoes etc we were always bumping into each other. For this price...not acceptable. The grounds were amazing. We walked all over the whole place including over to Kidani one day. Animals are amazing. I would do Kidani next time for more space though I don't know what the price is. Maybe a split stay here to enjoy the animals on a weekend and then move to more spacious accomodations for the latter part of a trip. The CM that were at the look-out spots were so friendly. We really learned from them. Borrowing the night vision goggles is a must. Very cool. I'm picky about beds and these met my expectations. Comfy bedding. It seemed quiet enough, I didn't hear people above or next to us. The frig in the room was plenty spacious for us:1/2 gallon of milk, juice, beer, yogurt, apples, snacks. I was worried that it would be too small but it was perfect. The coffee maker sitting on top of the frig with stuff to make coffee was difficult. They need some more places in these rooms to set stuff down. We'd make our coffee, try to put milk and sugar and there was just no place. Not a well laid out of thought out room. Only 2 dresser drawers in the room. The parking lot was a long walk, just be ready. But we always found a place. We rented a car, which I would recommend. Just on the other side on AKL on 192 are lots of shopping and places to eat. You can save a ton by having dinner at Olive Garden or picking up coffee and breakfast at McDonalds. Overall, I would not stay here again. The price is just too high for what you get. We spent so much of our time at the parks and didn't spend enough time at our lodging. If you are looking for a resort where you spend the majority of your time and can get a bigger room and you can afford it, in this case I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Room- bad staff”
Reviews.Author: VBR_1
Reviews.Content: We were on honeymoon and the Disney Hotel was the one my wife had been looking forward to for the whole year- when we arrived we were given little honeymoon badges which was a nice touch- the room however was appalling- it was really small, 2 single beds as they had no doubles left (despite booking nearly a year in advance and not told until the day!) and the balcony was so small you could only fit one chair on it. The room itself was filthy it had dust everywhere, child’s handprints all over the balcony door and the shampoo was empty. The worst part though was the bathroom sinks, which are based outside the bathroom itself as it is too small to fit it in- it had dried toothpaste around the sink and hairs in there. When we complained we were told they would send up a maid or we could pay extra to get another room ($215 per night!), it was only after complaining loudly and often that the manager intervened, and moved us to the nicer room without the additional charge. The final room was lovely, as was the rest of our stay but the initial response from the staff was appalling as was the cleanliness of the room. I would NEVER go back to a Disney hotel- the poor attitude of the staff ruined a night of my honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: Jujumommie
Reviews.Content: The rooms are beautifully decorated, the savannah views can't be beat, though even if you don't have a savannah view room, the lodge itself has great viewing spots. I was most impressed with all the great activities they had for kids young and old involving the animals. Our girls wanted to leave the parks early to come back to the resort for the activities. The restaurants on site are also some of the best in disney. if you're even considering it just do it!

Reviews.Title: “Unique Hotel Experience, Beautiful Property, Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bigtime7779
Reviews.Content: Everybody owes it to themselves to stay at this hotel at least once in their lifetime. The cost of staying here is pretty steep since it’s in the deluxe category, but it’s an experience you really can’t find anywhere else. If you do choose to stay here, I highly recommend paying the extra money to get a savanna view room, as there’s over 30 species of animals on display. If you get a standard view room you can still walk around the property and see a lot of the animals, but nothing beats coming back from a park and relaxing on your porch by watching the animals. I will say that the animals wander all over the savanna and are at different places at different times, so they’re not always there when you’d like. Also, the weather can affect where they are at different times of the day. This means that if you do get a savanna view room, you’re not guaranteed to always see the animals. There’s a very good chance you’ll see animals outside your room, but don’t complain if they’re not there all the time. They’re wild animals, not your pets, so just know that there’s a possibility you might not see many animals from your savanna view room. The hotel location isn’t that great since it’s pretty far from most of the parks and the bus rides are longer than from most other Disney resorts. The lobby is absolutely beautiful, but the way the hotel is set up is very confusing. When you walk into the lobby, you’re on level 3. The hallways on each floor are very, very, very long and if your room is towards the end, you could be walking for a very long time before you reach your room. The lady who checked us in was one of the most unfriendly and unhelpful people I’ve ever met. We also encountered her again at the concierge desk later in the week and she was just as unfriendly and useless then and ruined our mood both times. However, the rest of the staff throughout the property was very friendly and helpful throughout the week. We stayed at the Jambo House building in a standard room with a savanna view. The rooms themselves have a very cool Animal Kingdom theme to them, but there’s really nothing else that stands out from other resort hotels. One of our light bulbs was dead and the room smelled like mold the whole week. The room had a flat screen TV, a refrigerator, an iron and ironing board, a hairdryer, a coffee maker and a safe. The bathroom was very small with a toilet and shower crammed right next to each other, but we did like that the long counter outside the bathroom had 2 sinks. The zero-entry pool is very large, easy for kids to enter and has a water slide. There’s a nice little pool bar that’s open until sunset near the main pool, but I really wish it stayed open later. There’s also a small kid pool, a hot tub and a playground near the main pool. If you ever get some down time, you can work out in the fitness center. There are 3 restaurants on the property – Jiko (high end), Boma (middle of the road/buffet) and The Mara (low end/cafeteria style). We never got a chance to eat at Jiko because it gets booked up pretty quickly, but Boma had some amazing, unique food, along with some standard food that would please picky eaters and kids. The Mara is open until 11:30 PM and has standard American food (breakfast, lunch and dinner) that you can get fairly quickly most of the time. I believe they stop serving breakfast at 11 AM. There’s a nice little bar/lounge on property that’s on its own little level, but I wish it was open later than midnight, especially on the weekend. The gift shop is very big and has beer, wine and liquor for sale, although the price tag isn’t cheap. There were a ton of activities for kids, such as nightly outdoor movies by the pool, afternoon games by the pool, a children’s activity center and an arcade. As with all Disney parks and hotels, smoking is only permitted in designated locations outside. My whole family loved the experience here and the few negatives were far outweighed by all the positives this resort has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, however did not see too many animals as expected”
Reviews.Author: joules100
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to try another deluxe resort in Disney. The hotel is just gorgeous, when we got there we skipped the line since we had already checked in online. Service was great all over with castmembers being nice as usual and as expected in Walt Disney Resort. The art all over the lobby and public spaces is just amazing and also unexpected. It shows Disney is just not ripping people off with an african theme, but that they also appreciate the arts and culture of Africa. Food offered is better than expected ate at the quick service venue and options were fair. Moving around the resort was easy, entering the lobby at the third floor and only having to go up or down a couple of floors to do anything. it was a walk to the room however in a hotel that has thousands of rooms, it is expected to do lots of walking. Bus ride to and from theme parks was fine never had to wait more than 20 minutes as promised. In our weekend trip, never got bored. Rides to parks was a little bit long, however you are paying to be in an african savannah, outside of civilization, so longer rides should be expected and it's nice to have a space not cluttered in disney things all the time in everything. The room we got was smaller than the one we got at the Contemporary resort, however we never felt cramped. The room was very well appointed with very comfortable beds, tables and chairs. Bathroom was on the small side however had everything you expect. The bathroom had some unexpected touches like a note from mickey mouse and his friends and a towel mouse, very cute detail! The balcony is nice, fitting two comfortably. It was nice to have a space to sit down and try see some animals. Did not see as much animals as we expected, only saw the smaller animals and birds wondering around however I guess it's impossible to ensure all animals make appearances all the time. One night we got late to our room and got hungry, we called room service and food was excellent and arrived in a reasonable time. It was nice to have something tasty to eat late at night when arriving to the room tired of all the theme parks. Mousekeeping was great, rooms were left very clean and also very nice to notice that we got some tea and they added some nice complementary twining tea for us to try, very nice detail for them to notice and also to plus it! Coffee in our room was better than we expected, we were accustomed to horrible bad quality coffee, however the one offered in our room was made from Arabica beans, that actually has flavor and was not as bad as we expected. We had a great time in this resort, and for what we paid, we got everything we paid for. Great service and great property to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Phileasafy
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel! The lobby is just amazing and the feel of the whole place oozes quality and sophistication which is not easy with so many kids around? The rooms were excellent, we started off in a room overlooking the reception however when i asked about moving to a Savvana room and what they cost would be I was told it was free and moved accordingly. Well it was a different world - right next to all the Animals - Brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience! Wonderful Hotel and memories”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: This was a family vacation for a family of four. My wife, 9 year old daughter, 6 year old daughter and I. Let me start with my one or two complaints...and they aren't really complaints: 1. It was a little pricey. 2. The Animal Kingdom (Jamba House) was a little was away fromt he parks...Magic Kingdom in particular. Other than that... WOW! This resort was truly our "escape" and home away from home while at Disney. We truely loved it. The pictures do not do the views, or the lobby justice. I have lived and traveled all over the world and this is honestly one of the most breathtaking lobbies I have ever seen. Sincerely. We drove to Orlando from Chicago, and the parking was easy and close at the Jamba house...no need to Valet. Disney did a wonderful job with the Animal Kingdom "theme" and the details carry through everywhere within the hotel in dramatic fashion. If you are on the fence about staying here (and you can afford it) do not hesitate to stay here, but be srue to spring for the savanah view. Well worth it. We had a Savanah view bunk bed for October 8th through the 15th, and the Halloween theme through the parks were wonderful. Particularly Magic Kingdom. WOW. I was skeptical of the additional ticket to take the kids to the "Mickey's not so spooky Halloween" trick or treat event, and wow was it worth it. What a blast. We took a ton of photos, and did a lot of "Photopass" stuff. One tip, have the photographer take a picture of you with YOUR camera too, as they are glad to do so and they tooks some really great shots with ours. Lastly, we did splurge and did one of those in-room decoration packages. Yes, it was pricey but my kids were BLOWN AWAY. We did the Mickey / Minnie Halloween package through Disney Floral (you'll get e-mails) and they came in while we were out on the second day and decorated the WHOLE room with lights, cob webs, stuffed animals, candy. It was honestly amazing and the girls were so excited that Mickie and Minnie "stopped by" which is how they make it look. Well done. Yes, pricey, but so memorable and lots of "top shelf" stuff to take home...mongrammed blankets, light-up trick-or-treat lanterns, A huge Mickie & Minnie...awesome. Book and enjoy. wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place”
Reviews.Author: WynyardTravellers
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home having spent 10 nights at AKL and have to say that it was well worth the visit. The hotel is best described as being as near perfection as possible. From first arriving to leaving we could not fault the place. The staff are all so helpful and friendly Our room was in Jambo House which is the main hotel area. . ROOMS- Decent size with tea/coffee making facilities, a fridge, ironing board, hairdryer and a good supply of clean towels every day. FACILITIES- Plenty to see and do, a good childrens entertainment team with plenty to keep the kids occupied every day. Plenty of walks around the hotel where you can spot the animals.There is a shop situated within the hotel that sells mostly Disney memrobilia but it does have a small supply of basic foodstuffs and alcohol. There is a well equipped gym area with all the latest equipment. TRANSPORT- The longest we had to wait for transport to all parks was no longer than 10 minutes. FOOD- The Mara is open from 6am daily and provides a selection of snacks including breakfast. We visited a number of other restaurants whilst stopping here and they will be reviewed seperately. OVERALL- We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and could not fault the hotel at all, OK is may well be pricey but you definately get what you pay for. .

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for Disney”
Reviews.Author: Josh N
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Animal Kingdom lodge during our last trip to Disney. Although a little pricey, it was worth every penny. When we got to our room there were giraffe's right outside of our window. My daughter was so excited that she didn't want to leave the room to go to the park. If it wasn't for the view from our room we would never have been able to get my daughter to leave the park every night. She would get so excited wondering what animals she would see when she get's home. The restaurants in the hotel were also very good. We started going back there instead of eating in the park because the quality was much better than you could get elsewhere. The shuttle bus was also better than I thought. We never had to wait more than 10 minutes for a bus to arrive and it was a quick ride to any of the parks. We used the Disney website to book our flight, stay, and tickets all together. There was a problem with the way they booked our airfare which resulted in me being on the phone with the airline for about an hour the night before we left. I told the hotel about this upon my arrival and they immediately gave me a $150 credit to use at the resort. The fact that they took ownership of the problem and tried to make amends far outweighed the issue I had with the flight.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Getaway”
Reviews.Author: ATDom
Reviews.Content: We knew our trip to Disney for our first anniversary was going to be magical, but we never could have predicted exactly how magical it would be. There was Disney magic everywhere during our trip, but I will keep this review focused on the AKL. We had just booked a standard view to save money, and at check-in, the sweet staff member helping us gave us a free upgrade to a savannah view as a little anniversary gift. What a wonderful surprise! Our room was at the end of one of the hallways - it was a ways away from the lobby, but it wasn't a bad thing at all. We enjoyed walking past all the different viewpoints of the savannahs and going out on the various porches to sit in the rocking chairs and watch the animals. We loved our savannah view and were impressed by how much sound the door to our balcony kept out. Everyday our room was tidied up and on our last day, we had an anniversary surprise including AK chocolates waiting for us. Pretty special! During our stay, we ate at Sanaa, the Mara, and had a drink at Victoria Falls. Sanaa has a really cool atmosphere, but get there early if you want a window seat! We had reservations and would've had to wait an additional hour to be seated by the window. The food was very different than what we normally eat, but it was still a really neat experience. We really enjoyed the different breads and dips. The Mara was small and we just had one of the main breakfast entrees. My husband enjoyed his, but I didn't care for mine. It wasn't that the food was bad though, it just wasn't to my taste. The only food-related thing that wasn't good were our drinks at Victoria Falls. I couldn't even finish mine it tasted so bad, and it was just a mojito. On the bright side, though, that mojito was the worst part of our stay, which isn't a lot to complain about. The staff was consistently pleasant and helpful, our room was great, the lodge itself and the grounds it's on are beautiful, and the bus rides to each of the other parks really weren't that bad if you plan for them. We would definitely recommend AKL!

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: khufu2009
Reviews.Content: Wow!! Disney did their homework on this lodge. It looks like something out of Africa. One could spend a day looking at the art displayed throughout the lodge. This is as close to Africa as it gets. We loved it so much we bought a timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Travel581
Reviews.Content: Lobby is wonderful. Love breakfast @ Boma & Jiko is awesome. That being said...the room is OK. As I read from other guests...our room had a foul odor. Musty/bug spray-like smell. You get sort of used to it but I'm not sure what it is I'm breathing in. Makes me a little nervous. Completely unacceptable for a "deluxe" hotel & the price you pay to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Waaay too Pricey”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyTwinTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Jamba House, total of 10 people (6 adults and 4 kids) split between a double room and a two room suite. The hotel is very nice, great views of the animals, great staff, very clean. However, the eating options are very limited, its either expensive "fancy" food or cheap chicken part nuggets. The Animal Kingdom is removed from the rest of Disney so you have to take a bus to go anywhere and that really limits your options for evening entertainment. While the hotel was nice, it was just not worth the money. Having done Disney now multiple times and having stayed at other Disney lodges and hotels outside of Disney, I would stay outside. You can get a great room, with great restaurants and entertainment options outside the park. Driving in to Disney is a breeze and even though parking is 14 a day, its still cheaper to stay outside the park.

Reviews.Title: “loooove this place -real life magic!!”
Reviews.Author: capecotter
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at almost every Disney property so far -Animal Kingdom Lodge ROCKS!! From the cast member with the big mickey hand who escorted us to the front desk-to my first view of the lobby-this place wows!I do not have children -and personally think if you do you might want to be closer to the parks-but the remoteness and jaw dropping african ambiance was romantic and homey.My room was a garden view with giraffes,warthogs,zebras,ostrich,and a few species I forget in front of my balcony every morning.The room is standard disney-maybe a little smallish-but very nice large bathroom with seperate sink area.Breakfast at Boma is an absolute must-I think the best breakfast at Disney-Kona being second.Never waited more than 20 minutes for a bus-buses are very conveniently located-right out front.Pool is amazing -so are the drinks at the poolside bar and the bartender was very nice-we were sad we didn't book a whole day to just hang at the pool-I am a disney nut job and I would stay at this hotel just to stay at this hotel-please hate it-so I can keep renting my room here.

Reviews.Title: “A single leaving us wanting more”
Reviews.Author: 1Kryan
Reviews.Content: While we spent one night at the location, if a 2nd trip to WDW happens this is where we will stay. The Arusha view, while the more expensive rooms, can prove to be quite an experience for a photographer with a telephoto lens. The staff was friendly though we wish we had heard of the activities available though it was a one day stay. We learned of activities for adults and children, participating in one which was thoroughly enjoyed. The pace offered peace after a day of being in the Magic Kingdom. The rooms were clean, and colorful while smaller than anticipated. The transportation may be an issue for some as busses are used to commute to the remaining areas of WDW.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money and GREAT service!!”
Reviews.Author: HDCowboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in May, we were treated like "royalty"(always are!). My wife has a foot condition that flares up occasionaly and cannot walk very far. The guys(and ladies) at the Bell station found us a wheelchair to use for our entire stay!! Even when we had problems with a couple of them not working properly they were diligent in making sure our stay was enjoyable, and accessible. We WILL definitely stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel; animal viewing okay”
Reviews.Author: shackelton
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, well crafted and easy to get around. The staff was very helpful. Our room overlooked one of the "savannahs" where the animals are. While animals are not always present, we did get good views of giraffes on several occassions. If you're expecting to see animals every time you look out your window, you will be disappointed. But if you are content to get a few good sightings, you will be happy. The restaurants in this hotel are excellent -- a step above most Disney restaurants - but make your reservations ahead of time.

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge + Concierge = Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: wrensaver
Reviews.Content: Dear friend of mine and I stayed here to celebrate our 40th birthday year, sans kids or husbands. It rained the whole time but the lodge is, as always, just wonderful.. This was our first time in concierge. We got a deal of about $70 more per night than regular - and the food more than made up for it. Now part of it was the weather, so we were indoors a good bit, but we absolutely ate that $70 total between the two of us. Morning breakfast, perfect before the parks, mid-morning snacks, luncheon fare, tea and cookies, hors de'oeuvres, and evening desserts and cordials. Plus the balcony overlooking the lobby. Great time.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, but not worth the price tag”
Reviews.Author: Krista623
Reviews.Content: Upon entering, yeah, the place looks wonderful. It's definitely pretty. However, for a savannah view room, they're cramped, dark and the bathrooms are just miserable. The bed frames squeak, no matter if you're on a bunk bed or the queen size. There is no way to turn on a main light in the room unless you walk through it in the dark to get to the switch and even when you do, it's dim. Looking out at the animals is nice, but how long are you in your room while at Disney and not in the parks, to enjoy the animals?! Food options are awful when it's raining. Long waits (1 to 2 hours) with hardly a place to sit. The cafeteria hardly even has enough seating to be appropriate. The overall layout is awful and getting to your room actually seems like a chore. Now, adding on the price paid per night, I would suggest finding another option. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience, but very pricey”
Reviews.Author: southplainsgroup
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November 2010. We LOVED the place. We have stayed in 5 different Disney properties and this one was on the wish list for quite some time. The property is well laid out, and the staff is quite nice. The experience of being able to see the animals round the clock is amazing. The food facilities are good and the magic express service is quite quick to the resort as well as the park buses. I am not sure if I would spend the extra monies to do it again, but it was definitely an amazing trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fozlove
Reviews.Content: The hotel is spectacuar from the lobby to the rooms, so different from any other hotel that i have stayed in. We were checked in quickly and smoothly the only complaint was nobody around to assist taking our cases to the room. We had a savannah view room which was worth every penny, nice sized room and very comfortable, the view was stunning, a chance to see the animals up close. We particularly enjoyed the chance to watch the giraffes. The staff were friendly and very helpfull, we booked several restaurants during our stay and were able to do this from the hotel, it was quick and easy. The Disney dining plan was excellent, well worth it, fantastic choice of restaurants and the food very good quality with a vast selection. We ate in the Jiko which is a signiture reataurant, the service was excellent but the food a little disapointing. The sanaa restaurant in the Kidani village is well worth a visit, the view of the savannah area is superb and the food excellent. The pool area is very nice, it is clean and there is a nice freindly bar in easy reach, there are plenty of sun loungers and 2 nice jacuzzi pools. The disney transport system is very good, easy to get around the whole disney area, we were only left waiting a couple of times. The hotel is unique and we would definately go back, i would not hesitate to recommend this hotel for couples or families.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: easthamptontraveler
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 days at Jambo House for the 1st time where we celebrated our son's 8th birthday. Everything was easy from the time we booked until the time we left. I had used the online check-in which meant that when the Magic Express dropped us off at the lobby, it only took a few minutes for someone to have a welcome package in our hands. No standing in line either. He greeted us at the door and took my name and it was that simple! I was a little surprised when I saw our room on the map because I had booked a pool view room based on a friend's recommendation. We had been given a free room upgrade to a Savannah view room! What a nice surprise. The room was bigger than I had expected based on other reviews, and it was very clean. No problems whatsoever. We were lucky to see lots of animals every day that we were there from morning until night - it really was a special experience that you can't get anywhere else. We watched a few animals fighting & the zebras rolling in the dirt, heard the birds calling, watched the gentle giraffes feeding right by our balcony. Magical. The pool was clean and beautiful. Every afternoon the pool attendants hosted a pool party for the kids which my 5 & 8 yr old really enjoyed. They also showed movies by the pool in the evenings and had campfires & marshmallows too :) We ate at Boma twice - breakfast & dinner and enjoyed both buffets. We also picked up breakfasts at The Mara as well as a late night snack - those zebra domes really are as good as I've heard (and you can get them with a snack credit if you're using the dining plan as we were.) The shopping in the Zawadi Marketplace was nice too - we picked up a few gifts and things on our way out. We also used the hotel's kid's club for childcare one evening. It's Simba's Cubhouse right in the hotel and it included dinner for the kids. $11/hr each child and they had a blast (coloring, arts & crafts, games, video games & they watched a Disney movie) and we had a few hours of quiet - worth every penny :) FYI-I had called to make a reservation the week before we arrived. Afterwards we wished we had used it for another evening so that we could head back to Epcot to enjoy the evening during the wine & food festival. Shuttle buses to the parks ran very often (we never waited more than 5 min! - maybe we were just lucky?) and we made it to each park for opening each morning, which was the best time to get there - no lines at all! The only line I experienced was the one waiting to check my bags in the lobby on our departure day. That was slow moving, but it was a Sunday and a lot of people were headed out that day, so I would recommend making sure you allow time for that. The hotel stowed our carry-on luggage for the day until our flight in the evening, which was very convenient. Also, they allowed us a later checkout which was nice. To prep I read 2 books with good tips in them: One was the Unofficial Guide to DisneyWorld with Kids & the other was Mousejunkies. I know it's an expensive vacation, but we were there the last week of September and the rates were a little better and there were no lines, which made it a really enjoyable experience. It really is a beautiful hotel. Take the time to explore it and enjoy it and feel like you're getting your money's worth, though maybe some of the experience is up to luck - we had no rain & lots of animals to watch. It was a memorable experience for us and I would definitely recommend and go back there with my family again.

Reviews.Title: “Our last stay at this resort”
Reviews.Author: Onthego92011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before, enjoyed it much more the first time. Very disappointed in the service this time around. Check in was just average, not the enthusiastic greeting we received on our first stay. The room itself was just ok, unfortunately this hotel is the furthest from the theme parks (with the exception of Animal Kingdom), and the wait for a shuttle bus is never ending. We spent so much time just waiting for shuttles throughout our whole trip. Can't undestand why the hotel wouldn't want to improve on this. Disappointed that the hotel charges $10 for 24 hours of WIFI access, we were hoping our daughters could keep up on their homework assignments while there. Lastly, an iTouch was left behind in our room at the time of checkout, I phoned the lost & found twice, leaving my name, phone number and description of the iTouch, my phone calls were not returned, eventhough a voicemail message states someone in the lost & found will provide a return phone call. My suggestion to those considering this hotel - choose another.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort and service!”
Reviews.Author: Meredith B
Reviews.Content: This was our first "on-property" vacation to Disney with our children (6 and 2) - and it was worth every penny! (And, I plan on staying "on property" whenever we can in the future.) The convenience of staying on Disney property was fantastic - it also helped that we were there during the low season (Oct 2 - 7 and crowds were rated around a 3 to 5 out of 10 all week). We booked our trip during a Free Disney Dining Plan offer - very worth it! (Although, if you are already thinking of dates for your vacation - start booking dinning reservations as early as possible - even if you don't actually book your hotel/air reseravations til later!) Because we saved money with the free disney dining plan, we upgraded to a Standard Room - Concierge Level - with this, we had access to personal concierge service - pre-trip and on-site at the concierge level lounge. The lounge offered breakfast in the morning (I had hot oatmeal with fresh fruit every morning - and the kids had their favorite cereal and muffins). The lounge also had snacks throughout the day - and offered appetizers and wine in the evenings. Well worth the extra money (which was less than $200 total). Overall, the staff in the Lounge was fantastic - if you needed soemthing and it wasn't out, you just had to ask and they would provide it. Our children loved having chocolate milk on every visit to the lounge. Another great "included" service - Disney's Magical Express - and Transportation. I have seen other reviews complaining that the Magical Express includeds multiple resort stops when coming from/going to the airport - and while this was the case for us, it was really not a big deal and quite frankly I loved walking out of the plane, down to the Magical Express check-in area and getting on a bus - all within 10 mins. We still got to the resort earlier than if we had rented a car - and didn't have to drag our bags everywhere b/c they were transfered for us. when you have 2 kids like we do, this was a BIG deal - and not having to take car seats b/c we used their transportation all week was another SUPER bonus. As far as transportation on property, we only had to wait an extended period of time (~ 20 mins) for a bus to/from the parks on 2 occasions - otherwise, we only waited a few minutes and a bus appeared. Activities at the AK Lodge - wish our kids were a bit older to take advantage of all the activities they offered - but our daugther had a great time every afternoon at the pool during the kids' pool party, hoola hoop contests, etc. Some other activities: A campfire was offered every evening (complete with marshmallows), night vision goggles to see animals in the early evening, and Disney movies out by the pool @ 8pm nightly. Now...the only complaint we had was the food at the resort. While I enjoyed the food offerings at the Animal Kingdom lodge, my husband was not a big fan of the African inspired cuisine. Everything - except the childrens' menu - was made with curry and other similar spices and after our first reservation at BOMA (which I thought was very good! - my husband not so much :-(), I had to cancel our 2 other reservations at the on-site restaurants. If you prefer to return from the park and eat at your hotel, but may not like African inspired cuisine, then this may not be the best hotel for you. Other than this, our meals were excellent all week - from the Quick Service Cantina in Mexico at Epcot (great tacos and salsa!), to the Coral Reef restaurant in Epcot (best Mahi mahi I have had in a long time!) to Wolfgang Puck in Downtown Disney - we had good service and food all week. We went to 2 character meals - Crystal Palace in MK and Disney Junior at Hollywood and Vine (in HS) - both good buffets but a bit rushed. We didn't get a reservation at Cinderella's Table this trip - but was well worth it as food, service, and photos were great and we will go back. Final thoughts: we booked thru AAA - which can save you another 5% or so if you are a member - but I would just as soon book thru Disney the next time since you don't save the 5% if you access another offer like Free Disney Dining with your vacation package. Hope this was helpful - and you too have a great visit with Mickey Mouse!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family holiday”
Reviews.Author: kharmon67
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a 2 week stay at Jambo House in the Animal Kingdom with my wife and 3 year old son and we had a wonderful time. After a couple of days my was referring to it as home! The hotel itself was excellent, I have read some reviews complaining about the walk but in any hotel of this size you are either going to have a bit of a walk to your room or be waiting on elevators so didn't really find it an issue. Room was a good size for a family of 3 but I think it would be very cramped if going with a family of 4 or more with older children. There was not a lot of storage space for clothes either, most of my clothes were put on top of the unit where the tv was. Every morning we woke up to find giraffes, zebras etc at our balcony because that is were they got fed in the morning, my son absolutely loved this every morning. The pool area was good, I was actually surprised how busy it was. The only thing that slightly ruined it was the lifeguards (4 of them) who were over zealous to say the least. I was not allowed to put my son on my shoulders when in the pool and was told off for drinking my coffee to near the pool. The food in the hotel was good, we were on the DDP which was worth at least $140 per day for us. We used the Mara most days for breakfast which had a good selection of pastries, cereals, fruit etc. Buy one of their coffee cups when you get their and you'll get free tea/ coffee/ juice every day. We had lunch as well there a few times which was good. Don't bother with Boma its either a waste of a table service credit or expensive, $60 for cereal, toast, coffee etc. However it was very nice for dinner I am not usually a big fan of buffets but this was one of the best I have eaten at. The transportation to the parks was really good. Regular buses to take you to all the parks in less than 20mins. The only issues I had were when people in the motorized scooters went to the front of the queue with their whole family, then took up half the bus. No issue at all with disabled people getting priority but the number of people who went onto the bus on these scooters then got up and out of the scooter to take up another seat was quite frustating. The other thing was when on a busy bus home from a park, I had a few occasions where I had to stand with my son who was tired and wanting to sleep, while grown adults sat there watching you struggle. A general lack of manners. Overall the holiday was amazing and I would recommend this hotel especially those staying with staying with young kids, my son loved seeing the animals every day. I would also recommend getting the Dining Plan as it was great value but make sure you book tables a few days in advance or go for dinner early if you want a table. Also if you plan on doing Character Dining book this at the start, as we never got to do this because I left it till the start of the second week to book it and there was no space left.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth your money!!!”
Reviews.Author: dhtrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel because we read great reviews. Usually, reviews from other travelers have helped in the past. This was not the case. We brought our one year old to this hotel because of the animals. Unfortunately, it was raining our whole trip. We could barely see any animals. Obviously, weather was a big factor in our dissappointment but the real reason for our decision of never going back is mainly the rooms in the hotel. We stayed in a pool view room. We could barely see the pool. Rooms smelled horrible, very small, matress made noises, design is horrible, bathrooms are very uncomfortbale (small, dark, smelly). Dining: There are two restaurants in the hotel. If you dont have a reservation, you'll probably have to wait at least an hour. This includes breakfast, lunch, and dinner. We would never stay in this hotel again. We would rather stay in a much nicer hotel and take our son to animal kingdom. We would probably spend much less and enjoy it much more. Animal Kindom Lodge is overpriced and not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, but not quite worth the price tag.”
Reviews.Author: Dardogrimlee
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I stayed at Jambo house from Sept. 28th through Oct. 5th. We had utilized the online check-in service, so when we arrived (using Disney's Magical Express) at 10:30 a.m., less than 5 minutes later we were on our way down the Zebra Trail to our Savannah view room. Needless to say check-in was a breeze and we didn't have to wait at all even though we were hours ahead of the 3 p.m. Check-in time. Our room itself was on the farthest end of the Zebra Trail hallway and even though I've read other reviews of people complaining how "far you HAVE to walk" it literally only took us 3 minutes to walk from our room to the front of the lobby, and then another 2 minutes to get to the buses. I've been in grocery stores that are harder to navigate. It's really not a far walk at all. One tip to make it even less of a walk is to cut through the giftshop instead of going all the way to the lobby. Our room was a standard sized hotel room, nothing fancy except for the balcony overlooking the Savannah. This was a great feature and made it nice to sit out there after a long day in the parks to just relax and watch the animals. We didn't really use the pool at all as it was all that warm, I think the hottest it got was 84 degrees. We did walk the property though, and the pool area looked great. There were two hot tubs situated on either side of the pool, but were packed with families most of the time due to the cooler weather. We were on the dining plan, so we had made reservations to Jiko. The place is gorgeous and the service was excellent. They started us off with moist towels to wipe our hands with, then proceeds with a six course meal that was of great quality. Everything tasted great. I highly recommend this fine-dining experience. We also ate at Mara, which is the quick service location. We had both breakfast and dinner here which is the same food served at similar locations throughout the parks. The bus system was great as usual. This was our third stay on Disney property and we've never had a bad experience with the buses. Although oct 1st was the 40th anniversary of the Magic Kingdom, so those buses were very difficult to come by, so we just went to a different park figuring the Magic Kingdom would be to crowded to deal with anyway. That night there was also a marathon going on, so many buses took longer than expected due to roads being closed, but the resort had informed us of this prior with a note that was left by room service. As far as the time the buses take to get to the parks, Magic Kingdom is the farthest taking a mere 20 minutes from the resort to the bus stop. Epcot is about 15 minutes away, Hollywood Studios 10 minutes or less, and Animal Kingdom clocked in under 5 minutes. One tip when choosing which parks to go to, DON'T pick the parks that have either early or evening extra magic hours. Everyone picks those parks, making them extremely crowded. If you choose 1 of the other two parks, you will find it to be much more relaxed and pleasant. We did this, and every park we visited (with the exception of Epcot during the Food and Wine Festival) was tactically empty. 10 minute waits on the majority of rides except for Toy Story Mania, which we just got fast passes for. All in all, it's an excellent place to stay, friendly staff, top-notch room service, etc. Having stayed at other Disney Properties, however, this is the same service you get anywhere from Disney. The only difference here is that all the rooms are in one building instead of several buildings, the decor is breathtaking, and the view of the savannah is unmatched. If these things are important to you, then you may find great value in the price. For us, however, it's literally half the price to stay at a value resort and have nearly the same experience saving us over $2000. Even if you don't stay here though, get reservations for Jiko!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not my favorite Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DVCmemberHartfordCT
Reviews.Content: First, I am a frequent Disney visitor and have stayed at just about every hotel - I will not be returning to this one. I just returned from a 3 night stay at Jambo House at Animal Kingdom Lodge. The nasty black flies at the pool made it nearly impossible to sit and enjoy the sun, the only place they didn't get you was in the pool. I have stayed at other hotels where the pool party in the afternoon was very fun - these guys were just going thru the motions. They should take lessons from the cast members at Old Key West - they know how to throw a party! The lobby, although impressive was a bit dark and the seating not very comfortable. The counter service restaurant Mara had long wait lines with one person taking orders, two cashiers and a 20 min wait for your food. They definitely need to find another system there. It is not close to anything and both times it was a 25 min ride to Magic Kingdom. The animals were few and far between. We went to view them using the Night vision goggles provided in the evening - when I asked what animals we could expect to see, the staff member said "No animals, just fun to use the goggles" I much prefer Wilderness Lodge, Saratoga Springs, Beach Club over this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, horrible transportation”
Reviews.Author: ktesn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge Villas - Jambo House in late August 2011. The hotel is beautiful and we loved our 1 bedroom villa. Very clean, comfortable and beautiful decor. It felt very much like a home away from home. Our room overlooked the pool which was a nice view, but very noisy at night when we were trying to sleep. Our major issue was the transportation to/from Disney parks. We knew when we booked it that AKL was remote, but I had no idea it would take 26-30 minutes (drive time, not including the stop at Kidani) to go the couple miles to Magic Kingdom. Getting to Epcot and Hollywood Studios was slightly shorter, but still significant. Also, we found numerous times that we were waiting to go from the park to the hotel and we waited much longer than 20 minutes for a bus. We'd often see 2 or 3 buses for Caribbean Beach before we'd see a single bus for AKL. Even though AKL is a Deluxe resort and should have adequate buses running, we found AKL buses to be VERY scarce. Loved the hotel, but won't stay there again b/c of transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: chericua6908
Reviews.Content: My fiance ,myself and my 10 month old daughter stayed at Jambo house, animal kingdom lodge this past week in room 1470 (pool view) and it was THE most amazing experience! You feel amazed the second that you pull up to the resort, when the guy gave up the parking pass he said "welcome home". and then we pulled up to the front,and walked into the lobby to check in,and what we saw blew us away. It was the most beautiful lobby and hotel i have ever seen! and i have stayed at the most beautiful hotels across the country. They were careful to pay attention to every detail within the hotel, we were speechless.Our room was located right off the lobby and about a 3 minute walk to the bus stop, and seconds away from the pool. Every night when we would walk from the lobby to our room we could see many giraffes and zebras and many other animals just feet away from the window! :) It took our breath away, and so did our room! It was huge ! huge bathroom, nice fridge, beautiful unique african decor, very nice details all around the room! (love the hidden mickeys) The staff was also very friendly and helpful.The pool was a large beautiful clean oasis, it was as if we were in the middle of a jungle in Africa.If you are going to stay here make sure you set a day aside just to be at the hotel,because they have so many amazing amenities/activities.We loved going to the arusha rock right off the lobby and seeing zebras,giraffes,gazelles, wildebeests etc all playing together.If you do not want to be far from the bus stop i suggest whenever you make your reservations that you call disney and let them know that you would like to be near the lobby.Also, i seen many people complain about the distance from all the parks, but from my experience it was'nt a long drive at all!IIt really is a life changing experience, and well worth the money. If i could describe with words everything i love about this hotel, I WOULD NEVER STOP WRITING! I have stayed in EVERY deluxe disney resort and most of the moderate. and now,I WILL NEVER STAY ANYWHERE ELSE BUT ANIMAL KINGDOM LODGE!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, awesome views, property is too large”
Reviews.Author: Veronica C
Reviews.Content: We treated ourselves to AKL stay 9/24-10/1, after having staying in value resorts on our last two trips. The hotel itself was beautiful and seeing animals on the savanna was amazing. We actually had a corner savanna view room so we had a larger room and great views from the side and front. The only downfall was how far our room was from everything, buses, pool, cafe, shop. Our room was at the extreme end of the resort, which made it difficult for us to do the things we like to do, run to the cafe for coffee, or take a quick swim and even the walk to the buses took a long time. The buses took a long time and were often overcrowded. It was hot & humid so we tried to spend each day at the pool. Our 8-year-old son absolutely loved the pools party/games each day, they took place between 1:00 and 4:00 pm. We missed a lot of the evening activities due to heading out to parks. Overall, the hotel is great and the views are amazing, our room location will probably affect our decision to return to a value resort on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool, Great Service...Jambo House was fun”
Reviews.Author: matjaz2002
Reviews.Content: Drove up to Jamobo house on Sept16. Was greeting by a ton of people. The bell hop (a very nice lady) help my wife grab the bags. It was little crazy and stressful at the start. Had to wait a while to get in the room but I had feeling that was going to happen. view was great. view of the animals. Kids love it.. I love it. however the room was TIGHT..bunk beds for the 2 kids 1 queen bed. Knew that before doing but still tight. Pool was great. Hard to find chairs even though the pool was not crowded..hmmm... Boma was great..food was great..service was at times slowly. Matra well...not so good. food was average at best. Had a great time but dont think i will go back due to the cost.. wasnt in the room or pool to justify the cost..after 6 days kids were little bored of looking at the same animals. You are far away from all the parks besides Animal Kindom...didnt bother us since we got a rental car but if you are waiting for the bus be prepared to wait.

Reviews.Title: “Creatures great and small...”
Reviews.Author: Pichimura
Reviews.Content: We were so looking forward to staying at this hotel but unfortunately had a bad experience. At 12:30 AM we found not one, but two large cockroaches in our one bedroom villa. The first was in the kitchen, where I forced my husband to hunt it down behind the refrigerator. The second was found in the bedroom (!) just a few minutes after. Needless to say, I had a difficult time sleeping that night. Our son was already sound asleep so we opted to not change rooms. When I think back on the visit, I'll remember the awesome view of the giraffes & zebras but will not be able to forget the disgusting memory of those cockroaches! Yuck!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here and get a Savannah View!”
Reviews.Author: JulzieJ1
Reviews.Content: Ok firstly it is definately worth paying the extra money to have a savannah view of the animals - just being able to go to our balcony and see the animals was amazing, we spent many hours gazing at them - very unique experience. Also, we went Club Level, which was also totally worth it. Not much extra a night if you're already going for one of the savannah view rooms, and you get access to a 'secret snack floor' with food and drinks available pretty much all day (includes beer and wine and even spirits at night). We found this to be great as you're often on the run all the time with fitting things in at Disney and it was great to just go grab a coke or some pretzels. The 5-7 cheese and crackers, and appetisers from one of the restaurants were a highlight - great if you're heading out for a late-night sesh at one of the parks (because you get extra hours when staying at a Disney Resort). Also the staff are super helpful on the club level floor and will get/tell you anything you need. The lobby is really impressive and spacious, but this hotel is big, and some rooms would have been a fair walk from the entrance - however these rooms generally have the best views so that's the trade-off. The pool looked nice, spent a couple of hours out there. Looked like there were a lot of activities going on for kids to keep them entertained. We had a meal at the fancy restaurant (name escapes me), and it was amazing, couldn't fault it. Fairly pricey but food was that good it was worth it! The only negative I would say it that there is no wireless internet available which we thought was strange since it's common to have it at most hotels of this standard. We could walk to the sister resort (about 10-15 mins walk) and use theirs but they still wanted to charge us about $20 a day for it. Personally I think this is terrible considering the high prices you already pay to stay at a Disney Resort (and even at club level???). We ended up using the internet and Starbucks or McDonalds when we were out and about (as it is FREE!). Otherwise - excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Just As Good Second Time Round”
Reviews.Author: craigo11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the AKL for 14 nights from 16th September through to the 30th. This was our second visit having stayed here in November 2010. We love this hotel. When we drove through the gates it actually felt like we had never been away. All the staff that we met were very friendly and chatted away to us and made a fuss of our 3 year old daughter. Last time we stayed in a Pool View room, where we could hardly see the pool. This time round we opted for a standard room and were allocated one on the Zebra Trail (2572). Our view this time was much better and we often woke to giraffes, zebras or antelope outside our window. The room was ok, but we didn't go to Disney to spend a lot of time in the room.
