Our only minor issue we had was that the queen beds were quite high up and could not be moved, and we were concerned that our daughter (who is a restless sleeper) would fall out. Each night we packed the space between the bed and the wall with our suitcases to prevent her falling out of bed and injuring herself. We ate at Mara few time and the food was reasonable, although I think you would get bored of the limited choices quite quickly. We ate at Jiko one night and although the food was good we were very disappointed with the service. Our reservation was for 7.55pm. We were finally seated at 8.25. We did not order starters and our main course was on the table at 9.25. It's very difficult to keep a hungry three year old occupied for an hour and a half. There was no explanation or apologies from the waiting staff for this delay. A few of the reviews mention the transportation time to and from the parks. We did not think that they were too bad, however I did end up standing with the stroller on many of the journeys. We had two issues with the transportation. The first relates to the motorised scooters who swanned to the front of the queue, up onto the bus and then the "driver" got off the scooter and walked to another seat closely followed by their family. This often took up about a quarter of the bus, thus limiting the seating for those legitmately in the queue. The second issue relates to the rudeness of some guests onboard the buses. In many instances, on the busy bus, there would be adults holding onto young tired / sleeping children who were forced to stand for the journey, whilst able bodied visitors occupied seats. A common courtesy would be allow those with young chilldren to sit, but often this never happened. I gave up my seat on most journeys to allow other mothers / fathers with young children to sit down. I believe I was in the minority. Overall, we really enjoyed our two weeks as Disney and would definitely recommend AKL as a base to visit the Disney Parks and other Orlando attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Be a Jungle VIP! But consider elsewhere if you're a couple wanting more than just savanna views...”
Reviews.Author: ianrob84
Reviews.Content: On our most recent trip to Walt Disney World in September 2011, we decided that we would split our 8 day break into two pieces, spending two nights at the tail end of our holiday at Disney’s Bay Lake Tower, (where we own as part of the Disney Vacation Club), and six nights at the Animal Kingdom Lodge, Jambo House, (the older part of resort, Kidani Village is the latest edition). As we are DVC members, we stayed in an Animal Kingdom Villa on the 5th floor of the hotel. Our room was off the Kudo Trail and overlooked the Sunset Savanna, directly across from the atrium of Kidani Village foyer. We chose to only have a studio room, so that we could make the most of our points and to afford us a couple of nights at Bay Lake Tower. We chose AKL, as we had previously visited the resort on our last vacation, having dinner at Jiko. We felt the grand, Africana ambiance of the hotel was such, that we decided it would make a great vacation hotel. Needless to say, we weren’t disappointed! If you’ve not been to the Animal Kingdom Lodge, it’s worth a trip – steeped with architectural influences of the African Continent, the majestic building is constructed to look like it is made of a sturdy log-frame, topped with a hay thatch roof. The décor is rich in colour and texture, with comfortable winged armchairs and sofas littering the grand hotel foyer, complimented by a large open fire which burns all day and adds to the variety of delicious smells that emanate from Jiko and Boma restaurants on the lower levels. At the far end of the vast lobby with its high, vaulted ceiling, is a full length glass wall, with views out towards the well-designed pool complex. The Uzima Springs pool is over 11,000 square feet. It is also has an entrance without steps and a rather large slide which looked very popular with kids! There isn’t though a quiet pool, so adults, be warned! The pool is open 24 hours a day but is only manned until 10:00 PM, which is when the slide closes. The two spas close at midnight – we didn’t admittedly use the pool this time, but it’s certainly one of the best at Walt Disney World. The lobby has a large floor plan for the main level, with the well-stocked Zawadi Marketplace, selling everything from authentic African souvenirs and the usual Disney merchandise to beers, cereals and emergency medicines! To the right of the lobby is a series of multi level areas, entwined around a majestic waterfall, which ultimate lead down to the lower levels with restaurants and access to outside areas of the hotel. The check-in process was quick and painless as always. We chose not to check-in online before arrival, but nonetheless it was a smooth process. The only downside being that we couldn’t collect our park passes, (or have them directly linked to our room keys as on previous vacations), as we had purchased them separately from the Walt Disney World UK website and the two systems were not compatible. This did annoy us somewhat, but it would be unfair to criticise the hotel on this, as it was more of a WDW system problem and not AKL itself. After check-in, we made our way to our room. Our initial reaction was wonderful. The room’s design, compliments the rest of the hotel perfectly, with the same rich colours and textures, being carried into the décor and furnishings. You almost feel as though you are transported into a romantic African film set, and as you make your way through the room, the view of the Sunset Savanna peaks through the drapes. Upon pulling these back, the vast Savanna, which would be the envy of many safari parks and zoo’s across the world, opens up to you. In true Disney style, guests are made to feel as though they are “on-stage”, this time transported into another era, of desert plains and tropical oasis. Cleverly designed so that guests feel as though the rooms lead directly onto the Savanna, over looking animals such as giraffe, zebra, ostrich, to name but a few. Thankfully, a species guide is given in each room, so kids young and old can try to spot them all – it certainly is a wonderful sight to see and as far as we could tell – no animal smells! Cast members regularly clear up after animals, so it never posed a problem. At night, the savanna is lit up with artificial moonlight to help the animals feel adjusted – the key thing that anybody could easily pick up on at Jambo House, was that animals are very well respected and look after. It’s worth mentioning here that AKL is a smoke free resort – guests are asked to smoke only in designated areas – smoking on the balconies is strictly prohibited as with all Disney Resort Hotels, but at Animal Kingdom, this point is even more heavily laboured – discarded cigarette butts, as well as any other type of litter, pose a danger to animals. Management make it quite clear that anybody found to be abusing this will be asked to leave the resort, and quite rightly so in my book! It is Animal Kingdom, after all! Having said that, inevitably accidents will happen and the cast members will gladly retrieve any items that may fall from the balcony, as there is no access to ground floor level to guests on the Savanna areas of the resort. The room itself was just lovely. The bed was extremely comfortable, although ours did squeak at the slightest of movements! The room furnishings also include a decent sized wardrobe, a small dining table with two chairs and a comfortable sofa bed with coffee table. All help to continue the heavy theming and the imagination working! The room also houses a small kitchenette, with microwave and coffee machine. If you’re a true brit like me, you’ll need your morning cup of tea, and whilst we took our own travel kettle, documentation does say that a kettle can be provided if asked for at concierge, (limited availability). The room also has a vanity area with twin sinks and ample storage space for toiletries. A separate bathroom hosts a toilet with shower over bath – the shower was brilliant! Great pressure and hot water all-day every day… No cold showers here! We had a couple of minor problems with the room – as mentioned, the bed squeaked even if you looked at it the wrong way, one of the lights failed in the vanity area and the coffee machine stopped working. We went to concierge and informed the cast members – unfortunately, nothing was done about the problems the first day we reported it. I can’t help but think the cast member we spoke to was still “earning her ears” !! However, we reported the issues again the following day – after a very apologetic response, we returned home after a day in the parks to all problems having been rectified, so we were happily satisfied. Whilst the magic and feeling of the Animal Kingdom Lodge, are enough to wow even the most Disney-sceptic of people, we did find that as a 30-something couple with no kids, that perhaps AKL wasn’t quite suited for our needs. Due to the nature of Animal Kingdom, it needs to be away from the noise and fireworks of the other parks, which is perfectly understandable, but it subsequently means that it’s furthest away from everything else. That’s not to say it’s absolutely miles away, but don’t be surprised if a bus back from say Magic Kingdom, takes 30 minutes, especially when the park is busy – you might not even get on the first bus! This may not be ideal after a hot, sticky and tiring day wandering around the parks and all you want to do is get back and lie horizontal in your comfortable bed! We’re not naive though and understand that a Disney holiday is a drain on the feet & legs, and yes of course, you can happily drive between the resorts and park for free, I’m sure this suits families well! However, as we were a young couple on holiday, it wouldn’t have been fair to expect one of us to not be able to have a drink with dinner or whilst strolling around Epcot. We found that on occasion, the journey back to the hotel was a little tedious on the busses. That being said, AKL has dedicated bus services, which only stops at Jambo House and Kidani Village, unlike most of the other resorts, which may well have 2 or 3 resorts as stops on the way between areas within Walt Disney World. We personally thought that other resorts, such as the Boardwalk Resort Area, with its access to Epcot through International Gateway and boat transportation or footpath through to Hollywood Studios, plus the bars and restaurants of the Boardwalk itself, or the Magic Kingdom Resorts with on-foot access, (especially from BLT and the Contemporary) or greater transport access with the monorail, busses and the Ticket and Transportation Centre, would be more suited to us in future, as access to some of the parks is easier and more accessible. Do not expect to go to Animal Kingdom Lodge and be able to get anywhere, not even Animal Kingdom Park, on foot – it simply isn’t do-able! All in all though, Animal Kingdom Lodge is a truly wonderful hotel, a jewel in Disney’s collection. And whilst I believe it’s certainly more geared towards families with kids, I don’t think there is anyone who would stay here, who wouldn’t feel like they were young again – the imagination cannot fail to be stimulated! Bravo Disney, once again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but...”
Reviews.Author: dewybeach
Reviews.Content: We (myself, hubby and 5 yr old daughter) stayed at this resort from 9/25 to 10/1/11. Unfortunately, I couldn't wait to return home. I have positive and negative opinions mixed throughout this review so please bear with me. The resort was attractive and most staff were friendly. We had club level at Jambo House. The resort has a dark appearance to it, our room was small with dark furniture and this was just depressing :( Breakfast was repetitive, boring and not tempting enough for us to make it before 1030 am each day. Cereal, bagels (not very good ones), muffins/chocolate pastry and oatmeal. They didn't change it up. Somedays we waited until 11am for quick service lunch. However, the appetizers around 5ish, were delicious! I will say that the Concierge staff (servers) were really accommodating. Ok, I'm basing this review on our first stay last year at Beach Club, Club Level. The resort was bright, colorful and the rooms were large. I'm a shellfish lover and the Cape May clam bake was awesome! And, ahhhh..... the Beach Club sand bottom swimming pool!!! Should I say more? And then there's the pool bar!!! Ok, I need to stop reminiscing. Next paragraph... This time we wanted give Animal Kingdom Lodge a try especially since it was about $600+ cheaper than Beach Club. We now realize you get what you pay for. We did have the Savannah View at Animal Kingdom...very nice!!! We saw giraffes, zebras, wilder beasts, antelope, cattle and different types of birds. On days when we had down time was somewhat depressing because we didn't want to hang out in our small, dark room. During the day it was too hot to sit outside and the animals were nowhere in sight (cause it was too hot)! The resort wasn't big enough to explore and the pool was just OK. However, the water slide in Kidani village was awesome! Prepare yourself for hundreds of annoying flying bugs to attack you there while you're lounging!!!! You're better off at Jambo pool (less bugs). No bugs at the Beach Club pool and the resort is close to Epcot, the boardwalk, Hollywood Studios and other attractions. I will say that Simba's Cub House at Animal Kingdom Lodge was wonderful for our 5 year old. She spent a few hours there and loved it!!! So did we Ü The food at Boma's and Mara's was really tasty! We really appreciated the different spices and selections. Don't expect shellfish because you won't get it there! Very disappointing. The only seafood at Boma's was salmon, very good though. Lots of chicken which is a good thing because I love chicken! Well, next time it's Beach Club for us again Ü

Reviews.Title: “Jambo House-- Great Trip with preschooler”
Reviews.Author: Kristy_Lanikai
Reviews.Content: Me, my hubby and 3 year old son stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge-Jambo House from Sept. 24th to Oct. 1st for 7 nights. We had a pool view room and were on the dining plan. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Upon arriving (via car), we drive up to the huge reception area and were greeted by the valet and bell service. This was a bit hectic as the second we step out of the car, they immediately separated me and my husband by having him stay with the car while they unloaded and sent me and my son inside to check-in. I was wanting to wait until the luggage was unloaded so my husband could watch my son while i checked in. Rather, my son was running in between my feet while I stood to check-in at the reception desk. They pretty much pushed me inside the doors and I felt as though I didnt really have a choice to wait for my husband. That was the start of the trip. By the time we caught up with each other, and were actually in our room, both me and my husband were pretty stressed out. He mentioned the valet and bell service worker he encountered was extremely rude to him, even though he tipped him well. This wasn't the only rude cast member we encountered during the week. We had a few others, but chalked it up to maybe they were having a bad day? So, we started off a little overwhelmed. But, the actual lodge itself, decorations and theme, were quite impressive. In fact, walking into the lobby was breathtaking. Had we not encountered the stressful arrival that we did, I porbably would have had a little bit more time to take it all in. Our room was great! We had two queen beds and a pool view. We thought the size was perfect for our family of 3. We had plenty of drawer and closet space to put all of our belongings. The beds were comfortable as well. Air conditioning worked great. We were able to view animals at all the animal overlooks and saw animals almost every time we went to view them. One negative about the resort we had would be the proximity our room was to the daily pool party. Yes we had a pool view room, but every day from 1pm-4pm, there is a pool party going on---- a loud pool party. Our room must have been right next to a speaker because when we were trying to get in an afternoon nap, our beds were vibrating to the beat of the music. It was that loud! With a preschooler, it was tough to get him down for a good nap without him waking up every now and then due to the loud music. We use a sound machine while we sleep and had it up pretty loud, but didn't help drown out the music or noise. The pool area was fabulous, though! Although, if you don't grab a chair by 10am, it might be hard to find multiple chairs next to each other. We just wanted two chairs and had a hard time finding two side-by-side by 11am. We saw several families saving 5-7 chairs at a time with the white hotel towels and never return to their chairs for hours (2+) at a time. Saving chairs is fine if you are going to use them between going from the pool to the chairs, but please be courteous and actually USE the chairs. If not, please remove your towels so other families can have some place to actually sit besides the concrete. Thank you. Our experience in Disney World was awesome!! We had such an amazing time! We were able to visit every park and enjoyed them all in different ways. The travel books say that September is one of the best times to go as far as crowds go, but we encountered a lot of crowds each day at every park. My touring app would give parks a 2.5 or 3 on the crowd level and I found that to be a bit off as the walkways in some of the parks were very hard to maneuver through with the loads of people squished into them. Ride wait times weren't as bad, though, with waits anywhere from 15-25 minutes except for Toy Story which was up to an hour. We were able to make rope drop EVERY DAY of our trip and rode all of our "must-do's" within the first two hours of park opening, but by the afternoon it was packed, so we headed back to the hotel for a nap. I would highly recommend making at least one day of rope drop. Well worth your time!! We just made sure to be back in the room by our son's normal bedtime, if not before and didn't find it hard to get up that early. Another negative about the hotel, in particular: It is about a 20-25 minute, sometimes 30 minute, drive to Magic Kingdom on the bus or by car. If this is the park you will spend most of your time, spend the extra money for one of the monorail resorts. Although we loved the hotel and the area that it was in as well as the proximity to the Animal Kingdom Park, we spent several days at MK and felt a lot of our time was spent traveling back and forth--difficult to do when you have an exhausted preschooler. Hotel Restaurants---FABULOUS!! We ate at Boma twice for dinner and twice for breakfast and thought it was awesome! We were on the dining plan. We ate a Mara twice and thought it as well as a great quick service spot. Didn't eat at Jiko; maybe next time. However, our favorite restaurant the entire trip was hands down, Ohana! Make reservations for this place well in advance! You will be glad that you woke up at 6am 180 days before your trip---TRUST ME! Other than those few negatives: proximity to MK, the pool party noise in the pool view room, and the chaotic check-in with the rude bell service worker, our stay was great!! We would highly recommend this resort. TIP: either splurge on the savanna view room or save your money and get a view of the parking lot-- especially if you have a small child who needs a nap.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: LastMinuteLulu
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an Arusha view room with two double beds. Size was fairly standard. We didn't find it overly small and it was more than adequate for 3 nights for 2 adults and 1 child. Room was bright enough and not at all dark as some reviews suggested. Room was on same floor as and just to right of reception so a little noisy with lots of people heading back and forth but nothing too disturbing - would recommend further along the same corridor. We found being on the lower floor good for seeing the animals. Dawn and dusk are definitely the best times to spot them. Disney's magical express was an absolute boon when arriving fairly late in the evening. I booked this direct on the website and we were on their transport lists when we arrived despite the 42 days notice the website suggested and no email confirmation. Bought park tickets at reception, but would have been cheaper from the UK. If you do buy from reception, I'd recommend not buying the park hopper unless you are certain you will use it - you can pay the top up on the day if you decide to park-hop. Public areas of hotel are stunning - huge double height central atrium with a fire, beautiful carvings and disney on TV for the kids. Great bus services to and from the parks makes life very easy. We ate breakfast in Boma every morning (about $60 / day + tips for the 3 us). You need to book! It was fantastic, they roasted ham, tomatoes and asparagus over a wood fire and the flavour was to die for! There were huge bows of fresh pineapple, strawberries and other fruit as well as the usual buffet selection of almost everything you can think of. We never tried the nicer restaurants for dinner at the end of a long day in the parks and instead opted for the quick service Mara restaurant. We were pleasantly surprised with this, serving tasty simple food like roast chicken with couscous and african stew and you could still get a bottle of wine with dinner (albeit with disposal plastic glasses). Would I stay again? Yes, but can't imagine going back to disneyworld any time soon!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort but average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bocko57
Reviews.Content: The African motif is wonderfully setup and displayed. The resort inside and out is kept dark but contained enough lighting to move around safely. The resort grounds is beautiful and kept clean. The cast members were all very friendly. The resort is Eco-friendly. The rooms (king size bed) were not very large for being a deluxe room (cannot imagine the size with 2 queen size beds). The bathroom and shower were spacious. The room was kept clean but had a very musty smell everyday we were there (5 days). Also, the room really needs a new mattress and pillows. I rated the room average based upon the cost of the resort, room size, mustiness, and mattress/pillows. We could had just gotten a bad room with the bed and the smell but, I will try another deluxe room the next time I visit Disney.

Reviews.Title: “So much fun for all.”
Reviews.Author: shareair
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 9 days at the Kadani villa with family and friends and we all had a great time. We used our Disney vacation club points and got a two bedroom savanah view. Unfortunately we were so busy that we only enjoyed the animals from our balcony a few times. There are large windows everywhere in the hotel so as you walk pass the lobbey, you see different animals outside eating and just hanging. There are view points that you can go to enjoy the views so may not be worth to have a savanah view. The hotel is amazingly decorated and so clean. The staff were all friendly and everyone was either greeting you or helping you. Kadani is the smaller and quieter side compared to Jambo house. That place is nice too but what a zoo. Jambo house is nicely located with all the restaurants, bigger gift shop, and bigger pool. The hotel shuttle transfers guests from the two villages every 5 minutes so not a big deal to us. It is not far to walk but with two little kids and hot humidity heat, the van ride is nicer. The disney express buses stop by Kadani first to pick up passengers but drops off at Jambo house first. So we always had a seat on the bus taking the ride from kadani but not so if you wait to get on the bus from Jambo house. The pool at Kadani has a nice water park for kids. The main pool has two slides (one small one and one big one). The larger pool at Jambo is very nice with a fun medium sized slide that even my two year old can enjoy. The pool games were great for kids and adults and we can even win prizes. The rooms were very nice and the master's has a king size bed and a larger bathroom with whirlpool jets in the tub. The large shower is nice also. The single chair in living room folds out a twin size bed and the sofa converts to queen size bed. There is also a third full bathroom in Kadani villas but not at Jambo. The rooms are clean and plenty of amenities. We ordered groceries beforehand and they delivered the day we got there and put all the stuff away for us which tells you the level of service disney promotes. We went to every park and waterpark also. We used the disney buses for all our transfers and they are 90% of the time prompt. Once again, certain times it is so crowded on the bus that it is literally a sardine can. The restaurants are excellent. We went to Sanaa and Boma both very unique and tasty foods. Did not go to jinko b/c so expensive. Mara provides all kinds of snacks and quick meals and we never have trouble getting tables. We bought a disney mug that has unlimited refills on soda and coffee for $15. My husband drinks alot of soda so it is worth for us although you can not refill it at any of the parks and waterparks. Only at the resorts. Everyone knows about the disney parks so I'm not going to go over them. Waterparks are the best I've ever seen. So much fun for all ages. Downtown disney is full of life especially at night. You can't go wrong visiting there at night. There are a ton of people, musics, performers, shops, and excellent restaurants, how can you go wrong? Make sure everyone is well hydrated and strollers are a must for those with kids (even if they are in grade school). It is a huge place and lots of walking back and forth required. Alot of rides for little ones but 40inch seems to be the requirement for more thrilled rides. Just mix the rides with the shows so you can find rest and air conditioning in b/w the lines and the heat. It rained everyday we were there but unlike 4 years ago, the rain poured hard and lasted sometimes hours instead of minutes. We used ponchos but it rained so hard that the streets were flooded in minutes so umbrella seemed like a better idea. Have fun and all animal lovers or those with kids should experience this place at least once.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Disney Resort!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CLK16
Reviews.Content: My Husband and i stayed here on the concierge floor when they first opened, and loved it! We had a great view of the giraffes! The food here is very good. Whenever we go to Disney we come back here for lunch or dinner at least once. Try the African Stew!!!!! This January we are going to stay here with our 6 year old in the timeshares section.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking common areas, small guest rooms, allergy-friendly food court”
Reviews.Author: Wayoffyonder
Reviews.Content: We have been here a couple times before, and on this visit stayed at the Jambo House on the Zebra Trail in a Savannah view room. We were upgraded to a Savannah view room from a pool view room, which was a very nice surprise. We had a 2 queens room (we requested a king) but no kings were available. There have never been kings available on any of our stays, so if this is something you really want I would plan on it being unavailable here. The common areas of this hotel are just breathtaking--so scenic and comfortable, with amazing details everywhere. The common areas here deserve top marks by any standard. They set a wonderful mood and the hotel feels like a retreat (albeit a very large one). It does tend to be darker everywhere, which is part of the mood and pleasant in my opinion, but if you want a very bright hotel, this isn't it. Once in the room, the hotel does not impress so much. While the room looks nice, it is VERY small. There is hardly any room between the 2 queens and the walls, and only a small space in between the beds. On the end where the TV armoire is, there is just enough room to open the drawers. There is also 2 chairs at a table, and they are just wedged in there, giving one chair enough room for an adult (hitting the wall in the back), but the other is so close to the table it is really only a kid-sized space. Everything is a very tight fit, with very little room for suitcases. It is darker in there as well, but we didn't mind that. (If the shower room was a little brighter that would be better though, I'll bet it's only a 25w bulb in there). We found the beds to be in need of replacement. Mine was collapsing in the middle on the edge and somewhat squeaky, and the other one was profoundly squeaky. My back was not happy in the morning. For being in a quiet part of the hotel, there were many noises to wake you up. The main problem stemming from the very thin walls. I heard the snoring person next door, them brushing their teeth, flushing the toilet, tv, and talking. They seemed like pretty quiet folks, but the walls were just so thin. Much more so than other hotels, and also just the (as expected) hallway traffic noise. The toilet flush is really loud and would wake people up in our own room as well. If you get unlucky and get neighbors while are moderately noisy--don't expect any sleep while they are up! Housekeeping seemed to consist of a quick wipe down of the sink, empty the trash cans, and make up the beds. The only change the sheets on your fifth day, unless you request it. We had a towel animal the first day, but not after, even with tips. The Savannah view on the Zebra trails was pleasant--there were a variety of animals at different times of the day (no zebras that we saw though, how funny). It is not a very long walk/elevator ride on this trail to the lobby, pool, or food court, it is a very convenient spot if you are hoping to minimize what could be lots of walking at this hotel. The food court is nice in our opinion, but not a ton of hot meal selection. The cheeseburger and zebra domes was the only things we got more than once, so would be the most recommended. Lots of grab and go and fruit-bowl kinds of options, including a gluten and dairy free brownie and soy regular and chocolate milk boxes. The staff is helpful and very good with making a meal to meet allergies. This is a great food court if someone has food restrictions and needs a helpful chef who will make something to meet dietary restrictions. This hotel always had longer times on the bus due to its location, but direct service sort of made up for that. Now this bus makes 2 stops though, at Jambo House and Kidani village, and it really does increase the time and the probability you will stand on the bus ride. I am not sure if we will stay here again due to the room size and noisiness, and the increased travel time on the buses, but the common areas and allergen-friendly food court do tip the scales in this hotel's favor.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good but not quite Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: China101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge for 5 nights. We LOVED our first impression of the hotel. We were warmly greeted, given a mini-tour and escorted to the front desk for check-in. We had a pool-view room as we wanted to be close to the pool and restaurants and we were very close. Our room had a somewhat musty smell. I assume it is because of the humidity in Florida. The room, as others have noted, was somewhat small but clean and well laid-out with a decent amount of storage for clothing, etc. The pool was great for our 4-year-old as there was a zero-depth section to the pool and a great waterslide. There were also numerous lifeguards staffing the pool so it made it a bit easier to relax as our daughter swam in the pool with her life jacket. We were, however, a bit disappointed that the only poolside food service is by ordering room service with delivery outside to the pool area. This resort is absolutely beautiful and there is a full schedule of events and activities to do daily. There are a number of African-themed events as well as campfires, movies outside at night and pool parties and games. There is enough going on that you really wouldn't have to leave the hotel. The reason I have this 4/5 instead of 5/5 is because the staff, especially the concierge staff, were not particularly knowledgeable nor were they very friendly. Often, they were checking people in and those of us who had a "concierge" question would have to wait a significant amount of time in order to get our question answer. Plus, a number of the answers were incorrect (park closing hours; how to get to the mickey's backyard bbq and hoop-de-doo music revue). We also were stuck with concierge trainees a number of time who didn't know the answers to questions but had to answer because their trainer said the trainee must answer. This was a huge waste of our time and it wasn't at all very guest-focused. Finally, we mentioned our 4-year-olds birthday to a number of staff (including concierge) at this resort. We did not receive anything to commemorate the big event - not a card from the characters, not a call to say happy bd, not a cupcake. We were told, upon check-in, that if we wanted a cake we could call and order one (for $24 of course!). I was somewhat disappointed that Disney could not have done SOMETHING - we received more from the waiters at the various restaurants we ate at during the week. Finally, we did soon realize that the people working valet were much more helpful than the concierge staff and we relied on them for directions and advice on transportation within the disney system. Overally, we did enjoy our staff but would love to see Disney put more effort into their concierge staffing. It would have made our experience much better!

Reviews.Title: “Completely Amazing, Breathtaking, HEAVEN!”
Reviews.Author: codygude
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge in March of 2011. This was the first deluse resort we stayed at inside Disney. It was amazing. Being a college student on a budget we decided to just pay for the cheapest room, even if it meant not getting a Savanna room. Boy were we surprised when we checked in and had been upgraded to a Savanna view room! It made me the happiest person on earth! Inside the main lobby you will have your breath taken by the size and beauty of it! When we got to our room, just when I though my breath couldn't be stolen again, it was. The Savanna view was incredible, sitting on the balcony and being able to see the animal roam was such an amazing experience. We called our family in Tampa and told them that they should come over and enjoy the day with us. I called the front desk and asked them if this was ok and what should they do about parking and the gate attendent. They said all our family would need to do was tell them our room number and last name. So my family drove the 50 miles over and stayed the day with us. I had such an amazing time exploring the resort and doing a Hidden Mickey search with my niece and nephew. They LOVED it! Its an experience I will never forget! The grounds were clean, the room was spotless, staff amazing, best resort ever!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort hotel and animals!!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewT
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin. Really was a wonderful hotel. Fortunately stayed in June so perhaps not as busy as in July/August. Was plenty of parking space available (don't bother with valet) and just used the buses to get about the various parks (sometimes meant a longer journey coming back but that's theme parks for you!) Room itself was a standard two-double room with plenty of storage space for the two of us, but would've struggled if there were more. Had a very good view of the animals that roamed around the hotel grounds, particularly in the morning when getting up. Could have done with having tea in the selection and not just coffee but that's just picky! Restaurants were very good particularly Jiko which had some of the best food I've ever had and on a par in terms of prices with proper restaurants. If you can afford it go on the special hotel safari ride, it's worth it as get SOOOO close to the animals it's unreal plus food (and wine) all included at Jiko afterwards. Would of course prebook that restaurant and Boma unless you like waiting, but Mara self-service had plenty of options when you just wanted something fast. Pool was also good sized and could always get a bed just don't forget the sun-screen! Am sure there are other things that were wonderful, desk-service couldn't fault and were always there to help/suggest. Was a slight indulgence so if went again (with children) then would probably stay somewhere closer to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Good Location, Below Average 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EricTLosAngeles_CA
Reviews.Content: On arrival, our Standard Partial Pool view Room was cramped, poorly cleaned, and faced the airconditioner and a roof top. We were moved the next day to a partial savana view room which was just OK, but far better than the first. The staff corrected the problem and gave us a $100 room credit for dinner -- just enough for dinenr at the nicer restaruant there. The food was good, but you will pay big for food anywehre on the grounds. We stayed for 4 days. That was enough. The Swan or Dolphin were better values.... The Sanava is not worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious accommodation and lots of fun for kids!”
Reviews.Author: ehan31
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few months ago in Kidani Village, in a savannah view 2-bedroom suite (Disney Vacation Club). The first thing to remark about is the layout of the room. Not only are the two bedroom areas separated by the living room, but there is an EXTRA full bathroom near the entryway that made getting ready with four girls a breeze. (That makes three full bathrooms in total). The toilets are all separate from the sinks and showers for multi-person use. There is just so much SPACE, which was perfect for my 14-month old after a long day at Disney in the stroller. The beds were a bit on the hard side but comfortable enough, and even the pull-out couch bed wasn't terrible. The kitchen was stocked as usual for DVC, I appreciate the paper towels and dish soap a lot! The only thing missing in the kitchen was counter space to put any groceries, there wasn't an open cupboard either, so we had to do some rearranging of dishes to accommodate. I didn't mind but I'm not sure how housekeeping felt. The savanna was fairly populated any time of the day, and the balcony was generous and quite long as it spanned all three rooms. I love the Mara quick service, it really is a lot better than most quick service options at Disney. My son and I have a severe dairy allergy and as with all Disney restaurants, the chefs have always been very helpful. Boma is a great buffet if not expensive ($35 a person, $14 for children starting at age 3). It has a good variety and is similar to the Tusker House. Try the curry chicken stew and peanut rice. Mmm. The only two 'complaints' I have are somewhat minor. First, the rooms are decorated very nicely, with African themed furnishings. The appliances and lighting are all energy-efficient, with motion-sensor lights in the bathroom. Other than that, though, the lighting is all provided via lamps, no overhead lights. This made for quite a dark room no matter if the windows were open or not, during the day. It was a bit of an annoyance, honestly, but if you don't spend much time there during the day it wouldn't much matter. The other complaint I have is regarding the parking for Kidani Village. It is a above-ground parking structure with a weird one-way flow, and only one elevator per 'area' (Timon, Pumbaa, etc.). The parking here was sparse when I was visiting, even though it wasn't peak season, so we were forced to park quite far from our area's elevator and take all our luggage in, because we didn't want to wait for the bellboy (it is not staffed 24/7, they have to call someone down which we thought would take longer than going ourselves. Wrong). I only found parking near our elevator once, and we even were traveling with someone who had a handicap placard. Overall, it was a great stay full of wonderful amenities and activities. The facility is beautiful and the walk over to Jambo House isn't bad at all. I'd love to stay here again if we get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Once was Enough”
Reviews.Author: dicelees
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Jambo House, in a savannah view room. The room was lovely, we had a great view and saw a lot of animals, unfortunately it was very far away from the main lobby. Jambo House is shaped like a giant "U", with the main lobby in the center of the curve. If you are in a room towards the far ends of the "U" be prepared to do a lot of walking: and remember it will be a lot of walking at the end of a long day at the parks when your feet are aching and all you want to do is fall into bed. On the upside, being far away from the main lobby meant it was usually very quiet. One other thing to mention, AKL is very far away from all of the parks aside from Animal Kingdom. Expect to ride 20-30mins on the bus to get anywhere, and don't forget to factor in extra time for when you just miss the bus, or the bus fills up before you are able to get on (this happened to us frequently). Overall, the amenities and features of AKL are no doubt beautifully appointed and its an extremely unique hotel experience. But for us once was enough, and on future trips, just not worth the hassle.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous place to stay, our favorite hotel in Disney World.”
Reviews.Author: JMGReviews
Reviews.Content: This resort is super fun. My husband, son and I have now stayed there three times. We always got a room with a view of the savannah. In order to enjoy the hotel to its fullest, I would recommend such a room. The rooms themselves are fine, nothing super special. It was all about the view. We could see lots of animals without leaving the room. The pool is also great, one of the nicer ones in Disney. We also loved the lobby. Boma, one of the restaurants at the Animal Kingdom Lodge, is one of our favorite on Disney properties. I would highly recommend making reservations as they book up fast. The AKL is far from the Magic Kingdom, which is a drawback. But overall, I think the experience of being able to see giraffes, ostrich and zebras from your hotel room cannot be surpassed.

Reviews.Title: “Views of animals are main attraction”
Reviews.Author: 50StateTravelers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 7 nights at Animal Kingdom Lodge (Jambo House). The views of the animals from the lobby and from our balcony were amazing. We had an Arusha savannah view and it was great! We were on the 3rd floor and not far from the lobby. Our room location within the hotel was perfect. The room was on the small side but the bed was very comfortable. The main downside to this hotel is it's remoteness. After about 3 days, we wished we had rented a car. Food variety is a little limited with only a buffet, a cafe, and an expensive sit down restaurant. And the food is mostly African influenced. If we had had a car, we would have had more food choices. Additionally, we both caught colds and the selection of cold medicine was very limited in the hotel. They did have a pharmacy that delivered so that helped. Overall, we're very glad we stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge. We would recommend it to our friends with the caveat that the rooms are not deluxe resort quality but the views are.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip!”
Reviews.Author: stbarthsgrl
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort. We stayed in a savannah view room and I highly recommend it. That way you can see the animals roaming from your veranda. The pool was nice, the lodge is beautiful. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at AKL”
Reviews.Author: torun06
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Animal Kingdom Lodge (Jambo House) and I would recommend it to anyone looking for place that is both exciting and relaxing. First off, I would advise that you do opt for a savannah view room to maximize the enjoyment of your stay. We initially booked a pool view room. When we arrived, the room was on the ground floor, really close to the pool. There are activities going on at the pool throughout the day and we did hear some noise. Since we have a little one who naps in the afternoon, we requested a room change. The second time around the room was not only noisy, but also had a strong musty smell. Feeling kid of disappointed, I went down to the reception and requested yet another change. The staff member apologized and, after a talk with the management, upgraded us to a Arusha view room (these are supposed to have the best savannah view). The room smelled clean and was very comfortable and quiet. We finally felt truly "at home", just like we remember it from last year. We had a nice view of the animals throughout the day. The kids were excited about the bunk bed and kept themselves entertained climbing up and down. There are a few Disney channels on tv that play family appropriate shows. The rooms are quite small, but we found them adequate for our needs. If you are traveling with a small child you might want to know that there is a pack-n-play in every room that can be used. The toilet does have a strong flush, but I have to say that the doors are doing a good job at dampening noise, and we really didn't hear much noise from our neighbors next door. The room was very quiet at all times. The bathroom was ok. It's on the small size (toilet and tub/shower combo), like some reviewers mentioned, but that didn't bother us. The vanity area with two sinks opens up to the "corridor" right by the entrance and is a good size. We are a family on a budget, so we decided to splurge on this hotel instead of going to the parks, and opted for activities around the hotel and swimming in the pool at the lodge and the nearby Kidani village (great pool and splash zone that seemed less crowded than the pool at the AKL). For our young children this was enough excitement and helped us adults really relax and unwind. We did go to Downtown Disney one morning and had the kids play at the Lego store, ride the carousel and visit the Disney store for some shopping. There are numerous activities offered for kids and adults at the Lodge (Jambo House. We did the "bead" activities this year. At the end of each session, the participants receive beads that form a nice memento from the stay. I found the activities to be fun and educational, and the kids loved them. (One of them involved preparing treats for the animals and later watching the animals enjoy them - big hit with the kiddos). The hotel seems very busy, but we still had no problems with finding relaxing spots that offered a tranquil atmosphere. My favorite is the Sunset Lounge right off the lobby. We love the BOMA restaurant for breakfast and dinner (food is very good). I really think that it's one of the better buffets at Disney. The hosts and waiters are friendly and don't fail to deliver. We dined at the Fort Wilderness restaurant on the night of my daughter's birthday, and nobody ever acknowledged the fact despite me mentioning it several times to the staff at the time of reservation and at the restaurant itself. The following night at BOMA, I mentioned it briefly to the hostess as we were being seated. At the end of our meal, our server brought out a cupcake with a candle and we got to sing Happy Birthday for my daughter. It made our night. The MARA was just another quick serve place and after eating breakfast there, I would prefer BOMA over MARA every day. The price difference was not that significant compared to the quality of food at BOMA. Overall, our stay this year was another great experience. We were able to really relax and get away from our daily routine.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, likely wouldn't go back.”
Reviews.Author: nyc2some
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights starting Sept 14th. Echoing what other reviewers are saying, the grounds and atmosphere were very unique and exceptionally maintained. The rooms were clean and quiet. The Disney transportation was very good, and the distance of the ride to the parks or DTD weren't a problem as long as you allowed enough time, keeping in mind that you may have just missed the previous bus and would be waiting 15-20 minutes for the next. Dinner at Boma was fabulous. IMO the thing with Disney is that you are either exhausted when at the hotel or just not there enough to really enjoy it and justify the extra money. This was especially true with us and other families with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Always wonderful”
Reviews.Author: connied76
Reviews.Content: I love this resort! We staynhere every year and have stayed here at least 10 times. It is one of my favorite resorts in the world. I love the theming and the " feel" to theresort. It is awesome to be with all of the animals. The lobby is gorgeous. Service is top notch. Everything seems new and well kept. I love the pool here- big and open. All of the food options are wonderful - Jiko is my favorite WDW restaurant- it never disappoints. But buffets and even Mara- counter service- is greatbwith interesting choices and great seating. They added movies by the pool every night which we really enjoyed. While a bit remote, bus service at this resort is very good. Regular, timely and stops only within this resort. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: seriouslysunseeking
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, very clean and the staff are friendly and helpful restaurants are great too. Very child friendly even down to a film at the pool every night, its lovely in the water watching a film. Have stayed at other Disney Hotels, but this one is 5 star. Not overpriced for what you get. Next door to Animal Kingdom theme park, only five minuets away, although all theme parks are easy to get to, and the water parks. Either by the Disney buses included in price or by car. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Nina151169
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for part of a family trip to Orlando, we all absolutley loved it, the room we were initially given wasn't the best view but the desk soon sorted that out for us. We overlooked the main savannah and it was amazing to sit on the balcony and watch the animals day and night. Unbelievable experience and one none of us will ever forget! My kids still talk about it now years later. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Hoep to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, but let me recommend......”
Reviews.Author: StephV44
Reviews.Content: Everything was great with the hotel. The room was great, the grounds were clean, the restaurants were fantastic, which is what is expected according to Disney standards. My only advice is that if you have a little flexibility with your budget, rent a car. The buses were too many for one park and far too few for other parks. Some buses left empty while we waited 45 minutes for a bus to arrive for a different park. While transportation was below expectations, it was a great place to stay, which is why I gave it an excellent rating. I do recommend for people on a budget to stay at a moderate resort, because how much time do you really get to spend in your hotel and added amenities that would justify the additional cost?

Reviews.Title: “Wow. An amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonBry
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing family stay here. I was initially concerned about the distance from the main Disney sites, but the Disney transportation buses were amazing. Maybe we were lucky but we rarely had to wait for more than 5 minutes. The pool was great and there were plenty of pool side activities for the kids. We all like liked the evening marshmallow roasting over an open fire. Our hotel room was a fair walk down long corridors, but the view out of our hotel window was amazing with Zebras, Giraffes etc. The reception staff were very helpful even when we had managed to lose a pass key. They made no fuss and issued us with a new one straight away. A great stay and pleased we had booked here.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Price, Over-rated & over-hyped”
Reviews.Author: alturalakeland
Reviews.Content: One expects more from a deluxe resort, especially if it's a Disney one. Our Arusha-view room was extremely small and the oversized furniture didn't help any. One of our closet doors didn't work, the mattresses were squeaky, plus we heard the flushing toilets from neighboring rooms. This would be a $99 room anywhere else. Very dark ambience throughout the hotel. Food was mediocre at best, definitely caters to the fast-food crowd. No WiFi, only ethernet (cable) access at your room $10/day. Only plus was the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge - An African experience with the Magic of Disney”
Reviews.Author: MarkGradwell
Reviews.Content: For Families with young kids who wish to stay anywhere within Walt Disney World and are humming and haring about which resort to choose, look no more! This Resort is one of the newest, cleanest and best resorts within Disney World Florida and is the main hotel for the Animal Kingdom Theme Park (some 5 Min's around the corner by bus / coach). Granted, this hotel is one of the more expensive hotels, however, if you have the money I would go as far to say it will be worth every penny or cent that you pay extra. From the moment we pulled up we were impressed. The main lobby is breath taking as you walk through the main doors. Reception and Concierge are located on the left and you are welcomed almost immediately by a hotel representative. The main lobby is impressive and has an almost black glass style floor which is immaculate. The back entrance of the hotel is served by a huge glass feature which looks out onto a Savannah full of exotic African Animals. There are other viewing area's and platforms located throughout the hotel. We were lucky enough to be allocated a Savannah view room situated immediately next the the Public Sunset Savannah viewing area. The kids were absolutely blown away the moment they opened up the patio doors and were met by a beautiful Giraffe underneath our balcony. This was the moment I realised the extra money was worth paying for the hotel, although we did not pay extra for a Savannah view room lucky enough. In my opinion, Disney will do as much as they can to please and accommodate you so if your not happy with your room, simply ask to change. There are only a handful of rooms with restricted views of bushes and trees surrounding the pool. Some may not mind this as the amount of time you will spend in your room i guess will be minimal. Outside at the rear of the hotel is a campfire area where you can meet and greet some of the Animal handlers and wardens. You can venture around a small viewing walkway surrounded by wooden fence to separate you from the beautiful Animals such as Zebra, Pelicans, Gazelle etc on the Savannah. I would advise to wear mosquito repellent at night times. There are a number of activities put on for children and adults to get involved with like bongo drumming and learning more about the Animals etc. I must admit, we did not really take part too much. The lobby also has a comfortable seating area and a large TV which plays all of the Disney favourite cartoons day and night. There are 3 main hotel restaurants in Jambo house and another in the Kidani Village (Sister hotel adjacent to Jambo). The quick service snack style restaurant is the Maya. This will serve most of your needs and there is a shop and a soda drink fountain for unlimited refills. I would advise paying $14 for a resort mug, as you will be able to fill it up as often as you like, ideal for when your around the pool. The sit down buffet style restaurant is Boma. Not perfect for picky children as it has an African flavour to many dishes but the adults should give it a try. This is the perfect place for breakfast in my opinion though. The third restaurant is the more expensive of the two sit down table service restaurants, and is called Jika. This is worth a visit but a reservation is advisory particularly if you wish to eat later at night. There is a dress code but it is not too strict. Beautiful food and worth the money. There is a fantastic shop within the complex called The Marketplace. This has some basic essentials you might need, but to be honest, who wants to self cater when your in a place like this. The Marketplace is also a pick up point for all of your delivered shopping that you might have bought earlier the day before. Yep, Disney send any shopping you buy, straight to your resort hotel free of charge the next day. This is very handy, providing your not leaving the following day. The Marketplace sells wonderful artifacts and Disney related merchandise and in my opinion was only bettered by the Little Christmas shop in Magic Kingdom and the World of Disney mega store in Downtown. The Uzima pool is fantastic and has a slide for kids. It is served by 4 lifeguards at any one time and provide children's life jackets so Mum's / Mom's and Dad's can relax safe in the knowledge the kids can play in the water without dramas. There is activities during the day around the pool. My son particularly liked the musical statues game. If it rains, games move inside where the Wii comes out to entertain. The pool is open till very late and is flood lit. There is a pool bar also where cocktails and alcohol is available as you would expect, but for soft drinks I would just use the Mara. The Hotel is served by an excellent, complimentary bus / coach transport service which will take you to all of the other Disney World Theme and Water Parks. From these drop off points you are able to transfer to any other resort very easily and everywhere is clearly signed at these bus stops. The Animal Kingdom Lodge residents are restricted to the bus service only but this is not a problem as you will have to wait only a maximum of 20 Min's to get anywhere. Transfers to all of the theme parks, water parks and Disney Downtown are quick and comfortable although they can be crowded at times. The biggest test was after the Magic Kingdom fireworks show, when thousands leave the park at the same time. Where the queues for the Ferry boat and Monorail are lengthy and time consuming, the buses are frequent and we did not wait at all. We even had the benefit of having kind bus wardens on hand to give the kids presents whilst they waited whenever we had to wait at other parks. This helped to make the bus system a pleasant experience for us. The hotel also has a gym and outside jacuzzi. All in all this hotel is clean, comfortable and an absolutely brilliant experience. Whenever you are asked where your staying, and you reply with the Animal Kingdom lodge, people are always impressed. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to enhance the Magical Disney experience

Reviews.Title: “Best Theming at Disney”
Reviews.Author: Smoore1883
Reviews.Content: There's a giraffe outside the window....and you are still in the USA. What can possibly top that? It would be difficult to say anything bad about this resort. The food at Boma is AWESOME (Jambo House) and if you go over to Kidani Village (which is still in the Animal Kingdom resort) Sanaa may have the best food at Disney, and there really is no BAD food in Disney. The pool is a little crowded and the slide is kind of weak, but the theming is spectacular. The drive over to the parks is the only downside to this resort...but, seriously, the cool factor of all the animals you see here definitely makes the extra 10 minutes worthwhile. We wanted to stay here while our daughter is still small...and I am very glad we did. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! True report from a Travel Agent”
Reviews.Author: ukdwe2412
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just amazing , I've stayed in many hotels but this one really does have the wow factor , I have sent many clients here all to be amazed. I love waking up and seeing Giraffe's outside my room. The ambience in the hotel lobby , restraunts and public areas really give it a real feel of Africa in Orlando. If you want your trip of a lifetime to really be the holiday of your dreams choose this hotel. I would love to share my knowledge of this hotel and Walt Disney world [ -- ]

Reviews.Title: “Unique Disney Experience”
Reviews.Author: PBCGuy
Reviews.Content: Animal Kingdom Lodge has my favorite lobby of any Disney resort. While it's huge, it's not overly lit and is broken into multiple spaces... so it has an almost intimate feel. Which is great when you're looking out the multi-story window onto the "savannah" behind the lodge. Or walking across the bridge several stories up. I could hang out here all day. The service is top-notch, but the rooms are remarkably small for a luxury resort. (You'll get more space at Coronado Springs.) But if your room looks out onto the savannah, you won't mind. Strategically placed balconies - with comfortable rocking chairs - look out over the savannah. You can't guarantee animal sightings (AKL has it's own wildlife, separate from Animal Kingdom's.), but these balconies are a perfect spot to relax on a cool evening. On a previous trip, we went a little crazy and paid for an upgrade to "Concierge Level" - which gave us access to a special lounge overlooking the lobby and lots of little extras. If you can afford it, it's a wonderful splurge. Boma, the buffet-style restaurant is okay, but the place for a great meal here is Jiko. It's pricey, but the food is imaginative and delicious. One advantage of staying here: safaris (for an additional fee, of course) onto the lodge's savannah that aren't open to anyone but guests. Rooms are expensive, but you can get a taste of AKL without staying here. Just take Disney transportation from any park, wander through the lobby out to Arusha Rock, and enjoy the savannah view.

Reviews.Title: “Our Second Stay - more than lived up to our memories.”
Reviews.Author: Torsie24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at AKL in October 2009 for two weeks, and and new from the moment we left that we'd be back. So when we came to book the fist few nights of our wedding trip we were in no doubt where we were going to stay, and the Resort we'd recommend to our family and friends who were with us. We stayed for 5 nights in a DVC Studio villa, and had an amazing Arusha Savannah view on the 5th floor. We actually preferred the layout and amenities of the villa over the standard hotel rooms, and will choose to stay in a DVC room again, we also liked the high floor, allowing us a view of the entire savannah. We ate at Jiko with my parents one night, and it once again lived up to our fond memomries, the staff were amazing and the food delicious. My husband ate at Boma for dinner the night before our wedding (I had moved hotels to the Floridian by then) and they all raved about how great it was. If you;re going to Walt Disney World Animal Kingdom Lodge is the perfect Resort for luxury and relaxtion away from the parks. Our next trip will most likely be back at this Resort unless we can get a good offer on the Grand Floridian making it the same price as AKL.

Reviews.Title: “Twice...is super nice!!!”
Reviews.Author: tiggermyron
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at AKL Jambo House and we loved it...again! We were there for nine nights in a pool view room. During our first stay, we had a savannah view. In the future I would opt for savannah over pool. There is absolutely nothing like sitting out on the balcony with those amazing animals on your doorstep. That said, our pool view room was extremely convenient, located just footsteps from Mara as well as the amazing pool area. We simply made an extra effort to visit the various animal viewing areas. We participated in numerous resort activities including animal tracking and one where we actually made tasty treats for the animals of the savannah and then watched as they were set out and enjoyed! So incredible!! They've bumped up the pool activities and they were loads of fun :) The staff who are on exchange from countries throughout Africa are fascinating and wonderful. (Find Ben, from Jiko and a greeter at the hotel entrance - what a friendly, funny guy!) We loved everyone we met and learned so much about their homeland, the culture and the animals at the resort through them. We had an incredible evening at Jiko and a great meal at Boma. This is truly a resort experience that rivals a day in the park!

Reviews.Title: “Our first USA trip”
Reviews.Author: broadheathworcester
Reviews.Content: I had read some reviews before our holiday and arrived hoping fo the time of our lives. We were not disappointed the hotel was breathtaking and we were welcomed with genuine open arms. We had saved hard for this trip and went the extra mile by staying here, it was so worth it and would definitely stay here again. The amenities were outstanding and the setting stunning, All of the staff worked hard to make our stay smooth running, well they succeeded for sure, us Brits have a lot to learn from the States, customer care is natural to them they strived at all times to make you feel that nothing was too much trouble. The animals were amazing to see from many viewing spots around the hotel. The accommodation was comfortable and our special request to not have our standard room over looking the car park was met. The free transportation was well organised and saved us having to hire a car. Taxi services were available from outside the hotel. Food choices at AK were varied and met all budgets but would strongly recommend a booking at Jiko-amazing!!!!! The pool was well maned by 2 lifeguards till 10pm after the kids film each night. Unfortunately the poolside bar was closed by 9ish each night with quite a walk to the main hotel bar. Towels are provided by the pool each day with life jackets for a variety of kids ages. Finally the housekeeping was of very high standard. As you can probably tell we were totally taken by this hotel and cannot wait to revisit. Happy holidays to you all!!!

Reviews.Title: “An absolute joy”
Reviews.Author: sweetest12
Reviews.Content: If you are a Disney fan, or simply a lover of animals, this is one of the most amazing experiences you will ever have. Located in the middle of several "African plains" like areas, this is a hotel like no other in the US. I spent every free moment out on our balconey so I could look at the exotic animals wandering right outside my room, from giraffe to zebra and water buffalo I completely fell in love with this spectacular hotel. Filled with award winning restaurants, Disney's usual exceptionally friendly and helpful staff as well as the most convenient transportation system in the world, Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge is one of my greatest traveling experience. Try all the restaurants and absolutely DO NOT miss out on the safari offered right there on hotel grounds. Even though I'm in my 40s and my husband is in his 50s, we loved every single minute of the vacation we took here, great food, great staff, gorgeous room and exotic animals close enough to reach out and touch!! FANTASTIC!!!

Reviews.Title: “Granddaughter's 1st Disney trip”
Reviews.Author: SouthwestTravelerPa
Reviews.Content: Well-cared for property. Lots for visitors of all ages to do. Very friendly staff. Savanah rooms are great! Our 3-year old granddaughter just loved being able to watch the animals from the balcomy. Disney property farthest from Magic Kingdom, so plan appropriately: espeically if traveling w/ young children. This is a "deluxe" resort, & as such is not inexpensive. However, if it is afordable for you, it is certainly worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit - Still Amazing”
Reviews.Author: golittleperson
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at AKL, check in was without a problem and we had requested a standard view room - they had upgraded us to a savannah room so we walked the, what feels like a mile, to the room. It was a limited savannah room and the walk was horrid. We had stayed in a great view room before but decided that after the parks we are very tired, I get blisters on my feet and did not want that LOOOOOOng walk to our room every evening, every pool trip, snack etc. You get the point. We went back and requested our original non-savannah room. We were on the fourth floor with a view of the parking lot - that's ok as we mainly just took breaks. Three min. to the lobby! As to the resort, it is so beautiful and love to just walk around and look at the animals as well as the resort itself. Could sit in the lobby and see new things for hours. Met and talked to "Titus" one of the cast members around the main savannah and he was so sharpe. The rooms are a bit dark, but that is ok too. We did have a leaking sink, they came right away to fix it - but the fix only worked until it was turned on again. Never called back - couldn't hear it and it was just a slow small drip, still hated the water waste. One major thing I wish AKL would do - the area outside of the tub/toilet where the sinks are located would make a nice dressing area IF they would just hang a curtain. We have stayed at Caribbean Beach the last 2 visits and even the moderate had this. Left you dressing in this tiny shower room, and I steam up the shower, so getting dressed was muggy feeling. If your in company that you don't need privacy fine - but we did. Suspect next time we will try a different resort - we love it here but twice has me content.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing balcony view!!”
Reviews.Author: shiftdelete
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short and sweet. Animal kingdom lodge is the very best resort on Disney property. The views of the animals right outside your room are breathtaking. Very relaxing and a wonderful vacation spot. It's pricey but good if you want to splurge. However you can be a visitor at the resort and still see the animals and tour the property. Highly recommend you stay or at least visit this fantastic property.

Reviews.Title: “Kidani Village”
Reviews.Author: N7UNN
Reviews.Content: We loved the two bedroom villa with a savannah view. The rooms contain three bath rooms with a full kitchen. The balcony extended the full length of the two bedrooms and living looking down the animals roaming around. The room we stayed in seem a long way from the lobby. Only restaurant serves lunch and dinner, breakfast is served at the Jambo House a short walk away. The rooms have standard view and savannah view, access to the swimming pool and club house. We plan to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Michael E
Reviews.Content: I've traveled extensively for the past 15 years and stayed in hundreds of hotels of many levels of quality; therefore, I have a pretty good idea of what to expect when a hotel describes itself as deluxe. I can tell you this hotel is certainly not deluxe. I would classify this as an average budget quality room on par with a Hampton Inn. The decor is low budget and the beds are not comfortable. Factor in the $350/night rate and it turns into an over-priced hotel as well. Don't fall for the fact that the hotel is on an animal reserve or that it's a Disney property, there are several hotels within 5 miles of the park that ARE truly deluxe for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Classy with a capital C but not stuffy!!!”
Reviews.Author: mecheman
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned on 9/5/11 from the AKL. From the Magical Express to our arrival at AKL, the service was impeccable. When we got off the bus we were greeted by a bell hop who took our bags and then another gentleman waving hello with a big mouse hand. He made friendly conversation with us as he escort us to the check in counter where he introduced us to the cast member who would check us in. Check in was fast and effiecent. We had two connecting standard view rooms (my 4 kids stayed in one room, my husband and I in the other) but woke up to see the giraffes and other animals every morning. I don't think it is worth paying the extra money for a savannah view because there are several viewing areas throughout the hotel, plus like I mentioned above, I saw them from my standard view room. The lobby is stunning with gorgeous mahongy floors you could eat off of. They also had a large TV in the lobby that all the kids in the hotel would gather around to see classic Disney cartoons. We ate at Boma's and Mara's and were satisfied with both. I really appreciate that Boma took us two hours ahead of our reservation. We could only get a 8:05pm reservation online but arrived around 6pm famished from spending all day at the Animal Kingdom. They took us right away. Nice!! The pool was lovely and I really liked the fitness center's steam room. They provide fresh towels at both areas which was great. The only downside is the resort's distance from the Magic Kingdom which can take up to 25 minutes to get to depending on traffic. But the water parks, Hollywood Studios and the Animal Kingdom are 10 minutes away tops. But I would stay here again in a heart beat because waking up to giraffes is an exotic experience that you don't typically get at home. Lastly, I loved the airline check-in that is set up in the lobby. Give them your bags and pick them up at your destination. What a convenience!!! I think it was only for domestic flights though. AKL is a 5-star hotel without the snobbery.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort plus some Disney tips”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBob2009
Reviews.Content: We have stayed 2 times at the Animal Kingdom Lodge (AKL) (once in a regular room and this last time in a Disney Vacation Club or DVC room in Jambo House). The last time was just this July 2011 and what a great stay. It is a wonderful hotel with a cool theme. The grand lobby, halls, restaurants and rooms have a great African detailed theme design. It is so exciting to wake up in the morning and pull back the drapes to see some wild animals hanging out in front of your balcony. I think this would be fun for all ages--I know us adults loved it. We have had great luck paying for just a "standard view" but being placed on the edge of the savanna to see the animals as they go to hang out under trees or to be feed by the cast members. If you want a quiet room, I would suggest not taking a "pool" view as the pool is very nice and is also very lively. I think the rooms are well appointed. The bathroom is small and a little dark with only one light source but not a problem. With a DVC room we had a small "kitchenette" area which was very nice to store snacks and cold drinks. Here are some general tips to make your Disney trip the best it can be: 1. Get up early and get to the parks. You can do so much in the first hour before other guests arrive. 2. Use the Fast Pass system. As soon as your first Fast Pass time starts make sure to send someone in the group to get another one. 3. Before you go plan your days in advance (which parks on which days) and make reservations in advance for sit down meals at each resort. This can save you a lot of time and give you a nice break. People get crabby when they get hungry. 4. Take a break in the middle of the day. If you are hopping then go to a different park at night. You will get more out of the park early in the day and late at night. 5. Book a character meal (like Tusker House @ AK or Crystal Palace @ MK) you'll get a great meal plus wonderful photo memories with up close interactions with the characters. I have seen many kids and adults light up when we go to these places and then again when they share the stories with family and friends after getting home.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: debbie g
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 2 week Stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge Jambo House, Hotel was amazing, rooms were ok, Disney dinning plan was amazing value for money. This hotel was breathtaking and the cast memebers were so helpful. My kids 14, 7, 5 loved the pool, i loved the fact that all the towels were there for you so you could use as many as you needed throughout the day and at the end of the day you just dumpbed them in the towel return bucket. would reccomend this hotel as my family loved it and we are now planning our next visit for 2012.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience for our whole family!”
Reviews.Author: nancydiane
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort with friendly staff. this place exudes warmth and relaxation. Loved waking up to giraffes and other animals outside our balcony. Definately worth paying for a Savannah room. Dinner at Boma was fantastic and the kids went to Simba's Cubhouse that night and begged to go back for the rest of the trip. Bus service was generally good, although would suggest extra Magic Kingdom buses.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: ColieK
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 days at the AKL. We loved it. It was our oasis away from the crowds of the park. Really surprised by the fun pool actviities and developed a love affair with African food. Our room was small, but worked for sleeping and afternoon naps. The decor was fun and the bathroom nice, if small. The beds were fine, but the sheets were a little scratchy for a "deluxe" hotel. Would like to see upgraded bedding. The common areas and safari were great diversions. We were in a pool room view which was great. Only drawback was that we went back to our room to nap in the afternoon, which coincided with the daily pool party - translate thumping bass and screams of joy from lots of kids. We just ended up participating and forgoing the naps. We could walk down to the viewing areas to look at animals and didn't feel like we missed out on the safari by not having a safari view room. We honestly loved it enough, that we would stay at this resort even if it wasn't at WDW.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome”
Reviews.Author: hey_you69
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and friendly, The restaurants are great. We had a savanna view and saw a lots of animals close to our room everyday! I love the fact that the pool is open 24 hr.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Seenus
Reviews.Content: Was really looking forward to staying here but was disappointed from the start. Check in time took way too long. Spent 45 minutes to get checked in. My room was small and dark. Had a small balcony with only a window sized opening that faced the parking lot. The open grounds were quite barren of any wildlife. Saw an occasional zebra and a few birds but was expecting much more. The shuttles were timely but if you are going o Magic Kingdom it is a minimum of twenty minutes each way. Overall average service. I wish I'd stayed somewhere closer and more affordable.

Reviews.Title: “What a view”
Reviews.Author: UCFGrads
Reviews.Content: I live in Orlando so I generally steer clear of the resort area but spending a weekend at the AK Lodge reminds me why so many people visit. The lodge itself is spectacular. The decorations, the layout...they really did their homework. By far, the best feature is the savanna view room. Being able to see giraffes, zebras, gazelles, ostriches, and about 20 other native African animals from the comfort of your balcony is amazing. It's not cheap but it's absolutely worth it. Our room had a bit of a musty smell but it wasn't enough to call the front desk. The pool areas are great. We stayed in the Jambo Villange but the Kidani Village pool is more kid-friendly.
