The staff is top-notch and the animals are always in view. We had the breakfast buffet at Boma one morning and it was underwhelming. I'd go to Mara instead - cheaper, no wait and great selections.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lmj108
Reviews.Content: Walked in to the lobby and it brought a lump to my throat, breathtaking! Superb staff, facilities, food, etc. Room was very spacious and clean and had coffee making facilities and fridge. Easy transportation to the parks and free! Only negative was staff were unhelpful if you wanted information on anything non disney but apparently they are instructed to not give information! Fantastic holiday, Cant wait to go back. Can highly recommend the personal photography session with the disney photopass photographer at the hotel> Incredibly reasonable and brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Hamisheney
Reviews.Content: Just a quick review, just back from staying for 2 wks @ Jambo House, first impressions, wow! Fantastic friendly staff all over, room was excellent, a little bit of a walk from the center but walking's good for you, Room- Excellent 2 super comfy doubles (2 adult's & 1 x 11 yr old), view was fabo, untold amounts of animals having breekkie every morning. Pool-Very good, swam early every day & had the pool to ourselves. Mara-a bit monotonous, but we had a car second week, so we ate out off disney & found tons of excellent restaurants via tripadvisor. Overall, we would go back again, 1 week though & mix it up. 5 stars ...

Reviews.Title: “Can't imagine staying anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Chele834
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 11 day stay at AKL and we had the most wonderful experience! We originally booked a pool view room and were very fortunate to be upgraded upon arrival to a savanna view. Then we had to extend our stay due to a canceled flight by our airlines and were again placed in an even better savanna view room. The staff of the AKL were exceptional in helping us with the many changes and additions we needed to make to our travel plans based on our flight cancellation and the hurricane in our hometown. Waking up each day to giraffes, zebras, ostriches, and other animals is difficult to describe. It was a very beautiful and surreal experience that gave our entire family a true appreciation for the animals. We were so close to the giraffes and zebras at times that it felt as if we could reach out and touch them. The Disney parks are amazing but hectic and coming home each night to the animals outside our window gave us a sense of peace that carried us through our trip. In addition to the animals the lobby is spectacular, the pool is large and beautiful and the various restaurants at both Jambo house and kidani village were exceptional. We loved the music and the scents coming from the kitchen and the fire pits. This hotel is a delight to all of your senses. When we first arrived we were greeted by all staff saying "welcome home" and we surely felt at home for every moment of our stay!!

Reviews.Title: “What an Amazing Property - love waking up to zebras and giraffes”
Reviews.Author: MargieBar
Reviews.Content: We were so happy that we chose this resort! Waking up to wild animals passing your window is something to experience. I would suggest having room service for every breakfast just to sit out on the balcony to watch the parade of giraffes, zebras, peacocks, wildebeasts, antelopes ..... The restaurants were great too - especailly the one at the Resort Club. Bus transportation is easy to get to the parks .... Some rooms are quite a walk from the loby BUT this allows you to get just a bit more exercise! Don't miss this fun property

Reviews.Title: “Out of the ordinary”
Reviews.Author: kandzhawk
Reviews.Content: On a 15 day vacation, and first time visit, we divided our choice of hotel into 3 seperate locations to maximize the experience. (seperate reviews for each, 2 on property, one off with a rental car.) This was week one. Note: We spent a full "rest day" at each resort hotel resort in between 2-day park visits. We also had family members join up with us (could only come for the last week) On property definately the better option in saving the parking, gas and transportaion(rental) fees. However, the off property condo (3 bdrm, 4 bath) was a HUGE savings as the group grew and we needed all the extra space. (Disney properties arn't equiped for parties of 5 or larger, except for 3 specific resorts and the price is not worth what you get.) Okay, the AK lodge. Gift shop, transportation reception all good, all fast, all friendly and efficient. The interior is stunning, so well done, comforting and amazing at the same time. The Savanna and outdoor view of animals charming. The music and drums playing all the time was great, and then really annoying, and then we got used to it. Pleased that you can't hear it in the room unless you open the balcony door. We had a Savanna view and opened the door...alot. About the view, look, we came from the West coast and to us it was worth the upgrade. Other reviews complained about the expectations of seeing the animals not being met. Sometimes the animals were there, sometimes not, to us... no big deal, we knew we would catch them another time, and we did) The food is delicious and we ate at every place they have; bar, buffet, cafe, fine dining, concierge lounge, but be prepared for unique flavors. Warning! If you or your children are not into heavily spiced food (not necessarily hot, just a LOT of different and unusual spices), do not stay here, you will not be happy with the food. Instead, stay where the food fits you and come over for a visit, you can resort hop on the free transportation and experience everything the AK has to offer (excluding the rooms) and sample some of the adventureous food, no kidding, there is little else. My son is 10, into all kinds of exotic food, prefers gourmet, but grew tired of the flavors offered after day 2, and did not care at all for the "kid food" very bland and average (and pricey by my standards)... he was however always pleased with the free apps offered upstairs (concierge) so he went there. The rooms are small, yes small, every site I read warned me of that so I was not surprised. They are well themed though and we stayed in the concierge upgrade so we spent most of our "hotel time" in the upper level lounge, and the regular ammenities; pool and restaurants. Note; we did not stay on the concierge level ($$$) but instead stayed on a lower level and paid the concierge "upgrade"($) worth every penny to us as there was free offerings all the time, (breakfast/snacks/appetizers/desserts) including beverages to-go and my favorite...drum roll please... unlimited cappuccino (all day) and evening wine! There are a TON of kids/family activities here, the list changes but includes safari, stories, hide n seek, movies, games, bird watching, art, etc.. a ton more. You get a list of what is available when you check in. Some you sign up for some you just show up for. The Lodge is close to the Animal Kingdom Park and that's it, so prepare accordingly if you are going elsewhere, (not recommended) there will be a stop to the transfer station and extended travel time! Overall I recommend this hotel for it's uniqueness (design, food, merchandise, savanna) and service. Rooms always cleaned, chocolates on pillows, towel animals and delicious food. I do recommend a stay here at least once, it is worth it for 2 nights, 3 days (tops) and visit the AK park, the two are well themed and tied in together so well you'll feel as though you were far far away. I will not stay here again, but will visit it. I sampled many on property resorts and prefered the Wilderness lodge, the Port Orleans and the Grand Floridian and will definately stay at one of these when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Best one in Disney”
Reviews.Author: crimecrackers
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Disney and the hotel is fantastic, the best hotel on the whole of the Disney complex forget the others this hotel is remarkable and is worth paying the extra we don't stay anywere else. We had two interconnecting rooms on the first floor which has great access for the lobby and eating establishments on offer. Boma resturant is a nice place to dine for breakfast/evening dinner but the food is the same and you need to use your 'Disney Dinner Plan' and plan your meals on line before you go as you won't get in at peak periods otherwise. The AKL is beautiful decorated and stunning pictures to be taken, as well as the animals which are second to none. The rooms are clean, the cleaners come in every day and you feel as though Tinkerbell has been in don't forget to leave them a tip well worth it and they do the towels in animal faces such fun for the kids. The staff can't do enought for you and our thanks to a wonderful lady called Nichol who went out of her way to accommodate us and make us have a happy stay. There is a store on site which sells all the basic lines as well as Disney goods at very high prices. Take a taxi or a car drive to the 'Premier Outlet Centre' for the cheaper prices you will have a fun there goods are discounted ones at knock down prices and there is a 'Disney outlet store' on site. The parks were busy but the best time to go is middle of August as the school's go back over there and they are not as manic, a vist to Bush Gardens/ Sea World is a must along with the Kennedy Space Centre but don't forget the bug spray they are out in droves and like us Britts.....This is a Magical Place to stay and by the pool you have the Mara which serves all day breakfast / lunch/tea and the meals are fine along with the sweets, don;t forget if you have kids to get a cup which you can refill at the Hotel as many times as you want not only with juice but with tea/coffee/hot choc so worth the £12.99 each and saves you some monies. There is a laundry facility on site no need to bring it all back with you very cheap $2 a wash and $2 a dryer your soap is a $1 make use of this as it is a gawd send. No need to take towels all provided in the hotel and by the pool the pool is not big but adequate. We found in the August season is is wet and hurricane season so beware Hurricane Irene passed us by this time. If you have tried the other Disney Hotels now try the best one a simply wonderful building and they greet you with ''Welcome Home' everytime you will have every wish you ever dreamed off here and good food to add, but do try Epcot for further dinner venues as it has very taste of the world foods at hand, these are proper eating establishments so remember the' Disney Dinner Plan' you won't go hungry and some tour operators give it free in August. Enjoy your magical stay at this hotel and you won't want to stay anywere else believe me. The negatives only one grumpy reception women called 'Maureen' but you always get one anywere you stay maybe they will move her on ...... we live in hope and anticipation!!! This will be our last stay at AKL as our children have now outgrown the magic and want to go to pastures new, we feel that we have explored this part of the USA fully, teenagers want new places to see !!! but lets not say never again as who knows when we have the AKL calling again. Any questions please let me know I am very happy to help . X

Reviews.Title: “We loved Animal Kingdom Lodge Jambo House & would definitely go back again”
Reviews.Author: Pererasharon
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay & loved the savanah view. The room was really clean & spacious. We really enjoyed our meal at Jiko. The pool was great but did not spend too much time at the resort as we were out most of the day visiting the partks. We were definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: klvb1162
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip with friends to Disney we stayed at Animal Kingdom. When we arrived for an early check in our room was ready. However, we got a room with a queen bed and bunk beds. When reservation was made it was for two queens (I thought there was a day bed also, my misunderstanding). We were able to get a room change with no issue. The staff was great in making this change. The hotel and grounds are beautiful. Based on what animals I saw I am glad we did not pay for a savannah view. We only saw animals a couple times in the eight days we were there. I must say the rooms are very small(the rooms in POFQ and bigger and other mid priced) and the first room that had bunk beds had only two drawers (for three people, 2 adults and a teenager) the second room had a four chest dresser and the other two drawers. The buses ran wonder never had any issues. One this to keep in mind allow extra time this resort is far from all parks (except Animal Kingdon). Very clean, Mara (counter svc food) wonderful (yea zebra domes!) gift dhop/store great, Boma (breakfast there, breakfast is breakfast how many spins can you put on this food)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: jbg2
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms at Jambo with partial savanna views. We were able to see giraffes, zebra, wilde beast, and ostrich. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and loved the theming of the resort. The rooms were spacious enough, though not quite as big as most other Disney deluxe resorts. The resort offers many complimentary activities for children and adults. There were many chaise lounges at the pool so we didn't feel that we needed to get up early to stake out a spot. Also, there was also shady areas at the pool too. We drove to the parks so can't comment on Disney transportation. We found most of the staff at the lodge to be excellent. Special mention to Annette and Vanessa at bell services who really made our stay that much more special. We have stayed at most Disney resorts and this was our first time at AKL. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Missing the zebras already - wonderful animals, comfortable room...”
Reviews.Author: MegletMoogler
Reviews.Content: Just come back to reality, with a bump, from a 3 week Disney-fest. Staying at AKL's Jambo House proved to be ideal for us, but I feel having read previous reviews, before we went, that we we lucky in terms of the situation of our room. I expected, as we hadn't paid the extra for a savannah or pool view, we would be overlooking the car park or similar, but we were delighted to arrive in the room (following a walk along a very long corridor!) and find a number of zebras grazing in the savannah outside - phew! Possibly the length of our stay acted in our favour... Waking up every morning to the giraffes, ostriches, zebras, wildebeasts, etc was wonderful - the zebras unique way of communicating through kicking, biting and 'barking' at each other provided no end of entertainment! Hotel was lovely - pool really good, in a beautiful setting, with life-guards supervision and the availability of children's flotation jackets adding to our ability to relax a little more. Food was pretty good too, though we saved an absolute load of money by having the Disney Dining Plan - one table service meal, one 'quick service' meal and one snack a day was perfect for each of us and as it was included in the price of our holiday, even better. If we'd had to pay for the same sort of daily dining ourselves, we reckon it would've added around $3,500 dollars to the cost of the trip. The ability to be able to experience food in a variety of places around the parks was brilliant, especially in World Showcase at Epcot and being able to have an enormous double scoop of Edy's fantastic ice cream, as a snack was fantastic!! The bus service between the hotel and parks was generally good, but there were days when you would wait over half an hour for the bus to your destination, while 3 buses would come to each of the other stops. Busy buses were common at times, which were a challenge and the situation felt a bit 'dog eat dog' at times, in terms of getting a seat. Seeing 'gentlemen' remaining on their seat, while mums struggled to stand, with one or two tired children, was annoying to say the least. However, despite that sour note, it was excellent and we can't wait to return - time to start saving the pennies, again; waking up to couple of sparrows and the neighbours cat, this morning, just wasn't the same...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: iluvpits
Reviews.Content: Took my 10 year old nephew for his birthday present and my birthday present. We could not have asked for a better vacation! We arrived at 10:00 AM and the front desk agent was quick to notice that it was a double birthday celebration for us to which she phoned her manager and upgraded us from the standard room which we booked to the Sunset Savannah room at no charge!!!!! We were also allowed to check in early instead of 3:00 PM which was an added plus!!! The room was beautiful and the view was incredible! The staff went out of their way to make this a dream vacation not only at the resort, but every park we went to! I cannot say enough about this resort and will I stay here again -- you bet!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it- Except the quick serve food”
Reviews.Author: PinkL0ver
Reviews.Content: We booked a trip here for the beginning of August to only stay 2 nights before the beach. We absolutly loved it! We had booked a room without a view of animals however to our suprise we walked into our room and there were 5 giraffes standing right outside our balcony. Guessing this was an accident however we were defintly excited to get this upgrade. The room worked fine and I liked how the sinks are seperate from the shower and toilet. However, the shower head was really bad and had no pressure at all making it diffcult to wash long hair. However, the quick serve (forgot the name) has terrible food. I have never seen eggs that are more runny than the eggs for breakfast here. The mickey waffle was cold and the orange juice tasted spoiled. When we ate dinner here hoping for a better experience we sadly didnt get one. We counted the chicken on the chicken pizza and it had only 3 tiny pieces on it. Very disappointed since Disney food is defintly not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic cant wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Lesley H
Reviews.Content: This is the second time i`ve stayed at this hotel, first time for the rest of the family absolutely brilliant, staff very helpful and always very cheerful the rooms that over look the savannah are really special my granddaughter loved hers [she was 4yrs old first trip to Disney and her first flight].

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and get a savanna view with concierge/club. Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: melissastx
Reviews.Content: Just stayed a week and loved it. Don't know what others are talking about with the club lvl not being worth it. We were in Jambo lodge on the 4th floor, two buildings over from the 'main lodge.' it was not a huge walk to go to the 6th floor for treats. They varied and were served 4 times throughout the day. We ate all our breakfasts there. Coffee, juices, bagel, baked goods, fruits, apps from the restaurants and beer and wine in afternoon. A nice respite. To look out on our balcony and see animals was fabulous. Pay the extra for the sunset safari and dinner at Jiko. It is served tasting menu style with wine pairings. Really the dinner was geared toward adults, and couldn't believe how close to the animals we got on the safari. Much better than the safari ride at the park!!The perks of staying at Disney allow extra park magic hours, early it late, depending. We stayed at the kingdom until 2:30 a.m. Sunday! Only downside was housekeeping service. They were friendly but inconsistent. Someone needs to tighten it up. Turndown service was spotty, and twice room didn't get cleaned until after 3, and we were gone all day. Plus they were frugal on the bath products. I'd rather have extra shampoo than a crab made from towels.. Or how 'bout both!

Reviews.Title: “Let the safari begin!”
Reviews.Author: Rustycnrh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. The decor was out of this world. The staff was very friendly and very attentive toward our needs. The room we had had a view of zebras, giraffes, and other african animals. Our children were mesmerized the moment we stepped into the lobby. This is the place for your first, Disney visit with the family, you can not go wrong by staying at this hotel. The rooms are setup for both adults and children needs, as well. It is definitely worth the little extra cash to enjoy this place. They have three restaurants to accomidate your tight budget. There is a game arcade for the older children to keep them entertained, as well. Nice large pool and no wanting for towels. Entertainment ppol side for the children as well as, the adults. This place has their act together. They have bus service to all the theme parks and downtown Dinsey. So, you drop off your car in the parking lot and never need it again.. until you leave. The smiles on our children faces and the "ahh" looks was well worth the extra cash. As Disney states it, Where dreams come true" for the whole family.

Reviews.Title: “Public Spaces Roar! Guest Rooms Wimper.”
Reviews.Author: Mattsaab
Reviews.Content: Somewhere along the way Disney decided to put all their attention to deatil, quality and comfort into the lobby, restaurants and pool areas of their signature hotels -- and no where is this more obvious than Animal Kingdom Lodge. This truly unique hotel is one of stunning design and amazing animal savanah views that are magical. But, the rooms are standard, three star accommodations with terrible mattresses, uncomfortable furniture and disappointing, tiny dark bathrooms. The beddding is overly crisp, low end and the pillows hard and unwelcoming. It's not that the rooms don't look nice, it's that they aren't comfortable and feel on the cheap. If you do plan to stay here, make sure you get a savanah view of the animals--and be patient, they roam at their own will and pace. If you can't get, or can't afford a view of the animals -- stay someplace else! There are better choices on property closer to the action. So, should you stay here? If you love animals, embrace the African theme and want a hotel room with a view you can't get anyplace else in the US, then this might be the place for you. But if you want a plush room with a bed and bathroom that is better than your home, this might not be the best choice. A tough call.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Lisa C
Reviews.Content: What a truly wonderful hotel. Just got back today with our 2 children, 10 and 12 years and would return tomorrow if possible!. An unforgetable experience sitting on our Savannah room balcony watching Zebra, Giraffe, Wildebeast, Tommies etc roaming around free, was awesome, especially during spectacular storms!. Beautiful clean and comfortable rooms, with a fabulous daily maid service who left us little suprises for the children to discover on their return!! Hot showers, great air con and comfy beds. Pool was amazing for the children and open ALL night!. Super daily activities including toasting marshmallows and a 9pm Disney film, which the kids watched from the POOL!

Reviews.Title: “The wonders of Easter”
Reviews.Author: Nanayoung
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom 3 Bath room with full kitchen and washer/dryer. Wow We enjoyed all the Easter activities. My Grandaughter felt like a true Princess. The look on her face during all the activities was contagious to all of us. We had a small problem with the fridge but it was handled quickly. And we were compensated for our lost food generously. Thank-you Animal Kingdom Lodge we can't wait to come back and stay. We all enjoyed seeing animals from our balcony. It doesn't get any better than this!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KeKeinNC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in Aug 2011. We were in the Jambo House there is two parts to this Lodge. You have access to both lodges, for dining, touring, swimming, spa, fitness etc. They will shuttle you back & forth if you prefer one pool better. Our room was very clean, the bathroom was very clean. We had two sinks which was very nice for getting 4 people ready each morning. The staff was amazing, friendly, helpful and I loved them!! If we even looked lost or confused someone was there to ask us if we needed help, we that was actually all Disney employees rather our resort, another resort or any of the theme parks. The smells in our lobby when you walked through was just awesome amazing coming from Boma Restaurant. There is 3 places to choose from at Jambo house to eat at. The Boma was off the chain good, we ate there twice. There is a very well stocked store in the lobby if you forgot anything. Oh did I mention our view? We overlooked the Safari and I had coffee each morning w/the animals. You can't get that anywhere else!! This hotel was very pricy but for what you get it was well worth it. You will ride the Disney buses longer since AKL is the farthest away from the parks, the longest we ever rode was 20 mins. Just make sure when you are getting off the bus you know which lodge you are at, Jambo or Kadanni Village, if you aren't paying attention you could get off at the wrong one, but don't worry they will get you to the right one quickly. I can't say enough great things about AKL, it was well worth the money, the extra time on the bus, the experience, the everything. You have to stay here at least once to understand!!!! Glad we did!!!! This lodge made our Disney experience even more magical! PS our room was very quiet at night for a great night's sleep

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Danielle C
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa in Jambo House with the view of the animals. Beautiful room the view was amazing. The hotel was beautiful the bar lounge was great. The pool was really nice. Will def stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Trip”
Reviews.Author: Wicksy831
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, fantastic polite and friendly service/staff with amazing restaurants. Pool a welcome relief at the end of the day but very noisy with childrens all afternoon activity club (everyday) via microphone - impossible to read a book and relax. Made to feel very welcome and Savannah rooms well worth the cost - loads of animals to see. Buses to the parks very regular. Only slight complaint would be a poor buffet breakfast by poolside - food was always cold by the time you got to the table. Know how to operate the Disney Dining Plan before you go! Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “No more Animal Kingdom Lodge for Me”
Reviews.Author: michel f
Reviews.Content: During our stay we were disappointed with the service at the front desk and concierge. We spent more than two hours trying to check in, and the concierge was really confused, and made mistakes. Besides, on this our third experience at the hotel, we found, that all the concierges were not really too interested in helping or being friendly. Bus system Really SUCK for the Hotel..... Too long waiting time, possible due to new hotel area for time sharing resort that share the same buses. The services beside the front desk and concierge are magnificent and is a great experience to stay at at Walt Disney Hotel I guee, it will be my last time at the Animal Kingdom lodge.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Holiday Ever!”
Reviews.Author: princessalicia
Reviews.Content: We have not long returned from our best holiday ever, visiting Orlando and staying for 21 nights at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. We had booked a standard room but were upgraded to a savannah view room at check-in. Our room was at the end of the Kudu trail and was one of the furthest away from the reception area. This wasnt really a problem, unless you forgot something and had to return to the room for it! The room was great for our families needs, very clean and tidy, two large comfortable (if a little squeaky) beds and we never tired of the ever changing view from the balcony. All staff we spoke to were helpful, polite and efficient. The pool was great after a long day at the parks, the kids especially liked the film at the pool every night at 9pm. Lots of activities laid of for them during the day too but these were never a nuisance (ie loud and brash) for the adults. The food at the Mara was very good, quite a lot of choice but it did get very busy on occasions although the staff were very efficient and queues were kept to a minimum. We didnt eat at Jiko but had breakfast at Boma. Whilst this was enjoyable I think it was a bit over-rated especially when you took into account the price! Over $100 for a family of four! The zawadi marketplace was very well stocked if a little expensive but was handy for the odd pint of milk or bread that was needed. On the whole, the disney transport was very efficient, we preferred being further away from the parks as it felt very quiet and tranquil around the resort compared to the madness of the parks. Rarely did we have to stand on the buses, only once or twice after staying in the parks for evening extra magic hours. We had a slight problem on our second morning with the toilet leaking (clean water) but maintenance came immediately and fixed the issue straight away. The room was always cleaned to a high standard and special thanks to 'Mabel' our lovely mousekeeping lady who was very friendly and always made a fuss of the kids. Would highly recommend this hotel and would love to return some day, Im not sure how other hotels can top this one, it really is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Education disguised as fun”
Reviews.Author: UNCWAshley
Reviews.Content: As Disney Vacation Club members, We stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge savannah view room. It was so peaceful to wake up and sit on our deck, while sipping coffee and watching the animals interact. In your room, there is a poster (cheat sheet) to help you identify the various types of animals that live there. Be sure to check out the night viewing. You can use night vision goggles and ask questions of the trained Disney Cast Members. The Cast Members are native Africans and are so interesting to talk with and learn from. If you are a Vacation Club Member, try out both infinity pools including Kadani Village, which has a really cool water play area.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge - a most beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoMac1
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge for four nights in August, 2011. We booked a standard view room but managed to secure a partial savanna view upon check-in for no additional cost. This proved to be a great "plus" to our trip as we were able to view countless girrafes, zebra, antelope and other animals throughout our stay. I'd recommend getting a savanna view room, but if you don't there are still several public viewing areas to see the animals. The hotel itself is absolutely stunning. We stayed at Wilderness Lodge last December and loved it. However, we felt that AKL was even more spectacular. AKL has a more luxurious feel, both in the lobby, common areas and rooms. We ate dinner at Boma twice and would rate it as one of the best restaurants we have ever experienced (despite being considered a buffet). We also ate at the quick service restaruant called The Mara several times and liked it as well. The hotel pool is great - we especially liked the zero depth entry as we have two young swimmers. Our kids really enjoyed the pool party, with various games, hula hoop contest, dance contest, etc. We also did the bonfire activity where the kids roasted marshmallows. This is a hotel where you will want to spend a day or two just hanging out and soaking up the atmosphere and taking advantage of the activities. We look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for adults and kids!”
Reviews.Author: AAA-Deltachic
Reviews.Content: I love this resort because it is Disney without being so kiddy. Boma is such a great place to eat. The rooms are great and very clean. If you don't want a hike either go up to an Arusha view room or save on a standard view, both are close to the lobby. Staff are extremely helpful and go out of their way to make sure the kids are having a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “If this is one of the best Disney resorts . . . .”
Reviews.Author: MBasedow
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 days at AK, two in Jambo House, five in Kidani Village. We were two adult friends with two 9 year old kids. This resort is crushingly expensive, and so little in return. The room in Jambo House was very small and poorly designed. There was barely any room to move, let alone stow luggage or unpack clothes. We were all fit and healthy, but felt like we were walking miles in that hotel to get anywhere - assuming we could even find our way through the dark, poorly designed lobby and restaurant areas. Desk staff was appalling - honestly, we've been better treated in a Motel 6. The noise, the yammer - and, yes, a few animals outside. Is that what we are paying for? The animals? We moved from Jambo to Kidani Village after a few days because we were so miserable. The desk staff and concierge at Kidani Village were much better at the customer service aspect, perhaps because the Disney Vacation Club folk go there, and they have more of a voice than the odd tourist at Jambo. As others have commented, AK is far from everything, and shuttle bus service to the parks very uneven. We waited an entire hour on a weekday morning for the Epcot bus, for example, but rarely more than 20-30 minutes otherwise. Our Magic Express shuttle to the airport never arrived (staff just watched us sit there waiting . . .after we had gotten up at 5 a.m. (our flight was at 10:30) just to catch it. OK, yeah, this kind of thing can happen anywhere - but at these prices? Nowhere but Disney. Pool at Jambo was pretty - but shallow and so crowded one could barely move. The pool at Kidani was only a little larger than a motel pool, but had a better water slide. There was no easy access to it - would it have killed the designers to make the pool accessible from the building? You had to walk (a long hot walk) outdoors from the lobby or negotiate a labyrinth parking garage level (sneaking in behind the poolside bar), and this, quite frankly, is ridiculous. Vacation should not be so much hard work, particularly at the end of the day after all that theme-parking. As for the restaurants, Jiko was very, very good, and surprisingly reasonable considering the quality of the food, service and wine, all of which were among the best we'd every had, anywhere. Boma was an overpriced buffet nightmare. Do not get sucked into the breakfast there. Room service breakfast is cheaper than a Boma buffet. Sanaa in Kidani Village was good too - but very small portions, high prices. Mara, the counter service place in Jambo House, was a filthy nightmare with horrific service. Poorly organized and nasty! The lowpoint of our entire vacation was Mara. Room service itself was very efficient and, especially in Kidani, offered a wide and interesting selection of food. There were also tragically overpriced little stores with $3 bananas and such in the lobbies, far, far away. Know that if you go there, you will be disappointed. You will also be woken up by screaming babies and toddlers (walls are very, very thin in Kidani in particular). Do not save up for years for a trip to the AK resort - it's painful when you realize how little it was worth it. You will not be out there much looking at the animals,who come and go, but are mostly far away. If you are paying these kinds of prices, you will want a comfortable room, easy access to the theme parks, service when you need it, and a place to relax. You won't reliably find any of this at AK. Any of the mid-range Disney places are at least as good, and often better.

Reviews.Title: “Lookin forward to Disney Hawaii next year”
Reviews.Author: ritchiefamily_11
Reviews.Content: If animal kingdom is anything to go by, I can't wait until next year, when we sample the delights of aluani in Hawaii, we are dvc members so learning to use our membership to it's full potential, We stayed in kidani village last year and jambo house this year, I have nothing but good comments to say about both, although kidani is exclusively for dvc members and a little smaller the jambo, jambo house also has floor five for members, we had a balcony view of the savanna, and had 2 giraffes outside our window when we first checked in, amazing, we have 3 kids17-11 and 5, they all enjoyed it equally, there's not much entertainment in either hotel, but who needs it when you have early and late ( extra magic hours) in all of the parks on different days. The transport system is excellent, just a little crowded sometimes, but hey who cares, the air con is a god send after the heat and excitement of the day. We will deffinately go back to this hotel in 3 hrs time, but would like to stay in another one of their fantastic resorts for 1 of our weeks holiday. Whatever you do pay a little extra and stay here just for the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and Playful”
Reviews.Author: leo72976
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge for our honeymoon. If you are looking for a romantic resort at Disney then this is the perfect choice! The front desk staff was wonderful! If you stay here make sure you spend the extra money for a Savannah view room. Our room was quiet large and included some nice ammeneties such as a refridgerator and marble tub. The view was unforgettable! Every morning we woke to find different animals grazing just outside of our balcony. One little hidden thing to do is try the night vision goggles to see the animals at night. If you go outside and follow the trail around you will find several viewing stations. The night goggles are free but are first come first served. The only disadvantage to this hotel is its distance from the theme parks themselves. Obviously Animal Kingdom is close by, however the other 3 Disney parks are a bit of a ride. I would say on average it takes 15-20 minutes to get to EPCOT, Hollywood Studios, and Magic Kingdom. There are several places to dine at the resort and they vary greatly in price, which is nice in my opinion. There are a fair mix of families and couples that stay at this resort. If I were given the opportunity to stay here again I would certainly take advantage of it!

Reviews.Title: “we loved Animal Kingdom lodge waking up to animals every morning was magical”
Reviews.Author: hamilla1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge in August 2011 for 14 nights. We arrived late following a long flight and grabbed a quick bite to eat and off to bed. Woke up the next morning to a wonderful view from our balconies, giraffes, zebras etc. my 5 year old was mesmorised and spent the remainder of the holiday eating his breakfasts on the balcony watching the animals (we had booked a standard room so this was a great start). We ate in all 3 resteraunts and thought Jikko was fabulous (we had Dinning Plan), our server in Jikko had Goofy phone my sun who was so excited that Goofy wanted to speak to him and how did he know he was at dinner. If you can get the free Disney Dinning Plan this is great value for money and more than enough food, allowed us to try some really nice resteraunts. We also ate in Sanaa and although the food was also nice, much preferred Jikko for both food and service. We had previously read reviews about the transport times, but honestly we didn't have any problems at all and they ran very regular very little wait times. The pool was a nice break at the end of a long hot day at the parks. The only down for me was the drawer space in the room very limited, but did not affect my holiday or the fun we had.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: beachtravelerrrr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for almost a week in July. Had a great experience and enjoyed waking up each morning to look at the animals outside our window. The only downside to the hotel is that it is a bit far from all of the parks with the exception of Animal Kingdom. No monorail or boats left us taking buses to all the attractions. The property was well kept as most Disney properties are and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Idea and Fun with Mediocre Room Decor/Amenities”
Reviews.Author: AnnenycAnnenyc
Reviews.Content: We had fun at this hotel: great views of animals eating, playing, and lounging just outside our room facing the Savanna area. Unique! But with a value for money problem. Here is a quick summary with a few points below: * Many cool things about hotel common spaces in terms of integrating animals and elements of Africa (see below for description). * Great 3-4 ft pool with kids' water slide. And hot tubs. 5 year old LOVED it. * Good food with unique and tasty African spices. Typicall packed--reserve early. * Challenge: like all Disney "Luxury" Resorts, the value for money on the actual room is not good: smallish rooms, cotton/poly sheets, and mediocre amenities. After being out in the bright sun all day, it was nice to return to the cool, dark spacious lobby with soaring ceilings, real African artifacts, and a huge window view out to the Savanna as well. The lobby always had a wonderful smell of some kind of sweet burning wood and interesting African music playing at a low volume. Not an overload of Disney decor at this resort--subtle. Another cool touch was that, on a platform by the Savanna just outside the lobby, guides from various African countries were available to speak with you about any of the animals or discuss their country and traditions. Unique for any hotel in the US and certainly in Disney. The Food in both restaurants was good (and sometimes great) in that most dishes used very well-researched flavorings and spices from Africa. BUT, because this hotel is at least 15-20 minutes away from any other resort by bus (only option)--the 2 restaurants are always booked to capacity. Absolutely RESERVE RESTAURANTS IN ADVANCE. Still, the snack bar is not bad at all and usually has 1-2 OF the aforementioned dishes with tasty spices available (i.e., you're not stuck to pizza and hotdogs). In summary, you can tell ALOT of thought went into the development of this particular resort. It's wonderful and unique! But do not expect much luxury in terms of bedding, room size/layout, decor, or amenities. These are below the grade of a typical big city Hilton or Marriott, even though room rates at Animal Kingdom Lodge (at $450-730) could easily score you a stay in a beautiful room at the Ritz-Carlton facing Central Park in NYC. Sadly, this value for money challenge seems typical for all the Disney "Luxury" Resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge (JAMBO HOUSE) - SO MUCH TO SEE IN ITSELF”
Reviews.Author: eugene712
Reviews.Content: My family and I took an Early Morning flight so we could stay and relax at the hotel and see what it had to offer. and indeed..IT DID Have a lot to offer!! We opted to stay at a studio with a Savannah View which was a good choice for a small family. The room had its own refrigerator and microwave. The Balcony had a great view of the animals that wandered in for its feeding time. We were on the fifth floor so we had a great view of the animals and also of the great lobby to which it is known for. I will let my photos speak for itself. All of the animal photos were from the lobby and from our room's balcony. Among those seen are Ankole Cattle, Bontebok, Eland, Zebra, Greater Kudu, Impala, Okapi, Red River Hog, Nyala, Reticulated Giraffe, Roan Antelope, Sable Antelope, Thompson's Gazelle, Waterbuck, White-Bearded Wildebeest, Abyssinian Ground Hornbill, Blue Crane, East African Crowned Crane, Greater Flamingo, Marabou Stork, Ostrich, Pink-Backed Pelican, Spur Winged Geese, Guinea Fowl and Ruppel's Griffon Vulture (listed in the pamphlet)! The lobby had chandeliers which I noticed were made out of Shields and Spears if one looks at it closely. We also had a chance to visit the newer Kidani Village to look at more animals (like the Ostrich) and at the hotel itself. There are free shuttles to and from the Jambo House and the Kidani Village. Our Room like the lobby is African inspired right down to the Bed Covers, Cabinets and night lamps. The Bathroom was kept neat and tidy. Our room had a double sink which we loved. My family loved to lounge around at the Balcony every morning and evening for breakfast and dinner while viewing the animals. We had internet connection (Free for Disney Vacation Club Members). Everyone knows food and water in Disney is expensive..Here are some tips. Either you can avail of the Disney Meal Plan or one can go and grocery shopping outside of disney (dont forget a case of water for your trips to the park). There are also TV Dinners, drinks including African wine selections and sundries are available at the Gift Shop. The Uzima Pool has a zero entry type of pool which is good for the kids. My daughter loved it as it we can stay in it for as long as we like (She swims very well). We never ate at the Jika (fine Dining) But we met up with friends and we did eat at the BOMA which is an african inspired Buffet. I must say BOMA earned a lot of praises from our friends who are true blue foodies - their palates are raving about the flavors!! For those guests with budget in mind. Eat at Mara's which is cheaper and a fast food - take out kind of restaurant. They also offer a $14 disney mug which is refillable(soda and coffee) at anytime of one's stay at the hotel and some parts of the parks and other hotels too. Worth mentioning is the pool and the hot tubs (there are two). The pool has a bar available. The Gym and Spa has good machines on it and worth using although one gets more than enough exercise as one goes to the Parks everyday. Also worth and recommend mentioning is the Magical Express and the airline check in available at the lobby for departing guests. We use the magical express for our airport transfers. Our luggage we checked into Orlando from our departing airport was picked up by the Magical Express and brought to our room directly. We never picked it up at Orlando International. AND When we checked out.... we also checked in our luggage and picked up our Boarding Passes at the counter near the Check in counter of the Hotel. How convenient is that? From this hotel - I was able to print out our Boarding Passes early thereby earning us good seats at our airline carrier. If you have any questions please email me for more tips.

Reviews.Title: “Stay among animals!”
Reviews.Author: yatrika
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this lodge.. waking up every morning to see exotic animals grazing around was a pleasure.. Their buffet was well worth the price and a must try.. will visit again! Even if you don't stay here, go visit this lodge.. with the impressive lobby, nice restaurants, flamingos and animals, both kids and adults will love it..

Reviews.Title: “It is magical but I will return when the weather is little more colder please!!!”
Reviews.Author: psyworks
Reviews.Content: I stay on the summer of 2010 in August at the Animal kingdom lodge is just a magical experience. This was my first time in a Disney World hotel and it was just what I expected for being at a luxury place where I was treated like a king. Since you first arrive from the magical transportation service bus from Disney is just a breath taking you are transported to the jungle and are received with African music and dancing from the staff of the hotel. The wait was not that long after check in the hotel were you receive your welcome package. Then you can start you adventure of Disney from the time you arrive. What I really did not love of Disney world was the wait for the busses to transport you to the parks. The weather is too humid for my taste. You feel the intensive heat of the weather and the heat of the busses transportation everywhere. I will love to have a monorail system or other service rather than the busses taking you everywhere. The rooms are quite small for four people I think but it is quite comforting in a way. I loved the balcony and seeing the animals outside my room every day. You can see different animals every day, and I will strongly recommend you the dinner plan from Disney is really worth it you see what I tell you.

Reviews.Title: “5 Start Hotel, Awesome Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: nannie33
Reviews.Content: I brought my daughter to WDW for her 5th b-day spending 7 nights at this fabulous hotel. We traveled with a firend and daughter. The hotel was recommend to us through out travel agent who saved us $3K by not booking though Disney. We got in around 4pm and our standard pool view room was just beautiful. Our girls loved the balcony and wanted to swim the first day there. We were on the dining plan & loved being able to split our counter meals & snacks. They do take the 4 meals off at dinner. The food was great @ Boma & Mara. Each had many choices to keep our girls happy. The pool felt amazing! Loved swimming every night after a long hot day at the park. The rooms are very comfy, loved crashing each night and actually getting sleep. Each room has a mini fridge to store drinks & snacks. We brought Capri-Suns to stash for the park days. The fridge froze them on the highest setting. The staff is the best! They will do anything to help you make your trip much nicer. We got home to find we forgot our dresses in the gift shop. I emailed the housekeeping MGR a pic and the receipt that we purchased them in their gift shop. I had 2 brand new dresses sent free of charge 4 days later. Bring bug spray! Also if you are gum chewer, bring some. The hotel nor airport sell it. I highly recommend this hotel and plan to return in a few yrs.

Reviews.Title: “Once in a lifetime experience. Really--once.”
Reviews.Author: Mavirek
Reviews.Content: We reviewed a lot of other reviews before settling on this vacation. Disney is expensive, so getting it right the first time is a must. Originally, we booked tickets via a popular online travel agent but learned that they were selling us a room only guaranteed for two rather than three. So we dumped the reservation and tried again direct with Disney. Disney was not more intelligent. Disney initially tried to charge us extra for our third adult, even though the room comes with a queen and two bunks. Snafus aside, the main building is beautiful. Each restaurant was tasty. Gift shop had nice buys. And of course, rising real early (crack of dawn) to watch the animals wandering out on their treks to wear food is waiting was worth all the trouble. But I wouldn't do it again. A few more bits of information: our room was clearly occupied by kids eating in bed before us and not cleaned by housekeeping; waits were too long for a Disney bus for transportation between theme parks and AKL; the principal reason for coming is to see the animals up close outside your balcony, but that experience is largely an early morning treat (and not so close); the pool area was large with plenty of interest, but it's really just for kids because there isn't a spot to relax without them running about you, including the hot tub; and the bottomless cup beverage service for a mere 8 oz at a time, is in a remote cafeteria that is convenient for the pool but not the rooms or even lobby. My review may seem negative, but I really want to stress that it was fun to do ... once. Advice given to me about choosing one side or the other to see the animals turned out to be good but not deal-breakers. Their advice: Zebra Trail for Arusha view. My advice: get an inexpensive room anywhere where you are facing the animals, and come morning they'll be there outside your balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Kidani Village-OK”
Reviews.Author: KVP2315
Reviews.Content: We had a Grand Gathering family vacation here. While there were animals outside our savana, we didn't see as many as we had hoped to see. Many times, there were none outside our balcony. Not sure I would pay the extra to have the savana view as there are viewpoints in the hallways. Loved the rooms...ours were 1 bedroom villas-big, clean with full stoves and washer-dryers and a second full bathroom. The housekeeping staff was great. The wildlife staff was great. There are no quick service restaurants in Kidani so it was a hike to go to Jambo. Kidani is much quieter and cleaner than Jambo. The Kidani pool slide is nicer. The quick service restaurant in Jambo, Mara, was filthy. We had to wipe everything down with sanitizer cloths before we sat down, including the seats. The Jambo gift shop is much larger and has many more choices. Given everything, Kidani is a better resort if you don't want the gift shop and quick service food.

Reviews.Title: “Opened my eyes in the morning and saw a giraffe wandering by!”
Reviews.Author: JoanneRI
Reviews.Content: This was a very clean, beautiful resort with the most comfortable American leather pull-out sofa and chair. Watching the animals from our balcony was a treat. We stay at Disney resorts every couple of years because we're DVC members and we've learned a few tricks. On the way to the hotel from the airport, stop at a market and pick up some staples: cereals, milk, English muffins, butter, bagels, cream cheese, and plenty of wter bottles to take with you. everything at Disney is very expensive and you'll save a lot that way. When you book your stay, book restaurant reservations and any other activity you might want to do. Our children are older, and we LOVED the Segway tours of the parks. . For younger children, book character meals, Hoop De Doo Review, etc. way ahead, too -- when you book your trip. You can always cancel. If you have anything larger than a studio, you have a lovely kitchen with everything you need, including paper towels and dish soap. One thing they don't provide is a shower cap, so take your own along. Try to stay up for the fireworks, too. They're spectacular. We always book a later reservation at the French restaurant (we like the more casual restaurant on the first floor) and watch the fireworks from there.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: runab0ut
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 4th floor with a balcony overlooking some of the animals. Everyday we could see zebras, giraffes, and ostriches. My grandaughter loved the views. We were a little far from the fast food service which was an inconvenience. All in all, it is a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect choice for families with young kids.”
Reviews.Author: jjkittycat
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort and will definitely come back. We got the standard room which oversees the preserve area. My two boys at age 6 and 9 were literally screaming when they saw the animals from our balcony. They did NOT believe those are real giraffes outside. The check-in was swift. There was a greeter to greet you once you are off the bus and direct you to front desk depending on if you have done the online check-in. The lobby is gorgeous with huge open 3 story-high ceiling and many comfortable sofas. The room was clean and nicely decorated with the African theme. I called about the squeaky sounds of my mattress when I lay down and get off from the bed second day there. I don't know what they did. It was fixed immediately. My housekeeping lady, Liliana, was a sweet heart. She surprised us every night with different towel animals and a towel birthday cake for one of my boys. I loved the nice towel Peacock in the cup with my toothbrush. The buffet in Boma restaurant was the best buffet food we dined in this week comparing to other two: Hollywood and Vine and the Crystal Palace. The Mara Cafe was sufficient for the breakfast. The Pool area is huge with one water slide. They have activities for kids every night. 7pm for campfire with marshmallows and 9pm for kids movies. It was a shame we only spent one night on the pool side. The resort is not very close to the parks as other resorts so planed for 30-40 minutes waiting and taking bus to most parks except the Animal Kingdom which is a shorter ride. We really didn't have any complains other than we should spent a little more time in the resort. I will update this review about departure from this resort tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view and hotel”
Reviews.Author: LSM28
Reviews.Content: My family & I already miss AKL and all the animals that we were able to see there. Our room offered a really great view - it was off the 3rd floor (same floor as the lobby) and we saw zebras, giraffes, river hogs, wildebeest, and plenty more. It really was a magical trip because of this. The only complaint I have is our room was not very clean when we arrived and wasn't really cleaned during our stay either. Upon arrival our bathroom mirror had fingerprints of a small child all over it and hair in the bathtub. The only thing that seemed to happen in regards to cleaning was taking out the trash and making our beds. I was a little disappointed in this considering it is a deluxe resort and therefore, should be clean! I found myself cleaning which of course takes time and on vacation, you really don't want to waste valuable time cleaning your hotel room. The only other complaint I have is we found something to be leaking in the bathroom and it smelled like urine. When we would wake up in the morning the grout in the bathroom would be all wet so I'm not sure where it was coming from but hopefully it gets taken care of soon. All in all though the resort was really beautiful and I would stay there again - I just would make it known if the room was not as clean as it should be rather than keep quiet like I did.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely done hotel, enjoyed my stay.”
Reviews.Author: Purplevalentine214
Reviews.Content: If you are budget conscious then consider getting just the standard view room at Animal Kingdom Lodge instead of one of the Savannah view rooms. Standard views all have balconies as well but may have a view of a parking lot or roof top. I recently stayed at the lodge and had a standard view, my view wasn’t that bad. I had a view of the roof but I could clearly see the pool area. I didn’t feel like I was missing out on anything because there are plenty of places around the resort to view the animals. If you are planning to tour the parks and be out and about most of the day save your money and just go with the standard view. The Mara is nice but has limited food choices as a quick service venue. I personally still enjoy Pepper Market at Coronado Springs Resort much better. Lobby was beautifully decorated and the rooms were very comfortable. Only things I didn't like was the remote feeling you get when you are at the resort. This can be a good thing or a bad thing depending on your tastes. Also I had a problem with the bus transportation. More so the transportation to EPCOT. Buses to that park seem to run every 30 mins or so. At least 5 or 6 buses would come for MK, AK, Hollywood Studios or Downtown Disney before an EPCOT bus would arrive. So if you are planning on going to EPCOT a lot on your visit you might want to consider another resort.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: MarthaBSturbridge
Reviews.Content: We took our grand daughter for her 8th birthday, and the resort itself was worth the trip. There were activities for the kids, a spa for the adults, superb restaurants from sit down, buffet, or cafeteria style. The pool was beautiful with the setting, and of course there were the animals that you would see out off your balcony. You never knew what you would see when you looked out. The rooms were extremely nice and of course, African themed. There were also talks about African culture, dancers, and demonstrations. This resort lives up to the Disney excellence that we have always experienced when staying at the resort hotels. They are more expensive than the more economical Pop Star hotels etc. but if you can swing it, it will add a whole new dimension to your Disney stay.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel with very few small issues that end up not mattering”
Reviews.Author: CireEdorelkrah
Reviews.Content: My now wife and I recently took a trip to Disney World to get married. Our stay was from July 29-August 3 2011 and stayed in the Jambo House with an Arusha Savannah view room. All I can say is WOW. Everything about this hotel is amazing. When we first enter the enormous lobby we were amazed by all the decorations and atmosphere. There is so much to explore in this hotel. Check in was quick and painless. The cast member congratulated us on our wedding and informed us about everything there was at the hotel. He even gave us special pins to wear for our occasion. He took his time to answer all of our questions and wasn't rushing us at all. When we got to our room, we immediately went to the balcony to see if there were any animal. I am happy to report that there were giraffes, zebras, and ankole (Kinda like cows with huge horns). The only reason why I knew the name was because you get a guide with all the animals you can see during your visit. On other days we also saw gazelle, hogs, pelicans, cranes, and many others. There are also these little lizards that are just everywhere it seemed. Not just at the AKL either. I guess these are native to that area in general? I will admit that the animals are not out during all parts of the day. They do go into hiding when it gets really hot but I have seen them during different times. Just don't be disappointed if you don't see anything for a few hours. I knew this going into it so I was not disappointed in the least. I am overall very happy with the amount of time I was able to see the animals. Some even came right under our balcony and we got a really close look. I brought a pair of binoculars which came in handy for the ones that were far away. We had a room for handicap people which was fine. The shower was larger than one the rooms the brides maids were in who also stayed at the AKL. The room was always very clean. We would leave for 30 minutes to eat something at Mara and when we came back, the beds were made and we had fresh towels. The fridge was large enough to store some bottles of water and sodas. It is about the same size of a refrigerator you would store in a college dorm room and is hidden inside a stand by the dresser/TV cabinet. My only complaint about the room was the bed. It just seemed like the should use higher quality beds there but they were still comfortable enough for me. Make sure to look for the hidden Mickeys in the shower curtain and the bed comforter. We loved the fact that there are lots of areas where you can just sit and relax with friends while having a few drinks. There are several indoors and outdoors. Most of the seats for these "relax" areas are wooden rocking chairs which I thought were very comfortable. We mostly ate breakfast at the Mara quick serve place but we did go to Boma once for breakfast. We liked it but honestly you can get most of the stuff at Mara for a lot cheaper. Everyone says the dinner is the best but we were always at the parks during this time so we never got a chance to experience it. We also didn't get a chance to eat at Jiko. The bar area which is called Victoria Falls is right above Boma and the bar tender was great. My only real complaint was the wait at the concierge desk. It took an obsurd about of time just to get through this line. Even being the third person in line took 20 minutes. They only have two people working the desk at a time. This isn't a complaint towards the cast members who were working the concierge desk because they were super helpful to each and every guest who needed help. They just needed to have an additional person or two working the desk if there are people in line since usually people have a lot of questions or time consuming questions. My advice is do research before going to Disney World so you don't have any questions that need to be answered by the concierge in the hotel. We drove and have season passes (come with the wedding package) and we didn't use the buses so I can't comment on that. Driving to the parks didn't take long at all. You are obviously next to the Animal Kingdom and the other parks were within a 15 minute drive of the hotel. Not bad at all in my opinion. The last night we were there, they placed a few chocolates on the bed. One is a large one that has the AKL logo on it. It was neat and delicious. Overall I loved this hotel and would definitely come back. We got a reduce rate since we have annual passes and paid around 1200 for 5 nights. That is about 240 a night and I thought it was a good value for that price. Some tips I could offer is to stay on the 3rd or 4th floor if you get a savannah view. It just made viewing the animals better than the lower floors. Also, bring your own set of binoculars if you have them. I used mine a lot.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel experience of our lives!”
Reviews.Author: livinglearningeating
Reviews.Content: I took my family here (after saving for a *long* time) this past Christmas and it was amazing. The service was impeccable, room service was delicious (and the portions very generous - a kid's pasta dish filled up the grown ups and we *still* had leftovers), and the hotel is stunning. It really is an unbeatable Disney experience. If I can afford it, we'd love to come back some day! It may be really expensive, but it's worth every cent!

Reviews.Title: “Animals everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: AdventureDrMom
Reviews.Content: The guides are a great source of information. There is so much to see and do at the Lodge you could spend a lot of time. The shuttles were great to the parks easy, easy. The pool is great, the pool bar is great. The fast food restaurant was surprisingly good.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast with the wildlife...so cool”
Reviews.Author: Shawna00
Reviews.Content: While I would not call this a luxury hotel, the rooms are decorated nicely, clean and comfortable. However, the experience is so extraordinary who cares about luxury. THe first morning we ordered room service and had breakfast (food was ok, but prices are very reasonable considering it was brought to our room) on the balcony. That morning we spotted Giraffes, zebras, impala, nyala and ankole cattle. It was cool. The overall hotel was great. The customer service, restaurants, transportation, amenities were are "disney standard".

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for animal lovers”
Reviews.Author: dukehuh
Reviews.Content: We had a room with a view of the savannah from the fourth floor. This was our first trip to Disney. Basically one should give some time to explore the hotel if staying here as we spent breakfasts on our balcony (in July!) watching the various animals feeding. Most exciting for us were the giraffes and zebras. I will admit that after staying here the Kilimanjaro safari ride, although great, probably lost some luster given that we could see many of the same animals from our hotel room. At this location, there are activities scheduled during the day which would have been nice to participate in if we had enough time. The pool looked very inviting, but we were unable to take advantage of due to some very strong afternoon thunderstorms that closed the pools down for the two days of our stay. A few specific notes: we were delayed 4 hours on our arrival and got in late. We used Disney Magical Express, but didn't get our bags delivered to our room that first night. The hotel staff was very good about getting us toiletries and diapers free of charge when we asked. We also got a credit, which was nice considering that we changed plans for the next day waiting for our luggage. Given that this is Disney, though, the credit would not go very far in terms of replacing a lost bag. Hopefully that is already obvious. For restaurants onsite, we were not on a meal plan. We intended to eat at Boma but decided that the quick service Mara was perfectly fine for us and saved probably about $80 by doing so, especially given that we weren't hungry when our reservation was scheduled. BTW, just because you have a reservation via Disney's website doesn't mean that you will be seated immediately - another reason why Mara was appreciated by us for our kids that had to eat NOW. One nice things about the rooms is that they are pretty quiet. We really couldn't hear the people around us. The hotel must have thick walls. We also didn't have a car, so we used the buses. We only traveled to the Animal Kingdom park from this hotel. Since that is the closest destination from this accommodation, one thing we didn't consider were the bus time waits. The buses run frequently, but there was at least one time where we had to wait for the next bus due to the number of people waiting to return to the hotel. One last observation - it was very much appreciated by myself and my wife that the Disney cast members (staff) are very friendly in greeting you and not in a fake way. At the Animal Kingdom, it was pretty apparent that the staff there take this seriously. Given that they are dealing with children, it was a very nice thing to see.

Reviews.Title: “Neat experience. Loved the Savannah room.”
Reviews.Author: Rocknrollchica2
Reviews.Content: After a very long drive we arrived at the lodge. The staff were extremely welcoming. Upon checkin we realized that they had us in a king bedroom pool vieetoday with no pull out. There was 3 of us so the room wouldn't work. Without question they upgraded us to the Savannah room. The sites were beautiful! We could see giraffes, zebras and all of the other animals from a close distance. The property was beautifully designed. We had a great trip! My only complaints would be that we did have bugs in our room and had to have an exterminator come out to spray (probably due to the animals being so close by). Also the beds were really hard and sneaky. I thought a place this nice would have a little better beds but this shouldn't make the place a deal breaker.

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge - Jamboree House”
Reviews.Author: RNoel11
Reviews.Content: Excellent resort. Great accommodation and typically pleasant Disney staff.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Magic!”
Reviews.Author: Tioty86
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Animal Kingdom Lodge this year, after enjoying a wonderful stay a couple years ago. Let me just say that, this resort is still magical! The property itself is huge, with plenty of activity for those who are unwinding after a day in the parks. The lobby is wonderful to walk though and sit in, with daily activities provided for the guests. Zawadi, the obligatory gift shop, provides some non-standard souvenirs for vacation goers and easy pick up for purchases from the park. Check-in to our Arusha View room was smooth, with a quick luggage delivery to our room. The room itself, a bunk bed set up, was very clean and had a wonderful view of the savannah. We were able to see antelope, giraffe, zebra, and various types of birds during our stay. I do wish that Disney would provide free WiFi in their guest rooms though, since its a standard in many cheaper hotels these days. Unfortunately, we did not have much of an opportunity to sample any of the more upscale restaurants on the property. However, if you want a decent value, I suggest going to the Mara for a quick bite to eat. Its easily accessible to the pool. ((Hint: If staying for a week, invest in one those 14 dollar travel mugs that are offered. Its well worth it for the stay.) The pool was very clean and there was plenty to do for both parents and kids. Daily activities like water basketball and a mini water slide were available for the young one's and the pool side bar the hot tub are there for the parents. If you're a person who enjoys getting a bit of exercise each day, don't worry, the Lodge has you covered! The fitness room alongside the pool is very clean and has a variety of machines to use. Whether you want to work on cardio or weight training, there is something for the exercise buff to do. However, due to the security lock being in disuse, you will need to hand your room key over to the attendant. Not a big deal though. Finally, as with any other Disney resort, take advantage of the buses! The bus station is just a short walk from the front entrance of Jambo House and the drivers tend to stay on schedule fairly well. Overall, it was a wonderful stay at one of the best themed resorts on the Disney property. I will definitely look forward to staying here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “if you love animals this is the resort for you”
Reviews.Author: NEWJERSEYSCOTTIEG
Reviews.Content: disneys akl makes you feel like you are in africa on a savanna! when you look out from your room you see the savanna with animals walking right past your balcony the whole vibe of this resort is amazing.if you ever go to disney world stay at this resort you will love it!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the animals!”
Reviews.Author: OhioWV
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. Enjoyed seeing the animals the best. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: KittyC1
Reviews.Content: (Previously reviewed in August 2010) This latest stay was a pre-Christmas visit with my extended family (4 rooms total). Loved the decor and atmosphere -- truly beautiful. Had great rooms - 4th floor -with view of the pool area. Somewhat busy for the holidays but most people went into the parks during the day so resort was relatively quiet then.

Reviews.Title: “Like Being on a Safari!”
Reviews.Author: allynator2096
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my husband's 30th birthday. He LOVES animals & this resort did not disappoint! We used Disney's Magical Express to get to our hotel from the airport. Check in was smooth and easy. We were on the main floor and our room overlooked the "savannah". Looking out on our balcony we saw zebras and giraffes walk by! There were other anmals we couldn't identify, but at checkin we were given a list with pictures so that we could identify the animals from our room. It was SO cool. There was also an overlook at the hotel with a guide that would tell you about the animals if you asked. They even had nightvision goggles! The buses to the parks were available right at the hotel. We did really hit up the pool as it rained for our whole trip. On my husband's birthday, he was given a pin that said it was his birthday & I got an "I'm celebrating" pin. All day staff everywhere wished my husband a happy birthday. It was really nice. Some rides even moved us up in the line because of the birthday pins! We only ate at one restaurant in the hotel ( I don't remember the name, but it was right next to the pool.) It had the BEST butternut squash soup I have ever had in my entire life....I ate it 3 times! I have a food allergy, and the chef came out of the kitchen to talk with me about my allergy and told me my options. Actually, everywhere I went in Disney the chef came out to talk to me about my allergy. I have never been anywhere else that was so accomodating The chef would often deliver my meal right to my table! My only complaintshave ( and they are VERY minor), is that our room had 2 double beds instead of 1 king bed. And there was no WiFi. (what resort has to wifi?) I would definitely go back to this resort. Maybe next time try the Kindani Village, but LOVED the Animal Kingdom Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort with some flaws”
Reviews.Author: Zeedeemom
Reviews.Content: This resort is absolutely stunning. I would have my coffee in the morning and just marvel over the beautiful lobby. Everything was immaculate. That was the best part of the trip. I didn't find fault with the bus service. When going to Disney, you have to expect to wait. I didn't feel that the hotel was that far like other people mentioned. I was a little disenchanted with check in. We arrived around 11:00 and were told that they'd put a rush on our room. We waited about 3 1/2 hours for the room to be ready. I understand we were early but don't tell us that there was a rush when clearly there wasn't. The room, while very clean, was very small. There was only 2 drawers which did not accommodate a family of 4. I had to leave my clothing in the suitcase for the duration of the trip. For an expensive hotel, I found the room to be borderline motel-ish. We also did not get housekeeping one day and on another my 15 year old son called the front desk for housekeeping. The Mara was okay. There wasn't much of a variety especially for breakfast. The smells coming from the Boma for the breakfast buffet were very enticing but it was too pricey to spend over $100 for a breakfast. We did eat in the Boma for dinner. That was so-so...also pricey. We were on the Disney plan and I highly recommend doing that. The gym was okay too. Clean. What I found very weird was that they had the smoking section right in front of the gym! So after a good workout, I was rewarded with a big inhale of smoke upon leaving the gym!! Another disappointment is just a Disney thing...the prices for drinks were out of control!! I don't drink a lot but on vacation I do like to have a cocktail or two. My husband and I spent $40 in 10 minutes having a couple of drinks!!! That's kind of insane. But I know that's a "rip people off on vacation thing"! This was my 4th trip to Disney. I didn't hate Animal Kingdom but I didn't love it. I thought Port Orleans Riverside was far better, especially for the price. I would sooner stay at another Disney property and visit Animal Kingdom because it was truly beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but a bit disapointing.”
Reviews.Author: Sereed842
Reviews.Content: Interesting decor, friendly staff. The view of the animals outside gave a unique vista. But ... the pool was closed, the food average, and the location too distant from other parks. Transportation slow although the drivers very helpful. The yacht club hotel is a much better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Unique. Exciting. Fun. Disney. Bit Pricey.”
Reviews.Author: rishir
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a pleasant time here. Stayed for 4 nights. The animals from the balcony are just great. You truly get to eat, sleep, and live with them right outside. They seem overall peaceful. Rooms were clean, service was GREAT. We paid almost $500/night after taxes for an Arusha room over 4th of July weekend. I think it may be overpriced, however it was a holiday weekend and my wife and I were celebrating an anniversary. Truly something I recommend every couple (or family) stays at once. Tips: 1. We paid extra for an Arusha room. I think Savanna would have been the same view cheaper. 2. Everyday around 6-8 pm the animals get “energetic” you see some running around others coming closer etc. I think it’s happy hour out there around that time… (at least it was on our balcony ;) - what else to do while she’s getting ready!) 3. Buffet is expensive however, all other food locations are reasonable. (noticed this throughout Disney) 4. Pool is open 24 /7 and huge… activities during the day 5. Visit their sister property next door and eat at Sanaa… food was good and we saw some different animals while you eat. 6. Make use of all the hotel has to offer. Take pictures at different locations. Save a day or two just to relax at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An incredible experience!”
Reviews.Author: meme828
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here for 5 nights in July 2011 and absolutely loved it!!!! We stayed in a savanna room and it was incredible to open the curtains every morning and see zebras, giraffes, ostriches, wildebeests, gazelles, etc. right outside our window.
