THE kids were screaming and the parents were yelling. It was horrible. Why would you put a double bed room right next to a queen size room only. That makes no sense. They should have a floor with just single beds. It should not be mixed. I’d called to complain but they said that they would move us, but we only had one more day. So, we decided to stay in the same room they were so nice to give me 75 dollars off my bill. What a joke. The transportation was alright. If you wanted to go to the ticket place you had to go catch the bus, then go to another park, to catch another bus. I would not take at this hotel again. In my opinion, this hotel is much overpriced. You can stay at a cheaper hotel and probably get the same quality room.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: AustinAggie96
Reviews.Content: Good overall experience. Much more convenient to be in one of the hotels on the tram stop if magic kingdom is the park you want to spend the most time at

Reviews.Title: “50th birthday at the Animal Kingdom Lodge---a unique and beautiful resort with some spotty service”
Reviews.Author: toodycat
Reviews.Content: To celebrate my husband's 50th birthday, we decided to stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge at Walt Disney World. We had stayed at this resort once before when it first opened and really enjoyed it. This time, we were going for the gusto with a club level, savannah view room and reservations for the Sunrise Safari. Arrival: We arrived around 9:00 p.m. and noticed that we weren't greeted by a cast member immediately and checked in privately which is the practice at the Grand Floridian when one stays club level. Later on we were told that this is only available for guests arriving until mid-afternoon. We waited on line to get our keys and a lot of confusion ensued. The cast member who helped us was very sweet and full of energy, but not so clear on our needs. She was very excited to make DH a birthday button with his name on it. Then, she gave us our room keys and then told us we would have to get new gold keys in the club lounge. The club lounge closed at 9:30, so we had to get our keys the next morning. I had ordered a special birthday hat delivered to the room through the itinerary planning office, but when I asked about it, no one had heard of it, although there had been lengthy email exchange prior to our visit to confirm that the hat would be there and I had authorized charges on my credit card. Luckily, the charge had not gone through and I wound up buying a different, better hat for my husband in the gift shop. Public spaces: The lobby of the AKL is truly breathtaking. The designers put a great deal of care into respecting the African design influence without making it kitschy. There is so much to look at and so many interesting African artifacts that it is like a museum. The use of dark woods and colorful prints is lovely and, although the lobby is similar in structure to the Wilderness Lodge, it seems to have much more light. There are also interesting touches such as a bridge to cross in the lobby. Keep an eye out for hidden Mickeys! Once you leave the lobby, there are multiple animal viewing spots inside and outside, such as Arusha Rock Overlook. The landscaping is beautiful and evokes a sense of the jungle without seeming untamed.We love the pool area with its zero entry area and fun water slide. The whole area around the pool has a terrifically relaxing atmosphere. It wasn't at all crowded during our visit. Guest rooms: The room was really fun with dark woods and brightly colored, African print bedspreads. It would be nice if Disney resorts would enter the 21st century and add some duvets and comforters, but the bedspreads are usually part of the theming. We had a good view of the savannah from our balcony, but it seemed not to have as many animals as we remembered. The room was a good size, though perhaps not as large as the rooms at the Grand Floridian or the Polynesian. Because we were celebrating a 50th birthday, we received gifts and a birthday cake. Because we had cancelled our August anniversary trip when I broke my foot, the AKL staff had also left us anniversary gifts and anniversary buttons to wear in the parks. Club Lounge: The club lounge is on a different floor from the club level rooms. It offers a breakfast that is slightly more than continental, yet not generous enough to be called full, snacks such as hummus around lunch time, and appetizers before dinner. We didn't really make use of the club services so much, except for tasks like printing out our boarding passes. Also, you have to be a club level guest to take the Sunrise Safari tour, so all safari participants congregated in the club lounge in the very early morning before taking the tour. Sunrise Safari: The Sunrise Safari at the Animal Kingdom Theme Park is only available to club level guests and it is not inexpensive, but it is really worth it. DH loves photography and the photos he was able to take with the new camera he received for his birthday were excellent. After the safari, you have a very good buffet breakfast at Pizza-fari in the Animal Kingdom Park. Restaurants: We had dinner at Boma and Jiko and loved both. Boma is a buffet with a fair number of interesting African dishes and enough American cuisine to satisfy the non-adventurous eater. The service was very friendly and we had more than enough food to choose from. The roasted pork dish was very tasty and I would definitely recommend sampling the sweet potato pancakes. Leave room for the Zebra Domes at the dessert station. DH's birthday dinner was at Jiko and it was absolutely perfect. Our server was friendly and attentive without being intrusive. The menu selection was great---sort of nouveau African cuisine. Definitely try the "Taste of Africa" appetizer. I had the shrimp curry with Durban curry sauce, DH had the short ribs and our son had the Filet Mignon. Our server brought a great chocolate mousse birthday cake for dessert. The atmosphere in Jiko is upscale and beautiful, but still very relaxed. We would definitely return to both restaurants. As for the counter service restaurant, Mara, we bought lunch there one day and it was very good and the salad greens were fresh. Convenience: I've read many reviews that complain about the distance to the Disney parks from AKL. Granted, it is not on the monorail and it is true that the bus rides can be long-ish. We rented a car. The one day we did take the bus back from the parks, we found that it took a long time and that the bus stopped at Kidani Village (Disney Vacation Club) before the lodge itself which tacked on a few more minutes. I would definitely recommend renting a car if you choose the AKL. Overall, the AKL is a wonderful property with great on-site dining options and many intriguing cultural touches. Let's not forget that you can sit on your balcony and watch zebras and giraffes which makes it a very special place indeed. We would definitely return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and beautiful property!”
Reviews.Author: greeny-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in May 2011, and we were impressed with the highly themed, well-serviced (with one exception), beautifully decorated property. Our room was small and had no microwave (you must pay if you want wi-fi). But it was decorated nicely, kept clean, had a lttle deck (which we used for spraying on our sunscreen), and had gorgeous views of the animals. They hire many international people from around the globe at Disney, and many work here. We liked the laid-back atmosphere of the guests, and the attentive staff who seemed genuine with their friendly helpfulness. The only exception was this: in advance of our stay, we had a package delivered to the hotel, and they told us to wait in the room and they would bring it to us, saying they could not leave it in the room without us being present. Two phone calls and one hour later, it still had not arrived. We finally went to the front desk and asked for them to give it to us, which they did. This was annoying because they had first told us that the delivery was imminent, so we wasted time sitting around in our room waiting for it. The food here is excellent, and better than at most of the properties at Disney, especially if you like ethnic food leaning towards Indian and African, but also for hot sandwiches and so on. Boma was great (a buffet featuring seafood, steak, other meats and stews, great side dishes, etc.) Sanaa was good though the dining plan didn't include naan (!!??); the prices are jacked up so the tip is always enormous ($20 for a family of four, typically) We used the Disney Dining Plan which is pretty essential in our opinion if you don't plan to travel off-site to dine (tips not included though), since food prices are terribly high otherwise. It takes about 20 minutes or so to get to Magic Kingdom or Epcot using the Disney bus service which was fine for us since we didn't use a car while here. In the future, I would consider renting a car, since parking is complimentary, and eating off-site would have probably saved money overall since food is so over-priced on-site. Also, if we'd stayed longer, we would have wanted more dining choices. But we had a promotion that gave us the dining plan for "free", so it worked out fine. The pool was lovely. The gift shop sells everything including milk, snacks, convenience foods, clothing, gifts, and more. It is large! We enjoyed our stay and would probably reccomend this hotel to others, but for us, it was probably a one-time deal. In the future, I think we could have a more luxurious stay off-site for far less money even with the rental car added in. You don't really save time by staying here either, since this property is pretty far from MK and Epcot.

Reviews.Title: “Like Kidani Better, But AKL Good Too”
Reviews.Author: palmharbormichelle
Reviews.Content: DVC member for 10 years. Had stayed at Kidani but this was first time at the Lodge. Stayed at both places in a studio. This trip we spent 2 nights in a Deluxe Studio w/Savannah View; spent the 3rd night in a Value Studio w/Pool View. The Deluxe was near the elevator on the 5th fl and the view of the animals was great. There seems to be a bigger rotation or more animals at the Lodge. At Kidani we saw the same animals from our balcony all day every day; at the Lodge the animals changed throughout the day. There was no noise problem being near the elevator. Both Lodge studios had a queen bed, pull-out sofa, and flat screen TV. Bathrooms were the same in both. The only real difference was the size of the closet/armoire, and there was a small desk in the Value instead of the round table that was in the Deluxe. Pool view was noisy on the balcony, but no pool noise could be heard inside. The lobby was much bigger at the Lodge, as well as the gift shop. There are more scheduled family activities at the Lodge than at Kidani. There are a lot more choices for dining here also. Food was fine the one time we ate quick-service poolside. The parking lot can be a hike to the lobby at the Lodge; Kidani has a covered parking garage with elevator. The pool at the Lodge is larger, but the slide is the same at both places. The Deluxe Studios at Kidani are bigger than at the Lodge, so if you need more room stay at Kidani. My largest complaint is that there was no hot water in our room on the second morning, and I have never had that happen at Disney. Otherwise we liked the Lodge, but would pick Kidani. Kidani has easier parking, a more laid-back feeling, and you don't have to walk through the lobby every time you want to go to your room. The Lodge has more of a hotel/resort feeling. If you are a DVC member and don't care about the Savannah View, go with the Value Studio if there are only 2 people. The difference in points is worth the trade-off of a few square feet.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: pickers1982
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Disney many times staying in the likes of Allstars, Carribean Beach, Coronado Springs) but this time we decided to treat ourselves to the animal kingdom lodge have always wanted to stay and we weren't disappointed! We spent our full two week vacation in a low end room. The first week was a little disappointing as our view was only of the car park however for the second week i asked to upgrade which wasn't possible but they moved us to a room overlooking the savannah any way!!! This room was brilliant sitting down with a beer watching the animals in the evening was brilliant! So in summary below General Hotel: had a really lovely feel and much more like a hotel than the previous hotels we stayed in. There was always something to look at and seeing animals everywhere was brilliant. The general music and look was just really rice and very African. Rooms: a little but that is to be expected in disney hotels! Our fridge in our first room rattled a little. Beware some rooms are quite a walk to reception Transportation: Hotel is a little further out than most but we never found anywhere too far to go and found it a good location for nipping off sight to Walmart etc Food: the real highlight for us is Jiko, it is an incredible place to eat with fantastic tasting food that is really out of the ordinary. We ate twice here on our last trip and twice this trip but always wish we'd gone more!! Two DDP credits are a bargain! The quick service restaurant was excellent too with a much more inventive menu than most. Flat breads were excellent (posh pizzas!) Pool: lovely pool for adults only as well as children and is very much a place to relax or entertain the kids. The jacuzzis are a welcome addition! Shop: nice shop with lots of safari themed artwork etc which we would have liked to buy! Overall: Despite a few negatives its a great resort to stay on!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: acln88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our little guy to disney for his first birthday. We were lucky enough to stay in this beautiful resort!!! Have never seen a resort like it. Waking up to animals outside your balcony every morning was unbeatable! On top of that we only paid for a standard room but were lucky enough to have a room with a view of the animals. We spent a lot of time in our room because our little guy went for a nap in the afternoon and was in bed no later then 8. The room itself was a good size. We previously stayed at the polynesian and I personally think the room size is not much different except for the bathroom. Having the double sinks at the AKL was a very nice bonus!!! Also having the balcony was so nice. The beds were very comfortable! My mother in law had bunk beds in her room which is really cool if you have children and a nice bonus! The restaurants were good. Having Bomas only a few minutes away was nice because it is a buffet. If you are on the dinning plan it is so worth booking buffet meals! Mara was nice for a quick meal or snack and drink. The best thing you could do if you are staying at a disney resort is purchase some sort of dinning plan. I personally like the Deluxe plan but the regular one is pretty good too. The only problem I ran into was that I had to take our little guy out of his stroller when boarding the buses. The bus rides aren't that long but with a one year old I found it pretty difficult. The only way to get away from that would be to stay on the monorail and that can get pricey. Other then the stroller thing though we waited no longer then 10 mins for a bus and it took maybe 15- 20 mins to get to magic kingdom. Overall this resort is perfect!!! By far my favourite resort in the world!!! I can't wait to go back. I cried when we had to leave:( Just remember too when reading reviews on here that a lot of people like to complain. You get what you pay for and this resort is worth the extra $!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience, worth every penny!!”
Reviews.Author: MommynNurse917
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at AKL for 7 days 6 nights. It was our first trip to Disney and we have a 5 year old son. Our room was great, we had a view of the pool and perfect location. Room 4020, fourth floor. Our son LOVED the pool and the water slide, as well, as being able to see animals roaming freely. I would recommend Jiko, one of the restaurants in the resort, it has a dress code and is a tad bit pricey, but well worth it. We used our dining plan and 2 meals per person were charged, but like i said WELL worth it! :) The food and drinks were amazing and it was family/kid friendly. We had a wonderful experience, the staff was so helpful! They really go out of their way to help you and make your experience a memorable and enjoyable one! I can't wait to go back again, we probably wont stay at AKL again, only because it was out of our budget to begin with, but it was worth the money! Next time, we will stay someone a little bit cheaper, however, I wish we could stay there again! Maybe someday! :0)

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, seems like your in Africa.”
Reviews.Author: Leetherees
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay from start to finish. Very well setup, with nice food and staff who know everything about the great animals in Savanna around the lodge. We had a great time there and it's easy to get to the Disney parks no need for car hire. Thank you Disney

Reviews.Title: “A roar full of fun!”
Reviews.Author: mrFlorida71
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel. We stayed here for our first trip to the Walt Disney World Resort and were very delighted! Great service and most of the cast members who work at this hotel are from Africa. Very clean.Tasty authentic restaurants. Great view of the animals from our room. Our room was nice. This hotel is worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother,waste of money”
Reviews.Author: loppylugs19
Reviews.Content: Not worth the exspense at all.very disappointed.The Carrribean beach is even worse.Shame on you Disney some of your hotels are awful,cashing in on families eager to stay their.Some families save for a long time to go there.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not amazing!”
Reviews.Author: vicky_taylor58
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks for our honeymoon in May 2011. We had booked this as a holiday of a lifetime and I was a bit dissapointed. We did not pay for a savannah view but we were given a partial view, which was great. The best thing about this hotel was the view of a giraffe outside the window. The room was nice, we had a double bed and bunks that we used to keep our suitcases on! They took up a lot of room and the room would have been a lot more spacious without. The double sink vanity area was great but the actual bathroom was a bit dark but the shower hot and powerful! The room had a full size fridge, which was great. We ate at all the AKL resturants and they were great but Boma was always busy and the drums never stop!! Concierge were pretty useless and when I tried to check a booking we had already made, no one seemed to understand what I was on about and after speaking to 3 people and waiting 20 minutes, I was no further forward. We also had problems at Boma when our pager broke and we were 30 mins late sitting down for dinner. Just did not feel the Disney magic here and for the price you pay I expected more!

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: Oxxy909
Reviews.Content: I visited with my wife and 20-month-old son May 15-21. We had a Savannah view. It was an incredible trip. We found the staff extremely helpful and friendly. The people were too pleased to help us get anything we needed. The hotel itself is a marvel. The lobby is large and open and beautifully decorated. There are plenty of areas to see animals even if you don't pay the extra for a Savannah view. Our room had a view of animals and we saw them all the time (though keep in mind they're all in the barn from around 9am-12pm). It was fantastic. The room itself was great. I know some complain the rooms are small, and while I won't say it was overly spacious, I thought it was just right, plus there was the balcony too. The pool area is also quite wonderful and I'm sorry we didn't leave more time to enjoy it. This resort also has great restaurants. We ate at all of them. Boma is fine for dinner but even better for breakfast. Jiko and Sanaa are a little more upscale and pricey but the food is very very good. Even the cafeteria at Mara is excellent for what you would expect out of "fast dining." Overall, I would not hesitate to return to this hotel. It had everything we wanted. While we came for the theme parks, it was great to come back in the evening and here the words "Welcome Home." It was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Savannah Smiles :)”
Reviews.Author: SherylH_11
Reviews.Content: Animal Kingdom Lodge is truly an exotic experience. It's such an oasis away from the hectic pace of the theme parks. We arrived at 1:30 p.m. and our room was ready (awesome!) We paid for a standard room and were given a room farthest from the lobby. This was not a bad thing since the walk to the room is so pleasant to just look out at the Savannah (not to mention all the hidden Mickey's my 4 year old grandson found in the carpet!). When we first got to our room, we opened the door, went straight to the balcony to look out and immediately saw a mama, daddy and baby giraffe right outside the balcony. We saw so many animals all the time! It is just fun to look at the sheet they give you to identify them and read about them. The decor at Jambo House is so beautiful. I love the dark, glossy wood in the lobby, the fire pit, all the animal carvings and well, just everything down to the African music playing. The food at Boma, and the Mara is delicious as well. We spent all evening one night at the pool at Kidani Village where they had a movie under the stars. The water play area for kids is *so* much fun. We also ordered and had lunch delivered poolside one day and it was really good food (Indian influence). I have stayed at AKL twice now and I know I will go back. I read some of the negative reviews and I seriously don't know what they're talking about.

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: tink1229
Reviews.Content: AKL is the most beautiful resort I have ever stayed at. From the moment you walk into the lobby, if your breath is not taken away, there is something wrong. The cast members are awesome, the lighting is dim but it fits perfect with the theme, to some people this was too dark. The smell of indian spice or incense is extremely relaxing, to some people it was annoying. The animals are beautiful, the grounds are spotless, the zero entry pool is great, (especially for little ones). Its out of the way compared to other resorts yet for us it was like "going home" after a long day in the park. I want to go back in the worst way. The animals are right outside your window or lobby, the theming is so relaxing you can not help but be completely centered and grounded when you check out. If you like the smell of incense, the sound of drums or africian music in the background, animals right outside your door and you want to relax when you get back from the parks, this is the place for you. If you like the beach, noise, children EVERYWHERE then maybe the beach club would suit your tastes better. I am a very particular person who is a clean freak and with pretty high standards when it comes to spending money on vacation... the only regret I have is not spending an entire day at this resort without going to the park. It really is an amazing resort and leave it to Disney imagineers to make you feel like you are in Africa when you are really in Florida. Thank you Disney:) for giving my family a memory of a lifetime!

Reviews.Title: “Child was sick from what appears to be food poisoning”
Reviews.Author: chanman0
Reviews.Content: The Hotel had decent views of the savanna and the rooms were nice and clean. The pool malfunctioned while we were there and had to be closed for a bit while the chemicals got regulated. The worse part was my child getting sick from the Quick Service restaurant. She was up vomiting the rest of the night and according to one of the staff members this is not an uncommon event. I know that every now and again that this can happen and could really happen anywhere, just hate that it happened here.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't that impressed”
Reviews.Author: Newyorkcali
Reviews.Content: I'm usually not a weasel with hotels but I had to write a review with this lodge. I go on Disney trips annually and have traveled all over the world and stayed at ugly motels to 5 star resorts, from Hawaii to Alaska and even Tahiti. However I was not impressed by this hotel and I didn't even pay for the 7 nights. First off yes the lobby was beautiful and the animals were great around the hotel however. The walk to my room was very far, even for me being a "in shape" person. I didn't care for the smell in the lobby. The room was very mediocre, the tv display was so big and took up alot of room. The rooms were designed as regular motel layouts. The pool was very small and they did not have a sauna. The Boma restaurant was overpriced and not special. The only think I liked about this hotel was the staff and thats about it.

Reviews.Title: “great stay will definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: kaga99
Reviews.Content: Our first Disney hotel and we had read stacks of reviews. It was slightly expensive but well worth it. We took our five year old and she was overwhelmed by the decor and animals living in the surrounding grounds. The staff were great and helpful - in an American type of way - and we had all our problems solved. Not that there were many. On a down side the on site restaurants were extortionate and booked out. Worth getting the free shuttle bus to somewhere else and eating out. The pool slides were out of order for the whole week which was disappointing. To compromise they had a pool party for all the kids and played games gave prizes etc. The hotel was quiet at night and the rooms were sufficient and comfortable. We will absolutely go back and were very happy with it even although it was expensive. It's a Disney hotel and Disney does customer care very well.

Reviews.Title: “Was very nice”
Reviews.Author: tgc
Reviews.Content: Period: May 15, 2011 to May 20, 2011 at Animal Kingdom Lodge (Jambo House) Magical Express - The yellow luggage tags should be used ONLY if you want to take advantage of the service that delivers your luggage to your room directly from the airport. You can skip the baggage claim step at the airport. Be warned, it can take up to 3 hours for the luggage to be delivered. Pack items that you want to use right away in your carry on (ie. Swimsuits, electronics etc) The Weather can swing from hot to warm to cool. Take a light sweater. Getting around – Alamo has a location on site near Magic Kingdom. Arrange rental from your room. They pick you up at your hotel, take you to the Alamo, you return it there and they shuttle you back to your hotel. It is quite expensive. However, there is an outlet shopping centre (DKNY, GAP, Banana Republic etc) very close by which is also close to “regular” shopping (major supermarket, restaurants). The shuttle buses run every 15 – 20 minutes from resort to park and vice versa. Customer Service - My husband left a bag with electronics on the bus from the airport stemming from confusion about Kidani vs Jambo. Neither was identified prior to the trip so he went to ask the bus driver and in the confusion with two kids, we hurried off the bus and forgot the bag. If you do this, tell reception, they will open a claim. It takes about 2 days to get things back. My son also left his snake stuffy somewhere in the lobby and it was delivered to our room. We did not encounter any poor customer service on the resort and very little at the parks. Animal Kingdom Lodge – beautiful décor in the lobby, bright & pleasant cast members, rooms are small but nice, a little smelly outside due to the animals at times but c’mon, it’s AKL. It’s not a large resort to get around. Nice pool, zero entry. Lots of spaces to see animals even if you don’t have a Savannah view room, towels available at the pool free of charge, lots of lifeguards, nice slide, lots of chairs, several hot tubs, a wading pool, playground. The pool doesn’t get deeper than about 4.5ft. Your room card is also your park ticket, on property “credit card” and meal plan voucher. Card was blanked several times for room entry and had to keep going back to reception. It worked great at the parks and for meals. If you buy items at the parks, they will deliver to your hotel. You don’t have to drag purchases through the park. Laundry self service near the pool. Meal Plan – We had a snack, a Quick Serve and a Table Serve each day for each person. A snack can be a muffin, a whole fruit, a smoothie, ice cream bar. A quick serve can be sandwiches, wrap, pizza, with a dessert and non-alcoholic drink. For kids, example, cheese pizza, milk, grapes and jello. You can buy mugs at the resort. They are good for unlimited hot and cold beverages at the resorts only. They are about $15 each. We used them to our full advantage, free coffee at the fountain instead of using a snack credit. Allears.net has the menus for the restaurants. Seem quite current with what we had. We ate at Mara, Boma, Tusker, Askershus, Cape May – all very good. Tips are not included. Parks get crowded even now. Some lines are quite fast, some not so much. Use fastpass when you can. As a resort guest you get to go a little earlier and stay a little later beyond opening and closing hours. Use the maps, plan your route. Kids get tired, not a lot of shaded seating. Strollers available for rental. Overall - a good time. Next time I'll rent a house and car though to see more of the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT! LOVED IT! LOVED IT!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JB1013
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge - Jambo House. We had a view of the pool (non savannah view). The view was lovely (next time will get a savannah view, but tried to save a few $$ this trip). The room was great, clean, loved the decor. The restaurants on site were fantastic. We ate at Boma, Sanaa (which is in Kidani Village) as well as the counter service location, Mara. Overall wonderfull stay. So much to see and do at this resort. In fact, on our last full day of vacation, we didn't even go to the parks at all because there was just so many things to do right at the resort. The savannah's are fantastic, the savannah guides are all from Africa, and not only educate you about the animals on the savannha, but about their homeland as well. This resort is Disney at its best.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Unique Experience”
Reviews.Author: vacalove232
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Jambo House in AKL in May 2011. We stayed in a savannah sunset view room. The hotel was very clean, had interesting decorations from Africa, and had the best customer service. It was wonderful to sit on our balcony and watch the giraffes, zebras, and ostrich graze over the savannah, definitely the highlight of the hotel. The room was average sized, super clean, and gave an unique African feel that we loved. My only complaint was that the mattress was not comfortable and extremely hard. Compared to some other deluxe Disney hotels, ALK is set farther away from the Magic Kingdom, EPCOT, and Downtown Disney, but they did make sure there were buses every 10 minutes so it did not make much of a problem. Boma was great and we had awesome servers there who were all from Africa. Staying at AKL was the highlight of our trip and I would definitely recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we chose this one”
Reviews.Author: chrisbailey1973
Reviews.Content: 1st view from the room was a Giraffe wandering past the window. Never disappointed with the views all week, you can even get a look at night through the hotel night vision binoculars!. Boma the best for food,casual buffet great for the kids, Saana best for atmosphere with prime views of the 'savanna' while you eat. Lots written about the distances from other parks but if your'e realistic you won't find the wait for buses or time on them any reason for concern in the slightest , the longest journey we had was about 20mins and there's a bus every 20mins or quite often less.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel of Our Trip”
Reviews.Author: caroline188
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay somewhere unique on the last night of our Orlando/Naples trip so picked a Savannah view in Jambo House. From the moment we arrived we knew we had made a mistake. Being Disney, we expected a warm welcome but the staff we met seemed fed up and tired. The room itself was small and dark...picture a standard motel room on International Drive such as the Quality Inn then add brightly coloured bedspreads and a few African themed items then you will have the picture. The Savannah was nice to look at but the balconies overlooking it are very small. The hotel itself is incredibly busy all the time. At times, the lobby feels like the thoroughfare of a train station. There was no opportunity to sit and enjoy the main atrium because there was so much noise and activity. The pool area was utterly mobbed with families, certainly no place to go for any form of relaxation. We ate in the buffet restaurant, Boma, and hated it..... the food was average, very over priced and there was zero ambiance in the restaurant. The noise was incredible, rather like being in an African themed canteen. One had to stand in queues for dinner and desert. When we were presented with the bill, there was a message printed on it suggesting a gratuity of $15-£18 was expected. Prices very very inflated for everything in the hotel. There was no where else to go within walking distance which meant you are held hostage to the prices that they choose to charge. I would never return to a Disney hotel after this experience. So disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: Meghan122
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel! The employees told us we would have a beautiful view with animals, but we had a view of the parkin lot. No big deal. We always went downstairs outside to see the beautiful animals! We didn't get to hit the pool but it was AMAZING! We loved the service, the people were very friendly but the one bad thing is that it was in far from all the other resorts and parks!(except Animal Kingdom which was around the corner). Otherwise, it was a fabulous resort.

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay extra for savannah room”
Reviews.Author: Listen2U
Reviews.Content: We loved the overall effect of the property; quite appealing African decor. However, we paid extra for the savannah room but regret the waste of money. For three days we saw one ostrich and one impala and several crows. What we saw the most was the garbage truck doing its thing next door. Not very impressive. We were also told that we would have a much better view from this room that the one we were originally assigned so we agreed to the move. What a joke. If a giant blue swollen belly trash consumer on wheels is what you want to see, go ahead, pay the hundreds extra just like we did!

Reviews.Title: “Magical Stay”
Reviews.Author: kelmom_samandwill
Reviews.Content: We LOVED Animal Kingdom Lodge!!! We stayed in Jambo House in a pool view bunk bed room. The room (and the resort) was spotless the entire time and the kids loved the bunk beds. The grounds and the pool area were beautiful, just breathtaking! The longest we ever waited for a bus (to any park, from any park, and our hotel) was maybe 10 minutes. Great when you've got little ones with no patience and its 95 and humid out! The day we left, we missed our Magical Express ride to the airport (because we were trying to figure out how to check our bags). AKL paid over $70 for a taxi ride for us to the airport so we wouldn't miss our flight. We were VERY impressed! We are already planning our next trip to Disney World, and can't wait to come back to Animal Kingdom Lodge :)

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: lundve
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom villa at Kidani Village. We loved our room on the sunset savanna and the boys loved looking at the giraffes, zebras and ostriches early each evening. We found the best views of the animals to be during the hours of 3-6pm while we were cooking or getting ready for dinner. The Community Hall, pool, and water play area of Kidani were highlights of my boy's trip and they would have easily went all day everyday if we had time too. We had a few cleaning issues when we first checked it but after letting the manager know our room was spotless the rest of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting, but over-priced”
Reviews.Author: GuyFromStamford
Reviews.Content: Just last week I spent 4 nights in Orlando, 3 nights at a budget hotel, one night at this one. This is very interesting to look at; the lobby is astounding, the viewing areas are interesting, and the pool is excellent, but this isn't really a luxury hotel and for the price you can probably get much more luxury elsewhere. The room was much smaller than in my other hotel, not that it matters much as I wasn't going to be doing cartwheels in it, and it had a nice balcony overlooking the pool. The only bad thing about it was the "high speed internet service." First of all, they charge $10 / day for it. The second thing is that it's dreadfully slow - probably a dial-up connection. I couldn't upload so much as a single photograph, whereas in my previous hotel I could upload hundreds effortlessly. Overall, I'd recommend it to people, but with the caveat that it's not a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a couple of nights or special occasion”
Reviews.Author: Applegate08
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, huge lobby and fast check in. Depending where your room is you could be walking a good 10 minutes from lobby to your room due to the way it is laid out. We were lucky as we were only about a 3min walk. The rooms are really basic for the money - however obviously the big sell is the view you get from the Savannah suites. There were giraffes outside our room each night from about 6pm - 6am. There were also a couple other animals which I didn't know what they were. Other rooms could see zebras etc but you can see all the savannahs as you walk from your room to the lobby so you will see all the different animals. The rooms are very basic for the amount of money you are paying but you are paying for Disney and having the major advantage of transportation! There are 3 different places to eat, one fast food style which was ok for a quick breakfast, the main restaurant which did a fab big buffet which we had a great breakfast at and their up market restaurant Jiko which we didn't have time to visit but looked really good. There is a big gift shop where you can get snacks etc too which was good. The swimming pool is really nice, not too many kids either when we were there so you could just chill out and have a bit more room to swim. The bus service was really good as it doesn't share buses with any other hotels so you always get a seat on the bus and we never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus to or from here. It is a bit far from all the parks except AK which you struggle to even spend a full day at so it does take a while to get anywhere. Overall we really liked the hotel but to be honest on night 3 the view of giraffes had started to wear off. It's totally over priced for staying there anything over 4 or 5 days. It's worth it for that long I would say but no more than that as the novelty will be over quite soon. We stayed here for 3 nights before moving to a moderate resort which provided much better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Home!"”
Reviews.Author: MellyJersey
Reviews.Content: That's what the sign says at AKL and this was our 3rd stay here. We love it and it feels like we could live there! Love the animals, the decor, the bongos, the smell of the awesome foods cooking, and the pool. The only con I can give is the rooms are a little small for the price and deluxe category. The service is wonderful. Everyone from front desk, to housekeeping to food service was kind and super accomodating. Boma restuarant has great breakfast & dinner buffets. Big variety of foods and we got to try some new things we'd never heard of and they were great! Jiko is also really awesome. My teens loved the choices at the quick service rest. Mara. ie: chicken pita, turkey chiabatta, burgers, chicken ceasar salad. The atmosphere here is wonderful. It's not a "stuffy" fancy place. Its just lots of natural materials: rocks, leather, wood, in natural tones. It has a very relaxed feel to the place and feels very authentically Africa. And NO , you don't smell the animals! Everyone asked us that one! We were there a full 7 days and never tired of it. Actually we could have used just a couple more days to just stay there all day and enjoy the place w/out running to the parks. My daughter took more photos at the hotel of the animals and the cools things around the hotel then she did at the parks! Love Love LOve Love it there!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, enjoyable & excellent resort!”
Reviews.Author: RozCt
Reviews.Content: Very nice resort and area. My room had a view to the wild animal side and wow, it was great! For a moment I really though that I was is Africa, specially at night. Everyone at the Hotel was friendly, love their staff africa style hotel uniforms. Rooms are clean & service was great, I would highly recommend the concierge service for various reasons; the food and rest of the resort are expensive, specially if your traveling w/kids or family, if your categorized under concierge; pretty much there's a VIP room that gives you access to various food, snacks, continental breakfast, few cocktails/beer, all you can drink, deserts and etc. from 6am-11pm..boyy that did save us a ton of money in food!! We also did the safari excursion, super highly recommended. Very nice and once again it gives you that feeling of been on a realistic Africa safari journey thru the wild, my whole family loved it!! I would, highly recommend this resort under the Disney category.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect family trip!”
Reviews.Author: BlossomYoga
Reviews.Content: We visited Disney with our 2 year old who is crazy about animals. We chose a Safari room at the AKL so that we could watch the animals roaming and we were so happy that we did! It was definitely an expensive way to stay, but sitting on the balcony in the mornings and evenings watching the zebras and giraffes roam below was incredible. The lodge met all of our expectations otherwise. The room was spacious, there was a good sized fridge and coffee was provided for the coffee maker. We had the dining plan and ate at Boma once (delicious!) and the fast food restaurant about three times (great for quick and healthy meals). The AKL is a little far from Magic Kingdom so we will stay at another resort next time, but we are glad we experienced it!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: pda_2011
Reviews.Content: I did the deluxe Disney experience 10 years ago at the Polynesian and it was brilliant and have to say 10 years on at Animal Kingdom Lodge it was every bit as good - Well done Disney ! and we love Jiko's Restaraunt.

Reviews.Title: “Most beautiful hotel in Disney”
Reviews.Author: wgnwmn
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at AKL Jambo House 9/10 - 9/15. I never stayed here and was skeptical to stay at an AK hotel (I am not very fond of animals), but my boyfriend really wanted to. We received the 40% off room price, so that was even more of an incentive since Deluxe Resorts are just gorgeous. We arrived there at 10-ish AM and were greeted with "Welcome Home!" which was such a great touch and a nice way to start the visit! The entire hotel was BEAUTIFUL - I didn't even feel like I was in Florida - it felt like I was truly in Africa. So gorgeous and there were people playing live music - it was just beautiful. The lobby is HUGE, by the way. We proceeded to check-in where a nice woman told us our room was not yet ready (expected, since it was so early). I asked her if we could have a free upgrade to savanna view since we only had a standard view. She asked us if we would settle for a savanna view w/ 2 queen beds, but we were set on our king size bed, so we passed, but I was happy to see they were going to give us a free upgrade! (Paying for a savanna view isn't completely worth it - there weren't THAT many animals, but when there were, it was nice to see.) She told us she would text me when our room was ready so we headed to the pool, which was SO NICE! It's basically empty this time of year at Disney so it was nice and quiet to relax. The zero-depth entry pool was so cool and different and definitely a great place to tan or to watch your little ones splash around. The bar near the pool was also great and everyone was very friendly. We decided to eat at The Mara (quick service) because we were starving. I don't usually expect much from quick service places, but this is Disney, so it was fantastic! Great burgers and fries and you can even buy beer which I didn't think you could do. Only about an hour later did I receive a text that our room was ready and we headed right to it! What a great room - so much better than in the pictures. African-inspired decor EVERYWHERE. The bathrooms were very small, but all you really have to do is shower and use the toilet, since the two sinks are outside the bathroom, so not many complaints there. The ONLY con I would give AKL is that besides the fact it takes about 20 minutes to get to every park (besides AK), the bus stops at Kidani Village first to pick up and first to drop off (except the Downtown Disney bus). Our first night, we were coming back from EPCOT very late at night and it was raining. The bus stopped at AKL and we got off. Little did we realize we were not at Jambo House. Instead of waiting for another bus (could take 20 minutes), we walked the 10 minutes to Jambo House. This was annoying because no one made an announcement where we were and several other guests got off accidentally, as well. Yet, the next night, there was an announcement as to where we were. In this aspect, Disney should get their stuff together and notify us where we are. People are paying a lot to stay here and an announcement isn't THAT hard. I'd recommend this place in a heartbeat! I miss it so much already!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Waakas888
Reviews.Content: I love this place! The rooms are very nice but they could be a little bit bigger and have better lighting in the bathroom. The pool is very nice and restaurants are excellent! You have to try Jiko

Reviews.Title: “great holiday”
Reviews.Author: derbygazza
Reviews.Content: great holiday very clean hotel, savanna room over rated not worth the extra, food choice poor in quick service resturant but good quality other resturants very spicy poss not for young childrenl pool great to relax but overall a good holiday base will revisit soon next 2 years and stay again

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but not worth the money spent.......”
Reviews.Author: frenchy32034
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge. Pluses: The lobby of this lodge always takes my breath away. It is beautifully designed and always gives me a feeling of Africa. Of course, I haven't been to Africa, so I could be way off base! But the African masks, artifacts, hanging African inspired lamps from an incredibly high ceiling are really impressive. The placement of sofas and chairs in little groupings was also very nicely done. The Jiko restaurant has wonderful food and great ambiance. And of course, it is a thrill to see animals grazing on the savannah surrounding the hotel, although they were not as many or as varied as the last time we stayed here. The room price we paid for a savannah view room in April was almost $500 including tax etc. This time, we saw animals from the room, but from a distance. Last time it seemed as if they had a truck with food that left food which of course attracted the animals to the areas adjacent to savannah view rooms and to the promontory located at the rear of the hotel accessible from the lobby. This time, it seemed the animals may or not graze in view. Many times they were off in the distance. Certainly, something we don't see at home, but not what we expected and not we saw the last time we were there. The room itself was somewhat cramped with two Queen size beds and a small balcony with a bistro table and two chairs. Staff was friendly, but it seemed to me that they were not as friendly as in years past. They were not unfriendly, but I got the f feeling they may be overloaded with work. Just my impression and my husband's as well. We ate at the Kidani Village, the newer hotel facility, and found the cuisine a bit spicy for our taste. That is not to say the food was not good, but it was geared to a spicier palate.

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: hlarsen26
Reviews.Content: From the drive up the hill to the inside of my room, the entire experience was fantastic. Every single employee I met was so firendly and knowledgable. I can't stand when you go somewhere and the employees have no sense of what customer service is. Disney's Animal Lodge nailed it! It doesn't hurt that the rooms are beautiful with flat screen t.v and granite counters in the bathroom, along with a gorgeous overview of the animal safari from the balcony!!

Reviews.Title: “Are you sure we're in Disney?”
Reviews.Author: ABFine
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Jumbo House on 4/10 for a five night stay. We stayed in a DVC room on my wife's cousins' points. Therein lay the problem. Upon arrival we tried to switch to either the Boardwalk or the Beach Club. The cast member at the desk made a big deal of this, telling other cast members and anyone else in close proximity that we didn't want to stay at their hotel. We didn't appreciate this. She made a call to the Boardwalk and said, yes, they had numerous rooms available but upon learning that we were staying on someone else's points, she ended the call and informed us that only the owner could make the switch. My wife called her cousin who called DVC but was told the rooms available were for cash only. Even if we wanted to pay cash for the upgrade we couldn't do it. We asked if there were any upgrades available at the AK. Once again, not your points, no upgrades. We ended up on the fifth floor as far from the lobby as was humanly possible. As if all the walking we did in the parks wasn't enough, we really needed a half mile walk to our room. To top things off, when the bellman brought our bags up, he informed us that the hotel was at 60% occupancy. This was probably our 20th stay at Disney, always at deluxe resorts and they couldn't find a way to accommodate us? While the resort is very nice, there is nothing Disneyesque about it. Oh yeah, there were some animals outside. If you're into watching animals stand about and not do much, this is the place for you. We wouldn't stay here again if the room was free. The whole experience left a bad taste in my mouth, much like dinner at Boma.

Reviews.Title: “Should be a smoke free hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Retired930
Reviews.Content: The room was fair with a great view. However, every time we went out on the balcony to enjoy it we had to deal with cigarette smoke from other guests. A number of small things were wrong with the room. We checked out early.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: elwoodSouthCarolina
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights the last week of March. What a beautiful hotel. My children loved everything about it. The pool was amazing, with a slide for them to enjoy. The staff was great, rooms clean and updated. Would definately go back. I was worried about the location, but it all worked out fine. The pool view room was very pretty. We moved over to Kidani for the balance of our trip, and we had a view of the animals on the savanah. Zebras, Giraffe's etc. My kids 4 and 8 were in awe. We woke up to that view everyday.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in DW becasue of the animals”
Reviews.Author: SusuSeven
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many of the different DW resorts and all the high end ones have similar quality rooms. But what makes this one my favorite is the animals. It is so much fun to be able to look out at any time while in your hotel and watch the giraffes and other various plains animals going about their day. Definitely get a Savannah view. The food at this resort is also better - Jiko is excellent, the breakfast at Boma is lots of fun. All sorts of African food and wines. The lobby in Jambo house is so beautiful and there is African art and artifacts all over the hotel. I would not stay in Kadani, but their pool is best for the kids - we spent 2 lovely afternoons there and the kids had a blast - definitely worth the trip over there.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation of a lifetime, and this resort DID NOT DISAPPOINT”
Reviews.Author: HappyDisneyMama
Reviews.Content: My husband, children, and I stayed here from April 2nd 2011 thru the 10th, and we had THE MOST AMAZING time. We stayed at the Jambo house. We had the savannah view bunk bed room, and my 4 year old looooved that she could see giraffes and zebras and flamingos and gazelles and all kinds of animals from our balcony. The staff went above and beyond anything we ever expected. They were so helpful and friendly. The food at all 3 restaurants was amazing, although Boma was by far our favorite. The resort is breathtaking. So beautiful and unique. In my opinion the best out of all of the Disney resorts. The concierge was extra helpful in arranging multiple character dining experiences for us and the Disney busses were SOOOO convenient when going between resorts and parks. This was the perfect vacation. The pool and waterslide were awesome. My 12 year old son spent alot of time there. They even have Simba's Cubhouse, which is for kids age 4-12. Its $11.50 per child per hour and includes dinner, activities, and gives mom and dad that much needed break. We sent our kids there for a few hours one night and had some wonderful alone time that helped us relax and recharge. The kids LOVED it and had a great time. All in all this resort, and the whole vacation, was worth every single penny spent. We are already planning next years vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhoenisSunDog
Reviews.Content: We are DVC members and have stayed in numerous Disney hotels, but this was by far the best. We had a two bedroom lock off on the fifth floor looking over the Arusha Savanna at Jambo House. It was just the right amount of everything. We saw all kinds of animals outside our balcanoy, the pool is huge and clean, the restaurant mix met all our needs, bus transportation was quick, and the rooms were top notch. We were originally trying to get into Kidani Village, but I am so glad we got in here instead. We went over and had lunch one day at Kidani and it was in no way as impressive. We had our 15 year old daughter with us and she had her own room and absolutely enjoyed it. I can only imagine how younger kids would enjoy it. We ate at all three restaurants at Jambo and Sanaa at Kidani. Mara was good for quick lunches by the pool and getting our drinks. Boma was excellent, very pricey ($40 plus per entree), and Jiko -you can skip the buffet ($32 per person) not worth it. Sanaa was a good lunch place with different India taste.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite, but one significant small problem”
Reviews.Author: TjAtl68
Reviews.Content: Though I've been to Disney several times before I got married, this was our first family vacation to Disney and I researched meticulously and consulted all friends for advice. This recommendation did not disappoint. We were a party of 7 (my family of 5 plus my parents), and got the 2 bedroom villa at Kidani Village for a good deal as part of the early spring specials. Loved the decor, the beds and amenities. Kids adored the pool. It was not so remote - we were able to return to the room every afternoon for a swim / nap. Bus service to the parks was easy and didn't take too long (but it was "spring break" season, when the buses presumably run more frequently). The animals made regular showings -- afternoon is a good time to see them, which works well with an afternoon nap itinerary. The Boma buffet had good offerings for all palates, even for a self-confessed "foodie". Make reservations well in advance (like at least a month). It would have been a dream stay had our room not been "liberated" of our digital SLR camera that my husband had brought along for his business trip to Gainesville after the vacation. The safe is not large enough to fit 2 laptops and the big camera. Since it never left the room with us during our stay at Disney (not portable with 3 small kids in tow - used the CyberShot instead), it had to have departed with someone who had access to the room. For a high end resort with Disney service reputation this was a major disappointment, to say the least. Sure, we left it out for the picking but I expect more from a resort like this. This issue aside, it's a spectacular place to stay. Shop for deals and you can get a villa with a full kitchen and w/d. Kids are now refusing to stay anywhere else on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Let the memories begin”
Reviews.Author: Nancy2518
Reviews.Content: Our favorite Disney hotel so far!!! Our Disney memories began the night we arrived. As we got off the elevator and started looking for our room my daughter looked out the window and spotted a zebra (standing and sleeping in the savanna).... it was amazing. The savanna is filled with animals!! We could sit or stand on the balcony and watch the animals. The hotel is filled with amazing African artifacts. We chose the Kilimanjaro option and it was great! They offered a great breakfast with excellent coffee and the most delicious lemon muffins. In the evening they offered wine and cheese - a wonderful African Shiraz and Merlot. We have stayed at the Yacht Club, Key West, Caribbean Beach and Coronado Springs. Animal Kingdom Lodge is our favourite by far.

Reviews.Title: “WOW what a place”
Reviews.Author: AirlineTCX
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed hear April 07, wow what a hotel. My son was awake at 5.30am each morning to see which animals were outside of the balcony. It is a little dark in the lobby but you soon get used to it. Son loved the fact he could go to Disney all day, then come back and swim in the pool at night, it was heated so lovely and warm. Room was great, beds and pillows so comfy as soon as our heads hit the pillow, we were out like a light. Found we could always find something for each of us to eat at the self-service restaurant, if we decided to eat in the hotel. Transportaion to the parks really good. In all a great hotel & holiday, would easily go back tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: LIKETOTRAVEL125
Reviews.Content: This trip was really nice. Kids enjoyed it and you could see the animals off of our balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: halo_zandria
Reviews.Content: The lodge is very nice, Boma restaurant is excellent, and the pool is very kid friendly. We had a savanna view room, but it was not in the section we requested (several times) and workers were usually in the savanna in the mornings when we were in our room. Our room was also a good trek from the main entrance. We spent very little time in our room, so for us the price wasn't worth it. It was nice to have a refrigerator in the room for breakfast items and cold water. Animal Kingdom Lodge is closest to Animal Kingdom, so the bus ride to the other parks can take some time. This isn't the place to stay if you need to come back to your room everyday for a nap or break. That said, we never had any problems with the bus system and never had to wait more than 15 minutes. The pool is very kid friendly and has a zero entry, but it is often crowded. The dinner buffet at Boma is excellent. I would recommend spending one or two nights at AKL, but don't waste your money on a whole week there.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay in jamba house villas”
Reviews.Author: sammike1402
Reviews.Content: I am a dvc member stayed in a one bedroom villa in the jamba house I thought I was staying where all the villas were but no stayed at the hotel the villas are so far from the entrance forget bringing in any groceries which is why people stay in the villas for convince. I also think the rooms are alot smaller than any other one bedroom I have been in, the positive part was the view that was the only part very disappointed will never go back and I feel like I wasted my points on this place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Michelle780
Reviews.Content: We spent the first week of our two week vacation in Orlando at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge and were not disappointed. The savannah view from our balcony was absolutely amazing, with many different animals passing by at all times. It is worth the extra money to have a view, or stay somewhere else. The room is very small, however large enough for us to at least unpack our 4 suitcases. For the entire week I would estimate we spent 20 minutes TOTAL waiting for buses to the amusement parks and returning back to the resort. The bus rides were not long and there was much to see while travelling, you were dropped off at the gates to the parks and back at the front door of the resort and trust me, any walking you can avoid is a total bonus! The staff was fabulous and tended to our every need, the pool was fun for the kids. The activity center was definitely geared to younger children and was of no interest to our 11 year old son. Dining at this resort (and Disney in general) leaves much to be desired. It wasn't that the food was of poor quality or poorly prepared at our resort, it was that most options were African inspired and tasted very strongly. For myself and my son it was not enjoyable, however my husband did enjoy trying the different flavors. The quick-service restaurant Mara did have some plainer choices than the other two restaurants in our lodge. All-in-all the stay at this resort was wonderful, a very memorable experience and we don't regret spending the extra to have the 'Disney' experience.

Reviews.Title: “AKL - The Truth 2”
Reviews.Author: PWPres
Reviews.Content: Do dreams come true?....yes if you are staying at the AKL We stayed here in 07 (see my review on my profile) and were exited about getting a 1br villa at the Jambo house for this trip.......we loved AKL the first time we were there and we fell in love with the resort all over again. Folks to put it short.......everything about this resort is awesome. Period over the last five years were following a plan to try every Disney resort....that's over.......we'll be at the AKLV from now on.............Boma,Sanaa,Jiko....the best 1br villa..........perfect,comfortable,clean service 10 out of 10 the truth

Reviews.Title: “Bring the kids, but forget the romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: ninessica
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed in Animal Kingdom Lodge for 5 nights during our honeymoon. It was a 30% off deal Disney hotels were doing so we upgraded from Pop Century. Very African and tribal surroundings which may not have been the best for us but no doubt a family with kids will love it. Room: The room was ok. I had requested a king bed and got two queens. The bathroom (where the toilet and shower) was quite small and then more space for a large vanity. Didn't spend much time in the room but it was clean and the in room safe worked well. Service: To be honest, I didn't encounter many staff other than at the front desk (upon arrival) and restaurants. We never saw our housekeepers other than in the hallways. The guest shop people were really nice. Meals: Wasn't able to have a single meal in any of the restaurants on site because they were so busy. I would recommend making reservations for sure before hand. We had the quick service for snacks and such if we just got back to the parks. Transportation: Even though Animal Kingdom Lodge was far away from other parks (other than Animal Kingdom) I was surprised that we didn't wait more than 15 - 20 minutes for a bus and it didn't take long to travel to the parks. Summary: Bring the kids here, but romantic getaway - not so good.

Reviews.Title: “AKL is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: atljs
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at AKL twice now -- the first time in Oct 2006, and more recently in Oct 2010. This review applies to both stays. The property is absolutely gorgeous. Both times we had a savanna view room, in different areas of the property. We had no kids in our group, but we absolutely loved having the savanna view. The animals are typically up early, so by the time you get up there will already be a giraffe or something right outside your window. Great way to start a morning at Disney. Like others have said, the rooms are average size, to small. But they were clean, and of course the look of the room was in the style of the resort. As we were 3 adults, of course it would've been nice to have a slightly larger room, but since it was clean and since weren't in our room very often, we could overlook it. The walk-up restaurant, the Mara, is your typical Disney style one. Grab and go breakfast items (some hot), then burgers, etc for lunch and dinner. Definitely buy one of the mugs for $12 or so -- free refills at the resort, but not in the parks. While I didn't eat at the nicer restaurant on the property, Jiko, the other members of my party did and they said it was fantastic. We didn't use the pools, but we enjoyed walking around and checking everything out. The pools looked nice. As for the bus ride and wait times -- this definitely depends on what time of year you're there. As I said we were there in 2 different Octobers, and both times the ride and wait times weren't bad. Some times we'd be the only ones on the bus, after waiting only a few minutes. Then the next time we'd have to wait 15 minutes, only to see an already-full bus arrive. More often than not, it wouldn't be bad. I'm sure it's worse in more peak times. Those in our group were on slightly different flight schedules, so we were put on different buses. Since we wanted to ride to the airport together, they made the changes, with no problems. Also, we had no problems getting our boarding passes at the hotel. I absolutely loved staying at AKL and will always look here first when I return to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great for birthdays!”
Reviews.Author: broadwaychick93
Reviews.Content: Spent my 17th birthday at AKL, and I sure wasn't disappointed! The hotel is very charming and beautiful. I enjoyed being able to walk right from the pool to the savanna and gaze at the giraffes. Staff was very informative; don't pass up the opportunity to talk to them; most of them hail from Africa, and are more than happy to talk about their homelands. Staff also very friendly, stopping me to say happy birthday and the like. Don't miss the Zebra Dome treats at The Mara and Boma restaurants! Pool very nice and big; you can also go to the AKL Villas (Kidani Village) and use their pool (which has an excellent waterslide). Couldn't have asked for a better birthday trip! (Room was nice; requested a pool view; was close to the lobby, which was a blessing at the end of a long day!). Definately recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge is Great”
Reviews.Author: Surichar11
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a WDW vacation w/ 3 year old and 10 year old girls After reading reviews of AKL, I had some concerns regarding convenience, etc but it was where my husband wanted to stay. It was great. We booked a room overooking the Savanna. The room had bunk beds for the girls so no fighting about having to sleep with a restless three year old. We could see animals right off our balcony (typically in the early morning/late afternoon). The room was not spacious (but I have never stayed in a "spacious" room at Disney). However, it was clean and we had enough room to hang out. The heated pool was nice with the zero entry, making it great for the 3 year old. We had no issues with getting to the parks. We typically lined up for the bus between 7:15-7:30 and we were at the park gates before they opened. We never waited more than 10 minutes for a return. Because AKL is situated rather remotely, drop offs and pickups were not combined with any other facility (except, strangely, the bus to Hollywood Studios also stopped at Blizzard Beach, which was closed for renovations). The food was very very good at the high end restaurant -- Jiko; okay at the buffet restaurant (name I can't remember) and rather unmemorable at the walk up restaurant, which tends to be the Disney tradition for walk up restaurants. I continue to be lukewarm about Disney - I haven't quite discovered the magic -- crowds were huge after about 11 am; no chance to be spontaenous with dining options; after awhile having fun feels forced, but my girls had a good time. The only truly "unmagical" experience I had was with the Airline Transport counter at the lodge, where they provide boarding passes. They provided the passes for my husband, me, and the ten year old, but she couldn't find the three year old in the system. Rather than explain that there must be some sort of glitch in the system, she reasoned that we must have made the three year old's reservation separately and told me to call Delta. Rather, i asked if we could get on a computer and she said to go ask at the front desk. They, of course, were very nice to open the business center early where we rapidly printed off all boarding passes. If I was to return to Disnesy, we definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “wow lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: davsbabe
Reviews.Content: well where do i start? i did on line check in so when we got there about 1pm we went right to our room and wow what a room we had a savannah room i only booked a standred room we were blown away by this. later on in our stay we came back to our room and there was a red and yellow cooler with our last name on it and filled with snacks and a plush mickey and minnie i thought our children had sent it to us for our aniversery but when we read the card it was from the front desk staff holy cow now that was very sweet of them.we have been to the a.k.l. just to look around and eat but never stayed here before .my husband and son played drums and had a great time with all the a.k.l. staff we will be back to stay.oh and one more thing i timed how long of a drive it was on the bus to magic kingdom the best time 13 minutes from the time we were all loaded till we got to the park.longest tome 17 minutes from the time we got loaded till the park.i had a stop watch with me so i could give a good report its bad even with standing wich my husband of 60 did almost every time we were on the bus.so don't let the bus ride stop you from comming to a.k.l.i know that the staff will treat you just fine...

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: amask05
Reviews.Content: We had reservations for All Star Sports, but had a problem with our room and they sent us to AKL. AKL is a great looking hotel. The service is exceptional, just like any other Disney property.The room is not much larger than moderate or value disney hotel rooms. Two sinks in vanity area, but no door seperating it from bedroom , as in the Coronado. Shower\toilet area is not well lit at all. We had a view of the parking lot, which we could have had at any other hotel. Also, must pay extra for internet. For more than $ 300 a night, you would think they would not charge extra for internet. Beds were comfortable, pillows were very small. We could lower thermostat to desired temperature, unlike in the value or moderate hotels. I guess if you pay more for the room, you don't have to conserve energy. All in all, the room was nice, the atmosphere made up for any short comings. Two big negatives. The food court and the bus service. The AKL food court had less choices than the value hotel food courts. Definitely not as good as the Coronado's. The bus service was by far the worse of any Disney hotel that we have stayed. Waits were long and buses were always packed. Bus to animal kingdom took forever and was crowded. Would have been much quicker to drive ourselves. AKL is a beautiful hotel, but you can save a lot of money by staying at a value resort and viewing animals at Animal Kingdom. My family spends most of our time at the parks. Paying three times as much for a hotel room that we only sleep in, just is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Caratach
Reviews.Content: I have to say, for the money, I was disappointed. The restaurants were very crowded--Disney should add more. If someone in your party doesn't like spices, the fancy choices are no good. No pay per view, just a binder of old dvds downstairs. Kinda small rooms for the price. Very small space around toilet. Nothing special about room decor. No good room binder about hotel even. Animals, we paid for a view, were kinda neat but the African cows and deer = main animals out all the time, and got old fast. Only got giraffes very rarely. We paid over $300 a night, and I had a better time when we stayed at the cheaper Swan because there you could walk to the Boardwalk and the lake was nice, and could walk to Epcot and more restuarants. And, for the much cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property but with many little problems”
Reviews.Author: xy223yz
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay on a Disney resort property. The Animal Kingdom Lodge is an impressive property. The visual design is impressive and the hotel has a nice feel. The kids loved the animals being soo close to the property and right outside of the windows. The room was always clean. That being said, the room and property have a number of little problems that add up. First major problem, room service. We elected to get room service during 2 of our nights. The first time we attempted room service we were on hold for 45 minutes. We gave up and tried the front desk for some assistance. We were told that this is par for the course at night and to continue to hold. We gave up and just ordered pizza from a delivery place. The second time we were on hold for 25 minutes. For a "Deluxe" hotel this is simply not acceptable. Having stayed at plenty of true "deluxe" hotels (i.e. Ritz, JW Marriott, Hyatt Regency, etc) this just does not measure up. Second problem, room size. We had a pool view room. The room was nicely decorated but it was small for a "deluxe" hotel. We had family stay at one of the "value" hotels during our stay and our room was not much larger than theirs. While the double sinks were nice, the room is tight. Most Hilton Garden Inn rooms are larger than the rooms at the Lodge. Third, the pool. First, we personally didn't have any incidents at the pool. However, during our one day at the pool we witnessed almost two drownings right under the lifeguard's nose. The lifeguard was busy chatting while two small children on two different occassions found themselves underwater and in trouble. I'm not about to remove parental responsibility, however the lifeguard was clearly caught with his pants down as strangers came to the rescue I don't want you to walk away with the impression that this is not a nice property. However, when you add up the little things, you are clearly paying a premium for being at a "Disney" property when compared to what you would get and expect at a high end hotel for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous can't wait to go back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hrycyszyn1
Reviews.Content: I just returned from our stay at the AK we were there from March 1st to March 9th. It was fabulous!! I never wrote a review before but felt like I should because of all the negative reviews I read before we left. The rooms were a nice size not huge but not little. Some people wrote there was no place to put their luggage the beds were high enough off the floor to store them under the beds or under the sinks. The rooms were very clean so I felt good about putting them on the floor. We paid for a standard room at the Jambo house but got a great view of all the animals. There was a feeder for the giraffes right out from our balcony!! I also read that people thought the bus rides took forever or got off at the wrong stop. The Magic Kingdom was the futherest park but it only took about 20 minutes to get there to me that's not that big of a deal. Now for getting off at the wrong stop then they just were not listening. The driver will annouce which stop it is there are only 2. Either you are in Jambo house or at the Kidani Village. 90% of the time they went to the villas first. So all you have to do is pay attention. The last day we were there we went over to the Kidani Village to check it out, we found washer and dryers there which would have been good to know since we have a 3 year old who loved the ice cream at the parks.So needless to say we ran out of shirts for her. You don't have to pay for them just the laundry detergent. All in all the price for the room is for the experience you are paying for the animals what other hotel can you get a standard room with a giraffe view? Can't wait to go back next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Hukuna Matata...Except for the busses!”
Reviews.Author: AHunderthegritstree
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Animal Kingdom’s Jumba House as a Valentine’s Day get away. We arrived on a Tuesday and left Friday. This was our first time staying in a Deluxe Resort, having stayed at Pop Century and Coronado Springs on Previous trips. I have to say that overall the hotel was amazing! We had not planned to stay in a Savannah View Room but, thanks to our request for a birthday button, were upgraded at check-in. Our view was of the Sunset Savannah and we saw animals all hours of the day and night. Watching the animals was fascinating, we were on the 2nd floor which turned out to be the perfect level, and it was very difficult for us to leave the balcony. When staying here in the future, a Savannah View Room will be a must! We ate breakfast a Bomo every morning of our stay and very much enjoyed the experience. And, blessed by excellent weather, we were able to spend two afternoons at the pool! A tip: there are lounge chairs on the backside of the pool, behind the cabana, that face the Savannah…layout here, the view is much better. You can lay by a pool and watch sunbathers anywhere, but I’d never sunbathed with a giraffe before! Everyone at the resort was friendly and accommodating, be sure to take time to chat with the Savannah Guides, they are full of info about the animals on the Savannahs and their homelands. I have to share that although the overall experience was wonderful there was one big negative, the bus service. The bus service was the worst I had ever experienced and this was at least my 10th stay at a Disney Resort in the past 5 years. We waited 40 minutes on the first morning that we were there for a bus to the Animal Kingdom. By the end of our trip we had resorted to catching a cab to and from the parks, which seems very unnecessary to me as I have used Disney transportation often in the past without any issues of long wait times. My husband, a business owner with a “get it done right and get on out of my way” attitude was particularly bothered.
