We expect the best of Disney because that is what we have always received; poor service of any kind was a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “An Escape from the craziness of Disney”
Reviews.Author: CinnaPatty
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this place. Stayed in a room overlooking the pool. Was worried about pool noise but it was not a problem. We had bunks in the room and one bed for us. Perfect layout. Loved having the two sink vanity separate from the toilet and shower. Roomy enough. Bed area was a little cramped but all we did was sleep in there so who cares? Had a lanai, that was pleasant. Towel animals were entertaining! People seem afraid to stay here as it is the farthest away from the parks. We didn't mind at all. The decor was breath taking. We walked around with mouths open upon arrival in the lobby. Very peaceful. The grounds, also, breath taking. We saw animals all the time, day and night. It was an amazing experience. We did not eat in the resort restaurant but rather at the food place by the pool. It had great variety and did not disappoint for any meal. The pool was very fun. We came back mid day a couple times and the boys loved playing in the pool. We also would swim at night until we couldn't keep our eyes open. We liked walking through the gift store every time we arrived at the resort. We knew we wanted something so it was fun to walk through and look for that treasure we would take home! The pillows in our room were so amazing I called after we'd returned home to find out what they were and we ordered some for our home. Ahhhh, the luxury. Disney Bus transportation was reliable. No problems with that. We loved it so much we would not want to stay anywhere else at WDW.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, peaceful atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: Beach_Bum_In_Vegas
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay. My room overlooked the parking lot so I did not get to take advantage of spotting animals from my balcony. There are common viewing areas but the few times I tried nothing was out. The room was a standard double bed set up. The beds were comfortable. Room was clean. I just think the prices are too high for a room compatible to a Marriott. This place is all about room location so if you can't secure a savannah room I would move on to another hotel closer to the main parks

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 4Stars021
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice now, there are only 2 words - Amazing and perfect. We had a savanna room the 2nd time, free upgrade wow wow wow, a family of girraffes just outside our balcony every morning, made our holiday simply perfect! The service is fantastic, as in most places in Disney they just cannot do enough for you, the rooms are lovely, very big comfy beds, decor lovely with an African theme, if you can stay here, do it!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: L0ngIslandL0ngisland
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults, 3 kids..9, 7 & 2 yrs old) was very happy with our stay at AKL. Check-in took awhile but only because the staff did everything they could to give us the room we had requested. A huge bonus was the great view from our balcony. We saw plenty of animals (giraffes, zebras, cranes & others) from our room in the mid-evening hours on. The room was on the small side but still comfortable. Housekeeping was great, the rooms were spotless. Bed was very comfortable & not noisy at all. We never heard noise from the surrounding rooms either. We used the pool once & it was very nice. The food court had good variety. We ate at Boma twice for breakfast & it was fresh, delicious & just perfect. We had a rental car (which I highly suggest) so I can't comment as to park transportation. The only real negative was the small & dark shower/toliet area in the room. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Experience of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: Ulysses08
Reviews.Content: Wow we woke up each morning to watch the giraffes drinking at the waterhole just outside our balcony. This disney resort is a must to stay. We travelled with our two adult daughters and stayed in one room. Next time two rooms. The rooms are on the smaller side for four adults however comfortable and beautifully decorated to the african theme. We stayed for 3 nights then transferred to the Floridian resort for a change, would of rathered stayed at the Animal kingdom as it was unique. We loved the animals in our backyard.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful but too far from MK and Epcot!”
Reviews.Author: Bringonspring
Reviews.Content: We just returned from AKL- Jambo House, where we stayed for 7 nights. My husband, three sons (8, 6, 2 yrs.), parents, and I all travelled together from Ottawa. I love WDW (we've been before but never with the grandparents) and hoped that this would be the trip of a lifetime, but there were a number of little "hiccups" once we arrived. I won't bore you with all the details - mistakes were made but the staff were courteous and upgraded our room. The lobby and guest rooms are beautiful- exactly like the pictures. The housekeeping was excellent. The pool, hot tubs, and waterslide were also excellent. My boys enjoyed seeing the animals on the savannah, but to be honest, I didn't find it overly impressive. Usually, there weren't many animals out there. Two smaller complaints that our group had was the lack of WiFi (from Hubby and Grandpa) and lack of hand cream (Grandma thought it would automatically be there with the soaps in the bathroom). My biggest problem with the AKL was the bus service to the parks. We have stayed at a number of other Disney resorts over the years and AKL was new to us. What I didn't realize when booking our holiday, was that the location of the resort means that we would have to endure about a 30 minute bus ride to and then from the parks each day (not including the wait times for the bus). The busses are clean and the drivers are friendly (what else would you expect at Disney?) and they come every 20 min., but when added up over the course of the week, we would have preferred to stay at a monorail resort. We stayed on-site so that we could come back to our hotel in the afternoon for some down time, however the bus ride dissuaded us from doing this, making it a more tiring trip than it should have been. My husband began timing the bus rides. It took us 40 minutes to get to Downtown Disney one morning. Our favourite parks are MK and Epcot, which are furthest from the AKL, so next time, we'll try the Grand Floridian. I read TripAdvisor many times while planning our trip, so I thought I should pass this little tidbit on because I didn't read this complaint before and I didn't think the location of the resort would have mattered as much. I recommend AKL, it is a lovely resort on its own, but for our family, we'll choose somewhere with better transportation next time.

Reviews.Title: “A wild time at the Animal Kingdom Lodge - FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: TLC23
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 nights in this beautiful resort. Our room was cleaned every day - the room felt clean and fresh every night when we returned. Our room overlooked the Sunset Savanna. The front desk staff were friendly but were a bit too quick in explaining everything to me (much to take in). The Mara and Boma restaurants were fabulous. Wonderful food - even for my picky eaters (kids aged 7 & 9). The cast members were delightful and so helpful. The kids had bunk beds - which made life so much easier. The pool was warm and wonderful too. After a long hot day - we would head down for a before bed swim to relax. I have nothing bad to write. Our family had the trip of a lifetime!!! We leave in 10 months on the Disney Dream Cruise Ship for a 5-Night Bahamian Cruise. Gotta love Disney!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place with a few oddities”
Reviews.Author: Frank K
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Animal Kingdom Lodge (AKL) front desk at 3:15, Sunday Afternoon. The computer system went down moments before our turn at the desk. Without the computer, the Front Desk was basically helpless. Not enough people to do it manually. They could not check room availability, issue room keys or even check our reservations. Nada. After 30 minutes of no service, a back office person came by and explained it was a problem with an indefinite down time. After an hour of this, the desk clerk took our phone number and told us to go have dinner and bring the receipt. So, off to dinner. After walking around for a while (too early to eat initially), we went over to the Boma buffet. Since we did not have a reservation, we settled down for what we thought would be a long wait as people with reservations surged ahead of us. Well, about ten minutes after we got there the dinner reservation system went down and they had to write down names and times on a note pad. We had told them we did not have a reservation, but with the system down, and working off of note pads, they just took whoever was there. We got in within a few minutes. $95 worth of dinner later we left and sure enough they paid for it. They also gave us two attractions "Priority Passes" to go to the head of the line at one ride at a park, but we did not need them. No big crowds in February. Note: the buffet has a lot of different food types that are fun to try but may not be something you want every day. We had “upgraded” to a pool view, but the room was near an inside corner and the pool was barely visible way off to the right through some trees. Not close to the grand view I saw in the web site photo gallery. Oddly enough I am certain they had rooms available with much better views - the place was not crowded at all, so I don’t understand why they felt compelled to put us there. I guess they reserve those great view rooms for those who complain, or pay full price. We did neither. I was not in the mood to complain. After being roomless for three and a half hours, we just wanted to find a place to park ourselves. The room was fine. We also availed ourselves of the Bell service. For a few dollars in tips, it saves a lot of hassle. Turns out there was an unintended benefit to our corner room. We were only a few hallway steps away from a gorgeous overlook that gave us a great view of the Savannah area. The space was large, with several comfortable rocking chairs. Much more comfortable than the cramped confines of a balcony room with those small metal chairs. Next time, we’ll get a standard view and just walk to a savannah overlook when we want to see the animals. That was really nice. Giraffes, Thompson’s Gazelle's and many other interesting animals wandered around just yards away from the overlook. Jinko was an excellent, pricey restaurant. We ate there the second night. Yet, again, we found ourselves treated in a minimalist way. We were ushered to a table right next to the service area used by the waiters. Seemed odd to put us there when there were many better located unused tables set elsewhere. I guess you have to speak up aggressively to get better service, but for what we’re spending on the dinner and for what they advertise in service, that should not be necessary. At that level of service, you should not be expected to request special treatment – it should be taken for granted. Access to the parks was all by Bus. Not a big issue except take care on the return. The bus says “Animal Kingdom Lodge”, but it makes an extra stop at another Animal Kingdom Lodge before it gets to the main Hotel lodge. After a long tired day, we were only half listening to the canned voice so when we got to the familiar stop, we just got off and only after the bus left did we realize our error. The two places look very similar, particularly at night, but they are very different. You do not stop there on the way out. Took an extra 20 minutes to get to our place. Oh well. Overall, we will return to AKL. It was really nice and grew on us as we stayed. Lots of little corners and alcoves to discover and “hang out” in and relax in relative seclusion and peace. Service was very kind though not always the best, and they try hard to make it a positive experience. They were clearly distraught about the computer issues they were having, but that is something we will all have to get used to everywhere we go. It is not unique to Disney, and when they work, computer systems are fabulous, but when they fail, there is little to no backup. Having been visiting Disney parks off and on for decades (I live one hour away) I notice changes on occasion. One new Customer Service technique I noticed they have gotten down really well is conversation. When you find you have to spend time with one of their employees, say waiting on a ticket, or a bus, or just hanging out, they will strike up friendly conversations with you about what you are enjoying and plan to do, and about things they like to do and suggest ideas to augment your own experience. Every employee I ran into encouraged a friendly chat. Nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: blessed-mom1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the AKL and loved it. The rooms were very clean and the savannah room was well worth it. We had a great view of the animals and our daughter loved it. We have stayed at many Disney properties and this is one of the best. We will stay again !!

Reviews.Title: “unique experience - choose your room wisely”
Reviews.Author: Friquent_traveler
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said, this hotel offers an experience that you will not get anywhere outside of Africa, which is worth the price. The resort itself is also well done, if inevitably a little artificial. Savannah view rooms are worth the price (I am not sure we would have wanted to stay here otherwise), but note that all Savannah View rooms are not the same. We stayed for two nights; the first of our Savannah view rooms looked across to another wing of the hotel and did not have the feel of Africa at all. The giraffes came for the food left for them every morning and departed immediately when they'd finished. We asked for a room change, and were provided a room that looked across to the time share (Kidani Village, I believe it's called). This was far better - more animals, and something of the feeling of Africa (we have been to Kenya and Tanzania five or six times). Giraffe, zebra, wildebeast hung out all evening, and we could watch the sunset. As far as I know, there was no price difference in the rooms, but the experience was completely different.

Reviews.Title: “Best Honeymoon Ever!”
Reviews.Author: anangel32003
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend Animal Kingdom Lodge enough! My new hubby and I stayed at the Kilimanjaro Club level. Ths savanah view is well worth it. One night we even had a giraffe sleeping right outside our window. The staff is beyond courteous. My husband and I can be very picky and I can honestly say we never experienced even the smallest problem. The grounds are always clean and several times we saw some kind fo improvement happening. ie: painting, etc. I do recommend a rental car over the bus since it is one of the further resorts from the parks (with exception to Animal Kingdom). But if you are looking for a clean, luxurious, home away from home with a twist this is the place to go! Five stars all the way!!

Reviews.Title: “The most wonderful place ever”
Reviews.Author: vfoppe
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the most wonderful place I have ever stayed at!! The place was spotless, the views of the animals were amazing from our balaconey. The attention to details with the furniture and the carpet to have the lion king theme was amazing!! The use of the buses and transportation was great to use on the Disney property. It was the most beautiful and wonderful place i have ever stayed in! well worth the money and expense anytime!! The swimming pool was amazing as well!!

Reviews.Title: “A "must visit"”
Reviews.Author: NapaWineLover
Reviews.Content: We loved Animal Kingdom Lodge! We had a Savannah view room and saw plenty of giraffe, zebra, Tommys and other animals during our stay. What a treat to sit on the small deck and watch them eating in the early evening. The restaurants at AKL are great - Boma has a great breakfast buffet and we had an awesome dinner at Jiko. We've stayed at French Quarter on prior visit and AKL was definitely a step up. No Wifi as others noted but heck - it's vacation - who needs the internet! Wired internet access is available if you really need an online fix. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: beaniegirl6
Reviews.Content: me and my family stayed here and we enjoyed every mintue. the decore was amazing the rooms were clean and fearly well decorated although the drives to the parks was a little long it was worth it our room was on the first floor it was easy to get everywhere we were so close to the pool my children loved the pool they were in it every second they could i would recommend this hotel to EVERYONE!

Reviews.Title: “What! No wifi?”
Reviews.Author: realapprsr
Reviews.Content: I teach a class in our local Community College on touring WDW, so we (wife and I) have been to WDW at least once each year since it opened in 1971. We always stay at a different on-site hotel to keep up on things. Because I have a class coming up in March, and since we had not stayed at AKL since just after it opened, we decided to stay for an extended weekend from 2/04 to 2/09. Our flight out of Chicago got us to the hotel shortly before noon, and we had previously used the on-line check-in service. When our reserved room was not yet ready, we were offered an alternate which was ready. The alternate was a handicapped accessible room and because it was on the same level as the lobby and only four rooms away from the lobby it worked out fine. We had a view over the Sunset Savanna, and were able to view giraffe, zebra, eland, ostrich, and various other fauna, mostly in the late afternoon or early evening. The facilities in the room were much the same as I remembered from our earlier stay, and the service, etc. was generally up to Disney standards. We had breakfast and dinner in the Boma restaurant which was great. The Mara quick-service restaurant was fine for breakfast on the other days. Other meals were taken either at the theme parks, at Downtown Disney, or at the other hotels. Because we always rent a car at the airport, access to the major theme parks was not problem. We did not take any of the Disney buses, having learned our lesson about commuting times in the past. My only real complaint was the lack of wifi in the hotel. Recent trips around the US and throughout Europe, we were almost always able to check email, etc., via my laptop which is always with me. At AKL, I had to rely on my phone for receiving emails, but i have found it much more difficult to respond on a smart phone (my fingers are too big for the keyboard, and I'm too old to be able to use only my thumbs like my grand kids do). I mean, come on this is the 21st century. So, our stay was comfortable, but we have always enjoyed the WDW hotels. If not for the lack of computer facilities, I would probably rated this hotel five rather than four stars.

Reviews.Title: “Winter Weekend at Disney”
Reviews.Author: purpletreegirl
Reviews.Content: Disney trip with my daughter age ten and my sister. We had 4 nights and 3 full days at Disney. I booked a private car from the airport instead of the Disney buses and I think it saved on time and convenience with our luggage. Of course did not save on cost. Check in was smooth except for the fact that Expedia booked the room under my Middle name instead of last name. AKL said they would change it but never did. Our room was ready and we were able to drop our bags and hop right on a bus the AK Park for extra magic hours. Yeah. The rest of the weekend we took Disney transportation from AKL and had no significant waits. One exception was Universal Studios which I again booked a car to go see the Wizarding World of Harry Potter. We had breakfast at Boma which is pricy but quite a treat. Dinner at Sanaa which was also very nice. As far as the room it was very nice and clean, comfortable beds, good lighting but disappointing view as far as animals. We never had any wildlife outside our window until the last afternoon. Overall a wonderful stay. I would probably pick another Disney property next time just for the different experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort for the money”
Reviews.Author: Spershing
Reviews.Content: My husband and three year old son stayed 7 nights at the AKL on the fourth floor, labled the Arusha Savanna view- about a 400.00 per nite room plus tax- the room was clean, beds were very comfortable not squeaky like I'm reading in some other reviews. We are a temperpedic bed family so we are quick to judge the beds everywhere we stay - these beds were nice and comfie!! I actually found a booklet in the room that gives u the option if u want to purchase the bed type they provide- it's called Sealy posturepedic- The room is small but we usually don't stay in the room that much anyway but we did room service for our breakfast mist mornings bc we saw tons of animals.. Anywhere from giraffes,zebras, red river hogs, antelope, ankole cattle, impalas, waterbucks and several different types of birds. I never heard any guests next to us or above us! The staff is extremely friendly- almost too nice if there is such a thing- we usually dined at night at Jiko, a little pricy but well worth it! I def recommend to anyone considering AKL!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here at LEAST once if you can!”
Reviews.Author: Lifergirl1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 5 year old grandson and our son and daughter-in-law to Disney for a week and stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge - Kidani Village. Fabulous! It was our first time at Disney World and wanted to stay on property. We all loved the room. We had a two bedroom unit with three bathrooms. There was a king bed in the "master" bedroom and two queen size beds in the second bedroom. Our children and our grandson were very happy in the "other" bedroom. Both bedrooms have ceiling fans as well as the living area. We did not have a savanah view room, but we really did not find that to be any problem at all. The beds/pillows were very comfortable for all parties. We loved the layout as the living area separates the two bedroom areas and they could be closed off for complete privacy when necessary. The kitchen was nicely appointed and to our surprise, we had a washer and dryer in the room, so we did not need to carry clothes to the common area laundry (which was lovely) but know one had to be away from the family for laundry chores. They also provide a recycle can in the room, as well as a trash container. We stopped on our way for groceries and got in around noon and our room was not due to be ready til 4 p.m. The staff was wonderful and provided containers and refrigeration for our groceries til the room was ready. Which, by the way, was available at 2 p.m. There is a small, but nicely stocked, store at Kidani, but expect to pay a lot more for what you need. The main + for the Disney properties is Convenience, convenience, convenience. Park your car if you have one; and walk down the hall to the sheltered bus area and go to the park of your choice. Leave the park, walk to the bus area and back to the resort you go. Before we left, I read lots of reviews that the AKL was so far from everything and that is indeed true, however, it never took longer than 20-30 minutes on the bus from the farthest point. Do keep that in mind with little children, but our grandson is 5 and he was never antsy about the bus ride - either way. The pool area is great with a nice area for the little ones and a very nice hot tub as well. There is a community room where the children can do crafts or color; play games like foose ball and WII and pool and the staff there are great. The activities in this room are free. There is also an arcade (this costs money of course) but they have some great things there and both of these places are great for the times it might be raining or in the evenings if you don't have the omph for more Disney parks. There are many wonderful "viewing" areas for the sighting of animals on the savanah. Even though we did not have a savanah view there is a lovely balcony which spans both bedrooms and the living area...great for morning coffee and a little reading before you start the day. The restaurant in Kidani is very nice and we were lucky enough to have lunch there while they were feeding the animals and it was wonderful. There are two additional restaurants at Jamba House. You can walk, which they say is a 9 minute walk, but we all walked over together and it didn't seem very long at all. If you are not up to the walk though, they run a little shuttle van from Kidani to Jamba and back. Jamba also has a much larger store as well. I cannot say enough about the staff - and how knowledgeable and accomodating they are - and the accomodations. It is a lovely place indeed. My only negative is that it is dark - dimly lit - and if you want any time in your room to watch a little TV, there is not much to choose from except Disney commercials and info channels. Also, for those of you who like to stay connected via computer, be prepared to pay $10/day for the priviledge.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort”
Reviews.Author: jami_in_tx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge Resort for 6 nights. The atmosphere is amazing. The place is very clean and the staff is super friendly. Lots of activities are offered. My only complaint is the bed. It was not comfortable and was noisy, but this will not stop me from returning!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: kkjmluv2travel
Reviews.Content: Our overall experience with the Animal Kingdom Lodge was very positive. We stayed in a club level , savannah view room. When we first arrived we were greeted with a giraffe as close as he could have possibly been to our balcony! The theming of this hotel is outstanding. The restaurants are fantastic & the kids loved the pool and kids club. The only downsides were the location within Disney itself (it is kind of a hassle getting to the different theme parks), and the room size. I would definitely go back though. Would not go without a car.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy at AKL”
Reviews.Author: luvinluca
Reviews.Content: My husband, almost 3 year old, and I just returned home from staying 3 nights at AKL Jambo House. I booked a standard room but was able to get a partial view room upon request and availability. I was told many of the partial view rooms used to be considered savannah rooms but are now not and have some type of obstructed view. For our room it was a little fenced in area, which i would have never noticed. We did see some animals from our balcony, we stayed on the 3rd floor which is the same floor as the lobby, which was convenient for us. I never planned on paying extra for the savannah room simply because I only ended up sitting out on the balcony 2x anyway. I got lucky, but if it is that important to you then splurge- otherwise, save the money and take your chances. The rooms were clean and staff were very helpful. I guess I did notice the bed a little creeky, but come on people its not that serious. Boma was awesome and their quick service good as well. I was most concerned about the commute from the resort to Magical Kingdom, but honestly for us it wasn't a big deal. We waited maybe 10 minutes for the bus and the drive took 25 minutes max. It gave us a chance to map out our day and once again it was not worth the extra money just to pay for location. Bottom Line- If you want want of the deluxe resorts AKL is an awesome choice. It seemed to be less expensive, but did not compromise any of our standards. It was a unique experience that we will never forget!!!

Reviews.Title: “Where Are The Animals?”
Reviews.Author: suzyjacuzzi
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night visit to the Animal Kingdom Jumba House. Since we were taking our niece (14) and nephew (9) as their Christmas gift we decided to upgrade and pay the premium for a savannah view. Our double queen room was clean and nicely outfitted, however, a bit on the small side. The bathroom had a double sink with a very small separate toilet/shower area. The lighting in the shower area was extremely dim. The “savannah” view from our balcony was definitely not as impressive as we had hoped. Our balcony overlooked a very dry/barren land area with a few trees and a watering hole. During our stay, we only saw a few zebras, a water buffalo and one distant sighting of a giraffe. This was a disappointment as we had hoped to see a lot more animals from our balcony. The beds were comfortable but, as another reviewer had mentioned, extremely squeaky and noisty. This was a huge problem because anytime that someone moved in their bed we could hear a loud creaking noise. The beds have large wooden frames so I guess it’s the internal structure causing this noise. In addition, we were shocked that the resort does not have Wi-Fi and the only TV stations available are owned by Disney. TBS, USA, TNT, etc. are not available. Pay per view movies are not available. The pool area was fantastic - great little pool bar and plenty of life guards staffed all around the pool. It was cool during our stay but the pool water was warm for all to enjoy. The gym at the hotel had plenty of cardio machines and free weights. We dined at Jiko one night and had a fabulous meal. The restaurant is pricey and portions are small but service and ambience was nice which made for an enjoyable dining experience. The lobby of Animal Kingdom is gorgeous and spacious with lots of earth tones, dim lighting and seating areas. There is also an indoor and outdoor firepit for guests to enjoy. The only other “issue” is that the room service menu is very limited for children. The resort only offer 4/5 choices for children and does not have the typical pizza, hot dog, chicken nuggets that are popular with anyone under the age of 12. We had pizza delivered to our room one night from an outside restaurant (Flippers) which worked out really well. The bar at the hotel is really nice with very personable staff and great service. There is no food service at the bar but you can order off the room service menu and they will deliver to your bar seat/table. We did not try out the breakfast or dinner buffet – however, both were packed solid whenever we went by them. Overall service and hospitality at the resort was top notch!! Everyone we encountered was polite, efficient and helpful. I’m just not sure this Disney resort is worth the hefty room rate. There might be better options out there.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: KayBrook
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here because we have always loved the lobby and atmosphere of the resort. We paid for a savannah view. The room was so far away from the lobby. The rooms were very small and ours was very dusty. The beds were not comfortable either. There were some animals but for what you pay it was not worth it. All transportation was by bus and the longest time spent in the bus was to Magic Kingdom and it was only about 20min, so that was not to bad. Over all, beautiful resort to look at but not to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, room was just okay”
Reviews.Author: SwissMiss24
Reviews.Content: We extended a business trip to stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge with a savannah view room. The savannah view was pretty cool--definitely something do do once, but I'm not sure it was worth the $350/night price tag. We found that the animals were mostly out between 2-4 p.m. We made the mistake of ordering an expensive room service breakfast the first morning so we could eat and watch the savannah, but they don't seem to be out then, so if you want to have a meal and watch the animals, aim for a late lunch. My biggest complaint is about the beds. Usually I can sleep pretty much anywhere and the beds are not super important to me. But these were hard, squeaky and uncomfortable. The linens felt scratchy too. For a Disney deluxe hotel I was expecting a lot more. The hotel is beautifully themed, and you can wander the halls and find interesting exhibits, works of art, and areas for viewing animals. The fire pits in particular are a nice touch. We like the Mara food court, and had an amazing meal at Sanna, next door at Kidani Village. All of the staff we interacted with were super friendly. I got sick on the last day and they extended our checkout time and helped get my bags checked and boarding pass printed even though I was in the room lying down. I'm glad we did this one for the experience. On the next visit to Disney we'll probably stay elsewhere and just visit the lodge for a meal and some animal watching.

Reviews.Title: “Our First, and definitely not last stay at Animal Kingdom Lodge!”
Reviews.Author: MinneapolisMomof3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge with my husband and our oldest son who is 7. We chose the Animal Kingdom Lodge because our son loves animals, and we also wanted the convenience of staying at a Disney property. The Disney Magical Express bus was fantastic; a seamless transport from airport to hotel. Upon check in we received outstanding service, with the hotel staff guiding us through purchasing the tickets, helping us pick what we need for the best value, with no pressure. They even offered suggestions of things to check out in the parks. Our room was beautiful; it was very clean with a beautiful view of the animals. It is true that you couldn't always see the animals right next to your balcony, but we could usually see a couple in the distance. Sitting out there with the morning coffee was heavenly. The restaurants were good, although it would have been nice to have a little more variety. We ate a couple days at the Mara, which is essentially a grill that has burgers, etc. We also ate at Jiko our first night; the food was fantastic (try the spare ribs!) and our waiter was fantastic! Our son has a severe peanut allergy and ended up having a reaction at the Animal Kingdom. We returned to the hotel after seeing the medical staff at the park, and the staff called up several times to check on our son. They had benadryl sent up to our room and were very attentive. The pool area - what can I say? Gorgeous! They have a pool that looks exactly like the ocean, and has a section that you can actually walk into the pool, just like the ocean. The pool area is extremely clean, and the bartenders at the pool bar were wonderful. In summary, we will definitely stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge the next time were are at Disney! We had a wonderful experience and hope to bring our younger twin boys with us next time!

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: lpo1
Reviews.Content: I didn't think it was worth the extra cost. Disney has better hotels for less money. The rooms felt dingy, the animal terrain wasn't that impressive... the fancy restaurant there was cool enough, but the others were just the standard Disney fair. Also, the pool was closed, which they didn't tell us beforehand and which really put a damper on things. I would say to stay somewhere else--not worth paying luxury prices for an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Pluto24
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa on the 5th floor at Jambo House. I'm a DVC member and this my home resort. We had a great view of the Arusha Savanna. I checked in online and when I arrived my package was ready for me. The room was not ready, so we went down and ate lunch at the Mara. While I was eating I received a text message with my room number. The room was amazing! There was plenty of room for three of us plus the electric scooter. We saw lots of animals out on the balcony. We could even see Everest from the room. There was also another attraction, but I'm not sure what it was. I thought it might be Tower of Terror. It had a green glow at night, and we could see some fireworks. I thought that the lighting was perfect and the decor was wonderful. I loved taking the bridge over the lobby to the elevators. The view of the lobby from up there was cool! There was a great view of a hidden Mickey in one of the lights in the lobby. The staff was very friendly and I can't wait to go back! Next time I'm staying at Wilderness Lodge because I want to stay at every resort.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, well equipped”
Reviews.Author: salsasal_11
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort. The animals are close up and beautiful. The restaurant is amazing. There are hidden mickys, activities, lectures for the older kids, and people to talk to who come from various coutnries in Africa. In hind-sight I wish we had researched more of the things to do inside the lodge and not pre-purchased the park tickets. There is plenty to keep kids interested within this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Made to feel welcome and at home”
Reviews.Author: floridaldyjag57
Reviews.Content: Just got home from a 4 1/2 day stay at the Jumbo house for my birthday, the second yr in a row and we had the best time.Loved the hotel and all the cast members.Everyone on the club level 6th floor were wonderful,especially Wayne.Plan to go back every yr if I have my way.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag: animals great; room not so”
Reviews.Author: northCountryClauds
Reviews.Content: Watching animals out the window was great, but the room was inconvenient and drafty. The only chairs were in the draftiest corner and space cramped. Food was very expensive and OK, not great. Best restaurant was the Sanaa, which unfortunately we didn't try until next to last day there. Bus service wasn't up to Disney standards. We waited over 20 minutes more than once and the buses are only option from the Lodge. I prefer the Epcot hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Families”
Reviews.Author: AussieBSquared
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights and overall had a positive experience. The staff at this hotel were very friendly and efficient. The concierge recommended several great restaurants outside Disney and provided directions to all the good shopping venues. The hotel common areas were wonderful and being able to watch the animals roam around was pretty cool even though there didn't seem too many around. The gym was modern and had sufficient treadmills and cross training machines along with a good supply of weight training gear. The pool was not working during our stay (winter) but it looked very good. The room had two queen size beds and a balcony overlooking the animals but during our stay we saw very few animals from our balcony. Personally, I found the rooms slightly dated and a little small but they were clean and had everything one would need for a few nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Hotel with an amazing atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: FishersTraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from a 3 day trip at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge! We had a great time at this beautiful resort! We stayed in a "partial Savannah view" room. However, we were able to see all sorts of animals every day! We saw giraffes, water buffalo, zebras and all sorts of birds! The hotel is extremely clean and the staff is very accommodating! I highly recommend this hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive facility - Questionable Value”
Reviews.Author: PLOTs_travel
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Disney property - and we have two small children. On a previous trip to Orlando we stayed at the Marriott Village. We stayed on property since we were only there for a quick weekend and knew the destinations we wanted to hit for the kids. Not being hard core Disney people, the entire operation is a bit overwhelming - from the mass transit, to the retail sales, to the theme parks. The kids had a ball. Animal Kingdom Lodge was beautiful - well maintained, clean, beautiful pool and grounds. We had no trouble with our stay in the hotel and made it quickly via Disney bus transit to all our destinations. Our major issue with this trip was the Magical Express transporation to/from the airport. If you travel a lot, I would highly recommend your own airport transportation as this was enough to drive me crazy. It took us 2.5 hours upon landing to get to our room. We had to be on the bus back to the airport 3 hours ahead of flight time. It was neither magical nor express in my opinion. Many activities at Disney feel like cattle car types of events - mass crowds moving one direction and then to another. While not our style, the kids did enjoy themselves. Questionable value for this facility comes from the price tag associated with the hotel and the benefits received. We stayed in a similar type of room (queen bed, bunk beds) in the Marriott Village for about $125 less per night and had just as good of accomodation and service. While the ambiance is far superior at the lodge, and the transportation to and from the parks was convenient, you have to forgo any kind of value seeking frame of mind you may have when going to Disney. It's overpriced from beginning to end and you just have to go in knowing it and dealing with it. The smiles on the kids faces are worth it, though.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel...but poor value”
Reviews.Author: Cashewfeni
Reviews.Content: For the price I paid for one night in low season, I could have had two or more nights in an ocean front 4 star hotel at peak time on the East Coast. The latter would be far valuable to me. Especially since we did not see any exotic animals out of our "arusha view" room...and even if I did, the view of the ocean and people there is far more valuable to me. Even a day at any of the Disney theme parks for our family of 4 would easily be far valuable than this, even though the park would cost me $150 less on a one day pass than this lodge. The furniture, decor, service, and ambience was very good. I stayed there to complete the Disney resort experience but ended with the feeling that the price wasn't worth it at all. The stay was nice and comfortable but not enough to wow me or make me want to come back. I would recommend it for a night or two for the experience - and I guess it is such visits that helps this resort do business.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here! The amazing decor and the comfort of our room made our trip.”
Reviews.Author: bigthicket
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at AKL with my 2 daughters ages 20 and 22. We loved the hotel and its atmosphere and were very pleased with guest services. Before arrival, I was somewhat worried about the bus situation because of reviews written previously about long waits for disney buses as well as long trips to the parks, especially Magic Kingdom. I am very pleased to say that we did not encounter any of these problems. We were told that the buses run every 20 minutes and we found this to pretty much be true. Also, our trip to Magic Kingdom took us only 30 minutes. Now I know this may because we went during a less busy time of year but even at other times of the year we must remember that the Disney property is very large and that when it comes to the bus situation it probably wouldn't be that much quicker even if you were going park to park in a car. We were very happy with our room at AKL as well. We had a standard view room as it was cheaper and we knew we wouldn't be in the room long enough anyways to worry about whether we had a good view or not. If you do not have a view of the animals you can easily walk around the hotel where there are viewing areas where you can see the animals up close and personal. There are also knowledgeable guides who will tell you about their native land of Africa and about the animals as well. Back to our room, our beds were very comfortable and there were plenty of pillows for the 3 of us. There was an extra blanket in the closet so that was nice when the nights got cold. Having 3 women in one room, we were very happy that the sink area (and 2 sinks at that) was separate from the shower area. That made it nice when we were all getting ready at the same time in the mornings. We did not take much advantage of the food at AKL. We ate breakfast a few times in the quick service area and it was very substantial and good. We found all three of us could get by on one full adult breakfast everyday therefore not using up 3 counter service meals at one time. There was a coffee pot in the room so there was no reason to waste your beverage allotment on a cup of coffee. (Just a little tip I realized after the first day so thought I would pass it on) All in all this was an amazing hotel and if and when I returned to DisneyWorld I would most certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a very good hotel, but some improvements noted.”
Reviews.Author: busterjosh
Reviews.Content: As I write this review, I am sitting in my room at Disneys AKL. I am a frequent traveler and return visitor to Disney. Last year we stayed at Port Orleans French Quarter which was AWESOME in every way. This year we decided to upgrade to Deluxe at AKL. Overall, this is an amazing property. The lobby is grand and impressive. There are many animal viewing areas and an overall african theme everywhere. The pool is immense and there are plenty of activities to entertain the children. However, the quick service restaurant is badly in need of an upgraded menu. Currently there are 2 salads, 2 pizzas and hamburgers on the menu. We were desperate for protein after the second day and took the bus to Port Orleans French Quarter to get a decent meal. I don't think you would have trouble if you have the standard dining plan. However, if you opyt for quick servcie this is not the resort for you. Another thing to keep in mind is that a trip to magic kingdom is approx 45 mins and downtown disney is at least 30 mins due to the location of the hotel. Overall, however, a very good hotel that I would consider again. Having said that my next stay will likely be at Port Orleans again where we had excellent service, excellent rooms and location at a much reduced price.

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: cumbriancastle
Reviews.Content: Our recent visit to Florida was magical from beginning to end but if there was a low point it was our stay at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge. The hotel is remarkable. The design is superb and it is surrounded by a savannah in which african animals roam. The theme of the whole place is Africa. Our room had a balcony overlooking the savannah and there were giraffe, impala, zebra, waterbuck, kudu, ostrich and more grazing just below us. The pool was big, well heated and the whole area clean and well maintained. in short the place itself was near perfect. But the customer service was not. If Disney is known around the world as an exemplar of customer service, the news has not reached the Animal Kingdom Lodge. The staff in general (with the notable exception of Oscar in Jiko restaurant) were poorly trained, off hand and surly and not what we expected from Disney. If the management pay as much attention to the detail of their staff training as they do to the hotel itself they will have a world class resort but at the moment too many of the staff are betraying Walt Disney's dream. All that said, we would return but ready to stand up for ourselves!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: Lyd2020
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with extended family and had 2 rooms, 8 family member in all, and very spacious! This hotel was amazing! Though 1 negative thing was that my daughter threw up, but that wasn't Disney's fault! We came around Christmas time, as Disney seemed like a perfect Christmas surprise! The rooms were nicely decorated and the pool was great too! I loved the food and it was awesome to wake the kids up in the morning to see the animals! The Disney magic was perfect and I'd have to say, Animal Kingdom Lodge is my favorite hotel after Disney's Grand Californian Hotel and Spa, located at Disneyland resort!

Reviews.Title: “Our vacation at Disneyn world, staying at AKL was completely magical experience.”
Reviews.Author: TeresaEgger
Reviews.Content: Everything was just perfect. Everyone at Disney World is so happy and ready to help in anyway they could. I definitely recommend AKL and plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Truly beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: a_bells
Reviews.Content: We stayed the week of January 3-10. The lodge and the grounds were stunning. Paid for a Standard View, but were placed in room in 2547 which, if you look at a map, isn't technically a savannah, but let me say that I am certain we saw more animals than anyone else. We regularly had giraffe, zebra, wildabeast, and several other animals on a regular basis. Some standard views indeed have no view, but honestly - it's worth booking a standard as many people seem to get upgrades or animal views anyway. If you don't get the upgrade, there are numerous viewing areas to see the animals. I honestly don't feel that paying for anything other than a standard view is worth it. We stayed in one of the furthest rooms from the lobby. The walk was 3-3/12 minutes max, depending on how tired I was. I mention this because people have complained about the long walk. 3.5 minutes after walking MILES all day at Disney? Really? Come on people. The hotel was immaculate, as was our room. Each day our room was as clean, neat and tidy as the day we arrived. We did leave a $5 tip every morning, but I'm sure the room would have been cleaned just the same. So long as we're talking about tipping housekeeping - please do it. Those people work HARD and make so little. It was a $35 added expense to our overall trip that I feel was totally worth it. You tip a bellman who wheels your luggage to your room with ease, why not the person on their hands and knees cleaning your toilet, vacuuming your floors and doing the backbreaking work of making bed after bed after bed all day. Just a thought. For $5 a day you can really make someone's day who really deserves it. Anyway...my only complaint was drawer space. There were exactly 2 drawers in the room, in the armoire that housed the TV. I used one for me, and one for my daughter. The hubby lived out of the suitcase all week. Honestly, there wasn't really room for another dresser so yeah, the rooms are a little small...but nothing that should deter you from staying here. Just keep this in mind if you are staying a week or more and have 4 people in the room. Could be a bit crowded with space for your things. BOMA - Yum! This is the on-site buffet restaurant. We loved it, as did my parents who were also there. Definitely not African food, but perhaps African Inspired. Amazing soups, salad bar, hummus bar and desert bar. Great side dishes. I don't eat meat, but the meat eaters at the table seem really pleased with what was offered. Expensive, so - as I'd recommend to anyone - I don't know if it is worth the money if you are not on the dining plan. Speaking of which, it is a GREAT value so long as you are really into sit down dining on vacation. If you are happy with quick service burgers and sandwiches all week, you may be better off without. Anyway, do the math before you commit. JIKO - We didn't eat here as it was 2 dinner credits with our dining plan, but it has a wonderful reputation. If we didn't have a small child with us who simply wouldn't have appreciated the food for the price, we would have eaten there anyway. The staff was great...but I wouldn't call them "magical." I could see the frustration on the guys face at registration when I asked several times how a 3 person 8 day upgrade to park hopper could be over $250 when in my head it was nearly $100 less. When he finally sighed and pulled out his calculator he saw that I was right and quickly corrected it. But it's Disney, man...try not to look like your guest is being a pain in the a$$. On the other hand, I saw some really rude people in line and so I can see where they can get fried in the course of a day. Whatever. Yep, it is further from the Magic Kingdom than any place else. About a 10-15 minute bus ride from the resort. We may consider staying at the Contemporary or Polynesian the next time if the cost is on par with Animal Kingdom - but if it is much more expensive as it was at our time of booking, it isn't worth it in my opinion. The pool is gorgeous, great for little ones as you can walk in and gradually get deeper. At night, just past the pool on the side of the building, you can use night vision goggles to watch the animals. This happens around 9pm. Super. Give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Almost fabulous with some staff problems”
Reviews.Author: SusanVM
Reviews.Content: I hate to focus on negatives as this hotel is very beautiful and I think that so much work is put into trying to make everyone's experience a magical one at this resort.....however.....with all of the effort, there is some malfunction in training some of the staff, or as they say, "cast members". On arrival, we stored our bags as it was early morning, fresh off of a Disney Cruise. When we returned, after a long day at Animal Kingdom, all the rooms were under my name (we had a group of 16, with four rooms), all of the baggage was delivered to my room which was a wonderful suite at the end of one of the hallway branches in Jambo House. I was a the desk giving the credit card information and getting the keys. (First glich was that I had spent over a half an hour on line during the Disney Cruise "checking in"....costing me computer time on the ship...this was supposed to allow me to just pick up my keys on arrival.....but not so....even tho I told the man at the front desk, he had to take my card and do EACH room individually which took some time to do the ...not to mention he money that I had wasted with computer time on the ship). So back to the baggage......I arrived at our room to find the bellman leaving and 16 plus bags both inside and OUTSIDE of our room. I caught the bellman and asked him if he could just take the bags of my daughter's family to their room as I now had the room number....she has four children, some young, who could not handle their bags. I was truly flabbergasted as the porter continued on his way and said that it was just down the hall (a LONG hall) and around the corner. He might have been tired out from all the bags but I have never seen such a thing. He left his rubber stopper in the door to hold the door open!! My husband wanted to tip him but did not even have a chance as the porter was so flustered (we ALWAYS tip and could not believe his hurry). So those were the first two "strikes" in our book......We DID love the hotel......we saw so much wildlife out of our window and it was a perfect place to end our two week vacation. We had no problem with the buses......just depends on your luck, I think.....one day it right there and the next we had to wait a little while....no problem for us. We were on concierge floor and found this to be just perfect as our big group could all eat breakfast before we headed out to the park. The concierge food is on the sixth floor and we were on the fourth floor....it is tricky to get up there and we would have appreciated someone telling us that it took a special elevator, but we figured it out eventually. We also ate at Boma and it was very wonderful.....the most delicious buffet ever......so many unusual things, but they were all very inviting and tasty. We had a long standing reservation for our group of 16 but were given a pager on our arrival at the restaurant....we did have to wait at least a half an hour....could add that to the negative column but I understand with a group that large, it is not always easy. Another strange cast member happening was that on both nights loud knocks brought us to our doors to find maids who offered to turn down our beds at anywhere from 8 to 9:30 p.m.!!.....long after some little ones in our party were asleep. The night before we left I went to the check out desk to see about printing our boarding passes and finding out more about checking our baggage on though to our home as was advertised by the Magical Express bus service to the airport. The lady told me to come back the next day, early in the morning, to avoid the crowds later, which we did. I had signed up for a premiere baggage option with United Airlines which allowed me to check 16 bags for free, which was a great savings for this trip. I bought all of the enrollment paperwork with me to make sure I would have no problems.....the program was all attached to my mileage plus number. The lady at the airline desk, Denise, was very brusk and even tho I showed her my paperwork she said she could NOT check my bags. She told me my only option was to go and do my own check in on their computer which is "Hidden" behind the front desk area.....guests can use it but you have to be let in through locked doors. She said I would have to take all the bags with me on the bus. Since I had 16 people to check in for the flight, this took some time.......during my time in the computer room, and there was NO one else waiting.....a cast member came by to tell me that there is a 15 minute time limit on the computer.....hummm...let me see, I guess that was strike 4, however I would l iike to give Denise several strikes!! I finally finished the airport check in and printing of boarding passes when my husband and a very NICE man, named Ron, a cast member who had witnessed the whole thing, came to get me and told me that they WOULD now check our baggage as they had checked on my premier baggage membership and had found that I was telling the truth:) This is what they should have done in the first place. So happily, with the help of Ron and another nice employee, Wilberto, who had taken me to the computer room...and was very sympathetic, we DID finally check our baggage all the way through, they took the bags from us, a great help....and the Magical Express was indeed magical! Denise seemed to try to "make nice" when they were taking our bags......putting all the bags receipts on a paper for me and telling me that I should write everyones name on the tags so I would know who they belonged to if one went missing ??? this while they were loading the bags on a cart......didn't make sense to me as if one was missing, I would have been able to tell by seeing which ones arrived safely ...but oh well.......she asked me if I had printed my boarding passes and when I said yes, she dramatically ripped the ones that she was in the process of printing in half and mumbled something about wasting her time:) I did feel I had to make mention of all these mishaps from the staff......but hope that you will give it a try it you are dreaming of going here, because it is a very special hotel........with a few glitches......I am glad we had the experience of staying there, when all is said and done! They had made note that we were taking this trip for our 45th anniversary and there was a very nice welcome basket in our room, along with a little gift.....a very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Sofianicole
Reviews.Content: For our honeymoon we decided to go to Disney. We stayed for 10 days 11 nights. At first we had reservation in Port Orleans but we were able to to change to AKL for $200 more. We got to the hotel really early, at 7:00am. We check in but our room was not ready. We ate breakfast at Boma and went to Downtown Disney. At 1:30pm we were hoping our room was ready. But it wasn't. We waited in the lobby until 2:30pm. The room was amazing. We got a room with pool view and a king bed. Also they gave us a handicap room. The room was always clean and mousekeping was perfect. The service was great. The hotel is beautiful. We never got bored. The food was amazing at all the restaurants. The pool was always heated and we eve got to get in the pool at 2:00am. Our room was very calm and we never had any noise at the room. The only downside to the hotel is that is very far from the park, and there were times when we had to wait for over 35 minutes for a bus. But other than that we love the hotel. The animals are great and the night vision is cool.

Reviews.Title: “Much More than We Expected”
Reviews.Author: roxi06
Reviews.Content: Let me get the few cons out of the way. Didn't really like the room at Jambo House, they were deep but had no width if that makes sense, kind of made me feel closed in. Plus the toilet was by itself in a closet which I thought was kind of weird and creepy. My only other complaints were the location is kind of out of the way and the food is a little too exotic. However being in Disney there are tons of places to eat and if you have a car it's no big deal. Now the good stuff. This hotel itself is pretty cool. Even if you don't stay there go check it out. When you come through the front door it's like stepping into another world. You eyes kind of go wide and your mouth opens a little bit. The safari's and walking trails are great for the kids. We had a two bedroom on the Sunset Savanah and had a great view of mostly Giraffe the whole week. The pool is enormous. We were there in August and it was 100 degrees, everyone was at the pool and we still had no trouble finding spots and never felt crowded in the water. There is a small pool bar with a really friendly wait staff as well. If you have small kids, there is another pool with a childrens play area at Kidani Village. The pool is small but the kids playing there seemed to be enjoying themselves with water cannons and stuff like that. I noticed a lot of activities going on for kids. They have a camp fire and night vision goggle tours at night and also have guides along the walking trails. For the adults there is a bar that is kind of hidden halfway between the lobby floor and the bottom floor. The two bartenders their from Louisiana were a lot of fun and didn't even seem to mind my father-in-law chewing there ear off the whole time. (Just kidding dad if you read this). We didn't have a single problem while we were there. The busses to the parks ran pretty regularly, the staff was outstanding, and the place was amazingly clean. Would definitely stay here again. I

Reviews.Title: “So much fun!”
Reviews.Author: triptravel1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the AKL in the Jambo House with my fiance in October 2010. We planned a trip for the Epcot Food & Wine Festival and knew we wanted to stay on Disney property. Check in was great. As always, the staff at any Disney location is wonderful. When we walked in our room it was pretty surreal! The room itself was a standard hotel room (2 queen beds, bathroom with 1 sink & shower/tub combo) but the balcony overlooking all of the animals was really amazing. We sat on our balcony for hours and it was always entertaining watching the giraffes eating off the trees and the zebras just hanging out! At night we would sit by the outdoor fire pit. We also did the night vision one night which was pretty fun! The lobby was gorgeous and dark with African artifacts and there are many areas outside to view the animals if you do not have a view in your room. We also loved the music playing throughout the hotel! We enjoy trying out different Disney properties but I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Adult Trip, Romance and Fun, Celebrating our aniversary.”
Reviews.Author: Blancadaniela
Reviews.Content: A lot of fun for couples without kids, Fun and Romantic. Beautifull Hotel, Loved the view, you get to see Jiraffes, Zebras an all kind of wild animals, the staff places their food near the rooms tower so they can assure the animals visit every day. It was really great to wake up in the morning, open the window and see a different animal every day, ask for a Savanah view, I think all rooms have a view, but the savanah is the best because you get to see the Jiraffes and Zebras. We decided to celebrate our first aniversary trip in Disney, my husband had never gone to Disney so I wanted him to get to know it before we have kids. Overall the experience was great, lots of fun, and great service at the Disney complex. The dates we selected were great because it was not crowded, we were able to visit all the parks an ride all the atractions, the longest wait time for an atraction was 1.5 hour and we used fast pass on this so we only waited in line about 15 min. We notified the hotel that it was our aniversary so they gave us a pin for us to wear in our stay and the staff all around the complex would congratulate us, it was a really nice feeling. The hotel is very pretty, of course is a themed hotel and its all africa all around, the walk to the room is ok, it is not soooo big that you have to walk your feet off to get to the room, it is very accesible. We did not tried the restaurants because we were in the parks all evenings, but we use to wake up late and get to the parks at noon, and the sleep in morning hours was great, it is not noisy and its peacefull. Room was a little bit small, but is comfortable, and the bathroom is veery preetty, and you receive all kind of details around the room like towel art. The pool was pretty and good sized. The transportation to the parks is great because the hotel is next to the animal kingdom park, so its kind of far from the Magic Kingdom park, but buses don´t make a lot of stops to get to the hotel, so you get to the parks fast. Overall it was a great experience for an adult only trip, and we saw a lot of couples without kids, we had a lot of fun. To avoid crowds like we did, make sure to select your trip dates in school days and stay at a Disney hotel so that you can take advantage of the after hours, specially the night after hours. Don´t miss the parades and night fireworks at the parks for romantic moments, and visit Downtown Disney for a little nightlife, if you still have energy of course jeje. And before I forget, if you are planning to return to the hotel at late night, make sure to eat something before you do, after 11:00 pm, there is no food service at the hotel, they would give you numbers of pizza delivery, but the hotel does not have room service or snack machines for you to grab a bite before sleep. Also be sure to ask about the food plan at you arrival, they have an all included tipe of plan for your stay and it is convenient, but you hav to ask for it at your arrival because if you dont you wont be able to get it later.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: kbris10224
Reviews.Content: As others have posted, the rooms are small, the old standard hotel size, but like a cruise ship, we were not in the room too much. We had a Arusha Savannah room with bunk beds - great location and we were lucky enough to have quite a few animals out. I know some people have written they didn't see any, but we had 2 giraffes, 3 zebras, a lot of birds, etc.. outside our patio so it worked out. Maybe its just luck in terms of when you stay, weather, etc... I booked one night only and it was worth it to see the animals, float around in the pool, and the activities for the family. The staff is very friendly so that goes a long way as well. The buffet is good, lots of choices for every taste, but pricey. A tip if you don't splurge for the Savannah rooms is there are multiple viewing points in the hotel. We went to them anyway since the animals don't all hang out side your patio, they mill around looking for food. Also, try to catch them when the feeding truck comes... My daughter really loved seeing the interaction.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: TripTaker321
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews here before going. It was my first time staying at a Disney resort and I was happy with AK Lodge. The rooms and resort were very clean and well kept. The location is convenient. There are buses that come pick you up and drop you off at all of the other parks. I really enjoyed my stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “By far one of the BEST resorts stays of all our Disney family vacations!”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine4me2day
Reviews.Content: I'm going to make this so quick and to the point. We've stayed at G.F., Yacht and C.B.R. before staying at the Animal Kingdom this past October 2010. We traveled this trip with 1 senior, 2 adults, 2 young children and 2 teenage boys. I can't express that everyone in our group was in beyond heaven at this resort. The little ones were constantly in excitement going thru the hotel and in our room which was a Savanah view (I wouldn't do it any other way). It was beyond amazing. The grounds were just beautiful, the resort was 100% spotless at all times, rooms, pools, bathrooms....you name it everything was perfect. The food was excellent and there was always activities for the children. We had a connecting double bed room to a bunkbed/single bed room....both rooms had plenty of space and were beyond spotless. The rooms were kept spotless every single day by the wonderful housecleaning that were simply the sweetest!! I have to admit at the G.F. I loved the monorail, but this time we just rented a minivan for the week because when you stay at any Disney Resort you park for free when going to the Disney Parks, so this had us avoid the bus system. Which the bus system does work great, but I find with two strollers a van is so much easier. I by far will be going back to finalize our pick to stay for the future Disney visits at the Animal Kingdom.....it was simply amazing and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Like another park - but with comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: vasweetpea
Reviews.Content: We *love* this resort. It was our 2nd stay and we were the lowest level concierge room. This meant we had a standard room (which is great!) with a view of a savanna AND access to all of the concierge services - which is what we wanted. Because we stayed at this level and at this resort we had access to a number of extra experiences (at an extra cost). They were all amazing opportunities to get closer too and learn a lot more about the animals at the lodge and at the park. We did the dinner safari at the lodge (requires staying at the lodge); we did the sunrise safari at the park (requires staying at the lodge at concierge level) and the backstage tour of the safari ride at the park (requires concierge level at any resort). The Animal Kingdom Lodge is a beautiful resort and the proximity to the animals is a huge bonus. We find it to be quieter for some reason. There are still kids here (it is Disney) - but it was calmer than the monorail resorts (GF, Poly, Contemporary). The decor is beautiful. Our rooms were always clean, we had a new towel animal every day, the restaurants are great - Jiko is amazing. If you don't drive yourself (and I recommend Disney transportation) you will take a bus to the parks. While this resort is the furthest away from most parks - the buses only stop at the Villas (first) and the hotel (Jambo House) - the two areas that make up this property. So you quickly get to the parks. One person we met at a lunch was staying at the Contemporary and while it was great for getting to Magic Kingdom & Epcot - her bus stopped at FOUR more resorts before it got to Hollywood Studios - it took a long time and was cramped. Except for coming back at park closing - we never had a super crowded bus at all. If you stay here build time into your trip to enjoy the resort. Wander to different viewing stations (and your balcony) and see the animals. Go out at night and sit by the bonfire or see the animals with night vision goggles! Lots of fun things to do!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort....Horrible Transportation to the Parks!!”
Reviews.Author: disfanatic702
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here in a one bedroom villa on points borrowed from a family member. This resort is extremely beautiful and has great food in the restaurants, but the transportation to and from any park but the animal kingdom led to atleast a 40 min or longer wait for a bus to come. Once the bus did come, it would be a shoving match to get on, because of this I became quite sour on this resort. while I am glad that I got the opportunity to stay here, I probabaly would not again. In the future I will most likely stay at the magic kinggdom resorts or the epcot resorts to cut down on the transportation time to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “We will always stay at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge Jambo House”
Reviews.Author: Spruby
Reviews.Content: Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge is a deluxe resort at Walt Disney World. My wife and I saw a number of the other resorts and swear AKL is our "home away from home" at Walt Disney World. We'll never stay anywhere else. The lobby and public rooms are beautiful, especially when decorated for the holiday season. The concierge staff on the Kilimanjaro room level are top notch. They ably fielded all our questions and requests. Our room overlooked one of the lodge's savannas and we could see giraffes, ostriches, Watusi cattle, wildebeests, and zebras. Very cool! If you can spring for the sunset safari, you'll never forget it. The room was quiet and had plenty of deluxe amenities: soap, shower gel shampoo, conditioner, lotion, aloe vera gel, mouthwash, and even toothbrushes with toothpaste. We ate well at the Boma buffet and Jiko restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: dadizzles
Reviews.Content: we stayed the first week of december and really enjoyed our stay here.our room was spotless and very nice.like all disney resorts it could of been a little bigger.you can't beat waking in the morning and seeing giraffes in the backyard.we ate boma and the mara several times.boma was a very good buffet and mara is a typical disney quickservice restaurant (small menu-not very good food).we would stay here again and the lobby and atmosphere was fantastic.our only complaint would be the buses could of ran a little smoother.they sometimes very crowded and sometimes running 10/15 mins behind.plus resort should have free wifi at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: Ioie
Reviews.Content: Took 1 hour to get a special doorkey needed to activate internet in the room. The room was on club level but in spite of several attempts, and another hour, they could not get the key to work on the elevator leading to club level lonuge. NO WIFI, could not use my kindle, ipad or iphone(foreign sim card)

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money you pay for this resort”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkie071
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this resort in 2009 and had a fantastic view in a standard room so we decided as this was our 25th wedding anniversary we would book the animal kingdom again as this was a special celebration. We had stayed at the old key west resort for 5 days then had bell services move our luggage t oanimal kingdom went out for the day came back to animal kingdom they could not find our luggage it took them an hour to get it to us. Our room had bunk beds but we had no children with us not what a couple celebrating 25 years of marriage were expecting. We asked to change room as we wanted 2 double beds and were told we would have a better view imagine our faces when we got to our room and the view was of trees in a corner room and the hot tub below. then top all that the washers on site ruined all my laundry with oil stains. Will not stay on this resort even if it was free old key west was a much better resort even though the rooms were outdated much larger for less money and a much more friendly resort and more relaxing. The one service i would recommend is the disney flower service my children and husband had flowers delivered to our room and they were absolutely beautiful well done Disney for this that was the only good thing about our stay at the animal kingdom

Reviews.Title: “A Very Very Very Mixed Review But More Negative Than Positive”
Reviews.Author: PaulJude
Reviews.Content: Let me offer at the outset that we are big fans of Disney World. Typically, we find ourselves traveling to Orlando once every year or two and have always enjoyed our stay within the Walt Disney World property. So we were excited about staying at the Animal Kingdom Lodge Jambo House (the hotel, not the time shares at Kidani Village), one of the few luxury resorts we have never stayed in. First, the positives. The hotel overall is beautifully done. Dark wood tones, native art adorning many of the areas throughout the hotel create a perfect impression of Africa. We were enthralled with the animals outside most of the public viewing areas. In most regards, Disney World more than delivered on its marketing promises for general viewing. We also can't say enough about how incredible the food is throughout the hotel. Boma, the buffet is probably the most inventive and appealing buffets we have ever tried. The fine dining restaurant, Jiko, is perhaps the best of any of Disney"s restaurants. It was an absolutely PERFECT meal. We went back a second night. The down side....and there are many negative areas. First, the rooms. We booked a savannah view and quickly found out that represents a BROAD category. The first room we were assigned was overlooking a muddy 40 yard area enclosed with a chain link fence....more construction zone than savannah. If you do not have a room facing the inner circle, the viewing is very limited and rather poor. Typically smaller than most of the luxury resort rooms, the rooms are also very very very poorly lit. Two inadaqute sconces plus one floor lamp are the only lighting in the room. It was impossible to read at night. The bathroom sink and counter are open to the main room and feels more Days Inn and less luxury resort. The overall feeling is cramped and claustrophobic. We actually tried to book another hotel within Disney and unfortunately, all were already booked. We would have left the hotel if we had a choice. Lastly, when things go well at Disney, great, but if not......there is very little the staff are empowered to change or correct. Even small issues presented a challenge for the front desk. It wasn't that they didnt try, it was more they didn't know how or weren't empowered to create a solution. We can only say that after two days, we were desperate to change hotels and sorry we had ever booked the Animal Kingdom Lodge. I can only offer that rather than stay at the Lodge, take an afternoon, go over and see the lobby and perhaps have a meal and go back to one of the other resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay at Disney”
Reviews.Author: dec49
Reviews.Content: We loved Animal Kingdom Lodge-Jambo House. It was busy, but did not seem crowded. There were plenty of places to sit and relax inside and out. The huge lobby had several small groups of comfortable chairs and couches, a large gas fire pit, large windows overlooking the savannah, and an exceptional gift shop. Outside were pathways to animal viewing areas, and rocking chairs around another fire pit. The quick service dining, the Mara, the arcade, the fitness center, and the beautiful pool were accessible outside on the lower level. The restaurants (Boma is recommended highly) and the lounge were also on the lower level (stairs or elevator). We did not have any long waits for the busses. In fact it seemed as if other resort lines were much longer. Make sure you get off at the Jambo House exit, not the Village exit. Rooms were nice, nothing really "luxurious" and clean. We did not request the savannah view, but saw many animals along the outside overlooks. Cast members were available to answer any questions. We were close to the lobby on the fourth floor.
