The rooms on the fifth floor are part of the Disney Vacation Club (although we are not DVC members and booked this accommodation as you would a regular room via the website) and were a really nice alternative to the standard room given the full kitchen in the one bedroom suite (kitchenette in the studio) and laundry machine. Because we were not DVC members, we had daily housekeeping service which was excellent. As you would expect with Disney World properties, the service and hospitality was excellent throughout. The food in the restaurants was good. I heard more complaints about the Disney Dining Plan than I heard kudos, but am told it's a wonderful way to save some money. The bell desk is 100% full service. They received and held a motorized scooter for a member of our traveling party. They also received, held and refrigerated groceries for us which we had ordered online (http://gardengrocer.com/) and had delivered to the hotel . Just a couple notes, if you are staying in the DVC rooms (whether DVC or not), detergent for laundry is provided (but not dryer sheets). Dishwashing liquid and automatic dishwasher detergent is also provided as are towels and sponges. I didn't know this and had ordered some from the grocer. This was our third stay at this hotel and we would not hesitate to stay here again. Transportation to all parks is via bus with Animal Kingdom being the closest. The staff throughout Disney is so helpful and friendly. And the families traveling there are also quick to help a stranger, too. The animals visible from the savannah view rooms are always neat, too. Even if you don't have a savannah view, there are many points throughout the hotel to see animals for everyone... including while walking from your room to the lobby sometimes... depending on which wing you are in. I would probably suggest going to one of the full service spas around Disney, if you are looking for a relaxing afternoon as the one in the AKL is four treatment rooms right off the workout area and is more akin to what you might find at your local gym. The service was good and they immediately fixed a situation where I had booked my services at another of the 6 spa service locations and the therapists came over to AKL.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - excellent value - stay in a Savannah Room if you can afford it!”
Reviews.Author: PrincessJaney
Reviews.Content: The hotel is brilliant for children with young families. I stayed with my two children who were 7 and 9 at the time, and they loved it! I was initially allocated a room which was on a high floor, and then changed to one with bunk beds..and then had the worst nights stay ever in a room next to a 'pumping station'. After complaining I was allocated a Savannah Room, which was so beautiful I nearly cried... it could have been sleep deprivation though that made me emotional (!!) It was lovely though, as you could see the giraffes, zebras, etc, which the children loved watching over the days we were there. It was nice to sit out on your balcony watching the animals in the morning, whilst you ate breakfast. The hotel was clean, the pool was fab, and there are lots of activities for the children to do every day at the hotel.. mine designed a t-shirt, and painted some ceramics. The food is much the same at all the disney hotels in the quick service part - it is overpriced, but you expect that from any theme park!! I don't know whether I would have enjoyed it the same if I didn't have the Savannah Room.. as that really was the highlight of the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “The Lobby Makes it Deluxe”
Reviews.Author: VADizFan
Reviews.Content: The lobby is beautiful - the rooms? Not so much. We arrived with online check in and were greeted as we got out of the car with our Disney "package". While I am all for hurrying things along, this didn't make me feel welcomed just rushed. I couldn't ask a front desk person questions about the room or about the celebrations I had planned. Didn't like it. Plus our package of material had a map of the hotel and a sheet of what was happening at the hotel. At other properties, even with online check in, you get the brochures from the parks, and all sorts of other paperwork. But the real disappointment was when we went to our room. We stayed here six years ago - and thought it was nice. Either my mind has shaded it rosy - or I just liked the animals. Although we had a Disney passholder discounted rate, the fact that they gave us (or anyone) that room is quite sad. Room 4009 has a bunk bed and a queen in the size of a cracker box. The balcony overlooked the parking lot but there would be no way for an adult to get on it. As you opened the door, it was not a sliding door but one that pushed forward, it actually touched the railing. The balcony had to be less than 24" wide. It barely fit a chair so it wasn't very long either! I called down to see if our room could be changed. Was told someone would call me back. 25 minutes later, I called again (I would have gone down but I was afraid my luggage would get delivered and I'd miss it). I got someone who said they had another room available on the 4th floor with a limited view. I said that would be fine. We went down to 4259 and the room was larger. I know they advertise the rooms at 380sf or so but that first one was much smaller. Plus, our new room had a balcony that went across the length of the room like most balconies do. We had a view of animals (giraffe, zebras, elands, ostriches, African cattle, vultures, etc) the entire time so I do not think the view was limited at all. It was great. But the room itself is very small for a deluxe. We had bunk beds and a queen. Every time you moved on the queen it made noise. LOUD noises. The springs were horrid. I woke up all night just rolling over! The bath supplies were face and bath soap, shampoo and conditioner. At the Polynesian, they throw in shower gel and lotion and a lot of other goodies. There is no way to compare the two hotels. Animal Kingdom is a deluxe moderate - but not a deluxe. It has one shop. Just like Port Orleans or any other moderate. But it is deluxe in the size and look of the lobby - plus two sit down restaurants. The slide/pool were about the same as Port Orleans Riverside. The animals are the draw here. But by the 5th day, you don't even go to the window to look out. There is a flat screen television, coffee maker, and small fridge. The rooms are clean and we had Disney towel animals daily. I can't see myself staying here again. Absolutely LOVE Boma's for breakfast. Haven't done dinner there in years. But I love the breakfast. Mara's is the food court type of restaurant - nothing special. Ice cream offerings are only prepackaged bars/sandwiches. I was really looking forward to the night vision goggles everyone talks about thinking we could go exploring. Nope! There is a lookout room - where people get in line to wait for the two pair of goggles. There is an attendant to hand you the goggles. The line flows as the family involvement is. Meaning, for our family - we took about five minutes or less for all of us to get a look. Meanwhile, a man and his 7 year old son were there when we got there and still there when we left asking all sorts of questions about the animals they were viewing. We waited about 20 minutes for our view at 9:00. Keep in mind, these are the same giraffe/zebras/elands you see all day. The only difference is they are green. If you rate just the rooms, this hotel is a moderate but throw in the animals - and there's where it gets the deluxe rating. We were there for my husband's 50th birthday - which I think should be a huge event and my daughter's birthday as well. They did give the room one birthday card (we gave to her) and a birthday cake towel. They did nothing special - and when you take into account our first room, they really could not care less about celebrations and trying to make your stay a little more magical. It would not have hurt them at all to give us the 4259 room right off the bat. But they gave us 4009 first - which just really does not make sense. Unless the hotel is packed solid - NO ONE should have to have that room! In our room, we could hear the neighbors when they flushed the toilet - and when they used the sliding glass door. Not necessarily deluxe. The lobby is very nice, too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ukydancer
Reviews.Content: Went to Disney World for the first time as a solo traveller for my birthday (have been many other times with kids and family), and decided to splurge on the Animal Kingdom Lodge savannah view room. I was not disappointed. Although Disney, of course, is a lot more fun with my children in tow, it was a refreshing, one-time experience as a solo traveller. Check-in (I did the online check-in prior) took me less than 5 minutes (I arrived at about 6:30pm). All of my paperwork was ready, and along with wishes for a very happy birthday, I was on my way to my room. My room #4316 was overlooking the Sunset Savannah and in the distance I could see Kidani Village rooms. At all points in time during the day and evening I could view giraffes, zebra, kudu and various birds, including ostrich quite close to my room. Housekeeping kept the room neat and clean. I left 5 extra dollars one day and she left me extra pens and toiletries. The front desk was always prompt and polite in answering any questions I had. I have heard many a complaint about the bus service. Although at times the bus was crowded I never waited more than about 10 minutes for a bus. Now Disney does state that the buses run every 20 minutes, but I never waited that long. It is quite a hop to the Magic Kingdom, but not unmanageable. Although I suppose if you had young children it might be a different story. All in all the Animal Kingdom Lodge is a beautiful hotel, with wonderful grounds to explore. I would stay here again if I had the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort with excellent service and sublime accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: minnie_mommie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Walt Disney World this summer with our two daughters, ages 9 and 15. My 15-year-old has been there many times before as have I, but for my husband and younger daughter, this was their first visit! And they LOVED it! The Animal Kingdom Lodge is our favorite resort yet, and between my daughter and I, we have stayed at many. It is definitely a step up from the Value and Moderate resorts, so if you're on a budget, this is worth the extra money by far. The room service was prompt and quite satisfactory. And the room itself was IMPECCABLE. It was so clean and spacious. Ours was a pool view room, which was lovely. The pool was immaculate and so fun for the kids, what with the waterslide and all. My husband even went down it a few times! The dining was an incredible experience. We dined at Sanaa at Kidani Village, which was a beautiful and authentic atmosphere with food to match. We also dined at Boma, which was a buffet-style restaurant with incredible food and many options. They also have a quick-service place called The Mara, which was convenient and friendly, but could have used more options on the breakfast menu, like at the Grand Floridian and the Contemporary. The Health Club was very clean and conveniently located. The location of the hotel itself, however, is a little far away from the parks and therefore all of them can only be accessed by a bus ride, sometimes a little longer than we'd have liked. It was somewhat frustrating to be exhausted at the end of a busy day and have a long ride back to the hotel. But overall we were extremely pleased with the resort and we look forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KittyC1
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at the AKL - and indeed is was like "coming home." Everyone so friendly; seems they appreciate you being there. Love the decor and of course, the chance to see the animals. Previously we had a savana view, this time a pool view (4th floor). Both nice for different reasons. If you have not been there during the holidays (late November to Jan 1) , I highly recommend going. The resort takes on an entirely different feel. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great views with terrible rooms, what a terrible combo!”
Reviews.Author: ckayjr
Reviews.Content: We had just returned from our 4 night cruise on the Disney Wonder and were looking forward to our stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. The bummer was that we were dropped off by the Disney bus in front of the hotel with all of our bags and NO ONE was there to assist us. We waited and waited and waited longer to no avail. When we finally dragged all of our bags up to the front of the hotel we were told they were very busy at this time. Really? Our room that we were assigned first was AWFUL! The view was supposed to be of the Sahara but we only could see the corner of the building and a utility shack. NOT GOOD. I called down immediately and demanded to be moved to a more appropriate room. (Mind you that we had just had a 2 bedroom suite on the Disney Wonder so our expectation level may have been high but this room was awful.) We were unable to go right into a room that was nicer until later in the day so we just checked our bags and went into the resort. The second room was better for the view but the beds and layout were really poorly done. It was a very cheaply designed room. Views are great but if you can't stand the room you most likely won't be in it too long. The restaurants were very good at the hotel though and the staff members were quite knowledgeable about the animals. We really didn't spend too much time at the hotel as we were really busy with our 10 and 8 year old going in and out of parks.

Reviews.Title: “I would move in here tomorrow”
Reviews.Author: haveacappio
Reviews.Content: We booked a room in the Animal Kingdom Lodge for one week in August - UK school holidays made it a very expensive time to come but we have stayed there before and really love it. Upon arrival, we checked in and after a bit of a wait were told that we were being upgraded to a 1 bedroom apartment in the Kidani village - we had taken our god-daughter who is 12 and was away from home for the first time and so, after making some checks about the new accomodation accepted and WOW.. so glad we did. We had a one bed apartment with the largest en-suite i have seen in my life - jacuzzi bath included and a shower with a seat area if needed. Our god-daughter got a bathroom of her own, a pull out sofa bed but with the softest mattress and she was very very happy about the whole thing. And then there is the kitchen, we had a much needed fridge/freezer, cooker, dishwasher, washing machine and dryer - no time to use them but saved money on breakfasts at least being able to stock up at a supermarket on essentials. We had a savannah view (that is what we originally booked in AKL) and it was great - girafffes met us on arrival and a flurry of other animals soon turned up. This has truly raised the bar for disney holidays in my opinion and we were very privalidged to be able to stay, we were just sorry it wasnt for longer.

Reviews.Title: “The most memorable trip ever.”
Reviews.Author: simba_3413
Reviews.Content: Just visited about a month ago. Stayed for 6 nights went with family .The pillows and beds are sooooo comfortable always clean. It was beautiful to be awaken by bird calls and turkeys and giraffes right out side our window. Unbelievable experience since we got there all the cast members very pleasant. Every one is Disney happy wishing you a great day as you walk down the hallways. When we went back to our room the housekeeping staff would leave our kids stuff animals arranged in bed waiting for them with their sunglasses and TV remote next to them(so cute).The swimming pool was so much fun and my kids had an awesome time with the hotel activities and dancing by the pool and with the viewing of animals at the Savannah with night vision goggles, this stay was truly a magical part of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aprilc04
Reviews.Content: So we just returned on 8/22 for a weeklong stay and I must say the hotel was beautiful. We were there with our 2 kids, ages 1.5 and 11 years old, we booked the trip during the week of our oldest daughters bday which was 8/20. My parents also traveled with us and they stayed a few days longer....which I wish we would have done as well. You really need more than one week in order to really see everything. This was our first trip to Disneyworld, we live in California so we do Disneyland quite a bit. We did the online check-in 10 days prior which was great, and after reading very helpful reviews here I knew to ask for a room close to the lobby and on the same floor as the lobby. They were able to accommodate and it was very nice since we could tell that it was quite a walk to some of the rooms. The Magical Express is set up very nicely, it was great to not have to go to baggage, and be able to get right on the bus to the hotel. I did ask upon arrival if they were able to upgrade us to a Savannah view room since we were there to celebrate my daughter's birthday, but they couldn't accommodate. We had a pool view room which was nice and my parents had booked a Savannah View room so we just went into their room to see the animals. My youngest loved it! We had to tear her away from their balcony. She did drop a shoe over one day, and we were able to get it back within a few hours. Although my parents did mention that they probably wouldn't do the Savannah view again since they only got to see a giraffe twice from the room. Mainly it was zebra, cattle, antelope...but still fun for the little ones. Yes, the hotel is quite far from most parks (except Animal Kingdom and Hollywood Studios). We had pretty good luck with the bus system in the beginning of the trip, then near the end we had to really wait a long time for a few. I do wish that the hotel would have the bus waiting area set up like at the parks where you have to stand in a line to get on the bus. We had this issue on our last day where we walked up to the bus stop for Blizzard Beach/Hollywood Studios right as that bus drove away, so we had to wait for 20 mins and when the bus finally arrived, everyone who had only been waiting for 5 mins or so rushed the bus and were all able to get on and get seats. I was able to get one (thankfully since I am 6 months prego and had a 1.5 year old to carry) but the rest of my family had to stand. I think that next time we visit, we'll try to stay somewhere near Epcot since it seems to be more centrally located. We were on the Quick Service dining plan, which was absolutely great! We each got 2 meals and 2 snacks per day and ended up using the last 2 meals for breakfast on our last morning and ended up with 6 leftover snacks, which was fine. We didn't try Boma or Jiko since we didn't want to spend the money, but the food at the Mara was very good. My only gripe is that I wished that they had another menu that they would swap out every 2 or 3 days, because after a few days of eating the same exact thing every morning for breakfast or dinner gets old fast. It was nice to be able to use them in all the parks though. We found out that we could get creative though since each came with an entree, drink and dessert I would swap out the dessert for another drink. I needed water more than a brownie most of the time anyway. Or if we were at a place that had snacks they would let us swap in a snack instead of their dessert options. It takes a few days to get the hang of the meals plans, but luckily every person we dealt with at the registers was great at making sure we got the most bang for our buck. We did both water parks, first Typhoon Lagoon on Wednesday then Blizzard Beach on Saturday. We weren't super early risers since we would be out at the parks late at night, and got the Typhoon around 11:30am and it was PACKED. To the point where it took us about 30 mins to find an chair....then trying to find a spot in the shade to put it was another task in itself. I found that you really need a spot to call your own, especially with a little one. So while we were at that park eating lunch I called the WDW phone number and got connected to the Recreation dept and I booked a private cabana for Blizzard Beach. It's not cheap ($250, plus tax), but for an entire day you get a private area with 6 chairs, an umbrella, a few little tables, a locker and a cooler with waters. You also have a person who comes to check on you every 20-30 mins and will bring you your towels and will also order your lunch and deliver it to you. Worth every penny in my book. They only have 8 cabanas though so I would highly recommend booking ahead of time. Most every cast member that we dealt with was very helpful and friendly. Although the lady that painted my daughters face in Toon Town was the rudest person ever. She barely said two words to us and never once cracked a smile. I have a hard time biting my tongue, so I kept repeating "Pixie dust, pixie dust" in my head so I wouldn't rip her head off. The hotel staff was amazing. My parents lost a pair of reading glasses and they credited them $200 for them. Our room was clean when we arrived and remained that way during our entire stay. The fridge is great since you can really stock up on snacks and drinks from the Mara and keep them in there, also great for us with a baby to have a place to store milk and juice. The room is not huge, especially if you need to set up the portable crib...that really made it hard to move around the room, but it's Disney so how much time do you really need to spend in the room! The beds were very comfortable, but very noisy! Everytime I would roll over or switch positions, I was afraid I would wake up the baby.... Oh and if you want to see Fantasmic, get there super early! We got there an hour ahead of time and it was already full. I also highly recommend the Wishes Dessert Party: http://www.disunplugged.com/2009/06/24/disney-debuts-magic-kingdom-wishes-dessert-party/ We made reservations a few months prior and had a great seat for tht fireworks. Don't worry about getting there too early to wait in line and get a good table, they already have the tables assigned since it's by reservation only.

Reviews.Title: “Best disney hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: jodola13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at AKL 03/08 2010 for two weeks and its the best hotel i have ever stayed in. Very friendly and helpfull staff,great room with fantastic view of the animals. if you pay a supliment you will get a savana view of the animals but all rooms get a view of the animals anyway apart from the front of hotel car park view rooms so unless you are unlucky a animal view room is garanteed. The pool was huge with a small slide and two hot tubs and always warm the pool stayed open 24/7 but with no life guards after 10 pm. the Kidani village has its own pool that is better for kids smaler pool and water play areas. We were on the Disney dining plan and used it to eat at a other Disney hotels ie The grand floridian. the polenesian, the wilderness lodge.the carabean beach also the table service restaurants in the parks the dining plan saved us lots of money as most meals for three people were coming to $ 100 plus the only thing that was a bit of a shock was the $15 surgested tip after each meal (not used to tipping in uk) I would hire a car as AKL is quite a long way from the parks except animak kingdom 5 mins away. we hired our car from Alamo at Disneys dolphin hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Again !”
Reviews.Author: 37Rycroft
Reviews.Content: Returned to the AKL for 5 days after 5 years, and it was as fantastic as we remembered it, we booked an ordinary room, but were upgraded to Savannah View for free, and the rooms are large, comfortable and well furnished. The whole hotel is a joy to be in, the only hotel I have ever stayed in that you actually want to hang around in.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Disney Vacation”
Reviews.Author: BVI17
Reviews.Content: My family and I had such an amazing time staying at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. We booked our vacation directly through Disney. We chose AKL, premium dining plan, and concierge level. We were beyond happy with our choices! From the minute we drove up to the hotel the staff was friendly, accomodating, and full of information. With the concierge level you get met at the doors and personally taken to your room where you will be checked in. Our room had bunkbeds and a queen bed, this arrangement was perfect for us and felt roomier. Another bonus was our amazing view of the savannah and animals. The concierge level is also worth it for the lounge. AKL provides food throughout the day, drinks, and has staff on hand for any needs. A lot of people say isn't it too much food and drinks when you have concierge and the dining plan but we used our dining plan credits to eat at all of the nicer restaurants (usually 2 credits) and so the lounge was perfect when we didn't have a meal booked. All of the staff at AKL was terrific but especially the concierge staff. We decided at the last minute to add an extra night onto our vacation. Naturally we couldn't stay in our concierge room (School vacation weeks = sold out) but the staff moved us to another room and checked us out and back in right there in the concierge lounge. Tips: When you book concierge level and dining plans they will be good for the entire day when you check out of the hotel! When we moved rooms we were no longer concierge level and our cards reflected that. However our old cards were still good until that evening. It sounded crazy to us but if any of the theme parks are open till 2 A.M. (like when we were there) sleep in late and stay at the parks until they close. We were able to go on every ride we wanted to with no lines! If you are driving to Disney or renting a car pay to have valet service. We made a lot of dining reservations at other properties. We looked into the Disney transit service but decided to just take our own car. Here comes the great part.....once you valet at one hotel you are able to valet at all properties!

Reviews.Title: “World class!”
Reviews.Author: Felix_That_Cat
Reviews.Content: The Animal Kingdom Lodge is a great place to stay...and I wish I had the bankroll to do it more often. While the property itself is superbly decorated in what can only be described as African Fantasyland, the prime reason we went is because we love their restaurant, Jiko. Pan-African fusion? I don't know how to describe it, but every dish is excellent and worth trying. We celebrated an anniversary here several years back, were amazed by what we found, and wanted to come back and try it again. It's as good as ever. And, yes, the kids loved the huge outdoor pool and the night vision viewing of the various fauna roaming the perimeter.

Reviews.Title: “More than Adequate but some of the luster was missing.”
Reviews.Author: yuravgjoe
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I decided to visit make Disney our honeymoon destination. After several weeks of frustration with the Disney website getting our hotel and meal plan accomodations, the day finally arrived. We had reserved a king bed (we thought) but when we checked in, we were told they had only two queen beds. We were puzzled. "We are on our honeymoon and we booked a king bed." No help. She told us that all kings were booked, but if we would take a queen bed for a few nights, they would find us a king bed as soon as possible. Disgusted without how the first evening started, we went up to our room. We found both of our rooms clean and tidy. The rooms were nothing more or less generous than any other hotel. We had some difficulty getting soap, though each day they cleaned our room and left us every other toiletry item. The hotel is the furthest from any park, and taking a bus to the Magic Kingdom or Epcot was a time consuming adventure. The Disney busses did not appear to show up to the hotel on a regular basis, but when they did arrive, we usually had an opportunity to get on any bus we wanted without having to wait for the next. About seven days into our ten day adventure, we decided we wanted to go to Daytona Beach and so we decided we would need a car. We called the front desk for information regarding a rental car, and they were no help at all. They refused to assist. Disney does NOT want you going off property for ANY reason, so they are certainly not going to help you get a car to leave. We finally called a local company and found that Disney actually has a rental car company ON THEIR PROPERTY. After renting a car, we discovered that we should have done that from the beginning. If you have a key to your hotel, you can park for free at any park, and it's a lot easier to get around to the parks in a rental car - especially if you have dinner reservations and don't want to spend an hour and a half park hopping to get to the right resort and restaurant. The front desk and concierge service was abyssmal. It seemed that any request we had from trying to find a massage to finding out the schedule of fire works at a park were all met with "I don't know." One night we tried to rent a DVD player to watch a DVD we had brought. The front desk informed us that there were no DVD players for rent to the hotel guests. So we went out and bought a DVD player at Wal-Mart. When we brought it back to hook up to the television in the room, we found that the back of the entertainment center was bolted closed and there was no way to hook up the player to the tv. UGH! I won't make this a review of the parks, but the restaurants in the hotel were not spectacular. We did not get to eat in the large buffet style cafeteria but I heard that the food was pretty good there. We did eat in the fancier restaurant on the first floor but it was farm from the best food of the trip. We did see plenty of animals from both of our rooms. Mostly giraffes. The pool and hot tubs were a welcomed respite, and not too crowded. Despite the number of rooms in the hotel (and quite a walk to most of them from the lobby) we did not feel over crowded. The laundry facilities were easily accessible and relatively convenient if not a bit expensive. The rooms were quiet, but they certainly are not designed to keep you indoors. Disney wants you out of the room and spending your money in their parks and in their gift shops. That's also the reason behind them keeping DVD players and hookups out of the room. In the end, the hotel experience was more than adequate, but it was far from the honeymoon romance we desired. But again, if we wanted more relaxation and romance, we would have gone elsewhere. For what it was, we had a pleasant stay, but the luster you expect from a Disney property was certainly not present.

Reviews.Title: “great holiday”
Reviews.Author: cynfranelle
Reviews.Content: husband daughter and i stayed here for 2 special dates our daughters 4th birthday and our 21st anniversary and it was fab from the minute we got there to we left was all we expected and more. we arrived and were given room overlooking carpark but i said i would not be happy with it so lovely girl in reception changed us right away to a suvanagh room with great views how happy were we. Room was not the largest but was good enough for our size of family, it was always clean and made up for us everyday, very large and beautiful hotel with something for everyone, Pool was ok but we went over to the villa pool area as there was more slides and water fun for little one. Staff were friendly always greeting you with Welcome Home when we returned from parks. we eat most mornings at Boma in was lovely but very expensive but we were there for 14 days so soon ran up large bil with the expected tips added on every morning. we also did 2 character meals 1 for daughters bithday and then for our anniversary the food was ok not great again quite expensive for what you really got. while there we went to Mickeys Not So Scary Halloween Party didnt like the fact that we had to pay an extra $185 on top of having already payed £700 pounds for disney tickets and £300 for universal tickets for the 2 weeks we were there but we enjoyed the paprde alot so much so that we have booked holiday for the Mickeys Very Merry Christmas Party later this year (2010) and we are staying in villa this time just because it cost a bit cheaper than AKL but will miss the handyness of the busses to and frow to the parks they ran well and never had to wait more than 10 mins ever and always got a seat. so yes i would recommend this hotel to everyone as long as you have a large wallet

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING.”
Reviews.Author: jessacaf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is abosulutely stunning. If you are a DVC member, use your points for this! As soon as I walked into our room, I was amazed. It immediately felt like home. Everything is decorated beautifully, and since we had 6 people we had the room with 3 beds, 2 sleepers, and a HUGE bathroom and HUGE shower (with stairsteps) and a jet tub. Everything was beautiful and perfectly clean....didn't see ONE spot or mark on a wall or floors anywhere...we had a savannah view so we saw giraffes and zebras literally in our own backyard! The pool was nice, esp the slide and hot tub. The best place to eat is definately the Mara. Disney staff is ALWAYS very very friendly and helpful..so no need to worry about that. Each and every single cast member had a smile on their face at all times and was extremely happy to help. The lounge was beautiful..and the gym was quite nice to. The scenery is absolutely stunning. If you can afford it, or if you're a DVC member...STAY HERE. You will NOT regret it, guaranteed!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: honeymooners072010
Reviews.Content: Wow what can i say, we stayed at AKL for our honeymoon and have just got back from the best 2 weeks ever. The room had a king size bed and bunk beds, with a savannah view and balcony. There was a 2 part bathroom/shower/toilet area and then double sink/dressing area. We saw animals (giraffes, storks, cranes, ankole cattle, water buffalo, eland etc etc) from our balcony every day. The decor was very in keeping with what you would imagine African decor to look like. It appeared well kept and saw no visible wear and tear. There are lifts located all around the hotel. There is also a coin operated laundry area for guests to use. We spent $1 on detergent and $2 on washing and another $2 on drying and all was washed and dry within 50 mins. There are 3 places where you can eat. The Mara which is a canteen type eaterie that serves all day (06.30-00.00) although lunch/dinner can get boring unless you like burgers/pizzas and chicken nuggets. Price wise average breakfast we spent $15 for 2. There is a buffet style restaurant called Boma which serves breakfast and dinner and i would highly recommend this especially the desserts namely the zebra dommes (ladies that is definately one to try). Price wise the breakfast buffet was $23.99 and dinner was $34.99 plus taxes and tips. There is a 3rd restaurant called Jiko, but we did not try this as the food on the menu did not appeal. Looking at the menu average cost for a main meal was about $30 plus tax. The lobby in the hotel is very appealing to the eye and there are plenty of places to sit and relax with also a tv playing disney films for the children. There are plenty of daily activities that go on during the day/evening at the hotel including bongo playing, kids games and crafts and talks by some of the staff. We had no problems with any of the staff at the hotel they all seemed very helpful, happy and courteous. There is a pool area with a slide and pool side bar which serves non alcoholic bevergaes as well as beer, wines and cocktails. We never had a problem getting a sun lounger and towels are provided. There are also 2 outside jacuzzi areas. There is a gym and spa available for guests to use but we cannot comment on these as we did not use them. The hotel does have a high speed internet facility and this cost $9.95 for continous 24 hr usage and they do provide ethernet cables. Yes i do agree with the fact that the hotel is probably the furthest of hotels but we never had a problem with the bus transportation system which takes you to all disney theme parks and hotels and duration of travel varied from 5 mins to about 20 mins. The drivers are very friendly and helpful and the children seemed very well behaved on the buses. We would definately stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to family and friends and to you the reader.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Disney hotel, be prepared to make the most of it!”
Reviews.Author: tabsmum
Reviews.Content: Just got home after 10 days at Jambo house, the main hotel part of AKL. I was pleasantly surprised - the room wasn't as small as I had been led to believe; it was fine for the three of us with two queen beds. Bathroom was a bit disappointing, shower with curtain over the bath, very small area. A couple of corridors along from the lobby, once we had tried a couple of routes we found the best way. View of savannah was good from our room, we had giraffes and zebras very close to our window (on 2nd floor, room 2252) most of the time, apart from about four days when there was nothing at all. If you are struggling to pay for the savannah room I would suggest you don't bother. There are numerous viewing places all over the hotel and for the two minutes a day (max) you are looking out of the window is it worth it?? Also there are night viewing areas with night-vision goggles around the grounds. We had planned to sit on the balcony at night watching the animals with a bottle of wine while our daughter slept, but it was very humid and so couldn't stand to. As for being out of the way, this didn't affect us at all. We drove to the parks instead of getting the bus as I couldn't be bothered to wait and wanted to be in control of when we left, heading off to restaurants etc after the parks. Jiko is good but expensive.. Boma gets old very quickly, and if you are on the dining plan a meal there counts as table service, although is technically a buffet. Mara is the fast food canteen but is fine for dining plan grub. If you're paying for your meals, go to cracker barrell for breakfast, was definately much better value and quality. There is a shortcut off to the 192 (Sherbeth Rd) right near AKL which saves time. We were lucky to get the dining plan thrown in as part of our deal but I don't know if I would have paid for it. Even for free, you have to consider the 20% tip per meal. So for a Jiko (two point per person) meal for two with a glass of wine you are looking at about $20-$25 dollars for a tip. If you are on the dining plan, paid for or not, read up about the dining plan before you go and of course plan your reservations. The pool area is good but very busy and people reserve chairs very early, sometimes not using them all day which is annoying. Free pool towels which is handy. The fitness centre was a bit outdated but practically empty the (few) times I visited. We used Simba's Cub house twice for evening child care - my girl was the only kid there the first night but three the second. Staff were good, the other paid activities like ceramics are OK, something to do if you need a break from park stress. Disney make it all very easy. Our disney cards were for door entry, dining plan, paying for stuff in the shops etc. Easy to rack up a ton of money!!

Reviews.Title: “A little out of the way but a wonderful place to stay at Disney”
Reviews.Author: Often_on_road
Reviews.Content: Kidani Village is a new property adjacent to the Animal Kingdom Lodge. The rooms are generally all suites. Ours was a one bedroom, with a full kitchen, washer/dryer and sleep sofa and sleep chair in the livingroom. Two full baths, with the master having both a whirlpool and stall shower. The room also has a safe. Internet is wired only and $9.95/day. Service is Disney's specialty and it shows in this hotel. A "cast member" greeted our party by name as we got off the free Disney Magical Express from the airport. Special pins for the first timers and recent graduate in our group were part of the special package that he handed to us. Because it was early in the day, our room was not yet ready but they offered to text my phone when it would be available. Our room keys were given to us ahead of time and our luggage stored. Less than a hour later, while we were eating lunch, the text came through. This resort's beautiful African decor is a mere setting for what is outside -- animals that rove the 100 acre preserve. It was incredible to observe the wide variety of animals. The resort has its own bus area, with buses to all of the Disney attractions. This was the only negative of the location -- because it is further away from most of the parks, the wait for the bus tends to be longer than when I stayed at other luxury resorts and you only have the bus system available. The room and hotel were kept spotless by a cheerful crew. The front desk was always eager to please. Everything was geared towards having a wonderful time and we most certainly did. Everything was wonderful. What also makes this resort special is the size. Unlike the larger resorts, the smaller size of this property made it seem more intimate and exclusive.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation EVER!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bchavis054
Reviews.Content: Myself, Spouse, and 4 year old son stayed at the AKL from 7/20-7/27 and absolutely loved it. Disney really has the vacation experience down to a science! Starting a few weeks before or trip, we received our bag tags and travel info from the Disney Magical express. I have to be honest, i was a little nervous about the Magical Express baggage pick up and bus situation. But no need to worry disney pulled it off with no problems! We just checked our bags in Virginia and through “The Disney magic” they were in our rooms by the time we returned from the park on our first night. The bus from the airport went off flawlessly. We waited for about 20 mins on the bus for it to leave. It took us about 45 mins from the time we left the airport until the time we got to our hotel. This seems like a long time, but they have a movie that you can watch on the bus (a plus for the kids) and the bus does make stops at other resorts. When we got the the AKL, our room was not ready for check in. We did the online check in, so we bypassed the long check-in/out line and headed right to the counter. The front desk staff was so helpful and happy to answer all the questions that we had. We checked in and headed down to the Mara for a quick bit to eat for lunch. By the time we were done with lunch our room was ready for us and we went right up! The room was beautiful! We had the Savanna view room, with bunk beds. The room was a decent size. It has a mini fridge, flat screen TV, Safe, Small table ect. The BEST part about this room was the Savanna view/balcony. My wife and I spent every night and early morning sitting out on the balcony while our child slept. A few nights we could even hear and see the fireworks from the Magic Kingdom! Also, at night the giraffe would lay down in front of our room! I would recommend the 3rd floor and up, if you have a choice. We also spent sometime every day at the pool. It was great and refreshing on those hot florida summer days! It is a large pool with a small kids type slide. I think the max depth was under 5 foot. It ha large lights that keep it well light at night. There is a small bar, and plenty of seating. They also have life jackets for kids. There is a small kids pool and a small hot tub also. There are 3 restaurants at the hotel. We ate at Boma, and the Mara while we were there. I would HIGHLY recommend a Disney Dining plan, and the meals can be expensive. We had the Deluxe plan for everyone in our family. This includes 3 meals and 2 snacks per day for everyone. We ended up having 5 meals left over and used all of our snacks. We did ask on the last day if we could exchange out some of our meals for snacks, which they gladly did at a rate of 3 snacks per meal. So we had plenty of snacks for the plane ride back! We also received 3 refillable resort drink mugs! These were great because you could fill them with any of the soda, tea, or coffee at the mara drink stand. We ate breakfast @ the Mara/Boma most of the mornings that we were at the resort. Dinner at Boma is excellent! I would recommend making a reservation though, as it is really busy. We did walk in 1 night, but had to wait 45 mins. I read a lot of complaints about the distance of the hotel to the parks and having to wait for the bus. We only had a problem with the busses one night. The first night we stayed at the magic kingdom until it closed (to watch the parade and fireworks) we had to wait about 40mins for the bus. This was ONLY because everyone was trying to leave the park at the same time. Other then that, we waited a max of 10-20 mins for a bus. It was very easy! Its about a 20min ride to the Magic Kingdom (the furthest park away). I can tell you this, after a long day at the park, i didn't mind the 20min in the A/C of the bus. There were always enough seats on the bus. Overall the stay was excellent and my family and I are already planing our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Unwind from Disney Madness”
Reviews.Author: wutnik
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to have a Savannah view room at AKL during our first vacation to Disney World the week of July 17-24. It was so nice to have a quiet peaceful place to unwind for a bit after facing the heat and crowds. Our package was booked with Westjet Vacations with flight from Winnipeg and connection in Toronto Canada. We booked the regular dining plan and 7 day park tickets (no hopper, no waterpark). We choose not to tag our bags and picked them up before boarding the Magical Express. Check in was very smooth. We were even able to get my Mom who was also visiting Orlando added to our room so she could spend a couple of days with us at the parks. As others have mentioned, this lobby is spectacular. You keep finding interesting things about it each time you walk in. The room while not spacious (as we knew from TA reviews) was clean and comfortable. The view was AMAZING. The giraffes were out when we arrived and were usually out in the late afternoon. We also saw lots of birds, ostriches, zebras and antelope. I thought the lighting and comfort of beds, etc was fine. The hotel was very quiet at night and we were able to get a good rest after our long days. Bus transfer to the parks was fairly efficient and we usually did not have to wait terribly long. The distance from Magic Kingdom/Epcot I thought was the biggest draw back to this beautiful hotel. We found the bus trip to be rather long especially if you didn’t get a seat. This was especially difficult with our stroller, bags and four year old daughter in tow. We ate one breakfast and two lunches at the Mara quick service restaurant and it was good. I regretted a bit not getting a refillable mug when we first got there as it would have been handy for morning coffees and drinks by the pool. The dining plan portions are huge with a massive dessert accompanying each one. We found the two huge meals a day to be even more food than we needed. We also dined at Boma one evening. Boma was a treat with its fabulous African themed buffet. The pool area was huge and beautiful. It easily rivals the pools we encountered at Beaches resorts. Much busier though. This pool is full of people from morning to night, much like all of Disney. Getting a lounge chair proved to be difficult sometimes with so many people at the pool and likely many not even at the pool but reserving their chair. Services available that we used on site were the gift shop for milk /beer and souvenirs, the concierge for reservations and questions, the photopass desk and laundry facilities. In the heat we were going through clothes like crazy and needed to do wash about 5 days into our trip. Other nice features of the hotel are the playground, the viewing area, and the activities throughout the day. This hotel could be a destination in itself and we would have liked to have more time to spend at the property. I would highly recommend AKL to get away from it all after the long hot days in the park. It would have been a bit disappointing though if we had got a poolside room. You would lose the peacefulness and feeling of getting away from it all. It was a great place to see and stay at once. Should our travels ever take us back to Disney, we’d likely try to get a deluxe resort closer to the park on the monorail. You spend enough time waiting in Disney and we found the travel time took up too much precious time on an already jam packed schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort/Magical Time/Amazing Birthday”
Reviews.Author: _lovetotravel4_33514
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge- Jambo House Villas last June. I am planning another trip and was reading some of these recent reviews and I felt compelled to share my experience .This resort is exotic and beautiful the moment you walk in. The staff greeted us quickly. Check in was very fast and friendly even though they were busy. Our room was a little jaunt from the lobby where you walk out and catch the buses and the pool and both restaurants but this gave us more opportunity to catch another view of different animals as your walking through the halls and good exercise. If the boys were getting antsy while my husband and I were gathering last minute things or still getting ready, they would go to several different animal look out spots and try to name the different ones and spot any new animals. They would also go to the lobby where they played great African music and there are several comfortable spots to sit and watch childrens movies or disney cartoons while waiting. There is alot of art and interesting artifacts to see as well. I traveled with my two sons 6 and 16 and husband. Arrived on a Wednesday stayed till the following Tuesday. First night ate at Boma it was very good, large variety of food. We planned this trip to celebrate my 6 year old sons birthday and everything was absolutely amazing for him and well everyone. While the boys swam and rode the slide, my husband and I sat and watched them and sipped on a few cocktails. It was nice they had complimentary life jackets for little ones. The slide does drop off into about 31/2 4 feet of water. Wearing the jacket made my 6yr old feel much better. The pool is not as large as other resorts it is very clean and relaxing with plenty of towels and lounge chairs and the landscaping was lovely. They also have a spa which is situated over by this beautiful bird area. You can watch many different types. Again, the staff was very helpful and friendly. Housekeeping was great, again very pleasant and prompt. We took one day for some down time slept in and did a bit of laundry which was convenient to have in the hotel but we did have to walk a little bit to reach it, not a big deal though. Our room was great, clean, roomy we had a king size bed and a sofa sleeper, the bed was very comfortable and the dark blinds were very nice if you sleep in once in awhile. Sink, mini fridge, coffee maker, table chairs flat screen tv lots of toiletries, the balcony was so cool to sit out there in the morning and evenings and just gaze out at the Serengeti. Ok well almost. I feel bad for the other guests who had some issues at AKL. If they read anything about the resort they were staying at they should of know the AKL is the furthest hotel from all the parks which of course would take a bit longer. Never had to wait more than 10 minutes to get a bus only because we happened to miss the one pulling away. Your on vacation and have spent alot of money to have this experience, shouldnt you slow down a bit and relax. Instead of constantly rushing? The gift shop was great they had many snacks and grocery items you could take to your room and stick in the mini frig(cereal,milk, yogurt) and many great gifts. One minor glich we did not realize, one day we were at one park and felt like we were done there so we headed to Epcot to use another days ticket to enter there and they would not let us. We knew we had one extra park day to use since we had that lounging day and then went to Downtown Disney instead and did not use our park ticket that day. Unless you buy the Park Hopper add on you can only enter one park a day. Oh well we just went back to the first park and had more fun there and did more shopping. We did pay extra for the savannah view with our room and we loved loved it. Every morning to wake up to giraffes and zebras and amazing birds it was just incredibe and beautiful. I just can't say enough. When I told the boys we were taking this trip, this was the first place they wanted to stay. So worth it. While we were at the Magic Kingdom on Thursday the actual day of my 6year olds birthday we purchased a gift ahead of time, in which they came to our room while we were at the parked and had several different decorated boxes with different gifts inside from Mickey, Minnie, Donald, Goofy and Pluto and Tink. They sprinkled pixie dust in the room, tink was waiting for him Mickey left several gifts including his autograph and so many other gifts-cant mention them all. My son was amazed at how they knew it was his birthday and where he was staying. To walk in and have the entire room sprinkled with different size boxes and gifts was just so so Magical, if you could only see his face. Everyone at the Animal Kingdom Lodge and every park we went to made my son feel incredibly special. They wished him Happy Birthday and stop and talk to him and he was able to steer the Jungle Safari boat at the Magic Kingdom Park and wore the captain hat. Ok Ok enough there were so many magical wonderful things that happened I could go on and on. So to finish up the Tuesday day of check out we left all our luggage with the concierge staff and let them know we would be back for the Magical Express bus later to take us to the airport but we were heading to Epcot one last time and they took care of all our belongings. We still had meals on our Dining Plan that was not used. We did purchase the plan which gives you one table service meal one quick service meal and one snack per person each day. Alot Alot of food it was great What we did is we went to Epcot ordered our lunch and then asked a few people behind us if we could buy them lunch, to use up our plan so as not to waste it. They were shocked. What an incredible trip. My soon to be 18 year old wants to spend his birthday here in September. So see ya soon.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: JJECNorthWales
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge, Jambo House, for 7 days. We were dropped off right outside the main entrance. When we entred the reception area, we immediately noticed the african theme that we had heard about. We were greeted warmly by the reception staff, they were very helpful, giving us information about the hotel, our room and what we could go and see around Orlando. There were two types of room on offer, Pool View rooms and Savanna View rooms. We got the Savanna View rooms. From our balcony we could see a whole range of animals such as Zebras, Giraffes and Wildebeests. When you're from a place like Wales, they're not something you see every day in your front garden. It was a really interesting experience. We also had complimentary bus services travelling from the lodge to the 4 main Walt Disney World Parks, the 2 water parks, and the Downtown Disney area. The bus stops were just a short walk away from the lobby. This was our second stay in Florida, our last was 3 years ago, but we weren't let down. Thank you to everyone who worked at the Animal Kingdom Lodge and all the other Walt Disney World Parks for making our second visit so amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Kidani Village: a magical Disney resort”
Reviews.Author: starjewelmom
Reviews.Content: I was with my kids (13 & 8 years old) and my parents (in their early 60's). This resort is stunning! The lobby was amazing, but not too huge or impersonal. There is a small area for kids to cool their heels while adults check in, with a t.v. and a Wii station. Cast members were all over the place, all eager to answer questions and/or offer assistance. We had a one bedroom villa, savanna view. Giraffes, zebras, ostriches, and other animals were right outside our room! The room was very comfortable with a sleeper sofa and sleeper armchair (about the width of a daybed and very comfy), plus a king bed in the separate bedroom. Two full baths and a full kitchen, plus washer and dryer. It was very spacious but still very cozy.Our room was a short walk from the lobby, and just a couple of doors down from the laundry room, arcade, and community room; yet it was very quiet. Only twice was I able to hear people chatting while walking in the hall. Noise is not a problem here... Sanaa (restaurant) is just lovely: Indian food with some African influences (try the orange-sesame cake for dessert; amazing!). We all loved our dinners. I worried about the distance and waiting/transit times to the parks (I read many comments online and in guidebooks from people griping about this issue). But we went in "high season" and never waited longer than 10 minutes for a bus to or from any park (and we left the parks at closing time every night we were there). Also, the buses are shared by Jambo house and Kidani village; I didn't feel that the shared route made the commute to/from the parks any longer. I will definitely return. Only one issue: no food court. We used a meal plan and realized we had a lot of counter service credits left the night before we departed. I think if we had been nearer to a food court, we would have used them all up. (The nearest food court is at Jambo house, a decent walk.) There was a little golf cart that shuttled guests to and from Jambo house, but only in the daytime. Still, with better meal planning on my part, I will be back to Kidani village. It was a magical experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with giraffes and zebras right outside your balcony”
Reviews.Author: honeybee3311
Reviews.Content: We really loved this hotel for ourselves and our two small children and would highly recommend this. Rooms were spacious and comfortable. We saw Zebras, Giraffes, bison, pelicans right outside our Savannah View room almost all day and all night. The animals seem to always be around. Not a ton of variety. By the 4th day we were tired of seeing the Giraffe so if you are on a budget you might want to splurge on this hotel for 3 or 4 days at the end of your trip. We had a rental car otherwise this might have been inconveniently located. The pool had zero entry in the small end so this was great for kids and there was a small water slide also and a hot tub. Boma's had a great buffet breakfast as well with a really good guava juice drink instead of plain oj.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, but too long of waits for busing to/from Disney Parks”
Reviews.Author: wifam4
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed in a Standard Club Level Room for 9 nights. As for the Resort itself, it has everything you may want for a relaxing stay. Dining, pool, shopping, spa/fitness area and plenty of activities throughout the day are all exceptional. One could take several days to explore the resort itself. Our room was on the Kudu Trail and overlooked the Arusha Savanna. We saw animals from our patio at all times of the day (pelicans, zebras,ankole cattle, girafffe and more). The rooms themselves are small for a family of 4 and their luggage. As well as the great savanna view from our room, we could see the top of Everest over the trees. As for "club level rooms", the club lounge is on the 6th floor. We were on the 4th and it was quite a walk to the lounge. The lounge has ample supply of beverages and different snacks throughout the day, we went most mornings for the breakfast items. I was disappointed the lounge closed around 10pm. We usually arrived back at the resort from the parks after that time and would have liked to have stopped in for beverages. The biggest disappointment for us at the AKL was the bus transportation to all the parks. Our wait times were anywhere from 15-35 minutes to get a bus leaving the resort and coming back from the parks it was usually a 30-60 minute wait. I do not remember wait times being so long on previous visits at other resorts. As a deluxe resort I would expect less wait times. We were there 10 days, so we could afford to wait because we had plenty of days at the parks, however, we needed to plan on at least an hour transportation time to be on time for dinner reservations at EPCOT. The AKL is a vacation destination in itself. Combined with all WDW Resort has to offer a family can have a memorable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “nice, but FAR from everything”
Reviews.Author: deaconia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at AKL for four nights last week. The hotel is visually stunning, the lobby is amazing and the staff were helpful. The rooms were average sized rooms, bathroom a bit small but the double sink area was great. We stayed in a savannah view room - we saw giraffe and other animals outside of our room daily - definitely a unique experience. There are plenty of areas around the hotel for viewing the animals, and if you don't want to spring the extra $100+/night for the view, you can get by seeing the animals throughout the hallway windows and the many viewing areas in the hotel. We ate at BOMA one night (just okay) and the Mara for breakfast and lunch (good food, a bit chaotic with kids at times). We didn't eat at Jiko, but peeked in and it was mainly empty for the nights we were there. The pool at AKL was smaller than expected, and crowded! We visited the pool at the villas - a long walk away but worth the smaller crowd. My main complaint about this hotel is that it is FAR FAR FAR from everywhere else in Disney, except for Animal Kingdom. The bus ride alone to Magic Kingdom is a full 20 minutes, and when you add in wait times for the shuttle (which always seemed to be longer for AKL than the other hotels), it takes at times a full hour to get to anywhere else on the Disney grid. If you have small children or a big group, I would recommend staying at a closer hotel to avoid the wait times.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: DiamondN23
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed at the lodge July 3-9. Great hotel and stay. Stayed on fourth floor concierge level. Had a view of the animals but there were not too many that came out during our stay saw more on safari tour. You can take the food back to your room, well worth the extra money. They have drinks and lots of food. I was avaible to get milk for my 1 year old. Boma was so good I had to go back a second time. The rooms are a little small but we were able to it seven big pieces of luggage in the room and set the pack and play up. The first room I got was on the zebra trail and the very first room we could not see animals and changed rooms the next day. My boyfriend got a birthday gift for his birthday wish was a nice surprise. The gift shop is really nice and The Mara has a good chicken salad. We did the sunrise safari well worth the extra money. Was able to see all the animals up close and the breakfast were really good. I am a very picky person and only stay at five star resorts. I have stayed at the cove in the Bahamas and Halekulani in Hawaii. I read lots of reviews and did lots of research before I went. The transportation is not that bad. The longest we had to travel was to downtown Disney. That took about 45 min. We were able to go to epcot, Ak, MK, Hollywood studios and seaworld. We had a ticket for Fantasmic-recommend was able to get one a couple weeks before. My favorite park was Hollywood studios rode the Tower or terror with my six year old. We had a blast. Highly recommed the fast past saved us a lot of time. Ohana character breakfast is really good also did the luau. The character breakfast at Hollywood and Vine was not so good.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: Mentalnurse
Reviews.Content: A little late in writing this review but just wanted to say how fantastic this hotel was. Our first visit to WDW, 2 children aged 7 and 16. Booked a standard room however on check was pleased to hear that we had been upgraded to a savannah view for free!! The entire place made you feel like you were really somewhere special, the low level lighting (which many complain about) added to the african atomosphere. The room was lovely, large bed, bunk beds, two sinks outside of bathroom and adequately sized bathroom with shower over bath. My only negative would be that there was not much storage space, but who cares, your in Disney!! When we booked with Virgin we had received the free disney dining plan, however they upgraded this for free to the deluxe dining plan....all I can say is WOW....I wouldn't consider going again without this, it completely took the pressure off having to watch what you spent on food, we were eating 3 course twice a day!! Buffet breakfast at Boma was lovely, so much choice with some of it African themed, ate there once for dinner which was also lovely but then discovered the signature restaurants!! Jiko was absolutely stunning, I was a little worried that they would not be family friendly but boy was I wrong, my 7 year old absolutely loved this restaurant, we ended up eating there about 5 nights!! We didn't really use the pool much as it was pretty cold and to be honest we didn't have the energy, the hot tub was fab though. The staff were sooooo friendly, nothing was too much trouble for them. All in all this was a fantastic experience and we will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again! Sorely Dissappointed in Animal Kingdom Lodge!”
Reviews.Author: WeLuv2Travel50
Reviews.Content: Terrible. - Worst sewrvice I ever had at a WDW resort. I have stayed in others but his one was horrible for customer service and bed comfort! I had to see a chiropracter when I got back home because the bed was so bad. All furnishings were worn out. for the price I was so dissappointed. First night there I could not find the pool. Called front desk and they gave me attitude about how I should have read the material thay gave me. Unbelievable how this hotel staff treatred me and some other guests. When I booked the said that I could get a late check out. I anly needed one more hour. When it was time they would not let me have the hour extra. POOR!!! Other hotels never have a problem with that. This issue and others will not only not having me return to this resort hotel, but I wil never stay on WDW property again!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! I'm in Love with this resort!”
Reviews.Author: JennyLynn050
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this resort, everything was amazing I have already booked my next trip and I just had to come back! The service was Disney wonderful the rooms were beautiful, we had a pool view room which was almost as impressive a view as the savanna rooms! Kids and adults of all ages will find something fun to do and see, I know I sound like a travel brochure, but I promise it's just that great! I can't wait for my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “A once in a lifetime experience”
Reviews.Author: 2BoysHockeyMom
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 6 nights at this great hotel. The imposing building and large front driveway leading up to the building is the first to greet you. There is no shortage of staff to greet you or ask if you need help. Once inside there is a large foyer with African details throughout. Lots of lounge chairs and even a TV playing old Disney cartoons to entertain. The concierge could book your activities or get you tickets. We also got tickets to a Luah at the Polynesian Village Hotel. At the back of the lobby was a large window which must have been the entire 5 stories tall. Lots of African artifacts to look at all over. Even a Caricature artist was stationed there each evening. Our hotel room overlooked the Arushna Savanna and almost every night, a giraffe was sleeping right infront of our balcony. Each day we would see giraffe, zebra and various African animals and birds. The staff at this hotel and all of the theme parks can't do enough to make your stay memorable. The room was a large double (wouldn't say it was a queen) with bunk beds and not overly large. The bathroom was dimly lit and the door almost swung into the toilet so it was very small. At least there were 2 sinks on the other side of it. That helped. The pool was large and open 24 hrs. There was a small children's slide. It was lifeguarded from 10-10 each day with a Tikki bar. The restaurants were nice looking but we didn't eat at them. We had booked other restaurants at each of the theme parks we went to each day. The quick service cafeteria had food. We only ate there for 1 breakfast and a late night snack. It was a little pricey but no different than the theme park prices. They even sold microwave foods since there was a microwave in this cafe as the hotel room itself only had a fridge in it. We saw people making their own toast for breakfast there and if you bought a refillable mug, you could add any pop or coffee at any time in any of the hotels. That would be a challenge as they are pretty strict on security and we were screened each time we entered and exited the hotel. If you stayed at this hotel you could visit the Villas next door and use their facilities. The pool was smaller but had a different slide. From there you could see more animals too. There were staff stationed outside each outer area to ask questions. A nice "cast member" from Nairobi I believe chatted with us about the giraffes. At night you could observe them through night vision goggles too. There were children's activities each day. You could also pay to have babysitting service. My 9 and 11 year old only took advantage of crayon etchings of African animals on the floor of the lobby. They were also going to make cookies after that but we declined the offer as we were off to a theme park. The hotel offered the free Disney shuttle buses but we had a rental so never used the service as you were given free parking to each theme park with your stay. We also saw cruise line buses picking up people and also airport shuttle buses. Although the room was pricey it was worth having a Savannah view even if we did it just once. There were observation decks for guests to see the animals, but with it being so hot and humid and there were mosquitos at night, it was nice to slip back into the room quick after you took photos of the animals. We did luck out as not all of the Savannah rooms would get animals parked out infront of their balcony. We just happened to be given a lobby level room that was infront of a feeding station. The grounds staff were always out each day cutting the grass and tending to the animals' needs. They seemed to be well cared for. Our maid ("mousekeeper") made different animals out of the towels for the first couple days after we left a tip each day for her. Not sure if all the housekeepers do that. She was very thankful for the money and personally thanked us on the last morning of our stay. Although the location was the farthest away from the Magic Kingdom, it really only amounted to about 15 mins. by car. Not sure how long on a bus. It was very secluded. There was a McDonald's close by but it seemed to have "tourist prices". The parking lot was very large and required a bit of a hike up the hill if you didn't park near the front. What we liked the most was having the African experience and feeling like you were actually in some of the countries there, also the fact, you could spend your entire stay right at the hotel and have something to see or do. The villa next door also had tennis courts and basketball. If there was something that we didn't like so much, it would have to be the size of the room. The pillows were also very tall and my neck started hurting after a couple days. Also, you had to pay for the internet ($14/day). At the prices they charge, it should really be included. What was nice in the room was the fact the air conditioner was very quiet which makes a change from many hotel rooms. We also used the laundry facilities too. That seems to have covered most of the hotel. It really did add a great deal of pleasure to our whole Disney experience. After a long, hot tiring day out at the parks, it was great to be able to come back here. The security guard would even say that each time you came back , "Welcome Home". I hope one day, we can really go back home!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Disney property but...”
Reviews.Author: tsk1188
Reviews.Content: Had a recent stay at AKL. Very cool hotel, rooms are quite a walk from the lobby but it is a big place. We have a savannah overlook room and saw a few animals - zebras, some giraffes - not as many as we hoped and they seemed to never be there in the morning. I definitely would recommend this place but if you are going to be gone all day long at the parks then you really miss a lot of what the hotel offers - in that case a less expensive property would do better. I did notice on several other review sites of other Disney properties that bedbugs were mentioned. I don't know if that is what happened to me or not but I did end up with red patches on both of my legs after a couple of nights--no one else in my party noticed anything and my husband who was in the same bed was not bothered.

Reviews.Title: “Great place. Even if get a room not...”
Reviews.Author: RJ24R2
Reviews.Content: Great place. Even if get a room not facing animal areas plenty of options to view in common areas. Save the $$ and do it that way unless really into it. Also quite a long ride to magic kingdom. Just be aware if planning on returning to room throughout day. Great place would stay every time if not so expensive. Recommend for animal kingdom visitors -cant beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: scott0i812
Reviews.Content: The hotel is amazing...looks great...had a room with a view of the animals. If I had to pay full price or just under I would skip it. We did see a few giraffe, birds and one other. The room was nice. Two large queens, 32' LCD great balcony large closet with safe and nice bathroom with 2 sinks. The room was not small at all, its just the beds take up a lot of room. The only draw back is the rooms a a long walk from the lobby..but oh well. We took the buses to DW, AK and Epcot. We never had to wait more then 5 min and the buses was never too packed. On the way back it was the same. Not a big deal (and we carried a stroller). It was my daughters birthday so the 1st night mickey left her a voice mail with happy birthday, on the 2nd night they left a card from micky in the room with a small cake. Disney did a good job. Great free self parking too. The only issue is with the price of the rooms...a 3 night stay durring peak would have been almost $1500, good thing we only paid 1/2 other wise you can find cheeper. But for a one time adventure here it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience!”
Reviews.Author: aimeecarys
Reviews.Content: After a stay on International Drive, the highlight of our holiday was spending the last few days at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. We upgraded to a Savannah view room and it was well worth the extra. The expressions on our daughters' faces when they saw the giraffe and zebra from our balcony is one memory I'll never forget! The attention to detail in the architecture is second to none, as is the service. The rooms are not large, but are beautifully furnished in African style. I found the bed a little hard but I suppose that's a question of taste. We were able to use the pool at Kidani Village aswell as the one at Jambo Lodge which made a nice change and meant that neither pool was too busy. The Mara foodcourt was fairly priced for Disney and had a good selection (not just the usual burger and pizza), however beware of the buffet breakfast at Boma. Although the food was delicious our children ate very little and breakfast for four cost almost 90 dollars. Prices are not advertised! All in all, a stay at this hotel is a fantastic experience - you could believe you were in Africa. Highly recommended, we will definitely be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Izzie54
Reviews.Content: This was my third time going to disney and this resort is by far the best one I have stayed at. The location is a little out of the way but, with the transportation provided by disney, this did not become too much of a problem. Rooms were decent, hotel had nice details and nice grounds. If I went back, I probably would stay here (depending on price).

Reviews.Title: “The most magical experiece of my life.”
Reviews.Author: alice_c_678
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by African hotel workers all in traditional dress. It wasnt just a brief 'welcome' it was litterally as if my family were something very special and we were wanted there! The building if fully air conditions which was lovely when it was so hot and humid outside!! The service was wanderfull all week with all of the hotel workers being polite and friendly never without a cheery smile or making us think we were putting them out. The cleaners always left some king of micky mouse shaped towel on our beds which even my teenagers enjoyed! The pool was exceptional very clean with many life gaurds. The atmosphere of this hotel was more than i could ever ask for. The back ground African music was so peaceful and made you feel like you were really in the savanna. The animals were also incredible. There are so many viewing points that you are often the only guests that are at one at one time so you can enjoy the animals on your own if you wish. The food was great, and i would really reccomend going on a dining plan as it saved us a lot of money. The restaurant ' Jiko' was my favourate as it was typical ';fine dining' and you have a waiter of your own that isnt shared between about 5 different families. The staff were incredible and i would reccoment this hotel to anybody who really wants an experience of a life time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - but be prepared to walk.... and wait... a lot!”
Reviews.Author: admit_it
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the top floor of Kudu Trail - almost at the end of the building. It was over 1,000 steps to the front door from our room. This doesn't sound all that terrible - but when you forget something in your room and don't realize it until you are at the bus stop, or consider that all of the dining options are on the OTHER side of the resort, or you have spent the entire day walking in a park - you will realize that this resort is extremely LARGE. We had reserved a Savanna view room, and our view was of the Arusha Savanna. You WILL see animals - but keep in mind that animals and humans have different schedules! Very early morning and early afternoon/evening is when we saw animals. It doesn't get any better than seeing a giraffe first thing in the morning, feeding outside your room! It's quite incredible! As far as the service - the front desk staff wasn't all that great. The young lady that checked us in was really unsure of everything. She didn't have definitive answers to any of our questions. Later during the week we stopped by to change a dining reservation, we really had a tough time working with the guy at the front desk.
