We didnt have a savanah room but there are plenty of oppertunities to view the animals. The beds were very comfy and the rooms were an exceptable size. I had read complaints about the hotel and rooms being quite dark but I wondered what was expected as the hotel has a distinct african theme and the surrounding have to be as natural to the animals as possible. we thoroughly enjoyed this hotel and would have no qualms about booking it again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel... very suitable for families”
Reviews.Author: MsHolidayManiac
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a disney holiday, and i have to say that it is top notch. The room are amazingly clean. We didnt find one speck of dust in the room for the two weeks that we were there! The resteraunt wasnt like a posh hotel resteraunt, but the food was nice and the staff there were very friendly. When me and my brother went down to get hot chocolate or something like that, it was about 5 dollars for the both of them (expensive, i know) and we only had about 3 dollars, they let us have them, and didnt even make us pay them back the next day, even though my dad tried to! It is nice and it fills you up, and is much better than paying a lot for a 'high class' meal in the resteraunt downstairs. The thing about the mara is, there is only 3 dinner and breakfast and they get a bit boring after a while. For breakfast i say you should have bacon with a waffle and drown it all in maple syrup! Sounds disgusting but its lush, honest. The hotel makes you feel very at home and friendly, and it has a very comfortable atmosfere. The caricature man or woman is very good, and he will even frame your pictures for you! Animal Kingdom is quite far away from the parks, especially universal. It took us about an hour to get there, but it was well worth it! I also recomend you not to waste your time and money on seaworld, as the only good thing there is the whale show which has probably put lots of people off because of the little killing incident recently. The journey from Bristol airport is 12 hours, so i would prepare yourself well! Hollywood studios was my favourite park, defo. The shop in the Animal Kingdom Lodge is really nice, with everything that you would want and need... well, you shouldnt need anything at all in this hotel! You seriously get what you pay for! The beds are extremely comfy, and made you want to sleep early which is easier to get up early! The buses for the parks are running all day long so if your tired and want a lie in or a relaxing swim in the pool or spa session you can go to the parks in the night or the afternoon. The african theme is very cool and disney! Last word: Rent a car... it;s much cheaper, quicker and easier than to catch a taxi or bus to universal or the shopping malls! Anyway, go here, it's magical!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience if You Plan Ahead”
Reviews.Author: CreightonBlueJ
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the AKL! But we also did our homework and when traveling to Disneyworld it is necessary! I bought several of the books recommended (Passporter) to make our stay the best it could be (available on Amazon or at Borders). I knew to book a One Bedroom Savannah Family Suite with a kitchen (plates, glasses, toaster dishwasher included) at the Jambo House (even though I am not a DVC Member they are available and very spacious). We had a king bed and the family room had a pullout double couch and a pullout chair twin bed and washing machine set (convenient to throw our soaking clothes into from the daily rainstorms). The view was fabulous from our balcony and we were treated to giraffe mating season right outside our room. Kids got a huge kick out of and so did we answering many questions. Because of this type of room we had one of the local grocery stores deliver drinks and breakfast foods to our room the day of our arrival. Not only was it affordable but convenient to not have to eat out for breakfast everyday. Also ordered a case of water which I recommend if traveling in the summer as it is HOT! I also advise the meal plan. The one that had a counter meal a snack and a sit down dinner was perfect for us. We knew which parks we would be visiting on a daily basis and we scheduled dinner at a restaurant at that park in advance. (This is a MUST! When they say call 180 days in advance for reservations, it means just that!) This timeframe has been known to change so please check on it. We had no problem getting into the best restaurants every night we wanted, and we ended up way ahead on the meal plan as I totaled what we spent vs. what we paid at the end of each day and you do come out better IF you eat at the nicer more expensive restaurants either on property or at the parks. We ate at Le Cellier, Coral Reef, Boma, Saana, 50's Diner, and Crystal Palace (disappointing buffet) for dinner and lunch at each park. Saana, Coral Reef and Le Cellier were our favorite. Our waitress at 50's diner was a hoot. Just know that reservations are a must and those that stay at the resort and purchase the package get preference on reservations. Negatives: Room Service trays were not picked up all day in the hallway on several occasions. Our room was not vacuumed when we arrived (hair ball on floor) but that was quickly taken care of. Because we stayed in a room typically reserved for DVC members we did not get towel service on the second day (typically if you are a DVC member your towel service is every few days). When I called and reminded them I was not a DVC member and that I would like fresh towels daily we had them. Property is the farthest away from the Magic Kingdom but sometimes the decompressing ride back on the bus was just what our kids aged 13 and 9 needed to unwind. We went in August and there was a thunder/lightning storm almost every afternoon and they would close the pool due to weather conditions - not Disney's fault but that was when we wanted to swim the most was early evening and sure enough it was pouring and lightning. Make sure to bring your ponchos! Also, be sure to ask when Disney checks your bags at the hotel (service offered free as part of our package) that the flight has not been canceled or delayed. Our first flight was delayed causing our luggage to be checked all the way home and we had no control in changing it once we arrived at the airport and found we had automatically been rerouted on another flight. We made it home fine......3 out of 4 bags didn't until a day later. Pros: We never waited more than 15-20 minutes for a bus. If you have ever parked at a disney park you know that the bus service is worth its weight in gold. Our boys loved the map to search and find every animal at the Jambo House and even went out at night with the night goggles they provide to look for the animals. The pool at the Kidani Village is better and I would recommend taking the quick 5 minute bus trip up the road to the sister property to use that pool. However the bartenders at the pool bar at Jambo House were very friendly and accommodating - great drinks by the way! They also have a gaming room for the kids up at Kidani Village as well however the lobby is 1/10th the size it is at the Jambo House and way less impressive. Ladies were in the lobby daily giving facts and information about Africa and its history and the kids enjoyed asking questions and getting answers in the lobby daily on our way out for the day. The pros far outweighed the cons and we would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful African Inspired Resort”
Reviews.Author: skellyhiddenmountain
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Savannah Bunk View Room with 2 children ages 5 and 1. We had a great view of many different types of African animals. The staff was prompt and efficient. We never had to wait too long on a bus. The few times that we needed to hurry for reservations at other resorts we simply took a taxi. We enjoyed the Savannah View but really were not in the room long enough to really enjoy it. We could have just as easily view the animals from several different viewing areas. The food is excellent. We especially enjoyed Boma's. We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience for entire family!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy77Connecticut
Reviews.Content: As members of the Disney's Vacation Club we stayed in the Kidhani Village Resort as opposed to the Jambo House which is the Resort Hotel portion of the Animal Kingdom Lodge. We did make a number of trips over to the Jambo House during our vacation though. The rooms at the Kidhani Village are well appointed and very clean. The staff at both facilities were very friendly and helpful. Both facilities were very clean and up to Disney standards. The design of the Jambo House lobby is extraordinary, very very impressive much more so than the Kidhani Village lobby. Kidhani only offers one restaurant which is somewhat formal. Most of the villas at Kidhani have full kitchens since it is part of Disney's Vacation Club. Jambo House offers a few different restaurants including one which is cafeteria style and very casual. We found that the food was good but rather pricey. The pools at both facilties are very nice and heated. The pool at Jambo House is beautifully landscaped with a nice waterslide. The pool at Kidhani has a longer waterslide than Jambo. Jambo House has a good size retail store, but the store at Kidhani is rather limited. Both facilities have 2 savannahs. We had a room at Kidhani which overlooked the larger of the two savannahs and it had something like 5 or 6 types of animals including zebras, giraffes, antelopes, osteriches, and a type of cattle. We also saw vultures in the savannah. The animals were out in the savannah much of the day and slept out in the savannah at night. We all loved our savannah view and would highly recommend booking a room with this view. Overall, it was an excellent experience and would not hesitiate to return to either the Kidhani Village or the Jambo House Resort at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. The one downside of staying at the Animal Kingdom Lodge is that it seems to be located much further from most of the Disney Parks as compared to many of the other Disney Resorts, so expect longer bus rides to most of the Disney Parks except the Animal Kingdom Park.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Experience for a Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: LeLacAppelle
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge in the main building over Christmas. We chose this Disney resort for two reasons: bunk beds and the views of the savannah. We have boy/girl twins and find it much easier for all to sleep if the kids have separate beds. The room was very clean, but there was not a lot of room to spare. We were a bit disappointed with our view of the savannah - we were up closer to the lobby and had a less open view. We found that with the cool weather of December that the animals were out and visible more during the afternoon - a time when we were at the parks and not in the room. We did enjoy the views from other points in the hotel that are open to all who stay there. We did spend the majority of our time in the theme parks. The weather was too cool to utilize the pool, but it did look very inviting. Our children did participate in a unique ornament making and the staff truly seemed to enjoy helping our kids be creative. If you or your children are picky about different/unusual foods, you may want to make sure to make dining plans elsewhere. We did enjoy the unusual flavors at Jiko (fine dining) and even in the Mara (counter service). They do have a few usual standards. AK Lodge is a beautiful hotel and the service was very good. I recommend that you evaluate how you plan to spend your time at Disney. If you are worried about budget and plan to be in the parks most of the time, you might want to consider a moderate resort. If budget is no problem, this is a great hotel for kids who love animals!

Reviews.Title: “animal kingdom awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: CraigoryC
Reviews.Content: would recommend to anybody great place safari with giraffes and other animal 4 the kids also educational club 4 kids during day and also bonfire each nite

Reviews.Title: “You have to see it to believe it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Emucy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is jaw droppingly beautiful.... when you walk into the lobby it really does take your breath away. Service is exactly what Disney does best and this does not dissapoint, everything was done with a smile and a friendly hello. Rooms were lovely, African themed of course! Incredibly comfy bed to crash in after a full on day, huge TV etc.. We had a Savanah view room which was just lovely. Best time to sit and watch the aminals is early morning or dusk when they are grazing. Transfers to the park were great, never waited more than 10 minutes. The only slight negative is the food is pricey and again African themed which may not suit everyone. that is really not enough to put us off staying again though. It really did deliver what Disney promise - Magic!

Reviews.Title: “An AMAZING and UNIQUE experience”
Reviews.Author: StevieNBrandonsMom
Reviews.Content: Had heard wonderful things about Animal Kingdom Lodge (AKL) for several years but there is nothing like seeing it for yourself! Disney has done a wonderful job with this facility. The kids and I are animal lovers and were blown away at being yards away from all of these exotic animals and birds in a sudo-natural environment. We happened to travel during the COLDEST WEEK IN HISTORY, so most of our time was spent admiring the animals from inside the room but the animals were troopers and roamed all around for equal visibility. The Disney "experience" starts as soon as you hit the check in desk. The staff asked if we were celebrating anything and when we responded a birthday, she pulled out a button that said "Happy Birthday" and wrote my son's name on it. For the next 4 days 75% of every Disney employee we came across wished him Happy Birthday and he LOVED every minute. LOTS of things for young children to do at the hotel including daily arts and crafts, games, a game room and a kids club (babysitting service) located in a room with as many toys as your local target. My son was in tears while we were at Magic Kingdom (yes, we were AT Magic Kingdom) because he was ready to leave the park and go play at the kids club back at AKL. Wish we had more time to enjoy the facilities at the hotel especially the Agave Margaritas....yummmm. Highly recommend signing up for the dining plan while making your reservations. The food was very satisfying and tasty, however, pricing can leave you with sticker shock. Then again, it is Disney soooooo inflated prices is kinda to be expected. Really enjoyed the buffet and being able to sample all of the ethnic foods but think that $30 for anyone 10 and older is a bit much. Only ate there once during the trip. Was very pleased to see a wide selection of beer and wine at the Mara!!! And after a day at a theme park with the kids, I didn't care how much that bottle of wine cost :-) Mara had a decent offering for breakfast, lunch and dinner that was satisfying for everyone in the family. Didn't go all the way to Florida for chicken nuggets & burgers, but that's what it took to keep the kids quiet so.... so be it. We traveled with the kids, but wouldn't mind going back just Hubby and I. Just need to adjust your expectations about a 'mature' experience because the reality is that it is a family resort so the kids do kinda run the show. Only disappointing experience is with Lost & Found. Ended up leaving something in the room and have left two messages with Lost & Found but have not received a return phone call :-( If the tickets to the theme park don't break the budget, spend a few extra dollars to stay at AKL but most importantly, plan to spend some time and enjoy all the benefits the hotel has to offer

Reviews.Title: “I agree about the pool”
Reviews.Author: mmsanfca
Reviews.Content: Well, it sounds like the pool is still having it's problems. When we were there from the chilly north, we were looking forward to a heated pool. It was ice cold. They told us it was broken then. That was three years ago. That's why we have never gone back to this hotel. Also, the staff was not overly helpful about anything.

Reviews.Title: “Animal KIngdom Logde was exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: ahkeela
Reviews.Content: We were on a Make A Wish trip for our daughter, we extended our stay so we could spend more time at DisneyWorld (at our expense). Our stay at Disney World was in every sense of the word "magical". We were treated so well, the staff was so caring to our special needs. I highly recommend Animal Kingdom Lodge! And the club level is great and well worth it! The breakfast was always filling, and drinks and appetizers in the evening were nice for winding down.

Reviews.Title: “love it ;)”
Reviews.Author: alielzan
Reviews.Content: i love to stayed in animal kingdom lodge because every morning i wake up i always see a lot of beautiful animal the room is gorgeous...the service is great and the food at the hotel is amazing...for sure i'll be back ;D

Reviews.Title: “they know how to run the place”
Reviews.Author: Sjahdjekd
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! My husband and our 11 year old daughter went last year and it was fantastic. We had a late flight and got therebaeound 10pm but the staff were nice and didn't seem tired of people at all. It was a very expensive week bit totally worth it. The staff there can sence how people are feeling. They pay alot of atention to you and not just your money. Rooms were clean and Mickey sized. All the restranta were great, but I'd you want to fo to the aboml safari you I've to Check which says their doing it. We unfourtunantly missed it, but still got to see the animals from our window. Will stay again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Disney World January 2010”
Reviews.Author: harryonthebeach
Reviews.Content: 2010 Walt Disney World. Every year Walt Disney world near Orlando Florida holds the Disney Marathon. My partner was a finisher in this spectacular event on January 10. We stayed in the Animal Kingdom lodge: Jambo House, with savanna view room overlooking the exotic animals that roamed the African grassland surrounding the hotel. There was a variety of species which contentedly went about their daily routines with little regard to the hotel and guests a few meters away. It was a treat to wake up to this idyllic scene and watch the sun rise in the morning. The room was adequately spacious and had 2 large queen beds, a small table and chair set, a nice balcony, large screen LCD television with an external port replicator making device connection easier. Ours however was not connected and required some minor maintenance to re-enable. The bathroom was in two rooms with the shower and toilet in one and the vanity and two sinks in the other. Fortunately the room also had a furnace, due to the extreme cold weather, it came in quite handy. The resort was in great condition, very well maintained and had two restaurants. The pool was under maintenance but we had access to the Kidani lodge pool a few minutes away. It was too cold to swim so the pool was not an issue. The menu plan we chose included one full service and one fast food meal with snacks daily. I would recommend buying one of the menu plans which saved us many hundreds of dollars. Without it, food can be very expensive and there are very few places to eat that are not Disney affiliated restaurants. The two menu restaurants at the lodge are Boma and Jiko. Boma, is an “order from the menu”, or “self serve” buffet. Its African inspired cuisine was quite good although the flavour bases were somewhat repetitive with cinnamon, curry and chipotle predominating. Roast beef and spare ribs were featured daily. Varieties of soups and salads and other food choices were available and changed on a daily basis. Parties of six or more are automatically charged an 18% gratuity, Parties of 5 and under were not. Alcohol based drinks are not included in meal plans and they can be pricey. Soft drinks etc. are usually included. Jiko, a 5 star restaurant with a full menu of meat and fish was excellent and the service was very good. Two food menu credits per person are required if using the meal plan at Jiko. The bread and cheese selections were particularly good, with different African breads and both cow and goat cheeses available. The Sanaa restaurant at Kidani village is very good and offers African influenced dining along the same lines as Boma and Jiko. Mara at Jambo house is a quick service based outlet offering traditional American fast food cuisine with a static menu and interchangeable options. Casey’s which offered baseball themed fare at Magic Kingdom was a particularly good choice for a quick service meal, the ballpark franks (hotdogs) were very tasty and the food plan can be used at almost all the food outlets and restaurants. Food plans can also be used at some of the non Disney restaurants. All were clearly marked regarding food plan inclusion or non inclusion. Guides for everything can be picked up at the resorts or anywhere in the Disney parks. Park passes are required if using the food plan option. Passes may be purchased anywhere but are cheaper and more convenient if included in your vacation package. A park hopper pass allows you to bounce from one park to the other at any time. Without it parks can only be visited on one day with unlimited access. Book your food reservations as soon as possible to avoid eating at odd times or late in the evening as the traditional meal times are booked first and quickly. The best most efficient way to travel anywhere in the Disney parks is by the Disney transit system which is very efficient and goes everywhere, a bus comes approx. every 15-20 minutes. Walt Disney World is a truly enjoyable experience that we would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Probably worth it...once”
Reviews.Author: justalittlecrazykc
Reviews.Content: First off, you're reading Tripadvisor so you probably know the ups and downs to staying on Disney property. Fact: When we booked our trip, we could have booked a better room at the Waldorf Astoria Orlando for less per night than the standard room we booked at the AKL. So, assuming you know that the Disney properties aren't a great value, read on... This is a nice property -- the atrium is gorgeous. We got upgraded from a standard room to a room overlooking one of the savannahs, and we were across the hall from an overlook above the savannah on the other side of the hotel, which made viewing animals pretty easy. But after a couple of days, my wife and I were in the mindset of, "oh, cool...there's a giraffe again." My son lost his interest in the zebras, giraffes and other critters after a couple days as well and started asking where the rhinos were. There are no rhinos, so we dealt with that the best we could. :) The room was comfortable, but a little smallish. It needed a comfortable sitting chair and didn't have one. Bedding was plush. Lots of Disney details throughout the room. TV options were HORRIBLE (#1, be prepared for 10 ABC channels and 5 ESPN channels and not much else; #2, our remote worked about half the time and there were no buttons on the TV to manually change channels). Most of the staff we interacted with was terrific -- housekeeping staff was especially friendly, as were the folks posted outside who provided information about the animals. Here's the biggest issue: This is a big resort. The last thing you want to do after a long day at the parks is spend another 7-8 minutes walking from the lobby to your room. You must enter through the lobby and then schlep yourself to your room -- in our case this was a solid 7-8 minute walk. Everything is a good walk away (and we were in a fairly central room -- there were rooms that were farther away from things). On the day of our checkout, there was a system-wide computer failure which made for an inconvenient checkout (computers still weren't up when we left.) Also, the pool was closed for the duration of our stay, even though when I booked our trip it was slated to re-open prior to our stay. We discussed the decision to stay at the AKL afterward and my wife and I decided we were glad we stayed there...even though we would've been more comfortable at another hotel. If we hadn't stayed here we would always wonder what it would've been like...if you're considering it, go ahead and stay here...once.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome ... great resort”
Reviews.Author: Army_Dude
Reviews.Content: I went here with my wife and it was an amazing experience for a couple. The hotel was amazing and the Disney staff were courteous and the price was well worth it. We were wanting to stay at the Polynesian, but now that we've been to this hotel we may go back here as a first choice instead next time at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at AKL, perfect for adults vacationing at WDW”
Reviews.Author: OCwanderlust
Reviews.Content: I travel to WDW every January for my birthday, this was my second stay at the AKL & my boyfriends first. i have to start by saying i had a terrible experience with AKL last year & vowed never to stay there again. however, I have a Disney Visa (i recommend to anyone who loves Disney as much as i do) & i got a great rate for the AKL, 40% off regular rate. so i decided to give it a second chance, knowing now how to handle what happened last year. basically what happened last year is that when i went to buy tickets into the park from the front desk they accidentally recharged me for my entire vacation. I had used my debit card & this second charge had eaten up my entire cash reserve in my bank account. the charge was easily visible on my bank account but didnt show up in the AKL "system". Since it didnt show up in their system they refused to help. Even though i showed them my account online where the double charge was plainly visible, 2 front desk people refused to help even though i was at the front desk crying saying that since it was sunday i had no cash & couldnt talk to the bank until Monday. Even the manager said that all i could do was to talk to their financial services dept. Financial services said my only resource was to wait until Monday & have my bank call them. so, Monday my bank manager did a conference call between myself & WDW financial services. even after my bank manager explained how they had double charged me & how it was clearly their mistake, they still REFUSED to help me. My bank manager reversed the charge herself so that i would have my money back. it was a nightmare. however, i have been to WDW 15 times & this was the only experience i have ever had that even comes close to negative. the lesson is never use your debit card at a hotel. ever. so back to this trip. my boyfriend didnt have any idea what the hotel looked like (i am the planner), he couldnt believe how beautiful & "not disney" it looked. he just couldnt say enough how much he loved our hotel. i love the AKL most for the same reason that a lot of people compain about: the "darkness". i dont consider it dark, i think its beautiful, sophisticated & mature. its everything i want as an adult, without kids, traveling to WDW. also, we were super lucky that when we arrived at 7am from an overnight flight, they had a room ready for us. it was fantastic. i had called a couple days before arrival & had them note that we would be coming in early & if possible to check in early, but there was no guarantee. we totally lucked out. The room they gave us was "standard" view, but we lucked out again, because we were on the ground floor & right across our balcony was a savannah. we had a perfect view of giraffes ever day! also, we had purchased park tickets separately, and the front desk was nice enough to attach them to our room keys. everyone was so nice. the other main reason i like AKL so much is the food. i think they have the best selection of non fast food type food. i am a vegetarian & my boyfriend isnt really a cheeseburger guy & the AKL has great food. actually, i should say MARA has great food, because we dont do the restaurants ( i dont like making reservations so far in advance). They also serve my boyfriends favorite beer, Casa from Morocco, which didnt hurt either. Regarding the bus rides: unless you stay at a monorail hotel, you are going to wait for a bus. so plan accordingly. we barely ever waited more than 5 minutes for our bus to arrive, and this was during the off season. and yes, some places are further away than others on the bus, but you wouldnt get there any faster in your own car. (and if you are like me & my boyfriend, you love to go to Epcot & drink & have a sober bus driver take you home). the buses dont bother me, but thats just me. i'm on vacation, i'm not in a hurry. over all, i think this hotel is beautiful & everything great about Disney while still being adult, romantic, mature & comfortable. the rooms arent huge or fancy, but at WDW whos spending that much time in your room anyways? i would recommend this hotel to anyone, but especially people who want Disney, but dont want "Disney".

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: mom3boysNj
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel... it is very unique. Kids loved the animals, also, the TV in the lobby :-) Boma had a great breakfast, I had no reservation but was able to get in. Yes it is a little farther to the parks and the rooms a bit smaller but I didn't mind at all because I loved the place!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lodge”
Reviews.Author: GEOCacher
Reviews.Content: The lodge was perfect for us. It reminds me of a National Park lodge (Disney style). Huge lobby, nicely decorated. Loved watching the animals roam the savannah. The Boma buffet was really good. I found the service was excellent. Some things that might not appeal to people are: 1. It can be a long walk from room to lobby to counter service. 2. The animal grounds aren't "groomed". The grounds are natural for the animals. 3. MK is a ways away. None of those things bothered us. We thought the place was great.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing when it shouldn't be....”
Reviews.Author: eezee-to-pleeze
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an extraordinary building: beautiful, unique and inspiring. However,.....that's about all you get from it - because it is very poorly run. The staff are very helpful and friendly and try hard - but this still doesn't hide the fact that little works as it should: a true African experience, you might say. The building is everything, the rest is below-par. Like the other posts below, housekeeping isn't quite on the ball and it took 7 consecutive visits by amiable, smiling staff just to get 2 teabags (which should have been there anyway). By the 4th tap on the door, I was wishing I hadn't asked! The deluxe rooms are a bit cramped - and quite frankly the views of the savannah are a bit irrelevant if you have just visited Animal Kingdom where you see many more of the same animals right up close, should you take the Kilimanjaro Safari ride. The views of animals from your balcony are usually at some distance and after the first 5 minutes, you probably couldn't care less. Even my 8-year old had no interest and she loves animals. You can't get a table for breakfast or dinner unless you book well in advance: the desk staff say this is because it's such a huge hotel (which it is) and also it's a popular dining venue - which is cold comfort when it's 8am or pm and you're starving. Forget about dining in Jiko unless you reserved last week - and when you do get a table let's hope you are more impressed than we were. Good, yes. Special, no. More of an up-market canteen, really. The acid-test of how poorly-organised this place is manifests itself at the front-desk. Trying to get someone to talk to you is a fight of the fittest - and you have to be patient, very. The poor staff are visibly harassed and hiding from people because everything is a direct or veiled complaint - just spend a few minutes listening if you have the misfortune to stay there. I loved the decor and the cathedral-like atmosphere of the lobby but who wants to stay in a cathedral? For somewhere so beautiful, it really is quite soulless. We stayed for our first week in a budget hotel before moving to the AKL where one night cost more than the week in the previous hotel. How I wish we hadn't moved! The first hotel was better all-round and near I-Drive instead of in the middle of nowhere. Visit AKL by all means, to see the fabulous concept in the flesh, even stay for dinner - but spend your money on staying in an hotel where people are the central focus, not the building.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Theme and Decor, but very Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: PickyPacker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at AKL - Jambo House 1/24/10 - 2/2/10. We'd booked a standard view room but were kindly upgraded upon arrival to a Savannah view, room #3452. The good: This resort has incredible decor. Lots of art and artifacts, with plaques telling the story or describing what you're seeing. Many of the Cast Members are from Africa, in an exchange program Disney has set up with African Tourism and Animal preserve organizations. The Cast Members are very knowledgeable about the animals on the property, and the art and decor in the lodge, and are happy to tell you about their life in Africa. While waiting for the bus to the parks in the morning, there were often Cast Members out there with animal parts (teeth, antlers, etc) and educational games for the children. The gift shop, Zawadi marketplace, was immense, and had a generous selection of gifts as well as food and toiletry items. The not so good: The room was a lot smaller than we anticipated for a Deluxe resort. We were glad to have 2 queen beds (instead of doubles, which are too small for us), but there was a tiny table with only 2 chairs, so the four of us could never all sit down together. Mousekeeping had done a quick job preparing the room -- we found gummy candy on the carpet and the exterior of the fridge was covered with sticky hand prints. Also one sink did not drain (the plug was stuck in the down position), the clock and phone were covered with sticky residue, and the i-home clock was set 10 minutes too fast, and we couldn't figure out how to reset it without instructions. We enjoyed seeing a few animals from our balcony, but were disappointed that there wasn't a quidebook or pamphlet to tell us what we were seeing. When we asked for one, we were told they weren't available anymore. We also had to ask to receive a tip sheet with the daily activities for the resort -- we were not given one when we checked in, and there was not one in the room, so we had no idea about all the activities until our visit was almost over. The pool was closed, and the "shuttle" to Kidani village was actually just using regular bus transportation, so the one time we made the trek to go swimming, we ended up walking 10 minutes instead of waiting 20 minutes for a bus. We were told there would be a shuttle, which we assumed would be a van or mini bus between the two. The quick service restaurant is downstairs, in the basement, so refilling those resort mugs can take a long walk. Often we'd go get a drink to take back to our room, and by the time we actually got back to the room the cup was empty! There should be "refill stations" in other parts of the hotel, like at the ends of each wing! The soundproofing between rooms is very minimal. We could clearly hear the family in the next room each night as they struggled to get their kids to sleep, one night as late as 2:00am! We also could hear the plumbing noise of toilets flushing and showers running in the rooms above, below, and beside us. Not what you'd expect from a "Deluxe" resort. Overall: We enjoyed or stay at Animal Kingdom Lodge/Jambo House, but didn't really have time (or the information sheet until the 2nd to last day) to partake of all the activities it offered. It was a one-time splurge, and we won't likely stay there again. I'd recommend this hotel if you love Africa and observing wild animals. Also if you are up for the walking (the place is really spread out) and stairs/elevators (restaurants on basement level). I would NOT recommend this hotel if you have small children. The rooms are too small, there's a lot of walking/up & down involved, and you're going to be a LONG bus ride away from 3 of the 4 parks.

Reviews.Title: “Smooth sailing”
Reviews.Author: lindathediver
Reviews.Content: Yes, I would diffently say it was smooth sailing, the hotel ran in a orderly manner, clean, very friendly staff, never once did we have to ask the front desk for anything. It was a they came and went in the calmness of night, never seen them, so respectful of peoples vacations what more could you ask for. We loved the pool nice and hugh,, so there was no over-crowding, and always a life guard on duty, all in all this was a very clean, beautiful Hotel, with perfect staff, I've been on many vacations and this hotel was SMOOTH SAILING!

Reviews.Title: “Disney - with a touch of calm”
Reviews.Author: NorwayLovesVacations
Reviews.Content: In short: The hotel was great! We lived there a whole week (got a great stay 7 for 4 nights deal). The best thing is that we found the hotel so much quieter than the regular Disney fuzz - so it gave us real mental relaxation between the theme park battles. The constant African music in the background created a mind-soothing ambiance. And yes, the staff were as nice as they come. Too bad they couldn't mend the weather, though, as we visited them during the coldest week in like 40 years. The pool was closed for maintenance, but with temperatures in the 30's nobody really cared...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort and atmosphere but underwhelming for a Deluxe”
Reviews.Author: smt5741
Reviews.Content: Nice atmosphere and great views at least from the room we had. Jiko's is a world class dining experiance and Boma's has a great buffet with unusual varieties. Sub standard room though for a Deluxe Disney Resort. Small, very little storage, noisey ( did they forget the sound proofing?), ran out of hot water in the morning and for the first time in my stays at Disney we had average to below average housekeeping. By the third day I stopped the tips because they evidently were not helping. Some stuffed animals were lost a in the laundry I guess and the front desk worked with us to replace them. Good location, off the path enough so traffic was never a problem. Been there once now but will probably not again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: MIKET11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our kids (6&4) for 10 days and 9 nights January 17th-26th 2009. The resort is beautiful, the lobby is huge and very well done. After staying at All Star Movies before you can really see the difference between value and deluxe. We took advantage of the buy 4 get 3 free deal Disney was offering at the time. The crowd level alone was worth the extra money we paid. We always had a seat on the busses and never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus. Some reviews say the ride to the Magic Kingdom was to long, in reality it took approx. 13 minutes. There was a little light maintenance going on but nothing that really bothered us. The pool area is awesome altough we only swam 2 days there are 2 hot tubs by the pool. Seeing the animals on property was pretty cool and my kids really liked being able to see them from our room. The food court was never too busy like the food court and All Star Movies. Boma is great! All and all Animal Kingdom lodge is a perfect place for the entire family, if you can spend the extra money it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The trip of a life time!”
Reviews.Author: ashatsea888
Reviews.Content: I have read some reviews before I booked my room. Some where bad, but most where good so I gave it a chance. Thank goodness I did! It was the most beautiful resort I have stayed in. From the minute I walked threw the door I felt like I was in a whole new world. From the lobby decor, to the friendly service, and not having to haul around luggage after flying all day was a dream! The rooms where spacious and the savanna view was incredible. Definitely recommend the online check in. We spent 5 minutes at most at the check in counter and we where on our way to our room. Our luggage was already there waiting for us which was wonderful. Staying at a Disney resort is definitely the way to go! I had to wait a little for the buses sometimes but it beats having to pay for parking and driving all the time. The pool was closed when I was there so I can't really rate that, but it didn't bother us much since it was so cold. Hopefully it is warmer for you all who are going to Disney sometime soon or in the future! Other wise I recommend this resort to anyone. Waking up in the morning and watching giraffes right by your balcony doesn't happen every day. Loved it. Will definitely come back again! Thank you Disney for one of the best trips of my family's life!

Reviews.Title: “I love it !”
Reviews.Author: marie2000
Reviews.Content: The detail in this hotel is amazing from the parking lots to the pool. We got there 8am and they had a room ready for us but didn't have some of the stuff we've requested so we decided we will wait until another room was ready. While we waited we went to the Magic Kingdom 3 hours later we got a call letting us know that our room was ready. We got back and we had a great view. We waited less than 5 minutes to get our luggage the service was great. We spend 10 days at this hotel and not once we run into a problem the staff was helpful and friendly and when above and beyond to make our stay special.

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: Walkers-Wombourne
Reviews.Content: One of the best & most unusual hotels we have ever stayed at. A Savannah view room is well worth having ... although the animals can be viewed from several viewing areas around the hotel, being able to sit & watch the animals any time of day from the privacy of your own balcony is a bonus. The hotel is large & spacious & well planned out. Although the main areas ie Reception & the pool do get busy you barely notice anyone around once in the corridors & your room. The rooms are spacious, well appointed & always thoroughly clean. Since our primary purpose of staying here was to visit the Disney theme parks we took advantage of having the use of the disney buses which ran regularly & always on time plus the extra magic hours only available to guests staying in Disney properties - we found this a big advantage & often had been on or got fast passes for the bigger rides well before other guests had arrived for the day. A great hotel & would fully recommend.

Reviews.Title: “It would be nice to know that the pool is out of order in advance”
Reviews.Author: TheHighlander69
Reviews.Content: When booking a trip to Orlando there is so much information, it is almost overwhelming. So, after much review, we decided to take the Disney route. I finally decided on the Animal Kingdom Lodge because of the pictures of the swimming pool, Disney's transportation and the ability to watch animals from your room. Our trip was good, but it would have been great if only Disney would have disclosed a few items, and would pay a little closer attention to details. Let me explain... We arrived at 2:30 for a 3pm check-in. We knew that we were early and that we would probably have to wait for a little while and we were advised that we would have a room by 3:30pm. What we didn't realize, was that we wouldn't be actually given a room until after 5:30. I would not have minded the delay, if they would simply advise you of the timeframe, so that you don't find yourself sitting in the lobby with your luggage for 3 hours like we did. After we finally made it to the room, we decided to take the kids to the pool, only to find that it is closed for refurbishement. This would have been really nice to know before we booked our package. They do offer shuttle service to the next villas to use their pool, but who wants to get on a bus and ride to another facility to use their pool while on vacation? Our room was nice and well appointed with great views of the animal areas, but it was a tremendous effort to just to reach it. I actually counted from the lobby, and it was 357 steps to the room. I'm really not sure of how this is equivileant in mileage, but it was definitely a long way, and I am a 10 mile a week runner. My advice on the transportation system to the park is to not use it. It is much easier to drive and parking is free as long as you are a guest at any of their resorts. It was not a pleasant experience to be packed like sardines on a bus with too many people after a hot day of sweating at the Parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great theme and best food in Disney but we had a really filthy room!”
Reviews.Author: Denverabby
Reviews.Content: our room was dirty on arrival - hair in the sheets, trash in the room and the bathroom was also really bad.The staff was very apologetic and comped the room that night. The sheets on one bed had been changed but not the other. The trash wasn't visible at first- we discovered it after we'd unpacked. It was as if some the room had been cleaned but not all of it. Valet service was terrible and room service wasn't available because the phones were down one night. I am thinking this was a fluke because it is a really nicely themed hotel. Even so, I would give it another chance because of the savannah.

Reviews.Title: “Memories of a liftimes-a new family tradition”
Reviews.Author: luv2tch
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we traveled during Thansgiving. Our extended family enjoyed both Saratoga Springs and Bay Lake Towers. We have stayed at Saratoga in the past, but this time we were located in a different area of the resport. It was wonderful. We enjoyed using the monorail to visit the other hotels and experience all of the holiday decoration and liveliness they offered. We enjoyed high tea at The Grand Floridian, the luau at The Polynesian, Chef Mickey and the Royal Princess Dinners at Epcot. Bay Lake Towers was amazing. We had a two bedroom villa, which was spacious and had great views for the electric light parade on the bay. Each night we went to the lobby or walkway to see the fireworks over Cinderella's Castle. Disney itself is amazing if you really think about it. It is very well thought out with every aspect being addressed. We didn't have to rent a car since there is transpotration provided by the resorts. The staff we encountered was superb. Attention was paid to detail with the towels being folded into the shape of fish and dolls. My younger children love it! We are DVC members and once again, Disney exceeded our expectations and allowed us to experience beautiful family memories. We are looking forward to spending the holidays there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort on Disney Grounds”
Reviews.Author: Salf
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive in the lobby, you are entertained and treated like royalty. The rooms are slightly better than usual Disney fare, albeit small, but the view is tremendous. They move the animals around the savannah with food enticements, but you have to be lucky to see all the animals from the balcony. There are plenty of oppurtunities to see tha savannahs from viewing points around the resort, as well as having night vision areas set up. Boma is one of the best retaurants on Disney. The varied tastes on the buffet will satisfy anyone. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. I wouldn't stay anywhere else on property.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge Level Disappointment!!”
Reviews.Author: Huckley
Reviews.Content: We are loyal Disney folks who have been coming to Disney regularly for the past 16 years, I am sad to say the level of care we experienced on this trip was disappointing. We stayed in room 4417 concierge level (beautiful view of the animals...) and the dust on the tv cabinet and the DVD player was so thick you could write your name in it. I did write Dust Me on the cabinet. There were also obvoiusly empty, used paper coffee cups housekeeping refused to throw out each day, bell service tried to deliver someone elses luggage to our room twice, on the concierge level at peak usage hours there were no knives, I had to use a fork to spread jelly, there were empty condiment dishes and empty coffee dispensers and no coffee cups other than paper cups for a period of time. For $450 per night it was not worth it. It was also kind of sad to see the Disney we once marveled over drop below the standards we had experienced over the years. On the good side the parks were fun and we enjoyed our three nights on the beautiful Animal Kingdom Lodge property and loved the wonderful food at both restaurants, just would not do the concierge level again.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD STAY THERE EVERYTIME I GO!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kimconnors
Reviews.Content: This was my daughter and my second visit to WDW--and 2nd time to stay at AKL. When I checked in online I was asked what time I would be arriving. When we got there we were greeted by Alfredo and he was wonderful. I thought I had gotten enough tickets and dining plan for the week but somehow I didnt. Alfredo worked some wonderful Disney magic with the help of Tinkerbells pixie dust he was able to fix my mistake. Somehow the computer system started charging my credit card several times. I told Alfredo about the situation and he took care of it immediatly. He made sure my week was relaxing and not to worry about the charges. The rest of the staff upstairs were wonderful and VERY helpful!!! I wanted to change dining reservations at the lasst min and were very helpful. It was SSOOOOOOO cold when we were there --heck it snowed one morning--I mean real snow. The animals were not cooperating in being visible and we noticed that the staff would ride around in the trucks a little bit more to get the animals out into the opening. I would stay at this resort EVERYTIME I went ---the only reason I would not is because i would like to see what a different resort was like Alfedo thank you so much for making our week at WDW fun and relaxing!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Super Stay”
Reviews.Author: MITraveler60
Reviews.Content: We stayed at AKL during the week of January 3, 2010 and LOVED every minute! The standard room that we reserved was upgraded to a savanna view (perhaps because Disney knew that we were celebrating my husband's 60th birthday?). I agree with others that if you plan to be in the parks, etc. for most of the day paying a premium for a savanna view might not be worthwhile. Having said that, it IS fun to watch animals from your private balcony as your schedule allows. Animals can also be seen from various viewing points both inside and outside the lodge. We were on the dining plan and ate at Boma and Mara several times. The Boma buffet at breakfast and dinner includes choices for both picky and adventurous eaters. The quality of the food is outstanding. The value at Mara for breakfast is especially good - a couple can easily share one of the combo platters. The lobby of the lodge is breathtaking. The shop has all of the souvenirs and convenience items that one expects in addition to a wonderful selection of African wares. Our king bed room with daybed, though not extremely spacious, was immaculate. Having a refrigerator came in handy for leftovers and snacks. All in all I would heartily recommend a stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge!

Reviews.Title: “Kidani Village”
Reviews.Author: Luka1925
Reviews.Content: My wife, four year old son and I stayed recently @ kidani village. The rooms were great and spacious. We stayed in a one bedroom villa w/ a king size bed and two bath rooms, very nice indeed w/ a view of the animals. The weather was rather cold, coldest temps in many decades but that did not deter from the beauty of the lodge and animals. Only negatives, one place to eat and very long bus trips to the parks (other than Animal Kingdom) and the food @ the pool bar is limited and very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney Experience”
Reviews.Author: photographymom
Reviews.Content: It was my first time staying on Disney Property, but my 5th trip to the parks. We brought our 10 month old son for his first vacation. I was nervous about planning a trip with an infant & didn't want to have to worry about little details. If you have any questions, I would encourage calling the 1-800 number on Disney's website. Their customer service people are very helpful & can answer minor or major questions/concerns you might have. Because of needing a large amount of supplies for an infant (i.e. diapers, snackcups, bottles, baby spoons, snacks, babyfood, etc.) I shipped a package to myself at the hotel. I would HIGHLY recommend doing this if you have a child OR just if you have too much to take in your suitcase! Its very simple to do if you are staying on Disney Property. You simply ship the box to yourself...with your name, Disney reservation number, & hotel address on it. Ship it so it arrives no earlier than 2-3 days prior to your visit. This process is wonderful! The disney cast member will link the box to your reservation in their computer system...so whenever you arrive, you don't even have to ask about your box! They will retrieve your reservation & get your box immediately! It was so convenient! As I said, this is good even if you don't have kids...simply mail yourself clothing, shoes, whatever won't fit in your suitcase! You can ship yourself a Large Flat Rate box for around $13.95 (up to 70 pounds) and this is much cheaper than the cost for an extra suitcase with the airlines! (just an extra tip!) Upon arrival, they also gave us a button that said "First Visit" for my son. He was a little young, but still loved the fact that he was given something while the cast member spoke to us about our room. The check-in process was very quick (I also recommend check-in on the Disney website if you book through Disney...you can do it the day before you leave & it makes the process much quicker/smoother!) Before saying anything about our room, I must comment on the huge lobby...it was beautiful!!! It is decorated with an African culture theme & has huge windows to see outside. Its absolutely beautiful! There is a gift shop onsite with Disney items (like stuffed animals, keychains, mugs/glasses, photoalbums, shirts, etc) as well as Animal Kingdom items & African culture items. Its a very nice store with a wide variety of items. In addition, I was surprised at the large variety of "convenience store" items you could get. One evening, we needed a bunch of things & I was planning to run to the giftshop...I made the comment to my husband "If they have it." I didn't think they would have the items I needed...I was afraid I'd have to run to Walmart or Target. Well they had everything I was looking for. They have toothpaste, shampoo, pretzels/chips, some first aid items, a freezer with icecream...just to give you some examples. Over the course of my trip, I spent close to $250 at the giftshop at the Lodge & I watch money carefully (I am not a spender!) The rooms are very spacious. I don't know why others have complained about room space. Keep in mind, I had an infant who was crawling & starting to walk...he needed lots of space. I had no complaints...there was a closet with enough room to hang all of our stuff. I didn't have enough hangers though for all 3 of us but we just put our extra tops in the drawers. I had more than enough space in the 2 large drawers in the armoire...one for our clothes & one for my son's diapers, shoes, & toys/books that we brought along. We had a King-size bed, a couch, a small refrigerator, coffee maker, a small table with 2 chairs, and a private balcony. The vanity area has double sinks & the bathroom is separate from this area...I liked this a lot, it made getting ready in the morning a lot easier. The shower was huge & the bathroom had a door for privacy. I would suggest upgrading your room to the "savana view" so that you are able to watch the animals. Its not a necessity but it makes your trip a lot more enjoyable! My son & I spent many mornings & evenings on the balcony watching the animals. (hint: the animals are out more in the morning than evening...I think it is easier to see the animals from the viewing areas in the evenings) If you are planning to spend 10+ hours in the parks, I wouldn't suggest the "savana view" because you could spend that extra money on food, souvenirs, or another park ticket! There are many areas throughout the resort where you are able to sit in wooden rocking chairs & watch the animals. There are cast members (most from Africa) who are extremely knowledgeable & can tell you tons of information about the animals & culture! This was a great part of the trip! There is also a large viewing area outdoors, a playground, weightroom, arcade, and pool. Unfortunately because of my son's age, we weren't able to use the weightroom, arcade, or pool as much as we would've liked. The pool does have a nice wading area for small babies/toddlers. I took my son there one evening & he enjoyed it (it was the 2nd time he was in a pool) and I noticed the kids & how much fun they were having. So, even if you have very young kids, they will still be able to enjoy the pool area! One tip -- don't bring towels to the pool. There are areas (they look like large garbage cans) that have towels for you to use at the pool & an area to put them in when you are done. Very convenient! The eating areas -- AKL has 3 of these. Two are restaurants (I believe the one only serves dinner) -- they are the Boma & the Jiko. Unfortunately we did not go to either because you had to have reservations ahead of time. The one night, we went down & asked how long the wait would be & they said 45 minutes to 1 hour. It was nice because they give you a "button" to take to your room & it will light up & vibrate when they have a table ready for you. Unfortunately, my son fell asleep back in our room & since we didn't want to wake him, we cancelled with the restaurant. I have heard wonderful things about both restaurants & know people from other resorts who HAVE to go to the Boma every visit to Orlando! We primarily ate at the parks or at the Mara (the quick-service restaurant). I feel that they had a large variety of items (burgers, pizza, fried shrimp, soups, etc.) as well as three coolers full of snacks & side items. I would recommend getting the "Disney souvenir mug" with unlimited refills...HUGE savings! I believe it costs $14-15 and you will spend this your first day on property. In the coolers, they have different fruits, carrots, cakes, yogurt, tons of options as well as drinks. I would say however that its pricey...if you have a rental car, go to the local Walmart or Super Target & stock your refrigerator with snacks & drinks. They have a large seating area indoors as well as a few tables outdoors. Its nice to sit in the airconditioning after being outside at the parks, but its also nice to sit outdoors & enjoy the plants/scenery. There are stairs & elevators to get around the hotel & to the eating areas. I also recommend if you do not need a rental car, use the Disney Magical Express for yourself & your luggage. It is a simple process...at the airport, you go to a specially designated counter...its huge, you can't miss it! One person goes to the counter while the rest of your party waits on large couches/chairs. You check-in & it takes less than 5 minutes (even with a long line). You then go to another line & immediately get onto a bus which will take you to your hotel. We were the last stop & were there within 30 minutes...I thought it was pretty quick & loved not having to drive through Orlando traffic. You also get to see other resorts along the way. There are tvs on the bus for small children & adults to watch & learn about Disney. The day before you leave, the resort places a note on your door that says when the bus will arrive to pick you up. You simply take your luggage downstairs, check in with a cast member (who takes your luggage), and then head outside to wait for your bus. It takes you directly to the airport & you don't see your luggage again until you arrive at your home airport! Its very convenient & its one less thing you have to worry about. We also used the Disney shuttles to get to the parks. Make sure to ask when you check-in for a bus schedule. The buses arrive every 15-20 minutes (we never had to wait for a bus) but the schedule will tell you how to get around. For example, how to get to Downtown Disney via the bus route. I also highly recommend the Disney Photopass CD especially if you have kids or are traveling in a large group...order it online ahead of time for around $120 (sometimes they have a special for $99). This sounds expensive, but if you wait until you get home, you will pay $14.95 just for one picture or to get the download of ONE picture. We didn't even use the Photopass photographers that much & had over 50 photos. This is how it works: You will get a card (looks like a credit card) with a 16-digit number on it -- this service is free. Throughout the parks & some hotels, photographers will take pics for you. After you get home, you will enter the code on the website & can order whatever pics you'd like (or you can have a cast member do it for you at the resort or a photo center at the park). As I said, if you prepay the $99, you can have a downloaded copy of all the pictures & license to use them/enlarge them/whatever you want to do with them. You also can go on Disney's website & find locations of where the Photopass photographers are located throughout each park. They also come to the character meals. If you have a very young child & don't ride much, you may not see as many Disney characters because a lot of them are at the end of the rides. Ask any cast member & they can tell you where to get a "Character Greeting Times Guide"...this changes day-to-day & at each park. You can pick one up at the Magic Kingdom at either City Hall (in Town Square) or at the main tip board on Main St USA. I'm not sure where the guides are at other parks (probably near the entrances...ask a cast member). I also advise reserving meals ahead of time that are a MUST to your trip, especially Character Dining. You can do it on the Disney website or through their customer service number. I apologize for the length of this review...but I wanted to make sure to get all of my information in! I came home & said "Oh, I wish someone would have told me that before I went" at least a million times! So I didn't want to leave anything out. My main advice...if you don't know something, ask a Cast Member. They are all knowledgeable & can assist with any question you might have. If they don't know, they will find out...very nice people at all resorts & parks!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: InTheBizMyself
Reviews.Content: We took mom for a milestone birthday to Kidani Village. Our purpose was to be comfortable and act like kids. We had a perfect place to realize both goals. The attention to detail is always appreciated. The staff are friendly. The villas are comfortable, well stocked, and clean. The food at Sanaa was quite tasty, and our service there was stellar. We will definitely return. This place is huge so if you don't like long walks to your room...pass this one by, but you are missing out on a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Never disappoints!”
Reviews.Author: lactamom
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort several time and have never been let down. The design and theme of this resort are positively amazing! Where else can you stay and view giraffes from your room? This resort is top-notch in every possible regard. The restaurants here are amazing, but pricey. Be sure to make your reservations well in advanced (90 days) or you may not be able to get in. Boma is a Disney fave, and people come from all over WDW to have dinner here. The quick-service restaurant (The Mara) is less than impressive. Its fine for a quick breakfast, but does leave much to be desired at lunch. Its over-priced and does not have a big variety. The grounds are amazing, the service is delightful, and you will have a wonderful time! The pool has a zero-entry area that is great for kiddos and a pool side bar that is great for the adults! There is a water slide that is also fun! The resort gift shop is HUGE and has many options for souveniers. The rooms also have refrigerators in them, so you can purchase snacks and drinks here as well. The rooms are very nice and comfortable. This resort utilizes the Disney bus form of transportation, but does not share a bus with any other resort. I found the busses to be quick and easy. My only draw back to staying here is the price. The hubby is all for paying extra to experience this resort, but I prefer to stick to a Disney Value resort. I always feel a little guilty after staying here that we did not spend more time just enjoying the resort. It is a mini vacay in and of itself! Something to think about if you dont plan to spend much time in the room, with all that Disney has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the reduced price”
Reviews.Author: dakine_wahine
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Jan/Feb 2009 for a last minute birthday celebration. I have been to Disney at least 1/2 dozen times before, but this was my first time at one of their deluxe resorts. Paid $144 night and for that price it was okay. Hotel was not as vibrant and active as the All Star Resorts and it did not seem to have as much Disney Magic. Staff seemed more laid back and distant and didn't excude the happy smiling attitude as is typical at Disney World and their other resorts. It was like checking into a regular hotel (no magic). Room did not seem much bigger than the value or moderate rooms and not quite sure why they are so much more costly. I did have a balcony but because of renovations it overlooked an empty Savannah. When I checked into my room I did notice that the maid left the used soap in the bathtub with someone's hair on it. Another day I found a shower-hook ring on the floor. Definitely not up to Disney standards. I ate at Jiko for my birthday dinner and that was great. I really wished they had served the wine flight that is offered at Mara, but they said they didn't. I did have a nice surprise when I returned to my room after eating dinner. A birthday card from the Disney characters! When taking the bus at this route you have to walk by the smoking area and you end up inhaling smoke every time you walk to the bus stop. Save your money if you choose to go to Disney World and stay at a moderate or value resort. But do try the restaurants here.

Reviews.Title: “For the onsale price, you can't beat it! Wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: Parrotheads
Reviews.Content: Stayed here July 2009 for several nights. Our room had 2 queen beds. The carpet needed a better vacuuming and there was a water bottle and candy trash in the corner that wasn't cleaned up before we checked in. We didn't use house keeping service so can't comment on that. The AK Lodge is beautiful. The animal areas out back are great. The interior is amazing. Our summer sale rate was about $155 otherwise we could not afford to stay there. We had a glass of wine at the bar our first evening ($13 glass!). Ate breakfast downstairs in the quick service each morning. Ate dinner one evening quick service and also used our refill mugs for cocoa or cola. We have stayed the All Star Resorts and Pop Century. There is definitely a difference. One of the best things was that our room was so quiet. We never ever heard anyone else around us. The bed was so comfy and quality. The bathroom area was nice. The little balcony just overlooked the entrance but was still pleasant to have. We didn't want to pay more to upgrade to a view of the animal areas as we spend all day from open to close in the parks and it just wasn't worth it when we left at dawn and returned at night. We booked this room to help give us some space and comfort as we made the trip with family members, who stayed in another hotel. After all day with the family it was a welcome comfort to spend the evening at AK Lodge. We did not rent a car. Not needed. Get on the free Disney transportation bus early and just plan ahead how many minutes (15-20-30) to which park or Downtown Disney. We do not return to our room for naps. One thing we will agree with: DISNEY MAGICAL EXPRESS: heard on a podcast nothing "express" about it. For sure. This was our 2nd time and it took forever to get picked up at the airport. There were only 4 of us going to AKL and so they put us on a bus with some other resorts and of course, they stopped at those first. I think one was Pop Century. From the time we arrived at night to the airport Disney Magical Express check-in until we got to our hotel was over an hour. Maybe 1 hour 30 minutes. On the bus a parent let their child kick our seat the entire trip. So it seemed like 3 hours! ha. If we got the sale rate, we would definitely stay here again. We think fondly of our time at Animal Kingdom Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay.”
Reviews.Author: byanks7
Reviews.Content: We visited Walt Disney world the first week in November, staying 5 nights in savanna rooms at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. Here is my review of the hotel with some thoughts about the Disney experience as a whole. The Hotel is indeed beautiful. it’s a massive, African themed structure packed with eye-pleasing wood carvings, moldings , and lavish displays of every kind. It’s Disney, and definitely does not disappoint. The rooms are also decorated in the same substantial wood decor. The balconies are a little small, but the views of the savannas and grounds are very pleasurable. I was a little naive expecting to see animals all the time, but for the most part there weren’t many animals walking around. But when they were there, it was awesome! Especially the giraffes, but again they were only around for about 10 minutes a day. To be fair, we only had a few hrs of viewing time in the mornings as we were gone by 9 or 10 and didn’t return till after dark. We were on the 3rd floor Kudo trail. And you can smell the poop at times. We dined at Boma, the buffet several times for dinner and twice for breakfast. I loved the variety of foods, and sampled everything. There were also plenty of kid friendly foods, French fries, pasta, along with chicken, beef and pork. The one thing I didn’t like was the 18% gratuity extracted as the wait staff weren’t that visible and basically just refilled sodas. If there was one thing I regretted about the trip is that I didn’t catch on to was the reservation concept. I thought that only character breakfasts needed reservations, fortunately I was able to get last minute reservations ( two weeks prior to arrival) at some nice places, Trails End at Wilderness lodge being one of them. A great trip except I didn’t factor in the world series taking place at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “MUCH Better than Last Time”
Reviews.Author: JNTx3
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in WDW "deluxe" properties every other month all year and our previous experience with AKL meant that we would not likely return. Well, when Wilderness Lodge was booked I was forced to book AKL for our December 13-18 stay. To my surprise, it was WONDERFUL this time! The food was better, the lobby less chaotic and above all the staff was friendlier and more up to Disney standards. While most rooms are not coded as "savannah view" you can actually see animals from most of the hotel. Our room was not savannah this time due to availability, but it turned out even better. We ended up right at the barns where the animals come to eat and sleep. AMAZING!!! Much better than the savannah view that we paid dearly for the last time. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Stay at Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: canuckgal33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only one night and I wish it had been longer. We took the Magical Express from the hotel and arrived earlier than check in time. The check in was quick and easy, we were even able to get into our room early. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel lobby is beautiful with amazing African inspired decorations. Our room was nice, certainly adequate but I felt it was a bit small and somewhat dark. We had a standard room (so no views of the savanna) and it had a bunk bed and a queen size bed. The bunk bed is rather large and it takes up quite a bit of space in the room, but you don't really go to Disney World to spend time in your room, so that was ok. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom has a double sink outside the bathroom and a toilet/bathtub area that closes off from the sink area. The toilet/bath area was kind of dark, but the bathroom was very clean. Complimentary toiletries included 2 bars of soap, shampoo and conditioner. The pool was amazing, it has a small waterslide, which is always a plus with kids. It is a large hotel and it was fun to walk around the grounds and explore. We ate breakfast at Boma, which was delicious. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone. We loved our one night there, and wish we had been able to stay for longer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ericm315
Reviews.Content: My family to include a 1 year old stayed two nights at the Animal Kingdom Lodge (December 13-15, 2009) I was able to receive a excellent rate for my 2 nights having a Florida Resident rate. The lobby of the hotel is just beautiful. Check-in was very easy. I had booked a room not overlooking the savannah, but was given a room on the 2nd floor with a partial view of the savannah. To my amazement when he entered the room and looked out the balcony, was a giraffe, zebra's, and other animals all within 20 feet of my room. For the next two mornings, the animals were plentyful and always outside. We ate at one of the restaurants in the lodge (1st floor, forgot name) and had the usual burgers, pizza, breakfast, etc. The prices are pretty high, but it's not like you have much of a choice. We ate one night at Cape May (Disney Yacht and Beach Club) What a wonderful spread of food, choices, and service. We always eat at this restaurant when he visit Disney, and give it a high recommendation. The hotel room was very comfortable, and nice. Housekeeping provided us with bed rails which were very easy to attach to the bed. There was also a "pack and play" in the closet in case a person needed it. All in all we would stay at the Animal Kingdon Lodge again....

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: rastalinda
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at a disney resort. I have to say that the rooms were very nice , but a little dark. Also, if traveling with children you may want to bring movies or DVD's because the only channels you get are disney and one or two local channels. the Savannah views were very nice and the pools were nice but cold for the time of year. The lifeguard stated that the thermometer was broken.

Reviews.Title: “AKL- excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: palinscamera
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the last week of July 2009 foroone week. Can't fault Disney and we are considering returning this year. Book a Savannah room to see the animals from your balcony as it makes a difference at the end of the day!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: john02345
Reviews.Content: Stayed 22 nights recently and thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of this excellent hotel. Staff at front desk very good, housekeeping fine, restaurants excellent. Saw lots of animals every morning (though I reckon you don't get the same volume of animals from all Savannah rooms!). One minor thing was the travel time via Disney Bus to Downtown and all parks except the Animal Kingdom, but once you realised it took a bit longer than you'd like it was fine. Anyway, the Bus Transportation is part of the vacation, isn't it ? (!) Planning to return for our annual stay next November. J

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Lisa091
Reviews.Content: My husband, 4 year old and I stayed in a Savannah view room. Well worth the money! My 4 year old enjoyed standing on the balcony where she saw giraffes, zebra, and more up close. We also enjoyed using the night vision goggles supplied by the hotel to see the animals at night. The pool was great. It was open 24 hours which was great for when we got back late from the park. It was warm and comfortable for my 4 year old. The rooms and hotel were clean and the employees were helpful. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth full price but great if you can get a discount rate”
Reviews.Author: HuntingtonBeach
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay for two night before heading out on the Disney cruise. We debated staying down at the port but one of the families we were with wanted to stay at Animal Kingdom Lodge. Checking Disney's website showed a basic, non-view room would be $300/night. However, Expedia had the same room for $170/night. We booked and had low expectations- room near an elevator with a view of the parking lot. Our expectations were set too low. We had a quiet room down a hallway with a view of the animal area. It was great. Giraffes, zebras and antelope-like animals would wander near our room. They weren't 10 feet away, but sitting on the balcony gave a great view while the animals walked around and ate. The room itself was nice. We have previously stayed at Disney's cheaper resorts- Caribbean Beach and Coronado Springs. Those places were a little run down, with squeaky beds, old TVs, etc. Animal Kingdom Lodge has nice beds, flat screen TVs, nice fixtures in the bathroom, etc. The hotel premises are great. There are a bunch of animal viewing areas where you can sit and watch the animals running around. There are two big pools, each with a waterslide, and one with a water park (water cannons, a waterfall, a water playground). Disney staff were doing games and activities for the kids (free) at the bigger pool. There are at least three restaurants on site, including one that has quick service (with made to order plus pre-packaged food for sale). I do wish they would improve a few things: -WiFi should be free in all rooms. Instead, they have a wired connection available for $10/day. -Channel selection on the TV is pretty weak. -Food quality was a little sub-par. Not terrible, but could be improved. All in all, I would recommend this hotel. It is more expensive than the cheaper places, but if your kids like pools and the weather is nice, you can skip the parks for a day or two and just hang out at the hotel (free), go to Downtown Disney (free), and go to The Boardwalk (free). The money you save just might make up the difference, and the rooms are substantially nicer than the cheaper places on the property.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge !”
Reviews.Author: manzoorf
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful experience at the AKL. Starting with our Magical Express bus trip from Orlando Airport and the smooth and relaxing 35 min trip to the hotel, this was exceptional service at its best. The lobby itself is something to behold ... very impressive yet warm and inviting. Having arrived a bit earlier than the 3PM check-in time, we were pleasantly surprised to have a room available for us immediately. It gave us a chance to freshen up before heading out to Epcot.
