Being a stickler for room and hotel cleanliness, we were struck by the upkeep and cleanliness of our hotel room, bathroom, the hotel lobby and general access areas. Our room had two queen beds and a pool view. Very comfortable beds and pillows and the flat screen TV and balcony seating was great. Even though we didn't have a Savannah view room, viewing Giraffes, zebras and other animals from the various animal vantage points across the hotel was easy and fun. I know some people have commented about waiting times for the shuttles to the parks but we never waited more than 15 minutes and the ride was quick and direct to every park. From what I understand, the AKL is one of the few Disney properties that have direct shuttles to every single park. The only gripe we have about shuttles was that after park closing times, there was not always a shuttle readily available to hop back onto and usually the shuttles were standing room only and we had a stop at the Kidani Village lodge on the way back. However, again the wait was no more than 20-25 minutes every night. Boma : We had the breakfast buffet at Boma one morning and while it was very expensive (almost $70/2 adults + a 6 yr old), the choices were varied and exceptional. I especially enjoyed the corned beef with the Boma mustard. My wife was a big fan of the "omlette your way" option and the goat cheese scrambled eggs. We did breakfast at the Quick service Mara most other mornings and while not exceptional, the breakfast was not bad (and comparitively cheaper). Jiko : Between the superb soups and appetizers and the exceptional dinner entrees (tuna and curried prawns were superb), I can see why its such a highly regarded restaurant. It was an expensive indulgence that was well worth it. Simba's Clubhouse : We had the kids stay at Simba's Clubhouse the night we went to Jiko restaurant. The kids loved the Clubhouse and had lots of choices of activities - coloring, reading, movies and playstations that kept them busy and happy. Plus we were able to order the kids dinner at the Clubhouse. The rate was reasonable at 35/hr for 3 kids (ages 5,6 and 8). The Mara : Great location for snacks and quick meals. Open till 11:30 PM which made it convenient for quick snack runs after we returned back from park closures. Zawadi Market : Great selection of Disney branded items. Prices were comparable to about what one should expect for gifts/items in the parks. Our return back to the airport on the Magical Express was yet another smooth affair. In all, kudos to Disney for a job very well done with the Animal Kingdom Lodge. Some of our friends who visited the hotel and had stayed at other Disney Resorts in Orlando were very impressed with the overall ambience of the hotel. This will definitely be our hotel of choice next spring when we return !

Reviews.Title: “great resort with disney access perks”
Reviews.Author: scenicrentals
Reviews.Content: We did not get at the resort til late then went to the magic kingdom early the next morning but the resort was in very good shape there animals you could see at each walkway and a huge lobby with TV's and more activities for the kids .the only complaint I have is the staff was very abrupt on the verge of being rude and not just one but all of them .I think the management needs to think about a class in customer service , from the front desk to the bell hop .

Reviews.Title: “AKL--great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelaurPa
Reviews.Content: we stayed at AKL for 5 nights. whe paid the extra for the Savannah view on the 2nd floor (ideal location for animal watching). Every morning and evening we sat on the balcony watching giraffes, zebras and other exotic animals about 100 yards away. The hotel itself is magnificent--decorated flawlessly. It is so well done. the restaurants are very good. The buses did come regularly and we never had to wait longer than 10 minutes for our bus, but takes a good 10-15 minutes traveling to get to most of the parks from this area. It would be nice to have it a little closer. We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “All about it”
Reviews.Author: Jrb79627
Reviews.Content: Animal Kingdom Lodge is a very good place to stay. It has amazing service, pretty rooms and a reasonable value. The animals are beautiful and well cared for. The camp fire outside is welcoming and joyful. The swimming pool is large and good for kids to play in.

Reviews.Title: “lackluster staff -so not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Foxes999
Reviews.Content: I book a wayama safari for my friends. @ 210 per person you think we would be treated well. NOT so. I was celebrating a birthday but they split up me from my group..did not have seats reserved for me in the restaurant. well DUH. I had to sit a the small end of the table. Then the food was passed around to the other end...instaed of breaking it up to the two groups. How stupid. they never offered us doggies bags yet there was filet mignon left over 2 1/2 servings. and they brought the check before dessert. By the time I had retrieved glasses, pen and paper to calculate the correctness, the dessert samples were gone. for $630 for dinner for three ladies. I expected more. No decent restaurant brings the check before dessert.

Reviews.Title: “disneyworld trip 2009”
Reviews.Author: LeAnneW1
Reviews.Content: beautiful, amazing, nothing like I have ever seen. very attentive and friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Very good, not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: zukolivie
Reviews.Content: Overall, our stay at Animal Kingdom was satisfactory and I would suggest it to anyone. However this review is for those who tend to stay at upscale resorts when traveling. We booked a standard room with the Savannah view (facing the animals) and I’m not sure it was worth the extra money. We didn’t spend much time in our room, let alone on the balcony and there are quite literally dozens of opportunities to see the very same animals on your walk to the lobby and as you walk the grounds of the resort. If you plan on spending time in your room during the day or have children who might spend time on the balcony, I would absolutely suggest the Savannah view. If you plan on being out of the room during the daylight hours, I would suggest you save the money and get a garden view. The dining options at AK Jamba house (the main section of the resort) were a bit disappointing. The newest restaurant, Jiku, bills itself as an upscale South African dining experience however they aren’t quite there yet. The wine list was unique, try the Del Toren Fusion V, the food was delicious however the service was lacking in that we had to ask for water and we used the same utensils throughout the meal. For a meal that is comparably priced at Morton’s Steakhouse ($41 for an a la carte filet), I expected the service to be spectacular and it wasn’t. Every restaurant has a bad night; however we spoke with a couple at Epcot who experienced the same thing earlier in the week. We did not eat at the buffet, but there seemed to be many choices of meats, fruits and vegetables. The quick service section, the Mara, was as is to be expected. Fast food, coffee, soda, bagels in the morning. The pizza (cheese flatbread) was excellent believe it or not. A good place for a quick lunch or a snack as you lay by the pool. As I mentioned, there are many opportunities to view the animals that are kept in the resort. Everywhere you look, there are “look out” sections where you can lean up against the rock and watch the giraffes, zebras, antelopes, gazelles…you name it. It was very cool to see. The pool and multiple hot tubs are open 24 hours and they weren’t very busy. All in, the rooms were clean, the staff was friendly and the drinks were cold. I’d stay there again, but I would plan on dinner elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning !”
Reviews.Author: SolusIreland
Reviews.Content: During our vacation in Orlando myself and my husband stayed in the Rosen Plaza on International Drive for 11 nights and then we stayed in Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge for 3 nights. We loved both hotels - but in very different ways! Animal Kingdom Lodge is Absolutely stunning it feels like you are staying in the middle of the jungle with nature all around you. It has the WOW factor. From the time we arrived to the time that we left we felt really taken care of. Food and drink in the lodge is very reasonably priced taking into consideration that it is a Disney Hotel. If you plan on visiting Universal and other non Disney attractions you might be better splitting your stay between two hotels as we did (so that you are not so far away from the other attractions). The beauty of the Lodge itself and the perks for guests (magic hours etc) make staying in Disney Animal Kingdom a must ! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - do not hesitate to stay here !”
Reviews.Author: BubblesWales
Reviews.Content: Having read mixed reviews of this hotel I was a little wary - but totally needlessly ! The hotel is as amazing as the pictures look. And I'm not that easily pleased ! The reception/longe area is a fantastic place to chill out on the huge furniture with loads to look at and see. We did not book a special room but we still had animals every day at the rear - giraffes, all sorts. The staff couldn't have been friendlier, the check-in was quick and easy and the hotel room was gorgeous. Yes it can be shady as the wood is dark but it is truly atmospheric. The dual sinks and separate bathroom works well with more than 2 people sharing. The beds were comfy. The TV was huge - mostly US channels but hey, you are in the US and why would you come if all you wanted to see was UK channels ! It's a fair walk (2 minutes !) if you are in a room a way away but no haslle, and good exercise and there are viewing windows and patios and things to look at all the way along. Even drinks/food/ice machines ! We tried all the restaurants - the quick self-service restaurant was excellent - the food for self-service was great and reasonable - coffee $1.25 ? You don't get that in the UK anymore. My fave was the soup that came in a hollowed-out bread roll dish, wonderful. The buffet restaurant, though always busy, was easy to get a table if you didn't mind waiting half an hour or so - go there about 5 and they will give you a pager for when your table is ready even if it's 2 hours later. Its always fully booked months in advance but you will get a table. It was no problem. The food was really good and all-you-can eat for about 30 dollars adult, 15 child. Quite expensive with the £ not being as strong as it was but worth it. The range was amazing. The fine-dining restaurant is exactly that. So don't go there if you're looking for a quick large portion meal. It's not that, it's all carefully freshly prepared and has wonderful fine ingredients. We paid $200 for 3 of us for 3 courses plus wine and soft drinks but it was top notch. Try the room service also if you can't get a restaurant table - the food is in huge portions but soo worth it !!! The pool area of the hotel is also excellent. Tons of sun beds. Towels provided. Shaded areas for families. Easy access to self-service restaurant, waiter service drinks if you want and there is an outdoor bar too. The water is always warm. There is the occasional animal smell but YOU ARE IN ANIMAL KINGDOM - DON'T GO IF YOU DON'T LIKE ANIMALS ! I could go on and on about this hotel but it is one of the best I have ever stayed in and we;ve been everywhere - you must go, it is amazing - what more can I say ???

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, expensive and dark”
Reviews.Author: alexischristine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for five nights; he for a conference and I went along. Although a beautiful setting and lovely lobby, the hotel is very dark. As it is considered one of WDW's deluxe properties, I was expecting much more in our room. I've stayed at Disney moderate hotels and didn't find a difference although we did have turndown service.The room was an ok size with a double sink vanity outside of the toilet, bathtub area. The toilet and bathtub area is very small and dark. I like to read while bathing and that was not possible here. I couldn't imagine having to bathe a couple of kids in there. The only amenities we were given were soap, shampoo, conditioner and lotion. Nothing special or extra. The beds were comfy although I prefer a duvet rather than a sheet covered blanket configuration used here. The linens were very nice and crisp. Also, don't expect wifi in this hotel. Internet access is $9.95 per 24 hours and is wired. A wire is thoughtfully provided since most people would expect wifi and probably not bring a cable with them. Since we were staying in a club level room, we had access to the Kilamanjaro Club accessed with our room key to the sixth floor. An adequate continental breakfast (with the best oatmeal) is provided. Tea is held in the afternoon while wine and cheese plus other snacks are available at 5 pm. Then at about 7 pm cordials and desserts are brought out. There is also soda, beer, juices, espresso, etc. at no charge. Of course, the best thing about this hotel is the animals. Make sure to book a savannah view room. Although the pool view would be fine in any other hotel ,seeing giraffes, zebras and numerous other animals and birds from your balcony is amazing. Also, I have to add this. It can be a very long walk to the lobby area from your room because of the layout of the hotel. If possible, ask for a room closer to the lobby than we had. After spending all day walking around the parks, you will be happy you did. Nightlife is non-existent at this hotel. There is a small lounge but it is practically adjacent to the Boma, which is a very loud buffet restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Views”
Reviews.Author: NicoleZ
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second stay at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge. Our savanah view room #3227 had the best views ever. They put the giraffe's food in a tree that was right outside our balcony so every night the giraffe ate there and then slept there. We also had a plethora of zebras, a few antelope, a few ancole cattle and many other animals in easy view. The third floor is the main level so you do not have to find stairs or elevators. This hotel is very beautiful and my kids love it. I should also mention that the buses come constantly and take you directly to the parks. You may have to stop at Animal Kingdom Kidana Village but it is right next door. Some resorts make many, many stops before delivering you to the park - UGH!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we hoped for and more...”
Reviews.Author: Lignoto
Reviews.Content: I had a work conference and decided to bring the family as we have never been to a Disney property. I coudln't have been more happy withe decision to stay at AKL rather than at the Grand Floridian, where the conference was held. The AKL is absolutely breathtaking as you walk in - from the artwork to the woodwork to the african themed lighting and decor to the huge wall of windows that allows you to view right out onto the savannah. We arrived a couple hours early, but our room was ready and the whole checkin process took less than 5 minutes. We checked out our room - pool view - very nice, not noisy at all, then headed off to our first park visit. Transportation from AKL to AK took maybe 15 mintues - this includes the wait at the bus stop. We used the bus for all transportation - it truly is hit and miss. One time we'd be right in time and the next we'd have to wait 20-25 minutes but at no additional cost, it was worth it for the 5 days we stayed. Restaraunts were so/so - Mara - over priced convenience store or fast food type fare. Boma - very good buffet - at $29 per person, it certainly made us want to try everything! Didn't try the other two. Pool fantastic, playground fantastic, animals all around fantastic, arcade fantastic, daily activities for children fantastic, laudry room fantastic, cleaning service fantastic. While we didn't have a savannah view room, we didn't miss a thing. There are so many great spots around the resort to watch for animals. I would go back in a heartbeat but I also enjoy trying new places to stay so next time we go, we are likely to try another resort. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this resort with the highest of remarks to anyone who asks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon!!!”
Reviews.Author: hsk327
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I had our honeymoon in Disney and stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge with Savanna view (worth the extra money!!!) we loved it!!!!! My favorite resort by far. The animals were so close. we had breakfast on our patio during the sunrise and just watched the animals. Its was truly an amazing and unforgetable experience.

Reviews.Title: “better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: montreal64
Reviews.Content: we stayed 4 nights at jambo house with our 3 kid (6-3-2). We had a savana view with bunk bed and it was worth the extra money. each time we looked outside, there was a giraffe or a zebra...The room was ok. Surprisingly, the food at the hotel is very good. The kids loved the pool. Bus transportation was easy. We never waited very long.

Reviews.Title: “One of my more memorable Disney resort stays”
Reviews.Author: julfers
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several Disney World resorts with most of them being in the same "deluxe" class at the Animal Kingdom Resort. However, I found the stay at Animal Kingdom to be a bit more memorable because we had a Sahara room which allows you to see animals just outside of your window (and balcony). The rooms are just as big (and probably a little larger than some of the other deluxe resorts) as any of the other Disney deluxe resorts. The only disadvantage to staying here is that it is not as convenient as the Magic Kingdom or Epcot resorts are. With some of the Magic Kingdom and Epcot resorts you can easily walk to the parks. With the Animal Kingdom Resort you will need to drive or take a Disney-provided bus to any of the parks. Another complaint is that food service shuts down too early. The quick bite cafe closes at midnight and there is no 24 hour room service (only breakfast, lunch and dinner). One other thing to note is that hotel does not have a business center or wireless internet access in the rooms. You have to pay about $10/per day for internet access (wired). If you're looking to stay on Disney property this is certainly a unique hotel, especially with the Sahara view rooms. With that said you can find better values at other hotels around Orlando. All of the staff members were very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay in disneyworld”
Reviews.Author: karensolihull
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at Animal Kingdom Lodge using Disney vacation club points. Had a spacious and spotlessly clean room overlooking the savannah.It was amazing to wake up in the morning and see giraffes etc walking past your balcony. Didnt use the restaurant as it was full of families with noisy small children - but what else can you expect in Disneyworld ! Pool was lovely with lots of chairs and a great bar. Visited the new part of AKL, think its called Kidani Village - it was just like a much smaller version of the original hotel - overall i prefered to main hotel. My only criticism is the length of time it took to get anywhere on the Disney buses. We spend a lot of evenings at Downtown Disney and it took 40 mins to get there. Went onto Old Key West resort after this one which was much more convenient. Overall a great stay though

Reviews.Title: “Exotic, tropical, magical....Disney style. Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mexico15
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights to celebrate my husband's birthday. We have visited Disney countless times and stayed in all of their room categories. This was one of our favorite resorts. The setting was magical, rooms comfortable. The staff were very knowledgeable about the animals and anything they didn't know they eagerly found out for you. Seeing giraffes and other animals outside one's bedroom balcony is mind boggling and humbling. My son loved the pool and slide. The theming is out of this world. We ate at Jiko and Mara. Both were tasty and offered some healthier options rather than the usual burgers, fries and chicken fingers. We would stay here again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families with young children”
Reviews.Author: grillonLausanne
Reviews.Content: We stayed in that hotel with our 3 young children in Oct 2009. Very convenient when you're visiting Disney parks. Staff very helpful especially with kids. The whole family had a good time and could relax at the pool after the Disney Parks.

Reviews.Title: “Can I go back tomorrow??”
Reviews.Author: thekidds
Reviews.Content: What can I say... Disney does it all! We had the most amazing time at the AKL Jambo house. We had a savana view with 2 queen beds. The moment we arrived in our room, there was a giraffe walking by the balcony. They brought bed rails, as requested, for our 2 1/2 yr old right away. Every day our son couldn't wait to run up to each window on the walk to the lobby to see what animal he'd see next. (Note, the walk is long from many of the rooms). The lobby was warm & inviting. The staff was very helpful as well. One day our son decided to toss his new Pirate sword over the balcony. I called the front desk right away and they sent a safari expedition out to retrieve it! Food was great, the Mara is nice for small snacks, room service was fantastic (pricey but that's to be expected). Boma was a great experience too, but I think our favorite was Jiko... terrific food. Had no issues with bus service. Was always timely. Can't wait to go back, and we'd stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Savanna view - so worth it if you love animals”
Reviews.Author: puppyjake
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 2 nights at AKL....first impressions were a little off due to a very miserable front desk supervisor and our request of a King bed savanna view not being available - we could have downgraded (and recieved a refund) to a King Bed standard or stuck with the Savanna view and had 2 Queens - which we did, and we are so glad we did - our room was in the Zebra trails side of the hotel and sure enough every time i looked out of the window there were 4 Zebra wandering around. We actually saw every animal on the chart that they leave in your room...just for some reason the Zebra were there all the time. So the room - was nice - 3rd floor - which is the same floor as the lobby so no messing around with having to find the elevators - it was quiet, clean and comfy...as it was halloween mousekeeping left little ghost towels around the room. The balcony was great - we spent a long time in the morning and evenings watching the animals - i wish you could rent binoculars in your room. Ate at Jiko - absolutely fabulous - worth every penny - this is my 2nd time there and it truely is one of my favorite restaurants. Also ate the breakfast buffet at Boma - really good - great food selection and at $16.99 - i thought a good price. Didn't go in the pool this time - too busy running around the parks, but we did go to the other Savanna viewing areas - i really recco going at night and looking through the night vision binoculars. I think the only thing i didn't like about AKL was that apart from Animal Kingdom it is a long drive to the parks - the buses are great - just factor in a good 20 - 25 mins or so travel time plus however long you have to wait for the bus. In all honesty i think that apart from Magic Kingdom - its easier to drive to the parks as the price of parking is included in your hotel accomodation. Just one thing to know - if you are people who will be leaving your room at 6.00am and staying at the park till close then the Savanna view is probably not worth it...we spent a lazy saturday morning having breakfast on the balcony watching the animals, and then we had drinks on the balcony that evening watching the animals....so for us it was a huge part of the experience of AKL.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our Animal Kingdom experience!”
Reviews.Author: Suebee70
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our grown children stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge for 5 nights in October. My husband had completed on-line check-in several days before we arrived but they were unable to locate it. It was disappointing, however, they honored our request to be in rooms next to each other and upgraded us to a pool view. We were on the third floor not too far off the lobby with a view of the hot tub and a partial savannah view. It was a great location, just steps from the pool and restaurants. We found the rooms to be very clean and the beds comfortable. We also enjoyed the somewhat remote and quiet location. However, without a car I imagine transportation to the parks could become tiresome. It was a bit of an ordeal the couple times we used Disney transportation. As a party of adults we enjoyed the somewhat more adult theme to this resort. We had breakfast at Boma and loved it, wished we had planned another meal there! All in all we had a great stay and are making plans to return!

Reviews.Title: “Not For Us”
Reviews.Author: linnytoons
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this resort for 2 nights At the end of August supposed to be 7 nights. The lobby was really unique and beautiful with the window facing the Savannah. Ate a both restaurants as we were on deluxe dinning plan, both were excellent Boma was amazing. Had a room that was lobby level and a long walk to get there, although it was close to the pool and quick service dinning. We paid for a Savannah view and got an excellent spot. Found out that looking at the animals for a bit got boring. Things that made us move to Polynesian. The room was small not just small for the price but small. Our room was infested in ants and when we complained at first they made us feel like we were lying. Some one was sent up to change our sheets and bedding. Then the phone rang at 1:00 AM saying that pest control was there and wanted to send them up. All I could say was no thanks, you got to be kidding 1:00AM. The next morning I called and asked if we could change resorts and Disney came through and moved us to the Polynesian no extra charge. All in all ok place just not for us even with out the ants. Not sure if I would recommend paying for Savannah view as there are lots of look out points. Location to everything other than Animal Kingdom not great lots of travel. We had a car so it was not to bad could not imagine taking the bus.

Reviews.Title: “Very beautiful and unique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: alliballib
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Animal Kingdom lodge with my boyfriend, his sister and my mum last month and absolutely loved it! Upon arrival all the staff are very helpful, they came over to greet us and helped with all of our bags. The reception area, although quite dark, is really fantastic. The restaurants are all quite close to each other - we never actually ate in Jiko's but we did dine in Boma (which I did actually prefer for breakfast than dinner) and Mara which is the quick counter service restaurant. Boma is very nice for dinner if you are quite adventurous as most of the food has a sort of African flare to it (although there are things like chips, chicken nuggets, pasta etc for kids or adults unwilling to try). Unfortunately my mum stuggled to find something she would enjoy, but the staff really did go out there way to assist her, they even offered to make a pizza for her. The pool area is very nice, with flamingos around the bottom area (which are quite smelly when you get close up but they look nice!). The hot tub is extremley hot! I don't think I've ever experienced one like it. Great to relax in after a long day walking round the parks. Rooms are very comfortable and spacious, nice bathroom with two sinks which is always nice. The first room we had unfortunately over-looked the bus stop, but we did ask if we could move to another room and they very kindly moved us to a savannah view room! Really beautiful surroundings, you can't fault them at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good for animal viewing”
Reviews.Author: CiannaKeyLargo
Reviews.Content: I would stay on the 3rd floor for best view of the park. Rooms too small but all in all, a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: usaf29
Reviews.Content: See few attached photos. Yes animals are right below your balcony. The hotel & room has dark rich colors. This is not a character place. It is a dark, rich colored Savana location. The lobby is grand, smells like the open hearth fire where the restaurant cook. That is a good smell. Great receptionist. Great magical express to and from airport/resort. You even check in the airport, get tickets at the Lodge. Good fast service food. Extremely easy use of dining cards at every park & food kiosk. Going back to Disney but want something different this time due to the price. One stays in parks all day so up to you to spend lots on lodging. It is a place to sleep. Recommended to stay there one time.

Reviews.Title: “best family holiday yet”
Reviews.Author: gijayne67
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 2 weeks here, what a place we loved it, from the moment we walked into the hotel lobby, the rooms were lovely the beds really comfy and when we seen all the animals from our room balcony it was amazing we were in room 4344 and that was with a standard room. The kids aged 6 and 8 loved the pool open 24 hours,nothing better having a busy day at athe parks then back for a swim. Places to eat, Boma was lovely and Mira was a counter service was fine as well. We did not eat in Jiko.We had the DDPand it was well worth it we ate in alot of different places in the different parks and found we saved alot of money on the DDP.All the staff were really friendly, the disney transport was brill we did not wait longer than 10 mins for a bus to the parks, my husband got a eye infection when we were there and had to go to the walk in clinic so they came to the hotel and took us and then brought us back which was great .We took a taxis one morning to walmart to get some snacks to take to the parks$40 there and back.The kids club was great the kids went a couple of times and loved it,my husband and i went to the gym a couple of times, there was things for the children to do at the hotel all throught out the day, the place was amazing i could not fault it .It was a real happy place we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “We will return!”
Reviews.Author: Spike96
Reviews.Content: The AKL is our DVC home resort; however, we had never stayed here before. Our room was in the Lodge itself on the fifth floor. The theming of the hotel is brilliantly well done and (as usual at WDW) totally immersive. As soon as we arrived Helen rushed straight onto the balcony to see a Giraffe, Zebra and various birds. A selection of animals was visible from the room virtually every time we were on the balcony. We felt that the room was very well appointed and particularly liked the flat screen TV as it allowed more storage space than we have previously enjoyed at WDW. We made use of the fitness centre and can warmly recommend the massage and facial services, the ladies were great. We ate both breakfast and dinner at Boma and thoroughly enjoyed both meals, the Victoria Falls bar was also good and the staff were excellent again. As DVC members we enjoy the benefit of free valet parking and the guys on duty at the desk are a great team, thanks to Mike, Sean, Tez, Trevor and Christina. You were friendly, helpful and very efficient, you really enhanced our stay. We have only two reservations about AKL, firstly it can be very dark in places (it was impossible to see into the safe for example) and secondly it is a very child friendly resort so the pool, lobby and restaurants can be rather noisy (and sometimes fractious). All in all though we really enjoyed our stay and definitely intend to return next year. I would say book a Savanna view room, bring a decent camera and an illuminated make up mirror and you will be all set!

Reviews.Title: “Amazed to find poor service at Disney”
Reviews.Author: haplo888
Reviews.Content: It is pretty darn neat to have giraffes outside your bedroom window. Just be sure if you are going to pay to stay here that you pay the extra money for a room with a "safari view" so you can take advantage of the hotel's main attraction. The pool was relieving and open 24 hours. We did have a problem with a front desk rep while trying to upgrade our room. Believing he already knew what we were asking for, he really didn't listen to us and was shockingly insulting and snobby. I expect such treatment in Manhattan but was floored to find it at a Disney Resort. We eventually got our request fulfilled by talking with a front desk manager. After asking about room service surcharges we were surprised with a hidden 20% price increase on top of the declared 18% automatic gratuity and flat delivery fee. It would also be nice if they extended the hours of the hotel restaurants at least to match the hours of the parks. Finally, in this day in age I can see no excuse for a resort to carry all cable news stations, even MSNBC, except Fox News. Agree with their biased opinions or not, half the country is conservative and you have to either carry both biased positions, or neither. I caught a 104 fever while visiting the parks and could not drive back to Boston when we checked out, so my wife and I stayed an extra couple nights in a Hamden Inn just outside of Disney. We were so impressed with the comfort and cleanliness of the rooms, the helpful staff, location, and price that we will surely be staying at a non-Disney resort on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very Fun”
Reviews.Author: TraceyBoston
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this beautiful hotel. We were located at the very end of the hallway (7 minutes to the lobby) but, we had a beautiful view of all the wonderful animals. The room was fine and the housekeeping was sensational. Boma was awesome. We ate here at breakfast and dinner. The pool was cool and the night vision goggles was an experience. I think I would try a different hotel next time but, it was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pack your boots...and enjoy your stay!”
Reviews.Author: TheFiveOs
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge at Walt Disney World. We traveled with 4 generations of family...great grandparents, grandparents, parents (my husband and I) and our 3 children, ages 9, 5 and 2. We made our reservations about 6 months ago, and took advantage of the free dining promotion that Disney was offering. We upgraded the dining plan to the deluxe dining plan so that we would always have the option of a sit down meal, which the older folks prefer. The Animal Kingdom Lodge is lovely. We had stayed there once before, with just our immediate family, so we knew that we'd enjoy the surroundings. We had savannah view rooms, which meant that there were zebra and giraffe outside our balcony at times. Not too close, mind you, but it was neat. The other thing that's really neat about the AKL is that there are tons of African museum quality items throughout the resort. So much so, that the resort is actually considered a museum. A nice educational component, I think. The other thing that we really like about AKL is that there are a lot of programs for kids (and adults, actually) most of which are free, and quite educational. The kids learn about culture, conservation, music, etc. from the staff, over 50% of whom are actually from the African continent, which is really cool. Of course, the animals are always around, which is also really cool. The pool is nice, with a zero entry area, which is nice for the little guys. There is one water slide, which is open from about 9am to 8pm, but the pool itself is open 24 hours, which is also a great feature. The hot tub is large and was not crowded. There is a playground, too, and a very small kiddy pool which is about 1 foot deep, although I don't think that i ever saw anyone there. The restaurants are nice, the Boma has nice buffets with a lot of variety, and the Mara is typical Disney quick service dining. We didn't go to Jiko b/c some of us aren't very adventurous eaters, but I've heard that it's wonderful. The room service dining was fine, but quite pricey, and it was nothing amazing. In fact, my very expensive steak was overcooked. Here are my gripes about our stay: We booked over six months in advance, and requested connecting rooms. We had a total of 3 rooms reserved. We ended up with no connection rooms. We were near each other, but across the hall. And, it seemed like the rest of our party that was across the hall always had animals outside of their windows, and we rarely did! Who knows for sure! The other issue is that my 86 year old grandmother was with us, as was my dad, who, due to a recent injury, was in a wheelchair. Our room was about as far away from the lobby of the hotel as we could be. I am not exaggerating when I tell you that it took us 15 minutes to get to our room from ANYWHERE in the hotel. It was frustrating, to say the least. It made our days much longer, and the older folks much more tired. It was unnecessary and disappointing to me, especially since we booked so far in advance, were with folks who were elderly and infirm, and went at an off peak time. There were very short ride times in the park, so there's no way the AKL was anywhere near its capacity. Also, the AKL rooms seem to be a little smaller than the other Disney Deluxe resorts like Wilderness Lodge. The room description notes that there's a daybed in each room, but there wasn't one in any of our rooms, nor do I have any idea where they'd have put it. We had 2 queen beds, a small table with two chairs, and that was tight! Another issue, although one I knew to expect, is that AKL is far away from the other parks, so expect a long bus ride, no matter where you go...that's the trade off for staying in a place with lots of wild animals!! The one good thing is that AKL basically has its own buses...they don't stop at any other resorts! All in all, a great place to stay, lots of great kid programs, but a big lodge...so bring your hiking boots!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Disney has to offer!”
Reviews.Author: grena4
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a number of Disney hotels and this is one of our favorites. Everyone from my 70 year old father in law to my 3 &5 year olds loved it. While we were busy at the parks my father in law was able to relax and watch the animals. He also LOVED the restaurant. The kids loved the pool... the highlight was getting to be the first kids to go down the waterslide. They got a special certificate., they were so proud of it! To me it is a perfect amount of Disney. The staff was great always there to wish us a Magical Day. One of the best parts of staying on Disney property is the magical hours, which is getting in early or staying late at one chosen park a night. (This is, however, offered at all of Disney's Themed hotels.) Our experience was a great one... I'm sure yours will be too!

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping Among the Wild Animals”
Reviews.Author: lynlynch
Reviews.Content: If you have a rental car and don't mind driving to the various attractions, this is a very nice hotel. We have stayed here on three occasions and have not been disappointed. With a Savannah view, we awoke to animals dozing outside our window. The rooms are a bit small and be aware that you will be living out of your suitcases since there isn't much storage space. Also, the room safe is not the size of other hotels so don't plan on being able to lock up your laptop. Rooms come with a refrigerator and if you have children who don't want to share a bed, you can request bunks. We stayed on the club level. A bit of a disappointment is that, though you have access to the club lounge via your room key, the actual floor on which this room is located is only for vacation club members. We requested a room close to the main elevator, making it easier to get our snacks. The room we were given, even though Club, wasn't really prepared as such. When we asked, we were given our robes and extra toiletry amenities as well as turn-down service. They have eliminated plastic water bottles when staying at Club. You may want to buy water and keep it in the room's refrigerator. They will give you Perrier water to go if you ask, however the glass bottles that it comes in isn't permitted in all areas (such as the pool.) The food selections include many less familiar dishes with an African flair, but the snacks and appetizers also include mainstays to keep everyone happy. My one complaint with Disney is that there is no affordable option for Internet access. With the rates we are paying for rooms, that would be a nice touch. Be aware that each guest is allowed about 20 minutes per day Internet access in the Business Center at no charge. We didn't discover that tidbit until our trip was almost over. You can check e-mail, print boarding passes, etc. Take advantage of the free service to have your luggage transported directly to the airport. We have done this now for about 4 years and it's always been at our destination with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: piphigal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 4 and 6 year olds to Disney World for vacation. After much research, we decided to stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. It was fantastic! The decor was top notch. The rooms were comfortable and well appointed. We were upgraded to a savavanna and the kids really enjoyed seeing the giraffes and zebras each morning and early evening! The beds were comfy! The bathroom was separated into a toliet and shower area and sink area. The only downside is that our room was far from the lobby and was a hike in the evening after long days at the parks. But the hotel more than made up for the distance!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hyperhippiechic
Reviews.Content: My husband and I both enjoyed this hotel. Sitting on the balcony watching the animals every day was so enjoyable and relaxing. Every morning I woke up early, read the newspaper, drank some coffee and just watched the animals, before we ran around Disney. The hotel was clean and the interior and exterior were beautiful. The pool was nice, but I would have rather had a couple smaller pools around the resort. There is only one large pool, so everyone is there. There are also many activities during the day to participate in, if you aren't at one of the Disney Parks. We would definitely stay here again. The downside is that the resort is a far drive to most of the parks, except Disney's Animal Kingdom. The others are at least 15-20 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - we can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: mickeyandminniemad
Reviews.Content: My Husband, myself, our 14yr old and 1 year old stayed here in sept for two weeks. We had the best holiday we have ever experienced. We booked a standard room but were given a partial savannah, excellent to see Giraffe, Zebra, Thomson Gazelle etc right outside your window. The room itself was smallish, but we werent there very much. It was clean had a fridge, coffee maker etc. On arrival I called down to Housekeeping for a kettle as we have a baby who drinks formula. The kind lady offered us a microwave, which duly arrived within 10 minutes. The pool was great, and even had life jackets for the kids, plenty of towels, masses of sunbeds. Very pretty and the zero entry was fab for small children. Housekeeping left me a very pretty towel "birthday cake" and we also had Mickey shapes too. We tried the ceramic painting and jewellery making activities, both well organised and fun. The Mara quick service restaurant was great for breakfast and snacks and the refillable mugs are well worth the money. We had hot drinks at breakfast and then filled them up for the day ahead. Boma has a great buffet, with lots of different style fare and Jiko was a special treat. We never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus, but sometimes had to stand on the way home. This is a quiet hotel, with beautiful african theming and we cannot wait to return for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: KristelMIami
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room with a view of the savanah, it was beutiful, with the decor of the room and the view you actually feel as if you were in Africa. The rooms are very clean the staff is nice, the hotel is beautifully decorated as well in theme with the hotel. the food at teh hotel was good.at night we sat in the balcony very romantic. worth every penny!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for something different, here it is.”
Reviews.Author: kps1995
Reviews.Content: Not your typical Disney Resort, more of an African Safari theme. In the back there is a open zoo full of animals you would see on a safari such as giraffes, gazelles, and lions (in separate areas of course). The buffet was decent, some of the spices (like nutmeg) used in the food may be different. This is one of the more pricey of the the Disney resorts but was safe, clean, and the shuttles to the parks were easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond the safari- is peace and serenity”
Reviews.Author: princesslollipop
Reviews.Content: A pool like a bath- and a restaurant to sink your taste buds into. What better than animals roaming about the safari themed hotel and authentic dishes from Africa. Yes- your balcony or windows may view an open aired savanna to watch animals graze . The fees are exceptionally pricey for the Savann a( animal viewing rooms) but a experience in a million to see. I prefer the pool view- the lush trees and tropical feel is more my idea of rest and relaxation. The pool is warm and clean. It is expansive in size- and doesnt reach over 5 feet high in depth. There is a child friendly slide and and two lush encircled spa tubs to bubble up in after a great meal at Boma restaurant. This resort has 2 fab restaurants to choose from and an amzing counter service stop as well. The Mara is the counter service and serves up 1/2 a chicken meals- that is out of this world. The falaffal pita is very yummy as well- are the kids meals. Prices here are fair. As for the other resort restaurant is Jiko- I would say its more adult. Ahhhhh- The rooms are all authentic in design with wood carvings and the most comfortable beds ever. The balconies are roomy- and have beautiful lawn furniture in metal art - ours was a zebra. The bath rooms are double sinks- and there is a large tub and shower toliet area as well. The room is always prepared with frsh towels and clean sheets each day. There is cookie making at 1 pm- each day. Yummmy delicious yes!! Crafts occupy the kids for a fee and some are free . Yes Free things to make and play- yeah... there is a babysitting club with a room stocked with kiddie activities. I think the fee was 11$ an hr. or so. Real nice. I didnt use this - but Im sure some parents will. The drinks- are not too my fancy- I just wasnt enjoying the adult beverages to much. The buses are usually super fast coming to AKL but!!!!! since Kidani village was created - the sister property- the service is slower indeed. This was shocking- since we always got on super fast- to the parks. We waited 40 mins. for buses at times. Its changed - but still AKL is super in every way but this bus thing. The airline desk- are in need to of some extra help- as are some of the concierge- We had an amazing man - named Josh- help us choose dining amazing night out we had thanks to him. As for some yawning on the phone Mercedes- that was rude- as she was - rude! All else was enjoyable to an outstanding degree! I have visited this hotel resort a few times prior to this most recent vacation review. I must start with this hotel is spotless from top to bottom.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LisFab
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel September 2009. We had booked a standard room as we couldn't justify the extra cost of a savannah view (£700) and hoped to be upgraded anyway. When we got there we were given exactly what we paid for - a car park view room! There are other areas to view the animal but to be honest we only went a couple of times so feel better that we didn't pay the extra for a savannah view. The advantage of a standard view is that it was closer to the front of the hotel and therefore the car park, lobby, bus stops etc. I'd never stayed at a deluxe Disney hotel before and assumed the deluxe tag was for the savannah, however the hotel was fab. The beds were extremely comfortable (although this is always subjective) if a little high. I'd read reviews that said the rooms were small and dark but I didn't find that at all. With all the lights on or the curtains open they were very bright and although not large there was enough space. The counter service restaurant The Mara was average but we ate at Boma a couple of times and it was lovely. The pool area was beautiful and the pool itself lovely and warm. The only negatives - housekeeping tended to come late, one day at 4.20pm when we had returned to get changed for dinner which was inconvenient. Not a problem if you stay out all day. The other negative was the car park. Because of the savannahs it's all at the front of the hotel which means you can be parked miles away. It's the farthest out of the Disney hotels which can be a pain but it also makes it quiet. My only regret is that I've now experienced it and probably won't afford it again!

Reviews.Title: “Used to be my favorite hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mgm1976
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge many times, however, this stay was not as wonderful. We checked in on Tuesday and checked out on Friday. We requested a handicap room ahead of time when we made the reservations. When we checked in, we were told they had none available. i asked to speak to the manger, Robert, and he didnt seem to be very helpful nor very apologetic. Another complain I have was that the room smelled very musty. Also, there is a foul smell in the hallway by the public restrooms on the third floor. Even after all that, we wanted to stay an extra night but was told they were sold out (which I find hard to believe) so we moved to the Swan Hotel. Being that it is an older hotel, it was very clean and updated. Even though I will very much miss the Savanah view at Animal Kingdom Lodge, I dont think we will be staying there again. The Disney Transportation is also very slow. I feel like we spent most of our vacation waiting for Disney transportation than enjoying ourselves. I've complained about the transportation before, but it has not changed at all. We are annual pass holders, so we now drive to the parks since we dont have to pay for parking.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: atlantacmh
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a five day stay at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge with my best friend and some family. Let me just say that the hotel was amazing!! From the moment I walked through the front doors, I knew that I was transported far away from every day life the way only Disney can do so well. The lobby of the hotel is fantastic. The theming is done so well that you really do feel as if you've been whisked away to a lodge in the middle of an African savanah. It's very cozy, and there are plenty of nice spots to just sit and relax. Upon reaching the check-in desk, we were immediately greeted with a warm welcome and a smile. I had reserved a standard room on Expedia with a very good rate I might add, so I wasn't expecting any special treatment. To my surprise, we were given a Savanah room with a view of the animals, so I was very happy. There is something about waking up and looking out over the balcony to see giraffes that I thought was pretty cool. I really did enjoy it. As far as the room itself goes, it was beautiful. I thought the size was above average, and did not seem small at all. The room was well decorated, and continued the theming from the lobby and the rest of the hotel. Our housekeeper was also very friendly. Every morning she said hello to us, and on our last day she said goodbye and told us that she hoped to see us again really soon. It seemed sincere and it left a good parting impression on us. The food at the hotel is very good. We ate at Boma one morning for breakfast and it was excellent. The guick service eatery Mara is also very good, we ate there several times. I cannot comment on the dinner buffet at Boma because it was booked solid with reservations when we tried to eat there one night. I want to add that the location of the hotel is not bad at all. Indeed, it is located at the far southwest side of Disney property, but it was not a problem at all. We never waited longer than ten minutes for any bus to arrive, and the farthest ride was to Magic Kingdom, which took 10-15 minutes tops. Honestly, the location is fine, so if anyone is hesitant about staying there for that one reason, DON'T BE!!! The Animal Kingdom Lodge is far too beautiful and wonderful of a resort to pass up because of its location. All in all, I had a wonderful time staying at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. The grounds are beautiful and the staff really does a great job at taking care of you. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: daisysgrandma
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on Trip Advisor before we went and hoped we would be as delighted with this hotel. WE WERE. We arrived quite late and the first night on our balcony we could see the giraffes, zebras and birds. Wonderful. It isn't the cheapest (nor the most expensive) hotel on Disney but we loved it. Our only complaint is that we wished we had longer than the 5 nights so that we could have stayed in the hotel a bit more! The Disney dining plan was absolutely superb. We met someone who said he would 'be glad to get home 'from chicken and burgers'. Well this wasn't our experience. We used our vouchers for breakfast, and meals at some of the top restaurants and didn't have a complaint at all. The snacks were excellent for bowls of fruit or fresh orance juice. We thoroughly enjoyed Donald's Safari breakfast (who wouldn't with a 5 year old?), dinner at the Coral Reef restaurant (Epcot) and a fabulous meal at Jiko in our hotel. Yes we did trade 2 table service vouchers but it was worth it. I can only hope that anyone who goes has such an enjoyable time as we did. Please look out (from the Arusha Savannah) for the large animal (I think an Anikole Cattle) who has his head on one side. We wondered if he had one horn heavier or shorter than the other but no, he had an ear infection. However, our 5 year old decided he had WONKY HONKERS. Also the same 5 year old thought Pluto remembered her from Disnelyland Paris. Absolute magic moments and worth every penny

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Experience”
Reviews.Author: stagejunkie782
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of staying at nice hotels, but I am not a big fan of paying as much as we did for the Animal Kingdom Lodge - that being said, it was totally worth every penny! We had planned to stay one night, just for the experience, and once we were there we changed our reservation to stay for an extra night. Giraffe's are my favorite animal so walking out onto my balcony to see a giraffe walking around was pretty incredible. The rooms were so beautiful. They were decorated so nicely, with so many great details. Our curtains even had African animals and characters from the Lion King hidden in the design. The hotel itself is also incredible. The lobby is huge and you feel like you've walked into another world. The two restaurants on property are both great - We only went to Boma (which I loved!!) and apparently Jiko is even better. Although it's an expensive stay, it was definitely worth the experience! The only bad thing I can say is that it was a bit farther away from the Downtown Disney side of the property - so plan for a longer bus ride when going that way.

Reviews.Title: “A great theme, but too many drums.”
Reviews.Author: fquinter
Reviews.Content: My family of four, 38, 37, 12, and 8 stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge for five nights. This lodge is a nice property, but our stay wasn't without some bumps. We arrived via Magic Express late on Wednesday evening. Upon approaching the Disney transports at the airport we were directed to go to "that" bus. I allowed my family to precede me on to the bus, handed my paperwork to be scanned by the cast member and she said, "your on the wrong bus." I stepped up the three stairs and called the family off. In the mean time, the cast member walked away to see where I needed to be only to step back to us and let us know it was okay to board after all. The driver had four stops total. The Animal Kingdom was last. He said it would take 35 minutes. We arrived 50 minutes later. My kids were wowed upon entering the lodge. We arrived about 10:00 PM. We chose to bring carry on baggage with change of cloths, etc. since we didn't know how long it would take for our bags to arrive. There was no one in front of me at check in, and "Kat" was very gracious in welcoming us to the lodge. We had our difficulties thanks to a computer glitch. It was a long enough process for my wife and two kids to walk in the lobby and snap photos, go to the restroom, and walk in the lodge's shops. They came back to find me studying my materials about the dining plan and park hours for our days in the park. Kat had disappeared behind the door behind the check out. She had been gone for no less than 15 minutes trying to fix the problem. When my wife asked what was wrong I told her it was computer related. Apparently the computer was having problems making my wife and my room cards table to be used as charge cards. I asked another cast member to get Kat and she informed me of the problem was not fixed, but my kid’s keys would open the room door. Off they went to drop the baggage. My family returned to find me in the same spot. The cast members at this property work hard and with sincerity. I do believe it was a computer glitch, but it was making for a very long check in process with the four of us very hungry and tired. My son informed me our view was of another buildings roof. I asked for a Magical Upgrade and Kat told me to check back in the morning about 9. Finally the glitch was fixed about 10:45. We hurried to the fast food court anticipating it closing at eleven. Mara is open till 11:30. We made it to our room right at 11 PM. Our luggage had not arrived. I called down to the bellman and learned that they "say" to allow 3 hours for the bags to appear. My daughter wears contact lenses and we didn't think about bringing additional cleaning supplies in our carry on bag for her lenses, so she and I head down to the shop. It was about 11:05 and the store closed at 11. I called down at 11:30 and our bags were there. They soon appeared. The following morning everything got better. I asked for the magical upgrade and was granted a beautiful pool room view from the fourth floor. The first room we were in had five drawers available to us in two different chests. The new room only had two drawers as part of a TV Armoire. This property looks just like the Wilderness Lodge. We stayed at the WL over Thanksgiving and when we walked in to the beautiful Animal Kingdom's lobby, we both agreed it was the same dimensions. The rooms are also the same as the Wilderness lodge. The beds are very comfortable. The linens and cleanliness of the room were all at Disney standards. The room could be larger for the four of us and all the "magical stuff" we accumulated over 4 days. We loved the pool. It has a zero entry and is positioned to receive most of the day’s sun. The water was warm and the depth was comfortable for most children. The slide was delightful as well. The food at Mara was good enough. The selection is great for a child’s appetite and there is a person taking orders to improve the congestion and ordering process. My son and I did spend time in the arcade. I would guess there was close to 30 games. You could find both new and a few older ones for the mature crowd. Take a credit card or cash to play. There is a game card dispensing machine you need to purchase to play. Some members of Trip Advisor have mentioned the Disney property buses are too slow but we would not consider the time waiting, nor the time getting to parks, to be any longer than any other property. The negatives about my stay in the Animal Kingdom Lodge are few. On our last day we went to the parks, came back in the afternoon to swim and our room had not been clean by 4 PM. While getting ready to go back to the parks for the evening, two cast members knocked and when seeing us there asked if we would like to have housekeeping. I said yes. They said they would come back after 4:30. We came back to our room at 10 PM and the room was still untouched. I called down for clean towels and they brought them in minutes. The other thing was part of the theme of the lodge. As impressive as the details to the lodge are, the drumming music that plays nonstop from any speaker in the lodge or restaurants got real old. I wanted to hear a little different magical music by the end of our stay. My family and I agree after our departure we won’t stay here again. It was nice enough but not as great of a deluxe property as we anticipated. We are huge Disney fans, but this lodge was simply not a good fit.

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe Disney...Plus Animals!”
Reviews.Author: Hosalito
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the AKL this past weekend. Here are some observations that may be of use to you. 1) The lodge is located near (surprise!) Animal Kingdom. With that said, the bus rides to other parks/Downtown Disney do take longer than they would from other resorts, but never more than 20 minutes. The lobby is amazing with all of the African theming and the wood, but with that said, it as well as the interior corridors were also very dark, so if anyone in your party has vision issues, you may want to stay somewhere else. 2) We had a savannah view room with 1 queen bed (slept 2 adults just fine) and bunk beds. The room size, in all honesty, was not much different than the rooms at the moderately or value priced hotels. The part of the bathroom where the sinks are was spacious, but the actual area where the toity/shower are located was a TIGHT SQUEEZE and rather dark. Somewhat surprising for a deluxe Disney hotel. Also in the room was a desk, chair, a small balcony with two chairs and a tiny table, chest of drawers (under the flat panel TV), a converter so all you'd have to do is bring your gaming system, a wire (in the closet) for high speed internet access ($10/day), a refrigerator, an iron and ironing board, and a hair dryer. 3) I would try to book a savannah view room if possible. Yes, there are plenty of places to view the animals from other spots within the hotel, but waking up and throwing open your balcony door to find some giraffes grazing right outside was REALLY AWESOME. 4) We've eaten at Jiko many times and this time was no exception. Really great wine selection, service, and food. Ask for their separate vegetarian menu if you don't eat meat - they have some great offerings. I believe the room service is also provided from Jiko's kitchen so that is a huge plus! 5) We also had some drinks at the bar that is located on the 2nd floor, and they were reasonably priced and good. The bar doesn't stay open very late; it closes at midnight. So if you want late night drinks, I would suggest buying something at the store inside of the hotel and then keeping it in your refrigerator in the room. 6) It was our first time trying out Boma, and we only went there for the breakfast buffet ($16.99). The food and service were good, but there was not a whole lot for vegetarians or healthy eaters. I know this IS Disney and hey, you ARE ON VACATION but some of us don't like to indulge at every meal, especially at breakfast. 7) We also ate at Mara, the counter-service operation. Food from there was good as well, and it was never 'crazy busy' when we went. 8) This hotel has one of the best gift shops of any Disney resort in my opinion. It is huge and offers it all (all sorts of toiletries, booze, drinks, snacks, along with a plethora of the usual Disney souvenirs). 9) My only gripe was the amount of time it took to get our tickets, that we had purchased online, turned into real tickets at the Front Desk (if you are a Florida resident, you must purchase the tickets online if you want to obtain the discount - they will not offer it at the hotels/parks). We waited so long that they finally gave us a credit on our room, which was much appreciated, but the time was still lost. 10) Valet is not really that expensive at $10/day. I've seen worse! But the self-parking was not that far from the entrance so that would be "doable" on a non-rainy day. 11) We walked to Kidani Village which was pleasant. Kidani is definitely BRAND SPANKING NEW and their restaurant, Sanaa, has a great menu and looks out over the savannah. We did not eat there however. 12) Room was spotless during our entire stay. Cannot fault the maid service at all. 13) Noise level was not that bad. We could hear the people above us in the bathroom, however, which was a bit annoying at times. And you cannot escape the noise of those powerful Disney toity flushes! 14) The pool area looked amazing, although we did not go in. Nice slide for the kiddies and a couple of spa areas for the parents. Plenty of life guards on duty. We stayed here using a 40% off coupon that we had received from Disney. Had we had to pay full price, I am not sure I would have felt like I had gotten my money's worth (due to the room size and lack of soundproofing). But overall this is a beautiful hotel and I would most definitely return....if we get another coupon.... : )

Reviews.Title: “WOW - Resort in the Savannah”
Reviews.Author: southerncanuk
Reviews.Content: Whether you are an adult or a small child, the DAKL with impress you with its African themed resort. The architecture, artwork, artifacts and savannah areas will provide memories for years to come. A truly inspirational, creative, and beautiful resort by Disney. Even if you do not have a "Savannah View" room, there are many places to view the Savanah outside of your room. I look forward to returning to this magical resort in the near future

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cparker94
Reviews.Content: My husband daughter and i stayed at the animal kingdom. This was our first trip ever to disney. The second we drove up to our hotel it was beautiful the landscaping was nice the building was beautiful the staff were wonderful when we walked into our room we were amazed of how beautiful it was the bathrooms were extra clean and that's a must for me when im staying anywhere the beds were so comfortable we had a great nights rest, this hotel exceeded our expectations. we highly recommend this this place we'll be back there next year i can't imagine staying anywhere else. Im not trying to be mean but i wouldn't listen to any of these negative commments i would go and check it out for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Maceydog
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, with that magical appeal, very comfortable, clean, and excellent service, this is the 3rd resort we've stayed at in Disney and every time it gets better, you can't beat it ! The animals in the savannah are fantastic and every detail of the hotel has been thought out to maximise the experience, you really get lost in the African feel of the place. I can't think of anything negative to say about this holiday it's a must to try you won't be disappointed !

Reviews.Title: “Absoultely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: chicaNorwich
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a family holiday at this amazing hotel, my family consisted of myself, my partner and our 2 children (14 years & 12 years). On arrival the hotel is beautiful all done out in African style decor & African music is playing. The service was superb and the cast members were all exceptionally friendly.......not in your face or over the top....just right and always on hand to help whatever time of day or night. The room was a savannah view room, which meant that we looked onto the animals, which was fantastic as my children were never more than a couple of feet away from the African animals. The room was 2 queen sized beds and this was not a problem...even though the children had to share. Bathroom was big enough for us four and it had all the facilities in the room....the room was cleaned every other day. The location was just right & with the complmentary shuttle buses running every 10 mins or so this was excellent and took us to every Disney park and resort. This was ideal as meant we didn't have to drive and pay for car park entrance at the parks. Amentites were excellent as well.... far too many to mention....pool was always clean and life guards on duty until late in the evening.....never overcrowded and towels were provided free of charge. There was also a night vision session every night to view the animals which was superb. Food was out of this world a massive variety of differnet things to try & still the usual items you would expect on holiday....also fantastic if on the Disney Dining plan, which helps to keep the cost of the holiday down. I read the reviews on this before I went and was a little bit apprehensive about it, but I am not sure where these people stayed but clearly not here. I can not find one fault with this hotel so much so that we are planning on going back in about 18 months time. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of going to Disney either for the first time or going back.

Reviews.Title: “OK...And Not For Those With Allergies”
Reviews.Author: Kupojo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Aug 28 -31. Since we were traveling with extended family, we booked 2 rooms - 1 Savannah view & 1 standard view. We arrived late AM and were not able to check in early. They sent a text message when our rooms were ready around 3:30. Our request for rooms to be near each other was accommodated. After reading so many terrific reviews, I was disappointed with the condition of the rooms. In the Savannah room, the refrigerator had used food left in it & undergarments were left in the drawer. Yuk! The bathroom tub was dirty and there was hair all over the blanket on one of the beds. The standard room had dust fly out of the coverlet on the bed. When my 4 year old starting sneezing the next day, I wasn't sure if it was a cold or allergies to the animals & dust in the room. By evening, he was very congested. He continued coughing, sneezing & eye rubbing throughout our stay. His symptoms improved after we left As far as the rest of the hotel goes, it's somewhat dark in the halls & rooms. The lobby & grounds are very nice. It was exciting to see animals off our balcony. We loved the pool. The food at the Mara was very good & convenient. We had a car, so the location was not an issue. Btw, the rooms only have 2 drawers to place your clothes. Allergies to animals are not the fault of the lodge - I wish I would have thought about it more before I booked here. I realize there are many people staying at the lodge, and sometimes the staff can be rushed to get rooms ready, but for the price you pay here, there is no excuse for the poorly cleaned condition of the rooms. Maybe they need more housekeeping staff. Unfortunately, the room condition changed my overall opinion of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Disney resort”
Reviews.Author: pvavarou
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 5 year old son stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge last week. It jwas our very first trip to Disney, and we were not disappointed. It was a very nice resort. The lobby and grounds are beautiful and the rooms are fine. The bathroom area is large and roomy while the sleeping area is a bit small, but this was not a problem for us. We had no issues with housekeeping. Our room was cleaned well every day and on a few occasions when we requested extra items like bedrails and hangers they were brought up immediately. Staff overall was very accommodating. The best part of this resort is, of course, seeing the animals from the privacy of your own balcony. Prior to our visit, I had requested an Arusha savannah view on the 3rd floor. When we arrived, we got an Uzima savannah room (3510). I loved the location of this room since it was in the middle of the zebra trail and close to everything, however we rarely saw any animals in this savannah. I requested a room change and mid-week we were moved to the room directly opposite (3503) with a view of the Arusha savannah. This room was fabulous - we saw a wide variety of animals all day and it was again in the middle of the zebra trail so not a far walk from the lobby. I also liked being on the 3rd floor as it is the same floor where the lobby is located, plus it is at a good level for viewing the animals. This room also adjoined to another room, which is nice for large families that want to be next door to one another. The adjoining door area gave us a bit more space too, which was nice since the room is a bit on the small side. My son absolutely loved the pool. We couldn't get him out of it! The zero depth entry is nice for little ones, and the slide is great as well. He could go down it all by himself. The entire pool, except for a very small area in one corner, is pretty shallow, so it is ideal for preschoolers and grade schoolers. Teens and adults might find it a bit boring but we thought it was nice. We also went to both water parks and while our son had fun there, he preferred the resort's pool. The food at the resort was just ok. The food at Mara - the quick service restaurant - was pretty mediocre. We had the same Mickey waffles and scrambled eggs every day. There is not much variety and the food was bland. Boma was good but not great. Nice variety and flavors. Jiko was also good, but very expensive. I had the filet, my husband had the pork loin and our son had cheese pizza and the bill was $150. Again, a good meal but nothing outstanding and for the price I would have expected more. Our best meals of the week were at Artist Point at the Wildnerness Lodge and Ohana at the Polynesian resort. The food at Artist Point was fabulous and Ohana is a fixed menu restaurant where they bring the food to your table and it never stopped coming. The food was absolutely delicious and we didn't pay more than $70. We also ate at Chef Mickeys and the California Grill. Chef Mickeys is great for the kids so they can meet all the Disney characters, but the food is not very good at all. The California Grill was good but very expensive. We ate there late one night so we could see the fireworks from Magic Kingdom on their 15th floor observation deck. I feel that we paid for the atmosphere and view more than the food. We did enjoy watching the fireworks from the observation deck though. We were a little worried about booking this resort because of its far location from Magic Kingdom, but honestly we didn't have any transportation issues at all. Expect for on one occasion, the buses came frequently (every 5-10 minutes). We took the buses to Epcot, Magic Kingdom, Blizzard Beach and Typhoon Lagoon. The two days we went to MK and came home after the fireworks, we did have to stand up in the bus but that was to be expected. The buses came frequently and we were not waiting long at all. I was pleasantly surprised. So I don't think this resort's location is an issue. Transportation is quick and very well organized. We enjoyed our first trip to Disney very much, and this resort had a lot to do with it. We'll stay here again, though we might choose a different resort next time just so we can experience something different. Overall, I would highly recommend it for families.

Reviews.Title: “Just as Advertised....All Good”
Reviews.Author: MikeandCarmelyn
Reviews.Content: Very clean and unique hotel. Try (more $$$) to stay in a room with a Savanah view (can see wildlife 24/7). The pool is perfect for children. It's a little pricey but perfect for those that want something different and still has a fun feel for the kids. I would say it's also good for couples without children.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Thats all I can say”
Reviews.Author: TheBavers
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel from 11th August 2009 untill 25th August 2009. This is the second time we have been to Orlando and the first time that we have stayed in one of the Disney resort hotels. We booked our holiday through First choice and ended up paying £4200 for the two of us. This included premium seating on the plane, 2 week ultimate park tickets and the Disney dinning plan. The flight was 9 hours long from East Midlands Airport and we would recommend the premium seating on the plane with First Choice/Thomson. I am 6 foot 1inch tall and I had pleanty of leg room and the 4 course meal was excellent and there was lots of leg room and a free bar,. We arrived at the Hotel at Midnight and after traveling for 9 hours we were just about ready to collaps as we were that tired. As we checked in the staff were very friendly. Back when we were booking the holiday in 2008 were couldn't decided if to book the Savana view room for an extra £600. I didn't in the end but as we arrived at the check in and looked at the amazing lobby a suddenly decided that I wanted a savana view room. As we checked in I asked the recepionist how much it would cost to upgrade to a Savana view room. She said we had a savana view room. I couldn't belive it and was glad we didn't pay the extra £600. We went up to our room and dumped the bags. The room was large, light and bright. There was bottled water in the fridge (tap water was not very nice as I found out) ready for us and a safe in the room. The bed was a kingsize bed and was very, very large. The view from the balcony was amazing. We had giraffe, buffalo and many other animals out side the window. During the trip all the staff were very friendly and helpfull. We had the Disney dinning plan and this saved us about £25 a day in food. It cost £50 a day for the two of us. This included a quick service meal (burger and chips, dessert and a drink), a snack (ice cream) and a table service meal (sit down meal, main course, dessert and a drink). We added the cost most days and it was about £75 a day. It was expensie to eat at Disney and we could have eaten cheaper out of disney. Some of the better Disney restaurants required 2 table service meals. This did limit you to eat at Disney Restaurants. One evening we ventured out of Disney and went to Ponderosa steak house (steak and all you can eat buffet was £6) this was excellent. The only problem was you have to tip everyone and we estimated that we spent £12-£15 a day in tips on the meals alone. Another tip if you eat in Disney, is book the restaurants in the UK before you go. We had problems booking into as they were all fully booked. You can book them online up to 180 days before you go. There was about 8 restaurants that we wanted to eat in but were all fully booked. Also you can buy a refillable mug for $12.99 (£8) at the hotel and you can refill this as many times as you want during your trip at the disney resort hotels.
