Sure, I wish the time between the lodge and the parks was shorter, but it was never that big a deal. Cons: The cable TV was pretty basic. They have HD sets and HD channels, but if you take out the various Disney channels, the sports channels, the news channels and the religious channels, all you have are the networks. The soundproofing is terrible. You can hear the people in the rooms next to you urinating in their bathrooms. Gross! And the frequently unhappy small child in the room next door might as well have been having her tantrums while sitting in our laps, it was so loud. Our bags took over 5 hours to get to our room from the Magical Express. It says 3 hours on their literature. You have to walk right past the smoking area to get to and from the bus stop. It was not a good location for this area as the clouds of smoke were frequently overwhelming as you walked by.

Reviews.Title: “A room built for a mouse!!!”
Reviews.Author: Abaxter007
Reviews.Content: First let me start by saying that Popeye2625's review pretty much sums up how we felt about this establishment. I just wanted to add two small caveats. First, if you went to Disney when you were small and had great memories and think that you can relive those fantasies as an adult with your own child and reluctant husband beware if you decide to do it at this resort. This place is way over priced. If you do not mind spending $300 plus dollars to stay at a Days Inn collocated on a zoo then the AKL is for you. The lobby is truly amazing but that only lasts 1 day before you say...there goes that nice lobby but the room sucks. Maybe I should have had my family sleep in the lobby. The rooms are very very small. Internet is not free. Towels are small. It is like it was built for a little mouse. Hmmmm!!!!!!! Second, they snare you with the savannah room as opposed to the ones facing the parking lot. It’s like a spouse saying "you do not want to spend two pay checks on a Jlo diamond wedding ring. Are you too cheap for your family"? Don't fall for it. The savannah view is a BFR (Big Fat Rip Off). You see the same old zoo animals again and again. Why? Because, in order for them to eat they have to parade their happy butts outside your window to pick up the food. They are NOT running around in nature. This is not a wild kingdom voyeur site. It is a zoo!!!!! You will see the same big horned ox shaking his head back and forth. Save up your cash, learn another language and go to Africa. If the motherland is not in your near future, you could instead stay at a hotel closer to the action and do a day trip to the AKL and see the same animals that the $300 guys are seeing but closer. The animals do not come up to your window. There are metal devices that protrude towards the animals so they can not roam freely. Also if you decide to ignore my warning, watch out for the lip of the balcony sliding door in your room. Definite trip hazard. We had to lay a towel down on top of it so my daughter would not crack her skull. I will end on a good note. The bathroom had really cool African wall paper. Truly Magical!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun for all ages!”
Reviews.Author: JMLECMom
Reviews.Content: We loved the AK Lodge! Very convenient to travel to the Disney parks via bus--makes it nice with young children. We would open up our blinds each morning and be within 50 feet of gorgeous giraffes enjoying the morning sun. Rooms are small, but that is to be expected at the Disney theme resorts. We loved our stay at the AKL!

Reviews.Title: “Not so great for Kids under 12....”
Reviews.Author: mommaof3Oklahoma
Reviews.Content: While our visit at AKL was nice there were many downfalls... Transporation to the parks was awful!! It took an eternity to get anywhere. I would reccomend staying somewhere a little more centrally located. Hotel staff was not accomodating at all. Lodge was nice if you were going to sit in your room and WAIT for the 2 or 3 times the animals would come to the savannah each day but overall, very disappointing for myself and my 3 kids. Food was not kid friendly unless you eat at The Mara and after 3 meals a day that gets pretty old. Not much selection for food in this lodge. I suppose if you were only going to stay at the lodge and not visit any of the parks it would be worth the money but for our family it was a HUGE disappointment. I would recommend staying at one of the more kid friendly resorts if you are traveling with children under the age of 12.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: gone_again18
Reviews.Content: The staff at AKL were awesome, from arrival to check out. We had a rental car and paid for and used the valet service - soooo worth while. $10.00 per day plus tips. The consierge staff were very accomodating - we asked for a can opener and also a cork screw - they were in our room when we returned later in the day. They changed dinner reservations for us. They phoned a restaurant for us to find out what they had going for New Year's Eve and left us a message in our room, as we were on our way out to meet family and couldn't wait. They deleted a tip that I had added to a lunch bill (I didn't know that the tip had already been included). The housekeeping staff left plenty of towels. Every day they gave us shampoo, conditioner and soap. We didn't have a savannah room, but we saw animals everyday from our room. There are viewing areas around the hotel, but we didn't have to go to them as we saw animals daily. I went to the bar 1 evening and requested an empty wine glass, and tom collins glass to take back to our room, not a problem. There didn't seem to be as many small children at this resort. The rest of our family were staying at the Polyenisian Resort. (10 of them). Hubby and I don't have kids, so the travel agent suggested AKL for us. Keep in mind that it is the furthest away from the Magic Kingdom. We ate dinner at Boma the first night. Excellent. African buffet. Would highly recommend it. (My parents have travelled to Africa, they came over to Boma themselves 1 evening and said it was what they remembered from Aftrica. We got breakfast from Mara 1 morning, otherwise we ate our breakfast's elsewhere (just out of convience). The decor of the hotel again was African. Amazing decorations, pictures, the music, carpeting... right down to the bedspreads, and vent covers in the hall ways. The staff dressed in African costume as well. All staff (valet, consierge, housekeepers, and the animal keepers, bartenders etc...) Lovely. All staff were helpful, polite and friendly. Can't say enought about any of the Disney staff. All wonderful. I am going to write a review on Walt Disney Workd itself - as I can't say enough about it. I only have 1 negative thing to say, and it's about the dining time. If you want a relaxed sit down and enjoy meal (1 1/2 to 2 hours in length) you've got to book signature dining that's the 3 $$$'s. Otherwise, it's all about turning the tables and you're in and out in no time. If you're with kids I guess that's expected. I myself would go back to the AKL. But then again there are so many hotels, I might try the Disney Dolphin Hotel. It was beautiful. Hope this review is helpful to those of you planning a disney vacation. As they say in Disney World "Have a Magical Day"

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and overrated”
Reviews.Author: popeye2625
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge in December 2008 for our family vacation. We were extremely excited for the trip as it was our first to Disney in seven years -- and because of the promotional videos and pictures we saw about the Animal Kingdom Lodge. While the hotel is gorgeous, it was not worth the price or the hype. A striking lobby means nothing when you wait in line for 30-45 minutes for a concierge, have a room with two drawers for a family of four, and towels that would barely wrap around a 6-year-old, let alone a normal-sized adult. We found most of the staff to be "in training." I needed tickets that I had pre-purchased for Mickey's Very Merry Christmas Party, and was directed by Disney to simply visit our hotel concierge, who could print out the tickets for us. The concierge at AKL took 20 minutes with me, continually asking me to be patient as he was trying to figure it out, and I walked away WITHOUT TICKETS. He couldn't figure it out and didn't have anyone to help him. When I went back to get the tickets later, I waited in line for 45 minutes before I found a capable concierge to execute the task. If I'm paying more than $200 a night for a hotel, I'm expecting more than two drawers in my hotel room. Is that crazy? As a result of the scant storage room for clothes in the room, our room was cluttered and messy for the duration of the trip as we lived out of suitcases on suitcase stands in our rooms. The other big issue that I had with AKL was the bus system. While it's awesome that there are dedicated buses for AKL that preclude you from stopping at other hotels for pickup, the buses came every 15-20 minutes, and there was no system for bus boarding. While I appreciate Disney betting that the everyday human will be in good spirits on his/her vacation and therefore not have the nerve to board a bus before a load of people who waited the entire 15-minute duration, they underestimate the gall of many, many a guest. I cannot tell you how many times we'd get to the bus stop and be the first to wait for a bus, only to watch someone stroll up right as the bus arrived and right in front of us as we loaded our small children. Disney is asking for Tyson-like fights to erupt with this "every Mouse for himself" system. Everyone channels their inner Grumpy as they board (and often, stand on a moving bus for the 15 minute ride to the parks). AKL is an investment. And when you make an investment in a nice hotel, you expect a return. AKL was a losing investment for us. Check out Port Orleans, Key West, Saratoga or any of the economy resorts. There ALWAYS seemed to be buses for them waiting outside the parks! You'll save in frustration and in the wallet.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Knoxvoltn
Reviews.Content: My wife (who was my girlfriend at the time) and I stayed here during October 2006 for four nights. We had a very good time. I loved the room. It was very, very quiet. Also, it was clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly (as about 99% of Disney "cast members" are very friendly). The hotel had a very nice fitness center, but it opened too late for me to use it (it opens at 9:00 AM, I think, and we prefer to get to the park early and stay until late evening). The pool was beautiful and clean. The hotel has some live animals on its property, so you can walk outside and see giraffes and a few other animals. If you're like us, when you visit Disney World, you don't stay in your hotel room very long (basically just to sleep and get ready to go out). You might consider staying at a moderate or value resort. I don't know if I would stay here again due to the price, but it is a very, very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and overrated”
Reviews.Author: caitlinsdad35
Reviews.Content: This was our third time to Florida, so as a treat we decided to spend 7 nights of our 2 week vacation in Animal Kingdom Lodge. I have never been so disappointed in my life. There is only 1 smoking area in the hotel, (the room they offered us was miles away). The rooms are tiny . I was constantly banging my knees and bumping into things. The whole hotel is dark and dingy (i know this is the theme and for the animals benefit, but it still makes you depressed). All kids activities cost extra, and i mean everything!!! The car park is a hell of a trek from the lobby. Check in/out takes a lifetime. My advice is unless money is no object do not bother with this hotel. This place is way overpriced!! Stay in the Hard Rock Hotel at Universal instead!!! That hotel is how a 5 star hotel should be. And you get to fast pass all the rides with your room key.

Reviews.Title: “Great atomosphere with ok sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mich_AuburnHills
Reviews.Content: OK, this may stray from the average experience at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. I agree that this is a fantastic atmosphere with wonderful amenities including a wonderful pool area and great views of animals everywhere. The views from the balcony were also nice with animals galore. The lobby is and inside hotel is breathtaking and relaxing. That said, I would give high points for all of this. The room however would rate much lower. Now I give high points for the style of the room. It is nice and the beds are comfortable. However, for the price, the rooms are quite small. I have stayed in hotels with a full living room and kitchen for half the price. I know that the atmosphere and animals make it worth the price for many, but the room was just average for this price. Overall the Animal Kingdom lodge is a winner and one -of -a kind and visitors will enjoy the uniqueness of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed on Disney Property before - didn't fail”
Reviews.Author: hurley22
Reviews.Content: As someone who has stayed at Disney's Moderate and Deluxe resorts (Polynesian twice and the Port Orleans French Quarter), we were very very pleased with the Animal Kingdom Lodge. We had actually booked 2 rooms for 6 adults the the Caribbean Beach resort, but they had overbooked the Value resorts so we got bumped to the Animal Kingdom lodge, while the other Value guests were bumped to the Caribbean Resort. Not only that but when we checked in we weren't exactly ecstatic about the view of the parking lot so they bumped us up to a Savannah View room on Kudu Trail. It was quite the hike to our room, but really is absolutely NO different than staying at any of the Deluxe Resorts. At least at this resort you are attached inside. Also, our room faced the construction that is going on where they are building the Villas, and honestly IT DID NOT BOTHER US AT ALL. And it certainly did not bother the animals, there was always a giraffe or Zebra hanging out right in front of the balcony. People complaining that the rooms and resort are dark may not be aware that this is actually done on purpose for the animals for their benefit and ours! It also so we can see the nocturnal animals who come out night. The resort also has night vision so you can see them around the resort! After hearing complaints about the bus service here, I didn't find that we waited longer than at any other resort. The most we waited was 20 minutes and this was near the end of the night when they weren't running as frequently. The housekeeping was the only small complaint. And I mean small. It wasn't as thorough as at the Polynesian, but the beds were made and everything was replenished. Mara, the quick service restaurant was wonderful for a quick bite with Burgers, Chicken Tenders, Wraps, Sandwiches, Roast Chicken and African Stew. We used the Dining Plan which I strongly recommend, it is a great deal and saves the hassle of worrying about food all the time. The staff is really friendly! The lady who works at the bar near the pool is awesome, she remembered all our names every day. It was just that little extra Disney attitude that really makes the trip amazing. I witnessed some picky and rude customers complaining to the concierge one morning and I can't believe how well they handled them, honestly I would not have been so pleasant... Advice: ~ Request any of the rooms on Giraffe or Kudu Trail, each side faces a Savannah. We looked the opposite direction of the main inner Savannah and had more animals than the main one almost all of the time ~We found that it wasn't really necessary to reserve breakfast at Boma as long as you were there before 8:00. The buffet at breakfast is amazing. ~EAT AT JIKO. We ate at Narcoosees, California Grill, Ohana's and The Brown Derby and this restaurant had the best atmosphere and menu. Not to mention our server was above and beyond with the wine list knowledge. This will most likely require reservations in advance. ~We recommend making your room requests when you book your trip but then call again a few days before you arrive. They will usually know when you are gonna be and then they can perhaps make adjustments before you get there. ~Just ask. They will go out of their way to assist you. We were a forgetful bunch and lost jewelry, a wallet, Key card and sunglasses and all were either returned to us or are being shipped home free of charge. This is a wonderful resort to stay at, it is such a quiet, cozy place to come home to after a long noisy day at the park.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful View”
Reviews.Author: Colleen S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights last weekend. The hotel was decorated very nicely for Christmas. I had a wonderful experience with all of the staff. Everyone was very friendly and more than happy to help us with anything we needed. We had a great view from our balcony and saw many giraffes, zebras, the watusi cattle, and deer. The most wonderful experience was when we came back to our room to get ready for dinner, there was a giraffe laying directly in front of our room. It was the first thing we saw when we opened the door to our room. Amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected...But Rent A Car!!!”
Reviews.Author: DisFanNYC
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 night stay at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge 12/13-12/16/08. I was nervous after reading these reviews but wanted to share with you my experience. STAFF - the staff was much nicer to us than these reviews let on. We were checked in by Carlos after arriving early (12:30pm) and he not only got us into a room right away, but he had upgraded us to a Sunset Savannah room (one of the 3280s). We had gotten an amazing rate as a Disney Passholder (159 per night). The room was GREAT (not small like everyone states on here). We had an amazing view of giraffes, zebra, antelope, ostrich, and other animals on the "Sunset Savannah". There was construction going on across the way but it didn't bother us. We did not eat in the hotel restaurants...Jiko was too pricey and Boma had disappointed me once previously. We did eat at the counter service MARA and that was fine. Pool and whirlpools were amazing, as were the "night vision" goggles to watch to animals at night! One thing the reviews have pegged right, the Disney Bus transportation was AWFUL. This lodge is very far out and it often seemed like we were the lone waiters as scores of buses for the cheaper hotels passed by us. One driver even got lost on our way home from Magic Kingdom, and we were halfway up 192 at 11pm at night before he realized it. I definitely would NOT recommend staying here WITHOUT renting a car. Otherwise it was great...lobby was beautiful with Christmas decorations. I do wish they had food options available after midnight. Overall: It was better than I expected but I am not sure I would stay here again. It's priced as a deluxe hotel but really doesn't pull off the right level service to deserve that category. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great 60th Birthday!”
Reviews.Author: teacher34
Reviews.Content: We stayed at DAKL last month to celebrate my 60th. We had gone to Disney for my 50th and had such a great time I wanted to do it again. We flew in from Seattle, so this is a long jount! We purchased a package from Walt Disney Vacations. Everything was absolutely excellent; from the Disney Shuttle picking us up at the airport to the arrival desk at the hotel. The hotel is beautiful The lobby is lovely with all the African artifacts, the beautiful seating areas,etc. I was expecting our room to be very small after reading some reviews, however, we did not feel as if were that small and there were four of us. The bathroom area-toilet and tub were small, but since the sink vanity area is outside the bathroom it was great! Every morning we opened our window and saw many animals. The Savannah view is a must! We ate at both restuarants on the property and they both had very good food. We took the Disney meal plan on this trip and that was especially great! We loved this trip. With a Disney package you even have your luggage tags, and boarding passes at your door the evening before you leave. There were no hassles on this trip what so ever! A great trip, and a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge - A dream come true.”
Reviews.Author: Tayze
Reviews.Content: Stayed as AKL Concierge Level for the last four days of our trip to Orlando, and had a magical experience. CONCIERGE LEVEL - the food and drink at the concierge lobby was outstanding. Delighted to have quinoa as a breakfast option along with other warm and cold cereals and baking. The afternoon offerings were a bit sparse but breakfast and evening hor d'overes were excellent. Loved having the espresso maker. The staff at concierge level were incredibly helpful and knowledgable. They were also friendly and professional, contrary to many reviews I have read. I would encourage any who stay at concierge level to take advantage of the Sunrise Safari. It was one of the trip higlights. The cast share so much information and lots of time to observe all of the many animals - just wonderful. ROOM - we stayed in RM 4503, on the Zebra Trail. It was a bit of a walk but nothing compared to other Disney resorts we have stayed at. The room itself accomodated three adult women with all of our luggage and shopping, with ample room. Wehad a lovely savannah view and observed many animals over the course of our stay, particularly in the morning. The room itself was kept very clean and staff left us towel animals which was good fun and a nice added touch. Turn down service and room ammenities also above par. HOTEL - loved the lobby and the amazing drumming we frequently heard. The theming is outstanding and many artifacts on display. Had supper at Boma which although good was not worth the price - wished we would have gone to Jiko instead. The pool area was great, with a huge pool, and excellent service from the pool side lounge. Loved the gift shop and the staff again professional and helpful. We had a car so only had to use Disney transit once but then had only a short wait. Overall, we found the venue to be well worth the cost and would recommend staying concierge level - ample enough food for breakfast and a light supper or evening snack. All the staff were courteous, professional and went above and beyond for us. And, the views of the animals on the savannah is truly magical.

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge-first time experience”
Reviews.Author: wilhelm7
Reviews.Content: It was our first family trip and the Animal Kingdom Lodge in our opinion was a great choice. If you are interested in the African theme, this is a great place to stay. It is unique and something you won't find anywhere in the US. Veiwing animals is okay, some zebra, watusi cows, maybe a gazelle or impala, possibly a giraffe or two in the distance. Pros: b/c it is farther away from Magic Kingdom it is not nearly as chaotic in the Lobby, and lounges etc. as Polynesian and the others. It was a welcomed break after a day of crowds. Incredible themed decor Many activities for children to do if you are not going to a park Nice pool view from the Zebra trail rooms, 4th floor. Great overlook areas, including public balconies with rocking chairs for a quiet and relaxing evening. They were never occupied whenever we used them. Good food at Boma, did not eat at Jiko. I'd save your money if you are dining with kids and choose Boma. $25 for some sweets, a few chicken nuggets, and one or two other items seems a bit much. Take a water taxi to the Grand Floridian or Polynesian instead for some variety, and a free boat ride the kids might enjoy. Cons: Rooms are small, I would guess they are 2-3 ft shorter in width than a typical Marriott room. Limited to the property for restaurant choices, but then again, if you are hitting the parks, that may not matter anyway. Shuttles needed, even to Animal Kingdom Park - (we never waited more than 10 minutes for a shuttle. $20 cab ride to the Grand Floridian) Other: If you want a Savannah room, know that the Lodge is not physically connected to Animal Kingdom Park. The Lodge has their own "savannah" with zebras, a few giraffes, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great but...............”
Reviews.Author: MaggieinSoNE
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 22 nov to 02 dec; smack in the midst of the Thanksgiving breaks. Hotel is very lovely and quite spectacular. It lives up to it's reputation for a fabulouls African theme with authenticity and ambience. Room was average (#1028) with pool view on the 1st floor down a quite hallway. While the room was small, it was not as small as I had expected. Reviewers saying the rooms were as small as those in Europe must have been in tiny-tiny rooms. I have been in rooms in the U.K. that are much smaller and higher priced for example. So yes, the room was a bit small but we had plenty of room for the 6yr old twins and all our bags. Housekeeping left a lot to be desired and we did tip $5 per day. On some days, we found the "mouse"keeper had not taken the tip and this was a bit odd. We had zero towel animals - VERY disappointing as my twins were hoping for some. With the abundance of kids stuff in the room and the neatly folded PJs on the bed, the staff had to know there were children in the room. Concierge and Check-In folks were not overly friendly or helpful. No one could tell us how to get to our room properly upon check-in and we wandered around for about 15 minutes until we found someone was able to help. Staff in the restaurants were wonderful and so were the staff in the gift shop. Staff in the Simba Club was AWESOME - we left the twins for 1 1/2 hours to have a relax & drink in the lovely lounge in the hotel. The kids wanted to stay longer!!! Restaurants Boma and Jiko were great - we ate breakfast everyday in Boma and the staff began to recognize us and chat and say good morning each day; some even stopped at our table to say hello & see how our trip was going. Food was good too. Mickey Waffles on request!! Jiko staff great and the food was wonderful but a bit overpriced for the taste. Filet was so-so but the mac-n-cheese was great! We would probably stay again as our twins loved the animals and the staff that told stories, did craft time and talked about the animals.

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge - Just Not Worth It”
Reviews.Author: anm123
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Disney World (first trip was 2006 to Grand Floridian ) Our daughters are 4 & 6. We booked a savannah view room w/ bunkbeds. I knew the hotel was out of the way, but my youngest daughter is obsessed with giraffes so we thought we'd stay at AK so she could wake up, look out the window and see giraffes. The rooms are very small compared to the GF. Although, the bunkbeds were a bit hit with the kids and they do have rails all the way around on the top bed. Housekeeping was a bit of a disappointment. After check-in we went to our room and found a pair of dirty mens underwear behind the bathroom door...how housekeeping could have missed it is beyond me. We were there for 5 days and not once did housekeeping make anything with the towels, even though we left generous tips each day. The view, the main reason we stayed here, was not worth the money. The first 24 hours all we saw were birds. We then saw some gazelles and random animals, but never saw a zebra and only saw 2 giraffes far off in the distance. The thought that you will open your curtains and see animals in close proximity is just not accurate, at least not in the 5 days we were there. We tried early morning, during the day, dusk, before bedtime. They were never that close. You see more animals at a much closer range on the safari at Animal Kindgom (a giraffe was licking a passenger in our jeep!), so just do that and skip the Animal Kingdom Lodge. As far as food - Jaiko is a great Disney restaurant - better than Citricos and Narcoosee at GF. Even if you don't stay at AK Lodge, I would recommend going to Jaiko for a meal. We did the breakfast buffet at Boma each morning and we were disappointed. Very expensive for what it was and much preferred eating breakfast at the Grand Floridan Cafe at GF. Last but not least bus service - yes it's true we never waited more than 20 minutes for a bus, but sometimes there were so many people waiting you couldn't get on and then had to wait again for the next bus. What we loved about GF is you had the monorail & the boat launch to MK, making it very easy to get back and forth. With kids our age, MK is where you'll be spending most of your time. For the price, I would just stay at GF. As a side note, we did the Magical Express to the hotel and it was two hours from landing at Orlando to arriving at the hotel. The bus did not leave until every seat was full! We kept asking the driver when are we leaving, he would not give a set time, just kept saying we're waiting for a few more guests. I wish Disney would have been straight about it because we would have just taken a cab and been at the hotel in 30 minutes!

Reviews.Title: “Safari in your room”
Reviews.Author: billybusrammer
Reviews.Content: Stayed again at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. Unique hotel with safari view from your balcony, great for access to Disney Parks. Thouroughly enjoyable stay, ticked all the boxes. Took some time out and ate at the full service restaurant this stay and it was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mnmom2girls
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed considering the cost. We booked a year in advance to secure a good room. Our room was basically your standard Holiday Inn room with a safari themed decor. Very tiny room. No special amenities at all. The empty, unlocked, cold refrigerator was nice though. This resort is the farthest from any of the Disney parks, so the shuttle buses that are used to transport you from the resort to the parks, etc run slow. It takes about a 20-25 minute bus ride to get just about anywhere...bummer! Horrible dining options. There's an upscale, pricey restaurant that's really not kid friendly at all, then there's a pricey buffet restaurant that's not kid friendly either, and then there's a cafeteria with very limited choices. We promised our 5 year old that she would get Mickey Mouse pancakes while we were at Disney World, but they were no where to be found. Room service was no better. horrible selections, especially for kids. Come on...this is Disney for goodness sakes! We'll never stay here again. Buyer beware...good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Service not typical of Disney Resorts”
Reviews.Author: nflynn01
Reviews.Content: Like many of the reviews I've read, it was the service we were really disappointed with. Our view of the animals was spectacular! The atmosphere good, although we thought they would have done more with the pool considering what was done with Disney's other premiere resorts. But in a nutshell, the folks working at Animal Kingdom Lodge felt like third string rookies. NOTE: We had very little experience at the restaurants, so I cannot give an opinion on the folks working there. AND the folks involved in tours, stories, night vision, were FABULOUS! It was the service staff that was not up to par. Even setting up our return trip using Magical Express wasn't very magical at all, and typically it is a breeze. We had to go to concierge (and wait in line again) to get our return trip confirmed for 5:30am, and believe it or not, at 5:30am there was a debate with the young man checking our luggage whether or not we would be able to check our luggage since our flight was at 8:20am. If they needed us to be in the lobby with our luggage at 5:20am, they should have told us that! I am stunned there are so many of the same complaints, and nothing is being done to change it. I hope this is not what is to come at Disney resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Disney”
Reviews.Author: MisterWombat
Reviews.Content: Not what I expected for $400 per night. After reserving and paying the premium six months in advance to get a savannah room where we could view the wild animals from our balcony, we got a view of an outside stairwell and a fenced in area where guests go in case of fire. You needed a telescope to see any animals. Apparently if you can see one blade of grass, that's a savannah room. When we asked to change rooms, we got no help. There are animal viewing areas around the hotel but you have to hunt for them and the animals may or may not be there when you want to see them. We had good luck around 4 in the afternoon when there was some feeding but they post no feeding schedule so it's just luck. If you want to see the animals, a better bet is to stay at a nearby hotel on International Drive and buy your Disney ticket, then take the free resort shuttle to the Safari Lodge and watch them from the public areas. It will cost you $300 less per night for the same views as the guests get. If you stay at the lodge, the third floor hallway sounds like a herd of stampeding elephants all day and night so if you do decide to go, avoid rooms there like the plague. The room itself was large enough and clean, but poorly lighted. The TV remote control barely worked and the TV itself would cut off unexpectedly. Incredibly the hotel has no wi-fi, only a phone line connection that was so slow I could not access my email and cost $9.95 per day. For 400 bucks a night, you'd think they could afford free wi-fi. Even the family hotels in Paris had free wi-fi as did $60 a night hotels around Disney. Staff was friendly, but I have some doubt they even knew their own names. When I asked for the location of the buses to theme parks, the guy at the desk had to go look for them, saying he had no idea. Even worse, neither the concierge nor anyone else knew the times of the various special events at the theme parks. These holiday parades and fireworks shows occur at the same time every day, but to find out when, you had to take the bus to each park and pick up their schedule. How hard can it be to deliver a schedule to the concierge desk by email every day so guests know when the special events are going to be? A stack of schedules so guests could have one would be nice, but at least they should have one so the concierge knew what was going and can answer questions. Or even better, put a sign in the lobby. Besides which Disney had half a dozen TV channels advertising their products. Couldn't the schedule be put up there? All in all, a big disappointment and definitely not a good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but won't be back...”
Reviews.Author: BostonRN
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying we booked this trip to Disney World about 11 months in advance. Me, my husband, our 2 kids went with my parents and our neice. We stayed in 2 separate rooms. From the get-go, we requested adjoining rooms. Each and everytime we talked to the folks @ WDW, we double checked on our request for adjoining rooms and for a pack and play for my son who was 21 months when we traveled. Well, we didn't get the adjoining rooms. I know they can't honor all the requests but, the hotel wasn't booked to capacity and I asked 11 months prior. We DID NOT get savanna view rooms. I didn't think it was worth the $$$$. We wouldn't be spending too much time in the rooms so why pay the extra money? When we checked in, the woman was unapologetic and told us we could have adjoining rooms if we upgraded to Consierge Level (of course, we'd have to pay for the upgrade). No thanks. She told us we didn't have adjoining rooms b/c of the construction going on. The rooms were fine. Nicely decorated. The pack and play was in the closet, as requested. We just had to call down to the desk and have someone come up and remove the table and chairs so we could have a spot to set up the pack and play. The man came up in less than 5 minutes and was in and out very quickly. We had a pool view room. We couldn't see the pool at all because of all the foliage. No biggie since we were only in the room late at night putting the kids to bed and early in the morning when we were getting ready to head out. We walked to the viewing spots twice a day. We could see most of the animals but they were @ quite a distance away. My kids couldnt' even spot them. I'm REALLY glad I didn't get a Savanna view room. Even one of the employees told us that it's hit or miss if you get one of those rooms. We did go to Boma twice. Once for dinner and once for brunch. It was fantastic. Great service and great food. We utilized the hotel service to check our bags and get our boarding passes on our last morning. What a time saver that was. We were able to board the Magical Express back to the airport with all the kids without having to worry about all the luggage. Speaking of busses, we used the Disney bus service to get to and from the parks. We didn't have one single problem. We had a very minimal wait for the busses...never more than 5 minutes. The furthest bus ride was to Downtown Disney, I think. It was a solid 15-20 minute bus ride. All the other parks were relatively close and no more than a 5-10 minute ride. The kids are at an age that they think busses are fantastic so it was like another attraction for them! So, all in all, I liked the AKL but for the money I had to spend to stay there....I wouldn't stay there again. It was expensive and the animal viewing was hit or miss, like I said. It was nice to stay there that one time to try it out. But, our next Disney trip, we'll try out another one of the Disney hotels.

Reviews.Title: “What an experience”
Reviews.Author: Prospect1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, having never before stayed on Disney property. I am pleased to say the experience was very enjoyable. The savannah view room, whilst not huge, was more than sufficient for our needs. It was well furnished with everything required and the bathroom was adequate containing a toilet and a bath/shower. There was a seperate twin sink area outside of the bathroom. The room was clean with a good supply of fresh towels and bed linen. The view from the room was overlooking a small savannah area and giraffe, wilderbeast and zebras were in good supply. The only downside to the view was the fact that the otherside of the savannah and clearly visible was a building site of the new AKL lodges but this did not detract from the stay in any way. The staff were very cheerfull, helpful and attentive at all times. There were many viewing ares throughout the hotel to watch animals if you had the time and I would recommend the night viewing experience. Transport to the parks was very good with busses leaving every 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge Our Perspective”
Reviews.Author: jvelasquez65
Reviews.Content: Animal Kingdom Lodge is a bit overpriced. I'm going to stick to facts initially, then give some opinions at closing. The Room: Is simply overpriced. Your view is hit or miss. Our first room had no view, we asked to be moved and our second room had a partial Savannah view. The room is small and only different from a holiday inn due to nicer furniture. There is nothing about the room that makes it stand out to the caliber I expect from staying at Disney Property. None of the little things that similarly priced hotels go out of their way to provide. The Resort Is nice overall. We saw some animals, the lobby is well done with plenty of detail. Most of the property is impressive inside. The exterior is "OK". I did not get the feel I was in a "Savannah". And honestly that supposed to be the draw. The Staff: This is most disappointing. Disney take note. Another hit or miss. I expect 5 star service at a Disney Resort. Not here. They ranked from "above average" to "apathetic". The Pool: Nice, plenty of lifeguards, and nice slide if your have kids. The Gym: Above average. The treads are great but the rest of the cardio is outdated and in need of repair or just updating. Those steppers are 20 year old 1st generation steppers. The free weights and strength equipment is just right. Those who shined and meet what I expected to be Disney standards: The security guard at the front gate was a short older guy always in a good mood and made a great impression. He was the only person that gave me that Disney feel. The valet service was terrific. ....That's it. Tips: Get a room close to the lobby unless you like to walk alot. There are lots of kids running around and the rooms are not sound proof. There is some construction going on so beware where they room you. Note: I'm 40 years old and have stayed in places where there is nothing else but a Motel 8 or Holiday Inn to The Mandarin, The Waldorf, The Four Seasons, Etc.

Reviews.Title: “the staff were excellent throughout the very scary harrican!!”
Reviews.Author: em_rulz_the_world
Reviews.Content: we absolutley loved the animal kingdom lodge, the staff were great and nice. the rooms were pretty good, we got a bunk bed and a queen bed with a balcony looking over the animals. i was only 10 when we stayed there in 2004, so i can't remember that much. but it was pretty good :) the staff were excellent throughout harrican Ike + Jean (i think they were called) they had special activities for the kids when the 2-day storm was on. they cattered things very well and also the staff were excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mosie7677
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first time and will be going back! We had a savanna room and and enjoyed watching the animals from our room. We enjoyed it so much we found it hard to leave! If you love animals this is the place for you! I could see us telling people when we came home...oh we just stayed in our room! Of course we didn't! We tried Boma the first night and the food was different but great. The service was excellent here and our waiter explained lot's of the dishes. We tried Jiko one night and it was outstanding. It's different but great! People all around us were comparing notes with us and enjoying the food also. Mara fast food was good. We only had breakfast from there. It is similar to most resorts fast food. Check in was fast and simple. Checkout was also simple. We used the airline check in and what an easy service that makes! We had a car and only used the bus service 3 times. We were very lucky because there was a 2 min wait each time. The lobby is outstanding and fun to explore. The pool was chilly but you get used to it! Very nice pool and whirlpools! The whole outside is fun to explore and view animals everywhere! If you don't have a savanna room you will have many viewing spots!! The staff is friendly and very helpful! There was painting and construction going on but it was not annoying at all. Very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation at the Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: ericsch2000
Reviews.Content: The past two years in a row my wife and I stayed on Disney Property on our own, each year going there in October for our anniversary. This year we decided to invite my mom and her husband to come down for 8 days with us. They had been down to Disney a couple times in the past few years as well, so everyone pretty well knew what to expect. The other two times my wife and I stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside (which was a decent place to stay - here's a link to my review http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g34515-d125310-r6343413-Disney_s_Port_Orleans_Resort_Riverside-Orlando_Florida.html) and at the Polynesian (which was amazing, here's a link to my review http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g34515-d85990-r10320339-Disney_s_Polynesian_Resort-Orlando_Florida.html). My parents stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge the last time they went down and fell in love with it, so despite our desire to stay at a resort with a monorail stop, we booked pool view connecting rooms at AKL. When we checked in we were given the keys to our rooms on the pool level and were told they connected. We went to our rooms; however, the rooms didn't connect. This really wasn't that big of a deal for us, but decided to ask the front desk if we could get connecting rooms. The front desk was very polite and helpful. They said that they didn't have any connecting rooms by the pool, but said they could get us connecting rooms in a couple savannah view rooms with no extra charge - free upgrade! We jumped at the opportunity because we actually wanted a savannah view anyhow, just didn't want to spend that much. Our rooms were very clean and new (see pictures), although a little smaller than the Polynesian rooms. But, the view was outstanding! Every morning, each time we returned to our room during the day, and each night there were all kinds of animals right outside of our balcony to watch, including giraffes and zebras! It would have been worth it to pay the extra for the view anyhow! We didn't use the pool while we were there, used the counter service restaurant once (which was clean and nice for a quick lunch), and bought a couple of necessities at the store/ gift shop (which was also clean and neat). Also, if you are buying souvenirs in the parks I highly recommend taking advantage of the free delivery service - you items are sent to your hotel's gift shop for pick up the next day or so. Really nice not to have to carry anything around the parks! The only real downsides that we saw to the AKL were the lack of monorail and the distance away from all of the other parks besides AK. My wife and I try to spend as much time in the parks each day and having your resort close by with a monorail stop is very handy. Our average bus wait at AKL was around 20-25 minutes, and on one occasion when we had a tour booked that we had to be on time for we waited for the bus for close to an hour, then the bus broke down on the way there and we had to get on to another in the middle of the road! LOL! But, because we planned for enough time, we still just barely made it in time for our tour (Keys of the Kingdom - highly recommend for adults! No Children because they show you the "back stage" of Disney. So, all in all, the hotel was very clean and well appointed. The only real downside for us was the lack of a monorail stop. I would recommend this resort for older adults without children who don't mind a casual pace and enjoy watching animals while they have their morning coffee. The next time my wife and I stay on property we'll probably either stay at the Polynesian again, or give the Grand Floridian a try - both have the monorail stops, but the Polynesian is also within easy walking distance to the Transportation and Ticket Center, which is real handy for hopping a monorail to Epcot. Although we still had way too much food on the dining plan, I was disappointed to find out that gratuity and appetizers for table service meals are no longer included with the standard plan. We weren't really that disappointed that appetizers weren't included, but having the gratuity included was very nice because we didn't have to carry any cash with us in the parks. It would also be nice if you could swap a dessert for an appetizer. The meal plan is still worth it though. The last point I'll make is that each year we go down in October not only for our anniversary, but also for the Food and Wine Festival at Epcot! We are never disappointed with the booths set up from all kinds of countries serving their local food and alcohol. And, this year, we stuck around for a couple free concerts at the American Pavilion where we saw Starship (Jefferson Airplane, Jefferson Starship)! Awesome show! We actually stayed for a few performances.

Reviews.Title: “Theoritically Magical”
Reviews.Author: MAVF
Reviews.Content: The title of our review was easy to select as the reception staff in their answers to most questions used these two words frequently. For us the visit breaks down into two experiences; the hotel and the centres. We enjoyed all the parks and found the travel facilities between each of them first class and easy to follow. Each centre could easily be a holiday in itself and to experience them all you really need to be on the move the whole time. “Fast passes” will help you to plan your day, but it is only possible to use them for one attraction at a time. Whilst some of the rides are scary and you need to think before using them, there are plenty of gentle features for all ages. Within every centre there are plenty of places to relax and watch the world go by and to buy refreshments. Whilst there are good facilities for disabled travellers, we were disappointed to find many overweight people hiring electric scooters in the parks and receiving preferential treatment that should only be reserved genuine disabled guests. Some exercise would be more beneficial for them and the scooters be reserved for disabled people who need them. Whilst we had a great holiday, we were not so happy with the hotel and probably would not stay there again. The bedrooms were excellent and serviced daily to a high standard; however, we saw a total of five animals from our room, in contrast to what the advertising promises. The main problem for us was the dining and the delays in waiting for a table. When you book a table for dinner it is reasonable to accept that you will get it, but we quickly learned that in fact you reserve a place in the queue and have to wait for a table, we waited between 20 and 40 minutes each time we used the restaurant. Further long delays were experienced at reception where queues were the norm. This resulted in us dining elsewhere in the evening and never had the same problem. The cost of everything at Disney is high and visitors need to be ready for prices that they will probably not experience elsewhere. But we had a great time and would not have missed it. .

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeraldineSpain
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel this last summer. It´s a different type of hotel. You actually feel as if you were in a lodge in the middle of some place in Africa. The staff was really helpful. The views from our rooms were spectacular! And the best thing of all, is that is that if you stay at any of Disney´s resort you have the advantage of riding any of their shuttle buses o any of their parks, and that.. belive me it´s great, because you don´t have to worry about the parking, or wating long lines to buy the park tickets since you can buy them at the hotel´s reception. I reccomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Less magic than expected”
Reviews.Author: chooochoootrane
Reviews.Content: Animal Kingdom is truly breathtaking when you arrive. However, apart from the size of the lobby and seeing the animals from your balcony, lie cracks in the veneer that made my stay less than 'magical'. The staff were not particularly attentive (had to carry my bags to and from the room as well as a small child). The rooms were clean. Everyday, plenty of fresh towels, etc. There are major building works going on on the resort. Its an eyesore, but not too disruptive. I did not notice any overbearing noise. Although I was pretty hacked off that prior to booking I was told that the only property works were exterior painting....not the case, they are building a massive extension of condos onto the AKL so be aware. The wait for the bus to and from the parks was unbearable in the heat. particularly when you were ready to leave the parks mid day or late in the afternoon. In the end, I rented a car and paid $12 a day to park my own car at the theme parks. The biggest frustration, however, was not being able to get a reservation in the main restaurant for dinner. I was able to get a reservation late in the evening in the more pricey (about double the price) restaurant which too late with a young one. I resorted to the self service restaurant or room service until I checked out. When I complained to the manager, he explained that there was a special promotion for the restaurant and they were experiencing a higher than average number of reservations. It was ridiculous. It was pretty much a similar case in all the eateries around WDW so be warned....book up your dining choices prior to your holiday. Apart from the extortionate hotel prices and the dining issue, the hotel was ok. It was clean, the kids seemed to love it, and the pool was great. You could stay in worse places.....but they might have been a bit cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “Recomended”
Reviews.Author: DrakkarQ
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this location but I feel it is important to pass along that you will be spending a portion of your trip on being transported to and from the resort. For the same amount of money you may want to opt for the Wilderness Lodge if this is a concern of yours. And about those dinner reservations, people aren’t joking or being over diligent, we went during the slow season and you really did need reservations for many of the sit down restaurants. Great Staff Great theme Smallish rooms- but I don’t know how big any of the other resorts rooms are. *Fantasmic is a must see.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.....but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Jon14-6
Reviews.Content: I had booked a standard room with bunk beds on Disney's website while they were offering room discounts. I paid $170 ($191 with tax). We arrived in the morning at 9:30, and they told me my room was not available. I told them I just got off the Disney Magic cruise ship, and I would like to have a room now if possible. The lady at the front desk talked to her manager and moved us to a savannah view (facing the DVC villas under construction). Free upgrade.......score!!!!!! Almost everytime I looked off our balcony, there were animals in view. Giraffes, wildebeest, zebras and Watusi cattle. Room was great with queen size beds. Pool area was great, and the hot tubs were the best. At night, we went to the animal viewing area beside the pool and took advantage of the night vision binoculars. That was really cool, and I would definitely recommend this to others. The castmembers would point out where the animals were on the savannah, and you could see them so easily with the night vision. We didn't eat at the lodge, but the smell of grilled meats was very noticeable in the evening. MMMMMMM.....GOOOOOD. Was this place nice, definitely. Would I like to stay there again.....for sure. But at $275 a night which is their normal rate for a standard room, this was probably a one time deal for us, unless Disney runs another discount in the future.

Reviews.Title: “not what it is cracked up to be!”
Reviews.Author: cindycommons1
Reviews.Content: well, where to start. i ended up booking a two bed room suite at the animal kingdom lodge and was excited to take my family. we arrived and checked into our room and noticed that we had a room with a view of a tree. how wonderful. bathroom products were the same as checking into a holiday inn. waiting in line at the hotel for tickets took 35 minutes long. ruthie at front desk was the worst. no help at all. i paid alot for the experience of the disney adventure and ended up with a empty wallet and bed memories. i would not receommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: sewpeaches
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in Animal Kingdom Lodge. The staff was friendly and helpful. the food in Boma was excellent and fun. the cafe, Mara, was just so-so, but clean and staff friendly. The animals and the setting was amazing. the pool was beautiful. The tropical tree and flowers were beautiful. The buses to the parks arrived quickly. But we really enjoyed talking to the young staff members that were actually from Africa. They were well informed about the animals and their country. They were so proud of their particular country. We attended the "Not So Scarey Halloween Party" at the Magic Kingdom. It was just my husband and myself and we really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Made all our dreams come true!”
Reviews.Author: tyosi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to plan our first family trip to Disney and started the planning in April for an October vacation. I had never been to Disney before, and my husband hadn't been since he was a kid. We only have one son, who is six, and we wanted this to be a special week for him. When looking for a hotel, I was a bit overwhelmed by the amount of information and choices available. When we finally settle on Animal Kingdom we felt that it was a dream hotel for us- although a little pricey for what we are used to. We booked the hotel for a week, and compromised by paying for the basic view. By the time our vacation arrived, I was sure that the hotel would not live up to our overblown expectations. My biggest fear would be that it would be loud, dirty, and the staff would be rude. Nothing could have been further from the truth. When we arrived in Orlando we took the Magical Express to the hotel. This process went very smoothly and it was actually an enjoyable part of our first day. We pulled up to the hotel and could smell wood burning from the fire pit. Check in was quick and easy and SURPRISE we were upgraded to a Savannah view room which connected to my in-law's room. This made such a difference and when we got to the room and pulled back the shades we had giraffe eating right outside our balcony! Throughout the entire week we saw such awesome animal events (wildebeasts chasing antelope, giraffe galloping across the savannah...) and truly felt that if we didn't leave the hotel the entire week we would have still been happy. However, when we did leave the transportation was phenomenal. Perhaps it was because we were there in October, but we never had to wait for a bus- even when we left the Magic Kingdom on night during a thunderstorm. Also, because Animal Kingdom is away from the rest of the resorts, the bus only went to the lodge and did not stop at any other resorts along the way. The buses were never crowed- many times we were the only family on the bus! We ate twice at Boma and had a fantastic experience both times. We also found the staff to be extremely professional and polite...even our housekeeper went above and beyond and left towel animals everyday- my son would write notes back to her and tell her how much he loved them! The atmosphere is transporting and added so much to our time at Disney. I truly could not have asked for a better experience and would encourage anyone to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: loulouSurrey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks in July 2006. We had a family room overlooking the animals. The room was OK but quite small for a 2 week stay. Could also have done with more thorough cleaning - we found games under the bed from the previous occupants - which showed that the room had not been cleaned properly in between guests. Breakfast good - plenty of choice. We also enjoyed the South African themed restaurant. Bus service worked very well to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Animal kingdom lodge.”
Reviews.Author: talashea
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Disney's Animal Kingdom Resort on Oct 20.08 to stay 8 days, while the hotel is a very nice place, i have stayed at nicer ones.. One of the problems was house keeping was not that great as we were finding broken glass on the bathroom floor shortely after we arrived, and the inside of the bathroom door looked as though it had not been cleaned in a very long time. I told one of the people who had happened to ask us on our way out that day how our stay was so far, her response was she would immediately alert the manager of housekeeping for us.. Sadly 4 days later nothing had been done... While the stay was an enjoyable one for us we probably will not stay here again.. Other than that the resturaunts in the hotel were ok, the buffet being the nicest. Jiko was ok but then again nothing really special and very high priced. The pool area was nice but we never used it seeing as we were away most of the time... It would have been nice to use the hot tub at least once but even trying at 2 in the morning was no good as whole family's were still up at this time and they were never empty. Would i reccomend this hotel, yes if you have children.. If you are adults probably not.. Checking in was not a problem, but checking out at 4 in the morning was.. The whole bill was messed up having being charged for disney park tickets on my credit card that were paid for in cash, so word of warning DOUBLE check your hotel bill before you pay... I wonder how many times this mistake was made, never corrected and people just never noticed on their bills.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful.. again!”
Reviews.Author: haveacappio
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 5 years ago and returned for a 5 night stay in October. We booked a Savannah room to get the most from the animal viewing and weren't disappointed. There are some building works at the moment but we were facing the centre of the complex and got a good selection of animals (maybe not enough giraffe) every day. Our room was clean and of good standard - we got a fridge and coffee maker this time which is a welcome improvement from our last visit - generally we have no fault with the hotel and would go back tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “great holiday”
Reviews.Author: paulfallon
Reviews.Content: This the 2nd time we went to A.K.L. Again we had a great time The Hotel is the best we have ever been to. If you hear the moaners go on about the building work FORGET IT it didnt effect us whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return :)”
Reviews.Author: TEALOVER46
Reviews.Content: Welcome to my review on the AKL :_) First off, this was my very first stay at the lodge and it was just as beautiful as I had always envisioned it to be. Upon check in there were two other guest checking in so the wait was very minimal. I was given a room on the ostrich trail room #4723, which I found to be very clean, and with a view worth talking about. I was here for one night and dredded my departure the next morning :_( I caught an amazing deal and took advantage of it. I wasn't about to let this offer get by me.....again. Being that my arrival was on 10/04 we didn't see or hear any noise through out the lodge regarding construction noise. Maybe we lucked out over the weekend. Either way that would have not put a damper on my excitement to be aboard. The lodge has such a warm and cozy feel to it, especially with the dimness throughout. I've read past guest complain about the lack of lighting here. It goes with the territory (per se) well that's it for now. God's will I'll be back next year and with a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Building Worrks Do Not Stay”
Reviews.Author: kerrypar
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at the animal kingdom lodge until after spring 09 my family checked in and instead of seeing animals from our savannah room we saw jcb`s diggers trucks and workmen. We has three very upset little children and when we complained were offered $70, we should have been informed before we paid our money at booking and at check in at reception nobody informed us at all. And I was told that work would be completed next spring so be warned

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: marshallgirl
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at a Deluxe Resort in Disney and we were not disappointed. The lodge and whole atmosphere were great. We were upgraded at no charge to a Savannah view which my kids and parents LOVED. The rooms were a good size, clean and always ready when we returned. We had no problem with check in or check out. The buses were a little slow and you are a good 20 minute ride to everywhere - but it really didn't seem much longer than the rides from Key West or Port Orleans where we've stayed before. We were caught in the rain one day of our stay and missed our dinner reservation. We were put on the list for Boma and they called us in our room in an hour as promised with a ready table - we had just enough time to clean up from the rain storm - very accommodating. The pool was nice and the temperature was perfect for late September. My only complaint would be the noise level. The theme music was a little overbearing at times, in the counter service restaurant especially - the Maura - but even in the lobby and on the buses. We ate breakfast by the pool most days to avoid it, which was fine with us. I would definitely recommend the Animal Kingdm Lodge to families and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and view helps”
Reviews.Author: recklessfriend
Reviews.Content: This is a trip we actually WON. Therefore its hard to be critical. However I will review it as if we paid for it. The hotel itself is magnificent. The lobby is spectacular and they have done a great job making you feel like you have just started an African safari. The pool is nice, maybe too warm after walking around the parks all day. We ate at 2 restaurants which were both great and the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. I asked if we could get a complimentary upgrade to a savanah view room as we had booked a standard room. The clerk asked if we would be willing to spend $60 per night to upgrade and I said I was more or less looking for a favour and would keep the room originally booked if the upgrade couldn't be done. After 10 minutes in the back office she came out to say they there were no complimentary upgrades available. OK. So we arrived to a room on the 3rd floor which had a view of the employee parking lot. Disappointed but hey, we kept telling ourselves it was free. After a day at the park we returned to basically realize there hardly room to open our luggage. The rooms are nice but very small. We had luggage on our table, on the cabinet above the TV in the closet on the floor. With 2 queen beds, there is essentially 2 feet of space to walk around them. Its a tight fit for four people. I called the desk to see if there were any bigger rooms available and was promptly told that all 1000 rooms were exactly the same. I doubt it. Even though it might have seemed like a ploy, the following morning our coffee maker and built in fridge and the area around it were covered with ants. For every 10 I killed, another 20 would show up. I alerted the desk and they offered to spray and or move us to a different room. We switched rooms and ended up with a partial savanah view and had a wonderful view of giraffes and zebras and other assorted animals. The new room also had bunk beds which provided a little more floor space. We were in a much better mood at this point. The toilet and shower and in a different room than the sinks which is convenient if several people are trying to get ready for the day at the same time. The cafeteria is just as good as the buffet restaurant so don't stress if you can't get a reservation. The store in the hotel is handy but like with every other Disney store, it is overpriced. Wait times for buses are average. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: pipesinstripes
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful lodge with neat artwork. My son had a great time. We had a standard view but we were still able to see all of the animals. The rooms are very nice and clean. The staff was wonderful. The 3 restaurants were very nice. The pool is huge with a fun slide for the kids. The shuttles times vary depending on where you go. The Animal Kingdom was the closest park. The other parks are quite a ways away which I didn’t like – long shuttle rides. Shuttles come about every 20 minutes although sometimes it was a lot longer or shorter. I would stay there again in the future

Reviews.Title: “Reccomended Disney accomodation”
Reviews.Author: RichardJ82
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here for 2 weeks while visiting all the usual Disney parks. The hotel itself is very impressive and the room was clean and of a good size for the 2 of us however only a few rooms have any sort of a view as we were hoping for a room overlooking the safari / wildlife area and did request this before leaving but once we arrived we got a view of the car park. We asked at reception about this and were told that these were bigger family rooms that you had to pay extra for but this did not spoil the holiday as we spend so little time in the room. There are 3 places to eat - the cafe (burgers /pizza ), a buffet restaurant and a fine dining restaurant, with the last 2 filling up very quickly so expect to wait 30 - 60 mins for a table during busy periods unless you book in advance. From what we have heard from other people during our stay this is one of the best Disney hotels so if you are looking for something above average then this is definatley the place I would reccomend. Overall a nice holiday and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort!”
Reviews.Author: CAGW
Reviews.Content: We stayed 9 days a few weeks back at Animal Kingdom and we had an amazing time! The best Disney Resort we've ever stayed at (we've done Polynesian, WL and other deluxe resorts). We loved it so much we bought Disney Vacation Club at Animal Kingdom Villas. There was hardly a wait at all for the buses and the food was out of this world. The staff exuded the classic Disney customer service. Would HIGHLY recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: Chuggsy10
Reviews.Content: Just got back from AKL. We are vacation club members and for the past 5 years have stayed at the Beach Club. We stayed in a two bedroon Villa (Savannah View). Most of the time you could see the animals, they would have to entice them with food sometimes but for the most part saw all animals which was great for the kids. Rooms very nice and spacious, nice decor, bath and shower together unlike Beach Club, We like them seperate. Kids always wanted to sit in Jacuzzi Tub and we had to wait to shower until they where done. Room was fairly clean found some things under couch but nothing crazy. I know my 5 year old son stashed money under the couch we forgot so sometime it works out for you. We only did one restaurant, Jiko, was very nice for 4 adults and two kids, was 300.00 so pretty expensive. Ok selections but if Picky might be hard to find something you like. No idea on buses for we rented a car for the week. Pool, was ok, tough to compare to Beach Club for that is the best pool in Disney. Our kids 5 and 11 where a little bored there. they had a slide but small and that was it. Should be better once the new Pool opens up after construction. Staff always helpfull had no issue with them at all. We stayed at the far end away from The Mara Food Court, that is where you refill the mugs for coffee or softdrinks, so really never went down in the morning for that or at night, so best to buy something for the room. It was nice to stay at some where different but I think next time we will stick with the beach club

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: niktim
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Disney 7 times and chose this hotel as we had a great meal at Boma last year and thought the place was amazing. We didn't have the best start as it took 7 hours for our suitcases to arrive using the magical express (almost the same time as our flight). The view from our hotel balcony was fabulous with giraffes, zebra, ostrich and even rabbits. The pool was really nice with plenty of sun loungers, although a bit close together. There are lots of areas to sit and relax either at the bar, plenty of seating in the lobby, fireplaces outside and savanna views with rocking chairs. Boma is great value for money with really nice food and Jerry the chef was lovely. The only downside to the hotel is Mara food court, it was the same food every day and we couldn't even get basic things like pancakes for breakfast. In addtion the buses from theme parks took a long time to arrive in comparison to other hotels, even after the firework displays we were sometimes waiting 25 minutes which is quite disappointing for a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomidations and staff”
Reviews.Author: 1HTcowboy
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about how well we enjoyed our stay. From the moment we drove up everyone treated us as we were the most important guest in the resort. From the bellman to housekeeping ,everyone was attentive to our every need . Cleanliness is very important to me and I was pleased to find all areas were kept clean. The resturants were great and the service wes perfect. I just can't say enough about how well everything was handled when we had a question or a need. We will make this our first choice every time we visit Disney. Thanks again to everyone!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “loved it and going back for more”
Reviews.Author: lynncarver
Reviews.Content: we are from the uk and booked a week in sarasota then the week between christmas and including the new year in the AKL,all my family had a great time the staff in the AKL were polite at all times to all members of my family and myself ,the only downside was when we were checking out we met the lady who was selling the holiday villa,s ,but we only had a short time to talk ,so when we got back to the uk we booked up again for the christmas and new year at AKL ,and this time i am going to seek that lady out and try and buy a villa at AKL ,my family and i usualy have between 4 and 5 vacations a year but we have to admit, one of the best times we have had is at the disney world resort and the AKL so a special thanks to all at disney ,, and we will see some of you again this christmas and new years celibrations davidalberts84@msn.com

Reviews.Title: “Oh boy! It was swell!”
Reviews.Author: Wan2Scream
Reviews.Content: We live in southern California and have been to Disneyland many times. This was our first trip to Walt Disney World. We stayed five nights at Animal Kingdom Lodge and had a view of a savanna teeming with animals: ankole, antelopes, elands, blesboks, gazelles, giraffes, zebras, and pelicans. The property was secluded, with absolutely no skyscrapers, freeways, billboards, or telephone poles visible anywhere. We really had the feel of being in Africa. Because it was our tenth anniversary, we were given "Happy Anniversary" buttons to wear. Everywhere we went at Walt Disney World, cast members greeted us and wished us well. We were given several cards and special treats. One of the cards was from Mickey and Minnie, and Mickey also phoned us to wish us a happy anniversary. Everything was excellent: the room, the view, the restaurants, the cast members, and the memories we left with. As Mickey would say, "Oh boy, everything was swell!" We're hoping to be able to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Dreams really do come true!”
Reviews.Author: 4newfie
Reviews.Content: We have always stayed at a moderate resort, but this time we upgraded to Deluxe...and loved it. AKL was beautiful, the staff were excellant! We would definitely stay there again. It was worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: olle1
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in to our room we heard construction going on the floor above us. I called the concierge and they said this was normal and that they could not do anything. I went to the lobby and talked to the Manager, who said that they had not had any complaints and that they were doing construction from 9 to 5. So we thought lets see what happens the next day. Next morning at 7 am they start drilling on the floor above us and the whole family is awake!!! Once again I went to the front desk and they offered another room and we would have to pack our luggage and come back later in the day when the room was available. At this point I had had it. When I asked if we could transfer to another hotel they said that there were construction going on at the Grand Floridian and Polynesian also ! We managed to get transfered to the Grand Floridian where we had a fabulous time and we were properly looked after. What disappointed me and my wife was the lies coming from the management at Animal Kingdom. 1. No other complaints ( talking to the staff at the AK, this was a very common complaint and the people next room to us had also changed rooms ) 2. Construction only from 9-5, it started at 7am 3. Construction going on at the Grand Floridian and Polynesian ( as far as I know there was no construction going on ) We will never go back to the AK and if you are visiting please be aware of the construction going on. Be proactive and ensure that you get a room far away form the construction area.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the extra money”
Reviews.Author: pam28z
Reviews.Content: not worth all the extra money paid for the hotel. stayed in 2006 at all star movies and loved it. so when we decided to go back in 2007 we splurged and stayed at the animal kingdom in one of the sevana rooms. everyone was excited and couldnt wait. well the trip was horrible, the hotel staff was less than par and it should have been better. the bus to magic kingdom took an hour and a half from one to the next with no reason givin when asked. for the difference in price one would expect better service but i must say that we will stay at a cheaper hotel again because the service was better. we are leaving next week on sep10 ,2008 for our next disney adventure and are staying at all star sports, so hopefully we will have another good adventure to add to our disney stay..

Reviews.Title: “nice but therese better for the money!”
Reviews.Author: trip252
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at nearly all the disney hotels now as we are in the vacation club. we did not manage to book in time to get a savannah view which i think was a real pity as the main point of this hotel is the wildlife aspect. the rooms are lovely, amazingly comfortable bedding, super clean and we really liked the decor. the pool was nice but it doesn't compare to others at disney and the restaurants were hard to get a reservation in because people staying at all different resorts were c hosing to eat there and very expensive. my personal feeling is that this hotel would be great if you have kids who would enjoy the wildlife aspect, in which case you must get a savannah view or its really no different than any other disney hotel. litle disapointed with some o fhte activities offered, eg the "night visison" animal safari that the AKL boasts in virtually every write up, is 2 men stood with 2 pairs of night vision goggles that you can use to look at one specific animal area, the queue for which was about half an hour. tip to disney, buy a few more pairs of goggles, it won't break the bank! i just didn't think for us it lived up to our expectations!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A really wild hotel”
Reviews.Author: martinstev
Reviews.Content: Waking up to a Giraffe walking past your balconcy is just superb! Try and get a low down room for best views of all the animals. The overall themeing is brilliant. Yes things can be a bit dark but it feels right. Pool was good but older kids will soon get bored of the rather tame slide. No problems checking in or out. -ve Food was average but plenty of choice and a reasonable price to no real complaints. Couldn't turn off airconditioning so we had a cool breeze all night.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall, problem with the cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: crazywudsl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week with the kids to visit Disney World and the hotel is impressive with the animals wandering around the various savannahs. The buses were relatively convenient to most of the parks and transfers to and from the airport went off without a hitch. There were various activities throughout the day that were fun though we were kept busy by disney itself most of the time.
