The pool was nice, and we ate at the buffet and other restaurants which were very good for the disney area and properties. The only problems were with cleanliness as glass shards were seen near the bathroom sink. While not glaringly obvious, housekeeping should have done a better job at cleaning had they been the ones that broke the glass during their cleaning. If not, I could see them missing the glass perhaps, but not after telling them about it. They still failed to clean up the glass which was clearly visible. I actually also had to speak to management about blood stains being on the bed sheets which is also a health hazard of sorts. Overall, the management was nice in trying to handle the problems though it took them forever and being comped a half night or something was inadequate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the animals”
Reviews.Author: JackieTripper
Reviews.Content: My Mother took our family here for Spring Break and while the rooms were much smaller than they look in the pictures, over all the property was very nice. The kids had a blast. Bunk Beds were helpful! The animals really do stroll right under your balcony which is very exciting for the kids. Great staff and service, mostly African. The lobby is gorgeous. Fine art! At Disney! The place has a very good "vibe". Ate at both restaurants and had a good experience, the buffets were a lot of fun but a bit pricey for the little ones (who just want a piece of chicken or a waffle anyway, WDW should KNOW this!). The Coffee was surprisingly good! So were the African wines we tried. Our favorite part was the African story telling bonfire at sunset! Pool wass a little small (and COLD). I would absolutely recomend this hotel. Our main complaint, besides no visible recycling program, is that the "African" items in the gift shop are mostly Made in China and Asia, not Africa. Hey Disney, if you are going to build a whole hotel with an African theme, and profit from Africa's rich culture and history, don't you think it's fair to at least carry authentic African gifts? You buy genuine African wine, why not genuine African drums??? Had I seen African Fair Trade items I would have bought them, but didn't buy as we would have been embarrassed to give somebody an African drum or something stamped MADE IN CHINA (especially at $15 a pop for stuff you see at Pier One for $3). They had a few African items, but only a few. What gives Walt? The Animal Kingdom park is great, don't miss A BUGS LIFE and the Himalaya rollercoaster!!! BIG disapointment: we found the "Rainforest Caf"e a laughable disgrace, food service nightmare, nothing Eco Friendly, Recycled, Organic or Shade Grown about it. Actually HORRIBLE food too. No better than the Frozen junk I nuke at home for the kids. Our 6 year olds thought the gift shop was fun, but again, MADE IN CHINA. Tell me: just HOW does a fake plastic frog fit into the rainforest eco system? We would ask the Rainforest Cafe the same question as Disney: If your gimmick is the Rainforest, how about some respect for the Rainforest? Shouldn't you not EXPLOIT the rainforest? When we asked for Shade Grown coffee our server told us that we should be fine with the maxwell house. The Bob Marley cafe at Universal was FAR more eco friendly, fun and better food too, our whole family preffered it to Rainforest Hypocrites! Come to think of it, even McDonalds is more eco friendly and has better food than RC at Animal Kingdom too!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: laundrygal
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge as part of a week-long Disneyworld vacation. We loved the ambiance of the whole lodge -- the enormous lobby, the animal viewing areas and our room. The front desk was extremely helpful to me -- our suitcase was severely damaged on the flight in and I lost some medication. They were helpful in making sure I had the correct shipping information to have new sent, and then made sure to have the package delivered to my room within moments of its arrival. I really appreciated them taking such care with this incident and not making a big deal at all. Our room was clean and neat and always serviced in a timely fashion. We had a safari view room and although there are probably rooms with a better view, we saw plenty of animals every day and really enjoyed that aspect of the room. I am not sure I would pay extra for it again though. We ate at Boma every morning and Jiko once. Boma was fantastic with a wide range of breakfast items. Jiko was also delicious but a splurge. There was a quick-service restaurant also, we went there for sodas and an occasional snack, but not very often. We also used the sundry shop a few times and found it well stocked.

Reviews.Title: “An Instant Disney Classic”
Reviews.Author: jaibob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Animal Kingdom Lodge for our honeymoon and could not have picked a better location. Everything about the resort is Disney quality, but without the cartoonish feel of some other Disney properties. The food at Boma was surprisingly good, and since my wife is a vegetarian it was nice to see that the Mara served veggie burgers and other alternatives to meat. The gift shop has a nice wine selection, however it can be a little pricey. Since most rooms have refrigerators, it's a great idea to bring your own alcohol from home. The pool area is well done and the hot tub is tucked into a nice corner that gives a sense of privacy. All in all, the resort is welcoming inside and out. The African "jambo" experience is woven into everything offered. There are interactive displays and exhibits throughout and the conversational indoor fire pit is a great place to meet new friends and relax with a drink from the bar. This is a resort meant to be experienced, so don't simply rush out to the park and back to your room. Take the time to wander out into the savannah areas and see the animals. Feeding time is a great time to observe them as well as in the morning hours. I hope to go again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice lodge but has some negatives”
Reviews.Author: reimersnj
Reviews.Content: Good: -Lodge was stunning -Savannah was cool -Staff was friendly -Check-in was fairly quick -Jiko and Boma were nice, Boma was better -Check out was a breeze Bad: -The Mara is average at best, but so are all quick serve places in Disney. -Rooms are VERY small... 2 adults, 2 kids... no room for luggage and to move at the same time Ugly: -AKL has the least amount of shuttles going to other parks so you potentially have to sit and wait far longer to go to and from parks, etc. It's also the farthest away from everything in Disney besides Blizzard Beach and Animal Kingdom lodge... which means if it's a multiple stop bus you'll be the first on and last off so plan accordingly. -Restaurant service is S-L-O-W at every single restaurant we went to... gets very annoying. -Had blood on all of our sheets one night and had them change it out... Housekeeping manager was a complete [---], had to go to front desk management twice before it was dealt with. Overall the trip was good (and exhausting)... the lodge was nice and service overall was good. Just wanted to list the little quirks to make sure people know the negatives of staying there if they go. I probably wouldn't stay there again as we did it because of the animal savannah, etc... but that gets old in about 5 minutes and the location of the lodge makes it kind of annoying to go to other places.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hodgsons85
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a holiday in Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge. We had been told that building work was going on and had read reviews that said they saw and heard building work while staying there. I have got to say we never heard or saw a thing, if there was building work going on we were not aware of it. The hotel is fantastic, the staff are very friendly and all of the facilities and rooms are spotless. I would recommend this hotel whole heartedly and we would return as a family without any hesitations. The only advice I would give would be that it is definately worth signing up for the Disney Dining Plan and also get a list of restaurants on Disney property and book meals in advance, as we found that we couldn't get a decent meal anywhere as the Americans book tables about 6 months in advance and over our 2 week stay we only managed to get one booking that we requested. You can only eat so many burgers, pizzas, hotdogs etc. We also has a Savannagh room and this was superb, the kids loved opening the curtains every morning to see which animals were waiting. Pool area was fantastic. Lifeguards were excellent, very well trained and on the ball. If you are booked to go or thinking about going, we are very envious and know you will have a fabulous time.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible from Moment One!”
Reviews.Author: Tinkwannabe
Reviews.Content: From the second you walk in the door, you are bathed in warm, earthy scents. We were there for the holidays and the tree was breathtaking. The wall opposite the entrance is several stories of solid glass with subtle metal vines from floor to ceiling and looks out over a fire pit used for nightly story telling and animals. The castmembers were phenomenal and the Disney magic was alive and well. There is a fire in a mosaic covered pit to the side and a water feature that quietens the hustle and bustle. At night there is artificial moonlight over the animal areas and it is simply amazing. I bought a hand-carved giraffe while I was there and they wrapped it in newspaper...when I got home, I opened it up and the scents from the lobby flooded my senses. Absolutely incredible! We actually go back every year to just visit AKL, even if we stay somewhere different. The smell feels like home and Disney magic all in one!

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Roars with Fun!”
Reviews.Author: enjayflyer
Reviews.Content: I could go on and on about the Animal Kingdom Lodge… If you’re into animals, and the whole African/Safari theme, then this is the perfect place for you. We stayed on the 2nd floor – which has a terrace that looked right out onto the “Savannah.” A complete, unobstructed view of the animals… complete with rocking chairs and binoculars. We had a standard room - facing the pool, and it was fine (of course, larger would’ve been better) for a family of 4 – but we never felt on top of each other. The bathrooms have double sinks that are outside the shower/toilet which allows others to get ready simultaneously. There is also a refrigerator, for late night snacks. Each day, our cleaning person would leave us cute dolls or Mickey Mouse ears made out of towels. Oh and there is a Laundromat on property too! Very nice. The food at AKL is ‘different,’ because of the African theme, BUT they do have a wonderful cafeteria style place, near the pool that has an amazing turkey sandwich and delicious cookies. There is a small menu, so that took some getting used to… The pool is great, but because of the weather, rain every afternoon, you will have to come out of the water until the lifeguards allow you to return. In the evenings, make sure you get your caricature done, by the on-property artist. You should take time to tour the hotel b/c there is one-of-a-kind art displayed throughout. They also have wonderful activities planned for the little kids when/if you’re not going to the Parks. One final thing… I did find that the shuttle bus for AKL to the Parks/Downtown Disney, did take a long time – but that has nothing to do with the property. All in all, an amazing stay. Already planning my trip back for next year.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: louiseEllesmerePort
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel in may this year it was fantastic! I have two children aged 6 and 5 they loved it none of us wanted to leave and I cannot wait to go back. There was building work going on at the hotel but this didnt spoil our holiday I would recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bgyrmi
Reviews.Content: Disney's Animal Kingdom lodge can be described as an African themed hotel with African animals grazing around it, but this does not begin to do it justice. Of course it is Disney fantasy but it is so well done, the hotel looks great, feels wonderful to be in and we never got tired of looking out and seeing zebras, giraffes, various antelope and others. Our room was a savannah view room with a double bed and bunk beds and though not large was well equipped and very comfortable for 2 adults and 2 children. Even though there were lots of children at the hotel the room remained quite and pleasant to be in as the hotel is well laid out and obviously well sound proofed. The pool is good for all ages and well supervised, but does get busy in the afternoon. My only criticism is based around the food, there is no doubt it is quite expensive and does not vary much. There are three restaurants, the flag ship restaurant Jiko is excellent and should be visited, Boma is an African themed all you can eat buffet style restaurant and if you have a large appetite this may be good value but you will be eating the same every night. Finally there is the cafe style Mara, very popular with jet lagged europeans for breakfast as it opens at 6.00am, the food is simpler but good and can be eaten outside. If however you have an environmental bone in your body it is difficult place, everything is sold either in plastic boxes, on plastic plates with plastic knives, forks and spoons and it all goes in the bin, the waste is staggering. In short we had a wonderful time and were very sad when it came to an end, if your children like animals and the natural world they will love this hotel, and so will you.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to visit again!”
Reviews.Author: lisabookie1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge with our two boys, ages 3 and 6 and another family who's kids are 2 and 6 and we had a wonderful time. The hotel is amazing. Probably the best one at Disney. The food was delicious. We ate at Jiko's our first night and it was the best meal I had the whole vacation. We had breakfast every morning at Bomas, which is a buffet. The kids loved choosing there own food. It is pricey, so I would suggest the dinning plan. The hotel lobby is just beautiful. Interesting things to look at. The kids loved the pool. It's pretty big and has a slide which the kids never got tired of. And the pool is open 24 hrs. We had a room on the second floor with a queen size bed and bunk beds. The kids loved it. We had a balcony overlooking the animals. We enjoyed going outside first thing in the morning and seeing differnt animals walking around right outside our room. The staff was very nice and helpful. My son fell in the room and had to go to the emergency room and the staff was up in my room right away helping. They paid for my cab back from the hospital and gave my son a Mickey Mouse toy which he always has with him. I absolutely loved this hotel and will stay there again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: JB&RB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for the first time this year to see how it was. And i have to say i would definitely stay at this resort again. We got the savannah view (view of the animals) and it was amazing. The wild animals were right there almost like we could touch them. We have a 2 year old daughter and she loved the animals. The pool is very kid friendly and the games the lifeguards hold every 30 min is very nice. All the staff were friendly and helpful when needed. They even had a free show were you could walk in and listen to someone who is from Africa talk about thier country and that was very cool. They had a night vison area where at night you could go look through night vision goggles at the animals in the fields. All in all i reccomend that you try out this resort and if there is a complaint it is that the resort is alittle far away from the parks but makes up for it with a excellent atmosphere. If anyone has any questions please feel free to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: PixieDustedDisneyFan
Reviews.Content: Four night stay at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge Paid for standard view and received pool view Even if you don't have a view of the animals there are still plenty of spots to see them! We went outside to see them often and also from indoor viewing areas around the resort. Each area of the resort has different animals on the savannahs near it. Only giraffes can be seen on all three savannahs. Room: Not as large as I thought it would be. Very clean and well equipped. The lights are not in the easiest locations, so be sure to leave one on in the room if you plan on coming back to the room late at night. Fridge and coffee maker in the room. Lots of storage. Closet doors are kind of in the way...I would have liked a trifold door instead of two sliders. You can't get into both sides of the closet at the same time. Dining: We did not eat at Boma or Jiko this trip. (We have been to Boma in the past) They appeared to be booked solid. To get to The Mara (the quick service option) from the lobby area of the hotel, you have to go down to the check in area for Boma & Jiko to exit which during crowded times can be tough to naviagate. From some locations in the resort, The Mara can be very hard to get to. You can only get to it from outside the resort, near the pool. The food at The Mara was very good. The pizzas here are like none other on Disney property, they are more like a flatbread than a pan pizza. Very good! The African Stew is good too. Transportation: We only use the Disney busses for the Magic Kingdom and I was pleased to actually have a seat on the bus! They came frequently and never filled to capacity. I"m looking forward to seeing the completion of the Kindani Village, the Disney Vacation Club (time share) building later next year. When this is complete, a new savannah will be as well. I would definatley stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: lottie03
Reviews.Content: We decided to include three hotels in our Florida holiday. AKL was the second & we stayed there for three nights. I was so excited about coming on to Disney property & actually being a guest there for a few days. I booked this trip fifteen months ago & reckon we were looking forward to it more than our two children aged seven and four. The lobby is amazing. The scale is fantastic & there is so much to look at. Check-in was relatively easy although our room was not ready when we arrived. This was not a problem as our bags were stored for us, allowing us to get on the bus to Animal Kingdom Park. By 1230 we were eating in the Rainforest Cafe. Having driven daily to Disney from hotel number one at the bottom of I-Drive, it was just so nice for Disney to take the strain, especially when we returned from the SpectroMagic Parade & fireworks late at night. No boats or monorails were required! We were able to establish our room number via Guest services, handy as I was running low on mobile credit. Our room had a Savannah view & our children were constantly on the balcony looking at the animals. Admittedly, it was a hike to our room which was on the same level as Reception. Our son loved the Night Vision sessions run by the experts in the hotel. He was also delighted to use the pool, something we had not found time for in the first week at hotel one, being so busy at all the parks. We ate at Jiko on our first night there as a bit of a treat for our anniversary. The food was delicious and the service attentive. Thanks to the strength of Sterling against the Dollar it did not seem overly pricey at all. They didn't bat an eyelid as our daughter sparked out on two chairs pushed together. We breakfasted at Boma once quite early just to have the Big Breakfast experience. That was very tasty and again the service was smashing. I was impressed that Disney does provide food at prices to suit all pockets. I also noticed that healthy food is now heavily promoted, unlike on our last visit nine years ago. The Mara provides quality fare at value for money prices. On our last day we chose to spend the day at Typhoon Lagoon rather than rush off to St Pete's. Checkout was a breeze-no need to visit the front desk. Our bags were then stored for us until we came back from the park in the late afternoon. During our stay we clocked quite a few non residents who had clearly come for a nosy. All those I could hear were impressed with what they found. The room was themed to a high standard, although we did find it a bit small for four after having a suite.We had two weeks' stuff with us, so didn't bother to unpack for just three days. The Disney magic was everywhere in the hotel. We really loved the experience of staying there. It is just perfect for children the age ours are and for big kids like us.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rabc1
Reviews.Content: My family and I have recently returned from two week holiday to florida. We stayed at the animal kingdom lodge and we loved everything about it! The lobby is fantastic, totally breathtaking, you really feel that you are in Africa. The room was standard but we had great views of the animals which again was amazing and the game keepers are always on hand to give any extra information. The room was big enough for the 3 of us and was cleaned everyday although a little dark, but that just adds to the effect. The staff were brilliant, part from one member but must nt grumble. The food in Mara and boma are well priced and on the whole very nice, Jiko is over priced and over rated. On the whole the hotel is top quality and would reccommend anyone to stay there. If your doing the whole disney thing then you wont need a hire car as the transportation is first rate.

Reviews.Title: “differing views”
Reviews.Author: Rachel87
Reviews.Content: We had travelled from the UK, for 9 and a half hours, to be told on arrival that there was a slight problem with our booking, and after getting over the language barrier, discovered somewhere that 2 rooms had been booked for us, not one, but to be fair we just wanted our beds, however no effort to put this simple mistake right quickly were made. The man at check in, was very abrupt and unhelpful, couldnt understand a word we said, and we had to write part of our details down, and we were english and he was american, we couldnt see the problem!!!! eventually checked in, and got to our rooms, to find that we are facing the construction. this wasnt a problem at first, because after booking a standard room, we were facing the savannah, but be warned, its quite noisy, and they kick off at about 6:30am. we had men on cranes outside our balcony windows on some days doing some kind of restoration to the woodwork, which we had no warning of. we tried to change rooms, however we only got offered a room overlooking the carpark, so decided to stick with it. the rooms are very spacious, with a tv, good sized balcony, and a well equipped bathroom. the housekeeping was absolutely fab, and on some days arranged our toys bought in the park into scenes and made butterflies out of our towels!! all the staff (other than the man at check in) were very friendly, and had great knowledge of the parks and travelling to other parks, they couldnt help you enough. the mara, which is a fast food typo place is very good for a quick bite, and very inexpensive. breakfast is nothing to shout about, but if your happy with toast, cereal, or croissants then your ok. the cooked breakfasts are vile, dripping in fat and oil and completely tasteless, however i dont know how much of this is down to our "english" tastes. the boma is a good place to eat, its an all you can eat buffet for around $25 a head. the food is very good and varied, and im very sure there will be something there for everyone to eat and be happy with, again the staff are on hand to let you know what some of the more exotic looking foods are. the jiko, we didnt really eat at, as it was more expensive, but talking to the locals, they said it was good food, however they insist on a large tip. the hotel lobby is fab, and theres always things going on, and things to look at for people of all ages. the pool is lovely, and lifeguards are on hand all the time. the hotel is very clean and kept, and there was no signs of dirt, rubbish or bugs in any of the pareas of the hotel we went to. to find half decent food, you have to go into the parks. we found the best place was the coral reef restaurant at epcot. its very much out the way of most attractions, so is a well kept secret. it was around $130 for 3 people for 3 main meals, 3 deserts and 2 drinks each, so not bad at all, and the atmosphere is amazing and the food exceptional. beware of the large groups of brazillians and mexican school groups, they are huge groups of around 40 kids, very loud and take up all the room on the buses around, so like i said, beware. make use of the extra magical hours, its much much quieter, and also use your fast pass, theyre great and get you on the rides with little or no wait. a must, is mount everest at animal kingdom park, but for smaller children there are plenty of rides at magic kingdom. as for the overall value of the hotel, it was alright, however i think we would probably stop at another hotel next time, because the construction ruined it abit for us, and the savannah rooms are very very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing....True Disney Magic”
Reviews.Author: drummer658
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge for the last week of June 2008. The Hotel lobby is really breathtaking. All the staff that I encountered were very friendly. The food was pretty awesome, especially at Jiko. This was the best meal that I have ever had on a Disney property. We were upgraded for free to a room with a view of the animals. I don't know what that one review was talking about. We had animals outside of our room every day. My kids really loved it. The beds were comfy and queen size. There were alot of fun activities within the Hotel itself. The only possible criticism is the Hotels remote location on the Disney property. I've read that this causes some long commutes on the buses, but I had my car and drove everywhere so it was not a problem for us. If you have kids they will really love it. This Hotel rules. Don't hestitate. It is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, some tips”
Reviews.Author: welove2holiday
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews, but I read some before I left and they helped, so here are my experiences. The hotel is spectacular...entrance lobby different class. It is very spreadout (in a kind of U shape with pool and restaurants at one end of the U. This means that if you are at the other end you have quite a walk on your hand. Tip I used and would pass on is to phone the hotel directly beforehand and ask for a room near the pool. We had a standard room, but i chanced my luck and asked for a room with a nice view. We were still given a standard room, but it was on the corner overlooking part of the savannah so got the bonus of the flamingoes from our balcony (room 4486 if you want to be really specific). Mara cafe sells refillable souvenir cups. Buy one or 2...we constantly filled it up with coke, coffee (not bad either) and ice water (that didn't taste of flouride!). 2 between the 4 of us was enough for the holiday. I gather it's a disney tradition, but a few dollars to the housekeeper each morning, and odd 'thankyou' note, and my daughters were amazed at all the different animals that were created by the towels (mickey ears, elephant, monkey hanging from clothes hanger, dogs (girl and boy), doll, bird, snake, and butterflies). She also set them out one day for a pool party on the bed, and one day we found them all (and daughters cuddly toys) around the remote control watching TV...nice touches). Buses to parks were mostly reliable, but did have a couple of big waits (40 minutes returning from Magic Kingdom one afternoon). Hotel has a laundry for use by guests...this might be obvious to some, but we hadn're realised and packed for 14 days worth of clothes. Reception have a special number to phone on the day (after 10 for less popular characters such as Daisy Duck) and can tell you where particular characters can be found on certain days. Perfect if you have a child desperate for a particular autograph!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice experience overall...”
Reviews.Author: SDLCHARLIE
Reviews.Content: Our family of 10 adults and 11 children, stayed at the resort for the 4th of july weekend, perhaps if the resort had not been so full i am sure our experience would have been excellent, but it was overall very very nice. The breakfast buffet is excellent, the dinner buffet not so much, very pricey and the food is a little different but not necesarily extraordinary. Lunch by the pool is a little simple, not many choices, and drinks not so exotic. Overall staff is very nice in trying to accomodate your needs, though i was extremely disappointed two persons in my party including myself did not get the king size bed request since hotel was at full capacity and we arrived late at night. We had savannah view, which is very nice, though animals are a bit scarse at times...for my taste the decorations in the room and the amenities in the room where a bit rustic, though i know it is a rustic theme overall...cleanliness is a 3.5 out of 5 in the rooms, could improve a little more, and rooms are a bit too small or too crowded with bigger rustic pieces that don't leave a lot of room to move around. There is no minibar or water provided in the rooms, not even for a cost, though there is a very big and very and well assorted store in the lobby where you can find basically anything you may be looking for. Sorroundings are breathtaking, beautiful, this is the plus at this resort, the pool area is absolutely a pleasure to be at, relaxing, a 10 overall for relaxation and amenities. Even on such a crowded season, and having such a big family, we were still able to secure a beautifully shaded spot, enough chairs, enough towels, just very very pleasant. The bonfire, or fire pit outside by the savannah, the structure and architecture and gardens of the resort are truly worth paying for, i think this is why people choose this resort over other Disney resorts. While i do not think i will be visiting soon, i would definitely visit again in the future as my dauthers grow for the wonderful nature experience and relaxation that you can enjoy at this resort as individuals and even more so as a family.

Reviews.Title: “Animals right outside your balcony!”
Reviews.Author: SBW-Raleigh-NC
Reviews.Content: The Animal Kingdom Lodge is a wonderful experience! We stayed in a savannah view room on the 2nd floor. There were always lots of animals right outside our balcony! Great viewing at all hours. As well as throughout the hotel - hallways have huge windows. The restaurant Boma was wonderful. Buses to the park were always readily available. We never needed a car. When leaving, our bags were checked at the hotel to save time at the airport and make our trip back home painless!

Reviews.Title: “Where were the animals?”
Reviews.Author: sandrad600
Reviews.Content: We recently came home from a trip to Disney World. We stayed 3 nights at the Contemporary Resort, and the last 2 nights of our stay was at the Animal Kingdom lodge. First, let me say that the Animal Kingdom lodge is more expensive than the Contemporary. We changed hotels because we wanted to see the animals and experience the resort. We were surprised that the Animal Kingdom Lodge's rooms were VERY small next to the comtemporary. Not only that, but the decorations and furnishings looked a bit shoddy when compared to the contemporary. Internet service was supplied by a free inroom computer at the contemporary. At Animal Kingdom Lodge, you needed to have your own computer, plus pay about $10 a day. After the initial disappointment with the size and looks of our room, we decided to check out the animals from our safari view window. There were 2 ducks and an ox. That was it. Each morning we woke to find vultures in our field of view, and nothing else. There was a brief period of time when a few giraffes came into view. That lasted about 20 minutes out of our entire stay. We found out that a bird had nested mid field that kept most of the animals away from our viewing area. I know these things can't be helped, but we felt that we should not have been charged the extra money for a safari view room when a nesting bird was keeping most of the animals away. We did love the lobby. And the fast food court by the pool. The pool itself was very nifty as it resembled a pond. There was something strange about the inpool lighting which made the water always appear as though it was a pond. Skip Bomas. The food was good enough, but they have the carving station in the middle of the buffet, which really slows things down. The wait to go through line was about 20 minutes. We believe that this could have been intentional so that people wouldn't get a 2nd plate full. Cost of the buffet was high for only one pass through the line. An 18% tip was automatically added to our bill. High for a buffet. My suggestion: visit the hotel. Check out the lobby and the gift shop. Eat at the food court (interesting food!). Look at the viewing areas to check out the animals. Bring a camera. Then go to a different hotel. The Contemporary has a much bigger room, a computer, monorail access to the parks, plus other perks.

Reviews.Title: “Great place...especially for kids!”
Reviews.Author: zachsmama
Reviews.Content: We are DVC members and AKL is our "home". We had never stayed there before, but we were very happy we did. We had 3 generations staying in our 2BR lockoff. It was our 2 year old son and 6 month old daughter's 1st WDW trip. Our room overlooked the savanna and my son would have been happy just sitting on the deck watching the animals. Every morning he would go on the deck and have his breakfast and end the day on the deck as well. Yes, our room overlooked the new Kidani Village being built, and yes there was some noise early in the morning, but when we spoke to the manager they were more than willing to make up for it. (in typical Disney fashion!) In fact, my son LOVED the fact he got to see animals AND bulldozers! There were only 2 drawbacks - 1 being that the hotel is only accessed through the lobby and when you are all the way out, it is quite a walk-BUT, a nice CM told us of a better & easier route to go. The 2nd was that I wish there were trails you could walk around. Maybe once Kidani Village is built, there will be. All in all, I would highly recommend AKL. The CM's are great, the food is awesome (especially on the food plan!) and the pool, fitness center and accommodations were typical Disney. BTW don't let the thought of "African" food scare you from Boma. I thought I would hate it, but I absolutely loved it! In fact, we went there 2x. The transportation system worked flawlessly as well and there were no long waits. BIGGEST TIPS- Take advantage of the free activities for the kids and adults. Also, MAKE RESERVATIONS FOR DINNER! Do not leave the dinners up to chance. We had a real hard time getting reservations at any restaurants the day of. AND DO THE DINING PLAN! (the basic is more than enough for anyone!) We hated to see people paying crazy $ while we just handed a card and got so much more food. People were spending well over $50 for a quick service breakfast for 4 at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: morigaine
Reviews.Content: I broughtmy husband to this wonderful resort for his birthday one year. It was all we expeted and more. I truly loved the hotel, the food, the grounds, and the staff. Out experience was nothing less than perfect. The shuttle service is in the form of busses. I would have rather taken the monorail, but it was not a feature at this hotel. We had a Savannah view and it was lovely. In the mornings and evenings we saw some baeutiful giraffes and other lovely animals, practically outside of our balcony. We were visiting in the middle of August, so during the day it was very hot. We spent most of our time at the parks and were not able to get to the pool. We did love the restaurants, and if you want to save some of your meal tickets (we had the meal plan) then spend them on Jiko. It was wonderful from start to finish. The food was beautifully presented and tasted delicious! Do yuorself a favor and have a romantic dinner at Jiko!

Reviews.Title: “loved the animal kingdom”
Reviews.Author: jab1170
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the AKL with my mom and 2 children. We go to Disney every year. We had a great room with a view of the pool. My mom is disabled so the room was closer to the busses. It rained the entire time we were in Florida but it didn't matter. The resort was so amazing we didn't even want to leave. I could sit on my balcony at night while my children swam in the pool. We ate At Bomas several times for breakfast and dinner, it was always great. The service was incredible. I am going again this year with 20 people. We are all so excited. Nothing beats sitting around a pool and watching a giraffe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort -- But Check for Hidden 'Surprises'”
Reviews.Author: mwgoldstein
Reviews.Content: We just completed a week-long vacation to Orlando with a 1-night stay at Disney’s Animal Kingdom Lodge. We had never stayed at a true Disney resort before, so we thought we’d stay here for a night to treat the kids to a true ‘Disney resort’ experience. We had looked at the Contemporary, Polynesian, Grand Floridian, etc., and I have to say that the AK Lodge is a much nicer looking resort. The main building is a great site to see. We were a little disappointed at the lack of viewable animals in the Savannah and Outlook viewing areas. A few giraffes, a couple of zebras, some random African cows, birds, etc., but nothing like what we were expecting after seeing resort pics online. Our room with 2 queen beds was nice, and while we didn’t pay a lot of extra money for a balcony with a great view, we could still see part of the pool area nearby. In general, our room was clean; however, there was a massive bloodstain on the sheets of one of the beds that couldn’t have been missed by housekeeping when they changed the sheets. Also, there was a beetle (or some other bug) that had been crushed into the netting above the other bed. We didn’t notice it until later in the evening, so it’s possible it wasn’t there before we checked in to the resort, but either way, it caused our kids (who slept in that bed instead of the one with the bloodstain) some anxiety until they fell asleep. We had breakfast the next morning at the Boma buffet, which was a fantastic meal with plenty of different selections for the entire family. All of the resort staff were helpful, and having the ability to check our airline luggage at the resort instead of having to take it all with us to the airport was nice as well. Our only other complaint had to do with the free Disney shuttle service, which of course had nothing to do with the AK Lodge themselves. Trying to get to Epcot, we hopped a shuttle bus displaying ‘Epcot’ on the front. Instead of going there, it went to Blizzard Beach and then to Hollywood Studios. We asked the driver when he was going to Epcot, and he said that he first had to go back to the Lodge and then would be going to Epcot. After leaving Hollywood Studios, he drove back to Blizzard Beach and then to the Lodge before finally going to Epcot. What should’ve been a 10-minute ride lasted almost an hour. I will say, however, that the shuttle ride back to the Lodge was much better. My advice on this topic is that if you take a shuttle, be sure to ask the driver where he’s going b/c what it says on the front of the bus isn’t always what the driver has pop up on his screen telling him which route to take. Our room without a view cost us $310 for the night. If this doesn’t seem like a lot to spend to you, I’d recommend this resort over some of the others that are even pricier. Otherwise, I’d look into a timeshare, which is how we spent the first week of our vacation…and overall, was a more pleasant value than staying at this Disney resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: brandaniell
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Animal Kingdom from June 11 -16. We booked a standard room but were upgraded to a Savannah room with bunkbeds (The kids, ages 4 & 7 loved them). We saw Giraffes, Zebras and several other animals every single day.Hotel staff was very wonderful, views were awesome and the pool was perfect. Housekeeping did a wonderful job. The restaurants as AK are awesome. We ate @ Jiko one night and it was delicious. The kids stayed at Simbas Clubhouse (on-site childcare) and they did not want to leave. Boma Buffet for dinner was very good. Lots of activities in the hotel for the little ones. Bus transportation was very good, buses showed up about every 10 minutes. We have stayed at several Disney Properties and by far, Animal Kingdom and Wilderness Lodge are our favorites, because they seem very accomodating for our small children.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: jd405
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at this resort every year since it was opened and we recently became DVC members with this as our home resort. I believe the negative reviews regarding this resort on this website are a bit misleading. There are some things you need to know before you book this hotel and some can be a deal breaker, but if plan ahead and ask the right questions (which you should) then you will be fine. I'll try to address all items one at a time. Hotel Atmosphere including lighitng: The hotel is wonderfully themed. It is a real treat to go from the theme of the parks to this resort which contrasts so nicely. The funiture, background music and adult feel make it a nice stay. The main areas of the hotel and hotel rooms are dark. This is a dark resort. It is meant to bring you the feel of sleeping in the wilds of Africa so the lighting is essential to the atmosphere. If you like lots of light stay elsewhere. Hotel Rooms Too Small: All hotel rooms are smal, but the AKL has some of the smallest. If you are traveling for an extended period of time or really require a lot of space then stay elsewhere. Bus Service: I have never had a problem with bus service at this resort, but I have at others I have stayed at. We have stayed at all the Deluxe resorts so I know. I think it's luck of the draw. Rude Staff: We have never come across this. I have stayed all levels (value, standard, savanah, deluxe savanah, pool, concierge) and all the check in's, check out's, requests, etc... have been made with a smile. Dinning Reservations: When you call central booking they tell you to make your priority seating arrangements months in advance. If you book a week before you come don't expect to get the resturant or time you like. Be smart! Disney is busy all year round. I can't stand when people complain about not getting reservations and then I come to find out they didn't plan correclty. GET A CLUE! No animals in the savanahs: Hit or miss. Sometimes they are loaded with animals other times there not. Too Adult: This is the main reason we like this resort. The adult feeling is nice aftering being in the kiddy parks all day. We love the bar and the fire pits. Long Walk to everything: Every booking we have done we have been told that there are long walks to and from places at this resort. This is true also at the Grand Floridian and Saratoga Springs. You can request rooms closer to the bus station, pool, etc... but they may not be able to honor that request. If you really feel that the walk will be too much don't book here. The wilderness lodge is around the same price and has shorter walks. Conclusion: We love this resort, but it suits our lives nicely. Like all speciality places you want to make sure it is the best fit for you . If you can't handle the items I listed above your better to stay at another resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice visit”
Reviews.Author: sjxray
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from 5 nights at AKL. We actually had a good location being on the same floor as the lobby and were close to the pool and busses. The rooms are a little small and somewhat dark but are very clean. The housekeeping staff was very friendly also. The pool was awesome and we spent a lot of time there. My sons loved the virgin drinks at the bar. The cafe was nice. The chicken pita was excellent. We tried Jiko one night and loved it. My friend got choked and was taken to the hospital and the hospital for surgery. The AKL paid for the ambulance and their taxi back. Overall I was very satisfied with the hotel. We only had a small problem with the airline check-in desk upon departure but was taken care of!

Reviews.Title: “A Disaster”
Reviews.Author: MeganFlorida
Reviews.Content: We planned to meet our family who lives out of state and flew in. They took "advantage" of the airport service. They arrived about 3:00 p.m. and did not get their luggage until the next day. Despite many requests, no one was helpful and as it turned out, their luggage was at the hotel the entire time. This was horrible, with two toddlers. I had to loan my sister in law clothing and toiletries. I tried to make dinner reservations at both AKL restaurants literally 5 minutes after arrival at the hotel. We were never able to get in either restaurant. We had to eat in the cafeteria for almost every meal. In my opinion, if you expect guests at the hotel, you should be able to accommodate them in your restaurants. I just hated this entire experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite "Disney" Enough”
Reviews.Author: RJCurran
Reviews.Content: I stayed for the first time at Animal Kingdom Lodge the week of May 17th thru 24th. We had a Savannah View room with a bunk bed and a Queen for my husband, my two daughters (ages 14 and 7) and me. While the decor was beautiful I have to say that the whole experience wasn't quite "Disney" enough for us. We don't expect...nor desire...there to be characters around at all times but there is a certain level of care that is expected when staying at a Disney resort. Especially one at this level. The rooms were a bit on the small side...and yes, they were too dark as many people have said before. I understand that you can't have light glaring out of the windows for the animals sake. Why, however, can't the bathrooms be better lit? They're nowhere near the animals. Both the sink area and the tub/toilet area were very dimly lit. We found housekeeping throughout the entire hotel to not be quite up to the standards that we had hoped for and seen in the past in other Disney resorts. Our room's housekeeping didn't really do much more than make the bed and change the towels. I don't believe the floors were ever vaccuumed, the ceiling fan needed dusting and we even had some left over debris from the previous guests. The lobby was guaranteed to have a glass or beer bottle left on one of the tables or African display cases. The attention to these little details from the staff seemed to be lacking. I also think the staff wasn't overly friendly. If approached with a question they were helpful but they didn't go out of their way to even say hello or see how you were doing. Other than the front desk and the animal staff, I don't think many of the others spoke English very well. Okay, all of this being said...the hotel was beautiful. Our room had wonderful views of giraffes, zebras, watusi, and other animals. My girls loved the pool and the slide. We ate often at The Mara and found their food to be tasty with adequate selections. My daughters and I loved the food at Boma (although it wasn't quite the cup of tea of my somewhat pickier husband!). The setup of the Boma buffet, however, I think needs some revision. I felt like everyone was tripping over each other and getting in the way of the servers when trying to wait in line to get their food. One of the lines is setup to go right in front of the entry to the kitchen where the waitstaff had to go with large trays. The entire restaurant had a somewhat crowded, dare I say chaotic, feel to it that I wouldn't exactly say made me feel relaxed. Part of the blame of this, though, needs to go to some of the patrons that were there the same night as us that pretty much let their children run wild. This wasn't the best place for this. The food there was slightly exotic and incredibly delicious. After all is said and done, would I stay here again? Probably not. Do I think everyone should try Animal Kingdom Lodge once in their life? Absolutely. The experience far outweighs the negative.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the resort but transportation issues were a problem”
Reviews.Author: WhoDey119
Reviews.Content: The Magic Kingdom opened at 7:00. We got in line for the bus at 6:11 AM we waited 45 minutes for the first bus to arrive. We finally got on the bus but arrived at the Magic Kingdom at 8:20 the extra magic hours had expired. Disney transportation officials had plenty of excuses but no explanation for the transportation delays. What was interesting EPCOT did not open until 9:00 AM but in the time it took three buses to arrive from the Magic Kingdom 8 buses came for EPCOT with no one or only a few dozen getting on the bus. We did talk with guests that took the EPCOT bus at 6:30 and caught the monorail to the Magic Kingdom. Transportation problems were an ongoing nightmare. My daughter loved this resort more than any other at Disney. We have stayed at Contemporary, Polynesian, and five other Disney resorts. She loved all aspects of the Animal Kingdom Resort especially the animals.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite Worth the Hype”
Reviews.Author: stitchfan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked into Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge in mid-May 2008. We were lucky enough to be able to book a savannah view room, which has a balcony that overlooks the lodge's manmade savannah. We're both animal lovers and nature enthusiasts, so we were very excited! We also frequently travel to Walt Disney World (we go about 3 times a year) and love it there. However, our stay at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge didn't go as well as we expected. Our first room (I'll explain why we changed rooms later) overlooked the Sunset Savannah, which was supposed to have giraffes and other African wildlife. All we saw were a kind of cattle that really wasn't too different than the common cattle you see in on an American farm. At least half of the savannah, if not more, was closed off due to construction. Most of our view was of cranes (not the animal-- the machinery!) and other building equipment. We were told that there would be some construction, but we were also told that the savannahs would not be affected. Again, the savannah was half closed off. I assume this is why the other kinds of animals were nowhere to be seen. We tried to make the best of it, but had a hard time sleeping our first night due to our air conditioning not working to it's potential. I usually like to keep the room around 68-70 degrees at night (my husband and I sleep better when it's cool) and couldn't get it lower than the mid 70's. With Florida's humidity, it felt much hotter, too. The hotel concierge was more than happy to move us the next day. I have a feeling they were used to people wanting to switch from the rooms with the construction view, because my husband barely uttered what the problem was before they offered to switch us. Our new room had a view of the Arusha Rock savannah, which really was breathtaking. We were happy to actually see animals like giraffes and zebra. We were also happy to be away from the construction. For two days, we often sat on our balcony, day and night, taking in the peaceful scenery. After those two days, we were not able to go onto our balcony due to a paper wasp infestation. I'm an entomology enthusiast and have worked in the field as an assistant, and believe me-- paper wasps are aggressive, even unprovoked. To top it off, my husband is allergic to bee and wasp stings. We called the front desk the minute we saw the wasps swarming and crawling all over our balcony, and they sent pest control. A man representing pest control came up after a few minutes and sprayed some Raid near the wasps. I knew that a little bit of Raid would never take care of the problem, and said so. The man assured me it would. Of course, the wasps did not die or leave and remained for the next 3 remaining nights of our stay. We coudln't even take video or pictures from behind our glass doors, because it ended up looking like something out of a 1950's sci-fi movie with unintentional close-ups of giant wasps. I know that it seems like this was a rare, unfortunate occurrence, and usually I would not completely blame the resort. However, upon checkout, after responding to how our stay was, two of the concierge staff cheerfully told us how they "battle those wasps everyday" at the resort. Not only was their pest control either incompetent or unequipped to deal with the problem, but the resort had had this problem before, and often! I asked how they usually dealt with it, since spraying a couple squirts of generic Raid could never fix the problem, but was answered in shrugs and "I don't know". We really didn't feel as if the staff cared how our stay was or about our safety. We were never offered another room after the first change or anything to compensate for all of the problems we had. We still were charged in full for a savannah view. Other than the problems we had, the grounds are pretty and interesting. The lobby, although intricate and detailed, is entirely too dark and a bit depressing. Another con is that the resort is pretty far away from everything but Disney's Animal Kingdom theme park. If you don't have a savannah view room, your only option for seeing the animals are the overlooks and after staying at the resort for six days, I can honestly say that it's kind of hit-or-miss that any animals will be in view. If you make an effort to go to the viewing areas at feeding time you'll almost definitely see animals, however. The animals are taken off of the savannahs for two hours everyday so that their habitat can be cleaned. Unfortunately, that time was when we woke up. I really think they should alternate what times they clean the savannahs so that people who wake up later than 8 or 9 AM can see them before they head out to the theme parks. The food at Mara, the quick service restaurant, is up to par with Disney's standards and was tasty. Boma, the hotel's buffet, was okay and offered a large variety of choices Most of the staff were cheerful and friendly. The pool is pretty and even has a slide. I really don't think my husband and I will be staying here again. If we could somehow be magically guaranteed that we wouldn't face the same problems or that said problems would be taken care of properly, perhaps we'd give it another try. In the end, I really don't think it's worth all of the hype.

Reviews.Title: “What a great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelear
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Animal Kingdom with a savannah view. It was awesome. We brought our binoculars and were able to see animals that were very far away as well as the ones that were very close. The rooms are very nicely decorated. Disney does an amazing job decorating it's hotels. Every little detail is thought through. Everyone was very friendly. The pool and hot tub were great. We did the night vision viewing also. There were 2 pair of night vision binoculars available and sharing was no problem. We ate at Boma. It was fantastic!!! It was clean, and had a nice atmosphere. The buffet was huge. We wanted to try it all, which was impossible. (because we were stuffed) Our teenage sons loved it. We will be going back to hotel and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Not a premier property”
Reviews.Author: gayler104
Reviews.Content: Although we had a great time & the hotel was adequate I thought you'd like to hear some of the negatives I found. This property is one of Disney's more pricey resorts & it certainly did not have the ammenities of a 4 star hotel. I was surprised that there was no phone in the bathroom nor adequate lighting. The toilet & bath shared the space & the light fixture was near the toilet, so you are basically showering in the dark. There is no mini bar if you want a quick snack or drink and our room was so far away from the lobby we relied on the pricier room service. We had a Savannah View room with bunk bed & queen bed. Our room was at the end of the Savannah so we did not have the greatest view, although we did see quite a few animals. Others have commented that the room was small. It was fine for the 3 of us. I have stayed at other Disney Resorts & by comparison this would rank (in my opinion) as a 6 out of 10. The staff was very friendly & the hotel very clean. It was just lacking some of the "extras" I had expected.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Hotel with a difference”
Reviews.Author: flydanair
Reviews.Content: Whilst the Disney hotels are usually very expensive we got a very reasonable deal through Expedia - so a tip is to check these out rather than go direct. The free Disney transfer took the hassle out of getting to and from the airport and was included for free. The hotel setting is amazing, the inside has a distinct African savanna theme and the animals walk right up to the hotel perimeter (great viewing platforms throughout the hotel). The rooms were very well proportioned and the African theme continued. The pool was huge, with a slide for younger children, there was ample room around the pool to sunbathe if you wished and there was a jacuzzi also. One of the best things about this hotel was the food. The hotel had three main restaurants. One was quite formal called Jiko (which we didnt eat in), one was very informal The Mara - better if you wanted a quick snack at lunch and the main restuarant called Boma - was a self service restaurant but the choice and quality of the food was excellent. I dont often eat in hotel restaurants and never from a self service restuarant but the food really was that good we ate hereat least 4 nights of our 10 night stay. Breakfast in this restaurant was equally as good. We took advantage of their room service - it has to be said their Chicken Cesar Salad was one of the best ive ever eaten. We had breakfast a few mornings in our room and all the food was fresh and of a high standard. There were two bars (one poolside and one inside the main building). Transport to and from all the Disney parks and downtown Disney was free, efficient and easy to use, with easy access for the disabled. All in all if you want to stay somewhere that little bit special, you cant go wrong with this Disney hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This was my mom's best Mother's Day present!”
Reviews.Author: nifferearly
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the end of an 8 night vacation. We had a savannah-view studio - it was our first stay as DVC members. Check-in was very smooth and we were able to get into our room around 11. Our room was beautiful! We saw lots of animals from our balcony, including giraffes and zebras. The pool was really nice. My son loved the zero-depth entry and waterslide. There was also a great playground. I think his favorite part of the stay was watching Mickey cartoons in the lobby. We've eaten at Boma in the past. Very good, but pricey. It's a good restaurant to experience once. We got breakfast at the quick-service restaurant and were very impressed with the food. My favorite part of staying at Disney hotels is the airport check-in. We have a lot of luggage since we have a toddler and it's so nice to leave it at the hotel. We will definitely stay at this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel but nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: Denise_Eames
Reviews.Content: Myself, husband and nephew (8) stayed at AKL between 10-24th May. We were so excited pulling up to the hotel as the building looks amazing when you turn the corner and enter the grounds. At check-in the receptionist told us we had been allocated a room overlooking the car-park but as there was a room available overlooking the Impala Savannah we could have that if we didn't mind the construction work, we agreed. We got to our room which was nicely decorated and we did not find it too dark as other reviews have suggested. The receptionist had not really explained how much construction was going on and I was really disappointed with the view. The construction totally spoiled our view and throughout the stay the animals kept away from the area. A couple of times in the early evening when we had managed to get back, we did see a few animals and it was facinating to watch them so close. I love animals so for me it was a real treat, I just wish I could have seen them more often. Loved being able to swim in the pool/use the jacuzzi when we got back each night and often stayed until about midnight. The pool was a nice temperature and there were always towels available at the poolside. Went to use the night-vision goggles once and found that there are actually only one pair available. You have to queue and then have a quick look before passing them onto the next family. We ate at the Mara a couple of times and the food was really nice for a quick bite. Ate at Boma once for an evening meal and thought the food was delicious. However, did think the restaurant looked a little dirty with food, napkins on the floor and it felt rushed. The layout of the hotel was so confusing and we needed to go such a long way out of our way to get to the pool, that was the most annoying thing about the hotel. We had not been given any advice when checking in so there could have been a quicker way but we didn't find it. Was happy with the location of the hotel, it did not feel too remote as we had a car and used the buses to get to Disney. Never had to wait too long for a bus going to the parks but did have a 45min wait one night returning from MK. This is a real chore when you have been walking all day/night and your feet hurt standing for 10secs! Needed to get a taxi to Universal one evening and paid $40, on the way back though it only cost us $31 - we realised the next day that the driver there had taken us on a longer route. Check at the hotel booking station how much the journey should be before leaving. Though we enjoyed our holiday very much, I can't say the hotel played a very big part in that. Disney think that the theming is the the only thing they need to make the hotel a success. There was no 'magic' or extra special service to make you think 'Wow, this is what I paid for'. I think the bus service, charge card and package delivery service are really useful and for this I would book a Disney hotel again, just not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Good to very good option for family”
Reviews.Author: vacationer71
Reviews.Content: My family of four was at the Animal Kingdom Lodge for just under a week. We stayed, as ordinary hotel guests, in one of the "Vacation Club" suites -- ours overlooked the giraffe savanna -- with one comfortable but modestly-sized bedroom, one large bathroom, and a main area consisting of a sitting area with couch convertible to bed for the kids, a dining area, and a full kitchen. The value proposition here was about B+/A-. The rate was very expensive but for the space we got, it was pretty reasonable, particularly given that it was in an overall rate with a premium dining plan (a real necessity at Disney if one is to really enjoy it) and park ticket plan. The suite's fit and finish was a solid A- to A -- nicely done kitchen, very well done bathroom, and decent bedroom and living room furniture. I could see how people could use this space for longer-term stays. Housekeeping, room noise, appliance and fixture functionality, were all fine. The hotel was able to accommodate an engineering request that in my experience many hotels won't accommodate (moving a DVD player from the living room to the bedroom). The check-in and check- out experiences were wholly adequate. While we did not use the hotel's airport baggage pick-up and shuttle, we did use the system for on- hotel baggage check and shuttle back at the end of our stay, and it worked fine. We didn't use room service even once due to the confiscatory way that Disney prices room service on its dining plans. We greatly enjoyed the "fine dining" restaurant Jiko; it is one of the highlights of the entire Disney World dining offering (and we tried at least half of the top-rated restaurants during our stay). The "Boma" buffet restaurant had a perfectly competent breakfast, although I can't imagine paying cash for it -- terribly overpriced. We never tried Boma's lunch or dinner menu. The pool area is nicely done, but nothing special, as far as I'm concerned. You pay a real price in terms of convenience with the location. There were occasionally long waits and long walks to and from the AKL buses. There is no bus service whatever to the other resorts or non-theme park destinations other than Downtown Disney, which require a trip of one or two connections. People who enjoy golf, or dining at the other resorts, or are on a trip with people staying at other resorts, can easily encounter door-to-door trips exceeding one hour if using Disney transportation. We found ourselves using cabs quite often. AKL has a number of kid-focused activities and other parent services, which we did not use and cannot report upon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but Wasn't the Best Disney Experience”
Reviews.Author: thepoorpirate
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Disney World after 6 day / 5 night stay. This time around we stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. The hotel was really cool in the African theme with dark woods. The lobby though kinda reminded me of a casino because it's so dark, ...but still very cool. Let me first say I love the Disney resorts. I'm an advocate to stay there to everyone I talk to that might be going to Disney. This is my 4th resort stay at Disney. I've been to Caribbean, Coronado (x2), and now Animal Kingdom. Here's the run down: 1) Animals: What you see on TV and the expectations really set the bar too high. There are animals there, but it's basically (as another reviewer said) a very small zoo. Most of the animals you can see are African cattle and flamingos. They do have a giraffe and a couple other cool animals, but that's about it at the resort. 2) Price: The price of what you get really wasn't worth it to me. Not only for the rooms / resort amenities, etc.. Rooms were much smaller than i expected. 3) Food / Cost of Food: Wow, if you come to Disney, be prepared to spend a lot on food. I've been to Disney about 3 times in the last 10 years. I never remembered having such an issue with Disney food. You'll be lucky to find a meal under $12 (even for breakfast) per person. Even at the Quick service restaurant, the Mara, a burger and fries will cost you $10 + another $2-3 for a drink. Which, by the way, the Mara has a decent selection but the food feel is definitely more toward a cafeteria. The buffet restaurant Boma was too expensive in my opinion. Dinner is $26 per person. The selection is pretty good, but $26 for a buffet? I think the breakfast buffet is $16. The pool bar was pretty good for drinks, although again a frozen rum drink will cost you $7.50 each. My brother and I went to the Victoria Falls "bar" to catch a baseball game one night and have a few drinks. They have a full bar but no beer on tap. Everything is bottled. 4) Pool: The pool I liked. It's concrete and has a very natural look & feel to it. It claims to be heated, but didn't really feel like it. There are 2 hot tubs hidden away around the pool which were always packed with people / kids. One cool thing about the pool is that it's open 24/7. 5) Bus rides: I really like the resorts because you can catch a bus to everywhere in Disney without the worry of a car or parking. But be aware that staying at Animal Kingdom lodge, you are the furtherest out from everything else at Disney. So unless you are going to Animal Kingdom park, you're at least 25 minutes away from everything. 6) Someone else said this as well, but the balcony is very small. There's basically two seats and a table and not much else for room. 7) Layout: Layout of the lobby and restaurants is kinda confusing. It's situated on about 2.5 floors and it's very easy to get turned around. 8) Desk service: I had a bad experience here x2. Our check in hostess basically told us nothing at check in. She would walk off to this back room and come back several times. Finally one trip she came back with keys. This was after playing on the computer for about 15 minutes. I think she might have said 2 words to us the whole time we stood there. It was disappointing because the folks checking in beside me had a great guy who gave a ton of great tips on getting around, the restaurants, some of the hotel features, etc.. Additionally, I had requested a fridge & microwave for our infant daughter. The fridge was there no problem, but we had asked about the microwave. I mentioned it to our check in hostess and she gave me no response. I asked her again and she nodded, but never really did anything about it. Someone else stepped up and said we'll check on that for you. Time goes by... no microwave shows up. So i head back down about 2 hours later and ask again. The desk attendant this time was very rude and didn't really listen. She kept explaining that standard rooms don't get microwaves. I told her 3 times that i understood and every time she said the same thing back to me. She picked up the phone to take a call like she was going about her business and was giving me that line once again. Feeling like she wasn't listening I turned around and walked off. 3 hours later, the microwave shows up... while my daughter had already gone down for the night. This wakes my daughter up and was a whole ordeal as you can imagine. 9) WiFi: Internet access costs $10 per day. Luckily i have a verizon card supplied by work, but i would think at the price paid for everything Disney could at least throw in wi-fi. 10) Magical Express: This was a nice service. We didn't have to get our bags at the airport. Disney folks got them and about 2 hours later they show up in our room. Different story going back though as it's sorta up to you to handle things. All in all it was a good stay, but i definitely won't go back to Animal Kingdom Lodge. Just wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Location away from it all!!”
Reviews.Author: Bunneygirl1
Reviews.Content: Overall this is the perfect place on Disney property to stay if you do not want to be in the hustle and bustle of the madness of Disney. This was my first trip to Disney but I did get to visit most of the other hotels as I booked lots of other hotels for dining (something I would strongly suggest you research and book before you go to save being disappointed at eating quick service meals only), and have to say that AKL is a very impressive hotel on first impressions....However...I agree with a previous reviewer that it is just the same as 'a very small zoo' and once you have seen the animals, you have seen them. I was also not able to have a Savannah view room due to popularity, even though I had booked one and they wanted an extra $500 per night to be upgraded to a suite (which I declined). I soon got over my disappointment at not having a Savannah room and wasnt there enough to benefit from a savannah view room anyway. If you plan on sitting on your balcony all day every day then maybe you would!!! The food was a bit spicy for my husband but should have thought about that before booking an African themed hotel!! One person has commented on the colour of the pool water - it is supposed to look like that. It is supposed to be a tropical oasis so the floor is coloured green to give the impression of swimming in a lake or river. As above, if you want a proper sit down breakfast in the morning you will need to book Boma for every day to avoid disappointment as the walk in wait can be about 90 mins otherwise. Shop is quite big and sells all the little bits and bobs you forget like toothpaste and sun cream etc. Never had a problem getting a lounger by the pool. Even had waiter service by the pool. Try the blue glowtinis!!! Travelling around can be a bit time consuming by bus service as its so far away but after all...you are on holiday...whats the rush! I am not a snob but due to the price of the accommodation you do tend to get nice refined families there as opposed to the large families with screaming kids. Concierge services were all very good at reception. Very knowledgeable. Check in fairly fast and gave me all the information i needed. Room was cleaned daily. Towels and toiletries refreshed every day. House keeping very friendly. Came home one afternoon to find the tv on and the childrens bears propped up at the end of one of the beds with the remote control to look as if they had been watching tv whilst we were out. Very effective. My daughter loved it! Arline in the Mara very helpful to 1st time guests with dining plan. Lovely lady. Be nice to her she only gets 1 day off per week. Most of the staff are of African origin. Can sometimes be a bit of a language barrier but never had a problem that couldnt be resolved. Lifeguards at the pool all very vigilant. Several times saw one jump in to rescue little kiddies. Towels always stocked up and available at pool side (take these to water parks with you else you'll have to pay $1 for your towels there)...Life jackets in short supply by the pool side though. People seem to bag them in the morning and hide them next to their sun loungers even when their kids are not using them! Look out for the resident duck who has just had ducklings and takes them for a swim in the pool every morning! All in all lovely location, quiet and relaxing. Will not be going back as a lot to pay when you can go to Port Orleans French Quarter for 1/2 the price and from what I have been told, the same service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laen27
Reviews.Content: The grande foyer is beautiful when you enter the hotel. The rooms are tight and only are made for a family of four. The pool is large and inviting with many loungers to enjoy the sun. The Boma buffet is great and the overall experience was very good. I would recommend requesting a room away from the front as the Disney shuttles can be noisy. The black out drapes allowed you to sleep in after a late night. Great Disney hotel!

Reviews.Title: “There are cheaper hotels...”
Reviews.Author: Templar999
Reviews.Content: Stayed late April into early May for two weeks. Would not stay again due to the fact that; 1) too expensive for the available facilities. 2) wildlife no better than a VERY small zoo. 3) rooms very small and not very clean. 4) to far from the main Disney parks. 5) pool not the most pretty due to broken concrete/colour and cleanliness of water. 6) very small balcony which could only fit two seats on it so the expected family gathering over drinks and watching the animals was impossible and we had an up-graded room...! Is this quality what Disney is all about..? I would expect that a corperation of this stature would have a far higher standard in its Premier Resorts... you pay Disney prices so is it too much to expect the Disney quality that is promoted all over the world..? If the hotlel were half the price then I WOULD consider staying again but as this is not going to happen then on my return to Orlando I will give this hotel a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: MNhoops
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week stay at the Animal Kingdom (5-7-08 - 5-14-08) and I cannot say enough great things about the resort. When we first checked in we were given a room with a Savannah View but it was right next to the construction work. There was a hugh construction crane right outside our room. We returned to the front desk and were given new accomodations without any problems. We were then given a pool view room and were very pleased with it. Plenty of places to see the animals. Mousekeeping was fantastic. The room was very nice and comfortable. My kids (6 and 9) loved everything about the resort...the pool, the animals, the arcade, the night vision ect.. The Mara was a great place to grab a quick bite to eat. Never had any problems with the buses. My only complaint would be the bartenders at the pool side bar seemed very crabby all week, they just didn't have that normal "Disney" cheer to them that the rest of the resort employees had.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: lbfreder
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a great stay at the AKL. I stayed at this hotel for two nights with my Mom and best friend and we had a great view from our balcony. I did book a savannah view room on the Zebra trail. The room was adequate size, not huge but we weren't at Disney to stay in the room. The animals are outside from late afternoon until about 10 in the morning. They can NOT come up to your balcony; there is a carefully disguised barrier that keeps the animal way from the people. The best time to view the animals during our stay was earlier in the morning while it was still cool out. The lobby, halls and rooms are a little darker because of the theme but I enjoyed that because Florida is so bright. We used the cafeteria for the meals we ate there, standard stuff and no waits. Yes, it is expensive to stay here but a nice experience, beautifully decorated and a great staff. The only complaints I have are the bus wait times and the fact they made no effort to conceal the fences in the background.

Reviews.Title: “Great place buses a little slow”
Reviews.Author: Brady8
Reviews.Content: We stayed April 24-29 and really liked the Animal Kingdom Lodge. We had a poolside room and at the end of the hallway was a great place to see animals. Many other posters have talked about the darkness and I agree but it adds to the atmosphere. Check in was great and everyone was friendly. The only disappointment was no towel animals left in our room and while the room was clean it wasn't exceptional. We ate at Boma the buffet restaraunt and while not a wow the food was very good. The Mara is the other counter service restaraunt and it was great to pick up something for breakfast before heading to the parks. That is where our biggest disappointment was. The animal kingdom lodge is the furthest from the parks and I knew that before we stayed here expecting longer drive times to the parks. I was not expecting ridiculously long waits for the busses to arrive. Obviously the animal kingdom park buses were plentiful as it takes 5 minutes to get there. 40 minutes to wait for Magic Kindgom Epcot and MGM was not necessary. By the time the buses arrived some people had to wait for another bus which could potentially have been another 20-40 minutes. One evening we waited at MGM for almost an hour while we watched 4 pop century buses come by to do pickups for that hotel before 1 came for us. It is a shame because the lodge is beautiful and relaxing and I would recommend staying there, but you must consider renting a car. Waiting 10-15 minutes is no big deal when you are consistently hitting 30-40 minutes there is a problem.
