Reviews.Title: “Hard to see animals”
Reviews.Author: joe44334
Reviews.Content: Walked in with no reservation and got a room for 2 nights. The lobby was nicely decorated, but a bit dark. The room was very nice with an African theme, but my balcony overlooked the hotel entrance. The pool area is large, but the water color thru me off a little. I think it is made to look like a river , but I just like the normal bright blue pool color. When I walked to the animal viewing area, I was shocked to see how far the animals were- not too much of an attraction in my view. I paid over $300.00 per night, and honestly other Disney Resorts are a better value.

Reviews.Title: “A Dream Come True”
Reviews.Author: DeniseBournemouth_UK
Reviews.Content: My husband, 24 year old daughter and I stayed at the Animal Lodge Hotel from 19-25 April 2008 as a special celebration for our silver wedding anniversary and my husband's 65th birthday. We had been warned about the developement but we didn't see or hear any work going on. We were on the Zebra Trail and it was wonderful. The room, with a savannah view, was perfect - not small at all - the service was effecient, friendly and understated. The breakfast selection at the Boma restaurant was plentiful and fresh and the wait for a table was very short. The swimming pool with 3 lifeguards during the day was warm and inviting and a moonlight swim at 10pm one evening was a delight. For me the hi-lite of our stay was watching giraffe from our balcony. There were several animal watching areas with knowledgeable rangers happy to answer questions about the animals. The transportation was brilliant and we never waited for more than 15-20 minutes for a coach from any of the parks or the hotel. We had looked forward to our trip for two years and our expectations were high and we all agreed that it was even better than we had hoped. We would recommend this hotel for anyone as there was plenty of entertainment for children of all ages or time and space just to sit and watch the animals.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced not many animals and dark rooms”
Reviews.Author: trapar
Reviews.Content: I was soo looking forward to staying here but quite frankly it just does not live up to the hype. This was my 7th visit to Disney and my first and defiantly last visit to the animal lodge . Its just not very good value for money . We were in room 3431 which in theory gave a good view of the “savannah” but its not really a savannah its just a bit of greenery in between hotel rooms with a few animals that come out when fed . We only saw them at around 7ish each evening when they were fed and there were the same ones every day – 2 giraffe a couple of zebras and some cow things with big horns, I saw more bunny rabbits than anything else ! In addition we mainly looked over the public viewing area which was ugly to look at and due to the lack of animals resulted in more people staring at me than the savannah! There is another savannah at the back of the hotel which you can also view form the pool area which has more interesting animals and baby giraffes so if you pay all those extra dollars for a savannah view like I did make sure you ask to be on that side as I can’t recommend where we were ! The room was very small and very dark . The do not disturb sign and pre order for breakfast was removed after the 2nd day and not returned ! The pool was very busy and if you want a child free swim then first thing in the morning is your only chance as there is just the one pool . In addition there was no bath only a shower – I really do expect for a hotel of this price to have a choice of cleaning facilities ! The room was VERY basic to say the least . We did not venture into Boma as it looked like hell on earth with screaming kids everywhere . Hoping for a more adult orientated meal we booked Jiko for 9.20 one evening (be warned at Disney you need to book ALL meals in advance) . The food was average and even then there was still plenty of children when we first arrived so may not be the romantic meal you planned for if you dine any earlier . The after dinner cocktail was heaven though and service good. The main plus things were check in , radio that you could plug your Ipod into and the lobby area and pool bar are fab . (oh and there is very minimal noise from the construction work on the new villas) Wait for buses were at least 20 mins and lot longer for the animal kingdom where you would normally find the first bus to full to get on – how ridiculous that there is no way to walk there ?? To sum up if you are an adult with no kids give it a miss and stay at the Swan or Dolphin instead . Still had a great time as love Disney but just not worth the dollars I am afraid .

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere and Theme”
Reviews.Author: Zife
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights on our honeymoon. The staff was amazing, and was very accommodating to all of our requests. I called in advance and had them set the room up with rose petals and a welcome package, everything was perfectly set up when we got there (although we had to call to ask them to clean them up, the maids won't clean up that kinda thing unless you ask them to). We stayed in the Kilimanjaro Club, so we had automatic savanna view, along with our own concierge floor. It was worth every penny. They contact you before your stay and set up anything you want to do, including private safaris, dinner reservations, etc. One person in a review before me mentioned that it wasn't worth it to book a savanna view room, but we thought it was great. You could wake up before going to the parks and see anything from zebras to giraffes to Ankole cattle. Its a lot easier to just look out your window than try to get a good spot on some of the viewing platforms. We ate at BOMA one of the nights of our stay, and the food was amazing, although since it's African, it has a lot of spices some people may not like. They have a massive salad bar too. We didn't have a chance to eat at Jiko, since it has a dress code, and we didn't have anything fitting the code, but it looked great, and has tonnes of Zagat awards up in the entrance. All in all, we had a great stay, and wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: patmatleo
Reviews.Content: Great themed hotel! Staff was attentive and accomodations wonderful. Pool area large, with slide, two hot tub areas and pool side bar. AKL was very clean and well maintained. Animal viewing fantastic throughout the lodge and loved the abilty to see animals through night vision goggles at viewing areas behind the pool. Wait time for buses not bad at all... A draw back is AKL is very large and all parking areas and bus pick up areas are at the front of the lodge due to the savannahs surrounding the rest of the property. Be prepared to walk... I would highly recommend this resort to anyone looking for a 'deluxe' Disney experience...

Reviews.Title: “Good, with some precisations”
Reviews.Author: Doctor G 06
Reviews.Content: Checking-in has been slower than our tiredness wished. Maybe because of my fault in explaining we needed to sleep after a 19 hours travel, the bellman did not retained our luggage and insistently woke us in the heart of the night. The hotel and room were very comfortable and animals browsing under our balcony make it very special. Being not adequately aware about the need of reserving even breakfast, we found rather strange the unexpected hotel’s inability to automatically provide food accommodation to its guests, as we so far presumed should be the rule for a luxury resort. At 7 a.m. , I’ve been rigidly denied any reservation at the hotel’s restaurants by an unhelpful concierge, who pretended everything was booked and proposed me to stay in line in the afternoon to try to secure some place, or to waste my holiday time in searching around the huge Disneyword area. I had to protest with a manager, who promptly accommodated us for breakfast in a hundreds-capacious restaurant, that, despite computers stating its overbooking, was simply desert…. He also kindly provided us with a reservation at the Boma restaurant for the first evening. You may like or not the sweaty taste everything was given. What really appeared weird to me was the urged 18-20% service tip for a self-service, so that the waitress was awarded some 40 $ to bring us a bottle of water and one of (ridiculously overpriced and very modest) South-African wine.. After having nice dinners in different restaurants of the Disney area (at Wolfgang Puck excellent service and food were provided at the price of a long round-trip from the hotel which has been physically demanding after a whole day in the parks), I insisted for a reservation at the four-diamonds awarded Jiko restaurant of the hotel. I’ve been lucky enough to find a different concierge who immediately provided us what we requested, allowing us to rapidly reach our beds after dinner, which was nothing more than fair. In one word, be sure to book EVERYTHING in advance and, should you need anything straying from the rigid programs likely requested to handle an organization as big as a whole county, hope you are lucky in finding somebody elastic and helpful enough to match your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, don't pay extra for the savannah view.”
Reviews.Author: yumyumman
Reviews.Content: Only there one night. Pool side view was great. The animals are not always out and about on the savannah, and seldom come that close to the rooms. There are also many viewing areas inside and outside the hotel to watch the animals sleep. Recommend you NOT Pay extra for a savannah view. The BOMA restaurant breakfast buffet was excellent but the dinner buffet was even better with many tastes you would not expect. Service was 5 stars, everyone happy to see us. Generally a Disney trademark.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: sonicglitter
Reviews.Content: My Mom, boyfriend and I stayed here for one night on March 10. We wish we could have stayed longer but we were switching to another resort for my Mom’s business trip the next day. Check-in was quick and painless and the staff was very helpful and friendly. We booked a Savannah view room with two queen beds. I don’t know what everyone is complaining about the rooms being too small, but that’s not the case. We had three adults sharing one room and we were perfectly fine. The room is nicely the themed and the beds were comfortable. We absolutely loved the Savannah view and the balcony. It was so peaceful and relaxing. It is worth it if you can reserve it. We went to the pool in the afternoon and we able to get a seat with no problem. This pool is a kid’s dream because it has a waterslide but there is also a hot tub for the adults too. And a bar. The bartender we had was so friendly and quick. Frozen drinks by the pool are a must. Yes, the pool does look like it’s dirty but it’s really not, it’s painted that way. Disney is all about themes and some people forget that. We had lunch and breakfast at the Mara, which is the quick-service restaurant. We had no problems with lines or waiting and we went at what most people would think would be busy times. Everything at Disney is expensive, but eating at quick service restaurants can save money in the long run. For dinner that night we ate at Jiko. You must go here. It’s wonderful. We all had a really great experience eating here and the food was terrific. Definitely make a reservation (or as Disney calls it, a priority seating arrangement). If you don’t make a reservation, you will probably be waiting for a while. The décor was beautiful and it features an open kitchen. This hotel is beautiful, especially the lobby – it was just stunning. We were in awe of how gorgeous this hotel is. At night, there is a fireplace that is lit in the lobby and a firepit outside right down the stairs in the lobby. The one problem we had with the resort was the shuttle system. The morning we checked out we needed to take a bus to Epcot and then take the monorail to the resort we were checking into. We waited for 30 minutes for a bus and one never showed, so we ended up taking a cab to the resort we were checking into. This is such a pain. The shuttles should run more frequently. The other minor problem we had was the confusing layout. But after trial and error we were able to figure it out. Just remember all the restaurants are pretty much right next to each and the pool. Other than that one major problem, don’t believe what everyone else says, the Animal Kingdom Lodge is wonderful and we all want to go back. It’s one of the best hotels we have stayed in there (next to the Grand Floridian). We were all sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: CT_Road_Warrior
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week and had a great time. The pool was busy but not overwhelmed by the numbers of people staying at the hotel. Jiko, the restaurant at the hotel, was magnificent! Bomo buffet was very good also. The one complaint I had was the bedding at the hotel. (believe it or not!) The sheets made quite a bit of noise when those in the room rolled over during the night. The crinkling of the sheets was really strange and it woke up everyone in the room! Bizarre.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: taylorcat
Reviews.Content: Animal Kingdom is amazing. Would go here again, seeing the animals in the savannah is just wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: cgilmore267
Reviews.Content: I cant say enough about Animal Kingdom Lodge. My family just loved it. When we arrived, we were told that we were the "Family of the Day", of course this came with some perks. Good perks. Upgraded room and free freshment thoughout the day on the 6th floor. We received the gold key. At first i thought that I was dreaming but it was all real. The staff was friendly and always ready to lend a hand. We ate at Bona, great food and a great variety. We didn't have to wait long to be seated. I felt like I was in paradise when I woke up each morning and the animals was out grazing the land. Thanks Disney for this wonderful experience. The last time I was here, was when I was a little girl. Boy! have this place grown since that time. My son will never forget this experience. The transportation between parks was also great!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: Dancebluecat
Reviews.Content: Well we had a fantastic time at Animal Kingdom Lodge and plan to stay there again when we next go to Orlando. Check in took 5 minutes with a very helpful member of staff who allocated us a lovely Savannah room on the fourth floor Zebra trail (we had paid for the Savannah view). The room was absolutely fine and no smaller than other rooms we have stayed in with very clean simple African inspired decor and well the view was stunning - we walked on to our balcony to see giraffe, zebra and ancone cattle straightaway and we never failed to be amazed at the amount and variety of the wildlife outside - this is what you are paying for and boy is it worth it. The lobby is breathtaking and none of us found the lighting too subdued - it was very restful infact and the hotel at night was very quiet. The pool is beautifully appointed and pleasantly heated - a little busy at times but it was open 24 hours a day. We didn't take part in any of the arranged activities mainly because we were out in the parks all day and every day but they looked well organised and plenty of variety. We ate in the Mara for breakfast and found it set us up for the day with tasty food - obviously being in Disney it was a little pricey but thats life. The Disney bus service was very efficient and we normally didn;t wait longer than 10 minutes for a bus to take us to one of the parks each day. The journey is a little longer than from some Disney resorts but there is no second pickup so no stopping and starting each time. We reckoned on our trips from hotel to park turnstile entrance normally took around 45 minutes and anything less was a bonus. Disney manages to weave lots of magic and we had the most fantastic holiday visitng all the parks and waterparks each day - it is the most amazing holiday experience and one we want to repeat soon ! Highly recommended resort - clean, imaginative, friendly staff and awesome Savannah.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Experience in AKL”
Reviews.Author: marciacasey
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Animal Kingdom Lodge (AKL) on April 5 2008 for a one week stay. Got two rooms – one “villa” with a Savannah view (495 per night) and one a partial Savannah view (309 per night). The Savannah room was for our in-laws and two nieces who are major animal lovers. The Savannah “villa” room was a major disappointment. It is a tiny (did I say tiny) room with a queen bed and a pull out sofa-bed. What we thought we booked (based on the description by Disney Reservation) and what we got were like night-and-day. To say that we were disappointed would be an understatement. After my wife complained about the “villa” room…we were basically told that this is what we booked and tough luck. We can leave the hotel if we wanted to as they were fully booked. I was ready to walk out and check into the Ritz Carlton. The club level at the Ritz is cheaper than AKL. My nieces wanted the animal view so we were stuck. My wife had a mini-breakdown at the reception. She worked so hard to make this a perfect vacation for our nieces and a major part of the Disney experience was a disaster. Our other room was ok. It is in the same league as a Hampton Inn without the view. Our room at AKL had an excellent view of the animals. We woke up every morning to see Giraffes, Zebras and other animals just outside. This was a pleasant surprise since we were expecting a parking lot view when we checked in. The lodging part of the vacation went from bad to worse. The toilet in the Villa “Savannah” room started to backup from day 1. A previous guest apparently flushed a bar of soap and this caused the toilet to malfunction. The engineers came three times but could not fix it. It would be ok for a couple of flushes and then malfunction. After the fourth time…I had enough and threw a fit at the front desk around 10 PM. It was unacceptable that a 4-star hotel charging $495 per night could not provide a functioning toilet for guests, especially old disabled guests. Four days without a working toilet is not acceptable. They immediately sent engineering to yank the toilet out and replace it with a new one. Unfortunately after engineering did this they forgot to tell housekeeping to clean up the mess. We had to live with a stinky messy toilet till the next day as it 12 PM and we were exhausted after visiting the parks all day. The concierge desk at AKL were pretty unhelpful. Some were nice but a majority of them seemed to be unprepared. Make sure you plan carefully if you need wheelchairs at AKL or theme parks. Double check the information given as it is often inconsistent. We were going to the Hoop-Dee-Doo Musical Revue at the Wilderness Lodge. It was raining and was a cars-trains-boats-bus type journey before it was over. Nobody seemed to know exactly where to park and which mode of transportation would result in the least amount of walking for my mother in-law. Don’t bother asking concierges about restaurants outside of Disney or even directions outside Disney. They were pretty clueless. Other than our hotel room fiasco…the Disney experience was pretty amazing. Despite the crowds we were able to get on most rides without much of a wait by using the FAST pass and some planning. We did four Disney parks and two Universal parks in six days. The Universal parks are a must do if you like more adventurous rides. Make sure you get the Express pass at Universal it will save you 30-45 minutes in line at each ride. Bottomline – don’t stay in Disney Animal Kingdom Lodge if you can avoid it. There are much better hotels at a fraction of the cost around the theme parks if you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlSydMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at AKL Apr 3-7, 2008 and enjoyed our visit. We stayed in a pool view room however we were able to view the animals from many different locations throughout the hotel. The hotel itself is beautiful – especially the lobby. The kids loved the pool area and water slide the most. The bus service was perfect – we never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus to any of the parks or downtown Disney. We also really enjoyed the daily activities for the kids. My daughter decorated a back pack and had a great time doing it. The only real ‘con’ that I can think of was the distance from most of the parks (except the Animal Kingdom). The kids fell asleep every night on the way home from the parks due to the pretty long bus ride. I’ve stayed at Wilderness Lodge and prefer it due to it’s proximity to most of the parks. I was a bit disappointed that Mousekeeping never made us any towel animals. Every day when we came back to the Wilderness Lodge last May we had wonderful towel animals that made us laugh – not one time did Mousekeeping do that for our kids at AKL. It’s nice to say I’ve stayed here however I think I’ll choose another hotel in WDW (I’d like to try them all eventually!) or go back to Wilderness Lodge before I stayed at AKL again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DoninTN
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge online through the Disney reservation system. After doing research online, we requested an Arusha view room with bunk beds for our two boys (11 and 9). Upon arrival, I mentioned the Concierge level, and the desk clerk called a manager over. For only a $30 upcharge per night, they offered to move us to the Concierge level. As we were on the standard Disney Dining Plan, we figured the cost savings of breakfast alone would pay for the upgrade. This trip marks the 4th time we have stayed on a Concierge level at a Disney Resort, and by far, this was the most disappointing experience. To explain, I will categorize my disappointments. First, the service was substandard. Frequently, we would visit the concierge room well within posted times of operation only to find that there was nothing available there (food & refreshments). We rose early one morning to take advantage of an early opening in the Magic Kingdom. We ended up missing the early hours because the staff was so late in putting out a breakfast. Although there were exceptions, we mostly felt we were an intrusion into the day of the staff…definitely not a “Disney” experience. Second, the transportation was a disappointment. I realize that we were there during peak times, but the promised bus every 15 minutes frequently turned into 30 and 40 minutes. Once, after waiting over 30 minutes, we took a bus to Epcot and rode the monorail to the Magic Kingdom. In my opinion, it would have been faster to stay off property and rent a car. Finally, the facilities were quite a disappointment. Although it was nice to occasionally see an animal from our balcony, and the property was nicely themed, I was very surprised at the mistakes that were very “un-Disney.” I have always appreciated Disney’s knowledge and ability to handle large groups efficiently. However, I can only guess that the designers of this property were Marriott people. The food court was designed so that the smallest of crowds created traffic jams and impasses. Food lines end into walls and corners with no exit other than walking through the line waiting to move forward. The building was laid out to make reaching the rooms difficult. Even the concierge setup was designed so the entire food line had to stop while someone used a toaster. We took the cruise following this, and I honestly think our stateroom was larger than our hotel room. Even the swimming pool missed the mark, made from stained concrete to give the appearance of a watering hole. Although a nice “imagineer” idea on paper, but in practice, who wants to spend time around a pool with “dirty” water? After our visit, we understand why Disney is pushing so hard to sell units of this facility to the Vacation Club. I am confident that if you haven’t already prepaid, you won’t come back to this place. To be called a “Luxury Resort” by Disney is very misleading, and for the price that we paid, we expected much, much more.

Reviews.Title: “Bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: blades72
Reviews.Content: This was our third hotel we had visited having stopped at a cheap motel on I drive then a 4 star hotel in St Petes beach and to be honest it was probably our least enjoyable hotel. As per the review below we waited ages to get checked in and it did seem that certain people were getting preferential treatment with regards the level of service they recieved at reception. The room was nice, the view good and pool good. The downside was what seemed to me like a lack of atmosphere or personal touch due to the shear size of the hotel (on the hotel plan the rooms are numbered up to 6400 - I'm positve there were more rooms than the 1293 as indicated on this site). The lobby whilst architecturally stunning was not a place to sit and relax or meet people and the meal we had at Boma's was the worst Disney meal we have ever had. The housekeeping was excellent but they were the only staff we seemed to have contact with as to all the rest of the staff it seemed you were just a number. to summarise the hotel was spotless, facilities good but and this was a big but for us was lacking the personal touch I was expecting

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge ("oh dear")”
Reviews.Author: ormefamily
Reviews.Content: Arrived at AKL on 20th March 2008. Quede a long time to allocated a savanah room. No bellboy or any assistance with luggage, room average. Ordered room service food was good. Came down to breakfast on the 21st 7.10 a.m. at Boma, people queing as Boma does not open until 7.30 (parks open at 8.00 a.m) food was very average and also they suggest (printed on till receipt either 18% or 20% tip). On the 22nd we asked at reception if it would be possible to keep our room on for a late checkout we were told that they could not confirm until 24 hours before departure. (why). Then enquired at concierege desk about restaurants outside of Disney we were told they were not allowed to give out that information they could only promote Disney restaurants. Then asked the question did they have any information on Sea World again not allowed to give out this information. After spending a wounderful day at Sea World we decided that although we had paid for 8 nights accomodation we would leave after 2 nights, returned that afternoon packed and checked out 6 nights early. The lady who checked us out did not ask why we were leaving early. Checked in at the Ritz Carlton - excellent.

Reviews.Title: “It Was What We Expected With No Disappointments”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTGS
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Animal Kingdom Lodge during spring break 2008. The hotel came highly recommended, and did not disappoint in any way. We booked two interconnecting rooms with a Savannah view on the Zebra Trail. We took this option over a suite, because it gave us an additional bathroom, and actual beds, rather than a sofa bed which gets a little old for a week. It was interesting that on some days there would be very few animals, and on others they were everywhere. There are many observation areas for guests who don't have the view, but we all enjoyed relaxing on our balconies and watching the animals. The hotel's pool is huge! The hotel is beautiful, and the lobby is unusually quiet. We stay at the Grand Californian regularly, and the noise level there is deafening. I believe it is because non-guests in California wander into the hotel for a look-see, while the Animal Kingdom Lodge is heck-n-gone from anywhere, so you find only hotel guests hanging around. Housekeeping was prompt, and even my picky wife had no complaints about the room or housekeeping. The rooms are a little small, as others have said, and Disney has the same 15 watt bulbs in the bathrooms, so reading there is out, unless you bring a flashlight. The LG plasma TV's with HD Service were a nice surprise. Be sure to watch the "Stacy" video about the top 7 attractions. It's addicting! We used room service twice. Food was good, delivered on time. Others have complained about the "darkness" in hallways and common areas. I found the subdued lighting relaxing after a long day of rides, lights, noise and fireworks. We signed up for the Kilimanjaro Club. The lounge was comfortable, and well stocked, but the main feature was that were were guaranteed a view room, and they were of great assistance in booking premium seats at Cirque du Soleil, and other shows. We used the Mickey's Magic Express. For me, this was the highlight of the trip. You skip baggage claim on arrival at MCO, and take a bus to the hotel. Your baggage is delivered about three hours later. (If you're going somewhere right after you check in, make sure you have what you're going to wear with you)! Departure and check out was amazing. We used the express checkout feauture where we just left the room, bypassing a long line at the front desk. The hotel has an airline check-in right in the lobby. They take your luggage, and print out your boarding passes right there. You just get on the bus, and go to the terminal, collecting your bags at baggage claim when you arrive home. A major time saver! The bus service in the park is well run, but for those of you going for the first time, be advised that you can't get from one hotel to another by bus. You have to go to a park from your hotel, then catch a bus to the other hotel. The bus stops are clearly marked, so no problem there. One warning: The Downtown Disney bus makes two stops, which we didn't know. If you're going to Cirque du Soleil (fantastic), make sure you get off at the second stop, otherwise you'll have a long, long walk. The verdict: Disney World is bone throbbingly tiring, but the Animal Kingdom Lodge was a wonderful, peaceful refuge to return to after a long day. We had nothing negative to say about it.

Reviews.Title: “A Room With A View!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jersue96
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge December 6-9, 2007. We picked this resort because we had read so many wonderful reviews of the views. When we arrived here early on December 6, are room was ready, we had a savannah view and what a great view we had. We saw a giraffe and many other animals during our stay. The room was very clean and well appointed. The bathroom was spacious with the sink on the outside, the toilet and tub/shower in a separate room. This made so much more sense when you get ready, more than one person can be getting ready with ample privacy. We enjoyed this resort as access for food and shopping is within the resort. We like the fact that if it rained, which it didnt during our stay we did not have do go outside other than an undercover to go to the Mara for breakfast and also an undercover for transportation. The lobby is just beautiful as it was decorated for the Christmas holiday. The staff was wonderful and the room was always cleaned upon park return. I would definetely recommend this resort to all ages as it has something for everyone. The views are spectacular of the animals and the resort overall is just wonderful. The bus service was great, never a long wait and the buses ran about 5 to 10 minutes apart. We will definetely consider this resort when we stay here in December of 2008.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!! Definately stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty51
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 2007 and loved it. We had been on International Drive the week previous and then moved to Animal Kingdom Lodge to do Disney. We couldnt ask for anything else, from the moment we drove up the driveway to leaving to go to the airport, everything we wanted was catered for. The staff were brilliant, from checking us in to booking dinner reservations to cleaning the room. Everywhere was spotless, well cared for. Everyday the beds would be made up and the room cleaned. We ordered breakfast in the room the night before and when it came it was brought into the room, everything shown to us and made us feel valued. We loved the room, we had a savannah view so the animals were right outside our room all the time. To be so close to Giraffes and Zebras, etc was amazing. They were so close you could touch them (but this wasnt allowed so pictures had to do) The hotel does a safari where you are picked up and shown around the park, the animals and have dinner Bomas or Jikos. We did this, it was a little bit expensive, but the money we paid was to go back to the park and the conservation of the animals so we didnt mind to much and with the safari you get to be even closer and the guide tells you lots of facts about the animals and the park. We had breakfast and dinner in the hotel and we loved it. The service is amazing, you are looked after very well. The food is on an African theme, but there is still plenty to choose from. I am a little picky with my food, but I managed to find dishes from the menu. I would recommend giving this a try. Beware though, try to make reservations early as we were told people were booking upto 6 months in advance, so your chances of getting a table at your preferred time might be slim, but as only two of us, we managed to get in, with a slight wait. The hotel offers a shuttle service to the parks and this is free for Disney guests. Everywhere is signposted so no getting lost. The buses to the parks run regularly and we had no trouble getting to and from the parks. We went to Downtown Disney late on night and got the late bus back. Everything is secure and you dont feel threatened at all. We used this hotel as a base to go to the parks, but used it a lot also as it has a excellent swimming pool with lifeguards, a gym and also offers massages, manicures, etc. If you want to relax away from the parks one day, there is plenty to do at the hotel. Overall, this is one hotel that I would definately stay at again. Both of us didnt want to leave as we had enjoyed our stay so much, but there is plenty of reminders to take away also.

Reviews.Title: “Go, Go, Go”
Reviews.Author: dewisun
Reviews.Content: For my 30th birthday my dad and I were going to do a safari in Africa but after finding out my dad's vacation time we decided it wasn't worth it. So we decided to do the Disney version of Africa! We also brought my 11 year old niece for her first real visit (1st visit she doesn't remember) to Disney World. We normally stay at the all-star resorts which is basic and covers all our needs. We don't end up spending that much time at the hotel anyway but this time we wanted to try something new. We were able to book our room overlooking the Savannah and also got spots on the sunrise safari (you have to be conceirge level to go on the safari). The disney express transportation was great and since we were on the concierge level check in was fast with no lines! The hotel lobby was beautiful and educational too. Our room was spacious and the bedding and decorations were tastefully done in African motif. I was a bit worried about noise because we had a connecting room but we heard nothing! We checked in at night so we were not able to see anything off the balcony. The next morning we woke up at the crack of dawn to get ready for the sunrise safari. My dad got up before my niece and I and missed my niece screaming..."auntie there's a zebra and a giraffe outside!" It was a great way to start the trip! if you can afford the concierge level I highly recommended it. They serve a cold breakfast everyday that has cereal, pastries, hot coffee and tea, fresh fruit, an assortment of juices and regular milk and chocolate milk. If we had to pay separately for what we ate just for breakfast the bill would have been an easy $50. I can not say enough about how wonderful the sunrise safari was! The curator of the Animal Kingdom Lodge animals was our guide for the tour and gave lots of information about all of the animals. I learned a lot about the genealogy of breading the endangered animals and the eating habits as well. The sunrise safari is the same as the ride however its early in the morning when the animals are just getting out onto the savannah and are wide awake and the safari is close to an hour as opposed to the 20 min ride. The best part was the lions! The male lion was up on his pride rock and roared for well over a minute! It was amazing. After leaving the safari you get a full spread breakfast and its yummy! I won't give a review of the park because its always great. Back to the hotel...While we were there the parks closed between 8-10 at night so we did spend a great deal of time at night at the hotel. Every night we would go to the savannah near the pool to do the night vision goggles. We never saw anything more than vultures but it was still really cool. We had an amazing dinner at Jiko but if you have young kids that aren't very adventures I wouldn't recommend eating there. We would also spend some time up at the concierge lounge relaxing and eating. They have snacks and hot appetizers out through out the day as well as soda, water, juice and beer/alcohol. The hotel also has a parade through the lobby at night were they teach you how to play african musical instruments. They have presentations from the interns from Africa teaching you about where they are from in Africa. Needless to say there is a lot to do! It's the first time that I was at Disney where I wish we had a few days to spend just at the hotel because we didn't see half of the place. I went to school for hospitality and I work in the industry so I'm pretty picky about the level of service when we go on vacation and I honestly do not have one bad thing to say about the animal kingdom lodge!!!

Reviews.Title: “A grand stay at Animal Kingdom Lodge!”
Reviews.Author: Nora1999
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed a week at Animal Kingdom Lodge March 6 - 13, 2008. We'd been to Disney four months earlier (we stayed last time at Westgate Towers - see my other reviews) but decided to try Disney accomodations this trip. I'd seen Animal Kingdom Lodge (AKL) on Samantha Brown's Great Hotels show on the Travel Channel and was intrigued by the idea of staying at a African style lodge with views of African animals from the room. We booked a Savannah view room for our trip and also paid for the Disney dining plan as well. As we approached the hotel site, the normally well groomed Disney property began to take on a wild, unkempt look...as though we were passing from one world into another. Our first reaction to the lobby was nothing short of amazement and awe. By and large, this is the most dazzling hotel lobby I have ever seen. The dark, atmospheric ambience felt other-worldly and foreign, yet also inviting and comforting. Our first contact with AKL staff was the receiptionist, who - according to her nametag - hailed from Ghana. "Welcome home" were her first words to us, and indeed this friendly "Hakuna Matata" attitude was prevelant with all "cast members" we encountered during our delightful stay. We had a bit of a walk to our room and my first impulse upon walking in was to throw back the curtains and gaze upon the savannah. To my delight our first view was of giraffes, two zebra, several antelope, and a large, shadowy Bongo stepping about in the early evening light. The menagerie was constantly changing as different animals were apparently herded about the premises and this ever-changing view of wildlife was never boring. My five year old son was constantly enchanted with the animals during our week long stay. The room was more than adequate. The African furnishings were charming and the beds were five star comfortable...the lodge was perfectly silent at night...sleep always came quickly at AKL as walking around the Disney theme parks does have a tiring effect. The food ranged from ordinary to sublime. The Mara was great for a quick meal. Room service meals were better fare. There was a large and noisy buffet restaurant that I think others enjoyed more than I did. And yes, you must pop at least once for a meal at the incredible four diamond "Jiko: The Cooking Place." The sturgeon and filet mignon were out of this world and I may say it's possible I have never dined so well in my life. The pool was great, too. I was concerned that it was only heated to 82 degrees - this was March, after all - but the water temperature was fine. My son LOVED the slide. The hot tubs got a little crowded in the afternoons but were lightly used before noon. Oh, and did I mention the poolside bar with the darling thatched roof? Those frozen mango margaritas are WONDERFUL. I had no complaint about the bus service to the parks, either. This was much better than driving to the parks and walking, as we did last time. All and all, we had an enchanting and thoroughly delightful stay at the grand but somewhat unconventional AKL. Since Disney is all about escaping the ordinary, I can attest that the "illusion" of staying at a grande African lodge was a thorough and convincing experience - and no worry there of contracting dengue fever. :) Though not cheap by any means, if you're really looking to get away from it all, forget your troubles and escape to another world...AKL is just the ticket. We'll be back for SURE.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money go to a zoo!”
Reviews.Author: aunttee
Reviews.Content: The rooms are VERY small. The rooms are clean but tiny. You can see animals out the savana view rooms but really not worth the money. You would be better off going to the Animal Kingdom park to see the same animals.

Reviews.Title: “Lodge was nice - service was a HUGE disappointment”
Reviews.Author: MCChicag0
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked a 4 day stay at Animal Kingdom Lodge to celebrate our birthdays (both big years for us!). We decided to splurge and upgrade to the concierge level, figuring that would provide some extra benefits. We used Disney's luggage option where they will pick your luggage up from the airport and deliver the bags to your room within 3 - 4 hours. DO NOT use this service. The service is supposed to scan your luggage, using the tags that Disney provides you, so that they can track your bags throughout the delivery process. Well after 3 1/2 hours, our bags still had not been delivered so we inquired at the desk. They had no record of our bags and could not tell us whether the airline had them or the baggage service had them. We were told they would look into it. An hour later we once again went to front desk to inquire. Again, no idea where our bags were. And no apologies. An hour later, same thing. No one would even call our room to update us - we had to go to the desk to get an update. When I did call from my room and ask to speak to the manager (at this point it was 10:00 p.m.) I was told the manager was away from the desk and would call back in 5 minute. 15 minutes later - still no call. So back down to the desk...Eventually we got our bags that night, but the complete lack of concern/apologies from the staff was EXTREMELY disappointing. Our room was consistently not cleaned until late in the afternoon (3:30 - 4:00) even though we left our room each morning by 9:00 a.m. One day we returned to our room while it was being cleaned (at 3:30) - another day we told the maid to not even bother as we were trying to get some rest before dinner and she came in at 4:00 to clean. We asked the concierge to look into a couple of things for us, and they did not follow-up. Given that we paid extra for concierge service and it is a Disney lodge, we expected much better service Now the good things: 1) Lodge was beautiful and we had a wonderful view of all the animals throughout the day. 2) Food was delicious 3) We did the sunset safari, which was great. Matt and Rick were our guides and were very good. We had wonderful service throughout the Disney parks and restaurants - which just made the poor service at Animal Kingdom Lodge that much more disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Honeymoon destination”
Reviews.Author: pilotlover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort for our 4 night honeymoon after having a destination wedding in S Florida. Highlights: looking out the windows and seeing animals, and walking the beutiful property. The dinner buffet was one of the best meals I've ever had and the rooms were fun. We had the handicap room, so we had a very large bathroom. Lowpoints: we were there during spring break so it was very crowded- hot tub full of kids goofing off. Everything was sooo exspensive, can't imagine how famlies eat or stay at Disney. Also, the bus to the parks takes quite a while and makes a long stop at the tacky pop century motel. Overall unique experience and disney is always wonderful with their details!

Reviews.Title: “Destination Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mciordan
Reviews.Content: I loved the rooms, the decor, how my daughter went on the balcony and started screaming..look, mom they have a giraffe...two,!!!! It makes the difference between a hotel and a destination hotel. What I disliked was the size of it...it is a monster hotel, with too many rooms, and service takes a beating. Restaurants on the premises are great-we go back every time we are in town even if we don't stay on site. Parking is some distance away( it makes a difference in rainy season-lol) so be prepared to valet or walk. Don't bother with the standard room..it's not worth it...the parking lot is not so great! Either way - do at least visit- the public spaces are amazing !!

Reviews.Title: “Magical setting, average service”
Reviews.Author: mizlizNYC
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for something off the beaten path, consider the Animal Kingdom Lodge. AKL's not on the monorail system, so it's a 25-minute bus ride to the Magic Kingdom, but the bewitching views of wildlife from our hotel room made it worth it. Our savannah view room was clean and simply furnished, and conveniently located right off the lobby. The highlight by far was seeing giraffes, zebras, etc. in total peace from our balcony at the end of each hectic day. I'd heard dreadful things about the food at WDW, but it was surprisingly not bad. Boma's buffet dinner and breakfasts were actually tasty-- the curry bobotie was my favorite. Yak and Yeti's pan-Asian cuisine at the Animal Kingdom park was also not bad. Our prime rib, pasta, and pork tenderloin dishes at Cinderella's Royal Table were quite edible. You will need lots of patience at AKL, and WDW in general, because there is A LOT of waiting due to the volume of people. Waiting to check in/out. Waiting for the bus to/from the theme parks. Waiting for a table at any restaurant, despite reservations. Waiting until late afternoon for housekeeping to service the room. Waiting 40 mins. for room service for a simple chicken soup and fruit at 4pm. Waiting to get on the rides. But your patience will be rewarded as dreams do come true-- at least they did for my 4 yr old daughter, who was in princess paradise. Seeing the joy her face made all the waiting worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “AK Lodge is now like a timeshare”
Reviews.Author: righteous
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 3 times since the hotel opened. It was one of my favorite places because it has the African animals and experience, but also it is beautiful. Unfotunately it is changing into a timeshare marketing arena and the experience is much less satisfying. Check in was terrible, no rooms ready at 3PM, then finally got a room that had been cleaned but someone had come into the room after the maid and used it for a while! By 5PM we had a room and 1 night free after negotiation. We stayed 3 nights and the fire in the lobby was never lit. I requested that it be lit and was alwas given a lame excuse, not my job, etc. Incidentally the fire was almost always lit during previousstays, even in summer. The smell in the lobby used to be great, like you would imagine in Africa. The lobby now has kids timeshare activities in the lobby, banging drums etc. No more peaceful atmosphere. My impression is that Disney can make a boatload of money selling timeshare and will put it everywhere until they saturate the parks with people. This used to be a great place for a quiet, romantic getaway, but is not anymore. Previosly I would rate it a 4 or 5, but now a 3.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kirstenoel
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to Florida and my second stay at this hotel. I absolutely loved it! We booked a standard room and we were given a room with a view of the savannah; waking up to giraffe outside our window every morning, so close to our balcony that we could hear them pulling up the grass. The room was exquisite with 2 large double beds, a TV, a beautiful wash area with 2 sinks and a huge mirror, a nice bathroom and a roomy wardrobe. The room (and the rest of the hotel) was beautifully decorated in true Disney style. We got up really early every morning and made full use of the free gym, followed by a dip in the pool, a quick shower and then off to the Parks for a full day of fun. (Beware of non-Disney hotel - a stay at the Hard Rock Hotel meant a lot of hidden charges including gym). My Mum and I are both vegetarians and have found it hard to get a decent variety at Disney in previous years. The Animal Kingdom Lodge has 2 beautiful restaurants; Boma, offerring a delicious buffet and Jiko - the cooking place. We ate at Jiko once and the food was lovely, and at Boma twice. There was such a huge choice there for meat lovers and vegetarians - and wait till you see the desserts!! The hotel is quiet at night so you can get a decent night's sleep before your busy and tiring days in the park. The staff are extremely friendly making your stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge as magical as possible!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but stay at Wilderness Lodge Instead”
Reviews.Author: galaga_girl
Reviews.Content: I gave this hotel a rating of average for two reasons: 1 - the room was not clean, we found trash in the bin and half eaten grapes under the bed 2 - I recently stayed at the Wilderness Lodge and it is SO much better than Animal Kingdom However, the hotel is fabulous in it's own right, having the animals is really the only reason the hotel costs so much. We didn't eat from the restaurants in house, we chose to eat at the parks, but the menus looked great. The bus service is awesome, we never had an issue with busses (unlike Pop Century) and while we stayed we encountered Hurricaine Jeanne and had to bunker down, the staff were excellent, gave us flashlights and free Disney movies all day while we had to stay in our rooms. I probably wouldn't stay again because Wilderness lodge is the same price and so much nicer, with the lake and being so close to the Magic Kingdom, but I would recommend the hotel. The staff are nice and the surroundings amazing - you feel like you could be in Africa - the lobby is awesome. Just make sure your room is clean!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: MIDisneyPrincess
Reviews.Content: My 5 year old son and I just returned from the Animal Kingdom Lodge Resort and can't wait to go back. We were upgraded to a savannah room which was such a treat. The hotel really is nice dispite some reviews. I had no complaints about housekeeping or the darkness of the hotel. I do have to agree with some reviews that the lighting at the bathroom sink isn't the best but it is because of the light fixture covers. They are made of a paper type fabric and give off a golden glow...not the best when trying to get ready, but hardly worth grumbling about. Every staff member I came across went out of their way to be helpful but best of all, they were so friendly to my son...in fact, would call him by name when walking through the lobby or in the restaurants. One of the cast members actually gave him Disney buttons to take back to his class...he was thrilled. The grounds with the animals were beautiful. Watching the excitement on my son's face as he watched the animals from the balcony was awesome. That was one of the big highlights of his trip...being able to see all the animals. The activities at the hotel were great for the kids. My son was able to watch the animals at night with night goggles, paint a giraffe, make bead animals etc. The weather was perfect for swimming...I couldn't get my son out of the pool because he was having too much fun. The bus rides can be alittle long since the Animal Kingdom Lodge was the quite a distance from the parks but the bus service itself was great...no long waits at all. I am already planning our next vacation to Disney and hope to be able to stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge again...my son is still talking about the animals.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Moosejavian
Reviews.Content: The Animal Kingdom Lodge is a nice resort within WDW. To call it deluxe outside WDW is somewhat inadequate, but within the compound, it is still above some of the lower class hotels. Transportation from the airport to the hotel via the Magical Express was as advertised, although I don't know why it took 3 1/2 hours for the luggage to arrive even when we arrived just before midnight with maybe 10 people on the bus. The lack of Front Desk Staff (1) resulted in having to wait nearly an hour to have our accommodations (thanks to the man in front that needed to change everything). Did i mention one of my kid was sleeping in my arms? The room was very nice and even if we paid standard price, we still got a good savannah view with views on numerous Giraffes, Zebras and miscellaneous other animal and birds. However, the room had some issues such as burned light bulbs, no lights on in the room when getting in (where the heck are the switches) and some of the beddings were quite dirty. Did we complain? Of course not, it would have meant another trip down to the lobby which was 3 wings out, one floor down and 2 more wings over. Otherwise, the amenities were fine with a nice balcony. The hotel is quite dark due to the dark furnishing and colors to represent Africa (or so we think). A giraffe carcasse must have been left in the hallway one day because the smell was quite horrible (probably water leak on the carpet). The restaurant (The Boma) served excellent food with good choices for the kids. the other cafeteria style restaurant was also quite good. Did not try the classier restaurant since I don't think the kids would have enjoyed. The pool area was great with a zero-entry pool and water-slide (too bad kids can go down with adults). 2 hot tubs, kiddie pool and playground. Too bad that the pool was way at the other end. Overall, the Animal Kingdom lodge offers those interested in a different experience a chance to view some exotic animals within having to wait in line at the park. The problems with the front desk and room cleanliness detracted from a higher grading. But we still had lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Veteran - First Stay at AKL”
Reviews.Author: #1bamafan
Reviews.Content: I have visited Walt Disney World in Florida 30+ times and have stayed on site all but 2 times. But this was my first stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. I have to admit that it was not my first choice but there was availabilty for the time that I needed. MY STAY WAS WONDERFUL. The lobby was beautiful and of course Disney had the theming of they hotel perfected. The rooms were awesome. I would highly recommed this hotel to anyone for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “out of this world”
Reviews.Author: Shelly74
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks and loved every minute. This hotel is absolutely fantastic and anyone who thinks otherwise must be soft in the head!!!!! The attention to detail in the rooms is incredible. We booked a standard room but didn't realise that these rooms overlooked the front car park. However I expressed my concerns to the staff in reception and they quickly upgraded us to a pool view room with no problems. Yes the hotel is the furthest from the parks but you get free shuttle buses so what's the problem??!! Plus they run every 20 mins or so and it's only about 20 mins from the furthest park. I recommend this hotel to everyone. The beds are sooo comfy too and the toiletries are great. It truly is a first class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: stephcStephc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge on 2nd July for 2 weeks & after reading all the reviews we were slightly worried. It was for our honeymoon so we wanted it to be perfect. We arrived after getting an upgrade on our flight through Virgin Atlantic who were terrific to be greeted by the friendliest welcome I've ever received. The guy at reception was wonderful & made us feel very welcome. We saw the building work the next day & did experience some noise during our stay. But overall it was fantastic & I'd definately recommend this hotel. You never can trust the reviews & I was slightly annoyed as I didn't think many of the bad reviews were accurate at all. Staff were excellent & bent over backwards to help, Disney was just fantastic again, Restaurants at the hotel were first class, pool great. Our room had a great view & every day I opened my curtains to be greeted by 2 giraffes. I'd def recommend this hotel so don't be put off - visit & see for yourself!!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Disney Experience”
Reviews.Author: NewYork_NYMoso
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five-night stay. Was given free upgrade to savannah-view room right off the lobby. The experience of staying here is magical - upon checking in after midnight we were greeted at our room by two giraffe enjoying a late-night snack. Seeing the animals up close on a daily basis was fantastic - but that first view was breathtaking. The property itself is exquisite, and the pool area was a huge hit with our children. There were also plenty of nooks of extreme quiet throughout the grounds- this is by far the most serene of all the disney properties. Room itself was on the small side but well appointed. Bus service to the parks was excellent all five days and at all times of day. Definitely a hotel to experience, it is truly something different and a reasonable price for its uniqueness.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: nadinewilson1
Reviews.Content: I booked this holiday at the end of Nov. I paid just over 700 pounds for the flights, car and hotel. From the previous reviews I was not expecting a room with a view. But what a pleasant suprise. We were on the lobby floor and had a great view of the sunset viewing area. We had animals every day!! The hotel was amazing the staff were so helpful. I could not fault it. I have enclosed some photos. I had a room with twin beds and if there are two of you staying there was more than enough space anymore and would of become crowded. The bus shuttle was also great, we never waited more than 10 mins to get a bus to any of the parks, just watch out, you can not get a bus direct to Boardwalk you have to get a connection at downtown or a park, this took so long getting there we decided to grab a cab home (which cost 10 dollars). Anyone wanting to go, do it! I would back in a hearbeat! P.S. there is building work going on at the moment, they are building a disney vacation club, however I never heard the work going on (as we were in the parks during he day) and we could not see it from our bedrooms, I had to go to a look out point to see it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: BRBM
Reviews.Content: We just came back yesterday from this resort and it is by far the best place I've ever stayed! As soon as we arrived my kids went right to the pool. The pool is beautiful! The weather was a little chilly and the pool was heated my kids loved it! There is a bar by the pool for the adults. The rooms are beautiful. Others said rooms were small and dark, but there were 4 of us and we had plenty of room and there are several lamps in the room. The property is beautiful and the staff was very helpful and friendly. We ate at Boma a few times although pricey, the meal was delicious. We can't wait to go back. We will defidently go back to this resort. The shuttle buses took us back and fourth to the parks. I would go back to this hotel and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: gothicdreams
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful holiday. The hotel is truly amazing. Seeing the animals from your balcony and by walking through the grounds was brilliant. The Boma restaurant was buffet style for breakfast and tea. The food was plentiful and delicious, even for our picky eater. Our room was roomy, with bunk beds, double bed and a pull out sofa bed. The pool was a little chilly, due to the time of year but we braved it and had a fun time. The Maya is a cafe style eatery with a takeaway option, this was also very good quality. Buy the refillable soda cups, this saved us a fortune in fizzy drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Very fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: funtimeswanted
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. The pools were nice and warm and clean. The restaurants were great at the hotel, especially Boma an African themed buffet (with some typical American fare for those picky eaters). The rooms were spotless and spacious with a nice balcony. Seeing animals outside your hotel room was super cool. My only complaint is that about the luggage service. Disney offers this service that sounds great in theory... they will pick up your bags at the airport for you (rather than you waiting for them) and you can go straight to the hotel. The only catch is that it will take up to 4 1/2 hours for you to get your bags. I guess this service is good if you get in early and are going straight to the parks but we got in at 11 and thought we'd have our bags soon after we got to the hotel. Needless to say our bags arrived at about 2:30 and prior to that we had no pjs, or toothpaste. I highly recommend the hotel just don't use this luggage service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Inamd
Reviews.Content: Family trip to Disney, which turned out better than expected. Disney has done a nice job with this property, and the staff are excellent. It was really hard to fault anything about this property - maybe they could have more variety in the "Mara" restaurant. However, this is a small issue - overall it is a good property in a unique setting. The staff were excellent - very well trained and very friendly. We did have the savanna rooms, and did see zebra and giraffe everyday. Highly recommended for a "taste" of africa (but nothing beats the real thing!).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Valdez123
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort! My son and I traveled to Florida to visit the theme parks. We had never stayed at the Animal Lodge. It was amazing. Very clean and great customer service. The pool was fantastic. Views from our standard room were superb. We can't wait to go back. I wish we would have stayed at this hotel for the entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience at Animal Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaMadison
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms at Animal Kingdom through travel agent because didn't decide to go until October and I just couldn't seem to find lodging for the two of us plus children and three grandchildren. I was told I had a standard room but both rooms were Savannah rooms with lots of animals at our balcony each time we looked out. Kids loved the animals, and like I said, they were plentiful. This is a wonderful hotel and our experience was amazing. The Orlando weather was in the 80's each day so we were able to wear shorts to the park and the children were able to swim when we took a break from the parks. photos attached. We had a wonderful vacation although the parks were crowded (Dec 27-Jan 1) we didn't have many problems. The hotel was decorated for Christmas and at least one day when we returned to the hotel, Mickey and Minnie were in the lobby for photos with the kids by the huge Christmas Tree.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: bobbySouthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge for one week during December 2007. The stay was booked using Disney Vacation Club points. We stayed in a one bedroom suite consisting of a bedroom with a very large king size bed, a living area with a double sofa bed and a single sofa bed, sleeping five comfortably. There was also a large bathroom with double sinks and a large whirlpool bath, a fully fitted kitchen with full size cooker and oven, microwave, dishwasher etc. There was a large plasma TV in both rooms. The room was booked on the concierge service and the room was on the sixth floor with access to the Kilomanjaro club on the sixth floor. The room overlooked one of the savanahs and we saw a good variety of animal every day of our stay. On arrival at the Lodge our bags were taken from us and our car parked and we were escorted upto the sixth floor bypassing the checkin desks. During our stay the club offered complimentary food and drink including breakfast items in the morning, pastries and cookies etc throughout the day and hot food in the evening with wine, liqueurs and beer to wash it down. The cast members were extremely helpful and looked after every request. We took part in the Sunrise Safari on our first full day at the resort and this is something I would strongly recommend to anyone. Instead of the usual 5 to 10 minutes on the normal safari at the Animal Kingdom we were out for an hour seeing numerous animals close up and for a much longer time. This was then followed by a buffet breakfast at Pizzafari which left us fit to burst. This is only available to guests staying concierge level at the lodge. For anyone with children this a wonderous place to stay and is themed beautifully on an African theme. If you get the chance to stay here then DO.

Reviews.Title: “Best ever!!”
Reviews.Author: EnglandLoulou
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th holiday to Orlando, and definitely the best because of the wonderful hotel. The children loved every minute - all the activities and seeing the animals. Transport was great to the parks, and the pool area fabulous. We had a relaxing holiday, but managed to do lots of things along the way.e.g. saw shuttle launch (amazing!) and had a day at Clearwater. Fantastic memories for all of us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at the Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: bakery
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to see negative comments on this property, as I thought it was wonderful. We did have a Savannah room, and watching the wildlife from our balcony was a special experience we'll never forget. The lobby area is one of the most beautiful I've seen, and it drew me into the African theme immediately. The lack of a flat-screen TV wasn't an issue, as we were there to see the parks and weren't interested in watching TV in our rooms. The restaurants Boma and Mara were great. I loved the African theme, and our kids found lots to choose from. We were fortunate not to suffer any of the service problems that other reviews mentioned. We loved our stay here, and I wouldn't hesitate to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Giraffe at my window”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowPatrizio
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, very relaxing atmosphere. The prices in the bar aren't too bad and the shop has almost everything you'll need. Location is fantastic and you may get a visit from a giraffe or two if you stay on your balcony for a while. Very friendly staff and great location for touring the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning place”
Reviews.Author: catherp
Reviews.Content: I'd read all the reviews and was prepared for the problems others have reported. We found that what everyone else reports as issues were what made this a little more special to us. It's away from everything except AK, but there's a lot that's good about that. We were 5 minutes away from a grocery store, fast food, and other dining. Family decided to join us last minute and found some great deals on 192 within a couple of miles from the AKL. Traffic on 192 was a breeze and access to the AKL was so much easier than having to drive deep into the network of roads. AK was surprisingly our favorite park and the access was so easy. We drove to the other parks easily, too. There's also a feeling of exclusivity when you're at the very corner of the property. I can see why others thought it was a dark place, but my reaction was relief. It felt more like a normal resort and less like I was part of the Disney cogwheel. I consider this a good thing where others might not. The place is stunning. I'd watched the Samantha Brown Travel Channel a few times before and it didn't do the place justice. The amount of activities, dining, relaxation places, pool and enough to make you want to stay here. Throw in the animals outside and it's a surreal experience. We used the annual passholders' rate and got a good deal with an upgrade to Savannah view.

Reviews.Title: “AKL - a love/hate review”
Reviews.Author: Cambridgtravler
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at AKL the week after Thanksgiving. This is a low week for WDW so the rate was only $240. The Lodge is gorgeous, with an amazing lobby (decorated for Christmas when we were there) and areas for viewing the animals. The theming is amazing. The pool area is gorgeous, lots of nooks and crannies for sitting, and a pleasant pool bar. The landscaping is just lovely. There are two fire pits which make for relaxing sitting. Throughout the hotel there are areas where you can sit on a balcony and watch the animals. We had a pool view room which was very pleasant. Savannah rooms were all booked but this room had a pretty view of trees and pool area. There are many opportunties to view the animals so we didn't feel deprived, but I would definteily avoid a parking lot view. The room itself is like every Holiday Inn you've ever stayed in, but with theming. It was a bit small, the bath was OK but definitely not luxury. Toiletries were minimal and not brand named. Bed was OK, ugly cheesy bedspreads. They charge $9.95 per day for hi-speed internet. This drives me nuts, I feel I am being nickel and dimed to death. The housekeeping service was terrible. We had trouble getting clean glasses and coffee cups, even after calling more than once.. The sink was not clean when we arrived and was never cleaned. One sink did not drain properly, and the shower dripped. On our fourth day, we returned to our room at 4 PM after being out all day and the room had not been serviced. I called housekeeping, very upset because every time we had complained about something we had been assured it would be OK from then on. Ultimately they comped us half a night's rate. Overall I think Disney is really wrong to call this a luxury hotel, because it just isn't. It is absolutely a lovely environment, and we totally enjoyed the animals, the theming, the pool area, the lobby. The Mara, a food court, is a food court - noisy, smells like greasy fries, screaming kids, etc. There is no place to get a quiet coffee or adult breakfast. At Jika, a so-called fine dining restaurant, food was good but service was rude and hurried, they were clearly eager to turn the tables quickly. The bars and restaurants serve only South African wines, and only African wines are sold in the convenience store - overpriced, and not that great. If I had paid a high week price for this stay, I would have been foaming at the mouth over the housekeeping issues, the size of the room, the quality of the room. I have stayed at Port Orleans and at Riverside, and they are just as "magical" for the money. This is a Holiday Inn with an awesome lobby and setting. I'd go back, but only at this rate of $240 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Had tried to get Savannah Room for two years!”
Reviews.Author: serenityseekerFL
Reviews.Content: I had tried to book a Savannah Room for almost two years before we finally found a date where a Savannah Room was free. In the past, anytime we had failed to get a Savannah room, we simply stayed somewhere else, not wanting to have a view of a parking lot at Disney prices. We were traveling a child that was 2.5 years old and really wanted to stay in the animal viewing rooms for him. We checked in quite late and the check-in took a bit, even though we were the only ones in line. I would think that Disney would have the check-in down to a science by now, but that still needs some work. Our hotel room was all the way at the end of the hotel, which meant that we had to walk through very darkened corridors for a hotel. While I understand that this fits the ambience, my son was quite disturbed by the general darkness and the spooky masks. Our room was good, but was very cramped for a room that cost so much. We were pleased that room service delivers quite late, but the food is incredibly expensive. The beds were only mediocre and Disney really should think about investing in some beds like at Holiday Inn Express. These mattresses were unfortunately not very comfortable. Despite our relative so-so attitude toward the experience, in the morning, the room earned its value. At about 5 am, we looked up to see giraffes, antelope, and a slew of random birds outside our balcony. We were hard pressed to keep our son inside after he saw what was just right outside our sliding glass door. It is wonderful to wake up with these creatures 50 feet from you and it made the trip. That being said, I probably would not spend the money or the booking time for the Savannah room again because the Animal Kingdom Lodge has several viewing areas with rocking chairs and such that you can go watch the wildlife from. Next time, I probably would just settle for the standard room. Also, don't miss the restaurant named Jiko in the hotel. Make reservations though before you go!

Reviews.Title: “Much Improved - esp with a Savannah view upgrade!!!”
Reviews.Author: CanJam94
Reviews.Content: Well, if you search through the list, i've reviewed the Animal Kingdom Lodge before - I think around 3 years ago. It certainly has improved. It was good before but now it's great. My husband booked a standard view room for the Thanksgiving wknd so we drove up to Orlando from Fort Lauderdale on Friday afternoon right after our lunch with our 2yo son. At checkin, I was not in the best mood as due to carsickness, our son had thrown up in the back seat 5 minutes before arrival. We did have a bit of a wait but considering it was the day after Thanksgiving, it wasn't bad at all. The checkin agent took our info, looked at the screen, and said "I'll be right back." After a few seconds, he came back and told us that he had gotten approval to upgrade us to a Savannah view room. That made me feel better. :) The last time we were there we got a great view of the parking lot!!! So, off we went to the room and sure enough, open the windows and there were giraffes, water birds, and african deer. It was great. My son liked it for a while but my husband was even more excited. i was pleased to see that the bathroom amenities were much higher quality than at our last visit. Spa quality toiletries in good variety and amounts. We soon headed off to the buffet restaurant, which is still the best restaurant I've been to at Disney. The variety and quality is excellent. Our son chose two bowls of mac and cheese but hey, he's allowed. We revelled in chicken and beef, all kinds of side dishes, and of course, lovely bite-sized desserts of fruit tarts and chocolates. Great job with the Boma restaurant!!! We did have one maintenance issue but it was quicky resolved. On Saturday, the A/C display was flickering when we got back from Magic Kingdom but a serviceman was there within 20 minutes and it turned out an entire section of the hotel had the problem. It was fixed and due to the cool weather, we had no issues with that. My only complaint is that for a resort, they could have better beds and sheets. I write this review on my last day at a business conference hosted in a Westin resort and the Heavenly Bed is exactly that. Disney should upgrade the bedding and beds at their Deluxe resorts and keep pace with the Westins and Marriotts in the hotel circuit. Otherwise it was a great stay. We spent our last morning onsite at the pool and our son enjoyed it immensely. He was too young for the slide but had fun trying to swim. I felt very safe with three lifeguards on watch and didn't even see the kiddie wading pool until we were leaving. We had lunch in the Mara and then headed home (in horrible traffic). This time i am eager to return to the Animal Kingdom resort on our next visit to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: joshscure
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge Thanksgiving week 2007. Traveling were me, my husband and 2 sons 13 and 8. Our overall experience was fantastic. When we checked in the cast member helping us seemed a bit overwhelmed and kept complaining that he doesn't usually work this late. It got a little annoying but we didn't take it perosonally and certainly didn't let it set the tone for our vacation. Our reservation was a little complicated as we added a night at the begining of our stay and the resulted in two seperate reservations. We chose a pool view, bunk bed room. Although the room wasn't huge it was certainly sufficient. The room was clean and had everything we needed. I personally was glad we didn't spend the money on the Savanah view. We were located convenietly to all amenities the hotel offered. A short walk to everything. Even great Savanah views. It seemed to me that the Savanah view rooms were a distance from the Restaurants, pools, and bus stops. Since we hadn't arrived until midnight we opted to call in the morning to have our luggage delivered. It was promised that it would be there in 5 minutes of our call. Well, our luggage never came and after several phone calls it was revieled to us that our luggage was no where to be found. We were then instructed to go to the Hotel shop and pick out, free of charge, anything we thought we needed to make our day comfortable and to be able to go ahead with all our plans. Well we got more stuff than we could possibly have needed. Including face soap, make up remover, flip flops, bathing suits, shirts (long, short sleeved and tanks), deoderant, toothpaste and brushs, sweat shirts, hats and more. Disney went out of their way for us. Plus our luggage was found by the time we arrived back from the park that night. The restaurants were great we ate in all three. The Mara is the counter service place, not too much variety typical counter food, but good. Boma is the buffet pricey and a bit exotic in the food choices. Jinko the full service, excellent food but expensive. Worth it for one night. I recommend the dining plan. More food and snacks than you can eat. We wound up sharing some meals so that we could go to the more expensive restaurant one night. Plenty of food. Also we shared some lunches and got counter service breakfast and also used some of our snacks for breakfast items like muffins and yougurt. Overall we loved this hotel. Great service, clean rooms and pool. Excellent vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience overall, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: uclatm
Reviews.Content: I was prepared to be lukewarm about this hotel and I was really surprised by how much I liked it.
