I travel a lot (for business and for leisure) and I have stayed in many hotels but this was truly a unique experience. To begin with, check-in was quick, and our room was ready early. (Even in cases when rooms were not ready early I noticed that the staff did a good job of accomodating people and making sure they were taken care of until their rooms were ready.) Even though we had a heavily discounted rate to begin with, we still received an upgrade ato a Savannah view at the front desk for no additional cost -- simply by asking. We saw a large variety of animals from our balcony on a daily basis. The decor of the hotel is simply stunning in its design and detail; you notice new things the whole time you stay there. Truly one of the most asthetically pleasing hotels I've ever stayed in. Everyone was extremely friendly, constantly saying hi in the hallways or offering information on the different animals and culture around the resort. People hustled to help you out with anything you might need and everyone always had a smile. We do not have children but there seemed to be plenty of fun activities for them to take part in around the resort (making bracelets, storytelling, drumming, etc). The pool area was also filled with kids, but I liked that there were plenty of chairs available and some were located slightly farther away from the pool, so you could still get some sun if you didn't want to be right next to the hustle and bustle of the pool. Never had a problem getting a seat at any time. We spent most of our time at the parks during the day, and used the buses to get almost everywhere. I found it very convenient; our longest wait was probably 10-15 minutes for a bus, and we rarely had to stop at other resorts on the way to the park (as I gather other resort's buses do). As for the food, we ate at the Mara for breakfast often (which was absolutely teeming with children and very chaotic; the food was generally serviceable buffet-style stuff). We ate at Boma once, which was also buffet-style. We walked right up without a reservation and got a table. (in fact, we did not make a reservation for any restaurant the entire week we stayed at WDW, and were only turned away once.) The room service menu was somewhat limited compared to other hotels but the food they did have was very good. A lot of the ease we had with getting into restuarants, quick bus service, finding room at the pool, etc may have been due to going in November. I cannot imagine what this place must be like in the summer months... but fall is definitely a great time to go (80 degrees, not a cloud in the sky the whole trip). My only real issue? While the quality of the room was fine (think of every standard hotel you've stayed in, then imagine it with heavy African theming), it seemed slightly overpriced considering the overall expense of a Disney vacation. While service, etc was good, the full price of this resort seemed a bit much. With the discount we got, I didn't personally have a problem with the rate... but while seeing animals up-close from the balcony daily was very cool, the price would definitely be an issue (especially if I had children)! So if you can afford it I definitely recommend it... but hopefully you can find a discount somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny!”
Reviews.Author: KitKat16
Reviews.Content: The Animal Kingdom Lodge is great! Don't let other reviews tell you otherwise. If you go, it is worth the upgrade to a Savannah View room. Every morning we were greeted with giraffe, antelope and so many other animals! Yes, it is a bit pricey, but how often can you sit on your balconey and just take in the beauty of the animals? Yes, the lodge is a bit dark, but that's the point. You feel as though you are in an Africen lodge. Think about other hotels in Disney, e.g. the Polynesian, Yacht & Beach - they are made to feel as if you really are in Hawaii or a New England seaside town. Although the lodge is furthest from the other parks, the bus system runs about every 10 minutes or so and takes you directly to the park. If you have the time, I would recomment seeing Cirque De Solei in Downtown Disney. It is one of the best shows I've seen and everyone enjoyed it. I hope this has been helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Wondderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: KAHCT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Animal Kingdom lodge with our 16 month old. This hotel was wonderful. The room was big enough for the 3 of us and upon arrival we were upgraded to a Savannah view room. My son loved seeing all the animals right outside the window. The lobby was absolutely amazing. It couldn't have been done better. Transportation was excellant i never waited long for a bus and this resort has ITS OWN buses. It does not share them with any other resorts so it's a straight shot to the parks and back. The kiddie pool was great and never busy and the main pool had the wonderful zero gravity entrance like a beach which is good for smaller children so they can play without being in over their heads. We ate at the food court alot which i found to be a tad small but the prices and food were good. I'm not a HUGE fan of the themed resturaunts in this hotel though i am a picky eater so i'm not too suprised. This hotel was a wonderful experience and we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay, but spent most of our time at the Parks”
Reviews.Author: ericwithabee
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 4 night stay at Animal Kingdom. It was a lovely resort. Upon booking there were no rooms with bunkbeds available, but got one on check-in. We were also upgraded to a Savannah room free. It is a big hotel, but seems that the majority of rooms are Savannah view except those looking over the pool. We could also see some construction to the left of our view, but no noise was heard. I never heard any noise from any other rooms and found it to be a very quiet day and night. Mara quick service was similar to other quick service restaurants in the park. I especially liked the Chicken pita. Boma was also good. My only complaint about the food was true to everywhere i ate. It was good food, but noisy and busy. But I didn't expect to find peace and quiet in a location such as disney. The pool was nice, but the weather was a bit chilly and we were so busy in the parks, we only swam once. The rooms were small. We only did 4 nights so didn't really affect us. The bathrooms were especially small. We were treated very well at AKL, but that held true throught our whole disney experience. We did stop and buy a few breakfest items and did a quick cereal, yogurt in the morning. It saved time and money. I can't compare this resort to any others as it was my first time to disney. It was about 20 minutes on the bus to MK but buses were regular and we never really waited. I would recommend this hotel, but would probably stay on the monorail next time or if I had small kids.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel, Tiny rooms, very noisy, rude unhelpful staff, Never Again”
Reviews.Author: mrsmac26
Reviews.Content: Please don't book a stay at this hotel. Based on other reviews I booked for my daughters 2nd birthday. I was advised to get a Savannah view room which I did. The room was really small, not at all adequate for two adults and two children. Plus our allocated room was right above the kitchen so all of the smells came in. I asked for another room and was told I could be upgraded to a suite for an additional charge ($1700!). We paid over $400 per night for the room and its simply not worth the money. Ok its nice to see giraffes etc but why not just go to the zoo? Simple things just were not upto scratch, such as the bed linens with a very low thread count. Also the room is so small you end up tripping over stuff. All standard rooms are this size. The hotel reception is also really packed and fullof hysterical kids, not at all relaxing. The pool was unheated which is needed in the winter, not 4 star at all. We checked out and got a two bed two bath suite at the Sheraton Vistana village on International Drive. This place was really stunning, huge and really relaxing. And half the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Family Grand Gathering”
Reviews.Author: 60-ish
Reviews.Content: Love, Love, Loved the lodge. Staff treated you with respect and dignity. Had booked 3 rooms for family gathering with children and grandchildren and this was the best place. Our rooms faced the animals we greeted each morning and said good night to at night. The rooms were small and bathrooms tiny but who cared. The beds were so comfortable 2 of our members inquired what they were for purchase once we arrived home November 3rd.. We spent 8 days. There were 10 of us , Had the meal plan and the park hoppers. A dream vacation of precious memories for all. The Lodge is a distance from everything so the trek back home with winey children and blistering feet was the only real drawback but in spite of that, We would stay at the lodge again. Very Very good quality, not cheap but when at disney even money feels make believe so we had no problem spending. Would do the meal place again in a heartbeat.........................

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: ziggylu
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this hotel last week. For the most part we really enjoyed our stay. Booked a savannah room and while expensive it was a unique experience. We were near a water hole and enjoyed sitting on our balcony watching the animals from there. Quite relaxing. The theming of the resort is very well done. This is what you're paying for. As far as the rooms themselves, for the cost they are very small. It seems very hard to get a king here so we had a double double which made the room feel even smaller. everything was clean and in good condition. Bed was very comfortable...but the linens...again for the cost it would be nice if they upgraded the linens to something truly "deluxe" We had a meal at Jiko which was fantastic...one of the better meals we've had in any city. The only other thing we ate was a breakfast at the food court which was mediocre and nothing impressive. Service was good - everyone we dealt with was pleasant and well trained. we found the buses to be quick and convenient. From where we were (Uzima savannah I believe) we were not at all affected by construction. Would never have known any was going on if I hadn't read about it elsewhere. If you're not really excited about the theming of this resort don't book as you will be disappointed for the cost. Otherwise it's definitely an enjoyable experience. Have never stayed at other Disney resorts so can't compare to the other deluxe or moderate properties.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: ailismum
Reviews.Content: The cool air conditioning hits you as you enter from the tropically humid Florida air. The lilting sounds of traditional African music gently exudes from speakers hidden in the luxurious foliage. The lobby area is cool and exotic, with dark wood and animal images. Our daughter was happily entertained by the TVs showing classic Mickey/Donald cartoons in various tasteful sofa and armchair areas in different locations around the lobby, while we checked in. Staff throughout our stay, in every area of the hotel were pleasant, polite and friendly. We stayed on the Zebra Trail , room 1483, which is ground floor, and has a view of giraffe and long horned cattle from the verandah - pretty close, and more often in the afternoons. There was a hot jacuzzi tub just opposite the balcony, which came on around eight in the morning, and was delightfully deserted at that time. There are several places around the hotel where you can sit and look at the animals. There are huge wooden rocking chairs, outside 'fires' to relax around and the heated pool was popular until late - the lifeguards go off duty at eight but the pool was still available, warm and well lit, and not crowded at all. Trees with flowers and beautiful butterflies and birds are just part of the scenery. Little lizards/geckos scuttle away under the bushes. It is an nature and animal lovers paradise but with all the pampers and comforts of a luxury hotel. Food in all of the restaurants was great, the African restaurant was amazing, and the buffet style food in the main eating area was superb too. A dining plan is probably more economical than paying every night like we did - most other people seemed to be on a dining plan. We hired a car which made getting to the attractions easy, but there seemed to be plenty of buses anyway. The concierge helped will any enquiries and provided maps and shopping information of the local area. The staff made a big fuss of our daughter, and we all felt very special and were treated like 5 star guests at every moment. The rooms were cool and cleaned daily. There is a fridge in the room. Overall our stay was utterly gorgeous and I couldn't fault a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Great View - That's about it.”
Reviews.Author: triwinner
Reviews.Content: My wife and daughter and I stayed at this resort in January before we sailed on the Disney Wonder. We also had another family that traveled with us. The only other Disney property that I have stayed at was the Grand Californian in Disneyland. I found that the lobby area of these two hotels to be very similar. This particular trip became a comedy of errors because so many things went wrong. First of all, I would like to say that this is a very beautiful and well maintained resort. Where else in America can you look out your balcony and see giraffes, zebras, and other African animals a few yards away. We arrived via the Disney shuttle around 5:00 pm. Our plan was to check in and head to one of the parks for a few hours. Their computer system crashed as we were waiting to check in. This made checking in impossible for about two hours. We had requested adjoining rooms with the other family. Once we checked in, we realized that we were actually on different floors! It took about one more hour to get this problem fixed. By the time we finally got into our rooms, everyone was so aggravated that no one wanted to go out to the park. Our room keys were also supposed to be our park passes. The next morning, we waited for twenty minutes to catch the shuttle to the Magic Kingdom. We tried to get in the park only to find that our room keys were not coded with our park tickets. We ended up having to go all the way back to the hotel to have the problem fixed. It was one problem after another. The hotel had a representative form Disney Cruise Lines at a counter. She called our room and asked us to come down and fill out some paperwork. We went down and spent 30 minutes filling out all of the forms and gave them to her. The next day, we got the same call. We said that we filled them out yesterday. She said that she had no record of it. We had to go back down and repeat the exercise. Overall, the incompetence of the staff is enough to make me not want to the return. Most of the employees were very friendly, just not very intelligent. They seemed to not understand why we were having so many problems.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lodge”
Reviews.Author: splendidPalmCoastGa
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome, if you enjoy animals and african history this is the place. We had a great experience here, of course everyone here is for the "Mickey", but you could enjoy this place and never go to the mouse's house.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel that's far, far away....”
Reviews.Author: summerle0
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week's stay at the AKL. Here are the pros and cons: Pros: The atmosphere and decor are lovely, there are lots of activities for children to participate in at the hotel. The breakfast and dinner buffets at Boma are delicious. Try the Tusker beer and the cous cous salad! The Mara is ok too. We didn't try Jiko. Cons: We many activities and advanced dining reservations at other resorts and parks. We had to add an hour of travel time to our schedule in order to get there on time. We spent a lot of time waiting for buses and it was too far to come back to the room during the day for a rest and then head out again. Although, we enjoyed the hotel I would stay at a Disney resort with a monorail stop such as the Contemporary or Polynesian because it's much more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, if a bit overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: uplandgirl
Reviews.Content: We booked 'the 2 week holiday of a lifetime' at this Disney hotel & was it worth it? Well...... The hotel is beautifully & carefully themed throughout, so is a sight to behold each day. I never got tired of walking through the lobby, or down the stairs to the restaurants & pool. They even have african drum music playing ALL the time, at first I thought this was pretty cool, but after a week it did wear a bit thin!! We had adjoining rooms for ourselves & our 4 children which were clean, airy & spacious, also a strong african theme throughout. We had breathtaking savanah views & saw lots & lots of animals at all times of the day. We left a tip for the maid every morning for the 1st few days, but noticed that she wasn't doing anything extra, like those great towel animals you sometimes get, so stopped - the service stayed the same. ok. We found the reception cast members to always be polite & helpful, if sometimes a bit robotic! Something we did find frustrating - there are 3 restaurants in the hotel. Two of which are VERY popular with guest staying from all over the Disney resorts, so we always had a hard time getting seated for breakfast & dinner. When you did reach the end of the queue, the food was good & lots of it - if you have the buffet at Boma. But the poor servers were always so rushed off their feet they didn't have time to give us any individual attention - which we certainly paid for (18% graituity on the disney dining plan!) Also than darn drum music was also carried through to the restaurant - ok if you like to 'eat to the beat', but not for me! The pool & spa was nothing special & the slide was closed for most of the time we were there. It would also become quite crowded at times with little space for sun lounging & relaxing. I think that if I could afford to go again that I would look at another Disney 'deluxe' hotel, but maybe not this one. When you are parted from all that hard earned money you need perfection in my book! (& certainly no school dinner queues!)

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge, Not Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: GoNoles
Reviews.Content: We paid $335 a night to stay at this hotel and it certainly wasn't worth that sort of money. Yes, it was neat to look out of room and see a Giraffe but for as little time as you stay in your room it wasn't anything special. You can see these at a zoo or the Animal Kingdom. The lobby is neat looking but that's where it ends. The room is no bigger than their cheaper ones and no nicer. For $335 a night I want a luxurious bed and bed linens. I expect my room to not smell like smoke and for there not to be mold/mildew on the bathroom wall (I figured this out after sneezing my head off two mornings in a row while showering). We checked in on a Thursday afternoon and quickly left to go to the Parks. I noticed it smelled funny but didn't say anything. Noticed it again when we got in at 1 am but was more concerned with getting the kids to bed. Called about it in the morning and was asked if I wanted to change rooms. Well, our stuff was everywhere and we were wanting to get to the parks so declined knowing it would take forever. They brought us an air purifier. It did no good. I noticed the mold/mildew at midnight on Saturday night. Too late to do anything about that. When checking out the next day I said something to the manager about all of the things I was unhappy about. Did I get any discount? No. Not to mention, this Lodge is far from everything except the Animal kingdom Park. Takes forever to get anywhere. I don't recommend it at all! A year and a half ago we stayed at the Hilton. It's an official Disney hotel so we got all of the Magic Hours, free bus transportation, could walk to the Disney Village for dinner and it was very luxurious for less than $150! Great beds and linens. Would choose it any day over the Animal Kingdom Lodge. At AKL I felt like I was staying at an overpriced Holiday Inn (except for the few animals out the window). So save your money! Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: dabev
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at other Disney resort properties, and for what we thoguht might be our last trip for a few years, booked a stay at the very expensive Animal Kingdom Lodge. We had service problems from the moment we checked in, and it seemed to be one mistake after another, from wrong room to wrong room type to being checked into a room that had not been serviced since a previous guest slept and showered there. We were very surprised byt the need to escalate our problems each time, and even had a sympathetic baggage valet trying to call the desk on our behalf after being sent all over the hotel to various rooms. Our check in debacles were topped by getting no service in our room ont eh first day, despite being out of the room from 9am until 5pm. They were not able to provide service but had someone stop by with towels. The staff did a decent job of trying to compensate us for our troubles, giving us 50% 2 of the 4 nights. But when you travel far and pay more for the experience, you really expect more. We even had a front desk person (Kika, I believe) bring up a stuffed animal gift for our daughter after our 3+ hour check in process. We paid for the Savannah View, but overlooked construction and a gated area where no animals ventured anywhere close to. We knew of construction but would have never accepted this view if we hadn't already been wiped out by problem after problem. There was heresay that Disney had recently let go a number of illegal service workers. Makes sense when you think about it, but we were still surprised as our expectations were much higher. We wouldn;t ever choose this Disney property again, and are a bit disappointed with the overall Disney experience. They used to kill you with sincere kindness, this time was way below in average. Wait times all over the place and people who didn't really feel the love when saying "Have a Magical Day"

Reviews.Title: “Very Unique”
Reviews.Author: travelagent31
Reviews.Content: I am a Travel Agent and I really liked the Animal Kingdom Lodge. It was what I expected. The rooms are on the small size, but very clean. The extra balnkets are in a zipped up bag. The bedspreads on the Queen size bed was clean. The bedspread on the bunk beds was stained. The hotel needs to keep up with that. I had them bring up all new linens for us. The carpet was fresh and clean in my room. The walls were clean, the bathroom and shower were clean. Overall you do get a clean feeling when you walk in the room. The Savannah View was great! The resort can't control where the animals roam though. You may have a lot of animals outside one day and then the next day none. It is a lot of money to upgarde, so think about that. There are viewing windws all ove the resort. When your walking down the hallway from your room there a big windows to see the animals. This is really a step up from the moderate resorts. There is more storage room and the bathroom area is much bigger. The pool is great. Really big and nice. Boma was o.k. if you like trying lots of different/strange things. They do have chicken tenders, fries and mac and cheese for the kids. I paid 25.99 for my meal and ate chicken tenders. It's not worth the money unless you try everything. You are further away from some parks-it was not a big deal. The Magical Express drivers are excellant! They really get you in the Disney mood! Our luggage arrived about 2 hours after we checked in. I suggest packing bathingsuits in your carry-on so you can swim while your waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ERCTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the AKL for 6 nights. The lobby and rooms are nicely decorated. Most of the hotel staff are friendly. But the room is smaller than what we expected for a $300/night hotel room. The sheets are not very clean and we even found blood and stain on both queen size beds sheets when we arrived. They promptly exchanged them after we called their housekeeping. The transportation from AKL was very good. We don't need to wait too long and most buses are not full.

Reviews.Title: “All this and Giraffes too”
Reviews.Author: jmeh
Reviews.Content: The Animal Kingdom Lodge is the best hotel I've ever stayed in--and I've stayed in a lot of them. The lobby is magnificent, the rooms are decorated in an attractive African motif with balconies overlooking the Savannah (not all rooms). You can sit and watch the giraffes, zebra and other animals for hours, take safaris through the savannah, and enjoy the interactions between staff and animals. The pool is huge, warm and open 24 hours a day. We didn't try the expensive restaurants but Mara is perfectly adequate--a cafeteria with a few exotic African choices. The staff was friendly and helpful, some of them especially so. It was extremely clean well managed. People who tried to reserve poolside chairs with towels had the towels removed by staff after a time. You don't need a car, buses run to all the parks at frequent intervals. There is a lovely gift shop, activities for children, and just about everything you need for a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “great florida hotel lovely sight of animals”
Reviews.Author: spicynat
Reviews.Content: great hotel nice clean comfotable beds did not got savannah room got a view of the car park did not bother us that much as we where out to the parks everyday the maids are friendly and maid animals out of towels and left them on the bed. plenty of viewing places around the hotel, lovely swimming pool too many lifeguards boma was a very nice resturant too food boring did not go to jiko resturant not a lot of choice for vegetarians to eat and mara resturant they could not understand the british when taking food orders and did not change the food menu and hotel too far from disney parks and buses do take quite a while. we would choose another hotel if we do go bk another year.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with catches -- Park review too!”
Reviews.Author: amytap
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge at the end of Sept. 2007. We were only there for 2 nights. The lodge is absolutely beautiful. We happened to be given this trip as a gift or I would never pay what they charge for the hotel, particularly the Savannah view room. Seeing the animals was great, but you can honestly see animals from around the hotel -- walking to your room, from the lobby windows and there are viewing areas all around the hotel. You usually don't spend very much time at all in your hotel room at Disney, so I just don't think spending the extra money for the Savannah view room is worth it. The pool is great. The customer service was great. The rooms are small, as some people note, but again, you don't really spend much time in your room and they don't want you to! That's why they're not so large! We did eat at Jiko and we weren't impressed with the quality of the food vs. price. We have eaten at many fine dining places around the country and I have eaten much better for what we paid. It's a nice place and the food was good, but not worth what we paid. DO make dining reservations WELL in advance of your trip. We tried to book dining the week of our trip and most of the places we wanted to eat were full. The Animal Kingdom park is just enough for a child under about 4 years old. There aren't a lot of rides for parents to miss out on and kids love the animals. I have to say that the park wasn't as impressive as I expected it to be, but again, it is the smallest park. It closes at 5pm, so you can hop over to Epcot or Magic Kingdom if you get those passes. The park is small, so you can fit it all in, even with a nap in the afternoon, if you stay near the park.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Go Back in An Instant!”
Reviews.Author: CoensMom
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and 4 yr old son just returned from our trip to Disney. Our stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge was beyond words. The hotel staff was more than helpful and always very kind. The room and premises were extremely clean and well kept. The pool was beautiful and relaxing, food at all of the hotel restaurants was phenominal, couldn't say enough good things about this place. Aside from getting heat exhaustion from the 94+ degree heat and humidlity, it was a wonderful stay and we will be returning next Novemeber (not September--too hot for us!) for a longer stay. They even left a stuffed monkey and autographed Mickey Mouse photo for our son! What a nice addition to a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel experience we've had!”
Reviews.Author: UAEgal
Reviews.Content: I have read many reviews about this hotel and to be honest I am left amazed at some of them. This hotel is quite possibly the best place I have ever been and I have stayed at some wonderful hotels. When you book Animal Kingdom lodge, you are booking a 'African Safari stay'. The rooms are dark and small, quaint understated, homely and perfectly practical (apart from the lack of storage). To sum the rooms up in one word, I would say - 'lovely'. Nothing exciting, just lovely. Just what we wanted and expected!!! If like we did, you are staying in a Savannah view room, then you will not be bothered about the room anyway. The view from your balcony is stunning. The animals can get up to about 20/30 feet away from your balcony. Waking up to giraffes was just the best! If you are not in a Savannah view room, don't worry. There are animal viewing points all over the hotel and the pool views are really nice! Put it this way, i would rather stay in a room without a view than stay in another hotel with a great view! A few tips from our stay. The valet service is NOT FREE. I expected it to be free seeing as its a 5* hotel, but its definitely not. Its 10 dollars a day, and I was not willing to pay for two weeks of valet when the car park is literally one minute walk away. In fact, you could probably walk to the car park in 30 seconds. Just bear that in mind when and if you arrive for the first time (if you have a car). There are three restaurants in AKL. Boma, Jiko and Maha. Boma and Jiko being more expensive. If we wanted to eat cheaply, we either went to Maha or we went to the shops and restaurants that are literally a five minute drive away (staff will give you directions). There is a long strip of restaurants, supermarkets, a Subway sandwich bar etc, this was really handy. However, you must do 'do breakfast' in Boma and book yourself a table at Jiko (that opens early evening), they are both amazing restaurants. Book it when you first arrive to avoid disappointment. I would advise you to go to the concierge when you have arrived and have unpacked and just explain to them all the things you want to do, they will give you hints and tips and will check availabilities for you with things like character dining - something you HAVE TO DO! (I would highly recommend breakfast with Lilo and Stitch at the Polynesian resort, they sing and dance and do a little parade around the restaurant). You might not even know what you want to do... Even better to go to speak to them, they will advise you. There is a laundry room for anyone to use, with huge washers and dryers that we find really useful. There is also a kids club for four years to 12 years (I think), it opens from 4pm til midnight. Its very pricey at 12 dollars per child per hour, but if you are only going to go out once or twice without kiddies (if you have them) it will be worth it. Even for the most paranoid parents who don't like to leave their children anywhere, I had no fears here. There are loads of things to do for the children and best of all, they give you a pager that they will beep if there is a problem. I really felt at ease! AKL is probably the park furthest away from the 'hub' of Disney, but at the same time is still only about a 10 minute drive to the furthest point. There is no traffic on Disneys roads. The set-up is brilliant. Buses are fantastic and you REALLY DO NOT NEED TO SPEND EXTRA MONEY ON A HIRE CAR. Everything about Disney and its practicalities are brilliant. My advise for your stay at AKL. Just go there expecting little rooms and a real homely relaxing stay and you will enjoy your stay. I would NOT hesitate to go back/recommend this hotel. So much so, we joined the vacation club with AKL as our home resort. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: KARKARBelfast
Reviews.Content: My family and I (husband, daughter 6 and son 4) spent the last two weeks of august at Animal Kingdom Logde in Disneyworld and we thought the hotel was fantastic. Everything was so clean, staff were helpful and pleasant, and the location was beautiful. We found the restuarants were also very good the food was great and the portions were huge, we ordered room service quite often and found that getting kids portions were usually enough for us. My kids loved getting up in the morning to see the animals outside our window, I think they enjoyed exploring the hotel (pool, playground and animal lookouts) more than the theme parks somedays. We all cant wait for our next visit and would love to go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: N1cky
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from 14 nights at the AKL, what a wonderful place. The hotel was fantastic, the choice of restaurants was good and the staff were very friendly and helpful. There were loads of animals around at all times of day. My 5 year old loved the pool and the slide, the life guards were excellent and you felt safe to turn your back for 2 minutes knowing they were constantly watching the children. The construction wasn't an issue at all, the upper lobby areas were partly closed off, I look forward to coming back when it is finished to see this fabulous area in full. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Second time here.. fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Englishman98
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, food is excellent as is the service. The layout/scenery around the hotel is breathtaking,. The rooms are a little small but so are all of the other Disney hotel rooms. It is a little further to travel on the shuttle bus because of where it is situated but overall i would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A unique place, Wow”
Reviews.Author: ianwarne
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults, 2 children 16 & 9) stayed in AKL from August 25 to 29. Had a Savannah view room, with two queen sized beds. Had requested room with bunk beds but due to building work and resort being full no chance. Did not matter, room was more than adequate, after all you only sleep in it! The room was immaculate, room service every day if required. The hotel definitely has the wow factor as soon as you walk in to the reception, it is magnificent. The African art collection is huge, with the African cast members full of knowledge of their countries heritage, animals etc, etc. The pool area could not be faulted, and even though the resort was full, the pool never seemed to be over crowded. Yes their is buliding work in progress developing a new Vcation Club Resort, you never really noticed the work going on. It certainly did not seem to affect the animals. And what about the animals, where outside africa can you sit on your balcony watching giraffes, vultures, gazelles etc wander. For anyone wanting to visit Disney and stay in one of the deluxe resorts, pick AKL. It is a must

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: maylegolf
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing! The rooms are just your average room for the most part. Clean and comfortable to be certain. The huge benefit of this hotel is the amazing view out your sliding doors to the savannah! You can have any number of wild animals walking by your room at any time. We so enjoyed seeing these creatures, we almost didn't want to leave the room for the parks while we were here! Highly recommended for everyone! The staff and services are also A+

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaJulia
Reviews.Content: Oh my God, the food is so good!!! We ate the buffet breakfast every morning at Boma and it was fabulous!! So many choices!! JIko has a wonderful filet mignon with white macaroni and cheese that is to die for. The pool/slide and spa are great. No one was even in the spa when we went in. Get a savannah view room--so fun to watch the animals! There is a child care center that has a trained staff and a million things for the kids to play with (Playstation). We left our son there for one hour so we could finally have some "private" time, and he wanted to stay even longer. The atmosphere in the hotel is great and the decor is simply beautiful. The only drawback is that the rooms are on the small side. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the (very hot!) Sun”
Reviews.Author: DDANorthants_UK
Reviews.Content: Just back from Animal Kingdom Lodge - first visit to this hotel and Disney world. Hotel amenities excellent - very clean, service oriented and great links to the parks. A lot of the activities are geared up to the parks but during the days there are activities laid on for the kids such as beading, cookie decorating etc. Not a lot to do at night except chill out and eat/drink or as many others do catch your second wind and go to the parks again. They do have talks at 8.30pm each evening from various wardens talking about their home countries. Quite interesting. We had a savannah room which was nice - to be honest I'm not sure i would pay the extra GBP500 again for this - pleasant but I'd put the money towards other things. You can see the savannah from the viewing platform. Couple of tips for the hotel: a) make restaurant bookings before you go. Jiko and Boma were both booked out and we struggled to get in. Apparently you can book up to 180 days before your visit and many people had done this. Of the two would prefer Boma which is buffet style. There is also a place called the Mara which always had spaces and a broad selection- if you have hyper kids this is quick and easy. b) Avoid using the hotel room phone for overseas calls unless you are a lottery winner. we got caught out and were paying GBP 12.50 a minute for the privilege ! (I like my mother in law but this is pushing it ) Overall a great vacation destination and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best location~~amazing details! LONG review!”
Reviews.Author: rjsmom1117
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge for 7 nights and were so glad that we chose this hotel. We are a family of 2 adults and 2 kids (ages 14 and 11). We initally chose this hotel because we love animals but after reading some reviews about the distance to the parks we switched to the Wilderness Lodge. About a week before we were supposed to leave we switched back the the AKL and also got the Dining plan. We are sooo glad we did both! Our arrival was very easy, I could not believe how many people were at the airport... I think everyone at the Orlando airport was going to Disney. You are herded through the airport like cattle to the Magical Express area. (For those of you who don't know what that is~ it is wonderful... Before you leave home they send you tags with a bar code, when you check your baggage they send it straight through and someone for Disney picks it up at the airport and it is waiting in your room after checking in. So much less hassle at the airport! When you checkout, you check your bags at the hotel and they arrive at your home airport for you. ) Once in the Magical Express area you are split up by resort. You get on a Disney bus and head to your resort. It seems these buses run about every 15 mins. Upon arriving at the hotel we loved the look. It really looked like you would imagine a hotel near a wildlife refuge. Check in was very quick and they explained everything. We booked a room with bunk beds and one queen bed. Our room was very nice. The only complaint I have is the sheets.... Very low thread count, kinda itchy. Yes, the rooms are a little small but it was fine for the 4 of us and we were just there to sleep. A lot of the employees there are from different places in Africa, take the time to talk to them. You can learn so much. The hotel has a buffet restaurant called BOMA. A lot of items are African, but for picky kids they also have chicken fingers and fries, etc. BOMA is a must. It is a wonderful experience to try another culture's food. We ate there our 3rd day (again 2 days later and again for breakfast) and the kids LOVED it! I made the comment to the waiter that I loved certain items and he then brought me a request card and told me to write down the items I wanted the recipes for and they would email it to me. (Amazingly they did about 3 weeks later!!!) The kids liked it so much I had to drag them to other places to try on the dining plan. (HINT if you are a guest call the hotel operator and asked to be DIRECTLY connected to BOMA and put your name on the waiting list and they will call your room when your table is ready...Such a nice bonus after a LONG EXHAUSTING day at the parks....) We also ate at the Kona Cafe at the Polynesian. We all had steak and it was surprisingly good. It was a circus to get there though... (We went there from the Magic Kingdom and had to make 2 other stops at other resorts before arriving there~at AKL you don't share a bus...) We also ate at the Rainforest Cafe at the Animal Kingdom don't do it. A must to see, it is very neat inside, maybe even have an appetizer but spend your money somewhere else, the food was awful. MGM~ the Hollywood Brown Derby. Oh my gosh~~sooo good. It uses more credits but so worth it. (HINT~ our youngest did not like a lot of food on the menu since 11 is considered an adult, so we would order off the kids menu and pay cash and use his credits to upgrade meals.) We also ate at the 50's Prime Time Cafe, ask to sit in Auntie Claire's section. She was the best, everyone around us wished they had her she was so much fun. At EPCOT~ the Rose and Crown was our favorite. Not only was the food great but our waitress Nikki was outstanding. (HINT~ make your reservation for 8:30 so you can have a front row viewing for the fireworks. Don't worry if you are not on the patio, your waitress will take you out to the patio to see them. They also dim the lights inside so you can see better. They will also make sure your food is not out until before or after the fireworks. They were the best there! As for the counter service you use for lunch, most all the same sutff, burgers, hotdogs, etc. (HINT~The best thing we figured out to do was jump on a bus and head to downtown disney and eat at Wolfgang Puck's Express for lunch (amazing lunch menu and wonderful food) and jump on the bus back to the parks. So much better than burgers and fries.) The counter service the MARA at our hotel was not bad either though. Nice variety. (By the way at MARA ask for a re-fillable mug $10 but can be refilled as much as you want for your stay.) Now the buses. They run about every 10 minutes to the resorts and parks. The best part about being at the AKL was we did not share a bus with any other resort, so that means one stop. The longest ride was a little over 10 mins to the farthest park (Magic Kingdom). On the way back when it's dark they turn off the lights and you can relax on your way back. I think people that complain are the type that are never satisfied. One last HINT~ if you have left over snack credits from the dining plan (you will, more than half the time in the parks we were charged ONE credit total for all of us) you can use the remaining credits for Diney cookies, crackers, pretzels, candies in the hotels gift shop. We had 44 and used them all for gifts for friends and family. Our hotel was amazing. From the minute you enter the lobby to seeing all the animals and even the rooms had wonderful details. (HINT~ on the back side of the pool at night they have free night vision to see the animals, I think until about 10pm. If you can't find it ask someone, there is always an employee there to help!) If you can afford it upgrade to the Savannah room. Overall we loved our choice and would stay there again. Our friends who were there at the same time stayed at the Wilderness Lodge and that seemed like a circus because of it's sheer size. Our hotel was huge but spread out, we really feel we made a great choice. If you have any questions feel free to email me otherwise have a great time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Savannah view room ”
Reviews.Author: lovesublime
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in a Savannah view room. Yes it was expensive but well worth the money. We woke up and sat on our balcony watching the animals for an hour. It was quiet and peaceful, perhaps the most peaceful place in Disney. The room was a good size (there were only 2 of us) and clean. The pool area was crowded. I know its Disney and its all about families but I kind of wish there was an adults only pool or hot tub. We were in the hot tub when a bunch of kids jumped in and started splashing around. They must have cleared the pool 2 times in a couple of hours for "routine cleanings". Translation: some kid pooped in the pool. Also go to BOMA for breakfast and/or dinner. awesome buffet! wide selection of items. Everything from everyday food to very unusual and delicious selections. We wish we had gone there more often.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've Stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: pistoff
Reviews.Content: Really don't understand all the negative reviews, We stayed here for 2 weeks 16th - 31st July this year. Went with virgin holidays and had booked a standard room but on arrival I enquired about a room upgrade and was given a savannah view room immediately. We was in 3225 which was right by the lobby on the 3rd(lobby) floor which was perfect, giraffes, zebras etc everyday, roomed cleaned before 10am everyday (leave a few dollars in the room every few days for extra special service) The room and hotel are spotless, Mara is ok if you want something quick and Boma is fantastic but make sure you book or you'll be waiting! With the GBP being so strong against the dollar (nearly $2.10 to the £) when we were there even the slightly inflated hotel prices seemed ok. We tended to drive to the parks ourselves in the morning which was easier and quicker and you get free parking and used the buses at night, longest we waited was 15mins. As for the construction I heard a bit of drilling when I walked through the lobby a couple of times but that was it, I think Virgin have insured their clients are well away from it and are being upgraded where possible so don't pay the extra for a savannah room if you're with virgin you'll probably get one anyway. If you want to eat off the Hotel/parks take the first right when you leave the Hotel (Sherbaton Rd) then go left at the junction and theres ample restaurants, shops and supermarkets. As i've said before I really would like to have the negative reviews explained to me as I found no problems at all!!

Reviews.Title: “I loved it, loved it, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Jane15
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived back from 2 weeks in the AKL and it was fantastic. I find Tripadvisor so helpful that I thought I must share my experience. I was apprehensive about the hotel as after we had booked I was advised that there was extensive construction ongoing within the hotel complex until 2009!! and a small number of reviews on tripadvisor had been negative. I can reassure you that it was really difficult to spot any construction work as it was well out of sight from the guests. It did not infere in any way with our holiday. The hotel is breath-taking and worth every penny, the service and the food is excellent. I really liked the way that Disney promote the hotel from an animal conservation perspective. I have no hesitation in recommending the hotel and can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “A TIGGER-ific hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: thewearytravelers
Reviews.Content: The Animal Kingdom Lodge......Where do I begin??? This hotel is my FAVORITE on Disney Property! I would recommend it to everybody even if they do not like animals! The theming is wonderful! This hotel can not be beat! Sure It is a little more expensive. Is it worth it...YES!! From the moment you walk in you are immersed in the African atmosphere! The staff are from various African countries and can answer your questions. The Savannah View is nice! It is like staying at the Animal Kingdom park. If you liked the Animal Kingdom park you will like this hotel. If you did not then I would not recommend it for you but I personally love it. (but I love the park too!)!! The counter service restaurant is nice. You can get refillable mugs and use the fill it yourself drink station and get as many drinks as you would like! The pool is not to shabby either! Why do I love this hotel so much....the atmosphere! The cons: The Price! ~~~~Even if you do not stay here go and visit it!!!~~~~

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre and Waaay overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Iron-Mike-001
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a conference. It's not a place to visit on your own. All well to do families. Spoiled, rich kids and snobby parents. The staff are helpful and friendly and the property itself is exquisite, but everything there is grossly overpriced. The pool is nothing special and the animals are so far away, you can barely see them. On its own, this hotel doesn't stand up to what you'll pay for it. As a jumping off point to visit Disney World, you could probably find somewhere just as good for a fraction of the cost. If you're ready to part with the kind of money you'll need to stay here, my advice would be to look around. For the price, you can probably find somewhere nicer. Thank god my company paid for it and not me. ;-).

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved AKL”
Reviews.Author: puffcandy
Reviews.Content: Myself, husband and son absolutely loved this hotel. We had paid for a standard room but were upgraded on arrival to a savannah view, when we entered the room it was lovely and spotlessly clean, we opened the curtains and there was 3 giraffes outside and a few other animals, it was so lovely. We were on the side where the construction work was going on and yes you could hear some noise but only when you opened your doors to the balcony, the noise didn't bother us one bit as seeing the animals outweighs any of that. I have to admit that check in staff were not over friendly, we had to use the phone in the room for an urgent call home, I read the card at the side of the phone and it said if you used your credit card you would not be charged extra to your room, I phoned to reception to confirm this and was given the wrong information on how to call home. Subsequently they charged us $165 for an 8 minute call!!! When we went to complain at the front desk the girl said there was nothing she could do and that it was AT&T who were charging us, we did not believe this and asked to speak to a manager, she called one over and without even looking at us told the gir to take the surcharge off, our total bill then came to $11 a whopping $154 had been added as a surcharge by Disney, that sort of disappointed us as we would have expected more from such a wonderful company, be warned not to use the phone to call the UK!!! We ate at Boma for breakfast and for dinner, it was very good with plenty of variety. The pool was lovely but watch out for snakes as they are there!!! Cocktails at the pool bar are a must. Overall don't be put off by others complaining about petty things, this hotel is absolutely amazing and we would recommend it to anyone. Also if anyone is thiking of doing the Richard Petty Driving Experience, my husband LOVED it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: millimoo
Reviews.Content: Just a very quick review. Just got back as you can see. 3 of us went - My wife and myself!!! plus my 4 year old daughter. Drove to the AKL from Sandford great fun. Great cars! Had the car valet parked for $10. No stress. Breezed through the reception - resonably friendly. Got to our room - Very poor. Wasnt happy - made 1 phone call to reception and we were moved - upgraded to Savanah view. Room 3211. Great view - lots to see - animals great. Very dark hotel - but gave the ambience - the whole point. There was building noise that was very annoying and we didnt know about it when were booked it - didnt make to much problem as we were out all day at the parks. Was bad though whilst chilling and nursing my poor feet after treking around Disney all day. This place was not Disney (Fied) at all. But that was cool. The maid only did our room properly if we left a tip!! - Really. The face cloth animals were great. My daughter looked forward to them allday - never mind Mickey!!. The food was overpriced and repetitive - but wasnt a problem. MAKE NOTE - there is no point in dressing up for dinner. Really - we made the effort as we like to dress up a bit for a nice meal at Boma or Jiko - bit sitting next to people wearing shorts and string vests was a bit silly. We would have bought and took more stuff home in our cases and left our dresses at home. I still took myu dress!!! Anyway - i digress. The SIMBA CUB house - for youger children was rubbish. Amelia was bored to death - the staff were very rude and said to me - no room key - no kid when I came to collect her!! Security consious im sure. Amelia didnt want to go back either. Be ready to evacuate the pool if the sky turns a bit - 7 occasions we had to evacuate the pool and deck due to stormy weather. Again not an issue really - I dont want to come accross as negative. A trip to Wallmart to stock up on beer and put in the fridge for chilling on the balcony to stare at rangers raking poo was great. Better than $5 per bottle when you can drink 24 buds for $8.!! The Disney busses were great - we didnt have to wait long for any of them EXCEPT Downtown Disney!! for some reason. We had a fab time - the hotel was great - dont read too much into the negative stuff - thats just a personal experience - you make your own holiday. Looks like the AKL villas will be nice. = The building work isnt intrusive - just a bit noisey - I didnt see 1 crane or any builders - it may just be a tape they are playing - along with the other african music gently playing in the background.!!!!! Please contact me if you want anything answered. Just got back. Planet Hollywood is under refit!! Just the outside. Raglan Road - the best resturant we went too - Irish nite - fantastic. The Guinness is great. All the best. Isnt it great to have 30 days leave a year - not like you poor American chaps - 15!!! outrageous. No wonder you are all a bit stressed. Marc

Reviews.Title: “Great time, kids had a blast!”
Reviews.Author: japholden
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the AKL for a week in March of 2007. The kids, 4 and 2, loved everything about the hotel. We paid the extra for a savannah room, and it was worth it. We were on the end of the trail and could see the constrution out the corner of our balcony, but it wasn't bothersome. We were on the second floor, and there were some animal pens below us that were a little smelly in the mornings, but not offensive at all. Glad we brought the umbrella strollers with us. It was 480 steps from our room to the front door, too many for the kids to walk when we got back from a day at the parks. they loved being pushed around the hotel. the second floor was a great view of the animals. We had elands and zebras out our room everyday. The giraffes never came down our way, but there are so many places to view all the animals it was okay. The beds were a little high so the kids needed help getting into bed (we got the 2 queen beds). The room was a little smallish, but we weren't spending the vacation in the room! We were only there for a nap in the afternoons, a dip in the pool, or to go to bed. We did the Magical Express service, it was great with the kids. No car seats, no car rental or taxi to worry about. Just get in line and get on a bus. The return was a little different, we had an early flight and the airline desk didn't open till it was time for our departing bus had to leave (next time we'll just book a later departing flight, not an 8am flight).We did have to wait to get into our room, but we checked our carry on bags at the check in, and took the kids to Downtown disney to start our Disney experience. We did put our swim stuff in our carry on bags in case we wanted to hang out at the pool. But by the time we got back from Downtown Disney our room was ready and our bags were waiting for us. The zero entry pool was great for our 2 year old. My husband and I liked the water slide, and the kids liked us using the water slide. The souviner cup at Mara was the way to go. For $11 we got the travel mug with unlimited refills of soda, coffee, tea. We really got our money's worth with the two cups we bought. I got my coffee for the bus trip to the parks in the morning, my husband supplied his soda kick nicely for the week and the kids got their iced tea and lemonade for the pool trips. Well worth the money--plus inside the parks we could fill it with tap water and add a cystal light pack to give the kids flavored water and not spend $2 for a bottle of water or soda! Once home the cups have served me well in getting the kids to preschool in the morning and still feeding my caffeine habit! My husband had his birthday while we were there and Disney out did our expections. We had already scheduled a breakfast at the Animal Kingdom with Donald and I mentioned his birthday to our server when he went to the rest room. The charaters all signed a card for him, and the wait staff did a round of Happy Birthday. I had pre-ordered a "cake" made of chocolat bars and snacks through my travel agent and a Diseny Florist and it was wonderful. The snacks were great and the kids loved it as much as Dad did! When I asked the front desk in the morning about it being delivered, they asked me his favorite character and the cake was delivered with a card from Goofy with a picture in front of Cinderella's castle!!! It was a Magical vacation 100%!! I'm surprised by the bad reviews I've read. I think a lot of them come from poor planning on the part of the writer. We had read a few guide books and focused on the tips for traveling to the parks and hotels with kids so we knew to bring the strollers with us (and we got to save the rental money for a stroller in the parks by having our own....check them as plane side carry on at the gate and they are ready when you get off our plane at the gate when you get off). My in-laws meet us at the hotel for the last 2 nights. They loved the hotel as well. The kids had a great time with them there for 2 days, and even though we weren't able to get rooms near each other (they made a last minute decision to join us) it was fine. The were only one flight of stairs up from us. It was a great time and we can't wait to do it again!

Reviews.Title: “overpriced, small rooms, not worth it”
Reviews.Author: saratogamike
Reviews.Content: Took our 3 kids to Disney for their first time, decided to splurge on the "deluxe" category room and we were very disappointed. Room is very small. We had to jam the roll in bed between the two double beds...the result being one very long connected bed w/ no floor space. if you want to know the width of the room it's 2 double beds and a twin bed exactly, wall to wall. We also had some other issues - the door lock did not work one day, housekeeping did not clean or set up the kids stuffed animals the last 3 days of our week stay...very disappointing after they did it the first several days. The toilet broke. All the issues were addressed and taken care of as much as they could be but for a deluxe hotel it was a bummer. They also took off 1/2 a nights stay, also a nice gesture. The grounds and hotel are amazing. We had a pool view room and that was ideal. Savannah view is not necessary IMO as you can see the animals from everywhere in the hotel. The bus service was annoying after a while...just a long ride everywhere, and if you miss a bus by a minute you can wait another 10-15 for the next one and then have a 20+ minute ride to whatever park you are going to. Gets to be a drag, especially coming back afer a long day. Also, the meal plan was not a fit for us...limited options for our picky eating kids and not great food for adults. Jiko was really, really good and fun. Loved it, best meal of the week by far. The rest of the fod that week was subpar. Lots of activities and things to explore in the hotel - great pool w/ slide, night vision goggles are cool...would have enjoyed the stay if our room did not have so many issues and was so small. We will go back to Disney, of course, but we won't stay at AKL. I can see AKL being a good fit for small families (one kid maybe) or couples IF you don't mind being pretty remote. I will stay either at a monorail resort or stay off site and rent a car and not do the meal plan.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For!”
Reviews.Author: TheLuckyCharmClan
Reviews.Content: After carefully researching every possibility, in park and otherwise, we selected Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge for our family stay at Disney World. We booked a Concierge Level room and have zero regrets. The extra money we paid for the room had its perks. On arrival, we were greeted with a bellhop from South Africa which led to the authentic charm of our trip. He was extremely pleasant and seemed to enjoy pointing out details as we made our way to our room. We were advised that due to availability our room was upgraded to a Junior Suite. When we entered even the bellhop's jaw dropped. He said "Wow. This is amazing. I've never seen this room before." And, amazing it was. All thick, ebony framed furnishings with velvet coverings. The bathroom with separate vanity/make-up area was beautiful. There was a small eating space with wetbar and microwave as well. Then, on to the view. The only noticable problem with our room was that the insulated glass of the patio sliding doors had lost its seal allowing moisture to build within the panes and somewhat obstruct the view. However, once the doors were open we had an uninterupted (well, save for some fencing and barb-wire) view of an african-esque Seregetti complete with zebra and giraffes. On our first, and each consecutive morning, we enjoyed complimentary continental breakfast in the concierge lounge (free to conceirge level guests only) which was well stocked with cereals, pastries, fruit, amazing juice blends, milk, juice boxes, bottled water, coffee, and tea. We would also return for an afternoon snack (cookies, fruit, beverages) and again for a nightcap (cordials and luscious desserts). Since it's next to impossible to find juice boxes and water in the parks we took advantage of the concierge lounge offerings at the and kept an extra juice box or bottle of water in the kids' packs as well as in our room. The food savings were probably greater than the cost of the upgrade and I would not hesitate to upgrade during future stays. Wow, I haven't even commented on the architecture or staff yet. Five Stars. Seriously. This is the most beautiful hotel we have ever stayed in and the staff was trained to serve with a smile. I did not have one single regret and will certainly pay a little extra to stay at this amazing hotel in the future. Also good to know: the hotel provides transportation to all of the Disney parks and Concierge will assist you with reservations and tickets (even when you think getting into a show is impossible).

Reviews.Title: “Animal heaven Human earth”
Reviews.Author: nitsy
Reviews.Content: Myself hubby and a 2yr old stayed here for our 1st trip to Disney In Jan this year We read the reviews and booked a savannah view room which is well worth the extra Every morning our 2yr old jumped out of bed to go watch the animals from the balcony! Yes check in took 25mins on a saturday pm the rooms are dark the bathroom is compact and awkward and the food isnt great but all these things are easily overcome I would strongly recomend you hire a car as Disney does not let go of its inhabitants easily!! But during the day the Disney buses are great dropping you off right at the entrance of all parks Never waited more than 10mins at either end and very friendly drivers Very useful for popping back for a mid afternon nap before hitting the parks in the evening The lobby is fantastic and they hold events there for the kids or just chill out in the seats after a long day at the parks Definitely worth staying here for Disney but if youre planning to visit the other parks you def need a car or another hotel

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!!”
Reviews.Author: hellsing771
Reviews.Content: My family has been huge Disney fans for as along as I can remember. Then one day during the summer of '04, my mother received an offer from Disney to stay in one of their Deluxex resorts for $180 a night, starting on July 1st through August 31st. So after a little consideration, my mom and I decided to try the new hotel Animal Kingdom Lodge. So during the last week of July, we headed for Orlando. We left on a Wednesday night and were delayed at the airport for two hours. Combined with a three hour flight, we didn't get the resort until 2am!! But the staff there were totally friendly and sympathetic for our delay and gave us a room upgrade on the spot. We went from a room with no view, to a room with a view of the savannah. It was really cool, waking up in the morning and seeing all the animals out there roaming around. Room service was ordered and arrived 15 minutes later. 15 minutes!!!! Steaming hot food and a wonderfully funny delivery woman and we were off for the first of five wonderful days. We loved the atmosphere of this hotel. The food was a little pricey, but was very good. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. This basically was a dream vacation, nothing other than the flight delay arriving, went wrong. The only real downside to this hotel is it's size. We were fortunate to have a room very close to the lobby, restaurants and pool. But from what I saw on the map, it could be a very long walk from some of the rooms. My advice to people considering this hotel or any other Disney hotel is to plan ahead. Pick out a hotel and begin to figure out your costs. Do not be surprised by how expensive it can get. So plan at least a year in advance and start a vacation fund. Once you have this figured out, decide on what parks you want to visit. Now this is where it really gets tricky for a lot of people, so I recommend picking put one or two parks to visit. Unless you have two weeks to spend, and most of us do not, you WILL NOT have enough time to see everything and ENJOY it. Let me repeat, you WILL NOT see everything and ENJOY it. Sure, some of you will scoff and say that you can see everything there is in, say five days or however long you're going to be there. But you will not enjoy it. You will find youself racing from 6am to 12am, trying to get in as much as possible. You will feel rushed and irritated by the amount of people at the parks. You will begin to despise the people working at the park, thinking them to be lazy because you had to wait in line for a ride, hot dog, or the bathrooms. Remember these are the people who are trying to entertain you and your family. They do not have to do this, but they chose to do it. Be respectful of their choice and of them, and you will free yourself of a lot of stress. Think of the people you are with and how they want to enjoy ther parks, because let's face it, you are going to get stuck in a line for the rides. FastPass is a great innovation for stream-lining the more popular rides, but remember that you can only use it once every 90 minutes (I think it's 90, could be longer). So where do you think everyone is going after they too use the FastPass? So, do not get upset or stressed out, take this time to talk to your kids, spouse or whoever is there with you. Do not let this opportunity get away. This is supposed to be your vacation, a time of relaxation and rest. Time to spend with your family outside the daily grind of life. Just enjoy the short amount of time you have away from the stress of work, commuting to work, and worrying about work. Look at the smiles on the faces of your kids or other kids as they experience Disney for the first time, and remember your first time and how happy it made you to be there. And smile as you think about those kids will one day in the future experience the same joy as you're when they take their kids to Disney for the first time. Thanks for reading this little rant and remember to have fun and enjoy your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Disney for adults!”
Reviews.Author: MattnKel402
Reviews.Content: I was really pleased with our trip to the Animal Kingdom. My husband and I are in our 20's- I'm a disney nut, he had never been. Be sure to find out if you are in the wing of the hotel under renovation. We moved twice because the construction noise was unbearable. If you have kids and you're out the door at the crack of dawn, its probably fine, but we did the pool in the mornings and the parks at night, so we needed the room to be peaceful in the mornings. The disney dining plan was fantastic. I made reservations before we left and had great choices every night. If you're having too much fun and don't want to go, just cancel, no big deal. The cafe by the pool at the resort was great! I had awesome salads, wraps, fruit, etc by the pool each day. The pool bar and other hotel bars were very nice and very sophisticated. *Note that many disney resorts do not have pool bars. I really loved the pool. Always had fresh towels, plenty of chairs, etc. I'm not really into the african decor, but for the pool and "deluxe" quality without paying the price of the other resorts, we were thrilled. Also, because it is a "remote" hotel, the buses are generally only for your resort, so I thought travel between parks would take longer, but it was actually much shorter because you never have to stop at another resort. Tip: The gym has a nice shower facility that is free. We booked a late flight on check out day so that we could lounge by the pool, then showered in the gym/spa. It was nice and added a day to our trip. We wish we had eatten at Jiko the restaurant on site, but ran out of time. Ate at: Alfredo's (Epcot, its closing, but do book a 7pm dinner anywhere in Epcot then walk outside and watch the fireworks) Ohana's (Poly. resort- this is a best kept secret- it is NOT the luau but is a wonderful Hawiaan dinner, we loved it). Eat late and watch MK's fireworks on the beach beforehand. Brown Derby (MGM- not worth the price but got priority seating to the fireworks at fantasmic which is limited seating- great idea.) San Angel (Epcot- this is NOT as good as I remembered and I would go to Canada or Germany again before this in Epcot). Biegarden (Epcot- we did this for lunch and it was fun. Nice buffet, lots of beer, got stuck at a community table with some boring people but otherwise enjoyed it.) Feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: AllisonMadden
Reviews.Content: My family (husband myself and two kids age 5 and 8) stayed here with another family in June 2007. We were disappointed and aggravated by the whole experience. The lobby staff were incompetent and unfriendly. Our concierge room for which we paid a significant amount more for was on a different level than the concierge lounge b/c of construction that we were not previously told was going on. (PS - the room was small and bland). This resulted in a 10 minute walk to the concierge lounge from our room. The construction was LOUD! Jackhammering in the lobby at all times of day and no apologies about this also. (I immediately called my travel agent about this on check in who swore she knew nothing about this) Our luggage took 4 hours to get from the airport to the hotel. I called several times to the concierge (bathing suits and my husband's medication was in the luggage -- kids finally swam in their shorts begrudgingly b/c we were told the luggage was lost-- lots of tears there). The concierge receptionist put me on hold for 10 minutes and then disconnected me. When I called back she claimed she had just gotten a new phone and didn't know how to operate it. She then told me to wait for a call from the manager of the hotel IN MY ROOM. Finally I got a hotel manager to speak to on the phone who promised she would go over to the luggage area to look for our luggage... After I hung up, I left my room, found the luggage area downstairs, located someone in charge there who brought me out to a truck where they were unloading bags and picked through the bags until I found my own luggage... (not exactly a Magical Experience) As I was leaving the baggage "depot" area, the manager was just coming in (a full 35 minutes after we had talked). The lifegaurds at the pool seemed militant and unfriendly patrolling the pool area like a swat team. The staff in general (other than the people working with the animals or acting as animal guides who were mostly friendly and eager to tell us about the animals) gave off the impression that they were not happy to be there or to help and anything they did was as some great favor to us... At night they had something called "Night Viewing" of the animals, an event advertised to be a lot of fun b/c they "provided" night vision goggles to see the animals with. My kids looked forward to it and to our utter amazement ONE nervous looking staff member came to the meeting space with ONE set of goggles to be shared by 20 kids who had to wait in line, hold the goggles up for 2 seconds and were then told (again militantly) to pass them on and share them. It was the most pathetic thing I have seen, topped only by the "poolside kids games." One day they had (I am not kidding about this) a bucket of rubber duckies TIED to the side of the pool and two sand pails with shovels also tied to the side of the pool. That was a "pool game." The next day they set up a basketball net in the pool, threw about 10 miniature basketballs in and let the 25 or so kids throw the balls in the net. This would have also been qualified as fun especially by my 8 year old son, IF THEY HAD NOT ABRUPTLY AFTER 10 MINUTES removed the net and balls from the pool! There was no supervision required for this game and my husband and I watched in amazement as the staff worker packed it all away as the kids looked on in disappointment. I was really, really surprised by this experience. For the amount of money we paid for this hotel we were shocked at how bad it was. Our conversations with other guests also proved that we were not just being picky or sensitive. EVERYONE we talked to here had complaints ranging from lost reservations upon check in, rude staff to lost luggage Last year we stayed at Universal Hard Rock on the concierge level and had possibly the best vacation ever. The Hard Rock definitely spoiled us and created expectations of a hotel that Animal Kingdom Lodge didn't even come close to meeting. The Hard Rock Hotel was fun, the staff accomodating and the overall experience excellent. Skip this Animal Kingdom thing and head over there for a real treat!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time at Animal kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: TakingATrip
Reviews.Content: We just stayed for three nights at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. We had a great time and we love this hotel. We thought that it was very peaceful and enjoyable. We had a nice meal at Boma and we waited, once, for 15 minutes for a bus. Otherwise, we had very little wait time for buses. There can be a long walk to your room, but we were fine with that. One important word of caution!!!! I listened to others who wrote reviews and I requested to be in the Middle Savanah. We were not put there. We went to our room and there was loud banging and a terrible view. We called the front desk and asked to be moved to a room away from the construction and with a better animal view. We were moved immediately ,without any problem, to the Zebra Trail area. it was so much nicer and it was quiet. The rooms are expensive, so don't settle for a bad room.

Reviews.Title: “Elaborate, Friendly, Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: mjgAtlanta
Reviews.Content: The only negative about my stay was that we were only able to stay for 2 nights on this trip. I would have loved to stay longer. From the moment we arrived, we were pleasantly stunned by the attention to detail, courtesy of the staff, quick room service, and so much more. When we checked in we had trouble finding our room, so two emploeeys walked with us and personally saw us to our room. We had a pool view room, and even though there were laughing kids and jungle music playing right outside our door all night, we couldn't hear a thing with the glass door shut. The food was great. And outside, the animals grazing in the savanna were delightful--and made even more so due to the helpful staff who discussed the species' natural African habitats at length and offered us a night-vision scope with which to view giraffes after dark. I would definitely stay here again. It was Disney magic at its best.

Reviews.Title: “Far Far Away”
Reviews.Author: mytwobuckaroos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our first trip to Disney. We booked a room with a safari view. The animals were still far away and hard to see. The room was overpriced for its location to the attractions. Everything was far away. The bus trips were long and then the drop off zone at the hotel was up a hill to the resort. Then we had to walk a maze of halls to get to our room (very similar to vegas). It was very tiring to face that after being at the parks. The hotel was clean and well maintained. They said the pool was heated but it was freezing cold. I would not recommend this hotel compared to the money spent to stay there. When we went back to Disney in October of 2006 we stayed at Port Orleans Riverside and it was overall a better experience than the Animal Kingdom lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyFan73
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge early Saturday afternoon and breezed through the check-in process in a matter of minutes. Our very friendly and very helpful Cast Member explained our room key functions, briefed us on our package inclusions and directed us to our room via a map of the resort. Our room was ready upon our arrival, nearly 3 hours early. The room was clean, smelled fresh and was stocked with plenty of towels, toiletries and extra bedding. Our pool view was slightly obstructed by a closed wall as opposed to a railing because we were on the 2nd floor and situated over a roof top. Next time, I'd ask to be moved so we could actually view the pool without standing but we were so taken by the hotel, we didn't bother complaining. The entire hotel is beautiful and filled with authentic African sounds and smells. The animals on the Savannah were gorgeous and always able to be seen from the public viewing areas. We ate in all three of AKL's restaurants and enjoyed them all. We loved the bugers at the quick service spot, the Mara.
