Boma was a wonderful buffet featuring exotic dishes along with standard American fare like chicken fingers for less adventurous diners. We also ate at the hotel's fine dining establishment, Jiko. The experience was wonderful beginning to end. The food was fantastic and the pace was relaxed (I've noticed that many Disney eateries tend to be rushed dining experiences). Our Mousekeeper was wonderful - our room was always clean and well stocked and we were usually surprised to come back and find fun towel animals on our daugther's bed. The bus service from AKL was wonderful. We never waited more than 15 minutes for a bus (typically, 10 minutes or less) and were happy to find out that AKL does not share bus service with other resorts. We would absolutely stay at Animal Kingdom Lodge again in the future. Next time, we'rd actually like to spend more time at the Lodge and less time in the parks. We will also spend the extra money and upgrade to a Savannah view room for future visits. Before arriving, I wasn't sure the extra $$ would be worth it, but I am certain it would be. Overall, a fantastic experience and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the poor reviews....The best hotel Ever...........!!!!!x”
Reviews.Author: Mandypooh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in AKL in may this year and it was the best holiday to Disney so far...This hotel made the difference. we received a letter prior to leaving which stated the construction works had started and we were worried that this would affect our holiday badly...This was not the case. Disney made sure we were placed away from the construction..which you couldn't see anyway! We had a lovely savannh room that was so well themed ..was so exciting!!x We could walk out on to our balcony and the animals were right there!! Unbelieveable!! Giraffes, Zebra's loads of them!! The service was faultless, the room was cleaned everyday and the resturants were so yummy!x I can still remember getting of the transport buses and smelling the delicous food!! Mmmm It makes me so cross to read the poor reviews on this hotel, as they do not reflect the hotel experience just personal experiences ( We all have them!) We even took time to vist the other disney resorts to see which one we would like to stay at next...and it will be AKL again next time for sure!x Along with the magic of disney this hotel just adds to a vacation you will never forget!!! xx Please please please do not listen to the poor reviews, going to a place like this expectations can be high and this only breeds disappointment wherever you go!! This place is truly what its says on the tin!!! xx Do not change your mind on poor reviews you will regret it, we read all the reviews before we went and the good ones are the ones to base your views on! trust us!x

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for Animal Lovers!”
Reviews.Author: hifihound
Reviews.Content: We booked a Savannah view room, and requested a room in the best location for viewing the giraffes. We were not disappointed! The animals were able to come within about 20' of our balcony, and were the most active in the mornings as we were getting ready for a long day of exploring the theme parks. Additionally, they have "guides" located around the hotel who can answer any questions about the animals and can give you advice on where to see them best, and at which hours. The hotel's restaurants were excellent, and the pool is huge, not too deep, very warm, and open 24hrs! There are 2 spa tubs, and a children's splash pool as well. We had a great time and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely time...but I have some advise.”
Reviews.Author: xtina72
Reviews.Content: We loved the AKL, it was beautiful, truly a place to relax even w/ all the animals, be sure to get Zebra trail for your room stay, if they want to put you in sunset trail ABSOLUTELY refuse!!! It is a savanna smaller than my back yard and you see NO ANIMALS! You also have a lovely view of the cess pools, and the smell of them being sucked out....not worth 400.00 a night by far! They should be ashamed to even call that Savanna view! But I digress, we were in Zebra trail and it was outstanding! We had Giraffes outside our balcony all day long and then at night, we had views of the fireworks right on our balcony SUPERB! There is much to be desired of their staff and their lack of friendliness, we didnt need to converse w/ them much as we had no problems so it was not much of a concern for us. My children never wanted to leave, I didnt even have to buy tix for the park everyday, there are many many activities for them to get involved in, LOTS OF FUN! This year (2007) we opted to skip AKL as they are redoing many of the rooms to turn them into studios for the Vacation club owners, thats very annoying. I hear it is loud and just terrible there right now so I will take my 400.00 a night elsewhere......we will be going to the Polynesian this year. :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, shame about the corporate attitude”
Reviews.Author: marieOxford
Reviews.Content: The AKL is an African-themed Disney resort and is beautiful if slightly dark inside. Outside there are various non-carnivorous African mammals and birds in the grounds, visible from the public areas and for those paying a premium for a "savannah-view" room. The resort is pleasantly isolated from the mahem of the Walt Disney World parks, but this means the transortation takes a bit longer to get you to wherever you want to go, and nowhere is walkable. The rooms were very well-furnished and comfortable. The Boma buffet restaurant was excellent. My big gripe is that I took the family to the "fine dining" restaurant Jiko one evening, and spent the night vomiting. The following day (we were all tired) I asked for a refund and was referred by the restaurant and front of house managers to the WDW external claims bureau. Two months later, after some exchanges of paperwork, I receive a letter regretting my visit was not magical in every way and hoping our next visit will be completely enjoyable (no refund)!!! I thought it regrettable that the hotel couldn't deal sensibly with the issue at the time. We will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “OK - But expected Better”
Reviews.Author: ladybugkj
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying at the AKL, and I have to agree with some of the other reviews that I expected more for the price. Check-in is a hassle, and takes WAY too long. I waited 15 min to talk to someone even though I was second in line. Another problem we had was with housekeeping. One day they forgot to clean our room altogether. My husband had to call them at 6:00 at night, and we had to leave the room for a couple of hours so they could send someone to clean it. Not fun when you have two tired children who have been at the theme park all day. The pool is nice, and though there aren't a lot of animals, I did enjoy watching the giraffes and zebras around the resort. The food needs a major overhaul. The Mara "cafeteria style" is AWFUL, and if you want to eat at the other two restaurants be prepared to wait and pay a hefty sum. Room service is another option, and we resorted to this after being faced with a 2 1/2 hour wait at the Jiko. I found the bus transportation to operate without a hitch. Maximum wait time was 10-15 min; however, when departing the parks, it always seemed that we waited longer than the guests at the other resorts. Overall, OK, but I probably won't be staying here again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “An incredible experience!”
Reviews.Author: Stephlovestravel
Reviews.Content: We were finishing a stay @ the OKW resort (see review) and decided to extend our stay @ the AKL. We have been lucky enough to stay here before but this stay was awesome. We were checked in right away, and were shown to a Savannah View Room. What a treat to sit on our balcony and see 4 giraffes outside! Our room was spotless with a flat screen TV and lots of nice toiletries. Everywhere we went in the hotel we were greeted by hotel staff. There were animals everywhere and we spent much of our time being awed by the different Savannahs and enjoying the hotels food and wine. The wine @ this hotel is fantastic - they have the largest South African Wine List outside of S. Africa in the world. We have enjoyed many a great bottle @ dinner! The bus service here is great, never too long a wait and never to crowded. The pool area is beautiful, quite big with a beatiful flamingo pit right behind the pool area! There are 5 eating and drinking options here @ the hotel - all are different and all are excellent. Enjoy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A bit over-rated & don't use the room telephone!!!!”
Reviews.Author: heather47
Reviews.Content: Just returned from at Stay at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge from 26/05/07 to 05/06/07. To be honest not what I had expected. The hotel is nice enough, but it's a 4 star because of the animals and lobby decor.. not for the service. Check in was slow process, & no-one would help you with your bags. You were given a map of the hotel & left to get on with finding your own room lugging your cases with you through a maze of corridors. Lobby is magnificent, with lovely views of the animals. Bongo drums beating all the time will drive you bonkers after 2 or 3 days though. Room was ok, spotlessly clean. Bathroom clean, but bath was tiny only 5ft long & and only around 12 inches deep, i think to accomodate for disabled guests. African themed room which was a bit dark for my liking, but nice none the less. Had a great king size bed. View from the tiny balcony was disappointing, we were on the Zebra trail on the 1st floor with a pool view (well if you are over 6ft tall you could see the pool over the large plants), god only knows how much it would cost to have a savannah view, but you have to book the savannah views in advance for an additional supplement. No minibar, but did have a fridge for own drinks etc Had an old TV with limited channels, but it worked so it served it's purpose. WARNING: Don't use the phone in the room. We made 10 5 mintue calls to UK & when we checked out discovered that they charge $14 per minute... our phone bill was $700 ... yes folks £7 per minute to the uk. There was no warning or tariff of charges. I wonder if they would ever have blocked the phone or informed us how much we were spending. Even the male receptionist was shocked & went to ask the manager if it was correct, but the manager came out to greet us and insinuted that more or less - tough luck, we should have known better, it's not the staffs job to monitor adults using room telephones!!! I also aksed about public transport to visit Busch gardens (which was rubbish incidently) & was told by the consierge that she was only there to inform us about disney products. She also said that she had no information on buses to the airport as that wasn't a disney either! (there's a free bus which runs from sea world but you have to book places info from sea world guest services) Restaurants & bar weren't all they are cracked up to be. The Mara self service menu never changes and is all very haphazard once you get to the service desk. Jiko & Boma very over rated only african cusine on the limited menu in Jiko which never changed. Had to make reservations in advance and even then you could not get a table to eat before 9pm. As for Disney parks & services. Everything as you would expect Disney bus service top class, we were never left waiting more than 5 or 10 mins. Saw building work going on, but I doubt that it would have dispruted anyones stay or enjoyment. In conclusion. Nice hotel. Brilliant holiday. But when I go back I'd stay elsewhere and visit animal kingdom park.

Reviews.Title: “The Truth”
Reviews.Author: PWPres
Reviews.Content: First let me say if you are planning a trip to the AKL and are worried about the negative reviews,don't be. I have to admit that after reading so many reviews on this place,i went in looking for some problem associated with what i had read. I was overwhelmed,it was awesome.This is the truth people.The room was spotless,we saw animals everyday all over the place including from our balcony,the staff were friendly,we didn't hear or see any construction going on , the pool was great for small kids,never waited over ten minutes for a bus and the food was outstanding.Jiko is without a doubt the best restaurant in Disney.Believe me,we ate in 5-stars all week and it wasn't even close.The room was managable, not too cramped.If you plan to spend your vacation in your room you might think it is small.You do have to walk if you are far from the lobby like we were but it was alot of fun figuring out shortcuts during our stay.I know now that dreams do come true and the AKL is a big reason why.The truth,you will love this resort.We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: bluzrif
Reviews.Content: Stayed May 31st thru June 4th. I was nervous about the construction going on, but I have to say that I heard only one saw one time and that was at the pool around 4PM. Nothing bothered us at all when we were in our room. I never SAW any construction. We stayed on the Zebra Trail room 4472 with a pool view. I know some people love the Savannah Views, but for us, we enjoyed the pool view just as much and enjoyed the animals as we walked to the elevators or the lobby area. This resort was wonderful and very unique. The rooms were very comfotable and if using the drawers provided rather than living out of luggage, there was plenty of room for my husband, myself and two children. Housekeeping was great. I did not expect my sheets to be CHANGED daily unless there was a real need, and since we were the only ones sleeping on them, it's a waste of water and energy. Our showerhead was brand new, which I'm sure that is due to the hard water that comes along with Florida. Transportion: Not a problem at all. During the whole visit we waitied no more than twice for a total of 10 minutes at the most. The buses just magically appeared it seemed the moment we walked up to the pick up point. The buses were never crowded and you never felt any angst in trying to get on the bus for fear of missing it and having to wait for the next one. If there had to be a downside, it would be the length of the bus ride - not as convenient as a monorail resort. A note to those with children. The resort is very animal conscious, so straws are not permitted on sight since they are a choking hazzard to the animals. Bring your sippy cups for the real little ones. Also, They do not allow balloons from the parks in your room, They will store them for you. So don't bother to buy a balloon if you planned for your child to enjoy it in the room. I'm sure we will stay here again in the future. c. jones Nashville TN

Reviews.Title: “Not luxury standard rooms, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: luv2bbrown
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to a Disney hotel, it was our 25th wedding anniversary so we upgraded to 'luxury' standard. I had heard that there was new construction and renovation going on in this hotel so I was a little worried that this might spoil our holiday. I needn't have worried, the only noise I heard was on one day throughout the two weeks and that was some drilling noise that could be heard in the hotel lobby. The new construction was out of sight-typical of Disney. We started off on the fifth floor in the Ostritch Trail. The room was very nice, clean, and quite recent decor. We were asked to move on our second week as this floor was being renovated for the Disney Vacation Club. We were moved and upgraded to a Savannah View room on the fourth floor of Kudu Trail for our inconvenience. I must say that if I had paid extra for this room I would have been disappointed. Although the room was clean the decor was very worn-bed covers faded and net curtains ripped on the patio door. Unless you are mad on having animals outside your window I wouldn't bother paying the extra. Other rooms having viewing windows on each floor. At the time of our holiday the Orlando area was suffering from swarms of black flies-must have been the mating season-and these were a pain. Unfortunately, the flies that were trapped in the hotel pool stayed there as the pool wasn't cleaned. The pool itself was ok but not huge, although it never got really crowded. There were plenty of sunbeds but if you wanted the ones nearest the pool or those that were in the sun all day you had to get there around 9-9.30am. The self service restaurant was ok but with the ususal junk food-burgers, fries, cakes, pizzas, crisps etc. There was some fresh fruit, side salads with Turkey and sandwiches with Turkey (everthing seemed to be with Turkey or cheese and everything same with some sort of dip). The menu for the cooked hot food didn't change at all and after 2 weeks it became very boring and unhealthy. There were no different sandwiches or salads and the cooked meal choice didn't change either. The two other restaurants Jiko and Boma were expensive for a family and we didn't like the menu anyway. The staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and welcoming, noticably different from the other Disney hotel. To sum up, the Animal Kingdom Lodge is a lovely hotel it has a beautiful lobby. I have stayed in a moderate Disney resort hotel and in my opinion there is not much difference in the standard of the rooms, the only difference is you have a balcony at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. I would stay there again purely because I felt it was quieter at night than the other Disney hotel that I have stayed in and although the food variety wasn't great they did have some healthy things to eat. I certainly wouldn't pay for a Savannah view room though that would be throwing money away.

Reviews.Title: “A "Deluxe" resort?”
Reviews.Author: TheBedslugs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weeks Honeymoon May 2007. We had very hopes having read the reviews and seen the pictures of this place but were sadly disappointed. 25 minutes to speak to a receptionist, when we did get to speak to one it was hardly a warm welcome (i was particulalry upset as the receptionist was a fellow was a fellow Brit who couldn't even crack a smile). After an ordeal lugging our cases through endless corridors passing lots of porters that could have offered to help we get into our room. Having worked as a Duty manager myself in a hotel what i was presented with next simply beggars belief: Our room was placed on the ground floor thus offering very poor views but also had the added bonus of being in a corner of the block with rooms either side of us, in short it offered no privacy and one can only presume that the hotel had not been told the purpose of our stay. After moaning we were moved and full marks to the manager for his attitude and help, though the hotels gifts of manky srawberries, makny fruit and cheap champagne complete with card with incorrect name of bride and groom kinda made me feel their gestures was not so sincere. The next room was on the top floor with better views. "There's building work going on but it won't affect you and as a result the animals like to move away from the noise and should migrate to outside your room" was the promise both in person at the hotel and in a letter ONE WEEK prior to our stay. Hmm, there was building work going on and guess what, it was visible it was audable and yes it did affect what animals you saw and when. I was woken up to the sound of distant mechanical diggers more often than the sight of an african savannah that they promise in the videos but hey why should i worry it was honeymoon? Other things worth pointing out: I can't tell you what two of the restaurants are like as honeymoon or not it's very difficult to get a table. I can tell you that there's a fast-food restaurant there that has the same menu every night and i really do wonder what families with young kids must do. The lodge is poorly connected and we suffered arduous waits for buses to the various parks. Ever seen a reception desk completely unmanned in a four-star hotel? I have for several minutes and it wasn't a pretty sight. I was slightly confused at who this hotel is trying to appeal to. The four star four families with kids is a strange old mix and if your in the without child catagory then i doubt you'll be happy here. There's no place to get some quiet, even in the bar where the expensive cocktails go hand in hand with the sound of live african bongo's, interesting firs and e but not every night certainly not when you want to chill out after a days theme parking. Having stayed in Disney's 'buget' accomodation (All Star Movies resort) before, I was extremely disapointed with the so called 'Deluxe' resort. At £1600 for a week, stay elsewhere and spend the money on Mouse ear hats! Good views of a (very) few animals but not exactly the savannah thats advertised on the tin. You have been warned....

Reviews.Title: “OVERRATED LODGE”
Reviews.Author: JX1
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this resort at the middle of May & I wasn’t all pleased with my accommodations. First there wasn’t enough staff manning the registration counter and it took a while before I was able to check in. Second they gave us a room with bunk bed which took a lot of space from the room. The bathroom was dirty & the tub was clogged. The sheets were stained & it seems as if they just don’t change them at all. This is supposed to be a deluxe resort yet it felt like an overpriced value resort. The hotel is overrated with horrible Disney transportation. If you plan to go anywhere using their buses including Animal Kingdom; be prepare to wait for the long haul.

Reviews.Title: “Wild Animal WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Ikeybabe
Reviews.Content: Overall: We loved staying at the Wild Animal Kingdom!! It was fantastic, family-friendly, comfortable and exciting...all at the same time. it was so cool being up close with the animals and just watching them roam. Getting There: Super easy. The disney complimentary shuttle service got us from the airport to the resort without a problem. And our luggage arrived a few hours later, but not so long that it became an inconvenience. The Room: Very nice. We had 2 queen beds with a savannah view. the room was clean and comfortable. We loved the double sinks in the bathroom and the balcony overlooking the savannah was perfect - we saw lots and lots of animals. it seemed they were close enough to touch...almost. there were giraffes, warthogs, these oxen-like beast, vultures, ostriches and so many more i don't even know what they're called. I did have to ask housecleaning to change our sheets after the first night - they didn't do it on their own. Food: We dined at Jinko and the food was very good, the presentation excellent and the staff super friendly. The Environment: the lobby was fantastic. you just wanted to hang there because it was so cool with the vaulted ceilings, huge panoramic window and various carvings and exhibits to see within the huge lobby. Transportation: The shuttle service to and from various theme parks was so convenient. But beware, the drivers ask you to fold up your strollers before boarding. So, it becomes a drag. We just rented a stroller at the parks. Overall again: We got a good value for our money. We enjoyed our stay immensely and would definitely do it again! The Cons: ok, the shower head did have gunk on it, but i figured that was hard water stains or something. it wasn't fungus., tho. The pool was terrific, but beware if you're just lounging the love-bugs will swarm! they were everywhere, except in the pool. Ok, that's it. if you go to Animal Kingdom Lodge, i'm certain you'll have a fabulous time.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: little_leroux
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The staff were friendly, it looked amazing and the facilities were good. When we arrived we did have a problem with our room but they moved us with no fuss at all. We had paid for a savannah view room and this was well worth the money. We also ended up with a slightly larger room and this would also be worth paying for if you are travelling as a family. The hotel is organised into trails and depending which trail a room is on will affect what wildlife is seen. We were on the Kudu trail. Directly below our balcony was a patch of enclosed ground but this was an enclosure incase of evacuation so was necessary. We regularly saw giraffe, ostriches and bongos from our room, especially early evening. The dining was interesting. Most orlando breakfast food seems to be fried or sugar coated. They did have croissant. Also there were only facilities for making coffee in the room. We had the breaksfast buffet one morning and the food was lovely. They also had loads of fresh fruit here. In the evening the african buffet was lovely in Boma. Jiko offers some interesting food (I had filet mignon, served on macaroni cheese with a red wine sauce). We would recommened making reservations for both boma and jiko for evening dining. Because we were in a disney resort we were able to have our attraction tickets on our room keys. Also we could charge most things we bought in disney straight to our room with our keys. This was convenient. Overall we all loved this hotel, transportation around disney was easy and we didn't need a car. It is very disney with little mickeys on everything but then it wouldn't be disney without all this. The other nice thing was being able to talk to the african staff and learn about their cultures. There were variuos demonstrations of african life and tales round the camp fire every evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay @ AKL”
Reviews.Author: Goldenkanes
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay @ AKL. Everything was absolutely perfect. We didn't have a Savannah View Room but there are plenty of places to see the animals @ anytime of the day. The pool was awesome and my 6 year old loved the slide. From where we were I didn't even noticed that there was ongoing construction. The lighting is just fine and the walk to the buses is NOT very far @ all unless you consider 50 steps far. I've stayed @ every Disney Deluxe Resort and I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone with small children or those of you wanting to try a different Disney resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Lucyddr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a pre-flight night on May 11. Overall, the resort was outstanding. Check-in took less than 5 minutes and we were off to our room. There was definitely some construction going on (visible from our balcony), but the noise was not loud or distracting. Upon our arrival to the room, we saw pigs, ostriches, giraffes, and several antelope species. We then went to the pool, which was somewhat crowded. Despite the pool volume, plenty of chairs/umbrellas were available and the pool bar was great. After enjoying the pool, we went back to the room to enjoy a beautiful sunset before dinner at the resort. Overall, our room was clean, comfortable, and romantic. For those who love light, it may be a little dark. I will definitely stay here again and recommend this resort for couples wanting a romantic escape from typical "city" hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Substandard Rooms for the Price”
Reviews.Author: KatnArt
Reviews.Content: AKL, worth the price? not for more than a night or two just for the experience. Positives: Beautifully decorated rooms, Elaborate Lobby and Surroundings, THE ANIMALS !!!, and of course the staff - they were genuinely friendly and helpful throughout our 8 days there. Negatives: Very dissapointed in the size of our room. It wasn't much larger than a cruise ship room. I found myself shoving things in every little space I could find. There were only two of us, I could not imagine staying with kids. The rooms are SMALL. Not all the savanahs are equal. We had a room on the 4th floor, it was too high to enjoy the full experience of seeing the giraffes. Also our savanah viewed a smaller compact "backyard", not worth the money for that view. The middle savanahs had more animals and a prettier view but they are not guaranteed, nor is your bed size, you only get it if its available at check in. The pool area was ok, but not nearly nice enough for the size of the resort. It had one little slide and 2 spas, really a bit disappointing. The restaurants were excellent. African themed, excellent service, tasty food, but very high priced. The animals were always entertaining with live guides to educate you about the environment and animals you were seeing. SUGGESTIONS: Get there early on check in and make sure you get a middle savanah view on the SECOND floor, no higher. Not worth a stay longer than 2 nights to enjoy everything this hotel has to offer. Definately an experience to have once in a lifetime. I stayed on the Kudo trail closer to the main hotel and NEVER heard any construction. I really never knew construction was going on in this hotel and I was on the 4th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, but......”
Reviews.Author: WendyMc
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say that this hotel is very beautiful but you have to walk very far to the bus stop, and there is only one bus stop unlike some of the other Disney resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic but look out for the animals !!”
Reviews.Author: BichonTravel
Reviews.Content: A great hotel with lots to offer from entering the lobby to drawing back the drapes and seeing the savannah views. We particularly liked the cute monkeys sitting on our balcony in the morning sharing one of our granola bars - they soon ran off however when the Giraffes got wind of our In Room Dining and pushed their heads right through the open window and stole the coffee pot (the left the half and half !!). This was amazing and made for some spectacular photographs. After what seemed an age the giraffes moved off only due to the fact that it was alomost time for ''Mickey's Elephant Trumpeting Spectacular'' a magical and tuneful review of old Disney favourites. It might have been a dream as those beds are really comfy - we have stayed here at least 4 times now and apart from the obligatory loud American families thundering and shouting up and down the corridors with no thought for those who want to sleep .... a great resort (assuming you are within what seems a mile of the lobby otherwise it is a very long walk)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort with lots to do”
Reviews.Author: Leigh R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2004. It was our first time staying in a WDW deluxe resort. What a beautiful resort it is. The lobby is spectacular. The items you can buy in the shop are very unique. All of the employees (Disney calls them Cast Members) uniforms are themed. They have people from Africa that can tell you about which country they came from and their culture. The animals are wonderful. We had a third story room way in the back of the hotel. I"ve been told a third story room on the Zebra trail overlooking Arusha Rock is the best place to be, and if we go back that is what I will request. At the time Disney was having discounts, and we got what would normally be a $300 a night room for $200 a night. The kids can decorate cookies at Boma. Make sure to check out the two restaurants, Boma (a buffet) and Jiko, one of Disney's fine dining restaurants. The Mara has quick service food which isn't too spectacular, just your average fare. There were a few good looking things on the menu there, but we stuck with traditional burgers and chicken fingers. You can see the animals at night using night vision goggles. If you can't afford a savanna view room, don't worry, there are plenty of places on the property to view animals. The same goes for people who can't afford to stay at the hotel. Book a dinner or lunch at one of the two restaurants, and allow time to explore the resort. You can do and see everything at the resort without being a registered guest aside from swimming in the pool. Their pool is great too!

Reviews.Title: “An absolute must, a trip to Africa without the Coup de Etat”
Reviews.Author: Luckybear3
Reviews.Content: Absolutely Wonderful. Wish I was still there. It ain't the Ritz, but then again you don't feel like you are in Africa when you stay at the Ritz. It is what it is and it is awesome. Better then Grand Floridian although perhaps a bit less Disney feeling. We love it though. How about swimming until midnght in Africa with wild animals roaming about and then waking up and eating amongst the African Plains on your private balcony for breakfast. Jiko was awesome too, be prepared for unusual but excellent tastes. Let your expectations of city life and typical five star resorts go and visit Africa without chance of Governmment overthrow. An absolute must, and I am a seriously picky bas*&^d.

Reviews.Title: “Magical time at the Lodge”
Reviews.Author: cajundiver
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Animal Kingdom Lodge (May 7- May 11) and we had a blast. I wanted to post this right away to give a room suggestion to anyone going there in the near future. We stayed in room 3383 on the Zebra trail and it was wonderful. Great view of the savannah, but more importantly we never heard or saw any construction from our room. Once on the balcony I could hear something off in the distance, but just barely. The down side is that it is a far walk from the lobby (4-5 minutes), but we thought it was so worth it for the peace and quiet. The animals were amazing! We saw tons of animals from the balcony every day. I wouldn't recommend booking this hotel until construction is complete. However, if you were in the dark on the construction like we were and booked a room, this might be a good room request to make. I don't know how long this information is valid because the construction areas change, but I hope this helps someone going soon. Everyone was so wonderful to us and the front desk couldn't have been more helpful. Also, be sure to have a few drinks at the Victoria Falls lounge and try out Boma. We loved them both. The only reason this hotel didn't get a five is because of the construction.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel stayed in - ignore the petty bad reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: littlefluffy
Reviews.Content: We have just come home from our honeymoon at the AKL and felt that I needed to write a review, after reading some of the reviews before we went I have to say I was a bit worried. But after staying there for 2 weeks I realised that all the bad reviews were about extreamly petty things! We checked in late evening and the reception staff were very helpful and found us the perfect room with a view looking out on to giraffes, red hogs, ostriches and many other animals. We saw these animals EVERY DAY, one day we even came back to find the giraffes (3 of them) lying down having a nap just a few feet away, it was amazing! We had excellent maid service, everyday they arranged our towels in a fun way and our room was cleaned to VERY high standards, we were topped up with soap, shower gel etc as soon as we needed it. I have seen alot of reviews saying that the rooms are small?! what?! They are definatly not small I have stayed in hotels with much smaller rooms, and the two queen sized beds we had in our room were the best hotel beds I have ever slept in! The decor of the hotel was fantastic It made you really feel that you were in an african hotel. The swimming pool was suprisingly warm and relaxing after a long day in the parks! I have stayed at disney hotels before but this is the best, we will definatly be recomending it and will be trying hard to save to stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “AKL, great for small children”
Reviews.Author: brendanbrady1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the AKL from May 4 to May 8. We were booked for a standard rm, and upon check-in i asked to be upgraded to a Savannah view rm, which they did free of charge. It was great- our kids 1 and 3 loved seeing the giraffes everyday out side our room. The room wasnt as small as most of the other complaints say that it is...i had a double stroller and numerous toys that were acquired each day, and we were all fine. My biggest complaint though, is the food choices. If you want something quick, like most people with small children do, there is only one place to choose from, Mara. The same pizza, burgers, and chicken fingers got redundant by day 2. You also cant order food at the outdoor bar area, its just for drinks only. But, it is great for small kids b/c of all the animals, and also the zero entry pool. Staff was very pleasant and helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Super Comfy after a long day!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hiley
Reviews.Content: Such a great hotel!!!! After each day in the parks we looked sooo forward to the super comfy beds and wonderful shower!!!!! We booked a standard room hoping to upgrade to pool view but when we got there they were all booked. After we realized the pool is open 24/7 we were thrilled to have the peace and quiet with the standard view----and paid less than a noisy room too!!!!! If I had to complain it would be about the timing of the buses---though I am not sure that falls on the hotel--buses should run to the parks every 20min or so and we waited for a bus at Magic Kingdom for more than 50min with about 200 people for this same Hotel. May 2007

Reviews.Title: “You're Paying for the Animals - And it's worth it!!”
Reviews.Author: krackbabee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge for five days in the first week of May 2007. We used the Disney Magical Express option and just loved it. Disney give you special tags for your luggage, and when you depart for your flight to Orlando and check your luggage, you don't see it again until someone brings it directly to your room - usually three hours after you land. Ours showed up in under two! Some people have written complaining about the dark rooms. Yes, the rooms are dim, but not 'dark'. Bright glowing light from multiple rooms would light up the savanna, and disturb the animals rest. The animals are what makes this resort 'deluxe'. The room itself was quite nice. Small frig, TV, two sinks, nice balcony overlooking the savanna. Very peaceful. Well, until the construction started around 8ish each morning. They're working on much of the resort, and the vibrations do make they're way to your room. Didn't bother me much, personally. For the amount of work being done, it was quite discreet. I was a little upset that there was no shower cap or sewing kit available. One of my favorite pair of socks had a nice hole in the toe, and there's NO walking all day with THAT. After searching around, I found no sewing kit. Bit of a bummer, considering we did pay nicely for the room. Maybe it was from the incredible amount of walking you'll do at the resort AND the parks... but I found the beds just wonderful! The pillows just knocked me right out every night. The food is tasty provided you're not afraid to experience some different spices. You must try their special blend orange/mango juice. Yummy! If you're big coffee/tea/ice tea/soda drinker, it pays to invest in the $11.99 souviner mug with unlimited refills. Otherwise, they two dollar you to death every time you want a beverage. If you're staying at the AKL, be sure to remember what 'trail' you're on. This place is huge, and set up a bit like a bug, with the lobby being the 'body' and four long legs being the 'trails'. They have names like the Zebra Trail or the Giraffe Trail. When you check in, they will tell you which trail you are on. Do not forget it! There's no connection from one trail to the next except for the central lobby, so you'd having to walk all the way back where you started from to get to another trail. Everyone we spoke to from the hotel was very friendly and helpful. When my keycard wouldn't open the room door, my husband and I went to the lobby conceriege. The gentlemen working told me this happens all the time and that I must have put the card next to something with rechargeable batteries. I knew I shouldn't have put the camera in my handbag! Nonetheless, he reactivated and all was fine - fortunately, I noticed the card wasn't working when I was IN the hotel. Because this card is your pass to EVERYTHING, be sure not to deactivate YOURS and not find out until your already at a park. But overall, great trip - great time - beautiful animals and breathtaking sunrises.

Reviews.Title: “Not so deluxe”
Reviews.Author: tenmilecreek
Reviews.Content: If any of you are used to a 5 star resort, this will not fit the bill. Currently there is construction going on just outside the hotel and the noise is constant from 7am to 5pm. We were not informed of this, so after a long day of travel from Colorado we were extremely disappointed. They could'nt change rooms as they had full occupancy. The rooms are very small and very dark. I had read other reviews and I felt the people were overreacting, but it is true, small and dark. My family of four paid over 5k for 7 nights, meal plan(another story), and 7 day park hopper. Some would think this reasonable, but 7 days at an all-inclusive at the best resort in Huatulco, Mexico will cost $3400. I know there are Disney lovers out there that go annually, but I just don't get it. The children did love the trip. We did our parenting obligation and the kids had a great experience. We however took a vote and 3 to 1 we will be spending our next trip in Huatulco. The $1600 in savings will go to a true 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “questions and help required”
Reviews.Author: evro
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 3 two adults and one child age 4 and we have booked to go to AKL on the 2nd of June. Know one seems to be able to help us to get a clear idea of how the construction work will effect our stay and I am reading mixed reviews. Does any one know if there is an area to stay in that is not effected, are the animals still happy to be around all the work that is going on, are the eating areas effected, do you have any photos to see whats going on and would we beable to get a sleep around 3pm so that our little one can go out in the evening?

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Birdmoore
Reviews.Content: We were completely thrilled with Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge. The room was spotless, larger than a typical hotel room, and furnished well with really cool Afican themed Stuff. We were pleasantly surprised our "standard view" room in fact had a view of a smaller savannah and watering hole. Nice African culture programs for the kids and adults. The pool was lovely. We never waited more that 10 minutes for a Disney bus.....and most waits were under 5 minutes. Most buses went directly to the park of choice....no stopping at other resorts for pick-ups. The Disney Magical Express service was another story......but no fault of the hotel. The resort has an odd layout....in order to get to the restaurants or pool from the wing we stayed in we had to take an elevator down one floor, walk through halls and then the lobby, then take another elevator down. Not a real complaint, just odd. The restaurants were some of the best at Disney. For those with sensitive noses, however, the hotel smells of food when you walk in the front door....good food, but food nonetheless. Overall, we had a wonderful time with no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: MrDavid
Reviews.Content: My family and I have Just completed a 14 night stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge staying between the dates of the 10t and 24th of April. We have always stayed in Disney hotels in Florida, California and France and without hesitation I would say that Animal Kingdom Lodge is the best we have experienced, recently I have read several negative reports of the hotel and must say that I wholy disagree with them all, before our departure I faxed and telephoned the hotel and requested connecting rooms as we travelled as a party of six including my parents, when we arrived sadly this was not the case and the reception staff gave us two rooms close together, I asked to speak to the manager who was most helpful, he appologised for the error and instantly upgraded our rooms to a Savanah View with connecting door and bunks for the children which we had also asked for, from this point onwards we found all staff to be remakably helpful and courteous at all times, the rooms here could be described as a little darker than normal but this only added to the relaxing feel of the place, our rooms were well appointed, spotlessly clean and the housekeeping service was first class, I would highly recomend a Savanah View as the view is simply breathtaking, all animals were visible throughout the day at some time or another, the facilities of the hotel are also extremely good with a large swimming pool and multiple play and amenity areas for the children, we ate in both Boma and The Mara on several occasions and both offered a high level of service and quality, Boma is reasonably expensive but worth it and The Mara is ideal for a quick snack or Breakfast before venturing out, the disney bus service as always was excellent, the longest we ever waited for a bus was 15 minutes with the majority appearing within 5 minutes. On the basis of this holiday I would not hesitate to return or recomend the hotel to others

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but with a few problems”
Reviews.Author: themickeyd
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on my 2 1/2 year old's love of animals. The room did not let us down for that, he would wake up asking to see the animals. The giraffes and zebras were out of our patio nearly every night. The pool was great, very large and clean. Plenty of towels and chairs are found pool side. What did let us down? Well, as others have said, our room was booked and then a couple of months down the road we received a letter explaining there would be construction going on. Well let me say it wasn't the easiest getting the toddler to nap with impact drills and pounding going on. And they were quite loud going on between 9am and 6pm. Also, food choices are limited on site. With Mara (Counter Service), Boma (Buffet) and Jiko (high end table service) are all good but after a few days there it will leave you wanting something different. And if you want to eat dinner earlier than 8:30 pm expect to make reservations early on. Posters on site state that for Boma and Jiko reservations are required. If you are traveling with a small one, that can be a real challange. Overall we did like the resort but would not stay there until after the construction was completed and we would also have a rental car to open up more dining options.

Reviews.Title: “Whine, Winge, Moan - Give me a break!”
Reviews.Author: EmilyJRoberts
Reviews.Content: I love you Americans but do you know what? You whine about the slightest detail so much. Come and stay in a five star in the UK and then you will have something to moan about! If you think service was bad come to the UK and again you will go back happy to be home. Dont like queues? It is part of life in the UK! Staff not smiling enough? Be worried if someone does smile at you in the UK because they are probably up to something! I went to the Animal Kingdom last year and loved it. We are going to the Grand Floridian next year. I love Disney because there is so much to do for the kids and I am not entertaining them constantly. The service you get from Animal Kingdom was second to none. They were friendly, they smiled and nothing was too much trouble. I was upgraded free of charge to a savannah room and spent many a happy hour watching the animals and the sunset. You just need to chill a bit and stop rushing around like lunatics. The staff at Disney ARE HUMAN and are entitled to have days when they feel tired. I would feel tired if I had you lot moaning constantly about the smallest little insignificant thing and I did notice some of you doing it. Your moaning actually wound me up and this was probably the worst part of my holiday. It is such a shame because on the whole the majority of you are excellent company and I so enjoy visiting your Country. Trust me, your service standards to customers are exemplory and put the UK to shame! I could not fault anything. My room was clean, the food was good and the parks were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “loved animal kingdom lodge”
Reviews.Author: travelfamily
Reviews.Content: Seeing the bad reviews i wanted to write my own review. We stayed April 18th-22nd. We had a wonderful time. Check in was good, they tried to put us in a room way out of the way but insisted on something better and the CM was very nice and got us a better location We had a Savanah view and it is soooo worth it. I have three boys under 6 and i could not get them off of the balcony. They loved looking at the animals and would run to the door whenever we would get back. You can not get this close to the animals for an extended period of time anywhere that i know of. Yes the rooms are not that big, but for my family of five we had plenty of room. I have stayed at the values and the deluxe rooms are much bigger. We only heard construction noise a little out at the pool. did not hear any in our room. we were on Kudo trial. This was our second stay at the AKL and we were aware that construction was going on when we booked. This is our family's favorite place to stay and we can not wait to go back again sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Information Only”
Reviews.Author: EW1966
Reviews.Content: We are booked to travel in a few weeks and I have just received notification of building works. I have checked, and this is a major project which will take 3 years to complete. I have no idea what the effect is on my stay, other than I have been told that there will be noise which can be heard from the pool area. Some views may be disrupted but I dont know to what extent. I do know however that Disney issued a press release on 11th October 2006 advising that their timeshare 'Disney Vacation Club' is ready for sale and that the first phase will be completed in 'Fall 2007'. The extent of this development is huge and can be seen on the internet. The Holiday company through whom we booked claim they only found out on April 18th 2007 - after building works started. We cant move hotels due to lack of availability unless we are prepared to pay a further £2000. I know nothing else, but as I am feeling miffed about already paying over £7000 for a holiday, I think that it is only fair that you have the opportunity to make your own checks before spending out on your dream holiday. That is the purpose of forums such as this. I record that I dont know how much of an effect these works will have and offer this information on a purely factual basis as advised by my tour operator, albeit a bit late in the day.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for the service”
Reviews.Author: sveatch
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our second Disney trip. We thought we would splurge this trip and stay at a "Deluxe" resort, having previously stayed at the Carribean Beach resort. Due to a plane delay we have to check-in at 2am. It took awhile to get someone to the front desk, our room (we had booked bunk beds for our 2 young children) had not been made up - there were dirty kleenex on the unmade bed. We were given another room only to be awakened at 3:30am to be told our luggage had arrived. The next day, after much work on our part, we finally got into a bunk bed room the next afternoon. When I went to complain to a manager, I explained the problems we encountered he implied it was our fault for not booking a "bunkbed" room. He didn't believe that I did until I showed him my reservation confirmation. Then he offered to buy us a meal (we were on the meal plan). When I told him we had wasted an entire day his response was, "I would not insult you by putting a dollar amount on your time." (well THAT insulted me) We then had to content with constant construction noise from 9-6pm, and a 1am fire alarm. On a good note, the kids loved seeing the animals and spending time at the pool. The lobby is truly a site to behold, it is beautiful. We did not run into any trouble getting to other parks, but we did have a long wait to get to Downtown Disney. Overall, the service was lacking and definately not worth the money we paid!

Reviews.Title: “Typical disney owend hotel”
Reviews.Author: markple
Reviews.Content: This is without doubt the worst Disney hotel we have stayed in, the booking was wrong on arrival, the rooms are small, the whole hotel smelt damp, as regards the pool area I think I would prefer to swim in a proper African mud hole. We have stayed at the Disney Beach and the Disney Yacht club these hotels are far superior, we also stayed at the Dolphin and the Swan, both of these hotels are on disney property but owned by Marriot group, these hotel are far more proffesional but can sometimes be full of business suits at some conference or other. My advice forget the Animal kingdon lodge, the kids can see plenty of Animals in the park.

Reviews.Title: “bright, cheerful and artistic”
Reviews.Author: DJNyc
Reviews.Content: i read the bad reviews. you have to take them with a grain of salt. one person complained about no sewing kit in the room and mediocre toiletries and other petty criticisms. disney calls some of their resorts deluxe but the deluxe part is lodging inside walt disney world, the proximity to the parks and the magical details. is a hilton cleaner? maybe, but is it wonderfully themed as a beautiful african lodge? no. you're not paying for large rooms or expensive bedding. not even the grand floridian is really a luxury hotel. the rooms at GF are just slightly bigger than the ones at animal kingdom lodge. i think AKL does a better job with a more exciting theme. it's right up there with the breathtaking lobby of wilderness lodge. our room was small but beautiful. someone called it tacky, which is a shame. artists went through great efforts to create an exotic decor mixed with disney magic. there are so many wonderful details. the only pool does get crowded but is great for little ones with the zero entry. i stayed in a room with a balcony overlooking the savannah with giraffes and zebras. we got to watch the graceful creatures while we relaxed on the balcony. what a delightful,calming experience. you don't get that at a zoo. their marketplace has good food with ethnic flair. the staff is very friendly. this is a good resort to stay in off-peak when prices are cut in half and it is less crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: vze48xx5
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge! We had giraffes and zebras grazing outside near our room and saw many other smaller animals all around the lodge. The interior is so amazing! Our room had bunk beds and a queen bed and the kids were in seventh heaven. The pool area was one of our favorite features. The restaurants had excellent food! The service was great and we never wanted to leave. It was cheaper priced than some of the other resorts we stayed at in Disney World, but there really is no reason to spend more.

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge--Grrrreat!!”
Reviews.Author: flagfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge for one night following a business conference at another hotel and I'm glad I did; it was the highpoint of the week. This is a good way to experience part of the Animal Kingdom without going to the park. I was in the room for a limited time--just late one night and early in the morning the next day, but I saw lots of animals--giraffes, antelope, zebras, etc. I was worried that the animals were only on the savannah for limited times, but although they do move around from one savannah area to the next so not all animals are visible at all times, there was always something to look at and a nice variety. My photo does not do the hotel justice; animals are closer than they look in my photo (none are visible but I think there are some back in the trees). You don't need binoculars, but bring them if you have them for an even better view. Decor of room and public areas was very interesting, although my room was a little dark. Be forewarned, I had a late check-in (5:00pm), but that may have been an aberration. (I arrived at noon, bought a ticket to Epcot at a desk in the hotel, and took off, returning in time for dinner.) I had breakfast at Boma and it was great. It was a buffet with all the typical American breakfast items, but also had some exotic and delicious African foods. The buffet was an excellent way to sample some new dishes without having to pay for a full meal just to get a taste of something you may not like. Although this resort is primarily intended for families, I found it an enjoyable place to stay as a single on a business trip. Although expensive, I found it worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, but service was lacking”
Reviews.Author: CircleCityJanet
Reviews.Content: We had 7-day/6-night stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge for Spring Break during the last week of March 2007. We had high expectations -- perhaps too high. We had stayed at the Grand Floridian the last time we were at Disney and I think it gave us a false sense of reality. Pluses: The hotel is beautiful and unique. We had a Savannah view and seeing the animals right outside of the window was quite a treat. We booked the meal plan and that worked extremely well this visit. In fact, most dining locations were very accommodating and flexible in making the plan work for us. Also, we were concerned a bit that the distance to other parks would be an issue, but we never waited longer than 10 or 15 minutes for a bus, either to or from the hotel. The restaurants were extremely crowded --but not as fabulous as they were made out to be. It is clear that guests from other resorts come to AKL to sightsee and eat. We did enjoy Boma for dinner. Minuses: The room was pretty small. It also was not very clean. I will spare you the gory details, but we had to repeatedly request that housekeeping change the sheets on our beds and vacuum or sweep the floors. We also found the front desk staff/concierge staff to be short, curt and a bit condescending. Here are a few examples: Halfway through our stay, my "key/admission ticket" stopped working. Unfortunately, we found this out the hard way as I tried to enter one of the parks and was denied admission. To make a long story short, somehow our park admission was completely voided from our account, along with any charging privileges, etc. What a mess. They kept looking at us like we had done something to the card. Since they couldn't seem to figure out what happened in their systems, they chalked it up to a "glitch" in a computer software changeover that was taking place (during Spring Break??). They had to completely void our entire booking and re-book it into their computers -- twice -- before they could get it to work again. Also during our stay, we needed to mail some personal and business corresondence. We were directed to a mailbox just off the lobby. 9 days later, none of our mail has arrived at its destinations. We can't get any answers from the hotel other than "the mail gets picked up everyday." Very frustrating. We enjoy Disney and have stayed at the Yacht Club, Beach Club, Boardwalk and Grand Floridian during prior visits. From an accommodations and service standpoint, all of those hotel experiences were markably better than the Animal Kingdom Lodge. We have a 7-year-old who absolutely loves the Disney experience so we will return -- but won't stay at Animal Kingdom Lodge again.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling for 410 a night!”
Reviews.Author: songair234
Reviews.Content: We visited the Animal Kingdom Lodge from 12/28/2004-1/4/2005. We were going to stay at the Grand Floridian, but then thought about how neat it would be to stay at a hotel with animals right outside the room. Reservations: We made the reservations online for a grand total of $4,400 for 7 nights and three park tickets. The hotel was about 410 per night. The booking went smoothly and we received document packages in the mail with luggage tags and vouchers. Arrival: We flew on Delta/Song airlines to Orlando and got in around 10 am. We went to luch and then proceeded to the resort. On first impression the resort looked absolutely beautiful. The room: We were given the keys to the room and then we proceeded to walk a good 15 minutes to a room on the lobby level. Upon entering, we came to the quick realization that the room was definitely smaller than the master bedroom in the house. The closet was small and the beds were not very comfortable. There was dirt in the bed. There was no couch or anything. The carpet was unpadded. The bathroom had dirt on the sink with some sort of toothpast scum on the faucets. The toilet and shower are in the same room making it impossible for someone to use the toilet and take a shower. And there is no door separating the room from the sink area. At other hotels, the toilet is in a separate room which is nice. The AKL even ahs carpet in the sink area. If there was to have been a spill, I wish someone good luck trying to clean it. Our room was over the area where the animals are herded in the event of a hurricane. There were cigarettes dropped off the balcony too. There was an old tv. No LCD's here. There were no robes, no slippers, no mini bar. The decor was tacky. There was absolutely nothing about the resort that made it luxuious. It is a disney deluxe property. Housekeeping: Fresh toiletries and towels had to be asked for as housekeeping didn't leave them more often than not. The toiletries are not good at all. There is no conditioner/body wash, just shampoo and lotion, and a bar of soap, in paper with mickie mouse on it. Disney used to provide big toiletry sets with sewing kits. The sewing kits have been eliminated, and the toiletry sizes have been cut in half. The towels were industrial style too. The housekeeping was awful. Pool: The AKL has only one pool. Other disney hotels including the all stars have at least 2. There is a crappy slide, with a life guard yelling at poeople for going down headfirst down the slide that a 5 month old could even go down. The jacuzzis are not hot and the pool comes standard with floating hospital debris such as bandaids. Other: Turn down service had to be requested. They left you a small chocolate and a computer generated note. It did not feel personable at all. The staff weren't overly friendly and the gift shop does not open when the say they will. We managed to sneak up to the concierge level and all the crackers and food was gross looking andd just displayed on a table. Definitely not worth the upgrade. We called and complained about housekeeping when we got home and the manager was extremely rude blaming everything on us. He said that the housekeepers could not read notes because many were illiterate! I was appaled. A month later we received 3 one day ultimate park hopper tickets. They never expire, but we won't use them. They are going on ebay. I high suggest staying away from the AKL. Oh and the bus system is absolutely horrible. Stay at the Grand Floridian or the Polynesian. The Wilderness Lodge was much better. If you are going to stay at one of the lodges, stay at the Wilderness Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Hollie3
Reviews.Content: We went to disney on a 4 day land 3 day cruise package. We stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge and it was terrific. The place is absolutely beautiful. The animals were out all the time and you could see them great. The check in desk was fast and the staff was helpful. The buffet restaurant was expensive and not that good, but the Boma was great. We had breakfast and some lunches there. The pool and pool area was clean and towels were provided. The bus system to get to the parks was great. Never had to wait too long. We shopped at the gift store at the lodge and got everything we needed there. We had a great time at Animal Kingdom Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Environment”
Reviews.Author: Gallaghermom
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. The only drawback was the distance it was by bus to most of the attractions. The buffet is WONDERFUL! Even if you are scared of trying African meals, you have to try this buffet. There are choices for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “THE ABSOLUTE BEST!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: alakec
Reviews.Content: Okay, the only reason we ended up staying here is because my boyfriend had a friend get us the cast member discount (discount for Disney employees). I wasn't sure what to expect after reading the reviews. However, let me tell you guys, this is THE BEST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED IN. The lobby is beautiful. The rooms are awesome. The grounds are beautiful. We had breakfast at Boma, their restaurant on the ground floor. Breakfast was amazing. It was a buffet with everything from fresh fruit, to pancakes, french toast, every pastry you could want and even cereal for the kids. The resort advertised that it had a health spa. And sure enough, it was a real gym!!! This gym was better than the gyms you see at most apartment complexes. It opened bright and early at 6 AM for those who wanted to get a workout in before starting the day. The provided towels on all the machines and the walls are lined with televisions. The hot tub was to die for. It was open past midnight and was amazing. We sat in it everyday, lol, sometimes more than once a day. Their is a bar by the pool and if you can sneak a drink to the hot tub, you will be in heaven! The animals are out playing and you are able to take pictures of them, even if you don't have a room with a view of the animals. I cannot say a single bad thing about this place. Check in was easy, check out was easy. Towels were brought immediately after calling about them. The room was cleaned spotless every day and fresh towels provided when we arrived back at the hotel everyday. I'm not sure about paying regular price for this hotel, because it is expensive. But the saying, "you get what you pay for" is extremely true when it comes to the Animal Kingdom Lodge. Everything was the absolute best. Even the gift shop located in the lobby. If you can afford it, YOU MUST STAY AT THIS RESORT IF YOU VISIT DISNEY.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: travel-gal6979
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying at the Animal Kingdom Lodge for the second time and had a wonderful time again. The hotel is spectacular. You truly feel that you're in Africa. The service was impecable, everyone was so friendly and helpful at the hotel. We picked a pool view room which had a very lush, tropical view. We weren't disappointed at all and wouldn't hesitate to go back. We used to stay at The Polynesian but think that the AK Lodge is far more impressive...the architectural details are truly amazing...nothing was missed when this hotel was built. Jiko's restaurant is romantic and the food is delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time at the Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: DnRNelson
Reviews.Content: Awesome! We were hesitant to stay here but were very pleasantly surprised. I have been to Disney five times and this was my favorite trip. I was with a family group of about 15 people all age groups. We had a great time. The hotel is a really good deal for the price. Pool area is good (of course you have to reserve your chairs early in the morning), food is good, service is good, location is good, and the rooms are clean. We had a really great time staying there and would go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderfully relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaChic
Reviews.Content: We had seen pictures of the hotel - but there was still a lot of "Wow" factor when we arrived. The hotel is beautifully designed and and it is decorated with many African works of art and crafts. I've never been to any African country - so I don't know how authentic the atmosphere is - but it is a fun fantasy to pretend to be in an African country. We stayed on the club level in a "deluxe" room - which as far I could tell by was different from "regular" room in that it was about 2 foot longer. A standard two queen beds, 2 chairs, table, amoir- with-TV layout - but again, very nicely decorated. We had a good size balcony that overlooked the interior savannah. We could see giraffs, zebras, some other animals - but they were never very close. The club level offered breakfast, snacks during the day, hot snacks at night (enough for dinner for us light eaters), and desserts later in the evening. A great expresso machine, soft drinks, beer, wine, cordials, juice were available all the time. Finally, and best of all, was the staff of this hotel. Everyone was very friendly, helpful, and there when we needed assistance. We never saw the housekeepers, but they did a great job cleaning the room and turning down beds each day. The hotel has many staff from different African nations. The ones we encountered we ready to answer questions, talk about most anything, and generally gracious "hosts" to their hotel guests. They conducted several tours and classes (some specifically for children). We did not attend any of these, but there was a good variety listed. One thing that bothered my husband about this hotel was the location. It is located on the edge of the WDW property and there is nothing within walking distance. He prefers the hotels that have more options. On the other hand I liked the feeling of being secluded, away from the rest of the rush of WDW. In summary - a beautiful and restful spot, a little pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sparkyswife
Reviews.Content: OMG.... What can I say other than if you are going to stay anywhere..stay here. We had 7 glorious days in this Hotel and have nothing but praise. The rooms are well kept, hotel dining is fabulous, staff are very helpful and kind and the actual Hotel itself is just amazing. We will definatly be staying here again next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: delpreston
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several Disney hotels for business in the area. This was my first trip to Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge. I expected it to be much like my experiences at Disney's Wilderness Lodge. The hotel was easy to find with Disney’s signage around the property. Granted many of the road signs you’re not used to because they’re in purple and black, but the hotel is setback in a nice quiet portion of the Animal Kingdom complex. Gate security guided me to check-in parking. At check-in there was a five minute wait, and then I spent another 10 minutes waiting as they had misspelled my name on the reservation. Eventually I was off to my room. Since I didn’t know much about the hotel I didn’t know what to request as far as rooms go. Well, I come to find that many of the rooms border the safari where animals will actually come up to your guest room. The safari is a very cool experience that’s very unique to this hotel this is an attraction designed especially for those traveling with children that love animals (and what kid doesn’t!). The room was on the fourth floor which is only one floor above the main entrance on level three. I found the room to be typical of Disney resorts. Very clean, neat and orderly. The room was decorated in typical Disney fashion holding to the theme of the hotel. I had a double room with a comfortable bed and found it was easy to work on business. Disney offers what they call High Speed Internet access, but after speaking with coworkers we all agreed that they need to reconsider use of the terms, “high speed.” I apologize to those that desire actual upload/download test speeds. I’m not a fan of the bathroom design that’s open and without a closing door, but the toilet and shower are in a room with a locking door. I was a bit upset that Disney had seemingly switched toiletry products as I really like their sweet smelling personal care products that they had on prior visits. The only problem I encountered on the entire visit was with the shower head in the bathroom. he head had a bad build up of grime which locals tell me is typical in Florida after a few years. I then turned on the showerhead to find that the water flowed in dozens of directions. I quickly phoned the front desk for maintenance to replace the showerhead, which they did in less than half an hour. I walked throughout the safari game area and pool, but did not eat at this resort. Though I did check out the buffet, but decided not to eat there when I noticed very dirty glass on the sneeze guards (yuck). Overall I was pleased with this hotel, and I’d definitely bring my family here again. Though if it were between the Animal Kingdom and Wilderness Lodges, I’d have to choose the Wilderness Lodge, I’m a fan of their theme and food.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: shadowryter
Reviews.Content: This is an abolutely beautiful hotel. You could probably spend a half a day or more just taking in the views and all the African themed artifacts. This is also a large hotel so if you have any reservations about walking after walking the parks all day, you might want to request a room closer to the lobby. We had a lovely Savannah view room and we did see some animals. The problem here is if you are going to be at the parks all day you may not have optimal viewing time. So, if you don't have a room with a view there are still plenty of places to see the animals but again it would seem that timing is of the essence here. On our last day we went to Arusha Rock but were told they would not be back until 11:30. We were checking out by 10. That aside, we had an unforgettbale stay. I love Disney at Christmastime and the AKL was all decked out for the holiday. It was fantastic. Be sure to stop by for Boma's breakfast buffet. This place was so awsome that my teenage daughter requested we cancel another breakfast to attend Boma's again. I was more to happy to oblige and Boma's found no problems getting us last minute reservation. Be sure to take note of the cute towel and wash cloth animal's and don't be surprise if you come to your room to find your daughter's stuffed animals propped up by a pillow, paw on the remote, watching TV!

Reviews.Title: “A credit to the Disney Experience”
Reviews.Author: starkyscotland
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very very good, the front desk sorted out all the problems we had (due to Virgin Holidays,who are not so good). The rooms are a normal size although there were only two of us great decor,cleaned every day and great views.I think someone mentioned that their kids and thereselves lost interest in the animals walking about after a couple of days, I'am sorry but this has nothing to do with the hotel, the fact that you can wake up and open your doors to a giraffe or zebra every morning is outstanding and not something you usually see. The breakfast in Boma was fantastic but best of all was Jiko. Scotland has some great places to eat like Gleneagles and the Witchery in Edinburgh but this restraunt is right up there with the best of them. The Disney transportation was really impressive, granted I was there in January so the longest I ever had to wait was 10mins but it only takes 15mins to get to the furthest away parks. Overall staying here made the whole disney holiday a bit more special, not having to bother with parking at the parks, amazing food (no fast food junk) and a very unique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Atlanta1411
Reviews.Content: We stayed at AKL for 9 nights over Christmas and absolutely loved this hotel (2 adults & 2 kids aged 9 & 7). Check-in was really quick and we got a free upgrade to a Savannah room which you just have to have! We walked in to our room and opened the balcony doors to see giraffes outside - the kids absolutely loved it. Rooms were really nice although needed a step ladder to get in to bed each night as they are so tall! Rooms were cleaned every day and all the staff were really helpful. Boma was outstanding we went twice during our stay definately recommend the puddings! Mara was the usual Disney food court (chicken strips, burgers etc) but was ok. Bar was nice but small so we took our drinks and sat in the lobby area. Bus service was great never waited more than 10 minutes considering it was Christmas - parks were really busy but not unexpected. Never went in the pool but it looked fantastic, there were activities on every day for the kids. All in all a fantastic hotel and will certainly be going back in 2008 (staying in Pop Century Nov 07).

Reviews.Title: “We loved it...Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: MinnieVinnie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, who are in our late 20's, stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge Resort the last week of January, 2007 for 6 nights. We could not have asked for a better trip! If you are having doubts about staying at the Animal Kingdom Lodge because of other reviews, don't!!!! It is great! We travel all over the country, and this was one of the most unique, and fun places we have stayed. We have stayed on Disney World property 2 times prior to this at the Port Orleans Riverside and the All Star Movies Resort. If you can afford it, the Animal Kingdom Lodge is worth the money and has far more things to do on property that the other 2 that I mentioned. For a couple, who enjoy animals, we loved it! We booked a Standard view room in October of 2007 because of budget constraints, but still wanted to stay at AKL. When we checked in, we were automatically upgraded to a Savannah view room. We looked onto the Sunset Savannah on the west wing of one of the trails. I can't remember what the trail was called. Our room was almost at the farthest end of the wing, and although it was a little walk, it was not any farther than what you walk at the other resorts to your room. Our room was amazing for two people. Being on the same floor as the lobby, we had great views of the animals. As soon as we opened the door to our room we were greeted by 2 giraffes right outside our balcony. They were there every night when we returned from the parks and slept outside our balcony at night. It was so cool! The other animals were around most of the time as well. It was fantastic! The pool and jacuzzis on the property are great, as are the restaurants. We ate at Jiko the first night we were there. The service was great and the food fantastic. We ate at Boma for breakfast and dinner. Both times the food was really good. A little noisy, but oh well, no big deal. The location of the resort is not a problem , because the bus system runs so smoothly. We never waited more the 5 minutes for a bus to the parks. The furthest park is Magic Kingdom and it only took about 10 minutes to get there and it drops you off right in front of the turnstiles. So, you can't beat that. Animal Kingdom park is only about a 3 minute ride. We went to Disney World purposely in January because the crowds are supposed to be thin...and they were, as were the crowds at the resort. This made the experience all the better. We walked on all the rides. No more than a 5 minute wait and that was for Soar'in; a new ride at Epcot. The only negative about the whole experience was the cold weather while we where there. It was unseasonably cold...no shorts, but no lines! The trade off was worth it! We enjoy the whole Disney experience, both at Disney World and Disneyland. If you don't; then please don't go with a bad attitude, write negative reviews because you hated having to go, and make others dought thier decision.
