If you are wanting to have a great Disney vacation, and have the money to spend, and you want to stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge because of the animals and the Afican themeing; then go for it, you will like it! Also, if you are looking for good guide books to help organize your trip, the Passporter is awesome and the Unofficial Guide to Disney World is great. Hope this helps... have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Disney is an Experience...AKL Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: Hughsey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and did all the parks. The AKL is very nice and yes very dark. It is African and the wood is beautiful but overall very dark. The resort was very clean and we updated to Savanah room. We didn't see too many animals so was glad it was a free upgrade from pool view. BOMA is a fabulus restaurant. Terrific food and healthy choices. This is a nice lodge for little boys. The pool is safe and has a nice easy waterslide.They have musical kids parade every night and lots of activities. I would recommend this as a nice lodge at Disney. It is a bus ride of 5-15 minutes depending upon the park you are visiting but we liked being away from the business.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Great! Service Horrible!!”
Reviews.Author: simba8318
Reviews.Content: Good Just got back from a 4 night stay at Disney Animal Kingdom Lodge!! the hotel is stunning visually and the animals around the hotel are amazing! Breakfast at Boma - although a little expensive -- is a great way to start the day. The buses like most disney hotels run on time and make staying and enjoying the parks a great way to see Disney World. Pay the money for a savannah view room - just make sure you are facing the savannah and can see a wide view rather than strain your neck on your balcony to look in one direction or the other. Bad: Rooms are small and sheets are one step above sand paper. They don't even bother with a fitted bottom sheet -- I called housekeeping and they said that is how they make the beds with a normal sheet. the blankets are thin and cheap and the rooms are very dark. Rooms are almost never cleaned during the day and you have to call housekeeping to get them to come up. Ugly: The service especially the front desk is Horrible! They could not get it straight (i had two rooms with different names) my entire trip who was staying in what room -- this makes a difference with wake up calls and room service (twice wake-up calls went to the other room and not my room). To check in took forever and to get everything to load onto your room key took 5 tries. Several people at the front desk simply said they didn't know how to fix the problems I was having -- something about the computer system. Overall -- for the price I would not recommend it -- go stay at the Swan, Dolphin, Grand Floridian (all about same price) or stay at Port Orleans (which is less and rooms are nicer) - and spend extra time in the animal kingdom park with your kids and get the same experience.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up and a Big Toe!”
Reviews.Author: ThePoolGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed there Jan 21-Jan 28, 2007. Loved every minute of the experience. Loved the animals. Loved the pool which was well heated and filled with happy people even in January. Loved the room (okay they could be bigger, but they were really fine for the 20 minutes we were awake in them). Loved the fast, efficient bus service that took away worries of parking lots, driving, and direction-finding. Loved the parks - particularly AKP. Loved the food. Loved the staff. I recommend the Magic Your Way Dining Plan, but remember to book them' reservations to take full advantage of the Table Dining!!! Ask me if I love the trip - go ahead - ask - I totally loved this hotel and the whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “the trip that almost ended our ever going back to the animal kingdom lodge”
Reviews.Author: jusjor
Reviews.Content: Well to start, my whole entire family came on this trip for thanksgiving of 2006. I had told everyone about the hotel that i had loved so much the previous year for thanksgiving. We were a party of 16 all together. When we first got there we checked in and we had all booked a standard view but all booked it and requested that we were on the same floor and because my brother had 2 rooms I requested that he had gotten adjoining rooms. well when we go to our hotel rooms they were not as they should have been they were not connected nor were they even on the same floor. Me being the group leader i went downstairs to try and fix the matter. the gentlemen at the front desk was very very rude to me, I then started to cry and walk away, all this started on my very first hour of my vacation at animal kingdom lodge. I then said to myself i refuse to let him ruin my wonderful family vacation that i was so proud of getting together. I walked back up to him and told him that he was not going to ruin my trip and how would he like it if his family was away and things didnt go like he had planned for them to go after you have payed so much money to get there. I said to him, I want to speak to your boss. He then proceeded to get his boss which came out asking what happened in a very concerned way, His name was Ken and he runs the hotel at AK lodge. I explained to him more in detail about what happened. After everything was said and done he upgraded my whole entire family to the savannah rooms an asked me if there was anything else that he could do for my entire family. I told him no and that I really appreciated what he did for us. Everyday I would see him and he would still ask if we needed anything extra. Once again I am in complete love with the animal kingdom. I here alot of stories about the hotel . But everyones experiences are going to be different. Also if you are going , i here alot of people complaining about waiting to get into eat at certain places, get the dining plan because it is so worth it and you save alot of money and book the places you want to eat way in advance so you dont have that problem. we will be returning for christmas this year with a party of 30 of us for our family grand gathering and we will be staying at animal kingdom lodge in a savannah view.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: canadianmiss
Reviews.Content: Stayed at AKL from Jan 17-21 with my husband and 3 year old twin boys. We loved it! The rooms are on the small side but who goes to Disney to stay in your room anyway!? We had a "not so great" view which turned out to be fantastic. Woke up one morning to a herd of zebras right outside our balcony. The bed was super comfy too..very important to me :) The cafeteria style restaurant was great. Had healthful selections as well as regular fare. Great for families with small kids..no waiting! The pool and hot tubs were great too. The hotel offers life vests for little ones which was a nice touch. The kids loved coming home from Disney and jumping in the pool which is kept quite warm and has a beach type entrance. The lobby is breathtaking and has couches and tvs with cartoons playing for the little ones. All in all..it was a fantastic hotel..my first time at a Disney hotel. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “loved everything”
Reviews.Author: luvnascar
Reviews.Content: We took our first family trip to disney and stayed at the animal kingdom lodge because we thought it would be a neat place for the kids ( which were 4 and a half, 18 months ) They loved looking out from the balcony to see many animals,Which we woke up every morning to the giraffs outside the balcony,AWESOME!!!!We have no negative things to say we just wished we had more time to enjoy the hotel itself.There was so much todo at the hotel itself that we missed. The African theme was Great Too!!!!The restaurants in the hotel were great we even enjoyed the jeko(5 star restaurant ) Food was awesome for us picky eaters.Staff very friendly, rooms were very nice , kids enjoyed the pool, my daughter really enjoyed the water slid. We cant say enough about this hotel,We will definitly be staying here again and would recommend this to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: ChristaMiami
Reviews.Content: The Animal Kingdom Lodge is visually fascinating. The lobby is splendid and my kids loved the proximity to the animals roaming outside. That being said, the hotel is not a deluxe hotel. The rooms are on par with a Hampton Inn. We were particularly disappointed because we booked and paid for a “Deluxe Savannah” room, only to get a partial savannah view….and I couldn’t figure out what was deluxe about the room. The hotel is far from any of the parks (yes, even far from Animal Kingdom) – so plan on at least 30 minutes of travel time to Magic Kingdom, Epcot or MGM. It is a 10 minute bus ride to Animal Kingdom and there are no walking paths. We enjoyed Jiko. However, if you do not like exotic foods, stay away. Plan on spending about $100 per person at Jiko. Overall, there are better hotels to stay in at Disney. We won’t be returning to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here and don't go to the parks.”
Reviews.Author: Sonicblaze
Reviews.Content: A stay at Disney's Animal Kingdom lodge is so breathtaking and complete, you don't even need to visit the parks. No. All you need to do is sit on your balcony at sunset with a glass of wine and watch the animals go about their days. It's relaxing. it's wonderful. The resort is stunning, from the lobby to the rooms. The two full service restaurants are delicious and award-winning. The pool is limited in it's theme, but huge. There are many areas around the resort to view animals, and this is definetely the kind of place where you want to pay for a room with a savannah view. If you're going to look at the parking lot or the pool, it's just not worth it. The resort offers a wide variety of activities (campfire, night vision goggles) and the gift shop is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Andrew'n'Helen
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with wildlife safari included. We Stayed in December and there were lots of animals out every day. good bus links to the parks & you get extra hours in the parks as the resort is a disney resort. (Savanah room gets you a balcony with animal views). Only pitfall - you need to book a table for dinner as there isn't enough table space in the restraunts,

Reviews.Title: “Not a Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aligot
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from WDW and we stayed at the AKL for 5 nights. Overall, it was not a bad experience. The hotel is beautiful, clean and the view of the animals is exciting for children. However, this is not a luxury hotel. It is a nice hotel, but the service is not outstanding. For every good experience, we also had a bad experience. None of the bad experiences caused us any major problems, but we expected more for the price. We witnessed several people getting very upset during the check-in process. Also, although the bus system worked well, we wish we would have stayed somewhere on the monorail. Overall, if you want luxury, don't stay here. If you are active and plan on being out most of the time, save your money and stay somewhere less expensive. If money is not an issue, spend a little more and stay at the Grand Floridian.

Reviews.Title: “Our second visit, just as wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: rhiannonwales
Reviews.Content: We visited the Animal Kingdom Lodge for the second thime Oct.18-26, 2006. Our previous visit was in the inaugural year - 2001. On our first visit we were totally blown away by the resort and loved it.We came back and i was a little worried that a second visit wouldnt measure up.We were totally wrong!It was just as lovely as the first time. First i'd like to correct some misconceptions about the lodge.The only time a bus will stop at another loation is if you are going to either downtown disney,or the MGM bus which makes infrequent stops at the 2 water parks. Every other bus is direct to the location and NOT shared with any other resort. If you are trying to get to any other resort, it is a bit lengthier, but not hours like some people said.The first time we were there we didnt visit other resorts.This time we went to -the Grand Floridian, The Polynesian, The Contemporary,The Wilderness Lodge and the Yacht Club. Never once did it take more than 1 hour, and that was because we stopped at the park for a souvenir. The only way you are going to get resort to resort transportation is if you stay at the monorail resorts - which run $200 a night more than the AKL. Another misconception - the dark factor.Yes it is subdued but i wouldnt classify it as dark. I'm curious as to what people were expecting - don't you look at photos of a hotel before you stay there? I know i sure do.Anyone who looked at a picture of the hotel would have clearly seen its decor. One thing i will admit - your room location can make or break your experience. Ther eare some really bad views -like the wall which is classified as a pool view or the savannah view that overlooks the restaurant exhaust fans. When reserving a room here i would note it on your reservation (if booking with Disney direct - and trust its always the best way) that you do not want any room with either a partially obstructed view, or near the restuarants. Another valid complaint is that the rooms are small for a family.They are 341 sq. feet, the same size as the Wilderness Lodge, but smaller than any other Disney Deluxe resort. The resort is basically a sub deluxe resort, and the price reflects that... the Grand Floridian or the Contemporary will cost hundreds more per night. We are a family of four and we did it for 8 nights, but we live in a small home and are used to being on top of each other all the time.. another family might not be able to. We had a room on the 3rd floor lobby level this time - last time we had a 2nd floor view. It's pretty much equal, but i personally like the second floor as we are avid photographers and like the close up photo possibilities. I didn't really find the lobby level more noisy. We were on th Arusha Savannah again (this is the big one in the center) but on the Kudu trail this time (last time we were on the opposite side, the Zebra Trail) We had lovely views of the Arusha Rock, a watering hole with lots of birds, and trees.We saw giraffe, and Bongos, and Elands.We also saw zebra but they werent as close this time. There are lots more kids activities this time.Last time it was still a new hotel and they hadnt developed a kids program yet.This time they had crafts at the pool every day, as well as cookie decorating at Boma, and lobby activities like scavenger hunts and art. They also had a table in the lobby during the afternoon with objects that the kids could touch and 2 guides from Africa who answered questions and joked with the kids. I have never eaten at Jiko, but if you are a fan of exotic foods and fine wines, i'd say you'd enjoy it. We visited Boma for breakfast and enjoyed it. The Mara is good, but if your staying for more than 5 days, you do start to get tired of it, they need to offer more variety. The Zawadi marketplace is wonderful and they have a "Primal Parade " at night where the kids pick instruments and march around the store and lobby making music. My 2 kids (7&2) loved it. The store is HUGE (it is the largest on any Disney resort) and has lots of standard Disney stuff as well as items unique to AKL. All in all this a a fantasic resort, as long as youre not expecting the Four Seasons.It is what it is, a Disney resort, designed to cater to people with deep pockets.

Reviews.Title: “Run over to the French Quarter for music”
Reviews.Author: J.M.DavisGlendora
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful lodge. We loved watching the animals and found the long hallway walks good exercise. Be sure to run over to the French Quarter at Port Orleans to catch the best musician in Orlando - Elliot Dyson. He sings and plays a variey of instruments very well. His performance choices are versatile, he has a magnetic audience personality and it's free which is a Disney plus. You won't find better music anywhere in the Disney Park, in Orlando or maybe even in Florida. It was the icing on our Disney cake. J. Campbell

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TaniaWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Dec 10-14, 2006. We did have a minor dispute over the first room assigned to us. We booked a Savannah room and were given room 2484. When we looked out our balcony we had a lovely view of the hotel hot tub! I complained to the front desk and they immediately switched us to room 4457. No hassles, just an apology and an immediate fix. Priceless! The view from the new room was fantastic. We saw giraffe, antelope, kudu, ankole cattle and a wide variety of birds each day. Jiko and Boma were excellent - make reservations early! The Mara is very cafeteria-like with burgers, pre-made salads, pizza, chips, etc. It's an okay alternative if you're in a hurry but don't expect much in the "taste" category. Prices are super high at Jiko and Boma. We paid $50 for the breakfast buffet each morning for a family of 3. But the food was excellent and the service and atmosphere top notch. I think each staff member throughout the hotel surpassed my expectations. Even the cafeteria (Mara) clean up crew had smiles and warm greetings for everyone! The pool is a bit small for such a large hotel but we didn't swim very often as our main objective was to see the parks. The Disney bus system was perfect - even the long hike to Magic Kingdom seemed effortless with a new bus arriving/departing every 10 minutes or so. Very convenient if you have little ones. This place is low-key and less centered around the kids. Yes, they were everywhere - it is Disney after all - but you never felt crowded or stressed by crying babies or screaming tikes (Mara excluded). For some reason this hotel does a better job at crowd placement. Maybe it's the design...very spread out and that means a long walk to restaurants, pool, game room, etc...but in my opinion, that's a good thing. Just remember the umbrella stroller and wheel the kids around! Nice place and great staff. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “I would give it 3.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: MerrimackMrs
Reviews.Content: Just got back last night from a 4 night stay at AKL. A very beautiful hotel in many ways. I honestly did not think the room we stayed in was worth the money spent, but the common areas at this hotel are beautiful. We ate dinner 2 times at Jiko during our stay. What a fantastic restaurant. Such unique flavors. Service was exceptional. We arrived on the evening of December 25th. A hint to anyone thinking of going to Disney World the week between Christmas and New Year's: Don't go! Waaaaaay too many people. I have a feeling that the following week there will be a significant difference in the number of people. Would we stay at this hotel again? Maybe... maybe not. Can't really decide. Definitely wouldn't stay during such a high peak travel week, but that is certainly not the fault of AKL. Went on two safaris and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “I love Animal Kingdom Lodge!”
Reviews.Author: TrpReviwr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week in October of 2003. We were fortunate enough to have gotten a really good promotional rate that was being offered at the time. Or room was a savannah view room, so we were able to sit on our balcony and enjoy our breakfast, etc. while watching the animals. Very cool. We were somewhat surprised that the room was not larger, but it was just as described on the hotel's website. The decor was beautiful and theme-friendly. One of our favorite parts of the hotel, was the aroma when you walked in. The hotel restaurants were amazing and romantic. Besides the wonderful aroma, the hotel lobby itself was very impressive. We enjoyed just hanging around inside the lobby or elsewhere on the hotel grounds. In the evenings, hotel staff would even offer nightvision goggles for viewing the nocturnal animals on the grounds. This particular hotel offered transportation perks in that the bus service was dedicated to this hotel only. The pool was very large which enabled us to enjoy it even when it was busy. All staff members were above and beyond friendly and helpful. When we ran into a medical issue, the hotel staff even took care of having a prescription dropped off at the front desk for us while we were in the park - free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view of animals from our balcony”
Reviews.Author: kiki1969
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the lodge from december 17-24th of 2006. It is a beautiful place. The two restaurants at the lodge (Boma and Jikko) are both wonderful. Jikko was one of the best restaurants we've experienced. There are a few negatives which could be big depending on your personal preferences. First of all, the heating and cooling of the room was totally silent. We like to hear a fan noise to drown out other unpleasant noises such as people talking in the halls or kids running down the hallways. Secondly, and probably due to the quiet air system, you could hear the people above and beside your rooms. All walking, water running, toilet flushing, and other noises could be heard clearly...all night long. Thirdly, the pool claimed to be heated, but it was almost unbearably cold. We stayed at a Courtyard by Marriott for 2 days before going to the Lodge...the pool at the Courtyard was heated like a hot tub almost....it was wonderful. If the pool at Animal Kingdom had been even close to warm, our whole stay would have been much better. I do think that Animal Kingdom Lodge was a great place. We had giraffe, zebra, and many other animals just outside our balcony all day and evening long. The whole feeling of being somewhere special is definitey there. I would just suggest packing a loud noisemaker to drown out the noise at night. We took one, but needed a more powerful sound.

Reviews.Title: “I was disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cruisingaunt
Reviews.Content: Stayed 12/3/06-12/8/06 My husband and I have stayed at other Disney resorts and considered them above average with the Grand Californian more than excellent. Because of it's theming, we were looking forward to the Animal Kingdom Lodge. We stayed in a deluxe room with a savannah view and had concierge level privileges. First impression was very favorable. Excellent greeting and our room was ready! Our room, although clean, was a bit depressing for me. I'm not sure what I expected but everthing was so dark! Very dark wood furniture, dark curtains, and dark golden walls. Lighting was woefully inadequate for reading. However, our view of the savannah was spectacular. The concierge club was OK, staff was friendly when approached but nowhere near as welcoming as our Grand Californian experience on the club level. Food selection were fine. My major area of disappointment was in the housekeeping staff. On our first fully day there, we left our room at 9:30am and returned at 2:45pm. We had left the "Please make-up room" sign out. Our oom was not done. Since we had returned to take an afternoon nap before a long evening out, I was upset. After calling housekeeping, they came right up and took care of it. Day 2-I called and asked for the room to be made up early. When I returned, all was OK. Day 3-I called and requested early housekeeping service as we were to return to the room around 1pm because of an anticipated late night. When we returned at 1:30pm, the room wasn't done up yet. Needless to say, I was upset. We do understand that housekeeping works to clean rooms where guests are vacating, but, at a resort where many guest return in midafternoon to rest before a long evening, a request for early housekeeping should be honored if possible. No explanation was ever given. Overall, the resort was beautiful (although everything was very dark). The fast food restuarant (MARA) had great food. We didn't experience the other restuarants (BOMA and JIKO). Overall, I can see why many people love this resort. Staff was friendly and the theming is superb. Whenever I look at the savannah, there were grazing animals. For us city-bred folks, this was wonderful. Would I return? A big maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Caution ongoing construction at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ilovesoup
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the start of December, having paid for rooms with a savannah view. Unfortunatly they are building a Disney Vacation Club in the grounds ( earth movers, Diggers all very noisy). Our expensive savannah view was actually a view of this site, with 2 Giraffes stuck in the middle. We asked to move but the hotel was full and they could not move us to another savannah view. This construction affects many many rooms so please think twice before booking. Also don't let them tell you that it does not interfere with the view ( it really spoils it, honestly). It is unfair of the hotel to sell these particular rooms as savannah view. The rest of the hotel is great, and there are plenty of rooms not overlooking the construction site. We also stayed at the Polynesian during our trip and had no problems. You have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “10th trip to Disney and this was the BEST”
Reviews.Author: DisneyLover29
Reviews.Content: This was our families 10th trip to DisneyWorld since 1994. We had never stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge and thought that we would give it a try. I booked with a AAA discount through Disney Reservations. We got a pool view. We didn't want to pay extra for a savannah room and I am glad that we didn't. We were just a few rooms away from the laundry facilities, and right around the corner from Mara (quick service dining) and Boma. We had Boma for Breakfast and dinner once. Breakfast was very good. I thought dinner would offer more traditional fare but I didn't feel that it did. I felt horrible how much my husband paid for this dinner for his family and he found hardly anything that he liked. He was a good sport about it however. Our room was wonderful. I can't say enough about it. We were right around the corner from the pool. This place has the most gorgeous vegetation. Our room had a queen bed and bunk beds for our kids. My mothers room was connected to ours and had to queen beds. My kids loved the pool and the slide. Right by the pool is a Savannah area that we enjoyed watching. The hot tub is in that area as well. I told my husband that we must be in heaven.One evening we say 7 giraffes eating about 20 feet from us. Also every evening they offered night vision. Our children really enjoyed going out there and seeing what was really out there. There are several areas that you can watch the animals even if you do not have a Savannah view room. I am sure those rooms are worth it but if you can't afford one don't skip this hotel because of it. I have stayed at 7 different Disney Properties and this was our second Deluxe resort. I tell you it is beautiful. Everyone loved it and we traveled with my mother and our three kids. My teenager really loved it. Just thinking of it makes me so happy. I love all the Disney resorts that we have stayed at but this one will always be very special to me and I WILL return one of these days.

Reviews.Title: “Get a savannah view room”
Reviews.Author: schererd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 1 night as part of a seminar I was attending, and I didn't have a choice of rooms so I ended up with a Courtyard View room. It is a nice hotel, with interesting restaurants (espically Boma), but if you don't get the savannah view room (facing the giraffes) then I don't think it's worth staying at this property. There are too many other very cool hotels (like the Boardwalk) that are just as fun and in way better locations. The only thing that sets this hotel apart is being able to see a giraffe from your balcony. Having said that, the lobby is very impressive as is the pool. The room is awfully small for a deluxe hotel, but the decor is nice (such as the fake mosquito net behind the bed, or the wood carvings on the doors of the amoire). It does have some nice views of the savannah if you just walk around the hotel in the public areas, but I still think I will not stay here again unless I get a savannah view room.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: brokencarz
Reviews.Content: I was sceptical at first and tried to research Animal Kindom Lodge as much as I could. But I was blown away in the first minutes of the stay, by the staff and the hotel itself. As soon as you pull up to the front door the bell staff are extremely helpfull (even with the 75lb bags my wife brought) Then the front desk, even with the hotel close to compacity, quickly got us to our room almost 3 hours before check in time! The savana room views were great, to get up every morning to different animals, so close you can almost touch, this was a perk not many hotels can offer. The horshoe design of the hotel allows there not to be a bad view of the mutiple savanas. The food was amazing, Jiko for the fomal sit down 5 star dinner. Then Boma for the family buffet, breakfast or dinner this is a top notch buffet style meal, and this is from someone who hates buffet meals. There must be an army of chefs cooking all this great food! Finally a few sugestions. Make time to enjoy the hotel, there are overlooks in and out of the hotel for pictures, the staff brings out nightvision after dusk , the pool needs a review all to its own but the important things are, it huge, its open 24 hours and heated on the cool days, not to mention its beautyful. Last make reservations for the meals well in advance. There you go hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: turbotoys
Reviews.Content: The Stay -Upon arrival we were standing around for 10 minutes waiting for someone to check our bags for us and finally gave up waiting - we checked in and that only took 5 minutes. The lobby area is very very impressive. we were upgraded from standard savanna view to deluxe for free. Got up to the room and before entering the room we could tell that somone was smoking in there - completely smelt like an ashtray in there. Not very happy but before we could even call the desk somone knocked on the door and said somone complained of the smell and after a few hours it was gone. We were looking around the room and found that the people before us left clothes around the room that we gathered up and had to have removed from the room we also found the fridge had half empty bottles of water in them. On the second day my wife took a shower and one of the towels had holes and was all torn. The shower head was all scummy i didnt even want to touch it because it was so gross looking. on the 3rd or 4th day somone put a stinky diaper in the hall way and somone must of accidently stepped on it because it was all over the floor- that was there all night and in the morning i finally had to call somone to remove it because i got sick of smelling it - I know people had to see it because room service came by that night to drop off dinner to us and also in the morning somone delivered the paper to us. The lighting is very very dim there as a lot of others have mentioned i would compare it to candlelight. Food - very very expensive. There are 2 restuaraunts here and a marketplace. There is also room service. We tried room service twice, very very very expensive. I had an omlet with a bottle of water my wife had a waffle both were very small but for the 2 items it was $46 = rip-off. There isnt many selections in the marketplace area. The restuarant Boma was always packed we got in there for a morning breakfast and that was $16.99/person - I wasnt too impressed with that either. Sights- the sights out of the savanna view were pretty good - one day we saw a giraffe go by - other then that i think most the animals pretty much stay put. In our area we saw mostly these ankhole cattle things and ostrich. There is a sign on our window that they have cameras facing the rooms so if you want privacy you have to keep your drapes shut - i wasnt too happy about that i was hoping to wake up too the sun rising and looking at the animals but that was scrubbed. I was staying for a honeymoon and I would not recommend it for that, in fact I wouldnet recommend anyone staying there. Very overpriced - not a clean place to stay - very rude people behind the desk - very long walk to your room every day - In my opinion we will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: ougs103
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the first part of our honeymoon from Nov 14th-24th 2004. It was very quiet at this time of year and we were long gone by the time the hoardes arrived for Thanksgiving! From the moment you walk in the stunning reception area you won't want to leave (the christmas tree was huge!) It is simply amazing, you can sense a special atmosphere as you enter this hotel. We had paid extra for a savannah room which was well worth the money, as the views in the morning were fantastic. Previous reviews have talked about the rooms being too dark, firstly its not too dark, yes it is a lower light but its part of the ambience that disney were trying to create, secondly the rooms decorations are made from dark wood so maybe this added to some of the feelings previous reviewers were getting? The room was kept spotless by our "mousekeeper" ;O) The Boma restaurant was probably the best we have eaten in for breakfast, excellent service, even better quality food, and so much of it. We ate in Jiko once - again excellent service and the food was fine - nothing special though - maybe this was just the meal i chose? Overall I would not hesitate recommending that you stay here, it really is something different. We would love to go back, thats for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Best U.S. Hotel for Atmosphere, Service, and Value! A+++++!”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoReviewer
Reviews.Content: I have been at many fine hotels in the U.S. but Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge in Orlando rates tops. Yes it is a bit pricey but where else in the U.S. can you see giraffe and other animals from your room balcony? Plus since it is a Disney resort you get all the added Walt Disney World perks that come from staying in a Disney hotel. This includes free transportation to all of their theme parks and also gives you access to extra magic hours in the park (certain hours the parks are open exclusively to those staying in a Disney hotel). It has 3 great restaurants from casual to elegant plus tons of activities for the kiddies. I like it better than Disney's much pricier Grand Floridian which is nice but not as warm and comfortable. Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge is much newer and nicer than Disney's Contemporary and Polynesian resorts which are much older and about the same price. Though its a 4.0 star hotel, its very casual and comfortable too, most people walk around in shorts and t-shirts so its not stuffy at all. The employees at the resort are great too, very nice and friendly and knowledgeable but not snooty like at other 4.0 star resorts. This resort is the closest one to Disney's Animal Kingdom theme park but a bit away from the Magic Kingdom. Overall if your looking for a great place to vacation and relax at Walt Disney World for a pretty good value, this place is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional and Unique”
Reviews.Author: Home-in-TX
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 5 night stay at AKL booked through Travelocity. Our experience was excellent from start to finish, but I believe traveling during the off season made a huge difference. The reservation process was smooth through Travelocity, and when we arrived to check in early on our arrival day it was no problem as plenty of rooms were ready. We were asked about room preferences as far as location in the hotel, high/low floor, etc. and were very pleased with the room we received. We had a savanna view room on the 4th floor overlooking the Uzima Savanna. It was incredible being able to sit on our balcony and view the many different animals. There were 5 giraffes, one of them young, that were fun to watch. I would only recommend a savanna view room if you can plan to spend at least a couple of hours of your day relaxing in your room/on the balcony watching the animals. It's a very relaxing break from the parks, especially when the weather is nice. If you don't have a savanna view room there are many nice places at the hotel where you can view the animals. This is not a hotel where you can overdose on Disney characters, but it definitely has a Disney feel to it. Only at Disney World can you find a hotel such as this that makes you feel like you have entered another country. The hotel has a lodge theme, but it is very elegant. The hotel is a mix of light/bright and dark/warm. There are large windows all around the hotel that allow you to see animals on the savannas as you walk down the corridors. The lobby is incredible, as are the hotel grounds. I was afraid I had built up huge expectations, so much that I might only be disappointed upon arrival. AKL managed to far exceed all expectations I had developed. I was very nervous about cleanliness as some reviews mention dirty rooms. Our room was very clean and everything in the room was in very good condition. The room was also nicely lit. It was not the bright sterile light you might find at many hotels, but the room had a very warm feel. The theme is African safari, so don't stay here if you can't get into that. AKL has been very well maintained all around and it still looks new to me. It is not as far from the parks as many seem to think. It may seem that way if your only means of transportation is the Disney bus system. If you rent a car you can self park at the hotel for free, and you also get free parking at the parks which otherwise would cost $10 per day. If renting a car, I would recommend trying Dollar. Go to Mousesavers web site and you can find discount codes. I was able to reserve a mid size car for $108 per week. At Dollar's web site you can sign up for Dollar Express for free. There is a special line at the Dollar desk in the airport for Express members. I was able to get through the rental process in less than 5 minutes, then you go right out the door to the parking garage to get your car. In the past we have stayed off Disney property and it seemed fine. To stay on site has changed things. Not having to leave Disney property is a great as the area immediately outside of Disney is not all that attractive. Staying at the AKL provides a secluded feel, but it is no more than a 10 minute drive to the furthest park, Magic Kingdom. Animal Kingdom is about 2 minutes from the hotel. This hotel is large, but it is laid out in a U shape so even the furthest rooms are not that far out. Our room was about 3/4 of the way towards then end of the Zebra Trail, but it was not a long walk to the lobby. We walked a lot during the trip, but it's Disney and you're going to do a lot of walking. If you're not into walking, I don't recommend a trip to Disney at all! I would try to avoid rooms on the Sunset Savanna. This part of the hotel has rooms on either side with a smaller savanna in the middle. From the Sunset Overlook in the lobby it just didn't look that great. On that side of the hotel you are also very far away from the pool and restaurants. The pool area is nice and the pool is quite large. There are lots of trees, creating the feel of being at a lake on the savanna. There is also an area close to the pool where you can look out on to the Uzima Savanna. At night there are guides at this overlook that have night vision binoculars for guests to use. There are not a lot of animals out to see at night but it is still a fun experience. The pool area also has 2 separate spa areas that are very nice. We did not eat at the hotel restaurants, but ate most meals in the parks. I highly recommend the Brown Derby (get the Cobb salad) and Mama Melrose's in MGM. At Epcot we ate at the Teppenyaki restaurant in Japan which was fun as they cook at your table. The food was expensive at these restaurants but very good. The counter service restaurants at most parks pretty much serve the same types of food, burgers, chicken, etc. and it is just Ok. If you go to Downtown Disney, try The House of Blues. We have always had good experiences there with the food and service. Next time we would consider the Disney Dining Plan as it would have saved us some money. I thought we would end up eating more meals off Disney property, but didn't want to enter the outside world again until we had to. Disney is a fun and relaxing place to be when it's not crowded. If you can travel during off peak weeks you can have an incredible experience. AKL would lose some of it's charm when packed to capacity, but the same can be said for other Disney hotels, parks, restaurants, etc. By using web sites such as disboards, allearsnet, mousesavers and especially the services of tourguidemike we found a great week to visit. Tour Guide Mike's web site access will cost you $20 but it is money well spent as it helps you avoid crowds and enhances your overall Disney experience. Sign up when you are trying to decide when to go as this is where TGM's expertise really helps point you in the right direction. Sorry for the long review, but I feel many of the negative reviews come from people who had a bad experience or two during their trip and came home with an axe to grind. Disney can be frustrating if you expect everything to go exactly as you have planned. If you go with the flow and don't sweat the small stuff you will have a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl2005
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge. It was great. The hotel provided a relaxing break from the parks and surronding attraction. We booked Deluxe Savannah View, and were placed on the 5th floor. Animals were constantly grazing and walking by our section of the savannah. Room was a nice size, and the balcony was large enough for all 3 of us to sit outdside. Pool was large enough that it did not feel crowded and umbrellas are scattered about to provide some shade. Restaurants: Jikos- Fabulous. I highly recommend trying this one. Meals are great and service was good. Boma- Nice buffet, something for everyone. Mara- Quick service restaurant. Snacks and desserts are from restaurants. Nice selection. Overall, I would recommend to anyone to try the Animal Kingdom Lodge. Service was great and the resort is spread out enough you never feel crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but "great" experience is hit or miss”
Reviews.Author: Delraypete
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 1 night and 2 days at AKL. The lobby is very impressive and the staff nice as ever. We had "booked" a king bed, savannah view room and after some pleading and about 5 minutes of the attendant searching on the computer she "gave" us a room on the Sunset savannah with a king bed. After figuring out some bad directions of how to get to our room (the lobby is on the 2nd or 3rd floor and for some reason she told us to go up to the 3rd floor) and speaking to some very friendly housekeeping staff we were greeted by a room that seemed very clean and nicely appointed, even with the little towel animals that my girlfriend loved. Unfortunately the view was somewhat lacking. This is the hit or miss part. We were directly above a concrete paved area that extended a good 100 feet out into the savannah, which kept any animals from getting anywhere near our balcony. Beyond that, we barely saw any animals, but that's hard to fault as we were only there for 1 night. Boma was a rare treat with some interesting and tasty dishes, but at $25/pp seemed a bit steep for a pretty casual meal. Forget the Morrocan beers that we $7 or 8 a piece!!! Not a horrible beer, but come on! I would only return here with kids because besides the nice restaurant seeing a couple giraffes doesn't excite me like it would a 5 year old. But I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel surrounded by a ZOO!”
Reviews.Author: Cope09
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely incredible. Very well thought out so that almost every room is welcomed with a view of the wildlife surrounding them. The lobby is beautiful as are the grounds and zoo. My wife loves Giraffes and every morning we were greeted by a few off of our balcony. There are small lofts with rocking chairs and binoculars throughout the resort where you can sit and watch the animals. As is everything at Disney, the food is average and pricey....

Reviews.Title: “A Magical Stay”
Reviews.Author: TambiJ
Reviews.Content: Our family of three spent five nights at the Animal Kingdom Lodge in early November and were enthralled with our accomodations. I had made the reservations in January, but as the time drew near I grew apprehensive based on the wide range of reviews about the property. I am happy to report that the staff was very gracious and engaging. As Sarah checked us in, I mentioned that this was my son's 16th birthday trip, and she presented him with a birthday button - a very nice gesture. We have travelled extensively and found our room on the Giraffe Trail to be very clean, well lit, of comfortable size, and appropriately decorated in the African theme. Knowing that we were not going to be spending a great deal of time in our room, we did not chose to spend an extra $200 to have a savannah view room, and that proved to be a wise choice. The gift shop was a great place to pick up souvenirs and the Mara was a good option for a quick bite. We appreciated the large coin-operated laundry rooms as well. We will definitely return to the Animal Kingdom Lodge in the future and highly recommend it to others. It is off the beaten path, but that was a plus in our opinion. Early November is a fabulous time to visit DisneyWorld. The crowd level is low and the weather is perfect. If you're going to DisneyWorld, make sure you purchase a copy of "The Unofficial Guide to DisneyWorld" - what a great resource!

Reviews.Title: “A Must-Stay Place”
Reviews.Author: bankerdude
Reviews.Content: We just returned from five nights at AKL and it was a wonderful experience. There were four of us in a savannah view room so it was a little tight space-wise, but the attractive furnishings, cleanliness, helpfulness of the staff and the animals roaming peacefully just below the deck more than made up for the lack of an extra few square feet. A savannah view room is a MUST! Our superb dinner at Boma was a delightful surprise after the mediocrity of the food in the parks and in Mara, the fast food place at AKL. Don't pass this one up! The lobby is fantastic and the gift shop is a treat. We spent way too much time and money in there. Do take time to sit by the outdoor fire pit and chat with your fellow travelers, preferably with refreshment in hand. Highlights: Too many to mention in detail. Lowlights: "Heated" pool a bit chilly for my taste. No covered or indoor access to fitness area. We've traveled throughout the US and Europe and this property is among a handful at the top of our list, a strong recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Did what it said on the tin”
Reviews.Author: effhemm
Reviews.Content: Well I originally took the plunge over a year ago and booked this holiday well in advance - it wasn't cheap but I hoped it would provide a 'lifetime memory' experience for our family, the downside in booking so far ahead was that our expectations were hyped so high the experience might struggle to match them! We arrived at the hotel late at night after a delayed flight and a misdirected road journey and found the front desk staff helpful and friendly, we were efficiently and accurately directed to our room which we reached after a reasonable walk. The rooms reflect Africa - if you are expecting the bright shiny offerings of Marriot, Hilton or Radisson look elsewhere, the lighting and decor attempt to offer authenticity and so can appear gloomy, get in the mood you will soon appreciate it! Open the drapes to be confronted by zebras grazing in the simulated moonlight about 25 yards from your window -the effect was to cause us to speak in whispers to each other to avoid scaring the animals. The beds were comfortable, the plumbing was efficient, housekeeping was efficient and friendly, the hotyel staff were very helpful and efficient. The restaurants were excellent, try Boma, the buffet meal may seem initially expensive but look around Orlando for similar value and you can certainly find cheaper meals but add in the quality factor and you will find this restaurant is a secret bargain. Try new things, enjoy the steak, fill up on your favourite. Mara offers a canteen type service, my wife fell in love with the butternut squash soup ( takes all sorts), if you are staying longer than a weekend it is worth purchasing refillable cups from here at a cost of $11.99 each as refills of coffee and soda are free for the duration of your stay. The African stew served in a bread loaf is well worth a try too. The Victoria Falls bar on the mezzanine floor is largely forgetable, there are no draught beers and the place has little atmosphere, with barflies watching TV sport above the bar and tables being arranged cafeteria style in the remaining space. Would I recommend it to you? Yes but bear in mind it has a strong theme which you can't escape. Would I go there again? Based on this experience 100% yes. What could be better? This hotel attracts a lot of people who are full of their own importance and sadly their precious children too - the sound of whinging kids is never far away but I have no suggestions to offer to improve this. The valet parking costs $7 a day and attracts people who delight in parking and loading/unloading directly in front of the hotel entrance, might not seem a big deal as you read this before your visit but believe me at the end of a long day trekking through the parks with sore tootsies diverting around a VIP SUV can seem a step (or two) too far. This is easily cured though - go to your room look at the animals, be they zebras, cows, gazelles or pelicans send the kis to fetch coffee from Mara and you will soon chill. Have a great experience - you are only here once! The Grouch

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: Jess963
Reviews.Content: On august the 22nd me and my parents visited the animal kindom lodge it was the best experience of my life as we had a savanna view room we had the giraffes outside our room in the morning and evening the sevice was great the staff were nice and the rooms were amazing and clean the arcades and pool were great and the different places you could walk to see different animals were great to the food suited all 3 of us the busses were good and promp on timing and the taxis were great as there was always 1 waiting outside the hotel the lobby was an amazing experence somethink never to forget they have even got a bridge over it to walk over which was fun. i recomend this hotel to everyone as its a hotel that you will never forget!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this resort!”
Reviews.Author: TrvlDva
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this resort the second weekend of October (went to the Food and Wine Festival at Epcot), and really enjoyed my stay. The lobby is spectacular, and the rooms are very comfortable. Double sink (huge plus), very comfortable beds, and wonderful balconies with views of the animals (saw a giraffe from our balcony). Ate at the resturant the first night, because we got in late, and the food was excellent. Service at hotel was top notch as well. I would highly recommend this resort for anyone. One tip though - try to get a room as far away from the elevators as possible. It can be loud, if you are staying close to them.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: wackedout
Reviews.Content: Oct.25-30,2006. I had a party of 5 in one room. Alot of money for a small place for 5 people. The staff were wonderful but I think highly over rated. You can stay on the out skirts of Disney in a 2 bedrm and 2 bath w/breakfast and full kitchen for around $100. Not worth $350 per night. The day bed was horrible and the air blew right into the day bed giving that person a rotten head cold. The buffet was awesome. Very good food and great staff. I took my niece her husband and two kids. I feel that I was ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Not such a bad place... if you really must do the Disney thing”
Reviews.Author: Acer sed justus
Reviews.Content: For the purposes of this review, I've assumed you want the Disney Experience: personally, I don't ever want to do it again. If you’re going to 'do' Disney, however, you might as well do it properly, and therefore stay on the property. I'd guess that this is one of the better places to do so. On the plus side, it's rather intriguing in design and setting, offers accommodation of a high standard, and has pretty good facilities (pool, gym and so on). On the other hand, you have to accept that you are 'a number not a name': there is an efficient system which generally works, but it's on a fairly impersonal scale, and the staff's friendly demeanour cannot disguise the fact that this is effectively some sort of Stalinist state. Your room still not made up at 6pm? Housekeeping says they can schedule 10.30 (in a family hotel). Only when you hint you might make a bit of a fuss does it get done sooner. It's on the food and drink side that the place really falls down. There are only three options (which is not many in a place with a thousand-odd rooms). There is a fast-food café (in a style which the snobbier sort of Europeans will find odd in any hotel) plus two restaurants. The cheaper of theses actually does quite interesting African-themed food, but charm in a 400-seater buffet is necessarily elusive. Even when you book, you'll be given a bleeper to come back when a table is actually available. The 'fine dining' restaurant is more civilsed (even if you do still have to wait for the bleep) but not much more characterful and the food seems much less interesting. The under-sized bar, to end on a flat note, is a disgrace. Understaffed, undermanaged, under-cleaned, and with sometimes quite rude staff who seemed to have not the slightest understanding of what the job really entails, it is a travesty of what a hotel bar should be. And if you want a drink, there is, so to speak, no other show in town.

Reviews.Title: “not worth what you pay for it”
Reviews.Author: r.walgreen
Reviews.Content: we checked in at the lodge after staying at the marriott world center for 10 days , what a world of difference!!! the first view of the lobby is fantastic , the check in was quick and friendly, but after that .... we had to wait until 4 o' clock to finally go to our room , when we got there the room smelled like somebody smoked a whole pack of sigarettes in there !! and the view : we looked at a wall !! so we requested another room , They told us we already got a free upgrade to a pool?? view and there were no rooms left ... but after a while we got another room wich had a view of the restaurant roof and accompanying smells and the room had'nt been cleaned in two weeks (we found a letter dating minimally two weeks earlyer and a layer of dust) so we we requested another room , and they put us in a disabilatyroom with parking view , but at least it was clean and it smelled better. the rooms are dark wich is fine if you are staying on the savanna side , but on the parking side and pool side i think it makes trhe rooms look grubby and filthy. when you are used to the rooms in disney resort paris ist doesn;t even begin to compare . there were good things though, the animals on the savannah were nice to look at , the restaurants look good and you have a lot of veriaty of foods . the disney transportation is also very good (except when you have a driver that moves the bus at 5 miles per hour )you can get anywhere at anytime on the disney propertys . we never had to use the car for anything except drive to the airport. next time if we are staying in orlando we will probably get another disney hotel and skip the lodge . i know we can't all get savannah rooms, but it was defenately not worth wat we paid for it

Reviews.Title: “Horrific service”
Reviews.Author: zncoug
Reviews.Content: Had a plumbing problem in our 2 bedroom suite. The staff did not seem to be bothered by our issue in the least. The resulting water leak caused the entire room to smell horrible for the 3 nights we stayed at the resort. It took an entire day of talking to around 10 different staff members to even get someone to steam clean the carpet (which didn't help at all). Although the views and wildlife are very nice, I would recommend avoiding this place and just going to the Animal Kingdom park to take in the views and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Unique but remote”
Reviews.Author: nestornajwa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our 7 year old son to AKL during a 4 day weekend in October, 2006. I suppose we are Disney "veterans" since we've stayed at many Disney properties including the Beach Club, the Grand Floridian, the Polynesian and now, the Animal Kingdom Lodge. We spent 3 nights at Disney, then two more at Universal's Portofino Hotel. When planning our prevous Disney trips, we often considered AKL, but we always chose another property because we were afraid that the Lodge was too far removed from the Disney theme parks (other than Animal Kingdom, of course). Our experience with the Disney bus system has been mixed. We like to get to the parks early, ride everything, then spend the crowded afternoon hours by the pool. Waiting for the bus can put a crimp in those plans, as waits of 30-40 minutes are not uncommon. In addition, the buses seldom take you straight from your hotel to the park of your choice. Usually there are several stops along the way. We typically avoid these problems by staying at one of the hotels on disney's monorail route (Grand Floridian, Contemporary or the Polynesian). Of these, we prefer the Polynesian, because it is located at the transportation hub, where you can get direct monorail or boat service to Magic Kingdom or Epcot, and the buses seem to come more frequently to the other parks (for MGM, it's better to monorail to Epcot, the take a boat). However, for this trip, these hotels were booked, so we decided to take a chance on AKL. Overall, our experience was quite pleasant. The hotel was exotically decorated, and the animal show outside your own window did not disappoint. Zebra, giraffe, wildebeast, and many animals I could not identify (though Disney provides a key in each room). Very nice. The biggest problem we had was the water pressure. both the shower and sink were awful. It was extremely difficult to shave or brush my teeth under the puny trickle that came out of the faucet. The shower had a unique low-flow head which made it impossible to wash the shampoo out of your hair. I called the front desk to see if the problem was resort-wide or limited to our room, and they fed me some cheery palaver about saving water. The room was small, and the outdoor deck was tiny. My wife assures me that the shampoo and soap were of very poor quality. The towels were tiny and thin. So it's not the Four Seasons, but I didn't expect it would be. The service was generally good, and the room was quiet. We always request a room on a high floor away from the elevators. At Disney, this can mean quite a hike to the elevators from your room, but it generally assures you of a quiet night's rest. Room service messed up our order, but the food they brought was ok. we were on the 4th floor with a savannah view, one floor below the Concierge floor, which is the top floor. This seemed to provide the best view of animals without obstructions like trees and fences. The third floor was the lobby floor, and it seemed to be quite a bit noisier than the other floors. Every time we go to Disney, we learn a new trick. Mastering the fastpass system, going during the few (relatively) uncrowded times, and learning to ride everything in the morning or late evening to avoid crowds are all key components of enjoying your Disney vacation. This time, we learned that resort guests who rent a car do not need to pay for parking at the theme parks. This innovation took all the guesswork out of getting around Walt Disney World. We didn't have to wait for the bus, and we were able to come and go as we pleased. Definitely worth the cost of renting a car. Also, since we were heading to Universal anyway, renting a car saved us at least four expensive taxi trips. Note also that AKL did not charge for guest parking, though there was a smal valet fee if you chose not to self-park. We did not eat at Jiko, the fancy restaurant at AKL, but we had breakfast every day at Boma, which is a very good buffet. We also ate at the Japanese restaurant at Epcot, which my son loved (they cook the food in front of you Benihana-style), and at the All Star Cafe at the Sport Complex -- AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS. Painfully slow service and the worst food I've ever paid for. Just stay away. We found the parks to be more crowded than we expected in October. Disney has developed a strategy where, during certain seasons (Christmas, Halloween, etc), they close the Magic Kingdom early and make you pay about $30 per person to get back in for a "party" which typically includes a parade plus some giveaway food items (candy for halloween, hot chocolate for Christmas). in past years ,we enjoyed these parties, because we could ride popular rides without long lines. This year, however, the party was just as crowded as the regular park attendance. We felt ripped off, having already paid for a park hopper pass to get into all the parks for the length of our stay. I hate to dwell on the negative because we really had a grest time. The new Yeti rollercoaster at Animal Kingdom is not to be missed (get a fastpass). Mission Space was awesome (though it made me really sick), and the rental car made staying at the remote AKL hassle-free.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: GrahamCrackerMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 2 children, ages 6 and 9 stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge for a week in October. I was intriqued by the idea of being able to see wild animals from the balcony of my room and thought the kids would too. The hotel itself is gorgeous! Lots of native African art, very spacious. The staff was outstanding. Our room was very small. 1 queen bed, set of bunk beds for the kids. There was a small table and 2 chairs. Fortunately the sink/vanity area was seperate from the toilet/shower. Trying to get dressed and out in the morning was a horror! There was simply no room to manuver. The view was very nice from the balcony, but again, there was barely room for a small table and 2 chairs. We were in a Savannah View room and the walk to the lobby about wore us out before we started. I suggest you request a room as close to the lobby as possible. There are viewing sites all over the place where you can relax comfortably to see the animals. Be prepared for another long walk to the bus stops. And once you get to the park, you will face another hike, the buses don't drop you off at the ticket area but in the transportation section. Other than that, everything was great! Try the 2 restaurants at least once, but for quick, easy dining opt for the Mara, located near the pool. They are open from 6 a.m. until 11:30 p.m. and serve quick, tasty meals. You can also purchase beer, wine and snacks here. Also, my kids were more excited by the DUCKS than the zebra, giraffes and wildebeast!!!!

Reviews.Title: “family fun at the animal kingdom lodge”
Reviews.Author: Durness
Reviews.Content: My family, husband, 2 daughters, aged 10 and 7 and myself had 2 weeks during August at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. I read the trip advisor reports avidly before I go and if you are considering a stay here it's worthwhile doing but try to stay objective as some reports are misleading. Firstly, the rooms are not dark. They are not neon sparkling but very cool and restful. They are also immaculate as are all the public areas. I booked a pool view (which our family had one night in and it was fine) in the hope that we would get an upgrade to a savanna view. There are vastly more savanna views than pool or standard view (parking lot) so the chances are even if you go when it's busy with a pleasant request to the front desk you may be accommodated. The savannas all vary with certain ones having a more compelling view but you will see animals of some sort in all of them . A high floor, 4 or above will ensure you see it as a panorama and can appreciate it better. One of my daughters was enchanted with the animals the other I reckon was on the balcony once to look at them in the 2 weeks! The bus shuttles to the park were very good. Its rubbish to suggest its hours to get anywhere. About 20 minutes was the longest wait (we did that twice) when we had clearly just missed a bus. The furthest park was Magic Kingdom which was still a very reasonable 15-20 minutes away. No travelling by car and parking etc can beat that. The pool water as other guests have mentioned is not refreshing it is rather warm. This might be because it is shallow, which suits if you are travelling with children and do not want them out of their depth. My children did love the pool and it certainly didn't put them off. All in all my family enjoyed their stay. It's a lovely place to enjoy your Disney holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1923
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days at the Animal Kingdom Lodge in mid September. The hotel was amazing, right down to the very last detail. The hotel lobby and rooms were decorated in very bright colors and patterns, and the furnishings were very tribal in nature. The room was very clean and kept up nicely each day. The hotel offers several restaurant choices on the property. My only complaint is that the restaurants aren't open very late. So after a long day at Disney World, it was hard to find something to eat when we returned. The hotel offers several wildlife viewing stations throughout the property. We were able to see several giraffes and zebras. They even provided nightvision goggles to view the animals at night. Transportation to and from the theme parks was very easy. There were several shuttle buses that would stop at the property and take you to the parks. We hardly ever had to wait for very long. In typical Disney fashion, there was a large gift shop in the hotel with several African-themed items as well as your typical Disney merchandise. The staff was very courteous and helpful in making our trip the best it possibly could be. I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “African Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Ihavetravelbug
Reviews.Content: Once again, we were not disappointed! This was our third time staying here and I wouldn't stay anywhere else! We were here for 9 nights and could have stayed longer! My husband and my 3 and 8 year old sons loved looking out over our balcony to see animals just wandering by. The property has a lot of acreage so there weren't a lot of animals all the time, but there was always a wildebeast, giraffe, zebra or watusi nearby. There are also ostriches and other birds too. Because we love the theme parks, we didn't get to spend too much time at the resort but when we were there we participated in the kids activities. They have learning centers where the kids learn about African cultures, animals, etc. Since my son was out of school I loved that he was learning something new and be able to share it with his classmates. We love good ethnic food so we couldn't wait to go back to Boma. The African buffet was awesome once again. My kids love it and my husband and I decided to go back once again, so we went back for our last dinner there. Jiko was just fabulous. The African wine was amazing and the service impeccable. We grabbed food from Mara when we were rushing and trying to get out the door for the parks in the am. We were usually up pretty early so we didn't have to wait in long lines to grab food at Mara. Our last morning when we had a late start there was a huge line and I decided to forego eating there and eat at the Magic Kingdom instead. One thing to be aware of. Disney is really pushing the Disney Dining Plan. We were there at a time when the park was pretty much empty and we were able to get right on the rides without lines, BUT since more people are using the dining plan, it was really hard to get into sit down restaurants. I always make reservations ahead of time and this time my husband said "let's play it by ear," so I only had a few reservations. What a mistake that was. The places we wanted to visit were completely sold out. Even Boma was sold out a few nights. A few restaurants will take you but after 8pm and my kids were too tired to stay up. I highly recommend that you make reservations for dining ahead of time. This is for any sit down meal, lunch, bfast or dinner, at the parks or the resort. You can always cancel them but at least you will have an option to a sit down meal if you want one. The room was cleaned every day. The room was nice. The boys had a bunk bed which they loved and we had a double which was fine. The only drawback, which was not too bad for us is that since the Animal Kingdom Lodge is far from the theme parks, it took a while to get to and fro from the lodge, but we knew that ahead of time so we were prepared. If we had a car we would still have to park in the parking lots which some were a distance from the parks so either way it would take a little longer than if you were staying at some of the closer resorts. The reason we continue to stay the the Animal Kingdom (we have stayed also at the Beach Club Resort) is that there is a feeling that you are away from a lot of people and I feel relaxed at this hotel. AFter being in theme parks day in day out, it was great to come back and relax in our room with the peacefulness of the savanah in our balcony. The kids loved the pool with the slide and the lobby is very inviting, open and friendly. One thing to note, if your key gets demagnetized, you can easily get a replacement key. My husband got his demagnitized and they replaced it right away. Mine got demagnitized and I was told that all the keys had to be replaced they had to get reprogrammed, etc. It took 25 minutes and it erases everything that was on the original card which caused a mess. It was eventually fixed but keep that in mind. NO need to reprogram keys. Overall, the hotel was excellent, service was great. Food was wonderful and we will definitely go back there again!

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: karenRW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at AKL for 14 nights 14-28th Sept and loved every minute of it. Upon arriving in the lobby we were blown away by it all - we checked in and were given a free upgrade to a Savannah room for our stay. They rooms are furnished to a high standard throughout and we didn't find the rooms dark - (personal preference) The view from our room was wonderful and you find your holidays photos consist of 90 % Giraffes! :) The flies that someone else mentioned in the AKL review are all over Florida at this time and also in May - locals call them Lovebugs - so don't let it put you off. We ate at Boma quite a few times for Breakfast and it was lovely - was about $16 each and was a nice start to the morning. Mara was fast food and was ok for a snack - they do pizza and chips - dips and chips, cakes and fruit etc - we found the food quite nice - its open till 11pm so quite handy. Staff were fantastic as Disney staff always are! We will definitely be stopping there again - as we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: alyson.johnson-smith_123
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we were in awe at the size and design of the lobby. Check in was hassle free, we had a Savannah room on the 4th floor quite near to lobby. As soon as we got into the room, about 6pm I ran straight to the window to see the animals and was not disappointed. I could see Giraffe's about 20 - 30 feet from the balcony along with Zebra's and Bongo's. The room itself had 2 queen size beds in it and was sizeable. Bigger than expected after reading other reviews. Places to Eat Boma and Jiko are both fantastic if you like to try different foods, all african themed. Although the breakfast buffet at Boma has both classic american and african food, suits all tastes. My husband and I ate in both and loved them, Once you have an idea of what you are doing on your holiday then try and book in advance as they are both popular, at this time of year no need to book before you leave for your holiday. If you are unsure then the hotel does a culinary tour in the afternoons (free) so you can have a taster of the kind of food they serve. Mara is just a self serve, all american snack place which serves a purpose but it neither good nor bad. Tips There is a lot to see and do within the hotel and it is easy to miss. Just down by check in and also on the ground floor by Boma there is an activity board that tells you what is going on. Lots of stuff for kids but also talks about the animals and also times in the evening where you can view the animals with night vision goggles. All the activites and the staff by the savannah viewing points all come from various countries within Africa and have a wealth of info about the animals and can tell you a great deal about the culture of their country, these guys are definately worth talking to. Tip the maid in the room a couple of dollars every other day and if you want something you haven't got then leave a note and you will pretty much always get it. I guess this also tells the maid that you appreciate them and they are not working for nothing (they really do not get paid much) Talk to the staff they can tell you interesting things that will make your stay in Orlando better, the bugs that people mention are called lovebugs and they are harmless but annoying but come out for 2 weeks in May and 2 weeks in September and then die off. There is a lady by the name of Laura who works at the pool bar and she is especially helpful. It is quite normal to have a thunderstorm in the afternoon about 3pm (does not last long) and the pool bar may close for a short time as understandabley they do not want you to be struck by lightning so will get you inside. Most people go to the pool in the afternoon after the park so it can be quite busy about 5pm, but if you have a morning free then the pool is nice and quiet Sorry for the long review but hopefully the tips will help make it an amazing stay. If you have any question feel free to mail me at alysonsowrey@hotmail.co.uk

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Madcow692002
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the lodge for 2 weeks this September. I booked it without really looking into it and was quite worried by reading some of the reviews at the time. On arrival at the hotel I found that there was no need to have worried. It was really well themed, all staff during the 2 weeks did everything possible to make it the magical experience that the brochure said it would be. Our room was on the third floor and was a good size with 2 queen beds and hand carved furniture and an amazing view of the savannah. The décor was all African themed and looked really good. The only complaint I could have of it is that even with all lights in it was quite dark as only had lights on the walls which had thick frosted glass around them but this was really a minor thing in an other wise perfect room. It also had the benefit of a fridge, which saved us a fortune on food and drink in the hotel. There are 3 restaurants inside the hotel THE MARA - fast service food. We ate there twice when in a rush and found it to be expensive for what we got and both of us agreed it would have been cheaper and better quality to have eaten in a theme park. BOMA - buffet breakfast and evening meal. The buffet was a mix of African and regular food and had a great select. The servers were all very friendly and helpful seeming to take a real interest in what you had planned for the day and how you were enjoying it. We were served by one of them on the first day and then didn’t see him for over a week yet he remembered my name and what drinks and food I liked, which I’ve never had anywhere else. The priced were excellent for what we got at $34 for breakfast and around $50 for evening meals for 2. JIKO - High quality restaurant for higher prices. First impressions were excellent it looked stunning and felt like a quality restaurant there were awards it had won on the wall when you entered so expectations were high. Unfortunately the meal I had didn’t meet expectations meal for two was $110 with one of us drinking coke and the other having just a couple of beers and sharing a starter. I have a steak which I asked for medium to well done and arrived blood red and cold through most of the middle. I struggled to eat most of it as felt like it was rare. My girlfriend had salmon, which is her favourite meal yet ate very little of it. We both had a dessert which was a type of chocolate cake and was a large serving and very nice. Staff were friendly but both of us were left a little disappointed as we had left this restaurant till the last night thinking it would be the best. As far as for the rest of the hotel it was one of the best I have stayed in anywhere. I was extremely upset to have to leave and have every intention of going back soon. I would suggest to anyone to explore the hotel, we did this on the last day and found loads of great look out spots and seating places that we wish we would have found earlier. I would also suggest that if you are staying there that you get the savannah view its well worth it. + points Great theme and décor Excellent staff great service The animals BOMA restaurant Very good fitness suit and health suit Nice pool Great location Free Disney Bus service Room key can be used in most shops around Disney world (saves carrying large amounts of cash) - Points Hotel is quite dark in places particularly on the stairs by the Bar and restaurants saw a few people trip on them. - there were millions of mating fly’s outside of the hotel and pool area. Not hotels fault but I didn’t see them anywhere else in the Florida so possibly something to do with all the animals nearby

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault the AKL”
Reviews.Author: Kilty249
Reviews.Content: Just spent 10 wonderful nights at Disney's AKL. All the staff were terrific. Epecially the day my (hired) car wouldn't start! When their own Security guys couldn't get it started, they phoned my hire company and arranged a replacement, whilst I toddled off and enjoyed myself at one of the parks. Buffet breakfast at Boma restaurant was excellent, and so was the "economy" one at The Marah. Had dinner at Jiko too and loved it. My only complaint was that it was so far to walk to my room! Would definitely stay there again (but not too soon, I have max'd out on Disney for the time being!)

Reviews.Title: “Animal Lovers Delight”
Reviews.Author: Work_for_Hols
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the AKL for 6 nights in early september (following a 5 night stay at the Hard Rock Hotel). Even though we checked in early at 11.30am our room was already ready for us and we had been upgraded from a standard room to one with a savanna view without even asking!
