From the cast member who checked us in to the concierge who made all of our dining reservations the staff at this hotel were all friendly and welcoming. We stayed in a corner room on the 4th floor which had a great view from the balcony. The room was bigger than we had expected (having read previous reviews), with 2 queen beds and excellent theming, though I would agree with previous reviews that it was a little dark, but this just makes it more authentic. The maid service was excellent for the entire stay, we were never disturbed when we were in the room and the room was always serviced by the time we returned from the parks. We ate dinner at Boma on one night and the food was excellent with a great variety from the exotic to the more usual buffet fayre, we felt is was also good value although this could be down to the favourable exchange rate between the Pound and the Dollar. We ate breakfast at The Mara on most mornings, which had a good range of items on the menu along with a range of snacks and drinks. The pool area was very nicely done but with all of the flying insects in the area it turned out to be not a very nice place to spend time, so we went to the water parks instead! The bus service to the other areas of the resort is fairly regular, the longest we waited was 15 mins but be prepared to allow 20-30 mins travel time to get to most of the theme parks downtown disney etc. Overall this is a fantastic resort which has impressive theming and great staff who do all they can to ensure you enjoy your stay, we did and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unique experience if you want safari”
Reviews.Author: ArthurMF
Reviews.Content: Stayed at AKL concierge level on 9/6/06 to 9/8. Used Magical Express to get there from airport. No problem at all. A bit slow, but less aggravation than driving. The concierge check-in was excellent. You pay about 30% more for concierge service. It doesn't add anything of value to the room, they all seemed the same. But, you do get access to the lounge on the top floor. This was quite nice. They had drinks, cappuccino, food, continental breakfast, beer and wine in the evening, cognac at night. Was very pleasant. You also can go on the Sunrise Safari at Animal Kingdom if you are a concierge guest. That was a real treat. Get up at 7 AM and enter the AK before it opens and take a very in-depth look at the Safari ride and the animals before anyone else enters. Lots of rhino, hippo, lion, gazelle, zebra, etc.. Also get breakfast at Tusker House, which was very pleasant. Definitely worth the $ to do this one. We also went on Wayanama sunset safari, also only available to concierge guests. This cost $150 each. Safari is around the 33 acres of the AKL and you get to see many animals. This is much more like Africa, except better. Can get very close to the animals: giraffe and zebra mainly. No lions or rhinos because of danger issues. Still quite interesting. Even serve snacks. Then afterwards includes dinner at Jiko. This was a huge disappointment. The quality of the food is poor. Much of it was cold. Speaks of bad service and bad kithcen expediting. They do have a very high opinion of themselves, however. Food at Boma wa reasonably good, even if the place is overwhelmed with screaming children and lackluster servers. The rooms at AKL are reasonably nice, but small. You should ask for an interior savannah view to see all the animals. It is fun to watch them from your room. Very romantic. You get to see far more than in Africa. Also, take advantage of the proximity to Animal Kingdom. We arrived at 4 pm and ate dinner and then went to AK for extra magic evening hours. In the 2 extra hours that park was open, we managed to ride every major attraction. Worked very nice. Don't try to get to Epcot or MK from here, though. That takes a long time. We switched on 9/8 to Grand Floridian to do the other parks.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs galore, pricey, but great for amimal lovers.”
Reviews.Author: TravelswithFouf
Reviews.Content: The Hotel concept is truly wonderful and waking up in the morning to the sights and sounds of giraffes, exotic birds and other wild African animals is great. However, we itched from bedbugs till our skin turned bloody, and they wouldn't pick up our breakfast tray after 11.00 am. The prices were ludicrous for the type of luxury provided. Great breakfast, lovely views and complimentary bus service to Disney and back.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: Busterkg
Reviews.Content: I have been reading the reviews for AKL for a few months now so I thought I should post my review for others as well. This was our 6th trip to Disney but our first lodging experience with Disney. First off, pulling up to the lodge is amazing. We were immediately greeted by someone that unloaded our luggage. We were given a card and told to take it to the desk right inside the door to the left after we check in. The check-in process was a breeze. The gentleman was very nice. We asked for an upgrade from a pool view but the guy smiled and said he didn't think they could accommodate that request (didn't even check). All of our meals, park tickets, and the door key was loaded onto cards for each of us and we were off to get our luggage. We were on the 3rd floor (which is where the lobby is). We were just down the hall from the lobby and right by an elevator that took us to the pool, Mara, laundry facility, arcade, etc. That was super convenient! The Mara was our favorite I think in all of Disney (for quick service). We ate at Boma...it was ok. As far as the $11.99 mugs, I read the reviews and raced down to get them on our first night. I'm sure it makes sense for some but for us it wasn't worth it. We were in the parks from morning to night and usually had dinner at the Mara. Since we were on the meal plan, we chose bottles of soda for our drink. They give you paper cups at the counter so you can divide drinks for the little ones. We always had a couple extra bottles to take to put in our fridge for later -- and bottled soda tastes so much better than fountain soda!! My husband filled his mug up a couple times but it wasn't worth it for us (note: soda in the vending machines is $2.50). Our daughter quickly tired of the same kid's meals. On our 2nd day, we asked about getting something different and learned that they really don't care if you order off of the kid's menu or not. From there on out, she chose whatever she wanted - usually the cheese pizza at Mara! She could still choose a side and a dessert.....needless to say, she had lots of snacks for later. On the meal plan, I read where some people buy their kid's meals and then they have extra meals left over for the adults. This could be easily done but we didn't do it. As far as the room, it was ok. I expected it to be small and dark so no big deal. I thought the noise was annoying, it usually died down by 11:30 or so. There is so much vegitation there, our room view was severely obstructed. We could only see small glimpses of the pool! In retrospect, I would have opted for the the cheaper view and saved the $. The halls did have tattered and stained carpet in some areas, which surprised me, (Note: I read this in another review so I was purposely looking for it. Had I not known to look, maybe I wouldn't have noticed it) Bus transportation was pretty good. The bus stop is just down the hill from the entrance. I'm sure if somebody had a room on the other side of the resort, all of the walking got old! We didn't have to wait too long for buses. Downtown Disney was the longest trip. You pretty much have to allow for an hour of travel time by the time you walk to the bus stop, wait for a bus, and then travel time. But especially with Magic Kingdom, I think the bus system is more efficient than driving yourself. The pool was ok. It had a nice water slide in it. They also had a small round baby pool that was a few inches deep. There were 2 hot tubs around the pool (find them on the map because they are kind of hidden!). They also have a small playground for kids tucked in behind the pool (I heard several kids wondering where the swings were). Laundry facilities were ok. It was $2.00 to wash and $2.00 to dry. Soap was another $1.00 (we took soap with us). I do want to put plug in for the Disney staff - they were all wonderful from the lodge, to the bus drivers, to the park staff. Always friendly and helpful!. All-in-all, I'm glad we stayed at the AKL but we are the type of people that have precious vacation dollars and vacation days from work allocated. When we are on vacation we are on the go from morning to night and don't spend alot of "down time" just relaxing. To be very honest, we stayed at a Holiday Inn Express in Milwaukee before we flew out and that was one of the highlights of our 4 year old's vacation!! It had a little water park and that's all she needed! Actually, the room was much bigger and had a microwave in it too, which was great for bottles. Needless to say, we will be opting for more practical lodging on our next Disney adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, creative, beautifully-designed and GIRAFFES outside your window!”
Reviews.Author: bleeee
Reviews.Content: My husband, our two girls (5 and 4), and I just returned from a wonderfully happy seven night stay. I am very into researching hotels and trying to get the best hotel possible (like my fellow tripadvisors). And I did! The lobby is jaw-dropping, the giraffes and zebras and elands outside our window (4th floor, inward facing, second bldg on zebra trail) every morning and evening were truly magical to behold, and the service was outstanding. Housekeeping was very good too (a few dollars tip each day may have helped). On our trip, I made sure to check out the Grand Floridian and the Polynesian, and was so happy to know the Animal Kingdom Lodge beats them hands down in the fantasy factor, in interesting design, and sorry to say, even smell (the Polynesian lobby smells of smoke!) I am glad I ignored the warnings against the AKL here, and stuck with our plan. The only thing I can see the Grand Floridian or Polynsesian have over AKL is the MUCH SHORTER COMMUTE times to Magic Kingdom and Epcot. But just walking into the cool, exotic vibe after being out in the "World" each night makes it all worth the extra 20 minutes each way. FYI - In addition to tripadvisor, I used the "Unofficial Guide to Disney World" as a great research tool. Other pluses: My kids loved Simba's Cubhouse--the hotel's very well-run kid's club, the huge pool is nicely designed, fun and full of kids (as you'd expect), the amazing animals are all around, the grounds are fun to explore, you'll hear live drums beating in the lobby at any given moment (so cool!), Boma is a GREAT buffet restaurant full of yummy exotic foods you've probably never tasted before (try the fufu!), the African exchange students that work there add a lot to the experience, there are tons of kids' activities every day, even though we ended up missing most of them while in the parks. Go and have fun. It's wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: vickier
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old son and I stayed here from August 23rd until the 27th. Our check in was immediate. As soon as I approached the front desk, I was waited on. We stayed in a room on the 3rd floor and in the ostrich area. We did not have a room with a savannah view and that was fine. It was easy to see the animals from other viewing locations at the hotel. Our room was very clean and the beds were nice. We had a small balcony outside of our room and I sat out there several times. The staff at this hotel were so friendly and efficient. I have been to Orlando many times and the staff at this hotel rank at the top. The hotel has a message board that lets you know what is going on at the hotel every day. There are arts and crafts projects for the kids, storytelling and night vision viewing of the animals. I stayed here once before in 2004 and I would definitely recommend it, again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable - especially the staff!”
Reviews.Author: ears2u
Reviews.Content: Most of your reviewers go to a Disney property with their kids.....my wife and I are now "empty nesters" but still wanted to enjoy some of the magic that has made Disney what it is. All in all, we were impressed with the Animal Kingdom Lodge, but come away nonetheless with a profound sense of awe at what families pay to stay there. Is all that magic worth a rate that's 300% more than a place outside the park? It must be - Disney isn't running alot of specials...... At our stage in life, we truly appreciated the special, small things about the lodge, and Disney property in general. Things are super clean - employees (cast members) are genuinely happy to be there, and it shows. Have you found 50 "mickey's" today? Check your bedspread - your curtains....hey, there's another one! It's amazing! We used the Disney Express from MCO and found it to be a breeze. The Disneyworld transportation takes a bit of time, but it saves parking lots and waiting in lines. No matter what people might say, nobody does crowd control better than Disney. Oddly enough, our favorite place to eat at the Lodge was in the lower level Mara - part fast-food, part cook to order. Again, we noticed the "little things" about the place - primarily the staff. Friendly, helpful, kind - even fun. The lines were much shorter, and you had more choices there - and yes, the food was good! That's not to say the other places weren't great as well - we just chose not to do the lines and buffets. Would we book here again? Maybe. But probably with our grandkids - if we ever have any!

Reviews.Title: “Fell in love with the Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Jools99
Reviews.Content: WOW, what else can i say about the AKL, we fell in love with the place. The hotel is lovely and so are the staff. Disney really does know how to look after there guests. We had a Savannah room on the 5th floor. The rooms are well maintained and inviting. We loved sitting out on the balcony and found the whole place lovely and quiet, which is nice after racing around parks all day. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. Boma is a must for dinner and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a break from the Disney theme”
Reviews.Author: slev
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge for 4 days. My boys are Animal Planet Junkies and I wanted to stay at a nicer resort that would give me a break from the Mickey theme. This fulfilled both needs(you are able to still buy Disney stuff in the shop). With the exception of a few HIdden Mickeys, it stays true to the African theme. The animals were out and viewable. The lobby is a fantastic sight worth seeing on its own. The staff on the viewing trail come from Africa, they have many interesting stories to tell you (the one we visited with caught black mamba snakes in Africa!) The arcade was nice and Mira (informal meal area) was one of the best I've seen. Get the $14 mug-it's worth it. I will say we were disappointed in BOmas (it was crowded and loud- it reminded me of an African themed Furrs with a $28 price. We were not on the food plan and went next door to Jiko's- the cost of dinner was actually less expensive but the dining was top notch. It was quiet and the staff is very attentive- halibut at its best. Jiko was more on the scale of Texas de Brazil. Only drawback- you only have bus for transportation and the amount of walking from some of the rooms. Busses come very often (longest wait was about 7 minutes) and ask for a room near the lobby (we did and they quickly accommodated without any complaint). If you do the Land and Sea package- they will give the option of picking you up for the sea portion from the AK park next door.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sandycheeks
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard room at the Animal Kingdom Lodge and were very pleased with both the room and its location. We woke up on our first morning to the sight of giraffes, zebras and wilderbeast just a few feet from our balcony. The hotel is very impressive and its service and facilities first class. It offers a selection of places to eat and we enjoyed cooling down in the swimming pool. We found the bus shuttle service to the Disney parks very useful. We would definately recommend this hotel to familes and would love to stay here again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel impressive, rooms not”
Reviews.Author: TraciofNH
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Disney in September, about 2 weeks after school started. It was great, no crowds. Upon arrival at the hotel, I was impressed. The lobby is huge with alot to look at. The front desk staff was fine. We had requested a deluxe room with bunk beds. I asked for non/smoking and indicated that I had a child with allergies. I was disappointed in the room, it was smaller than I thought, and dingy. The furniture is dark,. so it made the room dark. It also looked quite worn. The couch had stains on the arms, and the netting over the bed looked dirty. The mattress was terrible, the springs were literally coming through the material. When we told the front desk, we were asked if we tried to flip it. We did, (at 2 am) but I was appalled that they expected us to do it. I asked for a new one, which never happened. Six nights on a terrible mattress is a long time. My daughters, however, said the bunk beds were quite comfortable. The view from the balcony was great, the animials certainly did not disappoint. We were in the back, so it was very quiet. I was upset that there was a used ashtry on the balcony. I was quite clear about staying in a non smoking room. The bathroom was small, but clean. I liked that the vanity area was outside the actual bathroom, 1 could shower, while 1 got ready. The Boma restaurant had by far the best breakfast in Disney. We did not eat dinner there, however, it did smell delicious. Next time we head to Disney, we will visit Animal Kingdom Lodge, but will not stay there. It is not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “true disney style!”
Reviews.Author: will64
Reviews.Content: Reading reviews some times i wounder what people realy want from a disney hotel, the room were larger tham others i have stayed in, check in on a friday afternoon was only minutes with a very friendly person who changed my room twise without any comments! The food- the buffet restaurant was over prised and very little vegetarian unless you liked couscous $27.50 for it was alittle steep. Mara was a good choice with friendly staff. Pool bar closed too early! a good hotel with rooms not far from main lobby. all in all i would recomend this resort to any one as we had a wounderfull time! Dont bother with the savana rooms as you can see the animals from lots of locations "when they are out".

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge - OK but just average”
Reviews.Author: SStamp
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed a week at the DAKL. It was OK but nothing special. The architecture and lobby theming are all great, but no good to you when your room is dirty, you've got holes in the linen and house-keeping hasn't renewed coffee supplies in your room for the 2nd day in a row. The staff all seemed friendly enough but told us we couldn't move to a better trail when we couldn't see anything much from our "savannah" view room, although we could upgrade the next day to a concierge room over-looking the zebra trail at an extra $150 per night, which we refused. We were on the Kudu trail on the end, and I would strongly recommend avoiding these rooms where possble due to the poor view. The restaurants, including the self service were all very very expensive, although the quality was very good and the staff were helpful. The bus service ran very well and we never experienced a long wait. The chikdren aged 10 and 3 both enjoyed their time at DAKL, especially their parading around the lobby playing african instruments, the story-telling and the lessons in animal tracking. I would recommend the DAKL for a short stay, just to see the place, but I certainly wouldn't pay to return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Holiday Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tim_H_from_Lincs_UK
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying at the Animal Kingdom Lodge and can't fault it. We do alot of travelling and although you will find hotels with bigger rooms (these rooms were plently big enough) the overall theming of the hotel and the rooms, down to the smallest detail is outstanding. If you are booked in standard room, which literally have a view of the parking lot, I would recommend upgrading to a pool view, which when we arrived was only $15 a day. Having looked at the Savannah, although a lovely addition to the hotel. it was not in our opinion worth the $120 per night to upgrade. But that's a decision for you based on you budget and your need to see animals when you wake up. The two full service restaurants are good, but not outstanding. Jiko gets rave reviews and when we ate there the food was good, but not award winning. My chicken was tough and chewy. Boma is good value for a Disney buffet, but again it is good quality rather than outstanding as certain reviewers lead you to believe. You get a nice size fridge in your room as standard, which enables you to have more reasonably priced breakfast and alcholic drinks if you wish. Soft drinks are great value. Buy a souvenir mug on your arrival from Boma and get free soft drinks for the duration of you stay! Staff were always pleasant and helpful and there are far more staff on hand by comparison with a similar quality hotel outside Disney. Thanks very much Animal Kingdom Lodge for a memorable holiday. Tim Higham Lincolnshire England

Reviews.Title: “AKL Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: torontotripster
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay at AKL for 7 nights but ended up switching to the Grand Floridian after 4. AKL is beautiful and the food really good, but I was not impressed with housekeeping. We saved for 2 years for this big trip. At close to $450.00 a night Canadian, I expected a lot more. The first night when I bathed my son, I noticed the plastic bolt cover for the base of the toilet, on the floor beside the toilet. It never moved for 4 days. That means the housekeeper never cleaned the floor around the toilet. When we got back to our room the eve of day 2 you could smell urine in the bathroom (i've 2 young boys!) so I dont know why the maid could not. On day 3, we decided if the bathroom floor wasnt cleaned, we would complain upon our return to the room in the evening.....except we forgot to remove the do not disturb sign from the door! So we couldnt very well complain at that point. The 4th morning we had a character breakfast at the Contemporary Hotel and decided to tour the Polynesian and the Grand Floridian too. When my oldesty son saw how beautiful the GF was he begged us to stay there. It didnt take much begging as we had stayed there on our honeymoon and loved it. The GF cost $50 more a night for the cheapest room but we went for it. It was the best decision we made! I now feel if you are going to spend a fortune on a room, might as well go all the way and stay at the GF. There is absolutely no comparison. Guests are treated royally! The beds turned down every night, and chocolates and a poem on the pillow! The rooms are stunning, fresh flowers everywhere in the lobby and hallways. Back to the AKL......some other minor annoyances. The walls around the bathroom sinks were covered in toothpaste splatters along with the wooden front of the vanity and wooden frame of the mirror. I dont know how many weeks it would take for that much to accumulate, but I've never seen a quarter of that in my own bathroom with 4 of us, and I probably wipe the walls around the sink area once a week. It was the first thing I noticed while unpacking. The taps actually had a layer of dust further up the handles where the hands dont touch! And trust me, I am not a clean freak. Is it too much to ask to have your bathroom cleaned fully, not partially, for $450.00 a night? We have stayed at probably 8 different Disney hotels and I have never had a housekeeping problem. Regarding booking a Savannah room, I paid aprox $1000.00 extra for this view for the week. Definately not worth it unless all you plan to do is sit on your balcony and try to look at the animals. I say "try to" because of the time we spent in the room during daylight hours, I would say the animals were in sight about 25% of the time. A lot of money for what you get if you ask me. Unfortunately, you dont really figure this out until you're in the room. I had read other review saying how you can go to the viewing areas and see the animals instead of booking a savanna view, but it sounded so cool to wake up and watch the animals eat breakfast! The only animals we saw in the morning the whole time was 2 zebras, one morning. Regarding the walk....didnt really bother us. We were 3 rooms from the very end of the Zebra Trail too! As long as you are in reasonable shape you can do it. It will not be good if your children are too tired to walk and you dont have your own stroller as you will have to carry them all the way from the bus to the room! The food was really good at all 3 restaurants. We enjoyed Boma as it is a buffet and a great way to try a variety of African foods and not commite to a whole entree. We did the dining plan which we recommend. We figure it saved us aprox $500.00 over the course of the week. Most sit down meals at Disney ended up being about $150.00 for us (2 adults, a 12 year old and 4 year old) and the dining plan cost us about $115.00 CDN a day. If we paid for what we ate , on average it would have cost about $225-$250 a day. All in all, we felt ripped off and somewhat disappointed about the Animal Kingdom. Once we switched to the Grand Floridian, it save the holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: treborniaw
Reviews.Content: Fantastic, I stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge for two weeks and loved every minute of it. When you walk in it is just breathtaking. All the staff were very friendly and there are cleaners around the hotel nearly 24/7. The food was great in both 'Mara' and 'Boma', we didnt try 'Jiko' but it was supposed to be really nice aswell. The pool could of been cleaned a little more often but was not too bad. The rooms are very comfortable and all cleaned to a high standard every day. The decor was interesting arounf the hotel and in the rooms but just added to the 'African' feel. Overall FANTASTIC. Food - 4.5/5 Cleanliness - 5/5 Service - 4.5/5 Activity choice (while staying in the hotel) - 3/5 *It needs a few more daily activities like water aerobics or things to keep people amused.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull place to stay,loved it all rlando,fl”
Reviews.Author: bigburrito
Reviews.Content: my family and i just returned from wdw on july 14th,we stayed at akl and we just loved it. everything was great the food the rooms the pool was great our two children loved it. housekeeping was excellent, i am not sure why it was bad for other people,we left our room about 10 am and no matter what time we came back it was clean. we loved the fact that if you wanted to go for a swim after a day at one of the parks no matter what time it was you could go in the pool. my sister in law and her family were also there and we wanted 2 rooms with connecting doors and they were more than happy to accomodate us. i would most definetly reccomend this hotel it is well worth it. our check in was very easy and our check out was even easier. great place to spend your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: seanchagan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from our honeymoon at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. We both were very impressed with the service and friendly staff we encountered. We were even sent a complimentary bottle of Champagne and toasting flutes to our room compliments of Disney. Many of the comments I have heard concerning this hotel is concerning it’s outside appearance which is supposed to mimic African building styles, which it does. Also the pool is meant to resemble a watering hole with a zero entry end to the pool which allows you to simply walk right into the water without using stairs. The hotel rooms are very large and well appointed. Each room includes a mini fridge, hair dryer, in room safe, ironing board & iron, internet service for a charge, sofa, dining table with two chairs and so on. The restaurants inside the hotel are very good but they can be expensive unless you choose the Disney dining plan which we did. I have never used the dining plan before but I can honestly say we definitely saved quite a bit of money and we did not have to worry about how much the trip was costing us since everything was already paid for. The only issue we had with the hotel was that we were in our room at the time the maid came by to clean our room and she asked us to call housekeeping when we left so that she could clean our room. I called about 4:30pm as we were leaving and when we returned at 11:30pm the maid had not cleaned the room. I called housekeeping and within ten minutes a maid was at our door and she cleaned the entire room within 25 minutes while we were having drinks. I have noticed that most of the bad reviews come from the United Kingdom and I understand completely why that is. The rudest people I encountered during our entire stay were from the UK so please take into account who is rating the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Ksigns
Reviews.Content: We just came back from AKL. Stayed July6-12 in a savanna view room. Check in was easy, no line (we did get there after 7pm). I had read some reviews saying that even though you have booked a savanna view room you rarely see animals. So first thing I did was go out on the balcony and right in front of me was a giraffe, so that was nice. We actually had giraffes outside our window almost the entire stay! That was a real treat for the kids. We were on the 4th floor not far from the lobby, room 4236. The only thing that needs improvement is housekeeping. I have to agree with a previous post in that we would split our day in half and go back to the hotel after 2 or 3pm and our room still wasn't done, our houskeeper sometimes wouldn't get to our room until about 4pm! All the other staff was great. We requested a refrigerator in the room, which we did get. I have an 18 month old and she drinks whole milk. We took ice packs to keep the milk cool while at the parks. FYI: these refrigerators do not have a freezer. When I asked at the front desk if they had fridges with freezer I was told no, but the front desk agent said that they have a freezer in the back and they would keep our ice packs overinight every night of our stay. I really liked that detail. So every night after we'd get back from the parks we would hand over or packs and pick them up in the morining. It is not an uncommon thing. We liked the pool. The only time we found it closed was when it was raining. The pool is open 24 hours, weather permitting, of course. Because of the rain on some afternoons the kids didn't get to use the playground (wet slides after the rain). The Mara is their quick service restaurant, I really liked it because of the convinience and their quick service. For breakfast they have an $8 breakfast platter, waffles, cereals, bagels ect. For lunch they have chicken strips, burgers, and you can get a large pepperoni pizza for $18, pretty good. Boma offers buffet for breakfast and dinner. Tried both and both were good. Reservations recomended. Tried Jiko once for dinner, I enyoyed the Hallibut bot not the appetizer or salad. You have to really be open to those different flavors. Again, reservations are recommended. Did the character breakfast at the Beach club, good buffet. And the highlight of the trip was dinner at Cinderella's Royal Table. Dinner is pre-paid with a 24hr cancel policy. Included is a 3 course meal and icludes soft drinks. You get your picture taken with Cinderella before dinner. The photographs are complimentary! 4 people plus an infant was $174. Everyone really had a good time. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Never waited long for any bus to any of the parks. Also, for those interested, We used Disneys Magical Express and it was the best! Our bags got to our room about 2 hours after we did. Then on our last day our plane wasn't leaving 'till 730pm, so we checked our bags at 10am and got our boarding passes, went to magic kingdom with our carry-ons and got back to the hotel at 5pm to get our transfer back to the airport. This is a really good idea if you're flying on a participating carrier,we otherwise would have wasted our last day.

Reviews.Title: “Not really what we expected from a 'deluxe' resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first holiday together, and our first 'disney' experience, and after months of excitement we finally arrived at AKL from the UK, at around 9pm on Saturday night. Being tired and hungry, though in a feverpitch state of excitement to explore the lush surroundings we thought we'd tour the hotel and get some food. Spotting one zebra and then queuing KFC style for deep fried food amongst screaming youngsters was not what we imagined on a romantic getaway, but as there was an hour delay for a table at Boma (the normal food buffet), and similar for Jiko (very nice food that we tried later in the week, but very expensive), our options were Mara, or in room dining. Opting not to be hermits on our first night, left us feeling very disappointed with the place, the food and service was quite frankly awful. The hotel whilst not small, in terms of public space is much smaller than expected from the brochures, and the bar area whilst not essential to a great holiday is very small indeed. In general the staff whilst polite, were not helpful, leaving almost all the discovering of useful information to ourselves -- even trying to organise some surprise flowers for my girlfriends birthday later in the week was beyond the capabilities of the front desk - in a supposedly deluxe hotel I was very disappointed, It seemed even beyond them to supply me with the numbers for a florist. As it happened, they would have struggled to help, as the disney florist is closed on the 4th July -- the number for central disney guest services (who were helpful) was on the in-room telephone (which had no manual, as did so little else!) Apart from that, we encountered exceptionally grumpy security men on the front gate, a total lack of instructions on pretty much all facilities, buses that seem to turn up when they feel like it, and then are crowded and not guaranteed to go exactly where you intended - for example - again on my girlfriends birthday we'd booked a restaurant at MGM, and started queueing for a bus a good 1hr15 mins before we needed to arrive -- needless to save we were 20 minutes late, after a few no show buses, and then a bus that decided rather helpfully to go via animal kingdom on the off-chance there were some stragglers there. Fortunately, the restaurant were good enough to understand, though we had to literally sprint from the main car park to the other end of mgm studios to make it, meaning that despite being really hot, sweaty and stressed we did not have time to grab a birthday badge from guest services, and to be honest the food when we got there was cold and disappointing (sci fi diner) -- mama melroses later in the week was worlds beter! The 4th July fireworks were really good. Other room niggles, it took 2 days to get more clothes-hangers for the wardrobe area, there was no pay per view tv, a missed opportunity when you have the entire disney back catalog that could be picked from. Towels were not collected from the bathroom floor when they needed refreshing, and the bed itself was considerably less comfortable on one side than the other. As a further note, for some reason the bar person in the waiting area for Jiko ignore us for a good 20 minutes whilst we watched one gent try his way through samples of at least 10 different wines to take back to his room!! In the end we decided to not drink wine, as it would have meant having to tip such awful service. Despite all that we've had a really amazing holiday, the imagination in the parks is amazing, though we both would not recommend this hotel to others. Overall, for the money we paid, we'd rather have stayed at the Gaylord Palms (where we had a fabulous lunch on the way back to the airport, and encountered far better service fom restaurant staff and concierges), or at some other luxury hotel than this supposedly 'Deluxe' disney resort, it is not worth the premium, and as one other person on here put so succinctly, it felt as if we were staying at a souped up holiday inn.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Disney resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Disney every year since we got married, and we're getting ready to go again this year. We've stayed in the Animal Kingdom Lodge several times now and highly recommend it. We've had no bad experiences there. The people are friendly, the restaurants are superb, the pool is beautiful, the atmosphere is relaxing and authentic and the lobby is absolutely breathtaking. The only thing I'd say wasn't perfect was that we found the rooms to be a little dark because of the way the lighting was set up, but the rooms were beautiful nonetheless and offered great views (we've stayed in rooms with both savannah and pool views). We especially enjoyed exploring the resort and finding quaint viewing spots - some with handmade rocking chairs - that overlook the savannah and the animals. There's nothing more relaxing after a day of touring the parks than coming back to the cozy Lodge. We especially love eating at Boma (an African buffet) and Jiko, both right inside the resort. The gift shop also sells lovely African things as well as all the usual Disney stuff. The main drawback to the resort is that it's a bit off the beaten path, so you have to take buses to get to any of the parks. The Animal Kingdom is, of course, nearby but it takes a little while to get to the other parks. But for this reason we found that we never had to wait long to catch a bus from the resort because there were so many coming and going. But on the other hand we enjoy the fact that the resort is not super close to any parks or resorts as it truly makes you feel like you're in another world. We love this resort. Stay here - you will be so glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Animals, and that's about it!”
Reviews.Author: BakerBoysGirl
Reviews.Content: Our stay was over the 4th of July week, and due to the childrens request, we stayed at AK. It wasn't that it was bad, it just wasn't Disney. We have stayed at Wilderness Lodge, Grand Floridian, Polynesian, Contemporary and Caribbean and this hotel just does not stack up against those. I am not a "hotel snob" by any means, and I do know that in a resort of this size, somethings are a hit or miss. I am just giving you the good, the bad and the ugly. The room is not large by any means for two adults and three children, the bathroom door opens unto the toilet (so if you are trying to save time, and let your kids take a shower while you are "doing big business", your knees get a good whacking). Housekeeping was NON EXISTANT. For two days, we left by 10:00 AM, came back around 3:00 for naps or swim, and then they knocked on the door. And it is true, our housekeeper spoke absolutely no english and the little spanish I know could not seem to make her understand to come back later since we were taking naps. Also, on our first night, I kept feeling something sharp on my side of the bed, and when I turned on the light, and took off the sheets, there is a spring coming through the fabric of the mattress. I had to sleep on a pillow. We flipped the mattress ourselves the next day. We had a Savannah View, and although it was nice to see giraffes and zebras from our patio, the constant fighting with large army ants really became a challenge. Maybe our room was on their nest, I really don't know, but if you went out on the patio, prepare for war. They also made their way into our room, but it was hard to see them due to the dark carpeting. I spent a few nights on my belly searching these little guys out so I would not have to worry about my 3 year old getting bit by one of these. I would love to say that the pool was great, but on both occasions that we tried to use the pool, after about 10 minutes it had to be closed due to a child who had "left" a little package. Very unpleasant, and especially to have it happen to us both times. The second time, I didn't even get to take off my shoes and the kids were just getting ready to go down the slide for the first time. Maybe I'm unlucky, but I have never gone through that, and the idea to swim in the pool after that just did not seem too appealing. The restaurants are fine...not fine dining by any means, but acceptable for a large resort. Overall, it is a fine place to try ONCE. After that, save your money and go to a real four star hotel, because this one is more like a fancy holiday inn. Our 13 year old said it was neat, but lets stay somewhere else next time. That pretty much sums up how the rest of us felt. I truly hope an executive of Disney reads these reviews, because as Florida residents, we go to a Disney Property about 3 times a year, but I really don't know if will continue to do so if this is what I am faced with. Hopefully this was just some once in a lifetime problems that we faced. Nothing to ruin a vacation about, just not "Disney" if you know what I mean.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the Food and the Animals not the room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Lodge 4 times. The first time the was at the Grand opening which was something. The food is wonderful as well as the lobby and the animails. The Lodge has become worn over the last 5 years and is certainly not up to the price. We moved over to the Ritz-Grand Lakes, which was less money and twice the luxuary.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel for children”
Reviews.Author: bobbob2
Reviews.Content: I was so shocked to see the reviews listed for the same time we stayed at the Animal Kingdom. Usually we are terribly critical of hotels, but we LOVE Animal Kingdom. It is a "deluxe" hotel, but is the cheapest and sleeps up to 5, so it saves us money. This is our 3rd time staying here and this time we got the really cool bunk beds. At every hotel, Disney pays attention to details. There are gorgeous decorations all throughout the hotel, authentic masks, tribal jewelry, clothes in displays. The doors have shapes of shields on them, the floor carpets look like giraffes and have hidden mickeys. THE BEST: The animals are always out and there are tons of different locations to see them from. They have great spots with rocking chairs, indoor areas, your own balcony from your room. It is so different from a zoo where there are tons of people and you feel rushed. Here you wander out and have coffee and see different things come and go. The workers even feed them several times throughout the day to ensure they come to your area for you to see. There are about 10 activities throughout the day for you to do. Plus, there are 7 activities for kids to earn beads at to make like a necklace/keychain at, not cheesy at all. Some included storyteller time at the firepit, night vision goggles for animal tracking, a hidden mickey hunt, how to get food like a flamingo. They have workers all over that are from different nations in Africa that do presentations and answer kids questions. They do medallion rubbings in the lobby. They have cookie decorating in the afternoon. All free. It is a treat to hang around the hotel and have the kids do all these fun activities while here. So-So: I will agree that the front registration staff are not helpful at all. In fact, last summer when we stayed there, our 5 year old fell out of the bed onto the edge of a nightstand (made of heavy dark wood) and was bleeding PROFUSELY in the middle of the night. When we called the front desk with the emergency, etc. there was no care at all given, even by the time we got to the lobby to go to the hospital we couldn't find anyone to help get directions to the hospital until we went outside by valet. Let's say I was very upset about that. You can't judge a hotel by one or two bad workers. I will say, we got all the beds a special bedrail and put pillows around the nightstands this time around. The pool is also so-so. Other disney hotels are so fabulous, with outrageous themes, etc. that this one is not that exciting. Plus there are a ton of people smoking everywhere for some reason, especially around the bar which is where a lot of the shaded spots are if you have kids. NOTE: There is a cool kids camp on Wednesdays I think as an enrichment, but it's not known about much. It's several hours long and very educational. We weren't able to try it. NOte: There are tons of walmarts, targets, restaurants, etc. once you drive 1 mile off disney property. It makes a ton of sense to grab milk, yogurt, fruit, snacks, drinks and save a ton of money, even if you have to take a cab. Note: We did use their laundry machines which come in so handy with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel despite other reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel from June 25th to July 1st. I have two teenage sons.This hotel is magnificant! The other reviews are from over exagerated expectaions by spoiled travelers who aren't willing to be inconvenienced at all. The staff is friendly and willing to accomodate if asked. The lobby is absolutely a MUST SEE even if you don't stay there, take a bus over to see it. My children, even as old as they are, were swept away by the savannah room and watched the animals the whole time we were in our room, which at Disney is not alot of time out the day. I had absolutely no trouble at all with the room cleanliness. We have stayed many times in Disney at other hotels, but we are hooked on Animal Kingdom Lodge!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in the Animal Kingdom Lodge. We have stayed at many other Disney properties (including the Grand Californian, Disney Hotel, Wilderness Lodge, Swan and Dolphin). This place is way below Disney's excellent standards: 1) The first room assigned to us had a horrible smell of cigerette smoke, even though it was labelled non-smoking. The view was "marginal" if that. We had a view of lots of steel and pavement, with a direct view of a small pen where the animals apparently go in the morning if they choose. We swapped and got a worse room and then swapped and got one that did not stink and had a slightly better view. 2) Our $330 per night Savannah view room turned out to be a view of trees and the hot tub. If you looked really hard, you could almost see a giraffe patternn through the leaves of the tree. When we arrived in this room, there was trash between the bed and the nightstand. (an empty water bottle and some wrappers). We complained about that 3 times over the next 4 days and nobody cleaned it up. Just to be spiteful, I added to the trash pile on my way out hoping that if there was enough trash there...someone would clean it up. The entrance to our room also had some cotton squares and a qtip dropped in front. THat was picked up by the maids the next day however. There were also bits of paper and crumbs on the floor in our room that were there when we arrived and never got cleaned up. 3) The room was so dark, we could barely see what we were doing. We had read about this before beginning our trip and brought our own supply of 100 watt lightbulbs. (we left them behind for the next guest) 4) The room also needed some repairs. The knobs on the drawer handles fell off in my hand and the shower continually leaked water. 5) And the worst part of all about Animal Kingdom Lodge...it was a LONG way from the parks. I mean it could be like a 20 minute drive + a 10 minute wait for the bus. You might as well stay someplace cheaper that is not part of the Disney property! 6) When checking in the person at the desk was a Trainee. Should could not help us with our room concerns. We asked for a supervisor who was surly and inattentive. They eventually wore us down and we just gave up. 7) The pool was FILTHY!!!! I've stayed in numerous 5 Star resorts with way too many kids peeing in the pool. In each of those cases, you can still see into the pool. This one was so dirty that you could not see *anything* underwater. So imagine if you will, your kid goes under for a little swim. You totally lose track of them until they come up (or if they came up...sorry to be morose!). The lifeguard is almost useless if he cannot see into the pool! So...either save your $ or go to Wilderness Lodge or Swan. I also hear Contemporary Lodge is nice and very close!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Philrdg
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge and thought it was fantastic. I was a little concerned before I went after reading some of the reviews on this site but must say me and my 5 yr old son loved it. The rooms are fine, typical American sized rooms and were clean and well maintained. There was a in-room safe and the bathroom area was quite large. My room had a balcony and it was great to be able to sit there and have animals a stone's throw away. We managed to see Zebras, Girafe's and Wilderbeast - thought it was kinda cool. One very minor gripe was that there was not a light on the balcony so if you intend to read at night out there think of a different plan. The pool area was fanstasic. My son loved it. A small slide for both the big and little kids ;-) Lots of choice for eating also either casually by the pool or in the more formal restaurants. Some people may say this is expensive for what it is but I do not regret for a second staying there. Disney know how to make your vacation relaxing and I would have no problems recommending this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby, but left off there..”
Reviews.Author: Jacobs-Family
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 3 night stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. I read other reviews before choosing this particular Disney hotel. One stuck out in my mind when we arrived, "Nice Lobby but they left off at the rooms". And it is true. It is definitely the coolest hotel I have ever stayed at, but not the nicest. I felt it was overpriced for what it was and Grand Floridian would of been a better pick for a romantic get-a-way for 2. I suggest staying at a budget hotel and riding the bus over to check out the animals and eat at the african-inspired restaurants. Also staff mis-informed us upon arrival about the magic hours for the park(s). Be sure to double check with the concierge before making a wasted trip over to the theme parks, b/c the lodge is the furthest away.

Reviews.Title: “Great animals, no magic in the staff”
Reviews.Author: noelx4
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at AKL in late May. We were looking forward to it tremendously, but the service we received was awful. It took 3 tries to get a room that was acceptable, and my husband was lectured by the front desk about not reviewing our TA's requests on check in. No one seemed to know anything about the rooms and we just kept getting sent to check things out--the resort is huge and we were dragging two tired little kids. THe second day housekeeping was so bad (toilet dirtier than we left it, used glasses not collected or changed, and dh found a carpet tack with his foot) that the manager who came to see it comped us the night. Standard savannah view room was SMALL, and I kept hitting my ankle with the bathroom door. My 5 yo son was pushed down the water slide by a much older bully, and the lifeguard either didn't notice or didn't intervene. There were lovely things--the lobby is magnificent, and the African staff were wonderful, warm, informative. The animals were also wonderful, and there is nothing to compare with the intimacy of having giraffes outside your window so close you can hear them munching. That was absolutely magical. I liked the room fittings, though the room was small to accommodate them. We had dinner at Boma and it was really good, interesting food, and we had a great server and a good table. I read another reviewer who said the staff was indifferent, and this is my experience exactly. It was no-one's job to make our stay pleasant, and for the money, that's not good enough. Even with being comped a night, it doesn't restore my expectations or give me back the vacation time. I'd rather have paid for the experience I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Soooooo Much FUN!”
Reviews.Author: eme1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights for part of our trip to WDW in a savannah view room. Our two toddlers ages 2.5 yrs and 4.5yrs old were just thrilled with our room and just the hotel itself! Seeing animals right outside our room window was just absolutely amazing for all of us. The restaurants are all very good and worth checking out. The hotel playground was nice and we loved the pool! We most definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For Everyone!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: helen
Reviews.Content: Just returned on sunday 11th,had great time,hotel was nice the room cleaning needs some attention we found a watch and hair accessories in ours and the patio doors and balcony were never cleaned the whole 2 weeks we were there. We arrived to be given room 3345 which was not good(the mosquitos love you here)so straight to reception and asked to be moved,they moved us to room 2315 on the Ashura savannah which was FANTASTIC lots of animals all day long and just along the corridor from reception and everything else great for everyone. We ate in Boma for breakfast and dinner it was great we even had Chelsea manager eating with us on saturday as he and his family were staying at the hotel. Mara was just quick service but good to fill your mugs and right beside the pool. We only used the pool twice for a short time so really cant comment on that apart from the water being hot. All the transport is on your door step and some people have said it takes too long to get to the parks,well the longest journey from the AKL is 15mins. The longest we waited for a bus was from downtown disney which was 30 minutes apart from that you can use the taxis outside all the time or the free telephone for Mears shuttles which is on the porters desk. All in all; we had a great time and would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definatly go back .Thank you for a goo time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Not too far !!”
Reviews.Author: Mina1234
Reviews.Content: I am an experienced Disney Traveler. I have been there too many times to count and have stayed at quite a few of the hotels on property. However, we had not been to this hotel other than to eat at Boma( must do ). I was nervous about the reviews that read " too far" " too remote". But, it was perfect! How can you have you have a relaxing atmosphere and have park madness around you. If you have never been to Disney and want to be saturated in it then don't stay here. But if you want the best of everything Disney has to offer then don't hesitate. The hotel is beautifully themed. They are always animals to see, unless it that's 1/2 hr in the am & pm that they go in. Usually after everyone leaves for the parks in the am. We requested a room close to The Mara. A quick service area that has a bakery, hot food, cold food, etc. We were situated right next to an elevator and viewing area. The viewing area almost felt like an extension of our room. Nice after you put baby to bed. The pool was large although crowded most of the time. And good luck finding a chaise. If I had a negative that would be it. In the evening you can relax around the indoor fire pit. Very relaxing, I almost fell asleep in the chairs there. How may people can say that about their hotel lobby? And there is also the outdoor firepit on a cool evening. As far as transportation goes, the buses were constantly coming through. The ride to any of the parks only took about 5 min. Ironically, our longest wait for a bus was coming from Animal Kingdom park in the middle of the day. At all the properties I've stayed, they all have their bad days with transportation. Have no hesitations about staying here and be sure to get a savanna view room.

Reviews.Title: “Beware AKL's very remote location”
Reviews.Author: dougie-w
Reviews.Content: The Animal Kingdom Lodge is spectacular, it has two fantastic restaurants (Boma and Jikko), and being able to watch zebras and giraffes from your balcony is a unique treat. However, we're sorry we chose it because it is far, far, far from most everything else at Walt Disney World, and by the third day of our six-day Disney vacation, we had already had enough of the exhausting commutes. The Animal Kingdom Lodge is located at the edge of Disney property, so getting to the Magic Kingdom, Downtown Disney, EPCOT and Disney-MGM Studios requires a 15-20 minute bus ride. And, you must also allow for the long, long walk between the hotel's lobby and its bus stops (a distance of about two city blocks) and an up to 20-minute wait for a bus to arrive. One evening, we had a 6 p.m. dinner reservation at the California Grill restaurant atop the Contemporary Resort, a trip requiring a transfer to a second bus. We left our room at 5:15, thinking we were giving ourselves enough time. We were wrong. Because of a traffic jam near the Magic Kingdom, we didn't arrive at the restaurant until 6:15. At least they still honored our reservation. Unbelievably, you must even take a bus from the Animal Kingdom Lodge to the Animal Kingom itself. Previously, we'd stayed at Disney hotels in California and Paris that are located just outside theme park gates, and we assumed it was the same with the AKL and that we would be able to walk into the park. Wrong again! In a major blunder on Disney's part, the hotel has NO easy access to the Animal Kingdom park. In an earlier trip to WDW, we had stayed at the Wilderness Lodge, and in my opinion, its more central location makes it far superior to the AKL. Also, I wonder if the walls are thinner at the AKL. At the Wilderness Lodge, we never heard our neighbors, while at the AKL, we were awakened early on different days by shrieking children in the rooms on either side of ours.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Nice Locale, Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Animal Kindgom Lodge in early May for our Honeymoon. My wife and I have stayed in various hotels within the park during the past 20 years. This was our first time to Animal Kingdom. Our room was initially on a footpath for the pool. Upon explaining that we were on our honeymoon to the staff, we were moved to another section of the hotel...and didn't see anyone in the halls the whole trip!!! The hotel is very large, clean (of course, it's disney) and the staff is attentive. Like most Disney hotels, the food is expensive, but available most the day and night. We didn't pay the Savannah premium, but enjoyed the views from numerous designated areas and the ground level feeding area. Because of the time of year, we didn't wait for rides or buses too long. However, next time we will probably stay in the Contemporary, I haven't stayed there since I was very young. All in all, a good time, we will probably stay there again. More reviews and pics on my blog (-)andy-cooper(-) blog.any-cooper(-)

Reviews.Title: “AKL exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night birthday jaunt to Orlando. Animal Kingdom Lodge was everything that we had anticipated. The amazing views from our Arusha Savannah room (2241) were enjoyed at all times of day. The small patio with 2 chairs and small table was comfortable and nice for watching animals feedings and enjoying a drink. The room was easily accessible from the lobby. Clean and comfortable with more than adequate housekeeping. One small snafu with a floral delivery but other than that the staff were warm and hospitable; especially the staff at Boma and Mara, the two dining areas that we frequented. There was some construction around the pool area but not too annoying. The Disney shuttle buses were always on schedule and we had no complaints re: time to and from the parks, etc. Disney's new 'Magical Express" was somewhat disappointing. We had more than one problem with the new service. If you have the time and $ to decline it, do.

Reviews.Title: “AKL Exceeds Expectations”
Reviews.Author: HogFan1
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights in a Arusha Savannah (Kudu Trail) room; early May. Comfortable and clean room with amazing views of most of the animals on property. Staff we interacted with were lovely, warm, and eager to help (especially Abigail and Sherwin)JAMBO! Greatest expectations more than satisfied. Don't miss Boma for breakfast and dinner. Some construction going on at pool area: jackhammers and saws. Not too bothersome. Buses ran like clockwork to other properties and parks. However, wasn't that impressed with the new "Magical Express" It may have been magical but definately not express. Can't wait to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best different hotel in Disney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from one night stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. Animal Kingdom Lodge was a great choice for us with a 3 year child. We utilized the Magical Express but make sure you bring your stuff needed for the next 4 hours until your bags arrive. The check in was quick and we found the front desk and concierge staff delightful. Our room was small but my daughter enjoyed seeing the animals whenever she wanted making it worth the money. We tried to try the food at the restaurants but the lines were long so we settled for room service. The meals were higher price but you got alot of food for the money. The bus service at the Animal Kingdom Lodge was nice. Waited around 5 minutes. The buses drop you off a WALK away from the entrance. If you have a stroller beware..you'll be standing in the bus. The bar, pool and KID FRIENDLY water slide was GREAT (especially for small children). A lot of staff around for help and supervision. Best "different" hotel in Disney if you love animals and want a break from the "it looks great but it's still just a hotel" experience.

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge was great!”
Reviews.Author: colemanrad
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 night stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. This is our second trip to DisneyWorld in the last 5 years. The first stay was at Wilderness Lodge which was excellent. We wanted to try a new resort. AK Lodge was a good fit for us with children ages, 7 and 10. We utilized the Magical Express which worked out well. The bus delivered us to our resort after a less than 5 minute wait to board. We were warned ahead of time about bringing our necessities in our carry on bags and were prepared. It does take 2-3 hours for your checked bags to arrive. We had requested a savanna view room close to the lobby and all was as expected. Check in was quick and contrary to other reviews I found the front desk and concierge staff very helpful. Our room was small but similar in size to Wilderness Lodge. It had a queen bed and bunk beds. We honestly were not in the room except to sleep. I think the price is somewhat high and you are paying for the savanna view so make sure you get it. My children enjoyed seeing the animals every morning before we got going. Having said that, if I did not have children I would stay elsewhere as it probably isnt worth the $$. In our situation, we wanted to try something new and the kids loved it. The food options are good but expensive. We didnt try Jikos but ate at Bomas for breakfast twice and dinner once. Make sure you have reservations because the lines were long even at 9 am. We watied 30 minutes for dinner even with priority seating. There were several couples without reservations who waited 90 minutes. The food was good but nothing spectacular and I didnt feel worth the cost. However, I havent felt many of the restaurant options at Disney are woth the cost. In fact the best meal we had was at the Hoop Di Du Review which I strongly recommend. Buffet BBQ and a really great show. The bus service at AKL was quite good. Never had to wait more than 10 minutes except for one glaring exception, MGM park. We waited 30-45 minutes for that bus. As I found it, even though the bus looks the same as the other Disney buses, it is run by MGM and I believe they have less buses. The buses to Epcot, and Magic kingdom were plentiful. In summary, AKL was a nice hotel with a great pool, lobby, and savanna. The rooms are small but nice. I would recommend it but only with people for small children and I will probably try a different hotel when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Let Down!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have always received the best when it comes to Disney. We spent our first night at the Grand Floridian and it was incredible. GREAT GREAT GREAT! We spent our second night at the Animal Kingdom Lodge and paid an additonal $100.00 for the night over the Grand Floridian. Major dissapointment.!!! The room was only average. The hotel lobby was impressive but it stopped there for us. Our room was on a top floor offering very little view of anything but a fenced service area. We asked the desk to move us for almost the $500.00 per night, they said no view was any better then what we had. The room was clean and the hotel was clean. The staff was very friendly as you would expect from Disney. We also attempted to swim in the pool and found the water to be cold and not heated. This hotel failed to meet our needs in each area and we will never be back to it. It will be only the hotels around the Magic Kingdom for us in the future. We recognize the greatness of Disney and it was our mistake for selecting this hotel. We were looking to do something different. We did!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday at thre AKL!”
Reviews.Author: fishersmead
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the AKL from 29th March to 12th April, with our 2 kids aged 4 & 6. We had a really fab time and were very impressed with the hotel. We have stayed at lots of Disney properties, including Wilderness Lodge (where we got married!) All Star resorts, Port Orleans and Caribbean beach and the AKL was definately the best! We got upgraded free to a savannah view but to be quite honest you can see the animals all over the lodge anyway and we just didn't really sit on the balcony much! Yes the rooms are fairly small and quite dark, but on a disney holiday how much time are you in your room anyway? We ate in Jikos twice and both meals were superb, really special. I can't understand why people are complaining about the service, we had no problems whatsoever, the staff were always polite and helpful, especially the concierge staff and the housekeeper (our daughter was sick on the first night and the beds were changed immediately) The only downside was the lodge is quite a way from the parks and downtown disney so the trek on the bus is quite long if you don't have a car. having said that we never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus to come along! The hotel architechture is quite stunning and we had loads of fun looking for all the hidden mickeys! We had a great time and would definately return to the lodge, if you love disney you will love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Like being on Safari”
Reviews.Author: lorri63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge as part of the Land & Sea Package for the Disney Cruise. As such, you stay in a savanah view room, and what a view it was. To wake up every day and see Giraffes, Zebras, and Water Buffalo and many other animals roaming outside your window, is absolutely breathtaking. Even the view of the back of the hotel was lovely at sunrise. My children where so excited to go out on the balcony and see what was roaming by our room. I was leery that there would be an odor coming off of the savannah but not once did I smell any kind of odor. The savannah was just as clean as the rooms. Absolutely impeccable! The service at this hotel was supreme and they just couldn’t do enough for you. Contrary to what I read online about requesting bunk beds, we requested bunk beds and we received them. Every room is equipped with a refrigerator so there was no need to request one. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable…I will attest to the fact that it is a dark hotel though. I am told that it is this way to conform to the likes of Africa, so I knew what to expect before I arrived. The only thing I would advise is that there is truth to the fact that some of the rooms are a far walk from the lobby but if that doesn’t matter to you, then this is a beautiful hotel to stay at. As for the dining, we didn’t have the opportunity to dine at Jiko but we did dine at Boma twice for breakfast and once for dinner, it is one of my husbands favorite restaurants even when we do not stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “good african themed hotel”
Reviews.Author: beach47
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 11 yr old daughter, and I stayed at the AKL during spring break. We stayed in a savannah facing room. Initially, I was disappointed with the room because I was expecting the greens of the savannah, but I got a different part of the savannah (which looked more like a parking lot to me). I made a request to change the room to one that looked out toward the arusha savannah, and the staff was very accomodating with the request...so we moved after a day. The savannah facing room was great in that you saw animals on and off during the day. However, my husband thought there should have been more animals kept on the property......they move around a lot, so sometimes you may not see any. Still, it was a treat to watch them when they were there. As far as the staff, I have to agree with some of the previous reviews. They will try to accomodate your needs (sometimes), but they are not very friendly or very helpful. We went to the concierge a couple of times for restaurant reservations and directions around Orlando, and they were not helpful at all. They will only do the bare minimum if they have to. They will not go above and beyond and give you more information than you need, and you're lucky if you have someone smile at you. I had gone to them about 3 times, and each time I walked away with no more information than I already had. Having said that, the staff that checks you in for the airline is exceptional. The service was smooth and very professional. The staff at Jiko is also very nice. The food at Boma and Jiko was very good, but I would stay away from the room service. We didn't like any of the vegetarian dishes on it, but the service was prompt and courteous. Overall, it was a good hotel...very beautiful. I don't think it rates a premium hotel level, but it is definetely a deluxe level hotel, and considering it was peak spring break season, they still did a good job with everything.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms and the service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms were great, we had a savannah view and to wake up in the morning and walk outside on your balcony and feel like you were on an African Plain was awesome. Also, the food and service was great! We ate in our room and we also ate in the hotel restaurants and the service was great. I cannot wait to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “what a dump checked out early”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to disney with my family and stayed at the animal kingdon lodge because a friend loved it. I had to move 3 time the first day due to dirty rooms and springs coming out of the bed! The staff was a joke! The front desk staff were not friendly or smart! The pool walls were all slime! It smelled badly out side and in. The inside lobby was wonderful....What happend to the rooms?? Why couldnt the rooms and pool area be wonderful too ? I have stayed in highway motels cleaner then this place!!! We ended up going home a day early because we could not take it! Then, I recieved my credit card bill and I was over charged around 800.00$$$$$$$$$$$$ I will never go back to this Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised with the room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned home from a 5 night trip to Disney. I have to admit right up front that Disney is not my favorite destination, but this time was really nice. My husband and I traveled with our 9y/o daughter, 2 teenaged sons, and one of their girlfriends. Past experience with staying on property, I recall VERY small rooms, and just an all in all feeling of chaos throught the resort. The Animal Kingdom Lodge was a pleasant surprise. The lobby was beautiful with plenty of seating available, and I felt a sense of peaceful excitement in the air. We got 2 rooms, separating the boys and the girls, and the man at the front desk worked very hard to ensure that we had ajoining rooms. I have a handicap which affords me little comfortable walking, so we were also given a set of rooms that were central to the lobby, pool, and restaurants. I was also given a wheelchair, courtesy of the Lodge to use for our stay..Check-in went well...then off to the rooms. Again, a pleasant surprise...the rooms were quite spacious, and beautifully decorated (even the bathrooms!) There was a refridgerator, iron&board,coffee pot,hairdryer, and a porta-crib. What else could we ask for? The balcony, as promised, allowed us to see so many animals up close and in their environment...it was cool! I was a tad disappointed in the pool...I thought it looked better in the pictures than it really was, but it was ok. Dining was also not my cup of tea. Thank God for the burgers, salads...at Mara, cuz the other two restaurants srved food with an African twist that I just did not enjoy. The rest of my family, however, enjoyed their meals immensly Would I go back? Yes. The people there were always pleasant and helpful, and the hotel on the whole was lovely. I feel it works for anyone who says there...families, newlyweds, seniors...there really is something for everyone. It was one of our best Disney vacations, due in large part to the AKL!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected from Disney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Though our trip started out rough, it ended wonderfully. The hotel was different than expected per the information I received through the travel agent. The animals are well taken care of and the facility grounds are awesome - except the savanah view. The staff was pleasant, though less than enthused about concerns or complaints, not at all what I expected of Disney, especially for the expense. Though a survey card was sent, I tried to gain access and was denied, thus these comments.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth It”
Reviews.Author: ukrednek
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel for 7 nights early april. We thought the facilities were very good, especially by family resort standards. The pool was extremely child friendly with the graduated walk-in entry point (sun beds there are hard to come by, but we managed). Food at the resort was again very good by family resort standards and disney standards. Boma for breakfast is by far the best Disney breakfast and Jiko would be worth the trip in NY or London. I read complaints about not seeing the animals (we stayed in 4381), but we had no such issues. We had a constant stream of wildebeast, giraffe, zebra, eland and various bird species. One bit of advise on the rooms, it can be quite a walk to some of the rooms. Our room was on the very end of one of the wings, but despite the walk, we preferred as I think it may have given a little better view of the animals and we also did not have a stream of people coming by our room.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother With Savannah View”
Reviews.Author: the3ds
Reviews.Content: As Florida residents, we are lucky to go to Disneyworld every other month. We always stay on Disney property and decided to splurge for my husband's 41st Birthday. We made reservations at the Rose & Crowne Pub in England (Epcot) and then reserved a savannah room at the AKL. We had previously toured the AKL at Christmastime and thought the resort is the most magnificent of all Disney hotels. We have always wanted to go to Africa and until then, we were willing to settle for the next best thing. The theming of the hotel is amazing. Tribal shields for chandeliers and the thatched roof are just some of the awe-inspiring details of the hotel. We upgraded to a savannah view room and though we had views of the savannah, the animals we saw were only bongos, an okapi and ducks. Now, I know that we should be impressed by bongos and okapis and we know that they are from Africa, but we were hoping for the "biggies" (giraffes, zebras, etc). The publicity photos and in-room commercials make it seem like the animals are all over the hotel grounds, but in reality, they hang out mostly in the center (by the lobby and viewing area). We could have saved a lot of money by getting a regular room and then heading down to the lobby area for viewing and photo opportunities (which we did anyway). One thing that was totally unexpected was the restaurant Jiko. My husband made reservations for what he thought was Boma, but we ate at Jiko instead. What a great mistake! The food was the best I've eaten at Disneyworld. We really splurged for appetizers, main course and desert plus after dinner tea and loved every minute of it. Our 3-year-old daughter ordered a pb&j sandwich which came with rainbow-colored bread. The beautiful decorations (a flock of birds) hang above the seating area and the wall changes color to imitate an African suset. Don't miss Jiko when you stay here! It was the highlight of our trip. The AKL was the first deluxe Disney resort that we have stayed at. While it was a nice stay and the hotel is simply magnificent, we would not have made a savannah view reservation. It didn't seem worth the significantly extra money when we had to go to the lobby to see the giraffes and zebras anyway. If you have the extra money and you can afford one of the centrally located savannah view rooms, then you should do it. For our family, we would rather stay somewhere a little less expensive and then splurge for a nice dinner or extra souvenirs.

Reviews.Title: “One Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The AKL last year just for a one night as a special treat. We chose this one as it seemed the most unusual and diffrent off all the Disney Resorts. Although check-in wasn't untill 4 we arrived early as my husband was feeling unwell, and they managed to fit us in to a room around 2PM after a 45 min wait(in the spectacular lobby)The rooms are amazing in themselves, and well cleaned. Sitting out on your balcony looking at the animals was amazing, and i could of stayed out there all night. The pool area was really nice too and well supervised by life-guards. We also ordered room service which was rather expensive (but we expected it would be) The food took around 30 mins to arrive and was well served and presented but generally i was not impressed with the quality.
