Over all the hotel was well worth the one night stay- i would recommend it to others. It would be nice to stay there again, but on a personal level i would like to try some other Disney Resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay at the AKL!”
Reviews.Author: flygirla
Reviews.Content: My husband, 4 year old daughter and I enjoyed our stay at this hotel! First, the hotel is absolutely beautiful and wonderful to look at. There's quite a few kids activities every day, although we never used any of them. We requested a Savannah room and had animals right outside our balcony the entire four days we were there. The look on our daughter's face when she saw the animals everyday was priceless. Check-in was a breeze and only took 10 minutes- the staff was always very helpful and friendly. Since there are only elevators on one side of the hotel, it was a little walk to get to our room every day- that was not a problem for us as we needed the exercise. The pool is very large and has a fun slide for the kids. Also, there are 3 lifeguards on duty at all times. Buses to and from the parks ran frequently so that the longest wait we had was 15 minutes. As far as the food goes, it is quite expensive, but hey, it's Disney. We had lunch at Mara and dinner at Jiko which was excellent. Other diners told us that Boma was very good. All-in-all, this hotel provided us with a great time at Disneyworld! We would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: ashleyswestyn
Reviews.Content: We took a trip for our wedding anniversary here back in september and it was wonderful!!!! The pictures of this resort does not do it justice! We had originally booked a standard view room but when we got there we had found out we had been upgraded at no cost to a savannah view room. We had a beautiful view of the animals. If we woke up early enough in the morning we would get to see the giraffes eating. The pool and the hot tub were really fun and relaxing. Bus transportation to this resort is nice because it has its own bus and goes to no other resorts. We absolutely loved this vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge made our disney trip extra special”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved the Animal Kingdom Lodge, highly recommend to anyone with below teenage kids. My husband and I travelled with our 8 year old daughter, who loved seeing the animals. We stayed on the 3rd floor overlooking the Sunset Savannah and saw animals no matter what time of day we were out on the balcony. The pool was lovely, three lifeguards on duty all the time, towels were abundant and easy to get. Food in all the restaurants was good, particulalry liked Jiko for evening meals, Mara was good for a quick meal after a busy day. We liked the hotel so much we spent two days of out two week trip just relaxing and enjoying the pool and the animals. Lots going on to keep the kids entertained from crafts at the poolside or in the lobby, to mini safaris and drum workshops. Plenty of African cast members about to tell you anything you wanted to know about the artifacts and animals. Rooms not too dark and adequately sized, staff couldn't have been more helpful, even with our tricky requests. Well Done AKL, thumbs up!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Views-Great Theming-Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for 6 nights on February 15-21st of 2006. We had a wonderful time and really enjoyed the AKL. We had just come from 6 nights at the Grand Floridian, and had read all the reviews that said AKL was dark, rooms were small and location was far. We did not find any of this to be an issue. We had booked a savannah view room, but we were upgraded to a deluxe savannah, which meant the room was slightly larger. The rooms weren't huge, but it would due for the 2 of us. And it was about the same size as our room at GF. I guess of their were 4 people, it might be a bit tight. We didn't have an issue with the lighting in the room at all, it was fine. As for the location of the resort, we never waited long to go anywhere, and I really didn't find it inconvenient. The buses were always there for all four parks and Downtown disney within a reasonable time. We didn't find it any different or longer than waiting for a bus to get back to GF (from Animal Kingdom to GF is probably the same amount of time as it is to get from Magic Kingdom to AKL). As for the hotel itself, the lobby is AMAZING. If you don't stay there, you have to visit to see that. The view of the animals from our room never got old! It's great to eat breakfast on your balcony and watch zebras and giraffes! We never swam in the pool, but it looked really nice. As for dining, Boma is the BEST in all of Disney. A great buffet with very different food, but very good food! We loved it! The counter service place, Mara was just ok, nothing special and we did get bored of that quickly. And unlike Grand Floridian's Gasparilla Grill, the Mara was NOT open 24 hours. (It's nice to come back to the hotel after midnight and fill up on your free soda!) Jiko is the fancy restaurant and it was exquisite. We had a wonderful dining experience there, but it isn't for everyone, the dishes are different and expensive. I wouldn't recommend taking small children there! We had a very easy time with our check in and check out, and we were able to give our luggage and check in at AKL for the airport, we got ourboarding passes and everything. Very easy. Also, there is a great place to watch the animals at night, and the provide you with night vision goggles. The people who work that are very knowledgeable on the animals and most of them are here from Africa. ONe guy ran his own real safari expedition and was telling us about it! They are so nice-definitely take the time to talk to them about the animals and their lives! The only issues we had with the hotel at all was at the end. We asked for a later check out, and they told us we could extend by an hour (noon) but then the lady on the phone told us to call back the next day to see if they could extend another hour. So we called back on the day of our check out and the person who answered said "We don't do late check outs. CLICK. So I called back and explained that we already had it and we were told to call back and the person said we should consider ourselves lucky to get that because they have a "Rooms Ready policy" for all guests arriving. She was pretty rude about it but that's about the worst experience we had in 6 nights, so not too bad. I would stay here again, if not just for the wonderful views of the animals, much better than the safari at the park because it goes by so fast. If you love watching animals at a leisurely pace, this is a great hotel to be in! And the theming is outstanding! My husband and I really enjoyed our time there and we are sad to be back home.

Reviews.Title: “Disney World is awesome, the AKL is not”
Reviews.Author: Fishbone0701
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the AKL after reading several reviews and the subtle but convincing sales pitch by the disney reservationists. The experience at the parks were awesome and the Disney Dining Plan was well worth every penny. However, if you are staying at the AKL with the impression that it is phenomenally better than the moderate price resorts, you are in for a rude awankening. The rooms are extremely small and every single staff member at the front desk proved to be rude or unhelpful. We booked two rooms with king beds and we checked in duringa non-peak time and were staying for 8 nights. THe person at the front desk even said the hotel was only half full. Did we get one room with a king bed? No. He said that the rooms were already assigned and he could not change it. The room was the smallest room I have ever stayed in and then luggage for two adults and a two year old (with the stuff you bring for a two year old) made it so cramped in the room that you couldn't even move. The housekeeper knocked at 8:00 every morning no matter what sign you had on the door. I also had one front desk person hang up on me when I called to resolve an issue that disney dining said could be resolved by someone at the front desk. There are more things I can go on about but luckily the parks made up for the poor lodging experience. I most likely will never stay on property ever again and if I do, it will definitely not be at the AKL.

Reviews.Title: “See all the animals in a day or two and then go to the Floridian or Polynesian”
Reviews.Author: ChrisMontvale
Reviews.Content: Our family consisting of mom, dad and two boys, age eight and five, recently returned from a weekend at Disney’s Animal Kingdom Lodge. We had a standard savannah view room with two queen beds and the requisite balcony overlooking Disney’s version of an African savannah. For the past several years we have stayed at the Polynesian because of its location on the monorail and the volcano pool that the kids love. The boys are both crazy for animals, so we decided to give the Animal Kingdom Lodge a try for a quick weekend getaway. I am very pragmatic when it comes to Disney resorts. Deluxe has its own meaning at Disney and people should get used to it. Deluxe at Disney relates to the price and convenience to attractions. A Deluxe Disney resort is not on par with a Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton. Set your standards at Hilton or Marriott and you will probably be right on target. That being said, I don’t quite get all the breathless and syrupy reviews about Disney properties. I am very suspicious of reviews that use terms like “magical” or wonderful” as either being from Disney shills, those who are very easy to please, or those who delude themselves into believing this “trip of a lifetime” was magical and wonderful experience. My family and I have had some very nice times at Disney resorts, the boys even go as far as to say great times. This, however, is due to the major attractions like the parks and the pools, not the size of the suite or room or the caliber of service. Although the “cast members” who work at the resorts may have went out of their way in the past to make a visit “magical”, today they are just run of the mill resort hotel employees. The Animal Kingdom lodge delivers what it promises. We saw plenty of animals from our balcony and the viewing points around the sprawling hotel. Our room was clean and in good condition, a typical Marriott or Hilton hotel room with two queen beds, television, small table and balcony. It was the kids delight in watching giraffes and antelope from the balcony while they ate breakfast that made the Animal Kingdom Lodge worth the price of admission. They also enjoyed the pool and the modest water slide at the pool. It was a unique experience to watch flamingos being fed while taking a break from swimming in the pool. I have read comments about lighting in the rooms and foul odors. The rooms are darker than average but not so much so that it bothered us or inhibited any normal activity. We did not notice any foul odors in our room. However, this is a hotel that is smack in the middle of what amounts to a zoo. There, of course, are going to be animal odors. The only place I took note of them was by the flamingo pond near the pool. You might want to pick a chaise on the other side of the pool from the flamingos. I would not recommend the Animal Kingdom as the place to stay if you plan to visit the other parks at Disney. The Lodge is just too far away from everything else. Although Disney and the true believers tout the bus system, the truth is that I waited 25 minutes for an Animal Kingdom bus at the end of a long day at the Magic Kingdom with the 5 year old and then the trip took an additional 15 minutes. This is not the same as jumping on the monorail or one of the ferries and being back at the Polynesian or the Floridian in 10 minutes. This amount of travel time inhibits your flexibility to leave and return during the course of the day. However, if you are going to take full advantage of the Lodge and the nearby Animal Kingdom Park, this could be a good place to stay. Be prepared to walk a long distance to your room and to wait 10 to 15 minutes for registration. Also, the pool area seems to fill up quickly, so get a family member there early to reserve some of those chaises (far from the flamingo pond).

Reviews.Title: “AKL is excellent!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ssbbcc
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as the "land" part of our 3 night land/4 night sea package w/ Disney. It was a terrific choice. We had a room on the 2nd floor overlooking the savannah. We saw plenty of animals, any time of the day. In the morning, there were always eblands and zebra out munching on the grass. We happened to be in the room in the early afternoon and saw the zoo keepers cleaning the area and replinishing food. Three giraffes followed them around constantly, and it was hilarious to watch. In the early evening and into nightfall, there were always more giraffes, eblands, zebras, and these cattle-like creatures with humongous horns (I can't recall their name). The pool areas and the spa were also very nice. The lobby is gorgeous, and plenty of room so we didn't really notice all the small children who can get annoying in very small spaces. We didn't take advantage of any of the other services at the hotel - we spent most of the rest of our time in the Disney parks. I would DEFINATELY stay here again!!! The previous reviews I read here were pretty accurate - the rooms are a little dark, and the African motif is distinct, but we loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice visit!”
Reviews.Author: sswagner
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to a Disney Deluxe resort. We have stayed at off site and the All-Star Movies resort on previous visits. Here, we stayed for 3 nights during the Spring Break period. First and foremost, I highly recommend getting a savannah view room. There are common overlook areas near the lobby, however we had our best viewing experiences from the balcony on our second floor room. I must confess we were fortunate to be at the very end of the "Zebra Trail" corridor. Even though it was a long walk to get there, we found ourselves with a view of TWO savannahs. Our room was on the very end, so one side of the balcony offered a view to the end of one savannah while the main lookout extended towards the "Uzima" savannah. We saw many animals, especially in the afternoon. The grounds are well kept and the animals are closely monitored by the staff at various times. The rooms were not so brightly lit, but were adequate for reading. There was a mini-fridge in there for our drinks. The room size was not large, but it did not concern me as I preferred to spend time either on the balcony or in the theme parks with my wife and nephew. We all enjoyed the Mara cafeteria setup (one of three places to eat at the AKL), which is where we chose to eat on property. Those who enjoy full service would like the Jiko restaurant. The Boma is a buffet setup. The pool is outstanding, and towels are provided for the guests there. The pool has a zero depth entry, a water slide, and 1 adjacent wading pool and 2 spas. There is also a savannah overlook behind the pool--likely one will see the flamingos. The lobby is as amazing as the others have stated. Service was good, and the staff is ready to assist guests with questions that they may have. There are many people who can give information about the animals as well. For transportation, we used the Disney Magical Express from Orlando Airport. We did not have to wait long to leave the airport, however I do recommend bringing things you want in the next 5-6 hours (swimsuits?) in your carry-on luggage. Bus transportation is very frequent to the theme parks and Downtown Disney. Indeed the hotel is expensive, however I do not regret the decision to try it. In my opinion, the ability to view animals outside your private balcony is the number one reason why people come here. The hotel is appropriate for people of all ages, however those who enjoy viewing animals such as giraffes, zebras, and bongos would most enjoy this unique opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “A Taste of Africa”
Reviews.Author: adrianhobson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the AK Lodge for a few days in March after a Disney Cruise. Its a destination hotel rather than a place to stay while visiting the parks. We stayed in a standard room with a pool view. If you're fascinated by the "wildlife", as we were, the Savannah rooms are probably worth the extra. However, even with a standard view its easy enough to walk to the end of the corridor early in the morning to watch giraffe and zebra feed at dawn. Its also possible to walk down to various overlooks to get an even closer view. I was told that at night there are staff at the overlooks with Night Vision Goggles but didn't test this out. What was very pleasant was the outdoor "campfire" around which guests could sit and relax. First impressions of the hotel are good with an imposing African themed lobby. Check in was quick and painless although some rooms are a long walk from the lobby. Our family room for 2 adults and 2 kids had a bunk and queen. Decor could be considered a little dark but is entirely in keeping with the theme. Kids are kept happy by the range of educational activities on offer. Its a great place to inform kids about conservation issues - despite the obvious contradictions of energy and resource consumption during international travel and tourism! There is a good choice of restaurants. Theres also the Mara foodcourt which can help keep your budget on track. The pool is a good size with a small slide to entertain the kids. Towels and changing rooms are provided poolside and there are several spas. The area is very attractive with the thatched roof of the hotel on one side and the Savannah on the other. A perfect place to spend the afternoon sunbathing and hot tubbing. Disney bus transportation to other parks is excellent with short rides to AK theme park and Blizzard Beach. Since AKL is to the far West of Disneyworld some of the other parks and Downtown Disney can be a longish ride but we never had to wait more than 10 mins to travel in either direction. This is an excellent destination hotel. Next time we'll make sure we spend all our time here and overnight in cheaper hotels while we're visiting the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kellyfromohio
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge during April, 2005 and had a wonderful time. The lodge is very large with lots of things to do. The architecture is amazing and the whole place is themed to the max. This hotel has four "extensions" which spread out from the main lobby area and then each of these extensions has "blocks" of rooms which seem to go on endlessly. We reserved a deluxe savannah view room, which I understand are slightly larger than regular savannah view and are located on the 5th or 6th floors. We requested that the room be near the pool if possible, and our request was met. The room was on the Zebra Trail portion of the hotel and was immaculately clean, with a breathtaking view of one of the savannahs right from our balcony (there are 3 different savannahs at the hotel, each having some animals unique to them). The savannahs can also be viewed from many spots around the lodge, but why not have your own private viewing spot from your balcony. Some people have commented that the rooms are small, but they did not seem too bad to me - a typical hotel room size. There are loads of things to do at this hotel including activities for the kids during the day and evenings (get an event schedule near the front desk), viewing the animals and learning about them from the knowledgeable staff, swimming, arcade, and a nice lounge for the adults. The hotel has a very large zero-depth pool with a fun but not-so-large water slide, a small playground, and plenty of places to relax in the sun. There are two on-site restaurants, Jiko and Boma, and a large well-stocked food court. We did not eat at Jiko although we would have liked to - it looked very impressive. We did, however, eat at Boma, and it was quite an experience. Boma is a buffet-style, all-you-can-eat restaurant that is not noisy and bustling like most buffets. The food is African influenced and too varied to even begin to explain. Make sure you get Priority Seating (which I would suggest for all Disney restaurants). The only down-point of this lodge is the location, which is quite a distance from the parks. The buses run regularly, but it can take as long as 1/2 hour to get to the Magic Kingdom (wait time not included). There is no other form of transportation to the parks from this resort other than buses, so I would assume that having a car would be an advantage. This lodge is closest to the Animal Kingdom and Blizzard Beach. If you plan on spending most of your time at the Magic Kingdom you may want to consider my #1 pick at Disney so far--the Polynesian. I would rank the Animal Kingdom Lodge a close second to the Poly, and will soon experience the Beach Club and Port Orleans Riverside. We have visited the Grand Floridian, Contemporary, Wilderness Lodge, and Boardwalk and so far like the Polynesian and Animal Kingdom Lodge best. I always suggest to anyone planning a trip to Disney....do your research. This is a very large place and it is immensely helpful to know as much you can about it before arriving. It will make your vacation so much more enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!! What an experience!”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Traveler_MN
Reviews.Content: On our first visit to Walt Disney World, we chose to stay at Animal Kingdom Lodge and were NOT disappointed in the least. The atmosphere made our trip even more exotic. The lobby is beautifully appointed and the African background music was wonderful. When we arrived a table was set up with a cast member discussing their home country of Botswana. And the week was filled with other such educational opportunities. Viewpoints and seats for viewing the animals are hidden all over the grounds with surprising opportunities to see the wildlife. And see we did--giraffes (lots, even a baby), hoof stock, zebras, and a wide variety of birds. The hotel staff were very knowledgeable on the wildlife and were genuinely pleased to answer questions and offer interesting information. Whether morning, afternoon or evening, searching for the animals was a must-do! Our room overlooked the swimming pool and was tidy and full of interesting things. The housekeeping staff did an exemplary job, and left a few little personal touches for us (a towel man, which my children--8 and 11-- loved and set up for her every morning). We received marvelous customer service from check in to check out. The concierge and bell staff were friendly and helpful. At check in, the staff provided us with all of the necessary information and few surprises that we were not aware of through booking our vacation through Walt Disney World resorts. The swimming pool area is nicely designed and the pool was well enjoyed! Towel service is available and the towels are placed all around the pool. There are 2 hot tubs and lots of place to explore around the pool area. The restaurants (Mara, Boma and Jiko) were very enjoyable. Even the picky eater tried a few new things and the adventurous one had a heyday with all of the interesting food! Mara (cafeteria style) provided us with a wide variety of breakfast food, which included pastries, cereal, fresh fruit, and hot food. In fact, we ate breakfast there every day! Boma (the African market buffet) was busy but very enjoyable. The variety of foods were visually appealing and delicious. The wait staff offered us a couple of "must trys" and they were well worth the adventure. We had reservations and arrived at a busy time, but were seated as soon as was possible. The atmosphere alone was enough to make the wait worth it! Jiko (sit down restaurant) was so wonderful that we ate there twice! We had reservations and were seated promptly! The food was delicious, widely varied and beautifully presented. What was even better is that the upscale menu provided a unique variety of options for the younger diners without compromising the enjoyment of a "grown up" restaurant. Along with the standard grilled cheese and macaroni and cheese was the option of salmon or steak. Both of which were well enjoyed by our children! The wait staff was friendly and helpful and introduced us to a few foods that we would not have considered trying but truly enjoyed!! We were very sad that we were out of vacation days as we had not exhausted their delicious menu. Animal Kingdom Lodge and our vacation through Walt Disney Resorts was far better that we could have even imagined and we will most definitely do it AGAIN!!! The perks involved with booking through Disney made our holiday effortless and one that we will talk and laugh about forever! In the words of the children: "THe animals were COOL!" "Our room was so fun, so was the pool." "That was the COOLEST vacation EVER!!!" "I want to eat at Jiko again!" And Mom and Dad echo those same sentiments! Especially the one that states "I wish that we were there now!!!" (since it is snowy and 20 in Northern Minnesota!)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Animal Lodge”
Reviews.Author: TNTravelChick
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent I had visited most of the parks but had choosen to stay at Animal Lodge for my next visit. The resort is so different and interesting that you could enjoy the resort itself for a vacation without the parks! We took advantage of the food court often for a quick, inexpensive meal option. Loved sitting out watching the savannah. Very relaxing way to waste the day away. Service was wonderful. Only complaint is kinda big deal. My bed needed replacing. I am very bed sensitive and this one did not meet my standards. There were no comment cards that I could find to let them know that the bed had lived its life & was ready to be gone. After a full day at the parks each day it did not prevent me from sleeping but a hotel of this level should have better beds. But on a positive note, we had a wonderful time and cant wait to go back next year when we will try the Wilderness Lodge!

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: travlnmompa
Reviews.Content: Great hotel!!! Concierge level a must when traveling with small children (ages 3 & 4). We spent a lot of time in this lounge area eating drinking and relaxing. Well worth the extra money and the kids loved the disney cartoons and being able to go to breakfast in their pj's. The rooms were spotless and we fit 5 very comfortably. Being on the concierge level you also don't have to deal with the front desk which seemed to always be crowded. I even needed to get a prescription filled and the concierge handled it no problem with out any wait. Some of the appetizers were flavored with curry so we didn't always like the food selection but there was always one thing that everyone would like. The kids loved the chicken fingers and pb&j. They would have 4 different wines and miller lite, michaelobe, and a specialty beer every evening wich was great. You have to try JIKKO if you are looking for fine dining, it was fabulous. The say there is a dress code but there were many people in jeans. Buses ran very effeciently except the Downtown disney bus. Waited 25 min both times we took it. Never waited more than 10 for the others and it was usually less than 5 min. Would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “loved every second.”
Reviews.Author: lcuibelloxo
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel a while ago, but i have been using this site for y upcomming travels, so i wanted to give my opinion. Originally my family and i were to stay at Port Orleans, but FORTUNALLy construction was going on and we were upgraded to Animal Kingdom Lodge. It was as close to Africa as im going to get anytime soon. We loved the view in the morning and at night. Watching giraffes eat and other animals roam- it was pure beauty. Our favorite restaurant was Boma. THe buffet had food from all over. The steaks with spiccy flavoring and different tastes were out of the world. The pool was just as nice, and in walking distance thre were flamingos. The slide was a good addition to family fun. Overall, if you stay at Disney. Please stay here. It is a wonderfull experience. While the other hotels are just hotels.. this is wonders of nature.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the animals but didn't love the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brobs72
Reviews.Content: From the time we got off the "Magic Express" bus at the Animal Kingdom Lodge our trip was destined for disaster. Our bus driver caught his foot on the side of the stairs getting off the bus and fell off and hit his head on the cement. As soon as we got off the bus and started to scream for help-it looked like the staff was moving in slow motion to help him and that they had no plan of emergency in cases like this. It looked like they were taking there own sweet time to help him as he lay out cold on the cement. It felt like it took forever before we heard sirens from the ambulance. So from the beginning there was an apathetic feel in the air as we began our 4 day trip at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. As we checked in and told our saga to the woman at the front desk (we were physically shaking from the trauma of what we had just seen) the woman said, wow I didn't know that happened and proceeded to tell us what room we were in. No customer service or empathy was shown here, either! We stayed in a room overlooking the "Giraffe" area of the Savanna. The room was small and dark-for a very high price. The room was dirty and a plastic spoon that had been left from the last guest that was still sitting there on the carpet untouched by housekeeping. The shower was disgusting with nasty stuff on the walls that was also left untouched all week. Our beds were rapidly made up where there were wrinkles all through them like a child had run in and threw the sheets up and over the pillows. The food in the buffet (Boma's) was so expensive that we opted to go to the cafeteria the rest of the week for breakfast instead of paying $42 for two people to have a buffet breakfast and coffee! Our experience at their signature restaurant was good- the food was amazing-but the service suffered as it seemed that our waitress had no interest in the idea of chit chat or pleasantries with customers and breezed in and out throughout our dinner. We did see a little lone Giraffe each afternoon outside our balcony who was lured to a point where we could see him eat a snack and then would leave by 4:30. But that was the only giraffe we could see from our balcony. So needless to say, we will not be going there, I do not recommend the Animal Kingdom Lodge due the its severe lack of empathy, good judgement in an emergency situation, (which after asking other bus drivers and staff had no idea of the condition of the bus driver who had gotten hurt) awful housekeeping and terrible customer service. If this is the most high end Disney can offer a customer, then it is a sign of where customer service and quality are now ranking with them.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every dime you spend”
Reviews.Author: tinytots2
Reviews.Content: We just had a " Grand Gathering" at Animal Kingdom Lodge Feb 22 thru the 28th. It was great!!! It is worth every dime you spend. We thought the food was great at both Boma and Jiko restaurants, the kids loved the "cafe" diner. The pool is very kid friendly and the lifeguards are OUTSTANDING!! Their eyes never leave the pool areas and when we saw one of them jump in to get a child, the rotation of coverage was like clock work... Plus the water slide wsa fun. Pool is heated and we ran back and forth to the pool and the hot tub. I never saw in any reviews anyone mentioning that you can check your luggage straight thru on your way home. I was a little skeptical, however all 8 pieces made it back to NYC. To wake up in the am and see all of the animals from your balcony was GREAT and the look on the kids eyes was awesome..

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place”
Reviews.Author: Magal65
Reviews.Content: My family really enjoyed the Animal Kingdom Lodge. I saw a reviewer say that a family of four doesn't get a bunk bed room. My family of four did. We also got a free upgrade that we did not request. I booked a standard room hoping to enjoy the animals from the hallway viewing areas. When we checked in we were told that if it was ok with us, we'd be put in a savannah room. Of course! We were able to check in at 11:00 am and were told the hotel was booked solid so that may have made a difference. The room I will say was a bit dusty but the bath was not moldy and the beds were clean. The mattresses are very firm (I sometimes have to sleep on the floor at places) so to my husband and me it was very comfortable. Others might find them hard. The ambience is A+ and the food is wonderful. Housekeeping people just ok but the rest of the staff were great. If there's a tropical downpour it's a great hotel to hang around and get an education about African countries. The pool is huge with usually three lifeguards on duty and two more doing odd jobs around the area which is great when you have kids. It has a zero entry area which is like walking into a lake and is great for the toddler set. I would stay again when at Disney and will always at least visit when at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge: Truly dark and interesting!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Marriott for five days we thought the Savannah side would be a neat respite from the hustle and bustle of Lake Buena Vista. Wrong; The Animal Kingdom Lodge has a beautiful entry and I totally enjoyed exploring the pool area and lobby with artifacts displayed beautifully. However, in our room we found the bed with bump like ridges (requested two matress pads in the morning) and the lighting so low I could not read. Our velour blanket actually had a hole in it! If you see the animals at the theme park then you will be dissappointed with those on the Savannah: Giraffe, zebra, wildebeast and another larger type hoofed animal stayed in mostly the same spot waiting to be fed and then they wandered off. You can see the chain link fence around the complex. I guess I expected a more dense jungle area. Most interesting were the large white pelicans at sleep early in the AM. A regular room would save money with nice views of the savannah from the hallways or outside walkway.

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ms.LoveTravel
Reviews.Content: We absolutely felt we got value for our money. Rich dark woods and the feeling of being in Africa without ever going there. Not to mention the wildlife right outside of our balcony! Boma serves an excellent breakfast with an African coffee that has as much flavor or more than my usual Starbuck's addictions. Jikos was also fantastic! Flavors of African food that I was fearful that I would not like turned out to be some of the best flavors I have ever tasted (and I am a big fan of Italian and Mexican foods) No one should go to Walt Disney World with out dining at the Animal Kingdom Lodge regardless of where they stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iggypug
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days with a two year old in tow. We did have a lot of walking to arrive at our rooms door every night, but strollers are amazing things. The things I loved most about this hotel was the lobby, the animals outside our window and being away from the main traffic hotels. I wish I had more time to savor all that the hotel had to offer. The hotel holds the best resturant in Disney, JIKO. This place will nock your socks off. Dissappointments, long lines for concierge desk. But nothing to crazy, we had our questions answered. Note when picked up from the airport, you might be upset your the last hotel to be dropped off. But as the bus driver says, why make the other guests jealous of were you are staying.

Reviews.Title: “Average - Savannah poorly maintained, rooms underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We weren't looking for a "magical day", just a pleasant one. Although we were constantly told to have a "magical day", it was disappointing. We thought we would be in a deluxe savannah room. It is deluxe if Motel 8 is your standard fare. If you normally stay in Embassy Suites or Marriott Courtyard hotels rooms, this will be a disappointment. Forget about those "bunk beds" option unless you have a family of five. We are a family of four. We were told this would be a priority request as we had a teenage girl and 6 year old boy. In reality, this was never an option as we only had 4 in the family. Wish someone had told us sooner. Sure would have been nice to share that piece of information on the website or Disney planning DVD. But we are here to see African Animals in a "Savannah". The "Savannah" we are currently overlooking is a small patch of poorly maintained land that makes you wish the animals were in a zoo where they would have a better maintained environment. My five acres of land at home is a better maintained "Savannah". On the plus side, the restaurant food is AWESOME. So by all means eat at the hotel. Overall, my recommendation is go somewhere else where you get your moneys worth.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Beds of my Life”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a delux savannah view room w/bunk beds. The room was horrible. View of the Animals loved it. Beds were harder then the floor. For what we paid and got it was not worth it. I would not recomend this hotel to anyone. For a disney property I was very disapointed. this should be a lower resort and not one of there top resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Was nice, don't know if I would go back”
Reviews.Author: roxy6
Reviews.Content: Recent stay at the AKL was pleasant. Was dissappointed with our room location. Was quite the hike to go anywhere. We had a savannah view room, with great views of the animals, the baby giraffe was amazing. Room service and housekeeping were wonderful. The restaurants were excellent, especially Bomas. Enjoyed talking to the African staff and learing about their home. The location of the lodge itself is too far from the rest of the parks. I prefer something more central. It was nice to go and stay once, but we will stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Room and Transportation a dissappointment”
Reviews.Author: injuly
Reviews.Content: Had a room facing the parking lot, sheets had holes in them - housekeeping "dropped" off new sheets that also had holes and stains, the person who dropped them off said she was just a runner and it wasn't her job (to remake bed). VERY disappointed in housekeeping, along walls and over lighting were plenty of dust. Transfers take forever - you are the furtherest out of onsite hotels and the last bus to arrive or to pick you up...spent alot of hours "waiting". The breakfast buffet was fabulous, the guides out on the safari at the hotel were very knowledgable and an excellent resourse. Our purchases made in MK and sent to hotel were lost by the gift shop personnel. Front desk personnel - I would say 1 out of 5 really have it together. Witnessed a very upset guest who was wanting to speak to management and was wanting out of there...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights during the holidays and we loved it. We have two kids (5yrs & 7yrs) and it was worth every penny and more. We got a Savanna view room and loved waking up to giraffes, antelope and zebras outside our room every morning. Transportation to and from the parks was so convenient we left our rental car in the hotel parking lot and were able to return to the hotel for mid day rests. While the kids liked Test Track and Big Thunder Mountain best about the trip - for me it was the Animal Kingdom Lodge!

Reviews.Title: “JUST A GREAT PLACE TO STAY-animals outside your room a bonus”
Reviews.Author: CANADIAN2006
Reviews.Content: We are they type of travellers (family of 5) that don't mind paying a little extra for quality. But you don't have to when staying here. This is my first "EXCELLENT" rating for a hotel on Trip Advisor. From friendly painless check in to the room with bunk beds,pool,room service,great restaurants, friendly staff, convenient bus service, great work out facilities this hotel has it all. And represents good value for a disney property. Your kids will love the "savanah rooms" with the balcony looking over the animal park (so make sure you book "savanah view"!!!) We stayed here for 3 days after staying at the Grand Floridian (see my review) and it was a great change of pace. CONS: The Animal Kingdom Park itself was a big let down. I must be missing something (we have all ages from pre-school to high school) other than a great savanah ride through the jungle and the parade, the park was...boring??.-but don't worry you can conveniently bus it to another venue.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Animals”
Reviews.Author: JFSD
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at this hotel. We had a savanna view room and it was amazing to open the blinds in the morning to see the animals. The pool facilities are also nice, but the rooms are pretty much the same as in a moderate disney resort. If you are expecting luxury room accommodations, please know that while the accommodations are clean and there is nothing wrong with the room, I would not consider the room to be what I would expect at a "deluxe" hotel. Disney's definition of "deluxe" does not translate into 4 or 5 stars elsewhere. However, the animals, facilities, lobby, activities and hotel management (we had a problem with our luggage and the hotel manager was wonderful - in fact he turned the negative experience into a positive one), make up for the acceptable but unspectacular rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: tripbuddy123
Reviews.Content: Was here for a short 3-night trip. I thought the view I paid for would be better...poolview. I could only see the pool from the balcony, not from the room, and had to look right in order to see it even from that balcony. Also, I was told there were viewing spots all over the resort. I wandered for hours, and only found a couple. Too confusing, not enough direction. Everything was way too spread out to try to find places without assistance, which I had trouble getting. I think, in the right room with the right view (thus eliminating the need to hunt down animal-viewing areas), this would be a great place to stay. But the busy decor was not relaxing to me, and as stated previously, tyring to bumble my way around to see the famouse ANIMALS was just plain frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for deluxe hotel”
Reviews.Author: cosmoz79
Reviews.Content: If you want a deluxe disney without breaking the bank, this is for you. Certainly a deluxe - I would say 4 going on 5 star. Most people would proably put location as the reason to not stay here and pay loads extra for an alternate delxue, but it is not an issue. The busses run so frequently that I dont think the boats or monorails could beat it. The place is spectacular, the animals a nice diference, the pool lovely and i just enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: scrapjacks
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful! We really enjoyed the theme and viewing the animals from our balcony. The animals came very close to our room and there was almost always some animal in view. Service was great. We were able to check in early with no hassle. Lots of walking to get to the rooms & then to vending area, though.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent 7 wonderful nights at the AKL during Christmas. Disney has done a wonderful job with the African theme. You truly forget you are still in Florida! The first thing we saw when we first walked in to the lobby was the huge Christmas tree! The Christmas decorations were beautiful as were the wood carvings and art pieces throughout the resort. Our check-in was relatively smooth and quick. When placing my reservation I had requested a savanna view with lots of birds for my son who is an avid ornithologist. At check-in we were assigned a room on the Arusha savanna...I was thrilled, but my son was less than ecstatic as he had been hoping for a Sunset Savanna view to see the vultures and marabou stork. Needless to say, when we got into our room the first animals he saw were Blue Cranes, Guineafowl and Pelicans, so he was more than pleased. It was certainly a treat to look out your window and see Zebra, Giraffe, Wildebeest, Kudu etc. Other reviewers had mentioned that the rooms are a bit dim and I have to agree, however I do believe it is purposely done to maintain the "mood" of the resort. Although the lights were not bright, they were sufficient. The room was quite comfortable with exotic carved wooden bed headboard, posts of the bunkbed, armoire for the TV, chairs and mirrors. The zebra motif chairs on the balcony are very novel as well. The double sinks in the vanity area were great, and it was nice having a refrigerator for juice and milk etc. I found the service to be excellent. The castmember who checked me in went out of his way to find out if my son was enjoying our room. Partway through our stay I caught a cold and stayed in bed for 2 days. The housekeeping staff did a wonderful job of keeping our room clean and freshly supplied. I even had the housekeeping manager stop by to ensure that his staff was doing everything possible to make our stay magical and see that I had everything that I needed. My son and I also enjoyed just spending time in the massive lobby and the hallways. All the hallways have windows where you can watch the animals on all of the savannas. Some even have a place to sit. The fireplace in the lobby was a popular place for people to sit and read a book or drink a beverage. The kids area with the tv playing disney cartoons was always filled with kids...my son included. There were tons of activities for the kids...African art rubbings, Ostrich egg ornament making, Night animal viewing, Cookie decorating etc. My favorite place in the lobby area was the Sunset Overlook Room. It was a lot calmer than the outer lobby and had lots of comfy seating, beautiful african artifacts and a balcony to view the animals. The restaurants Boma (breakfast & dinner buffet) and Jiko (upscale dinner only) were both wonderful. (Try the flatbreads and the Tilefish at Jiko!) We also received excellent service from every cast member we encountered in these restaurants. The Mara food court was like any other, less expensive than a sit down meal but definitely not cheap. It had an adequate menu and everything we ate there was decent. My son also spent a bit of time in the small video arcade. We didn't have an opportunity to spend time in the outdoor spas or the pool, but it looked like there were quite a few people taking advantage of this amenity, and enjoying it. AKL also has a fitness room, 2 self service laundry rooms, a playground, and a kid's activity room. This is not the fanciest of resorts, but it certainly is very comfortable and is the perfect place for someone who loves animals!

Reviews.Title: “If you have kids, you must go once”
Reviews.Author: ali1298
Reviews.Content: We visited January 7th and 8th 2006. We reserved two savannah view rooms, my two children, husband, father in law and myself in my party. One room had bunk beds, a thrill for the kids, the second two double beds. We were in rooms 3352 and 3354. The rooms were unimpressive, small, dark, musty, typical hotel rooms. A fridge was provided, cheap soaps and shampoos, thin towels, and the worst, cheap motel bed spreads. The beds were comfortable though. No complimentary water bottles as in most deluxe hotels, no water in the vending machine down the hall either, only soda. Who drinks soda anymore? Water in the gift shop, quite a trek from the room, especially with kids. Gift shop well stocked with milk, beer, medicine, ect. but expensive. No special welcoming touches, i.e., chocolates on the pillow, face cloths folded in disney shapes as I remember from previous years, were provided. Cattle call mentality, mass production. The view was memorable, lots of giraffes frolicking about 60 feet from balcony, wildebeasts, and ostrich. You will not see anything wilder than tame animals. It is built like a typical motel surrounding the savannah. Rooms are crammed into every nook and cranny. It could easily be a holiday inn if you took away the animals. Animals very active in morning and at dusk. Other than the view of the animals, nothing to write home about. I think the kids will treasure the memory, but I would not elect to stay there again. If you go, request a room near the check in desk, rooms are wide spread. Actually, go further and search for a map of the hotel on the internet and consult it when making reservations. The Victoria Falls bar is horrible, incompetent bartenders, I ordered a coffee drink and was warned I would not like it because the coffee was hours old and they did not intend to make any more because the bar was closing in an hour(closes at 11:00). It was 30 degrees outside, and I needed coffee! It was undrinkable. Do try the Tusker African beer, available only at Mara. Very smooth and relaxing. The lobby itself is very dark, the fire pit so many rave about on this site is gas powered, unattended and unwelcoming. I found no one reading stories around it and the clerk at the desk had no idea what I was referring to, she directed me to Ft. Wilderness. It is at least a 30-40 minute commute to the M.K., including waiting for the shuttle. The first day, a marathon was in progress and we waited a solid hour for the bus. As we exited the M.K. at 9:15 p.m., we saw the shuttle pull away and waited 30 minutes for another bus. Best tip I gained from this site, if you are staying on Disney property with children, return mid afternoon for a nap. We left the M.K. at about 2:00, my five year old took a two hour nap and woke up with a giant smile, ready to return. Trust me, you are not missing anything by remaining in the park with a tired kid. All will be miserable and Disney wears out the best of us. Again, kids love seeing the animals, but how long are you in the room? If you are accustumed to luxury resorts, at this price, you will be disappointed. The food in Mara, the cafeteria style dining establishment is fresh, and healthy choices are available, but it is overpriced(4.75 for yogurt parfait, $4.50 for PB&J), although that is par for the course at Disney. All in all, I am glad my kids saw the place, but I would choose a place along the Boardwalk next time. This hotel should not be grouped among Disney's "deluxe" properties. Animal Kingdom could use some training from the Ritz if they intend to continue to charge outrageous rates.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, whatever your age!!!”
Reviews.Author: WendyJJ
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Dec 27th, after a 3 hour delayed flight & getting lost(ish) in our car. The hotel lobby is gorgeous, a big Christmas Tree was in the centre and lots of lovely comfy sofas & chairs.There was one TV in lobby showing the customary Disney shows for the kids, but this was very inobtrusive. The guy on the reception desk could not have been more helpful and gave us lots of information about the hotel and Walt Disney World.Including telling us about the new arrivals at Animal Kingdom, a baby giraffe and elephant. At first I was disappointed to see where our room was which was quite a way down The Uzima Savanna, at the bottom of one of the shoot offs. However, our room was great(Room 3566), it was on the corner, so we had quite a big corridor when we entered the room (light switch as soon as you entered room!). The room was a good size with two King (could have been Queen) sized beds. It had air conditioning, a fridge, coffee maker (with comp coffee/tea) & plenty of storage. I loved the dresser area which had two sinks, a big mirror and plenty of shelving etc to store your toiletries. Our balcony had a great view of the savannah, we spotted the baby giraffe immediately, and it was outside our room every day. We saw Ankole cattle, Zebra,Impala,Wilderbeest,and lots of other animals and birds from our balcony. We ate in Boma for our 1st breakfast, which was great, buffet style, but you did feel you needed to get your moneys worth! We then always went to The Mara and bought cereal, toast & coffee etc,which only cost $20 for the four of us. The staff everywhere in the hotel were great, very helpful & courteous, apart from in the bar where we found them abrupt a couple of times. Our kids (aged 6 & 4) loved the activities and the fact they were given an african bead for each activity they attended. The activities were fun and educational. Overall a great hotel, very relaxing, clean & decor is wonderfully African.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: woodchucker
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Disney and for our first one we had stayed in the Wilderness Lodge, which we had loved. So this time we decided to stay in the Wilderness Lodge again for a few nights and then move over to the Animal Kingdom Lodge for the rest of the stay. Well, as much as we loved the Wilderness we loved the Animal Kingdom way more. From the moment you enter the awe-inspiring lobby to the moment you step out onto your balcony and see all varieties of African animals underneath your window, you will be amazed! The service was great, we paid only $140 a night and were upgraded to a savannah view room. We woke in the morning to the sounds of some kind of water buffalo bellowing outside our window (it was great!)and we couldnt' have been happier. One night we went out onto a rock formation and the staff there had night vision goggles so we could look at the animals, which were standing very close to where we were. Our room was very nice and very clean. The pool was awesome, as were the hot tubs. We ate dinner twice at Boma, on the bottom floor of the Lodge, and it was by far the best food we have ever had at Disney. Nothing else has even come close. We loved it here and would never stay anywhere else if we go back to Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place”
Reviews.Author: CTFAMILY
Reviews.Content: AKL is fabulous. The decor in this place makes you feel like you're visiting Africa. This was our second stay. We were in a regular savannah view room. I was concerned when I saw our room was WAY down at the end of the zebra trail. NO worries! We woke up every morning and watched the giraffes, zebras, and african cattle march by. We are all animal lovers in my family so we cant imagine staying anywhere else when in Disney! We stayed for a whole week, and hardly waited long at all for the Disney buses. DISNEY MAGICAL EXPRESS worked GREAT for us! What a treat to not have to gather or check my luggage in Orlando. What a great idea. Also, the restaurant in ALK we loved most of all Jiko! Food and service were phenomenal! Happy New Year, all!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Papad
Reviews.Content: Just spent 10 nights in that hotel. During our stay we also checked out other Disney deluxe properties - Grand Floridian, Polynesian, Contemporary, Wilderness Lodge. Hands down Animal Kingdom was the best of all of them. My kids 8 and 5 had the time of their life. Everything from the bunkbeds to the Savannah facing view. The animal feedings where zebras, giraffes, wilderbeast were outside our balcony to the activities to the kid friendly pools were beyond my expectations. The food at Boma's (onsite restaurant) was average and it was crowded at all times and sometimes difficult to manuever your way through the buffet lines. The Christmas decorations, music, Character Meet and Greet, Zawadi Marketplace shop were outstanding. The resort is a good 15 minute drive from all the parks (except Animal Kingdom) but I still highly recommend it. I am sold on this property and after spending 10 nights I am ready to start planning my next vacation here. Also met a lot of folks from Botswana, Capetown, Pretoria, Kenya. They actually employ exchange students from Africa. They come and work for a year and then go back and new ones come. They all were extremely friendly and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “All that we expected--and more”
Reviews.Author: dmspeech
Reviews.Content: We go to WDW every year and every year we say let's stay at Animal Kingdom Lodge next year. Well, this year we did and it was worth the extra money. The room's furnishings are great. African themed, subdued lighting and pretty spacious for Disney. The lobby? Gorgeous. Two fires. One inside and one outside. Great artifacts, decorating very tasteful and very "African." Viewing areas to see animals. There was a 3 week old giraffe that we stalked every day. That, in itself, made the trip worth it. I'm rambling but I'm having fun reliving the trip. Go, and you'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: kmae2006
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge for 2 nights and we had 2 Savannah View Rooms. The hotel is wonderful. We saw all kinds of animals from our balcony. My husband and I ate dinner at Jiko and the food was excellent. One of the best meals I have ever had. With one appetizer, 2 entrees and 2 desserts the meal was approx $90. We didn't use the pool because of the time of year but it looked wonderful. If you don't have a Savannah View Room there are many places on the hotel grounds that you can view the animals. It was a great hotel for children as there were many planned activities for them all day long. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel for travel to any of the parks. The rooms were a good size and everything was well taken care of and very clean. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: tjay2
Reviews.Content: I thought I'd written a review of this hotel but on reflection it looks like i havent!! Ok so this hotel is the best place I have ever stayed and Disney is the best place for that particular type of holiday! I may be a bit biast seeing as I payed nothing for my weeks holiday here but truly how people can compain about this hotel really does confuse me! I had a savannah view room with an incredile view and giraffes outside my window as a 21 year old male i got excited so a small child must be in wonderland!! The pool area is fantastic and traditionally themed Disney style! Rooms are very large with big balcony and fantastic views with everything you need in the room from in wall safe to iron ironing board coffee making facilities fridge and TV of course with Disney Channels. The only starnge thing for me was the depth of the bath was very shallow but im 6ft4in and too big for a bath anyway! I guess the only moan that people have is the walk from some rooms back to recpetion! But hey come on if you can walk down a corridor for 5 mins your pretty unfit and just tryin to find things to moan at personally my walk down the corridor set me up for the day it gave me time to wipe the big grin from my face compose myself and remind myself that im 21 and not 12!!! The buses are just as good from the Animal Kingdom as they are from any other Disney hotel the longest i think i waited was maybe 15mins but in the hot florida sun whos complaing about waiting!! I wasnt really bothered about this trip as Disney never appealed to me i thought at my age i was past it all however Disney is fantastic for everyone I had an amzing time and being in dreamland everyday is a wonderful feeling you may come home tired but your mind is refreshed and your outlook on life becomes free like a childs again! I had an amazing time at this hotel and i had to visit all the disney hotels as part of my trip for work! Personally i would not stay in the value resorts! i think you need to go for moderate or above and i have booked to go back in the Coronado Springs which i thought looked fantastic! However for magic and the shock and unexpected events of animals living live on their own savannah has to make this the best hotel disney have created if you have a bad time at this hotel or in disney you have a problem and need to lighten up!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, disliked the Staff!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to stay at Animal Kingdom Lodge (AKL). My parents decided not only to join my husband and I on our annual 'Christmas' trip, but actually paid for the trip! As a Florida resident, we always get deep discounts on AKL or Wilderness Lodge. We decided to say at AKL. I am so glad we did! The Hotel: AKL is so beautiful (especially the Christmas tree during the holidays)! When you walk into the hotel it looks OK, but once you step into the lobby, it takes your breath away. I can see why Disney won an award for overall theming at this resort. You actually feel like you've been transported to Kenya. The rooms: BEWARE!!!! If you check in after dark, your room will be pitch black (in the savannah view rooms). The switches for the lights are located well inside the room (none by the door), so it takes a minute to turn on the lights! It was really funny, but if you had small children, they may be frightened at first (???). As I mentioned, we had Savannah view rooms. Ours was located on the Giraffe Savannah (there are three different savannahs on property). No kidding, at all times of the day you could see some type of animal, usually giraffes. One night, my family and I came back to the hotel at 1:30am, and my husband said, "I wonder if I can see any animals?" He opened the curtains and jumped 5 feet. There was a huge giraffe right outside our balcony. Disney has little electrical spikes in the grass so the animals cannot get too close (and you can't get too close to them!), but this giraffe was RIGHT THERE. The theme in the rooms was continued with African inspired bedding, drapes, and wallpaper (in the bathroom area). There are even fake mosiquito nets over the beds. A note of caution: My parents had an oversize room with an extra little entry-way with console and pottery. My sister and her boyfriend had a regular room with 2 queen beds and a nice dresser for holding clothes. My husband and I had..... bunk beds! There was one queen bed and one set of bunk beds (no, I didn't try them out). And my room had no dresser :( My sister said our closet was bigger than hers, though. Also, some of the hallways on the way to our room smelled like... animal???? I can't explain the smell, but it wasn't pleasant, and I was happy that our hallway and rooms didn't smell. I don't know what the going rate is for these rooms, but with our discount we only paid $199 per room, definitely a steal! The grounds: There are three lookout points on the property with actual African cast members that will talk to you about the animals and also about their native country. It's pretty informative and cool. Also, the pool is HUGE. It has a waterslide and is heated during the 'winter' (for Florida) months. The restaurants: We only ate at Boma, once for lunch and once for dinner. The dinner had mixed reviews. Boma serves authentic African cuisine with American specialities. If you are a picky eater, you might not like Boma for dinner (neither did 3 of us). If you are an adventurous eater (my spouse, my dad, and my sister's boyfriend), you will really like it! Love it even! Boma's breakfast is a huge buffet with tons of options for all eaters. Disney is so huge, that it's possible to stay all week and only eat in your hotel once or twice. The other sit-down dinner place, Jiko, has won several 5-Star awards for their cuisine. There is also a counter service restaurant for quick bites on property. The staff: Orginally, we were told that we could check in to our hotel, even though my mom was paying and the rooms weren't in our name. My husband and I rushed to Orlando ahead of everyone else and guess what? We sat in the lobby until my parents got there. Also, the concierge was rude! Unbelievable. The refridgerator was not working in our room, and we asked for a replacement. We went to Downtown Disney at 8:00pm and returned at 1:30 am and we had a refridgerator by our bathroom, blocking the sink, and the same stinky broken fridge plugged in. My husband had to change it out himself. The maintenance manager didn't even apologize. Oh well, small price to pay for a beautiful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the money !!!”
Reviews.Author: Uglydork
Reviews.Content: For the money this place costs an Elephant should have poked his head in the window and woke me in the morning. Beautiful but VERY dark. Hardly any animal views and we stayed in a deluxe view room. Staff at the front desk want very friendly. Too much money for a moderate hotel. We stayed at the Radisson Parkway before moving to Animal kingdon for $55.00 a night AAA discount and it was much better! The pool was bigger and warmer and the staff is very nice. The rooms are bigger and cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “The Animal Kingdom Lodge ROCKS!!”
Reviews.Author: minamu
Reviews.Content: We did a Disney Land and Sea Vacation, with 3 nights at the Animal Kingdom Lodge and a 4 night cruise to the Bahamas, and even though the cruise was great, I must say that a part of me wished our whole time had been spent at this wonderful resort. This place is GREAT. I can't imagine wanting to stay anywhere else. No other Disney resort is as unique as this one. Even our son wanted to spend more time here than in the Magic Kingdom and Epcot, and was bummed that we weren't going back to the resort again when it was time to start our cruise. The resort is lovely inside and out, and upon arriving, you feel that you are in another world, which is great for getting away from everything Disney that you do during the day. When we first arrived, I was bummed that we got put on the Ostrich trail, not in a room overlooking one of the main large savannah areas. HOWEVER, as soon as I entered my room, I didn't even have time to put my stuff down before three giraffes strolled right in front of our balcony, followed by a couple of watusi and there were already several very cool looking African birds that you don't normally see in the States, including one that looked like its legs were drinking straw wrappers. An ostrich pruned itself in the background. I decided that I really couldn't ask for much more. Also, even if you don't get a room right in the middle of it all, there is a whole series of viewing areas off the lobby where you can stroll around and see all of the animals you want to see. The lodge itself is beautiful, the lobby is gorgeous, the pool area wonderful and huge. I believe the brochure said the pool was like 6000 square feet. It has a sand-colored bottom to look like a watering hole and a water slide set in lush greenery. The decor is just great, all wood, dark, rocky, earth tones, with tons of real African art. The gift shop has a parade either every night or every other night for the children, where they let the kids choose an African instrument to play and march them around the lobby. The kids like it and they got certificates afterwards. There's an arcade and a kid's club, though we used neither. Also, this resort has tons of educational offerings for kids, the guides who are from Africa will explain all sorts of things, and they have storytelling around a fire pit, maskmaking, etc., etc. We didn't have time for much of these, but wished we did. Next time must be a week. This lodge has one of the best restaurants in Walt Disney World, BOMA, a lovely buffet style wonder with both American food and a lot of African specialties that are absolutely delicious. We went for dinner and again for breakfast on our last day. It is great to try out such different foods, and while they are definitely unique, they are not so highly spiced that you'll get sick or anything. My mouth still waters thinking of the delicious curried breakfast casserole with biscuits on top. Or the roasted chicken with the delicious spices you would have a hard time finding in the US. A lovely lounge upstairs from BOMA, Victoria Falls, has some awesome drinks, which they make strong. The lava smoothie is wonderful, pina colada swirled with a delicious raspberry concoction. Heavenly. The "Hanging Out in Capetown" martini drink will leave you reeling. They also make great margaritas at the poolside bar. Anyway, the night at VF and Boma was one of the best of the trip. So mellow, such delicious food. We felt lucky to have Boma right in our own resort. People come from other resorts to eat there, be sure to book in advance. On top of the lovely lodge itself, having the animals all around you is such a treat, and they are cool, several that you won't find in the U.S. While the resort is totally separate from the Animal Kingdom park, between the resort and the Animal Kingdom park safari ride, we saw some amazing African animals. When I think back on our vacation, this resort is the thing that makes me most nostalgic. It's the best.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon for two weeks, we experienced everything, we feel the hotel had to offer. We enjoyed breakfast on our balcony whilst watching the giraffes and pelicans. The restaurants are great the food is great and the service in the bar is good. I do have very minor issues with the hotel which is the rooms are quite small but in all honesty you only sleep in a room on holiday, not live in it!! We had one problem with one guy behind reception who just could not be bothered to help and was so dissmissive of us. We had no problems with the transport or anything else. And with the magic of disney we had an amazing honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “loved akl...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we returned from staying at akl on the 11th of november! we stayed on i drive for a week and then akl! akl was wonderful, reception staff a little abrupt, and long queue's at reception! the hot tub and pool bar wonderful after a hard day at the parks. i wouldn't stay here for a full week again as we felt it was a waste of money not having time to appreciate the beauty of akl, 2-3 days would be ideal after you've done the parks, a time to chill in a wonderful hotel! room service excellent and we got a savannah view, only paid for standard view, so to watch the animals in the morning a great bonus! stay here when you've completed your disney parks otherwise a waste of money!

Reviews.Title: “Concierge -- not sure worth the extra money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed three nights at the Wilderness Lodge at two nights at the Animal Kingdom Lodge, Concierge Level. The room was $500 per night at the Anima Kingdom, not including any tickets, etc. When we booked we requested a King Bed with a Savanah View -- we were told that Concierge Level rooms could not guarantee a room. For $500 per night, the resort cannot guarantee a view?? My husband called the hotel and explained it was a very special trip for us and to please book us into a King Bed with a Savanah View. Upon check-in at 11:00 am we were given a room with two Queen beds, on the fifth floor. (Concierge food service is on the sixth floor!) We asked to be changed, which they accomodated, but why would a resort book a husband and wife into two Queens? I read on a website that conceirge would contact you to make reservations, etc. No one contacted us. Additionally, with Disney now allowing dining reservations 180 days in advance, one cannot wait for Concierge to call as they do not have any "ins" to places, ie they cannot get you into a restaurant that is booked-up. However, the one perk of staying on the Concierge Level is that I read about a SUNSET safari that was for adults only (on the web) and included a chef designed meal with wine pairings. I called and booked that ahead of time and it was truly a once in a lifetime experience. In addition to having the chef cook for us personally, we also petted a giraffe on our own safari. THAT was worth the money. But I would not spend the money on concierge service again. And the Animal Kingdom should be ashamed of themselves for charging the same prices for the fifth floor pool view versus a sixth floor savannah view on this level.

Reviews.Title: “Savannah Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Queenofeverything_7
Reviews.Content: Just got back from AKL yesterday. What a beautiful place. Being able to sit out on the balcony and be so close to the animals was magical. Transportation was fab we only had to wait longer than 5 minutes once. Quite often we were the only ones on it!! This is the third Disney resort hotel we have stayed in and I was absolutley horrified and dissapointed when my sons Quick Silver rucksack containing his MP3 player book and towel was stolen from his sun bed by the pool. We reported it to security who didn't manage to find it and did give us one call back to say that it hadn't been relocated. Was very dissapointed that some one from hotel managementdid not get involved and compensated us the £150 as it was such a rare event and apparently never happened befor. Didn't let it spoil the holiday and will be sorting it now. My only negative comments about the place are: The boma - excellent value but the same thing day after day. The only thing that changed very occasionally was the meat from beef to pork and the rice. The breakfast - again good value but the food was left to heat for too long and a lotof it was dry. The biscuits were cold. Reception - never enough people on reception I had to wait in line for 15 - 20 minutes to change some travellers cheque which was extremely irritating. You can only change $200 dollars a day which is ridiculous. Stunning place and Disney is always wonderfull.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tackitikihut
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the long holiday weekend and spent 3 nights in a deluxe Savannah view room. Checkin was easy and the staff was nice. The room was fairly small as we had two queen beds. One complaint is the bathroom is tiny. You can barley close the door while you are in there. This is due to the fact that they have the sinks outside the shower/toilet room. The view, which is on major reason to stay here, is very nice. We saw animals at almost all times of the day and it is very relaxing. The theme is African in nature. If you do not think you would enjoy that entire theme or want "Disney" feel, do not stay here. Upon arrival we had a cheese plate and champagne sent to the room, which was fabulous and we enjoyed sunset from our balcony. Hung around the pool one day. Quiet and nice, but not exciting like many of the other hotels. Slide is tiny and if your kids are over 5, it will bore them. Transportation was easy and we never waited for busses going or coming. Jiko was excellent. Nice selection of African wines. Good selection of authentic foods. Steak that I had was one of the best and the flatbreads and sampler of dips is a must. The casual resturant was great and, I think, reasonably priced. Bottom line is we enjoyed our stay, but 3 days was enough and we would come back to the hotel, but even if we do not stay again, next time, we will visit Jiko again. I just can not imagine 7 days straight at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but not luxury”
Reviews.Author: vkb_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed a weekend at the Animal Kingdom Lodge in Ocotber 2005, My stay at the Coronado Springs Hotel in August was much better. As far as service it was excellent and the room was more pleasant than the room at the Lodge. At check in the agent was so confused she was unable to answer any of my questions. The buses to Magic Kingdom were never on schedule, on one return trip I ended up waiting 30 minutes for the bus. For dinner I went to the concierge so that they can make a reservation for me at one of their 2 restaurants, and they were unable to, because we were 5 and she could only reserve for 4. So, I had no reservations and go to the restaurant and they give me a pager and tell me the wait would be 40 minutes. 50 minutes later I still have not been paged, so I go to see what is happening, and they could not find my name. Meanwhile the manager is telling another client that they are not accepting walk ins and that they have not been. I was told I would have to wait a few minutes more. I ended up eating dinner at the fast food place by the pool, with 2 hours later i still had not been paged. The hotel is ok but I would not say it is Luxury.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful !!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my family just came back from staying at the animal kingdom lodge and it was fabulous!!!!! I have a 2 year old and a 1 yearold and they loved watching all of the giraffas come by the window and eat the leaves off of the trees !!!!!1 the food was excellent and the staff were so helpful in making our stay so comfortable !!!!! 1 i would recommend this hotel to everyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “This is not a Deluxe hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After spending ten days in the Disney Port Orleans French Quarter, which cost us round about the same price as four days in the AKL I was really disapointed with what was classed as a deluxe hotel and I feel the hotel is a real waste of money. We were going to transfer to Pop Century which is a value hotel but i felt that as it was the last four days of my holiday I would splash out for something special. BIG MISTAKE, DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY. I wished we could have stayed at Port Orleans for the last four days of our holiday but they were fully booked. Although the Port Orleans is a Moderate hotel it had everything and i could not fault it at all. The staff at Port Orleans would do anything for you to make your stay run as smoothly as possible where as the staff at the AKL from the begin of our stay to the end took the attitude that everything was too much like hard work and I found them alot of the time damn right rude. None off the staff looked like they are enjoying working at the hotel apart from the South African Rangers who i thought were excellent. The staff in the Mara restaurant were terrible if you asked for anything a little diffrent the response was NO. And this kind of service for around $260 night. NOT GOOD. They should be jumping through hoops at that price. We ended up with a standard room which I can apreciate did not have a view over any of the animal Savanahs but when i opened the curtains there was no view just bushes. A balcony full of bushes it might as well have been looking at a brick wall. We explained to the front desk that the view from this room was a joke and was told that this was just a standard room. The cleanliness of the room I felt was also poor as i kept treading on what i thought was chewing gum that kept sticking to my feet but later realised it was all the dirt and hair stuck together were the carpets had been cleaned. Disney sort out your hotel. Anyone reading DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY.

Reviews.Title: “you gotta go!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
