Reviews.Content: recently returned from a 10 day stay at akl - it was truly wonderful. everything was first class. accomodation was excellent and clean. had a wonderful view over the savannah. the restaurant food was really well prepared and there was a good vairied menu. there was a magnificent pool and hot tubs. YOU GOTTA GO!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic, amazing and beautiful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Carlau
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from the most incredible two weeks at AKL. The hotel is really beautiful - especially the lobby and outside areas. We had a savanah view room and saw plenty of giraffe's and other wildlife from our balcony. There was never any bad smells from the animals even when it rained. As there was just the two of us the room was plenty big enough, the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was very nice and always keep very clean and the vanity area was great. The room had a real romantic and relaxing feel to it - due to the low lighting which was not a problem to us. The vanity area had more light and therefore ideal for applying makeup. Our towels were replaced daily and the room was spotless the whole two weeks - housekeeping was very good! We ate at Jiko, Boma and Mara. Jiko is incredible - the food is just amazing - Jiko is a must to try. Boma is also the same - however was always very busy and requires advanced booking, so much choice at Boma's. Mara was great for a quick snack - they do great salads and have plenty of healthy options as well as the normal junk food. The pool was great - in the heat of the day it was a relief to jump into a refreshing cool pool! There were always plenty of sun beds and towels - every where was very clean. It is so amazing to see all the animal everywhere and they were always plenty of guides around the hotel to explain about the animals. All the staff we encounted were very helpful. The disney bus service was great - we never waited long for a bus to arrive. We went out of Disney on several occasions, as this hotel is so far away from anything Disney we soon dicovered that by getting the disney bus to Down town Disney that we could get a taxi for about $6 to loads of resturants and shops near International Drive. We also used Mears Transport to get to Universal Studios which cost $14 per person return from AKL. The only negative comment of the hotel was the long walk to the hotel room - however this was not a huge problems to us and as this is such a big hotel it was expected. Apart form this we could not fault this hotel and would not hesitate to recommend. We loved AKL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Classy stay for animal lovers”
Reviews.Author: hliss
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently (end of September) stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge (AKL) for one night. We got an outstanding rate for Florida residents ($143 including tax) right from the Disney website, and were upgraded from a standard view to a savannah view room (likely because it was an off season time so there were many empty rooms). One month earlier we stayed at the Wilderness Lodge (WL), so in addition to giving information about AKL, I can also compare the two lodges. The AKL is newer than the WL, and I found the decor quality to be slightly more upscale, and in general there was less wear and tear at the AKL. AKL is MUCH bigger than the WL, and along with the larger size, there were longer walks to rooms (some of them were really, really far from the lobby) and the parking lot was pretty massive. You could wind up walking nearly a mile to the lodge from the parking lot, and then nearly another mile to your room from the lobby - I'm not kidding. The pool area was fabulous, and if you are an animal lover it is really exciting to get to see the many animals outside your window (if you have a savannah view room) or outside the resort windows. I found it a bit annoying that, as we were waiting on line to check in (there was only one person ahead of us) there was a staff member going up to people telling them to get out their credit cards and identification. There were only 2-3 people on line. Given that it takes around 10 minutes for staff to check people in, and given how few people were waiting, it seemed a bit annoying and unnecessary to insist that people get everything out immediately. Other staff were pretty nice and helpful. Like most of the Disney resort rooms, our room had 2 queen sized beds (actually, some resorts only offer 2 full sized beds). There are very, very few rooms on Disney property that have king-sized beds, and most of those are disabled accessible rooms. I have no idea why this is the case, but that is what we were told at the WL. Consequently, many couples, particularly honeymooners, are quite disappointed when they are not given a king room. The beds at the AKL, like at the WL were quite comfortable, with a generous amount of pillows. One thing that is really annoying, and this was the case at both the AKL and WL, is that the queen beds are not set up to have 2 people sleeping in them. There is a bedside table in the middle between the 2 beds, so whoever is sleeping on that side gets a bedside table, but the people sleeping on the outside of each bed are out of luck. At the WL I think that there was the ability for the person on each side of the bed to control his/her own light switch, but this was not the case at the AKL - only the person sleeping next to the bedside table could control the lights. This was a problem when I wanted to stay up and read and my husband wanted to go to sleep. The room had a small refrigerator, and it was convenient to purchase cereal, milk and fruit the night before so that we could have a quick morning breakfast. At the AKL if you have a savannah view room they have video surveillance of your balcony - there are small signs regarding this in the room, but I may not have noticed them if someone had not warned me prior to my visit. They do this to make sure that guests are not harrassing the animals, or doing anything that would be harmful to the animals. Just make sure to close your curtain for privacy if you have a savannah view room. My husband enjoyed the fitness room, which had nice looking equipment (I did not partake - I had enough fitness just walking to the room and around the parks). We did not eat at the restaurants at the AKL, but they looked really interesting. This seems as though it would be a great place to stay with kids: animals, fun activities, nice looking kids pool and playground, etc. In addition to the massiveness of the resort, the other negative is that it is pretty far from everything else in the Disney resort. We drove to Downtown Disney the night we were there, and it took around 25 minutes to get there!! Imagine how long it would take on the Disney shuttle bus, which probably stops at a few other places before getting there, not to mention the possible 30 minute wait for the bus to get to the AKL in the first place. The AKL is close to the Animal Kingdom, but it is not really within walking distance or set up for walking to the Animal Kingdom park, so you need to drive or take a bus. Although this was an enjoyable visit, and it is a unique and classy place to stay, I would probably not return. It was fun for the day, maybe even for 2 or 3, but I think that the resort could get tiresome for adults after awhile. Next time we will stay at a more centrally located resort.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort in Disney”
Reviews.Author: GNJL
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best resort on the Disney property. I have to admit the concierge and front desk staff were less than stellar but the rest of the employees, from the housekeeping staff, dining staff and especially the "safari guides" more than made up for it!! It is an amazing lodge, and the experience of waking up to zebras, giraffes, etc. right outside your balcony can't be beat! The rooms are a bit on the smallish side, and bring your own toiletries but other that, it was clean and nice and comfortable. It's not a suite at the Four Seasons, but then again, you don't get a wild safari outside your room at the Four Seasons either. :) The pool is amazing, very shallow but it's big (deepest point was 5'). The slide was so much fun that I found myself queuing up for it with the 5 year olds. The best thing about this resort is that it is sparkling clean. With all the animals, you would think that it would have a bit of a smell but it doesn't. I think they try to overcompensate for any hint of smelly-ness by being super super clean. It was the cleanest pool I've ever been too and it doesn't even have a chlorine smell, which was wonderful. THe gym is a bit on the smallish side (3 treadmills, 5 elliptical trainers, 4 tvs, weight machines, free weights, excellent locker room facilities), but again, spotless. THey have tons of staff at the hotel, always cleaning, stocking towels, straightening chairs, etc. All were very polite and accomodating. The MARA foodcourt was wonderful. Great food, freshly prepared, larger portions than the parks. I ordered waffles one morning and they made me fresh waffles even when there were some already made on plates! The bus service is a bit long and slow, but mostly b/c it's the resort furthest away from the parks. But even so, we were able to come back to the hotel to swim and take naps during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Does not deliver...”
Reviews.Author: Dusty-traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here to see what the hype was all about, and were extremely disappointed. Granted, we did not have savannah view rooms, as we stayed using discounts on our annual passes, but the rooms were dark, small and lacked ambience. We have stayed at various other Disney properties and this one is far the worse. Our favorites are the Contemporary and the Polynesian, and we have also stayed at the Wilderness Lodge, the Grand Floridian, the Yacht Club, the Beach Club and the Boardwalk. In fairness, it is a very expansive hotel and the vistas of the animals is a wonderful sight. The hotel pool is okay, and the gift shop has come very nice one-of-a-kind ceramics that are handmade by African artists. My chief complaints were that the rooms were very poorly lit (in fact, the whole hotel was quite dim), the decor was drab and depressing. The level of service was distinctly lacking (I was on hold twice for more that 20 minutes just to reach the front desk, and staff seemed somewhat indifferent) Also, if you are planning to stay out late in the parks or elsewhere, do not plan on getting anything to eat at the hotel, as there are NO restaurants open after 11, and room service is also not available after that hour. In comparison to other Disney resorts mentioned above, the rooms at the Animal Kingdom Lodge are much smaller, and the bathrooms are closets. The bunk beds are a nice touch for the kids, but trying to get a family of 4 ready to get going using a bathroom where we had to stand in the shower to close the bathroom door was a bit of a challenge. We did go to the restaurants, and the self serve Mara was entirely adequate for the kids and the food quite palatable. The African Stew was a surpise hit for us. Boma is the buffet style restaurant, which had many food selections to choose from -- unfortunately, much of the food was of low quality and/or cooked to death. We did finaly manage to get a nice peice of medium rare prime rib which was excellent, as was the flat bread. The pool was fun, and finding chairs was not a problem. The kids loved the zero entry and the slide. We asked for rooms facing the pool, as the kids enjoy swimming after a long day in the parks. All in all, I suppose it comes down to a question of tastes. I did not enjoy this hotel, and will not be staying here again -- even if they offered $50 per night room rates. Though we had a car, and even with the Disney transportation, this hotel is not convenient to anything but Animal Kingdom (and even that is not accessible by foot from the hotel)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Fabulous, Exceptional, Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: dizzy25
Reviews.Content: The most fantastic hotel we have ever stayed in, myself, my husband and our 10 year old daughter just returned from AKL what a wonderful place, as soon as you walk into the loby it takes your breath away. The staff are so helpful, we had been allocated a standard room (view of parking lot normally) but were upgrade on check-in to a savannah room, this was such a big plus for as as we were travelling here to celebrate my husbands 40th birthday. When we opended the doors in our room to the savannah view we were meet by three beautiful giraffes out daughter was speechless, we all spent many a morning just watching them. The staff at check-in arranged all are character breakfasts/dinner reservations for us and we so helpful and made many suggestions to make our stay more enjoyable. The rooms are spotless, our maid was excellent, every day upon return we wold find the toys our daughter had purchased on her bed arranged in different poses, the funniest was when Stitch was attaching Mickey!!!! We booked the holiday approx 16 months ago and have read many different reviews over that time some not so good, yes, the hotel is dark, but the theam is Africa, and this just adds to the atmosphere. All the restaurants are excellent and each one caters for your requirements as you would expect. I have read on prevoius reviews that the hotel is a long way out from the parks and that the Disney bus service is not always that efficient, well this is completly incorretct, it takes about 15-20 mins the the Magic Kingdom, but remember that because you are on top to the Animial Kingdom Park it only takes 5 minutes and on average 10 to the rest of the parks including the water parks. Longest we waited for a bus going to park or returning was no longer than 10 mins. If you go to Animal Kingdom Lodge you will have more that just a normal, boring stay at a hotel, even after a long, hard day at the parks, it is a pleasure to return to the hotel to enjoy a different experience, we had so much fun just walking back to our room and trying to spot the diffentent animals at the viewing points on the way. This was our fist time staying on a Disney property, the best decision we made, and although the hotel was FANTASTIC, we plan to visit in about another 5 years we would try another hotel, but can only hope it lives up the ANIMAL KINGDOM LODGE!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best resort in Disney”
Reviews.Author: rabrassard
Reviews.Content: I have lived in South FL for over 22 years, and go to Disney on a fairly regular basis. Nothing could have prepared me for the surprise of this resort. My son's 7th birthday weekend was spent watching animals through night vision goggles, eating at Boma (the she crab soup and african spiced prime rib are inspiring), and watching giraffes from our free upgraded savannah view bunk bed room. He didn't want to leave the lodge..and neither did the rest of us! Tons of activities at this resort for all ages! They have a board posted so you can plan your day. They also gave my son a birthday pin and notified all of the places we were dining of this special occassion. He got 3 cakes-fantastic! Plus a personally autographed picture of Mickey Mouse hand delivered to our room the night we arrived. How can you put a price on that? The theming, music, dim lighting (which seemed to have a magical calming effect on everyone including little ones), the African artwork proudly on display, the staff playing drums and singing, the fire pits inside and outside of the resort, the huge pool at night..I could go on and on. It is the definition of Disney Magic. From the moment we arrived to the time we departed, the staff treated us like friends and went out of their way to make sure we were happy. We are already planning on going back in December with our 3 day play pass (we only used one day, as the birthday boy found plenty to do other than the parks.) Our excuse? Our other son's birthday! From a Disney regular who has been to almost every resort, take it from me...we found our "home", and if you love animals and the amazing culture of Africa, you will find yours, too.

Reviews.Title: “Surprized by hotel”
Reviews.Author: junekimble
Reviews.Content: Just returned for the ACL at Disney, we were so looking forward to this trip. It was to celebrate my husband's 50th. Great transportation from airport. Check in marginal, had a trainee, without help doing our checkin. The Room- dirty coffee cups, with cracks, and no coffee for the morning, beds looked like the spread had been just pulled up and someone had sat and watched TV. The Linens- the towels and face clothes, thread bare, how sad for such a upscale place. Frontdesk, sure I complained and they gave us another coffee pot (didn't need). and about a months worth of creamer and sugar, and one packet of coffee. Daily newspaper. well they didn't get enough for all the rooms....... This place prides itself for its ambience and for the animals, oh yeah the view of the animals, not bad, had a better view of the power plant and trash containers for the resort. Will we ever go again, Disney yes, Animal Kingdom Lodge, noway.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: loved the hotel.stayed from the 3rd sept till the 9th and it was great.had a great view of the animals from the balcony.even if you dont get a room with a good view there are plenty of places round the hotel to view the animals.the hotel staff were helpfull and polite and check in didnt take long.i found the food to be delious and they had a good range at good prices for a hotel.i would advise anyone who hasnt been to this hotel to try it.the pool was big and i loved the 2 spas.the gift shop has a good choice of stuff ranging from toys to good quality hand made crafts.the disney transportation is brilliant.the buses run every 10 to 15 mins and you just hope on outside the front of the hotel and they take you to all the disney parks and water parks.well worth the money.i will definately be going back for my next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Disney_Skier
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights in early August. The room consisted of two double beds, which suited us well, being a family of four. The room was spacious, with a fridge, TV, and coffee machine. (I drink tea only, and this produced horrible tasting tea!) There were three restaurants in the hotel. The Mara, by the pool was a self service restaurant, serving a good choice of food, with some African choices. We also had the buffet breakfast and dinner in another one (cant remember the name) which also had African dishes. Good food but a little on the expensive side. Some of the earlier reviews said that the hotel smelled of animals - we did not notice this at all, and enjoyed looking out of our hotel balcony onto the savannah watching the animals grazing. The only complaints I have was: The pool was too warm, and not very refreshing when trying to cool off! I also wanted some help at Guest Services and had to wait for ages, there was only one person on duty.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Concierge Level!”
Reviews.Author: ritzlover
Reviews.Content: We surprised our kids with their first trip to Disney last week. They had seen Animal Kingdom Lodge online and really wanted to stay there to see the animals and sleep in bunk beds! I reserved a Savannah View Deluxe Bunk Bed room. At check in I asked for any upgrades, where I was told I could pay an additional $60 per night for Concierge Level........SOOO worth it!!!! When we got back from the parks we freshened up in our room and headed upstairs for wine and beer, excellent hors d'ouvres and a kiddie buffet with wonderful chicken nuggetts, PBJ sandwiches, chocolate milk, etc. One night my husband and I ordered a Chef Salad from the Room Service menu and had it sent up to the Concierge Level. One salad could feed an army and it was delicious.....only $10.99! Lovely breakfast in the mornings with Cappuchino, coffee, fruit, etc. They also keep a large TV on with Disney cartoons for the little ones! As for our room, it was very dark and a little on the "worn out" side.....but we were really only in it to sleep and bathe! And we truly didn't see a ton of animal activity either. But having Concierge access was great. It is about a 20 minute bus ride to/from the Magic Kingdom, but the bus is clean and air conditioned. It seemed a bit taxing on families with strollers. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: Sitarra
Reviews.Content: This is my all time favorite Disney resort!! We have been staying here once a year since it opened. The lobby is magnificent. The rooms are very spacious and clean with large balconies. The beds are comfortable. We loved watching the animals at all hours. I recommended being on the right hand side of the resort where the savannahs are larger. The savannahs on the left hand side of the lobby tend to be smaller with more views of fences and utility vehicles. The only problem I have with every single visit is getting the “view” we like. Some savannah views are not as good as others. We like to be on one side of the resort but for some reason, those rooms are always “not available”. After numerous complaints, we are always moved to a better location. Don’t bother trying to get into your room before the check in time, because they say the rooms are never ready. I want to address some of the complaints I’ve read about this resort. I know there are a lot of complaints about the price of food. This goes for the entire Walt Disney World resort, not just the Animal Kingdom Lodge. Food is overpriced everywhere. I recommend renting a car and eating off site for an inexpensive meal. Unless you have a reservation, most restaurants have one hour or more wait times. The Mara has good food, and is less expensive than the other restaurants on site. The Lodge has one store, and yes, the items are expensive, but what other store on Disney property is not expensive? Disney does have a very good marketing team that ensures guests coming off of any attraction or key areas in hotels be paraded through a store so the kids will beg their parents to buy, yet, another over priced Disney item. Depending on the location of your room, the walk to the bus stops can be pretty long, but when you’re staying at a larger resort, that is normal. Make sure to get the bus stops early because they usually come every 20 minutes or so and sometimes you may have more stops along the way. If you love animals, this is the place to be. It’s absolutely breathtaking! We will never stay at a different Disney property. I highly recommend this resort!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best vacations we've ever enjoyed!”
Reviews.Author: Momof3GorgeousGirls
Reviews.Content: My husband, 5 year old daughter and 23-month-old twin daughters and I stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge for 10 days and it was incredible! I have been singing their praises to anyone who will listen, it's that good. Upon check-in, we asked nicely and were immediately upgraded at no extra charge from a parking-lot view to a Savanah room, overlooking the Sunset Savanah, one of three in the resort. This was a $1000.00 value from what I've read! My daughters and I enjoyed seeing three giraffe when we settled into our room. It was so serene and beautiful, the view from our balcony. Throughout our stay we saw zebras, wildebeast, African cattle, antelope, warthogs and pelicans FROM OUR ROOM. There are common viewing areas throughout the resort where many other animals can be viewed. Our room was decorated with authentic African artwork and remained immaculately clean during our stay, except for one night when we lingered till about 1 pm, and the room was never made up. When we returned at 7 pm, I called the housekeeping number, and they sent someone in 30 minutes, and chocolates were left on our pillow after turn-down that night. We had an issue with milk at the lodge, in that my twin daughters drink about a half gallon daily and the only milk available in the marketplace in the lobby was little pint cartons. We inquired about larger sizes at the concierge, and she said she'd find out. Later that evening, she called our room and informed us that the had sent a runner to the nearest Walgreens and purchased for us 6 half gallons, which they would store in the hotel fridge and give to us incrementally as we needed them in our mini-fridge. Now THAT's SERVICE with a smile! The hotel lobby is nothing I'd ever seen before, very austere and incredible. Lighting is dark and mysterious, and my husband and I enjoyed looking for the seven "hidden Mickeys" that are subtlely placed througout the decor. The staff members milling around were in African costumes and indeed they were on assignments for a year from African nations and were so lovely and informative to speak with. The restaurants: Unbelievable! Jiko is the signature restaurant and it was delicious. I had the Mahi Tuna and the Stuffed Halibut and everything melted in my mouth. Just as good as Daniel and Nobu in Manhttan, in my opinion. Except that Animal Kindom was family-friendly withought selling out their fine-restaurant integrity. Our waitress brought over comlimentary fruit dishes for the babies as we waited for our courses to arrive and she anticipated our every need. What a wonderful experience. And all the wines are African and quite good. We ate at Jiko our first night and chose to repeat our resevation our last night. A little pricey but worth it. Boma is a buffet restaurant with even more African influences in the preparation of the food, so you need to be more adventurous. It was all very tasty, though. For example, the breakfast buffet had a curried corned beef hash selection which was awesome. The swimming pool is great, with a water slide you can't get sick of, even after 50 times down. The pool is colored gray-ish and not your regular blue water to resemble an African watering hole. It was in keeping with a wonderful Safari theme. I was impressed with how many lifeguards they had on duty (4 or 5 at once) who took their jobs seriously, which is good, considering there were lots of kids. There seemed to be pllenty of international travellers at the resort which speaks to the fine reputation of this excellent resort. Their bus services to the theme parks were prompt and efficient. My husband and I have travelled all over the country and the Carribean and Greece and France and even Malaysia, and the Animal Kingdon Lodge was right up there with the Big Guns. Highest recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic out of this world”
Reviews.Author: KentSue
Reviews.Content: Fantastic, marvelous, brilliant what a holiday! This was my first visit to America and my sons (age 11) my Husband has been many times(not at this hotel) We were given a room miles from reception and as I am disabled & in a wheelchair we changed to a room closer to the lobby the hotel staff were brilliant. The rooms were cleaned every day and the Towels and flannels were made into great animals! which we all loved. The hotel is fantastic out of this world,the pool was brilliant with a slope going into the pool (easy access) the hot tubs were a little too hot but brilliant,the towels were lovely and in constant supply & everywhere so clean & tidy too! We saw newly born Flammingos, excellent! and the giraffes well I could have filmed them all day. My husband,my son and myself had such a wonderful time and would definately return and spend more time looking at the wonderful hotel and go to the African talks that they have during the evenings.The guides were so helpfull and you can ask them questions about the animals,one of the girraffes is due to give birth. We didnt eat in the hotel restaurants,we brought mugs though which are brilliant too! We would go back tomorrow Animal Kingdom Lodge is a must!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was accommodated at the Animal Kingdom Lodge from August 28 - Sept 01 2005 with my husband and two kids, ages 2 and 5. The hotel was absolutely beautiful and the service was great. My savannah view room with two queen beds comfortably accommodated my family and it was great to come in after a long day at the parks and sit on the balcony, with a glass of wine and watch the animals below. Meals on the whole were good. Unfortunately I did not experience dinner in Jiko or Boma but I had breakfast in Boma and it was excellant..good choices, great taste. Mara was convenient when we wanted to get a quick bite before and after hitting the parks. The staff were very friendly and courteous from housekeeping to the staff in the market place. The complimentary bus service was dependable and the drivers were friendly, polite and jovial. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay here again on my next trip to Disney in 2007. Kathy-Ann B. Barbados

Reviews.Title: “It was beyutifool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This by far the nicest and cleanest even though we went i Jan it was just a little bit chilly if you want to go in the winter stay there food service was excellent get water slide every thing was great the views even though we were on the 5th floor it was defently excelent

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: glyndab
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before and have had a great time. We had a Savannah view room this time and it may not be worth it in the heat of the summer as the animals are not out that much because it is so hot in August. We were there the 19-22 of August. We used the spa for massages- which was great and the gym which also had state of the art equipment. The pool was nice - the complaints about it being dirty are silly - it's the coloring of the pool. The kids complained about how hot the pool was - but the weather was hot, maybe there is someway to circulate the water so it isn't so hot in the heat of the summer. It's not fun to jump into bath water when it's 95 degrees out! Had dinner at Boma which was good - but not the best place for kids who are not adventurous eaters. I would not stay here unless you rent a car, it is tough to get around. No problems when we checked. The people at the front desk seemed tired, but not overly grumpy. May have been because it was late on a Friday night - but they were lacking a bit of the Disney magic. All in all a great hotel, with a unique theme and I would continue to stay there on my future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Lot of show, little on details to make it a must do”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I suppose we should have immediately asked for a room change when it ended up being the furthest one from the lobby...but we didn't expect to do a lot of in hotel back and forth traffic. If this is important, take note right at check-in (with the little map they give to indicate how to get to your room) so you can try to switch when you haven't unpacked or gotten your luggage sent to the room. The room was a small step up in decor from our previous stay at the (very motel-like) Port Orleans. I attribute the colds we all got on a hidden air conditioning vent that was directed on our heads all night. For this price range, I was looking forward to slightly more attractive bed and soft linen...oh well. On a positive note, housekeeping was quick and thorough, the balcony overlooking the vista of zebras, giraffes and wildebeasts was wonderfully baby-proofed (so we didn't have to panic when our toddler was out there), and it was nice having a fridge to keep our night supplies and snacks. Highly recommend the Jiko restaurant for a great dinner (amazing steak!) and bring your child/ren, they serve with a smile, so please recipricate and keep yours entertained for the nearby diners. The Bomu buffet for breakfast was filling and had a few unique African dishes. The marra is typical cafeteria/mcdonald-like. Last note: This is the most isolated lodge so either plan on taking your rental everywhere or depending on the disney buses. Even so, it is a quick drive to Magic, Epcot, Animal and MGM.

Reviews.Title: “The Best In Orlando!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have my Disney pass and myself and my friends go all the time to Disney.The animal kingdom lodge is by far my fav place to stay in Orlando.I took my mom there for her birthday and just to show you what kind of people Disney employee's she left her wedding rings in the room and the room attendant found them called her at home and then mailed them to her.She had the rings for over 30 years and was sooooooo glad to get them back.I just cant say enough good things about this place.From the lobby to the people they employee that are from Africa to tell you tells from their homeland to the beautiful pool and the wonderful restaurants.Once you go you will find yourself going over and over.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel ... Gorgeous Views”
Reviews.Author: simon_cse
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this hotel .... apart from amazing...... The hotel building is fantastic and the lobby is just breath taking. The shear size and scale of the lobby takes your beath away. We were lucky and were given a savanna view on arrivial. Booked the hotel as a package in the UK so not sure what room we should have got. Views were amazing and we could always see animals when we looked outside. There are 'rangers' wandering around the grounds of the hotel who are happy to answer questions about the animals or Africa (they are all African). Some reviews have commented that the staff are unfriendly, this is simply not true ... everyone we met went out of their way to help us. Every day the 'maid' left a towel animal - was great fun. Some people have also "moaned" about the size of the rooms, although they are not massive, they are more than adequate - besides who spends much time in their room in Florida. We spent most of the days in parks or by the pool. BOMA is a fantastic restuarant and I cannot recommend it enough ... although do make reservations as you can wait hours for a table otherwise. One note of caution this is a 5 star hotel, but probably only just - do not expect as many facilities as the grand floridian or contemporary resort, which cost a lot more. But the hotel does provide everything that most people could want, 3 great restaurants, pool, fitness suite, creche, ..... and more than I could list. To sum it up the best hotel I have been to in Florida (this is my 6th visit), cannot recommend it enough. Live the Disney Magic.

Reviews.Title: “absolute must.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My son, Grandson and myself stayed here four days and enjoyed every second of it. Animals right outside your room day and night. A fantastic lobby, great staff, nice rooms, pool and real good restuarants. We will stay there again. A must to come back to after the parks. A real different experience. Charlie

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Resort..... its ok”
Reviews.Author: kecia
Reviews.Content: The Lobby area of this resort is absolutely georgeous. The rooms are very small, a little tight for a family of 4. When booking this trip I specifically asked for a room with the bunked bed and 1 queen size bed. That was not available at the time of us checking in. But we were moved the next day with no problems. May I suggest the Savannah view. It was cool watching the animals getting fead in the early morning. The restaurants there are ok way over priced but everything at Disney is. I've been to Disney at least 4-5 times and I must say that the shuttle services to the parks are horrible. It use to be that you waited no longer than 15 minutes, now you are guaranteed to wait at least 1/2 hr. We almost missed our dinner reservations one night. And we gave ourselves plenty enough time to get there. Also be sure when purchasing your park tickets be sure they include the water parks. We found that out the hard way. You would have thought that a $4,000. 00 Disney Vacation Pacakage would include your water park admission. Over all my family had a pretty good time. I hope you all find this info helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Warren10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at AKL in June 2005, what a perfect place. The restaurants serve excellant food. The breakfast at Boma is equal to none, best breakfast in Orlando. We were with our grandkids they thought it was wonderful, the service throughout AKL cannot be faulted, for example when the maid service found out there was small children in the room she made Disney character shapes with towels and left them on their beds, which always thrilled the kids on returning to the room. Activities are arranged throughout the day. Viewing the animals from your room was great and the lobby is spectacular. All in all highly recommended. The pool which slopes gradually is ideal for anyone with children, with pool games organised for kids, waiters coming around the pool aking if you require anything, all makes for an ideal vacation. For my work I stay in lot of hotels and AKL takes some beating.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: foofoome
Reviews.Content: We have been to DW 3 times in three years, and have NEVER had ANY trouble with this hotel. We tried Wilderness lodge last time, and left after one night to go back to AKL. It's clean, warm, dark, cozy, and if you like the African savannah setting you will like this hotel. If you are more into bright and sunny, beachy, or uptown feel, you will probably feel this hotel is too "dark", as it is a true LODGE. We are decorating a room in our home to match the feel we get when we visit. WE LOVE AKL!!

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded at the Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently took our first trip to Disney and stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. Myself, husband and two kids 13 and 8. We arrived at 10:15 am on Sunday July 17th, and although we booked a standard view, we we given a complimentary upgrade to a savanna view... 4th floor, kudu trail, sunset savanna. It was wonderful! There were giraffes and other animals outside our balcony at all hours of the day. Because we had booked at a rate of only $124.00 per night, it was a most definate bonus. We thought that the hotel was beautiful and there were many activities that kept our children busy. The pool area was very nice with a slide that, although not huge, was alot of fun for all of us. Our room was very clean and housekeeping provided the kids with towel animals all week. We ate mostly at the quick sevice Mara, as it was convienent. I regret not trying Boma, the buffet, or Jiko. The food smelled delicious. We did order room service several times and service was always pleasant and prompt. The resort also provides a fitness area, as well as an arcade for the kids. Although there weren't any watersports, we never felt bored when we were there. It was very relaxing and didn't bombard you with all things Mickey. It made the trip from the parks back to the room, a treat in itself, just to come into the lobby and know that you were staying here. The bus service to the parks were fine. We never waited longer than 10 minutes for a bus and because we shared with no other resorts, they were never crowded. We bought a few items from the gift shop and were very happy with the selection of everything from artwork to Disney souveniers. The staff was always friendly and we will not hesitate to stay here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We live in Florida and were looking to go someplace for a quick weekend getaway with our 6 year old daughter. We were able to get a great rate at this lodge and decided to give it a go. It was fabulous. The decor, the staff, the amenities were top notch. Just sitting out on our balcony and seeing the animals was fun and relaxing. There are a lot of activiteis for children and it's nice to have the fitness room on site as well. I would recommend this place to all of our friends. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely breathtaking. The initial view of the lobby will grab you the second you walk in. I traveled with my 10 year old daughter, 8 year old son, my mother (age not disclosed), and my 7 year old nephew. We were entertained by the staff from the minute we were checking in from the minute we left. From pintrading, to story telling, to an evening informational speech about South Africa, the staff go out of their way to make sure that everyone is enjoying themselves. Boma will have your taste buds opening from all of the delicious food offerings. I highly recommend at least one meal here (call for reservations!). The one thing that was a bummer on the trip was that the housekeeping accidently grabbed my daughter's "blankie" and threw it in with the laundry. We had filled out a card from the "lost and found" and believed that the blankie would be returned. I waited about three weeks before calling the hotel in regards to the item. The gentleman that I spoke with was extremely helpful and found the blanket posted on the computer as "lost". Within one week, my daughter's blankie was back in her arms. Kudos to Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Beaky1
Reviews.Content: I've been Going to Florida for 12 years, and I'm not fed up of it. This hotel is the best I've been to. The food was great you cold choose from 3 restraunts, but the main one was the Mara. It was fantastic with the theme of Africa. The family rooms had a bunk bed, a double bed and a balconey. It is great for us all. It is amazing with all the theme parks and waterpark's. If you are looking for souviners there's a lovely giftshop in the hotel. In the pool for children, there's a slide and games. There's a mini club (Simbas club)with is open dailey. It's been the best hoiliday ever!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge( Best hotel )”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice now at the Disney Animal Kingdom Lodge and are planning our third stay. Of course the main attraction is the atmosphere. I mean who wouldn't like to have the opportunity to wake up, stroll to your balcony and see a giraffe browsing or Thompson's gazelle grazing, instead of a resort pool or worse yet a parking lot.One of the most noticeable things for me was how quiet the hotel is. Even when there are people busy milling around the lobby, it is still surprisingly quiet. Compare that to the All Star sports complex where we have stayed before and you'll see what I mean. One feature that makes this huge hotel seem "cozy" is the fire pit. It is a ring of chairs that circle a fire( propane) that guest tend to congregate at the end of their days at the parks. It is fun to meet people from all over the world and chat about things you've done for the day. At 10PM they had a nightvision monocular that guest could use to watch the animals at night. Most if not all of the staff are from Africa so a conversation with them gives you a glimpse into their homeland. Although this is a Disney Deluxe property( read expensive), we were able to get a annual passholder discount so our room was $166/night value season. Even at full price, this is one of only 2 Disney properties( Wilderness Lodge) where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge Is The Best!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband,myself, daughter and her friend(both age 17) stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge from June 11-17, 2005. This lodge is AWESOME!!!! We have stayed at other Disney Resorts before but nothing compares to this. From the time we walked into the lobby we were treated wonderfully. The staff went all out. The view was great, we woke up in the morning and had coffee on the balcony and watched the animals. Sometimes we started out later than we planned because we were watching the animals and just relaxing. The food there was excellent. We ate at Mara usually for breakfast-there is something for everyone there. We also grabbed a snack after we came back from the park from Mara. We ate at Boma once for breakfast and once for dinner-WOW-loved the different food and flavors. The room was definitely big enough for the 4 of us(deluxe savanah view room). Housekeeping went out of their way with towel art and different way of making the beds. TOO cute!!! The pool was great. We wouldn't stay anywhere else!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we were there july 16-17th,we had a blast the hotel was really nice we could see the animals from our room, huge swimming pool, fun game room , fire place to sit by at night inside the hotel, it was really nice. the only thing i didn't like was the bed wasn't really that comfy but other wise it was a great stay and i would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful experiance!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We checked in and were told that we had been upgraded! Our room was perfect, we saw animals outside our room around the clock! We will visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Disney Hotel We Have Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Of the numerous hotels we have stayed at in Disney World, this was by far the best. The staff is unbelieveably accomidating and the rooms are first class. The interior lobby, restaurants, and other public areas are top notch. The only draw back is the entire hotel is very dark. In terms of the savannah, our kids really enjoyed the views. Also, the pool is very big and quite inviting. When we go to Disney again, we will definite stay here. As far as I am concerned, it is a "can't miss" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Animal Kingdom Lodge is a great hotel to stay at in Disney. only problem we had was with check in, we booked 2 rooms but were told we only had one, and it took us about an hour and a half to finally get everything sorted out. then we were told the wrong directions to get to our rooms so we walked all over the hotel about 3 times until finally we were told the right way to go. other than that it was a great experience, the pool is amazing, HUGE and heated with a water slide. its a light brown sandy color on the bottom of the pool to make it look like a watering hole in africa. Boma is a great buffet to eat at and in the morning they give you Jungle Juice which is a mixture of all different fruit juices. our maid Jill was a blast, pulling practical jokes on us, making "towel people" on our rooms for when we got back at night. overall a great experience and hotel. saw animals in the savannah, zebras, giraffes, pelicans. everyone that works at the hotel is extra nice. it was sad leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: gemjarvis04
Reviews.Content: My partner an I stayed here for the full2 weeks of our stay. I was so amazed by the hotel that when we arrived I did shed a tear. I had been so excited and it was my first trip to disney it fulfilled all my expectations. Truely stunning although steer clear of Boma if u not a fan of foreign food. They do have a range of stuff for kids though.

Reviews.Title: “not that great”
Reviews.Author: nlewis29
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two children,ages 5 and 1, just got back from our stay at the animal kingdom lodge. We have stayed at several disney resorts and wanted to try this resort. The lobby was really impressive! Upon check-in I was informed of an upgrade from a pool view to a savannah, great! However, when we opened our drapes we had a slight view of the animals and more of a view of a hot tub; which my husband and I both agreed a pool view would have been better! I was also told when making the reservations that a crib was guarenteed; but I was told upon check in there was a pack and play in all rooms. The in room fridge was not that cold either. The pool area was not that great, considering it was a "deluxe" resort. My daughter wanted to go down the slide the whole time, and my son who can't swim yet favored the "zero depth" entry which was across the other side of the pool from the water slide! Also, kids were very aggressive going down the slide and the life guards never made an attempt to monitor when the kids could go down. The food selection was awefull! Aside from the covienant " Mara" cafeteria,there were only two resteraunt selections that was priced at least $25 and up, and the buffet style one was too busy and no openings until 8pm! Animals were lacking as well, not that many were seen like what was shown on the video. Our room was standard, however the bath tub had hair in it, and toilets were very noisey,as well as the room beside us. We will stay at another disney resort next time.

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday Ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to the Animal Kingdom Lodge on 28th May 2005 with my husband Mark and my two daughters rebecca Age 8 and Rachel Age 5 for 2 weeks. I feel I must put my feelings onto your website. It was the best holiday we have ever had. The staff were fantastic - nothing was an effort for them. They loved the children and went out of their way to help us and were very polite. I can honestly not fault anybody from the hotel including maids, restaurant staff, reception staff, valet parking and shop staff. The hotel was very clean with a good choice of restaurants. The pool was lovely and the children loved the fact that it was open later than normal pools would be open. All in all I would have no problem recommending this holiday to anyone - it was fabulous and we cannot wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Disney's best resort”
Reviews.Author: Luvorlando1
Reviews.Content: 6/7/2005-6/12/2005 What can I say? This is our 14th trip to WDW and this resort just isn't up to the Disney standards we've become accustomed to expect. I don't see how it is classified as deluxe. My 7 yr old son wanted to come here so we figured we'd give it a try. I was afraid of the darkness complained about so I got some 60W bulbs at W@lm@rt and night lights on our way and found that the resort used the same (I can't stand low lighting). The place & pool weren't filthy. Its themed like Africa so the pool bottom and resort walls were painted to look brownish red. On the other hand the hallway carpets were worn and ripped in some places where the different styles were meshed together and I've never seen this before at WDW. The food selection was terrible...and we're not too picky, EVERYTHING seemed spicy with exotic flavors, ICK. After day 1 we ate in the parks. Customer service was the worst I've EVER seen at WDW. On 2 separate nights I tried to call the front desk and they just let it ring! Once for info about transportation and the other to retrive a message THE FRONT DESK LEFT FOR ME and I couldn't get the darn light to stop flashing so I called housekeeping to speck with a Mgr. and the girl I got at housekeeping turned off the light. Not a Huge deal but not expected at Disney! Our refrige wasn't cooling properly and they made us wait 2 nights...un-heard of at WDW! Our only plus was our free upgrade to a savannah room from standard AAA. The animals were nice. My kids LOVED to see what was walking around outside our room but my husband and I got bored with the giraffes after day 2, they should switch stuff around a little more. Overall I say Eh. I was at WDW and my time in the parks made the trip a blast. However, part of the thrill of being at on WDW property is the continuation of the park-like feel in the resorts. Animal Kingdom Lodge just didn't cut it. We'll be back in Feb 2006 but will probably never return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “reply to not worth the $$$”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised at the experience that this person speaks of. We have stayed at this hotel numerous times and have always had a wonderful experience. The "murkiness" that they speak of is the color of the bottom of the pool. The bottom is on tan/brown side to give it the character of an african watering hole. We also have not had a problem getting chairs by the pool. The best part of the hotel are the animals. Nothing compares to having breakfast on your balcony and watching the animals. As deluxe hotel pricing goes, this hotel gives you the most for the price. You are more likely to get discounted accomodations here than at any of the other wdw deluxe hotels. When we check in we also ask for a free upgrade, which we have received each time!! The only drawback is it's distance from the magic kingdom. The 20 minute ride back late at night can be a drag with the little ones. My advice is never to pay full price for Disney hotels. Unless you go at peak holiday times there is always some type of discount available. You just have to ask the right questions. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: davall
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have recently returned from a fortnights holiday which we spent at the animal kingdom lodge; we thought it was fantastic.We had a savannah room with an outstanding view. We had read a number of reviews regarding the hotel about how dark the decor and lobby were but it is an african themed hotel so we wouldnt have expected anything else. We ate in bomas on two occasions and were very impresed with the variety of dishes on offer. Our room was lovely with two kingsize beds and plenty of room for the two of us. The only thing I would have preferred was to be closer to the magic kingdom as we had to use the shuttle buses which took us about twenty minutes. It was our first visit to Florida and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the lodge and would definately stay in a disney hotel again. We saw Cirque de Soleil in downtown disney which is a must see it was fab! We only wish we'd booked for three weeks as there was so much to see and do and we could have spent some more time relaxing by our hotel pool which was stunning!!

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: arrived at the hotel shortly after midnight after 12 hours flying and airport delays thanks to the hurricane.Was greeted by a young lady who checked us in and gave us our room key, got to our room to find the darkest pokiest room ever,my wife opened the curtains to find we were ground level looking at the bumper of a buick in the car lot, if we had gone out to sit on that tiny balcony with no lighting and someone jumped into there car and turned the lights on we would have looked like two startled rabbits, my wife and myself were certainly not going to accept this room having spent $3000 and flew half way round the world, this was not what i was expecting, i went to see the girl who checked us in and made my point but to no avail she was uniterested and instead tried to rob me blind by insisting that if i wanted another room i would have to cough up a mind bogling $75 a night for a savanah view room on top of the 3k already paid( glad i didnt, must have counted all but 5 animals for the duration of our 2 week vacation) next morning complained again and was given another room , still dark, the beds are the most uncomfortable beds ever slept in and had bad back for 3 weeks whe i came home, also you can hear every toilet in the hotel being flushed the walls are that thin(counted the times people above took a leak ). food and beverages are ridiculously expensive,and takes ten minutes to walk from room to hotel entrance.My wife and I visit orlando nearly every year sometimes twice and would never stay here again give me a marriott any day,always wanted to stay on disney property but never again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $$$”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This review is for those that are contemplating whether or not to drop the $$$ on this hotel. We stayed for 4 nights at a whopping $1100. I don't mind spending that kind of cash on something that is worth it, but this is not. You are better off spending your money elsewhere. We requested a King size bed with a daybed, and not only did we not get it, but when I brought it up at check-in, the Disney cast member basically shrugged her shoulders. We were then put in a room with 2 queen size beds, and by the elevator no less. The next morning we had to call and complain, at which time we were kicked out of our room until 3 in order for them to find us adequate accomodations. WOW! We had to pack up everything and have it in "storage." Everytime we tried to call the front desk/room service etc. we were placed on hold--a couple of times I just hung up out of frustration from waiting...not something you'd expect when you are paying so much $$$. The pool is murky for some reason and ALWAYS overcrowded....never a chair around the pool. And, there is a weird musty smell throughout the hotel..... Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit, as good as the first.”
Reviews.Author: TonyCardiff_Wales
Reviews.Content: Having spent two weeks there in April 2004, we booked up again for this year. Having booked through Virgin with a standard room, I rang ahead a couple odf days before our stay and asked for and received a fee updgrade to a savannah room. Overall the hotel was as good as we remembered. Given a favourable exchange rate I found the restaurants fairly reasonable, until that is we ate off-site. Disney is very expensive compared to the rest of Orlando. For example, I bought a bottle of water for $2.50. Couple of days later went to a gas station and bought a case of TWENTY FOUR bottles of the same water for $2.99!! Front desk staff were friendly and efficient, although the staff at the Mara were as miserable as sin compared to other staff in other restaurants around Orlando (maybe because they don't get tips????) The pool seemed less crowded than last year which was a bonus. Agree with some of the comments that it does seem very dark, but maybe that's the ambience they're seeking to achieve? All in all, another very enjoyable time at AKL! One criticism of the Parks (same as last year) are the long lines to get through the bag check. Ok, I can accept the need for security, but it's very frustrating to queue up for so long for the security people to make only a cursory poke around with a stick. The bag checks at Kennedy Space Centre are far more detailed (AND handled with greater effieciency). If you're going to make people wait for a bag check then at least check them properly!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic time at AKL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week stay at the Animal Kindgdom Lodge. What a great experience!. For any who have read the negative reviews and are concerned about staying here please take a second look. From check in to check out we had nothing but positive experiences. I had also read the negative things about this hotel and until we arrived I was sure that we were going to have a horrible time in a dark and unclean hotel. Nothing could be further from the truth. Upon check in, the desk clerk was courteous and helpful. He upgraded our room without us asking and even suggested making a dinner reservation while we were still at the desk. We had a savannah view room and saw different african animals every day!. As for dark we felt it lent to the atmosphere of the theme of the lodge. I loved the smell of the wood and I considered the long walk to our room a great form of exercise. As for the long wait to get in to Boma, there was none. We had a resevation set for 8:50pm. We went down a little early and were seated within 10 minutes of our arrival. Although my children ages 19 and 14 were not too excited about the food, they did admit that there were things on the menu that they thougoughly enjoyed. As far as complaints about the bus service, we have none. The longest wait we had was our first night when we went to downtown disney. We waited approximately 20 minutes for the bus. Other than that, we caught a bus as early as 08:00am and as late as 12:30 midnight with NO problems. Our room was great, we were a family of four and did not find the room too small or uncomfortable. Our housekeeping crew was both efficient and accomodating. We made many request for towels,pillows etc... we were given our request within the hour always with a smile and never with a hand out. The pool was always clean and for those who thought it was dirty did not understand that it was the coloration of the pool bottom. If they found towels every where that is because your fellow guest were too lazy to return them to the towel stations. My family truly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and we would stay here again. There were many activities that we did not take advantage of only because we did not have time. The staff was wonderful and the hotel was beautiful. Those who had complaints were looking for something to complain about. They did not allow themselves to enjoy the essence of the AKL. Our only complaint , the Florida rain and humidity.

Reviews.Title: “A Really Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tolandowski
Reviews.Content: This was a really cool hotel. It was really fun looking at the savanna with the animals and there were people from Africa there to answer questions about the animals and hotel. The rooms were a little dark and not really that big, but nice, clean, and very, very well decorated. The food at the resort is pretty good, but expensive. The lobby is very cool. You enter through the 3rd floor. We were there at Christmas time, so there were African Christmas trees, and one night there was even a bell choir concert. There are fires at night around the savanna and I heard that there were story tellers. The bus service was good to all places around Disney. We got a very good rate- about $130 a night at Christmas!

Reviews.Title: “Our "African" adventure”
Reviews.Author: jgot
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth trip to Disney World in about 15 years. Normally we stay at a "moderate" resort. But this time, we decided to splurge with a more expensive resort, staying less days. Because we probably will not get to take an African safari, we chose to spend three nights at Animal Kingdom Lodge, splurging for a savannah view room. Right up until we arrived, we wondered if it would be worth it. After all, a hotel room is a hotel room, right? Wrong. This proved to be one of our best vacation decisions. The first time we opened our drapes and saw a zebra, we could not believe our eyes. Each night, we would stop in whatever park we were in and find a bakery, to buy something for breakfast. In the morning, we would brew a pot of coffee and take our cinnamon roll, danish or other treat out to our balcony, sit in our zebra chairs and watch the animals. When we stayed elsewhere, we would be up and out early to explore the parks. At Animal Kingdom Lodge, we discovered it was harder to leave the hotel than we ever imagined. At 10 a.m., when we would finally decide it was time to head to a park, we would see a pick-up truck drive through, throwing branches and some other food from the back. And suddenly there were giraffes, zebras and grass-eating varieties everywhere. It was like another, separate park. We actually took more photos in the hotel than in Animal Kingdom or Epcot. For those who cannot afford to spring for the more expensive Savannah rooms, there are public viewing areas everywhere. Since man cannot live by oggling animals alone, the hotel has a buffet (Boma) and a sit-down restaurant (Jiko), both offering African-influence food. We chose to celebrate our anniversary at Jiko and were able to sit at the cooking place, where the chef's prepared the appetizers. One was from South Africa and shared some thoughts on the differences between the cultures. The food is amazing (sitting at the cooking place, we were tempted to order appetizers only, and the chef's put together a tasting plate for us, but we were glad we didn't miss the short ribs in tamarind glaze, too). The next night, we came back for dessert, and ended up ordering a chicken barbecue flat bread instead. The restaurants all serve African wines and beers, which just adds to the experience. Even the "fast-food" restaurant, Mara, has some interesting choices, including a chicken tandoori pizza (which we split as our post-travel snack) and the zebra domes made famous in Boma. While Animal Kingdom Lodge is tucked into a corner of the Walt Disney World property (making for some long trips by Disney bus to get anywhere), it was more than outweighed by the experience of staying at this beautiful lodge and spending time looking at the animals. We have already discussed returning to this hotel in the future, even though we used to prefer trying different hotels every trip.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting and fun, but worth it?”
Reviews.Author: EyeMD
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 5 day visit. I made my reservations through the WDW desk for 3 rooms, standard view, connecting rooms (offered by resrevation receptionist), and microwave in one room. I confirmed with the hotel that microwaves are available for no extra charge. When we came in, we found that our room rate was less than quoted ($215 rather than $239) and although the higher rate was charged to my credit card as a one-night's stay for deposit, I didn't complain. However, they said there were no microwaves available in the hotel. After stressing that I made the reservation only because a microwave was available, a manager was brought out and assured that a microwave would be there by 3pm. Because we arrived too early to use our rooms, we went to the parks and returned at 6pm to give my 3 year old kid some dinner. We found our rooms were not connecting (which we needed for babysitting purposes) and no microwave was available. We went to the front desk to complain (because we waited over 15 minutes on the phone for some help), and when the desk clerk said "I'm sorry but there are no other available rooms" many times, a manager finally helped us and gave us connecting rooms with an upgrade to Savannah view for all of our rooms available the next day, and said a microwave was going to be delivered from another resort (which it did). However, one of the rooms had a view of pipes, and when we brought this up, the desk clerk said "We are doing you the favor by switching you, so don't complain" (shocking from a Disney castmember!), but another talk with the manager got us what we needed. Finally, the last 3 1/2 days were wonderful. Standard view rooms face the parkinglot, and some are near the bus station to the parks. UNless you come to the hotel for the resturaunts or the savannah view lounges, I'd try a different hotel. Standard view rooms are significantly cheaper than other deluxe Disney hotels, but the magic of this place is in the view, so I'd consider a moderate hotel if you can't spring for the savannah view room. The hotel has lots of character, and it was fun to stay there. The Mara is a cafeteria style resturaunt there that was quite convinient. The pool was nothing special except for a small waterslide, and was always overcrowded. The transfers to the parks were excellent. Rarely waited more than 10-15minutes. Once the downtown Disney bus was a 30 minute wait, and my family once gave up when the Magic kingdom bus didn't show for over 30 minutes. The good thing about AKL is that it is by itself, so no other hotel pickups on the ride to & from parks. Overall, the trip was fun. Alot of mistakes, but the managers tried hard to rectify them. The savannah view rooms were great (but we got them and standard rate). No regrets, but next time I'll try a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but inconvenient.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm not usually a person who splurges on hotels and vacations, but this year my hubby and I decided to go all out and take our daughter to Disney and stay with the animals. I researched and researched. We decided on the Animal Kingdom Lodge since our daughter was young and might take naps during the day, and in the mean time hubby and I could hang on the porch and watch the animals. Here are some good things about AKL: The actual check-in was a breeze. We were greeted at the door by really friendly employees. We were amazed by the beautiful lobby. All of the employees were very friendly, never holding their hands out for a tip. The pool and hot tub were both clean and seemed well managed. There were 3 places to eat, and 2 bars. The cleaning people were honest. As an example: My daughter had left the $10 bill her Aunt gave her on the bed. Wouldn't you know the $10 was sitting on the side of freshly made bed when we returned. It was a good feeling. Bad side: It is a dark resort. I don't know why they keep it so dark, but it makes you feel like it's the middle of the night all the time. It really didn't bother me too much though. My allergies were a little wacked out because there was a constant smell of wood burning. Reservations were required for the restraunts, or you weren't getting in. We even got a reservation, and we still didn't eat until 9PM! We were sick and vomiting all night over the food, as well, but I tell you it was delicious food, maybe we just ate too late... There is no complimentry breakfast!!!! My hubby's still in shock over this. We spent a bit more money to get a room facing the sunset savannah. It was about $1,700 for 5 nights. Considering that we paid about $340 a night, I would have hoped they could give us a muffin or something. There was a resonable shop in the lobby that sold 1/2 gallon milk cartons, so that was nice, and there were fridges in the rooms. Don't order off the menu for room service! It would cost you $12 for some pancakes (not including some OJ)! How do you justify that? Transportation to and from the parks was wicked on the shuttle busses. We sat and sat for our bus to pick us up, usually seeing other parks come about 2 times before our bus would come for our resort. The rooms were overall smaller then I thought they would be for the price, but there was generally at least 2 animals outside of our room at all times. They fed them under out rooms, and the animals slept under our rooms with some simulated moon light so you can see them sleeping. All-in-all a great place to stay, but if you plan on being at the Disney parks for most of the time, it might be pointless to stay here, because you don't really have the time to enjoy it much. My daughter ran to the window as soon as she woke up to see "Gina" the girraffe (she named one), so I can justify us staying there when I saw that little face light up. They had drum parades for the little ones, but I didn't see any other activities, like story telling or the such. Maybe I just missed it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got home from a week at the Animal Kingdom Lodge at Disney World. It was a terrific experience. The hotel was wonderful and the staff could not have been more helpful. My husband and I are well seasoned travelers and found this resort to be perfectly suited to our needs. The rooms while fairly small were the perfect size for a couple. We were greated every morning by 3 to 7 giraffees, zebra, ostrich and wildebeast. Housekeeping was perfect and our room was consistently cleaned prior to 11:00 am. All of the restaurants on site are great. A special kudo has to go to Jiko. The service and wines are top notch as well as the food quality. We ate at the restaurant on two occasions and both meals were perfect and the servers were able to guide us through the menu and wine list with perfect suggestions. Mara (the quick service restaurant) has a great selection of fruits, sandwiches and desserts available at any time. Room service was great and it was a unique experience to dine on the balcony as giraffee and eland grazed nearby. The pool area is wonderful. The pool is at first an off putting green but it perfectly clean. Upon closer examination you realize the color is due to the bottom coloration of the pool. A bright blue pool would be out of place on an African savannah. Poolside drinks are excellent especially the Mt. Kilamarita and Victoria Falls Mist. Bus service was quick and efficient. Our longest wait for a bus was 15 minutes and our longest commute was 18 minutes. This is the only way to travel the "world". Highly recommended property!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be afraid”
Reviews.Author: gfap13
Reviews.Content: I mainly wanted to write this post to give some reassurance to those such as myself, that tend to worry too much about the negative reviews for a certain location. I am currently in the process of planning a ten year anniversary vacation for my wife and I, and it seems that no matter how nice a place is, there are going to be at least twenty percent of people that hate it. I've gotten really discouraged, because I haven't been able to find any place that at least a few people have'nt written horrible reviews for. In order to give myself some reassurance (and be able to overlook the negative posts), I thought I would check reviews for the most enjoyable place I've ever stayed, and see what people had to say about the Animal Kingdom Lodge for review comparison purposes. I now feel better because although there are several people that hated the AKL, I thoroughly enjoyed it and would go to spend a few days just at the AKL without any thought of ever leaving it. My family and I spent one week at the Animal Kingdom Lodge in February of 2003. My biggest regret was not taking an entire day just to spend at the lodge. Contrary to the opinions of some earlier posts, it is a resort with plenty to do. There were many scheduled activities that we just didn't have time to do while we were there. We didn't even really have much time to enjoy the animals or the artwork, let alone the programs. The pool was clean, very large, and generally terrific (heated year round) and there were scheduled activities for kids around it at different times during the day. Animals were very interesting and there were programs (listed in the program guide) that you could attend that related to learning about the animals. Botany program also (missed that as well). There were other activities including African Storytelling by campfire that I also missed. One of the really interesting things was getting to talk to several of the employees (many of which are on two year terms from Africa). The architecture, authentic African artwork, overall lodge design, etc. were extremely interesting and very well done. Boma (buffet style restaurant) was very good. I enjoy gourmet cuisine and will have to say that most of the food at Boma was better than the entrees my wife and I both had at California Grill (bill for two at CG was twice as much as for three at Boma). Ate at several "classy" Disney restaurants during the week, and Boma beat them all. Due to the fact that the lodge was modeled after a merging of different African Lodge styles, it was somewhat dark and was layed out in an elongated fashion. I didn't mind the several minute walk to the lobby, it gave me a chance to stop and look at some of the animals (we didn't have a Savannah view room) and some of the artwork in the hallways. The room was large enough for three people (we pretty much only slept there), and was cleaned daily (the housekeepers took extra time to do something special for our child almost every day as well). Overall, if you want to stay in a place where you can be absorbed in the African Culture for a few days (without the bugs, poverty, and disease) in a very classy and fairly authentic way, then you will more than likely enjoy the Animal Kingdom Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up to Snuff”
Reviews.Author: HelpfulTraveler
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my Disney experience but AKL rooms don't compare well with others in the $300 - $400 range. Check-in at 3:00 p.m. was prompt and professional. Lobby is impressive and well maintained. Hallways offer multiple viewing sites of adjoining animals. Four days/3 nights in "Savannah Deluxe Double" (i.e., animal view - 2 queen beds). Typical U.S.-size room with shallow balcony: semi-private double basin vanity, private commode/tub chamber, keyed wall safe, small fridge, coffee maker and supplies, walls/carpeting in browns, furniture of heavy black wood. Room very dark b/c of theme decor (photos are brighter than reality b/c of flash); vanity felt cramped; wall safe large enough for a laptop but capacity limited b/c of vertical mount - key required, not a combo lock; sheets are "hospital-grade;" no wifi/no direct internet access/no on-site business center; questionable housekeeping/cleanliness: hair on "clean" pillow upon arrival, neglected to remove dirty towels after replacement; failed to replenish coffee pack. Guest Services (for info/tickets/reservations) understaffed: long lobby wait for rep/failed to answer phone for inquiries from room. A long bus ride for airport & theme parks; bus access to other Disney resorts inconvenient. Large, shallow pool popular with families. Excellent food at on-site restaurant BOMA - don't be put off by buffet-style service. If using "Magical Express" bus service from airport pick up and transport your own luggage (transfer by Disney staff yields a 4 - 5 hour wait for luggage delivery). In summary, if you're a road warrior accustomed to Marriott or Courtyard you'll be disappointed. If your travel experience is more limited, AKL is a fine choice. Presence of animals is a redeeming feature.

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom was fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: hstar29
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Walt Disneyworld and I have to say it was one of the best vacations I've had.We stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge and it was stunning,from the lobby to the room to the pool,absolutly beatiful.I also stayed at the Boardwalk Villas for part of my trip and although it was very convenient to get to MGM and Epcot it could not hold a light to the Animal Kingdom Lodge.The restaurants in the Kingdom(Jiko and Boma as well as the counter service Mara)were wonderful as well.Our check in took no longer than 5 minutes and everyone was friendly and helpful. At Disneyworld the lines were nothing like I expected.We must of picked a great week to go because with the exception of magic hours nights we did not wait on any line for more than 20 minutes,most of the time not even that long.The fastpasses are also a great invention and must come in really handy on the really busy days.We went the 2nd week in May. All in all everything was wonderful.Loved it and will go back to the Animal Kingdom Lodge again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty! Poor Management! Very Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Makai7
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Disney Animal Kingdom Lodge as part of a 6 day visit to Florida. The plan was to take my 9 year old son for a whirlwind tour of 4 parks in three days. My husband has wanted to stay at this hotel ever since he learned that it was being built. We have stayed at the Yacht Club (in 2000) and he has also stayed at the carribbean beach resort about 14 years ago. The decor is amazing as always- I cannot complain about that. The ability to see the animals is a treat.
