HOWEVER: we had planned to use the "magic your way" express from the airport- but never received any documents or information prior to leaving home, so we instead decided to keep our rental car and drive to the resort. When we checked in at approximately 10:30 am (the first of our three days in the parks) we were given a DIRTY room. We were given absolutely no information about the resort, the park hours, or any type of welcome packet. All we were given was a map of the resort and the maps of the four parks. Since we didn't want to waste time, we dropped off our luggage, put on some sunscreen, and headed to Magic Kingdom, expecting the room to be cleaned when we returned. When we arrived back, tired and hungry, the beds had been made but the room still had the the dirty towels, used soap, used dental floss, and former room occupants trash in it. Needless to say, I had to make a request to have the room cleaned and to specify to have the sheets changed. I got no more than an apology for the misunderstanding. The next morning we took one look at the pool and almost became ill. It was green and cloudy. My son was hoping to get to go swimming, since it was still cold in New England, but even he didn't want to go in after looking at the condition of the water. Absolutely filthy and disgusting. The resort was also beginning to show some signs of wear. I would say- do not stay here! It was not worth the price- you are not getting anything better here than you would at any of the Disney hotels. The restaurants were outrageously overpriced. Buffet breakfast for the three of us was over $45.00, and there were no real special items available beyond omelets made to order. These are Hawaii prices, but not Hawaii quality. The appearance of the parks was also dissappointing. They are not as clean as they used to be, and the staff are not as helpful, or friendly as they used to be. The sight of McDonalds everywhere was also not what was expected in a Disney experience. We did have a good time, but this is the last time for us at Disney. When we arrived home, we found the information for our "magical express" package, including coupon for complimentary lanyard and trading pin for my son. I called customer service to voice my complaints about the resort and the delayed documentation and they really did not seem to care. The only response about the condition of the pool was "did you speak to the hotel manager?" and a promise to be called by him. That was last week and I never received a call.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Disney stay”
Reviews.Author: alshin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at AK Lodge in Disney back in late March for 5 nights. The reason for selection of this hotel was Disney annual passholder rate of $199, which is great for "Deluxe" resort. First of all, they should not label this hotel as "Deluxe". As stated in this list many times before, the hotel is very dark, and has murky smell. My request for upper floor was not honored and I was put on the first floor with the view of the walkway to the pool. What was funny was that the front office person refused to tell me which floor I was placed on just 30 minutes before the check-in time as if it is a national secret. The room was murky, damp, and tiny, tiny, tiny. I found mosquitos in the room. 2 kids and 2 adults in that tiny and dark room for 6 days in a row was very tough. It is a very ill-designed hotel, as it took more than 10 minutes from the room to the front door. The pool was absolutely dirty. My kids refused to go back to the pool after the first jump-in. People save loungers with towels and do not remove them when they leave. They never enforce any policy about them, and I did not see any crew going around picking up those towels, so there are a lot of empty loungers with towels on, and many more people wandering about looking for place to sit. A lot of people complain about restaurants or lack of them, and I never attempted to eat at the hotel. The least amount of time spent at the hotel was better. The service was almost nonexistent. Immediately after I came home, I was e-mailed guest survey from Disney so I vented out everything, but I was never contacted back. I have been an avid Disney visitor for the last few years, and I sense quality changes in Disney hotels. They are getting older, and they charge enormously for those rooms. You can never get less than $300 for deluxe resorts whereas if you drive a few minutes out, you can stay at wonderful hotels for half as much. We still enjoy Orlando immensely, however, I would think twice about staying at Disney hotels. This was it for us.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it- even in a Hurricane”
Reviews.Author: alidiffin
Reviews.Content: This hotel rocked. My three year old loved it and so did I! We were actaully there during the big hurricane in Sept 2004, so we got put on lockdown, but they had just tons of stuff to do for the entire family! They kept the poor staff there for a couple days to enetertain us, but they were good sports. We loved the shuttle service and if you stay here you have to stay Savannah side, we giraffes right in our faces! We stayed on the second floor and that was perfect, there a ton of different animals out everyday, The pool area is great, the gift shop is enormous, and the restaurants are definetly interesting! I was totally impressed with the lobby, it is awesome! The deco of the place is fantastic, our favorite resort at Disney so far!

Reviews.Title: “loved AKL”
Reviews.Author: jolily
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the AKL two different times, once in a standard room and once in a savannah room. We had three rooms each time and our family absolutely loves this resort. The gift shop, the lobby, the pool, the animals, and the restaurants were all great. We ate breakfast and dinner at Boma once and most of the time at Mara for a quick inexpensive meal. Check in was a little slow but nothing that would make us not stay there again. We did not find it too dark but very relaxing and quiet, and only l time did we have to wait quite a while for a bus to leave one of the parks. We were fortunate enough to get a great rate, $l09 standard, $119 savannah, so we feel we definitely got our monies worth.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the African Theme.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In December of 2004, my fourteen year old son and I stayed at the Disney Animal Kingdom Lodge for 3 nights. The hotel was lovely. It was all decorated for Christmas and they had special events going on at the hotel. All of the hotel workers that we came in contact with were friendly and courteous. It was so much fun to step out on your balconey and see animals. The hotel has big picture windows you can look out of as well. There are areas on some of the floors of the hotel, where you can step out on a large balconey and there are chairs and viewing glasses to see the animals up close. The swimming pool area was clean and pleasant. I would highly recommend this hotel. The bus service was efficient and the bus drivers were very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved the Animal Kingdom!”
Reviews.Author: Lanikai
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Disney's Wilderness Lodge, Disney's Yacht Club, the Hard Rock Hotel and the Royal Pacific (both at Universal), and the Animal Kindgom was the most impressive and the best themed of all the hotels. The service was impeccable and attentive. The on site restaurants were absolutely fabulous, although you could make up a great meal at Mara, the onsite "cafeteria". Although it took a bit longer to get to the different parks than at other hotels, the onsite bus service was prompt, and since it wasn't shared with any of the other hotels we always had a seat. For information on how to save on your hotel reservations and your Disney trip, check out (---), a wonderful source for Walt Disney World related information, and (---) for an automated trip planner.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Management”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Animal Kingdom Lodge last night. I will agree with most of the complaints posted. The hotel is dark and needs more lighting. It is very difficult to get dinner reservations. We called 1 week earlier for dinner at Jiko. We were given a reservation for 10:00PM, with 2 small children. We did go and saw other families in the same position. Check in took over 40 minutes at 8:oo at night. Guest services is where you can purchase your park tickets. Again at least a 30 minute wait. Cast Member gave me a price of 727.00 for two day hopper passes. When I asked to have a printed out receipt she realized the price should actually be 607.00. We did not have a bell hop for check in or check out, not offered. Stingy on toiletries, 1 tiny bottle of shampoo for 4 people. It may seem as if I am nit picking, but we paid 358.00 a night for 4 nights. The hotel is very pretty and the view is really as nice as they show on their website. We did not notice any activities or tours of the grounds taking place. we did inquire with various cast members and did not receive any information. The worst experience happened at checkout. We had requested a late check-out. Upon leaving our room at 2:00pm the housecleaning manager was waiting at the door. With a big Disney smile he told us we had been charged an additional night stay for late checkout, $358.00!! I said that was unacceptable and we would not pay that fee. He told me again and again , "We have already charged your Visa." I immediately called a front desk manager who told me she would back up her peer and the charge stod. My family and I left so upset. I knew once I was home and could contact the proper management the charge would be reversed, but what a way to end our trip. My husband and I felt sick the entire flight home. I even tried to call someone from the airport, but was given the same girl Casey. Casey was completely unflexible and insulting. I did contact the general manager, Rick Allen , who assured me my account was credited and apologized for the unprofessional behavior. Unfortunately with an ending like that to an expensive vacation you do feel victimized. With that being said I do not think we will return to Disney for a while.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel- nice view of animals”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just came back from the AKL and thought it was okay. My 3 year old daughter loved the view of the giraffes outside our window feeding from the trees. The valet parking was an issue and they lost our car in the system twice. Good thing was this gave us free parking at the parks and valet at all the resorts for dinner. Due to issues, hotle did credit our valet parking fees though. The rooms are small and the food expensive. We did not eat in the restaurant but ate at the quick service restaurant which was just okay. The staff was helpful, our room was ready when we checked in early at noon which was a plus. Overall, I prefered staying at the Imperial Palms condo we had rented for the previous 5 nts as we had more space, the use of Marriott's facilities and were just 5 mins away from the parks and outlet shopping. Probably would not visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Family Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Brian9900
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights and loved the experience. Spectacular African themed lobby with both inside and outdoor sitting, fire pits and observation areas. Our inside savanna view rooms (3rd level) were great for observing all types of african wildlife. We had 2 adjoining rooms and found them to be comfortable and clean. One room had two queens while the other had a king and bunks for the kids. Food at the buffet was excellent,varied and well prepared (ate to much), the service was great given we were in the midst of spring break. Just plan ahead and booking a table is not a problem. Booked both rooms using one Disney annual pass ($500 cost) and received a 40% discount ($1,500 saving) on all accomodation and a further 10% discount for having an AMA memebrship. Go figure! Kids all voted to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “ALK - Definate choice”
Reviews.Author: PaulTravels
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with our two teenage daughters stayed at ALK for 11 days over spring break. It was our first stay at ALK. We enjoy Orlando very much (Disney, Universal, Sea World) and have visited over 12 times in the past 15 years. We have stayed at most of the Disney properties, from value to deluxe, and we would rate ALK as amoung the very best Disney has to offer. We would recommend this resort and we would stay there again without hesitancy. That said, we shop heavily for deluxe resorts on the web and pick the best priced resort we can find, this is how we came to ALK for this trip, but, our absolute favorite resort in Orlando continues to be the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress Resort. We read many of the Trip Advisor reader comments and we found most of them on target. The rooms at ALK are suitable for 4 people, but tight. The general room lighting is a bit low, but we found the lighting in the double sink and make up area to be good. The toilets DO flush loudly!! Our room #3366 was as far from the lobby as you can get, and it was a hike, but, with the distance brought a very quiet room--refreshing after the parks. Our room did not face the interior savannas, it faced an exterior savanna, but we found the animals were very often right in front of our room and our view was very private. The pool is large and the zero entry was really great for vey small kids, seniors, and handicapped people due to it's gradual slope into the water much like walking into the water at the beach. The hotel was at capacity when we visited, every room filled, and by 1:30 the pool was getting crowded. By 3PM not a chair was to be had with guests returning from the parks. We wondered, now that we have a "grown up" family, if we would have been better served at a more business focused property like the Swan or Dolphin, possibly some of the rooms would have been occupied by business guests reducing the demand on the facilities the resort offers?? The room we were in, and I suspect each room , had a mini refrigerator, and a fold up type bed for an infant that was stored in the closet. Housekeeping and hotel staff we found to be excellent, but as noted in another review, if you are used to the towel animals, mints, etc. of other Disney deluxe properties, they do not do that at ALK. The rooms, lobby, and whole resort are absolutely beautiful and are worthy of a full day to explore and enjoy. Without question this is a resort you need to stay at, even if it is only once. Generally, you feel really good about where you are staying. The Mara cafe was very good for morning quick breakfast and lunch around the pool. Boma (buffet) and Jiko (table service) are the restaurants at the site. These offer African themed foods and both are top notch, and not only for Orlando. The word is out on both these eatries as many many people from outside the resort were lined up to get into these two restaurants. Definately make priority seating arraingemnets well in advance for both these resaurants. I commute around NYC so I do not like buses on vacation, so we rent a car. Parking for the car was no problem and we saw buses pulling into the lodge very frequently so I do think the bus service was good even though we did not use it. We find with the car we are free to come and go as we like and we travel to Sea World and Universal as well. Last, a case of Budweiser at a supermarket in Orlando was $20, compared with $5.50/bottle at the ALK. Similar savings on wine for my wife. For the kids we bought the $12 mug when we checked in and it was refillable at the cafe for all their soft drinks for the length of our stay. That's it!! If you are on your way to ALK enjoy!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced ,poor service and average food”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the animal kingdom lodge and can honestly say that it was one of the worst hotels we have stayed in .It is expensive ,the service is poor ,you have to queue for everything and the restaurants are so overbooked ,we were told on arrival ,with two young children that there was no way we could get a booking in either of the two for the first three days of our stay .They suggested a fast food restaurant in one of the parks or the pool cafe ,which serves the worst junk and cheap processed food .They even charge for polystyrene cups to put your drink in.Apart from a few animals ,we did not see any Disney characters at the hotel ,the pool was overcrowded and grotty ,people were having to change on the side of flowere beds as there was no where to stand.also they give you very little information to help you navigate the Disney experience ;there are no bus timetables so you can wait ages for a bus ,which stop at 10.30 ish without warning.The only shop in the hotel is expensive ,sells only Disney stuff and the staff were unhelpful.The rooms are small ,dark and you can hear the people above flushing the toilet! All in all ,The hotel only distracted from the Disney experience and is definately not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Cold weather, but great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at AKL in Dec. for 4 nights. Moved over from Port Orleans French Quarter. Bell services transferred our luggage for us. We were told our luggage would arrive between 1 and 3 in the afternoon. It was there about 2 pm and delivered by a very friendly cast member. She pointed out all the animals in our savannah view room!! We tried to get reservations for the first night at Boma, but couldn't get them. We went down anyway, fairly early and got seated right away. The food was awesome!! The weather was quite cold, so we didn't get to use the pool. It looked very nice, just steamy from the weather! Our room was very nice. The vanity and bathroom area were decorated very well. Besides having a closet and the drawers in the tv cabinet, there was also a dresser for storage. Lots of room for clothes. Check-in was very pleasant - we even got in our room early. Enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous! Gorgeous! Gorgeous! ”
Reviews.Author: JaniceNJ
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge over spring break. It was absolutely incredible! We paid for a pool view room, but were upgraded to a Savannah view, and WOW were we glad we were!! The view was AMAZING! At any point there were giraffes, bison, antelope and various other plains animals wandering by our window. It was awesome. The room was clean, the staff was friendly and very helpful, the Mara (cafeteria type eatery near the pool) was great for my 7 year old son and a quick lunch or breakfast...I just can't say enough about it. I stayed at the Wilderness Lodge last year and was less than impressed, but we LOVED this place. The only bad thing I can say is that if you don't like to walk, you might have a problem...the savannah rooms can be a bit far from the buses and pool, but if you're like us and prefer the exercise, there is nothing bad to say.

Reviews.Title: “Loved lodge at Animal Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: AneWeehawken_NJ
Reviews.Content: Overall a great property. Beautiful. However the people working the front desk and guest services need to have attitude adjustments. We went during Easter break...never will do that again....too many people at the parks...... Loved it will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Rumble in the Jungle”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi, we have recently stayed at this hotel for four nights, it was the final stay for myself and my two children aged 13 and 11, of our twelve night holiday in Orlando. Our first hotel for three nights was the Royal Pacific at Universal and our second was for five nights at the Residence Inn at Seaworld. (I have posted separate reviews for these hotels) This was the part of the holiday that I had booked as a treat for myself and I was very much looking forward to my stay here. I had got a good deal by telephoning from the uk for an offer that was on the USA but not the UK web site. Staying here was mid price between the Royal Pacific and the Residence Inn. We did not get off to a very good start. We were early but not that early for our check in and after waiting for some time to check in there were no rooms available and we had a further wait. We could ring the front desk to check if our room was ready in about half an hour, and had to hold for a while to get through. Finally we were given our non smoking room number, we had booked a poolview room and were offered a room on the second floor. This room clearly smelled of cigarette smoke even though it was non smoking and we rang the front desk to complain. Again there was a wait on the phone followed by a wait at the front desk as we were reallocated a room on the 5th floor. This was a much better room not only from the smoking point of view but also the noise from the pool was less and that there was a view over the treetops. The bell hop rang to say that there was a delay with our luggage, after a further twenty minutes we had to chase it up again. Time was marching on and it had taken us about two hours to check in. (from 1pm to 3pm) One further irritation of our check in was that the boys surnames were wrong on their keycard, the cast member who was checking us in originally was unable to change them after clearly not being ok with the computer system. Luckily the second checker in was much more competent and was easily able to change them. So, yes this is the most beautiful setting but completely undermined by the most painful check in ever. Mostly when uk guests read reviews by Americans regarding room size then we know to take them with a pinch of salt as Americans are used to much bigger rooms. It is not just that the rooms are small, but there is no where to put anything. Also the bedside lighting is badly designed, the choice being between sleeping in the middle and having two lights on (one of them shining on the other bed) but being near the switch or sleeping on the outside and not having a light switch or come to that a bedside table either. Luckily I had a torch with me. It was nice having the balcony, they are very small but I enjoyed the fresh air. Once we got over all of this, then we did actually enjoy our stay here. There are many places to view the animals if you dont have a savannah view room. It has to be said that it is the african guides who enhance the experience, they are very helpful and cheerful and clearly enjoy sharing their love of the animals and promoting their home country. We had previously stayed onsite at Disney's Dixie Landings and I would say that there was a definate lack of Disney service compared to our stay there. I know that people complain about the transport but we had no problem with that. The food and service at Mara were standard Disney foodcourt service. Sadly we did not have the opportunity to dine here. As the days went by we did relax and the children enjoyed the pool and slide. One very lovely added bonus was that Mickey and Minnie visited on Easter Sunday and we finally got a taste of Disney magic. So overall it was ok but I would try another onsite hotel before staying here again. It is a beautiful hotel and has the unique setting with the animals but we missed the space of the Residence Inn and the 'Fast track' of the Royal Pacific. p.s. if anyone from Disney reads these reviews, and they should. Please consider an added fast track system for onsite guests. Even if it is not feasable to do the all out universal system, then at least let onsite guests fastrack from their hotel under the existing rules instead of having to visit the actual ride.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing for everyone !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge IN MARCH and it was great !! It was myself and my son. we had a great time. My son is a disney pin trader so we were always on a bus going to downtown disney! The bus service was Excellent, the bus came every ten minutes. It only took us 14 minutes to get to downtown disney!!! The Boma was probably the "Best" restaurant on all disney property, and believe me ive eaten in almost every resort and epcot restaurant and this was the best so far. Ive stayed at All-star music , polynesian, carribean beach and beach & yaht club resort .This was the best one ! The animals were so visable from the room (savannah room) It was nice to wake up every mourning to a giraffe eating outside the window. My son is 14 and he loved it! Who ever gives this resort a one star must of had everything go wrong! The staff is amazing , "signature staff " Most friendliest resort on disney property. Im going back in dec. and guess where im stayin ?? AKL OF COURSE !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at the lodge 3/19-3/21 and loved it! I followed advice I read from other posting about checking in early and requesting an inner circle room. The girl at the front desk said they were at full capacity and she didn't think there were any left, but she would check. She found one on the 3rd floor, I told her I was excited because I was there with my mom celebrating her 60th birthday. We went to our room and were amazed by the beautiful view. It was awesome to sit on your balcony and see numerous animals. We had a fridge and a coffee maker, maybe that only comes with savannah view rooms? They remembered I had told them it was my mom's birthday and the next day an autographed picture of Mickey @ the Lodge in a card was delivered to our room. It really was a nice touch. We ate @ Boma for dinner. It was good, but I'm not big on exotic and different foods. I signed up for the Disney Visa a few weeks before our trip, the first time you use it you get $25 rewards card. I used that for half the bill @ Boma. Check it out, $25 comes in handy @ Disney! We went to Cirque Du Soleil....definitely recomment seeing that show!!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Animal Kingdom Lodge on March 21st. We stayed in a Savannah Room and loved being able to step out on our patio and look at all the wonderful animals. The staff was excellent. The staff members there who talked to you about the animals and Africa were wonderful and also funny. I coulden't say enough about the lifegaurds. My favorite was the housekeeper we had all week. Our children brought there stuffed animals and everyday she would do something different with them everyday. One day she had them at the end of the bed watching Disney Channel and they had the remote control in there hands. Then on another day she had them sitting on chairs looking outside at the animals. Then on our last day there she brought them a new stuffed animal. She was great!! Our room was very clean and the pillows were so comfortable. We only ate at one of the restuarants there and it was very good. It was fast food like. The pool was great. They have fun activities to do there for the kids everyday. The lobby is beautiful. It was a wonderful expierence and I am so glad we payed the extra money to stay at that resort. It really made a difference in our family trip. The transportation to get from park to park was great! I would diffently stay at this resort again. I am a Travel Agent and I will definently recommend my clients to stay here if they can afford it!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic, as expected”
Reviews.Author: MillsMC
Reviews.Content: Geez, Louise, how can you go wrong with a Disney hotel? The staff is fantastic, the architecture amazing, the landscaping pristine... The only question is how much do you want to pay for this? Don't get an animal view or a pool view, and go in the offseason; this is the cheapest "Deluxe" resort on the premises, and it doesn't disappoint. However, you don't get ANYTHING for free here, no fridge, no microwave, no free continental breakfast, not even free coffee. It seems the more you pay for a hotel room, the less you get for free. And they aren't giving away food at the restaurants. The counter-type restaurant downstairs is your best best for value. We ate at the buffet restaurant one night and the food was very exotic and delicious, but the $25/head price was hard to swallow. They offer valet parking, but we didn't use it; the parking lot is right there. The pool is great, even by Disney standards; it has a zero entry and a water slide. I just wish I bought the soundtrack to the resort. Also, the bus system at Disney World is the best; so easy to use, especially for the Magic Kingdom, since it takes you right up front. MK is such a pain if you drive. You don't have to stay here to see it, however. Just take the bus from any park. You can also buy tickets at the resorts.

Reviews.Title: “A Dream Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent visitor to Walt Disney World. During my last visit with my girlfriend, I decided to splurge a bit and stay at a "deluxe" resort. I have to admit that staying at the Animal Kingdom lodge was worth every penny. The lobby is awe-inspiring. The Savannah is beautiful to look at. We particularly enjoyed the opportunity to observe the animals at night with the night vision goggles one of the keepers provided. The room was beautiful. The Boma buffet has excellent, unique food. I'm a picky eater and was hesitant to dine on African specialities. I was pleasantly surprised. There was a variety of food and great deserts. The staff is extremely helpful and accomodating. I would definitely recommend the resort to Disney visitors. Disney is not Disney without staying at one of their resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: dickson_thunder
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. We only had to wait about 10 minutes to check-in and our room was ready although we checked in around 10AM. We were given a room on the same level (3rd Floor) as the main lobby and only about 100 feet away from the lobby. The room was clean and nicely furnished but I found the bathroom to be extremely small. A small refrigerator is provided with the room which I understand is standard with all Disney moderate and deluxe resorts now. I found the overall theming interesting and we did see several animals when we were on the savannah overlooks. (Although not as many as we thought we would). I found the service to be friendly for the most part. I would stay here again if we had a discount "Code" that reduced the price down to 55% of rack rate but I don't think it would be worth it at any price above that.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Overview: March 15, '05”
Reviews.Author: Butchhall
Reviews.Content: Wow...Previous reviewer must have had EVERYTHING go wrong! Anyway, my wife and I just returned March 15th, after 5 nights in Animal Kingdom Lodge. I suggest paying extra for the "Savannah" view rooms, it was neat observing the wild animals outside the balcony. Our check-in took only 5 minutes, and we were off to our first adventure, La Nouba, which we highly recommend. We then had a late dinner at Boma Restaurant, in the Animal Kingdom Lodge. Our wait was less than 15 minutes, and we actually arrived almost an hour before our reservation. WE MADE ADVANCED RESERVATIONS AT OUR RESTAURANT CHOICES BEFORE WE ARRIVED AT THE PARK, WHICH ALLOWS FOR "PREFERRED SEATING". We did not have delays being seated at any of the restaurants. We found the staff to be helpful and polite, throughout the park. The free shuttles run on-time, so don't bother to use your car (if you brought one). We found this lodge to be absolutely beautiful and the wild animal theme was effective and tasteful, with employees playing the roll of safari guides and interacting with the children and adults. We fully recommend this resort, and it appears to be on "par" with any of the other upscale resorts in the park. A couple of items were true.....first, the lighting is low, not only in the rooms, but also in the other public areas. Perhaps this is by design? The Boma Restaurant was not my favorite, but my wife liked it. Our best dinning experiences were at Artist Point and California Grill, but both are more expensive, and neither recommended for small children or guests wearing teeshirts and sandles. Rainforest Cafe is neat for small children, and the cafeteria at the Lodge has macaroni & cheese for those little ankle biters.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely- One of Disney's BEST!”
Reviews.Author: jpocccoc
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that we have stayed at several resorts in Disney, including: Polynesian, Contemporary, Shades of Green, Carribean Beach, Port Orleans Riverside, and All- Star Sports. Though the Polynesian remains my favorite, the Animal Kingdom Lodge now runs a close second! I have read other reviews with complained about the "darkness", room size, and availability of animal viewing, but I have no complaints! Yes, it is dark, especially compared with other Disney properties, but the dim lighting is part of the atmosphere and African theming. I loved how intimate the lobby was, with clusters of seating, and a fire place. The bar continues this this "feel" by combining upholstered furniture with traditional bar seats. The rooms, though small, are beautifully decorated, and have ample drawer/ closet and vanity space. The hotel is shaped like a horseshoe, with the "best rooms" in the inner circle. Our room faced the outside, yet, from our balconey, we awoke each morning to see a variety of animals. Our favorites were the giraffes and little wild pigs! Even if you don't have the best view from your room, there are glass breezeways throughout the hotel, where you can spot the abundance of wildlife. We ate at the counter-service restaurant, which was ok for a quick bite, and also at Boma. We loved the buffet at Boma. The food was delicious and unique. The kids also enjoyed the pool and water slide. (There's a poolside bar as well.) There are many activites around the resort; from cookie decorating to educational experiences with the animals. There is an on-site spa where my friend received a GREAT massage! The staff was friendly and helpful. Maid service was unremarkable (They didn't even clean the coffee pot or replace coffee!) However, friends of ours who stayed on another floor at the same time had exceptional service, including the cute towel animals! Overall, this resort is a wonderful family resort. I would also enjoy coming here with just my husband because it is very quiet and relaxed compared to many Disney resorts (Like the Contemporary and All- Star especially!)

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe Resort does not live up to the word”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge for 3 nights in March 2005, which turned out to be 2 Nights, because we thought the service and overall stay was so horrible that we left a day early!! We arrived about 7:00pm on Friday and after it took us almost two hours to check in and get our luggage we headed to our room (The room was very dark , had two queen beds and very hot ..the heat was on???) .....we had realized that they didn't give us our park tickets, so we had to head back to the front desk, stood in line again and after about 45 minutes they told us we had to go to the will call window to get our tickets the next day? We also reported that our heat was stuck on and were told that someone would be up to fix it.(you had to leave the door open to breathe) After another 15 minutes or so, we finally got our tickets and headed out to get dinner. I ran up to the room to grab a few thing and there was a girl leaving with our thermostat unit, she said she would repair and replace it before we got back ( she also had 5 other units from other rooms and told me they were having big problems with them that night). There are three restaurants in the hotel, one is upscale, one is a buffet and one is a cafeteria. The Buffet and Upscale restaurant had 1 1/2 - 2 hour waits, and the cafeteria was just that...a cafeteria. Due to the fact that it was very busy at check-in, you were NOT told much. Not where go to take a bus, not where special things where going on, where to get info, etc. It took us about another half an hour to get out of there to find dinner...we ended up grabbing a cab, rather than wait for a bus...we were starving. We went to downtown Disney for dinner, we arrived about a half an hour before the restaurants closed...but we made it! But then we couldn't figure out where the bus picked up to take us back (we had taken the cab, so we couldn't find the bus stop). Finally after walking around the entire place we found the bus stop (quite a walk to get to). We arrived back at our room around 2:00am, and we immediatley checked our thermostat, because it was now frezzing in our room. It was on 65 and blowing cold (it was 49 degree's outside that night)....so we turned it up to 68 degrees and it blew HOT air again....there is NO OFF button so we had to sleep with the patio door open and the heat basting to balance the air?? We were up all night either freezing or sweating...thank goodness for the extra bed, because we had to take all the blakets off it and use them! We actually held our blanket in front of the vent to warm them up because our room was so cold. We finally got up at seven, and just said forget this. We called down to tell them that our thermostat still was not working properly, we asked them to send someone up, as we were going to the park for the day and also to send up extra blankets, just in case! We got back around 8:00 and had planned to changed into our suits and relax in the Jacuzzi after all the walking, we couldn't wait to relax. We opened the door to our room and it was about 90 degree's! We called down to speak with a manager and were told that they would call him and have him call us right away....my husband hung up phone and it rang instantly!!! My husband said hello and the man at the desk that we just spoke with says to my husband in a sarcastic voice," Room # 1234 wants to speak with a manager right away, their heat is in and they just can't stand it any more...blah, blah, blah", This is when my husband speaks up and says, Sir, this is room # 1234 and the guy just stops and says...oh, i must have hit redial, needless to say, my husband just hung up. So now the staff is being sarcastic and rude. So we wait for a call back and a half and hour later we have a knock at our door. Its two repair women, who tell us that the manager sent them instead, and that they were never sent to our room that day to repair it again. One tells us that she did what she could with ours last night, but that they couldn't get new one's until today. Now it 9:00, nobody came to fix or replace it while we were gone all day, and so we wait with them. After they make a phone call to the Head Repair man (on a radio) they ask him to come up, he says he is busy, she tells him it is an emergency and he tell her that she can do it....just check the such and such part. One leaves to get the new part and one stays with us. She returns and goes to replace the part...then a Pipe Burst and boiling hot water is shooting out all over the floor...and hitting the walls across the room....she is soaked and because the water is so hot they are scrambling to find towels or blankets to cover themselves, so they can shut it off and not get burned! It was beyond a nightmare! They now have to move us to another room. I packed everything up and we moved....our room was not on the same Savannah that we had in the beginning, but at this point, we don't care...we put our suits on and now its after 10:00pm and we go to the jacuzzi. I guess the part that really surprised me, is that we never got a phone call back from the manager. After the mess that just happened, I would have expected a manager to call us and apologize, and just check in on us at this point. But we got nothing, not a phone call, not a message on our room phone, not a note! We checked out the later on the next day. Things happen that are out of our control, but I am a business owner and can never imagine not approaching a customer to apologize for something like this. My husband and I get away once a year for a long weekend, as small business owners we work 6 days a week and so look forward to our little getaway, needless to say I would never recommend this property. I have stayed at other Disney deluxe Resorts and can tell you that the service at this Resort is unexceptable. Also, be aware that there are no mini-bars in the rooms, Room service food seems like it comes from the cafeteria restaurant, there is NO poolside service, and you cannot order food from the pool bar. The service level at this Hotel is very poor. As far as the animals go, they are hard to find and are far and few. Customer Service by far needs huge improvement, they just are not living up to what they sell you. I was also told that my package include a private safari for Hotel guest only, yet when we got there upon check-in were told we were not qualified, that this was for special guest at conceriege level only. I actually had another guest checking in directly beside me and overheard her telling her service check-in person the same thing...so when you are told that your package includes a special Safari...get it in writing. Hope this helps in making your vacation a better experience then ours.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Riot”
Reviews.Author: AvatarGirl
Reviews.Content: As a child-less "twenty-something" not quite ready to deal with other peoples' children, choosing a hotel in Disneyworld can be tricky. Our experience at the Animal Kingdom Lodge was perfect! They were very accomodating; from allowing us to check in early, to upgrading us to a better room, and finally calling us after our stay to alert us to the fact we'd left some things behind and they were already in the mail!! The hotel is very pretty, has a nice restaurant/lounge ambience, and- the part we were really blown away by- has the QUIETEST ROOMS! Even though we were overlooking the pool, we couldn't hear a single "marco polo"! The doors to the hallways were also quite solid, and we didn't have to wake up on those rougher mornings. This hotel seemed to have great amenities for families and couples alike. Also great in-room dining. I would go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “A Very unique Resort!”
Reviews.Author: jarmes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at the Animal Kingdom Lodge in February. We got a great deal with a resort discount code found on the internet. Our room was on Sunset Savannah, Ostrich Trail. We had a great view! We could usually see ostrich, giraffes, ankole cattle, all kinds of birds, and lots of other animals. The only animals we never saw were zebras, but we did see them at a savannah near the pool. The only restaurant we ate at was the quick service place for bagels, pizza, etc and it was very good. The pool was large and heated, but still a little cool in February. There are plenty of places to walk around and explore at this resort. It is very different from all the other Disney resorts I have stayed. One drawback is that the only Disney transportation is via bus, but we never had to wait over 7-8 minutes for one and usually just had to wait 1-2 minutes. It is farther to Magic Kingdom/Epcot, but the ride never bothered us. Conclusion: I would definitely stay here again if I found another discount available for a Savannah view room. I don't think I would like it as much if we had only a regular or pool view since I spent time out on the balcony looking at animals a lot. However, even for savannah view, I would not pay the regular Disney rate, just wait for a discount and save a lot of money for a great resort!

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge - An Orlando Hotel you have to check out!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge is simply the best hotel in Orlando to stay at! Having stayed at Universal's Royal Pacific Resort and Universal's Portofino Bay Hotel, I always seem to find my way back to Disney for that extra attention. Disney really out did themselves when they opened Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge. Animals can be seen grazing throughout the entire property even if you do not have a savannah view. As expected from Disney, the rooms are always CLEAN and maintained unlike some Universal on-site hotels (owned by Loews). Whatever you do on your next visit to Disney, just make sure that you and your family spends a night or two on the wildside at Disney's Animal Kingdom Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “AKL a Wonderful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed at AKL for three nights 2/7/05. After reading reviews I was prepared to not have a very good experience. Quite the contrary our experiences there were exceptional. Not one staff person was unpleasant in fact all were friendly and generally spoke to us first and could not have been more intersted in accomodating us whether for directions or providing service. The maid even brought us extra toiletries and made us a Mickey Mouse from wash cloths; and we had no children! Our check in was pleasant. I had read that the rooms were first come first serve so we planned our arrival for around 11:00. I requested a room on the inner circle and not only were we given the room of our choice but it was ready for immediate check in. We were on the 2nd floor which was wonderful for viewing the animals. We saw giraffes, zebras, wildebeast and assorted birds. Definately try to get a room on the inner circle for the best view. The rooms are small but adequate and vanity area is quite nice. All rooms now have a refridgerator and coffee maker (coffee was replenished each day). We did have breakfast at BOMA and while not extrodianary it was very nice. One evening we had reservations at Artists Point at the Wilderness Lodge. This was perhaps the best meal we had while at WDW the food there is exceptional and the wait staff were wonderful. The Lodge itself however though much like AKL does not have the serene ambiance of AKL and we were happy to return to our hotel. We did use the transportation system and the buses were most often prompt. As noted in other reviews these buses only serve AKL so you are not on endless stops at other resorts. If you drive to the lodge you are given a pass for your car which allows you into any of the resort areas or parks free. This enabled us to go to the Boardwalk one day for lunch and see some of the other resorts. All in all our experiences were very nice and much better than indicated by some of the early reviews. I would definately recommend this hotel especially for couples or adults. Though there were many children here the hotel is not frantic with Mickey Mouse and was most appealing to an older traveler..

Reviews.Title: “AKL is Amazing!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this reort two times, once with my family of 5 and once with just my husband . It was so perfectly suited for both the family and the romantic stay. The staff was a joy! The fireside story telling was charming. Waking up to Giraffes and Rhino's made me/us feel like we weren't in the U.S. anymore. The decor was stunning especially at Christmas time. The pool great, the non buffet restaurant (JIKO) was soooooo yummy. My children enjoyed the dancing and singing of the hosts and hostesses as we waited to be seated before dinner. My husband and I enjoyed the bar and moonlit savannah walks. We got a lot of enjoyment out of the arcade both trips. The gym is well appointed and has all the equiptment needed for a great workout. I cannot wait untill our next stay there. If you are on the fence about this resort, just go for it and stay. I highly reccomend Animal Kingdom Lodge!!!! I really cannot think of even one bad thing to say about this delux resort (unlike the Beach club resort that beside the great clam bake felt more like a moderate resort than a delux one; it smelled dank and was worn and dated in decor too. The beach club has poor insulation, you can hear both hallway and room-next-door chatter).

Reviews.Title: “A highlight of our vacation”
Reviews.Author: michiganmand
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights here the week of January 31. As my wife is a fan of spotting animals in the wild, she adored this place, even though we only had a poolview room and we weren't exactly in the wild. The theming is magnificent as is the architecture and landscaping. I should add that this is our first stay at a Disney deluxe motel and I heard at least one guest say they preferred the Wilderness Lodge, also a Disney property. My only real complaint was with the size of the room, surprisingly tiny for the money spent. But there is a double vanity next to the bathroom which helped in the mornings. My regret is that I didn't interact more with the guides at the viewing area outside who are eager and willing to answer questions about animals, themselves, whatever. For example, the night vision goggles guests can borrow to look at animals cost around $2,000. And because of the hotel lights, guests can't spy on other guests, but some have apparently tried, according to one guide. We have stayed in most of the moderate resorts and the budget ones as well. They all have their pros and cons. But personally, if I were visiting Orlando and Disneyworld in particular, I would not think of staying off property.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the AKL 4 nights at the end of Jan. Walking into the lobby, I felt like I was walking into a cave. Walked up to the counter to be checked in and Bruce appeared from the back and waved me down to an empty slot. He punched a few keys on his computer ask for my credit card and had me sign for charging. He then tells me your room is ---- on ---- Savanna. I ask if I could be on another Savanna, he said "no I've already checked you in" then turned around and left without giving me my key cards. I found someone at the end of the counter who went looking for him and could'nt find him, but did find my key cards. She picked them up and said "Here" the only animals we saw were gazelles. The rooms were so dark and depressing. For $160 a night and all of the rave reviews I expected better. I thought the breakfast at Boma's was way overpriced for what you got. However, the dinner buffer was exeptional. Thankfully we had 5 more nights at the WL which is bright, cheery and the staff is a joy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, staff needs work..”
Reviews.Author: bean
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed in all the Deluxe and most of the mid-price Disney hotels over the years. The AK Lodge is superbly themed and the food will knock your socks off, even my 4 year old nephew loved everything. Our room was always clean and the pool area is great. However, the staff perhaps needs to go back to 'Disney School'. Except for the front desk clerks, everything we asked was met with a sigh or a scowl. We are not the demanding type, I was amazed. As soon as we finished unpacking I asked an employee I met in the hall where to find the best view of the savannah animals and was told, "you should have booked a room with a better view." Then she continued walking away. Great, thanks, but that's not what I asked! I simply wanted directions to the viewing area. The front desk was happy to oblige. The next mornig, my sister attempted to engage one of the staff members near the pool in conversation about the animals and was told,"Look, I have work to do". (He was straightening chairs) We didn't interact with the staff much after that, it was easier to get info from fellow guests. If you plan on spending most of the vacation away from your hotel, this is a great choice. My family has always taken a mid-week break from the parks to stay back and relax and look around our hotel. This year, we spent our 'off day' at Downtown Disney and had dinner at Wilderness Lodge. Sorry, but the next time I spend that kind of $, it will be at the Polynesian or Grand Floridian where you are not treated like a pain in the rump for asking simple questions.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay at the AKL but the transportation leaves much to be desired.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 stayed here from January 2 to January 5 after booking a Savannah view room at $160.00 per night. My son who is 10 enjoyed seeing the animals from the room. Upon our arrival around 11:30 a.m., the rooms at the inner circle were not ready until after 3:00 p.m. and we got a room where most of the time we were only able to see the zebras very sporadically (about three times during our stay) and very far away. We only saw a giraffe once. The only animals we could see every day during our stay were the pink white pelicans! If our room rate had not been obtained during a special reduced rate period, I would not recommend a savannah view room. You can see the animals with the night vision binoculars from the first floor animal area asking one of the attendants much better than we could from our room. My son enjoyed watching them at night with the binoculars. I objected about the 4th floor after reading from several sources that rooms on the 2nd and 3rd floor are preferable because the tree tops interrupt your view of the animals. The lady that assigned our room indicated that in the area we were getting there were not as many trees. Not true and very misleading. I would not pay more than $160.00 for a savannah view unless you are actually assigned to the inner circle. I found the buffet breakfast reasonably priced and very good. You get croissants (chocolate and plain) other pastries, plenty of fresh fruit, cereals, scrambled eggs, bacon etc and also you can have an omelet made to your preference (ham, cheese, bacon, mushrooms, or veggies). There are some african entrees that I did not taste, but they looked appetizing. This breakfast is much better than the breakfast menu at the Wilderness Lodge (where we stayed for 4 nights) which we found much more expensive and not as good, even greasier. Also the Wilderness Lodge has a much smaller breakfast area than the AKL. At the Wilderness Lodge you have to wait sometimes a 1/2 hour or more to be seated. At the Wilderness Lodge the ambience is much lauder because the waiters make believe they are hillbilies and even though they make you laugh it gets very loud. The servers are better at the AKL than at the Wilderness Lodge where they are not as prompt. In terms of the rooms, the two Resorts are exactly the same in square feet and layout. The only difference is the decor. My only complaint about this resort (AKL) was the bus service. That prevented me from giving this resort a rating of "Excellent". I agree with another writer that you must plan for an hour to get to the parks and to a restaurant. In fact, we had priority seating planned for 6:30 for most nights and we found that we were better off if we had the seating for 8:00 or 8:30, otherwise we had to leave the parks too early. While we stayed at the Wilderness Lodge we enjoyed the proximity to the parks but hated the breakfast. If I had to choose between the two resorts (AKL or Wilderness Lodge) I would stay at the AKL because of breakfast and the animals.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Vacation in awhile”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing hotel! I loved how the pool was open 24 hours so you could go down and swim without Kids. My favorite part was waking up and seing the animals in the savanna outside. Its was an amazing experience and everyone in our party enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely spectactular hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was running in the Disney Marathon on Sunday Jan 9th and arrived on Friday, Jan 7th at 9AM. They were wonderful in accomodating me VERY early and sent us to a upgraded savannah room on the Ostrich Trail 3rd floor. The wait in the lobby was a little longer than I expected, but I was checking in when families were checking out...so that was so be expected. At 11AM (check out time) came, the lobby was dead...so that would have been much better! Upon arrival, we parked in the self park lot (FREE) but the valet parking is only 6$...good price for Disney. The self park lot is only a few feet further than the valet lot and it was quite a nice walk anyways. No one offered to take our baggage to the room, but again..there were lots of people leaving and since we didn't do valet, we really weren't important to them. At 300 a night...I guess they should pay a little more attention to us next time! Our room was wonderful. Great size for 2, but it may get crowded with kids or more adults. Keep in mind that Disney charges 25$ per adult over the allowed "2" per room. We only had 2, but I was interested to learn that! The decor of the room was great. Perfect viewing of all of the feeders and giraffee were outside our window at all hours! Comfortable beds, but it is a little loud when other guests take showers or flush the toliet. We heard no noise between walls or in the hallway. And I know there were people next to us on both sides! Did not hear any footsteps above us either...good sign of a well built building! Dinner was a BOMA the first night...and oh my god was it the best buffet I have ever eaten. HIGHLY recommend the punch that they make there. Desserts were wonderful...had thirds on most of everything! Salad dressings were creative, unique, and super tasty! Soups were to die for. Mara has wonderful salads and soups....which can also be found in BOMA. I did get desserts from BOMA at Mara a few times...and remember that it is cheaper walking to Mara than ordering it through room service! Mara food is really good and not very expensive. The 11$ mug deal for unlimited drinks is a good idea if you are going to be around for a few days! But I just refilled my cup while I was at the pool a few times and it was all the same...and 10 bucks cheaper lol. I recommend this hotel to a family who is planning on some relaxation during their stay. If you are going to be rushing around the parks, then this would be a major waste of money for you. You can see animals at Animal Kingdom. You need to sit outside on the balcony and *watch* them...go for a stroll on the savannah or even sit by the fire at night! The pool was awesome and really needed on the unusally hot days! They have alot of kid stuff to do during the day...so you really can get your monies worth!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awesome!”
Reviews.Author: joparadise
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for 6 nights on our yearly DW trip and we were blown away. We stayed on the concierge level and from the moment we checked in the staff could not do enough for us. The food was excellent, the room was beautiful with amazing savannah views, the housekeeping was impeccable. This year we will be trying the Polynesian concierge level but we would return here in a heartbeat. Yes, it is expensive but if you want a bargain then perhaps a hotel in Kissimmee would be a better choice. After all, this is Disney. Excpet to pay a few bucks for the experience!

Reviews.Title: “great room”
Reviews.Author: Roni_H
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night / 4 day stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. We had never stayed there prior so we had no idea what to expect. We loved it! We had a pool / water view room that ALSO had a partial savannah view. We could see the animals roaming right from our "pool view" room. We felt as though we got our moneys worth. We could actually watch the fireworks from Epcot right from our balcony. Our room number was 4032 and we were right above the slide and the hot tub. I tried to enjoy the food at Jiko but I just couldn't get into it. My fiance loved it though! The breakfast buffet was wonderful and the wait staff is excellent. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Was very upset with quality for the $$$$”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very overpriced for the lousy service that was provided to my family during our holiday stay! I would not stay at this hotel again. The room was not the room that was reserved, we had to switch rooms after getting unpacked. Maid service was very sluggish to clean our room. Our request were NOT honored on the first note. I felt that I was supervising the staff opposed to vacationing. Our last 2 days (only) were enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but could improve!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed from December 21-29th, just got back today. We were in the "Ostrich Trail, we booked two connecting rooms for 4 adults. The resort is fantastic, all the staff are helpful and the lobby is beautiful especially during the holidays. Our rooms were clean, and well decorated. Pool looked nice (too cold to swim), Jiko is one of the best restaurants in WDW and the breakfast buffet at BOMA is excellent. Even though we had standard view rooms, we could walk out of the lobby and view the animals on the savannah. Paid $209 per night with AAA.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: mariposa3838
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the AKL from December 18-23. It's a busy time of year, but I really have alot of good things to say about this hotel. First of all I requested two adjoining room with bunk beds and they didn't have those rooms available for me, so we were luckily upgraded to a Savannah room 4352. The rooms are small, their was no coffeemaker, it's a little dark, but it's beautiful. To be able to sit and watch the animals just graze without looking at them behind bars is amazing. The hotel lobby and grounds are gorgeous. I have not stayed at any other Disney resort, but I think that it's worth it to try it once. It's expensive, but a unique experience. The food at Jinko and Boma are great. The pool is beautiful. There are alot of activities for the children within the hotel as well. I think that although the price is a little high, the ambience is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views but just not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Feedback
Reviews.Content: This review pertains to our stay in December – 2004. NEGATIVES: [Neg. Item 1] Reservation was for a King – Non-smoking room. Upon check-in, no Kings are available. The reservation did not guarantee a King, however, we were shocked to not find a King available when arriving mid-week in the dead period between Thanksgiving and Christmas. After requesting to speak to a manager we were informed that there are 1293 rooms in the resort, however, ONLY 12 are kings. Of the 12, 2 of the kings are in the suites, 8 are handicap rooms, and 2 are regular king rooms. WHAT????? I know that Disney is a family resort, however, advertisements focus on romantic retreats…in what…double beds? [Neg. Item 2] Resort guests are just slobs. Broken glass aound rocking chairs outside. People are just pigs but shame on the resort for not keeping it clean. Pool area was also dirty too. For a resort of this price-range…I expected a far cleaner resort. [Neg. Item 3] Room size is no better than lower priced resorts. [Neg. Item 4] Room living space is no better. We had stayed at the Wilderness lodge last year and found the walls to be paper thin. We could hear people in the adjacent rooms and hear the supersonic flush of toilets in the rooms all around us. The same occurred in this room. Very disappointing. It just goes to show that buildings need to be built to code and sometimes the minimum code is ordered. Soundproofing should really be a main consideration. We were awakened to crying babies as well. What can you do…it’s Disney. [Neg. Item 5] Based on our room assignment, we felt the best viewing of animals in the Savanah rooms were between the region of room numbers 430 through 530. Rooms too close to the Arusha Rock Savanna Overlook will not give you your moneys worth. During our stay – it appeared that at various times of the day – animals would roam. A recommendation is to get close to the viewing tip of Arusha Rock’s peak. You'll have clear images of the animals as they place food/vegetation for the animals to eat. [Neg. Item 6] Insufficient porter service. Upon check-out, over a half-hour wait for them to come to the room. [Neg. Item 7] We found our check-in person to be so rude. Upon being handed our keys – I looked at my wife and thought….are we in Disney? Customer service just isn’t a priority anymore. Get ready if you haven’t been in a while. There’s a reason why they no longer say “Have a Magical Day”. POSITIVES: Fabulous viewing of wildlife. Zebras, Wilderbeasts, Giraffes, and other animals can be seen grazing pretty much all day long. Bring the cameras and enjoy. The resort does provide an opportunity to be in the thick of the animals from your room. We were on the second floor and enjoyed opening the curtains in the morning and viewing the giraffes eating within 30 yards of the window. The resort does have a responsibility to the safety of the animals and I can understand why they have a perimeter between the rooms and animals. Don’t expect to see straws at this resort either…for the safety of the animals those just don’t exist. The lobby design is similar to that of the Wilderness lodge. A huge hangar like structure with African décor. Rooms were decorated well also. My first Disney room to have a complimentary refrigerator. We’ve stayed at the Port Orleans, Coronado Springs, Wilderness Lodge, and Dixie Landing. You really need to dine at the Boma Restaurant for dinner and breakfast at least once. Great Great food for the price. We really enjoyed it and recommend it. You should also try the Mara which is a cafeteria like eatery. Fair prices. The center lobby also had a tv playing round the clock with classic Disney cartoons. A fun place to gather ‘round. FINAL COMMENTARY: The hotel definitely had some positive things to enjoy, however, just not worth the money. Take a bus to the resort and enjoy the sites for free! We had similar feelings to a Dec-2004 Animal Kingdom lodge posting entitled "Not a Deluxe Resort by any stretch - A Total Rip-Off". Customer service really needs to improve. The staff just lacks that go-getter attitude. No exceptional service to be seen. Have the workers lost touch with the Disney ethos? I know I won’t be returning to this hotel for a room but definitely for a meal at Boma. I don’t think I’m ready for an off-site hotel, however, I have to admit – I find the moderate resorts just right. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me. Happy Travels. The world is just a matter of hours by plane!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the theme”
Reviews.Author: wanderer1
Reviews.Content: Every person has a different experience on every trip to any destination/hotel. So it's nice to get a lot of different viewpoints. I have 20 years in the travel industry, own an agency, and became a Certified Disney Specialist about 10 years ago. I no longer book leisure travel (corporate only), but I've "done" Disney about 12 times as a single parent. Sometimes single parents look for different things in our experiences and hotels (like our use of the Contemporary Tower so we could quickly and easily monorail back for afternoon naps when my child was younger). So I thought I'd add my two cents, as I refer to tripadvisor a lot, and think it is an excellent tool in decision making. For comparison's sake: I've stayed off-site (only if we're visiting a Disney park just for a day), Caribbean Beach, Dixie Landings (now it looks to be half of Port Oleans), the All Star type hotels, Wilderness Lodge, Contemporary (Tower room), the Swan, and taken a Disney Cruise. I booked AKL because it was going to be COLD on my 2 night trip. I didn't want a "motel" with exterior corridors, no jacuzzi, or to be stuck in a room with nothing to do if it was too cold for the parks. These are the reasons I chose to opt for one of Disney's Deluxe hotels. I'm not one for the "home away from home" properties...I don't have a big family, crave more "action", and am not about to cook a single meal or throw in a load of laundry! I want room service and laundry service...when needed. I was lucky to arrive on a not-to-busy-for-Disney day. Yes, folks... Disney is a busy place, especially during any school holiday, and you will spend money. No one should be surprised to find this. It's not worth complaining about. It is the number one vacation destination worldwide. There are lines and more lines, but...if you listen to tips, you can save yourself money, time, and a lot of frustration...and you won't be one of those screaming tired families you see. If your line at check in is LONG...plop your kids in front of the TV and be thankful you're not washing dishes instead. Valet parking was $6 day (great price). Self parking was not a terrible walk (if you were only doing it once). Valet was FAST, even when busy. We had reserved a Savannah view room, requesting Nonsmoking, bunk beds, near lobby. We got nonsmoking & bunkbeds, as requested. The bunk beds helped distribute kids as well as "open up" an otherwise small room. I feel it's important to note here that many complained their check in agents were "rude", or "didn't honor our requests". Requesting a specific area of the hotel, bedding type, etc...is just that...a REQUST. They'll either be available when you check in...or they won't. They do their best, but EVERYONE can't have the first room down any given hallway, or with a specific bed type or view. We were lucky. We got nonsmoking, only about halfway back through the complex, with bunk beds. I didn't think our animal view was spectacular. But none were really any better than any other. I read a lot of "grass is greener" comments on here about the viewing. But the animals DO roam from area to area. We had mostly birds, but one morning the giraffes all came over for breakfast. I read there were no coffeepots in room, or that people had to buy coffee refills. I did have a coffee pot, and empty fridge. I didn't use my coffee so I don't know if they would have refilled it. I would have liked to see our soap/shampoo refilled. We used ours, and I think they could have replenished it because, let's face it, that's a souvenir that people love to have. I used to line up hotel toiletries in my travel agency, and they're now on display in glass containers in my bathrooms at home. I think just one bar of soap or shampoo could easily be absorbed in the cost of each guest's stay. Towels were average in quantity and quality. Double sinks in bathroom was NICE! The opposite of the "do not disturb" sign was a "please make up room" sign. As a one time hotel maid...I LIKE that. It's nice to know when the room is free. Another "aside" to other posters who complain that they were "gone all day and their room wasn't made up". Again, the maids work all day 8am-5pm (or so). SOME rooms have to be tidied in the 3-5pm time frame, and SOME rooms must be tidied before 10am...or they just won't all get done. Toilets were the new, POWERFUL flush type (like a cruise ship). I heard flushing and showers and hallway noise constantly, as well as the crying baby next door through the connecting door (all the time, yikes!). I was disappointed at the overall noise level. It was hard to control the room temperature, even hard for me to understand the controls...but that's probably just me. The views were nice, but I personally would opt for the "standard" room next time (non Savannah view). For me, it wasn't worth the diffence in money. You can see the same views walking down the corridors, and at several viewing areas. And I've known too many people who were "upgraded" to Savannah view rooms anyway (too many Savannah rooms for the people willing to spend the money in them, I'm assuming). It was a fun "extra"....just not for me next time. There were a lot of kids activities going on at the hotel (night viewing, crafts, story telling). Too cold to swim (though some dared...in 40 degree weather with barely heated pools!), but the pool/spas looked very well kept and inviting. The grounds were beautiful. That is certainly something Disney excels at EVERYWHERE...all parks, all resorts..the grounds are fabulous. Lobby was...well, GORGEOUS. 3 stories high maybe? Stunning African inspired decor. The usual TV area to entertain the kids while you queue up at Guest services or check in. A relaxing lounge was just off the lobby ...conveniently on your way to dinner. Pit fires inside and outside were lined with rocking chairs. We were lucky to see the hotel as it was decorated for Christmas. It was just nice to get off the bus from the park and walk inside. You could feel your tired body go "ahhhhh!", peace again. Seemed like there were not as many sundry item choices for that forgotten toiletry in the gift shop...as there were at some other resorts. May be imagining that. I can recall having no car one my first trip, and not a single place in Disney sold "pull - up" diapers. I was amazed! We ate at Boma for 1 dinner and 2 breakfasts. Not outstanding. Serve yourself buffet, which I'm not fond of anyway. I love a big selection, just don't want picked over food or to queue up for it. It's been touched by kids with snotty fingers and tastes rather mass/cafeteria prepared. There were some "fun" choices at dinner, worth $25 for an adult easily, but $25 for a 12 year old to eat chicken fingers and mac & cheese? Breakfast was nothing special there either. We also ate at Mara (quick bite type dining) twice. Nothing special....served the purpose it was meant to. At least I never saw it "crazy" the way the Value Resort (All Star) food courts are. It's embarrasing to see people who looked like they hadn't eaten in weeks attacking those places. Blech, makes one lose their appetite. But Mara was kept clean and pretty well stocked. We ate at Jiko's once (table service). The best of the restaurants by far, nice selections, interesting appetizers. We tried the goat/sheep cheese appetizer tray and something (can't recall the name) cooked in corn husks (mmmm...tasted like hominy with the consistency of tofu in a hearty herb sauce...tasted much better than it sounds, great flavor). Good service. But, again, just nothing to write home about. Though I did get into every restaurant without reservations in less than 20 minutes each time. I must say I've never had a really GREAT meal at any Disney property or park. But we don't go there for the reknown food, after all. Walk to the hotel's bus transportation was not bad at all. Bus waits were normal (no matter what other reviewers say...they may have had a few bad wait times...it happens at every hotel sometimes). But the ride lengths and waits for buses was VERY normal, compared to other hotels. Bottom line. Loved the theme/decor/ambiance. I'd go back (except there are SO many other properties I want to try first). I would not pay the Savannah price (we paid $275 a night, plus we had to book an extra night just to meet their minimum requirement...and we didn't use the room that night). I would not plan on eating there as often (too many other choices abound). Liked the relaxed atmosphere. Liked the shorter and interior walk (unlike places like Caribbean Beach, where they had their own shuttle within the hotel complex), or the BACK of the value resorts...where you can have a long walk back to your room when you're tired. It's a very good hotel. It's not a 4 star hotel. But then, it doesn't claim to be. AAA currently (12/04) rates it 3 star...and it's a VERY high 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Some of the Rooms at Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: girlfromdenver
Reviews.Content: Our family of four spent five nights at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. We had reserved a Savannah view room and a few days before the trip I requested a inner savannah view. We arrived around midnight and were given a room as far as you can get from the main lobby. They told us it was a Savannah room but it was little more than a view of the parking lot and a small fenced in area where they said the animals feed. I called right away and asked to change rooms. They said they could not do it that night but to try in the morning. I called first thing at 6:30 am and they moved us to the inner Savannah view. It was a thousand times better. My question is why they didn't put us there in the first place as we were able to move right away the next morning. If we had not been given this new room our feelings about the hotel would have been terrible. A pool view would have been better. On our last stay to Disney World we stayed at the Grand Floridian and we really missed being by the monorail. The buses were pretty frequent but one morning we had a charater breakfast at the Contemporary for 7:00 a.m. and had to hire a taxi as the buses were not yet running. On a positve note, the main lobby was beautiful and the kids liked the bunk beds. Both restaurants, Boma and Jiko, were way above most of the restaurants we dined at in Disney. The staff was ok but not overly friendly and the pool was fine but not exceptional. On our next visit we'll be returning to the Grand.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of serenity”
Reviews.Author: Seacoast3
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in a Disney property and we found the Animal Kingdom resort a welcome spot. We liked the African theme decor, the plentitude of resting spots, be it sitting in front of a roaring fire in the lodge or out by the viewing decks, the enormity of the swimming pool and the sense that the lodge provided a respite from the frenzy of activities in greater Orlando. We had a room relatively close to the lodge with a nice view of the grazing giraffes and zebras. The kids loved the bunkbeds and Simba's clubhouse, the onsite childcare. I thought the dark decor and dimmed lighting throughout augmented the intended sense of serenity. The holiday decorations were beautiful. While I would rate our overall experience excellent, I would not rate our dining at the same level. My six year old son thought the breakfast buffet pancakes tasted like "playdough" (I had a taste and would concur) and our dinner seemed overly seasoned with pepper and the salad was overly dressed. Without exception, the staff was very knowledgeable and friendly. We'd return to the hotel and would recommend it to a family who wants to experience a full theme resort. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Africa,...without the A.I.D.S”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice now in different locations, and have never been disappointed. The lighting is too little wattage in the rooms? perhaps, if you are performing surgery. You can hear the powerful flush of the adjacent toilets from time to time, pretend you're in Africa and be thankful there are facilities. If you are travelling with little ones, this place is extremely tough to top. The capacity of the pool is 266, which is sufficient for all but the busiest times, the bar is good, hot tubs are secluded and there is a playground for the kids. Mara is not a bad little cafeteria either. One thing: they do nickel and dime a little by making you pay for the fitness equipment. Overall it smells great, looks great and you can definitely spend the day there without even thinking about the parks and mayhem.
