The best feature: the smokers have to walk all the way to the far reaches for their accomodations, ironic as I here them wheezing past my door to the lobby. Thanks to all you folks who report on here, it takes all kinds to make a world, and it takes all kinds to rate resorts, even smokers.

Reviews.Title: “All in all not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: travelingfromTX
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at Disney last week, November 21, 2004. We spent our last 2 nights at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. We are a family of 4 with 2 daughters ages 15 and 12. There were some things about this hotel we loved. For example: The decor throughout the lodge; Breakfast and Dinner at Bomas; We loved the food at Mara's--for a fast-food restaurant it was wonderful!; There were a lot of activities for both children and adults; The bunk beds for the kids; And, most of all we loved seeing all the animals. We took chance a piece looking out our sliding doors searching for animals. Just got some great pictures back! However, we didn't think this hotel was worth the price we paid (1 night discounted and 1 night full price for a Savannah view room). The room was not much bigger than the value resort we stayed at earlier in the week. The rooms were so, so dark, you literally couldn't see. The maid just cleaned, didn't even lay the girls animals on the beds, or anything. Didn't display my daughter's birthday cards. The hotel is huge and our room was in another state! The parks especially the Magic Kingdom are very far away. You wait at least 15 minutes for a bus and then it is a 15 to 20 minute ride. The only great place is traveling to the Animal Kingdom. We are glad we stayed there once and got to see the animals. But, I doubt we will be back. Prefer to splurge on a nicer property.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the AKL prior to our Disney Cruise in March 2004. I have stayed at most of the Disney Resorts, including the Deluxe (Wilderness Lodge, Polynesian, etc.) but this was the first time I didn't want to leave the room! The views were stunning, it was great to wake up in the morning to the sound of an Ankole Cattle family in front of our balcony, and watch the Giraffe swander by. If you are an animal lover, this is the place to go. The food and service at the AKL were execellent, everyone was as pleasant as could be. This is also an execellent learning experience for children, there are "hands-on" with the animals and experts from Africa to answer all your questions. I would highly recommend AKL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Take the word of a travelled travel agent, STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Glasgowtraveler_79
Reviews.Content: Having been on numerous Disney organised International Travel Agent Educationals, I am an actual Certified Disney Expert Travel Agent. I have statyed at every Disney property in Florida, California, Paris and Tokyo. On my own trip, I chose to stay at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge and I would highly recommend it to anyone thinking about staying at a Disney Property in Orlando. Having stayed there before on an Educational trip, I found myself looking forward to staying at the hotel even more than the 7 night, five star caribbean cruise that I was going on before coming to Orlando. I was most impressed by the beauty of the hotel, the spectacular main lobby is similar to the Wilderness Lodge but the African elements offer something that no other Disney property can, genuine originality. The animals in the savannah are the main focus of the hotel, with numerous areas from which to view them even if you don't have a Savannah View room. The rooms are of average size for a Disney Property, which is not too big but also not at all cramped. The decor of the room is superior to many Disney properties barr the rather garish bed linen, the tied mosquito net behind the bed adds a little glamour while the artefacts on the walls as well as the TV cabinets, beds and mirror are all highly original, hand crafted and very pleasing to the eye. The balconies are a big bonus, they are very comfortable and quite large in size. Savannah Views are excellent, Waterview rooms are also very good and an excellent cheaper option. The level of service from the staff is that expected at a Disney property, excellent. The pool is very large with plenty of sun loungers that are always available and the restaurants are very popular, even with people not staying at the property. There can be a little bit to walk to get to your room from reception but it's not any worse than any other of the Disney hotels and its a lot less than some others for example, Port Orleans Riverside. Overall a very good standard and in addition if you leave anything in your room (as I did) the hotel will return it to you free of charge (even all the way to Scotland) provided that they have your address. A great touch as I hadn't even realised that I had left anything. I would urge all to stay at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge, even if you're not fond of the park (I'm not), because it really is a haven of peace and tranquillity in a world of magic and mayhem.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Magic Works Again”
Reviews.Author: Traveler121
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with my brother, sister-in-law and their three kids stayed here for a magical 3 nights at the end of October. We have stayed on property before and again were not disappointed. We had Savannah view rooms and if you want to see the animals in a special way this is the room you want. Very quiet, we never heard noise from the next rooms or the hallway. The decor is awsome! Quite a treat even the kids loved the animals, activities and movies in the lobby. Also the rooms and the entire property are very clean. The only drawback is the location. It is quite a way from all of the parks except Animal Kingdom, but the bus service was very good and we never had to wait long to catch the bus we wanted. The other item was check-in. They seem to be going through some adjustment with new computers. We check-in and stored our luggage fine without incident, however found later that the key cards which hold all of your wishes, credit card information and room key were messed up. The kids were on our cards instead of with their parents. When we got back to the hotel after a long day at the parks, we had to get the cards straight and get our rooms. Our first rooms had none of the requests we had called in advance for and one of the rooms faced a parking lot. After much waiting and calling of porters we finally had two very nice rooms with great views. Staff was very nice but slow. All of the switching and moving of luggage took over an hour before we were in our rooms. The key here is to be persistant.

Reviews.Title: “Good but small”
Reviews.Author: lagodch
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from the Lodge - nice hotel, great restaurants (Jiko), but crowded, and unbelievable views of the animals. We all had Savannah rooms and were lucky to have a discount through a Disney employee. We woke up every day to a plethora of animals off of the balcony - it was amazing. The rooms were VERY small, though. Let me say that again...VERY SMALL. If you are looking for comfort, look to spend that extra money at another Disney property such as the Yacht or Beach Club as the rooms are larger - I've stayed in most of the Disney resorts and have never been in a room this tiny. If you don't opt for the Savannah rooms, then I would not even bother with the property. If you do decide to stay, here's a tip...make sure you buy the refillable mug from The Mara and you will have endless free refills on sodas, coffee, etc for your trip. Otherwise, a styrofoam cup for tea is $2.50!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time @ Animal Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back with the wife and two kids, ages 6 and 9, from a week trip to Disney World and stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. What a great place. Got a savanah overlook room and loved the view of wild animals out the sliding glass door at all times of the day and night. Woke up in the middle of the night several times and saw zebra's sleeping in the grass below. Mornings usually had a couple of giraffes feeding outside. Kids really enjoyed counting the animals and kept a running total of all animals seen. Bus ride to all other parks and hotels was typical of Disney. Everything is 15 to 20 mins. Great pool with water slide that the six year old really liked. Pool has a large ramp for special needs kids to ease themselves into the water. Fantastic main lodge with super African decorations. Some days had singers and dancers perfoming in the main hall. Food a Jeko was great. Upgraded to concerige service and really used the free latte's and breakfast. Saved time and money feeding them bagels and fruit in the morning. Didn't use for cocktail time but it looked inviting. Would go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: psgriswold
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic time here in October. Wonderful sights and smells. Went to Jico twice and highly recommend it. The refillable mugs are a great deal if you are staying more than 3 or 4 days. Recommend the Zebra Trail as it is closer to the pool and Mara. Bus service is great. Rooms are rather small for this price category but are more than passable. Place is a great deal if you get a discount (we paid $185 for savannah room) but at rack rate it wouldn't be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Okay, this is not a typical stay to review as we arrived as Orlando Airport was closing in prep for the latest hurricane. I really hated to disapoint the kids and cancel. I spoke with a really nice Disney rep on the phone and she convinced me we'd be safe and we were. It was unbelievable how well informed the hotel kept us. Hourly voicemails in prepartion on our phone, memo's with instructions under the door, and flashlights. It was costly stocking up in the Mara for food in the room but that can't be helped. My kids absolutely loved the hotel (ages 5 and 6). The bunk beds were a huge hit. I'm glad I followed advice of other trip advisors because getting a savanah view with a balcony to watch the animals was worth the price. They didn't come out for a couple days after the hurricane, but when they did and the girls spotted the animals, I can't even describe. Good thing I had bought them disposable cameras because they loved taking pictures. The activities are wonderful. Obviously because of the confinement to the hotel it was packed with kids, but it was so fun. African singing, story telling dancing and playing along on authentic instruments was just a small part of the activities (all with disney characters stopping by). I agree that buying the cup for refills is a good deal. If I wouldn't have read about that on trip advisors I would never have even known that was an option. And let me say, finding the Mara (big snack center) was difficult. There are no signs. The lobby is actually on the 3rd floor and you go down to 1st floor and wind behind the pool to find it. No signs. I finally saw someone with a glass and followed. There is no trouble finding the pricey gift shop or the upscale restaurants . . .hmm. This is a FUN resort to stay at. It's african theme is wonderful. We enjoyed it for our first stay. I am anxious to try other resorts to see if they compare. Another plus of going to the park before and after a huricane. . . literally NO LINES. We even got to stay on the log ride to go again. Downside, park closed early and we paid for a whole day for 1 hour. Oh well, the price you pay for travelling into a huricane!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this resort!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa M
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week at the Animal Kingdom Lodge with my 8-year old daughter. I had huge expectations for the vacation, and let me say that this resort met and exceeded every expectation! I am used to 4 and 5 star hotels and this one lived up to the hype. From the moment we checked in (early - about 9:30 a.m. but they were able to get us a room right away even though check in wasn't until 3 p.m.) until the moment we left, everything was wonderful. The hotel is beautiful; the decor, down to every detail, is really splendid. All the rooms have a balcony so they are neither dark nor claustrophobic (don't understand what the other reviewers are talking about). We had a pool view room which was really lovely; I cannot comment on the parking lot or savannah view rooms. The rooms are not terribly large, I will agree, but they are comfortable. All of the staff, from all of the front desk hosts to the staff in all of the restaurants were excellent. But one stands out above all: our housekeeper (Jill) was an absolute jewel. After the first day, she and my daughter left notes to each other and Jill did funny things w/the stuffed animals...I think my daughter enjoyed coming back to see what Jill had done almost as much as she enjoyed the parks themselves. The food at the Mara and Boma are excellent with lots of delicious and healthy options, and I felt that everything was reasonably priced. We never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus and all buses had direct service to the park or location, so no time was wasted on multiple stops. I would highly recommend The Animal Kingdom Lodge and would definitely stay there again whenever I return to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge mid-October '04, and had a wonderful time! Everything was exceptional- rooms, service, view of savannah and animals, children's programs, etc.. My 4 yr old also really liked sleeping in the bunk beds in our room. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, but value was just as good!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at AKL in September of 2004. We were origially staying 2 nights but due to Hurricaine Jeanne had to stay an extra night. The staff were very busy because of the overload of guests due to the hurricaine, so we didn't get the level of service I would have expected from a Deluxe resort - one cast member was excellent, she pulled me out of the line and immediately arranged for our extra night stay. Before arriving we had stayed 7 nights at All Star Movies, the accommodations there were excellent. We arrived in our room at AKL, we had a pool view room, it was beautiful and quite large, however it wasn't overly clean - we had grapes under our bed and the trash wasn't taken out :( we didn't really mind too much though. The savannahs here are great, we saw lots of animals and the cast memebers there are great, we met one woman from South Africa who was really nice and we spoke for a long time - 2 days later she remembered my name! :) We didn't eat at any of the table service restaurants here, but we used the Mara counter service eatery a lot! It was expensive and had basically the same food as in the parks and at the value resorts. The lobby is amazing and i'm glad we were here during the hurricaine because we were able to walk around the hotel without going outside. I'd definetly recommend staying here, but you can save a lot of money by staying at a value resort and get the same level of service - just a smaller room!

Reviews.Title: “Great place except for the rooms”
Reviews.Author: jhfhkdjsh676
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from the Animal Kingdom Lodge. We actually got married whilst staying at the hotel. I faxed a letter to the hotel a few weeks before we were to arrive to inform them that we would be getting married and could we perhaps have a nice room, near to reception if possible, as we had heard that some of the rooms could be quite a trek to reception/restaurants etc. When we arrived I again stated that we would prefer a room close to reception and was then given our room which was in the block furthest away from reception! So my faxed letter and request on the day were completely ignored. I was told that we may be able to move the next day, but after a 12 hour journey and then unpacking, the last thing you want to do is to pack again and move. The room was okay but not what I would expect from a 5 star hotel, our view was not great and the room was dark and claustrophobic. That, though was my only complaint about the hotel. The reception of the hotel is magnificent. The pool was great, nice and big with two lovely jacuzzis and a flamingo pool very close by. The Mara foodhall was great for just quick eating. We ate in Boma a few times, which was excellent service and food. Jinko we did not try, but it looked lovely. We did not have to wait for a bus to the parks for more than 5 minutes and they were all only short rides away. Overall the hotel is lovely because it is different from other disney hotels and has a great African atmosphere, and if you love wildlife it is definately for you, if you do not, then I would suggest going somwhere cheaper on the disney resort, as we went to the Caribbean Beach resort three years ago and I liked this just as much as Animal Kingdom and it is half the price.

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend, daughter and I stayed at the Animal kingdom lodge this past August. All that can be said is that it was breathtaking. I have read past reviews that have almost dicouraged my expectations. But upon my arrival all negativity was lost. Stepping into the lobby transports you to the beauty of Africa instantly. The rooms were lovely and tasteful, with a wonderful staff answering your every call. Then downstairs was the wonderful "Boma". One of the cheifs must have overheard that I was a vegetarian, because he suddenly arrived at my table with an exquisit work of art. Leave it to Disney for making everyone feel like royalty. The price to this resort may have been a bit much, I'm sure a few could agree. But on our first morning, my 2 year old daughter popped up like a little pop tart and exclaimed with both open arms (literally) "Oh mommy, what a beautiful room!" We knew then, how perfect it all was.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of animals- little value”
Reviews.Author: AnEN
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 night stay at the animal kingdom hotel. It was our son's 4th birthday and he loves animals so what a better way to celebrate than take him to Disney's animal kingdom. We booked a deluxe savanna room at full price. What you get for that is a small room and an even smaller bathroom- really no better than a holiday inn. Yes there are animals wandering outside your balcony which the kids loved. The pool was only average size considering the number of rooms in this hotel. The restaurants are crowded so reserve you table the minute you arrive or you'll be eating at 5:30 or 8:30. The food is actually quite good esp. at Jiko's. Overall it comes down to asking yourself is this a value at 385.00 a night plus a 25.00 resort fee plus tax. We didn't think so but if you can get a room at a discount - go- if not stay at the Ritz Carlton at the club level for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the lodge on the 28th May 2004 for 2 weeks. We had never stayed in a WDW hotel before and had reservations upon reading reviews before booking. Upon arrival we were immediately upgraded to Savannah rooms, without requesting it (both us and my mum). Our children (aged 2 and 5yrs) were entertained by staff whilst we checked in and our very heavy bags were taken to our rooms. All additional requests, bunk beds, safety bars on bottom bunk. lost jewellery etc..were acted upon immediately by extremely accomodating and helpful staff. The room was clean and adequate but the view was breathtaking. The whole hotel takes your breath away as you take the tour. Eating breakfast on our balcony each morning with the animals below us is an experience we will never forget. We purchased the hotel cup on our first night and found it worth every penny for the fabulous coffee in the morning, cold drinks in the day and cocoa at night. The pool was fantastic for the kids, at all times. We often enjoyed a late swim after a long day at the parks and the free life jackets were a god send. We ate in all the restaurants and found the food to be of good quality, although somewhat expensive but hey your in WDW! We also found Valet parking was invaluable, especially when the heavens opened. Overall a fantastic experience for the whole family. My only minor complaint, which is a personal one, is that you are not allowed to smoke on the balconies (I understand why not ) and so the walk to the pool area was quite a treck each time I needed to smoke. The walk from our room to reception was also a treck but with Savannah views at each window you pass we lived with it. We will definately go back it was excellent. A real luxury disney hotel, without being too disneyfide.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not Delux”
Reviews.Author: DSZ
Reviews.Content: this is a very nice hotel with beautiful animals and very nice decor. If you are going to stay I would definitely recommend getting a savanah view room. Although I can't compare against the other disney resorts, the things that I thought that could have been better... -size of bathrooms -guest services (checking in took 40 minutes, not standing in line, once I spoke to someone, 40 min) -need a car to get to parks -a bit overpriced

Reviews.Title: “Surprised me!”
Reviews.Author: cardinalgal
Reviews.Content: I never had any desire to stay here. When it first opened and so many people were so excited about it, my thoughts were "What's the big deal?" On paper, it seemed such an overpriced waste of time & money. I have now seen the light!! First let me say that I would NEVER pay full price for this or any of the deluxe resorts -- it just isn't worth $300/nt to stay at any of them. BUT, having said that, if you can get an AP or other special rate, it was really worthwhile. For less than we paid for the Wilderness Lodge (also at a special rate), we stayed here 4 nights in 6/04. While the Wilderness Lodge is still our family favorite, this comes close. Don't be put off by how far away from MK, Epcot, and MGM it seems -- it's not bad, and the buses for this resort were fabulous, even in this relatively busy time of year. Plus, you don't have to share with any other resort! It actually took us about the same amount of time to get to the Magic Kingdom from here as it did from any of the other 5 resorts we've stayed at (even the Wilderness Lodge with their direct boat -- however, we've not used a monorail resort yet). The housekeeping staff was efficient, though not as creative as we've had in the past, but just as friendly. We found the entire hotel to be relatively clean (difficult with all those hardwood floors), and room service trays left outside doors (one of my big pet peeves at WDW) were removed relatively promptly. The pool was wonderful -- it isn't one of the best at WDW, but is certainly above average with plenty of chairs even at crowded times and a nice shallow area for the not-toddlers-but-not-quite-swimming kids. The slide was fun for the pre-teens. The only issue I had with the hotel is that your room could potentially be 10-15 minutes walk away from anything -- the food court, the bus, whatever. We were lodged in one of the furthest away corridors (although we were upgraded for free to a Savannah view room). We didn't mind the walk but if our kids had been younger, it could have been a real problem. The food court is pretty much like all the other WDW food courts with the exception of the fresh salads they prepare there -- very good -- and the soups -- very spicy. The Savannah views are varied. They rotate the animals among the savannahs, so the chances are good for viewing almost anything from each savannah view at some point during the day. We looked out on a sort of circular pit that was fenced off, but just beyond it we saw giraffes, zebras, multiple other animals at various times. We probably had one of the least desirable views, but it was still ok. Again, though, if I'd paid $300/nt, I would have been disappointed. At $149/nt, it was great. Overall, we would definitely stay there again if the price was right. However, if you can't get it for under, say $175, go elsewhere on the property.

Reviews.Title: “Best WDW Resort!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in eight different Walt Disney World resorts, and this is my favorite, no contest! The restaurants are wonderful, the staff is wonderful, the architecture and decor are breathtaking, and the hot tub is the nicest one on Disney property. Simba's Cubhouse, the kids' club here, is my son's favorite, which makes it easy for us to sneak out for an evening with just grownups! The rooms are beautiful, and you can spend some extra $$ and get a room overlooking free roaming giraffes, antelopes, zebras, etc., or save some $$ and enjoy the many public viewing areas. I've heard wonderful things about the Concierge level rooms here, and am saving my pennies to do that someday.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: baseball95
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best. Everything is top notch and the animals are unbelievable. We saw giraffes, zebras, cattle all through the day. The resort activities for the children were wonderful. A must is the mug at the Mara's. You pay for the mug and then you can refill anytime during your stay. Again, I would stay here again anytime. It was wonderful. The staff was great, especially Gene at check-in. It is so peaceful here, a great place to escape to after the parks. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “not a honeymoon site not very clean not worth the$$$$”
Reviews.Author: sondeesrider
Reviews.Content: OK first off I am not a big complaint person but I read reviews on this site both good and bad before deciding to go to this hotel. Mistake!First thing is your reservation is basically no good. The best viewing rooms are first come first serve ifyou get there late forget about getting what you were promised. When we reserved a room a month ago we were promised a king size bed and perfect viewing. What we got was a room on the top floor on a outer wing that has no elevatore, 2 queen sized beds because they have no kings. Also one of the beds had sheets on it that were blood stained. I guess it matched the bathroom blood stain. The animal viewing is overated. We did see 3 zebras and that was about it,( if you do not count the wonderful dirt track outside your viewing balcony). The lobby is beautiful and the food at he Boma is wonderful but at $64.00 per couple hardly worth it. Also a fridge is a $10.00 a day rental Y8u are also pretty far from any of the parks except for animal kingdom. If you want to see animals up close and personal save your money and just go to the Animal Kingdom. We were booked for the week but I am writing you from another hotel on the resort. We stayed 2 nights at Animal Kingdom Lodge and cancelled our reservations. Another trick is thy tell you they are going to upgrade you to a deluxe i found out it is a marketing ploy they upgrade everyone tat stays there. I guess they think that that will ease you after they have just told you that you have gotten there toolate for the good rooms. B the way we arrived at the hotel at 4 pm check in was at 2 pm so you see what they call "late".

Reviews.Title: “Not a Delux hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First, what a beautiful hotel, really unique in its approach to the african theme. In fact, its somewhat surprising that they would spend so much money on the hotel itself and care so little about service and providing for a happy client. The fact that the hotel is so huge with so many rooms means that it overburdened. It's no surprise that rooms are not cleaned. By the way the rooms are amazingly small and the bathrooms are so tiny it is almost funny. The pool is so shallow and the florida sun so hot that it is like taking a warm bath we couldnt even use it. A majority of rooms are so far away from the lobby and the shuttles it makes for an exhausting trip back and forth. Yes, go once enjoy it for what it is [ a theme resort] but i wont be going back anytime in the near future. finally, beware. Do not pay full price, make sure you get some deal which I did, because this resort is way overpirced.

Reviews.Title: “a mixed review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying, I am a big Walt Disney World vacation fan. I have chosen to do our family vacation here every year, sometimes twice a year, for the past nine years. This time we chose the Animal Kingdom Lodge, concierge rooms. We have done concierge rooms at the Polynesian, Wilderness Lodge, Yacht Club and the Contemporary, (some more than once). We arrived and were escorted to the Bell Services desk first. My husband had spoken to Concierge two days before we left, we had to call them, no one contacted us!! He was making sure of our request to be on the 6th floor with a pool room view. Everything was repeated back to him as we requested, including the fact that my daughter's 15th birthday was during our stay. We were taken up to Concierge and told we had a fifth floor room with a savanah view. We were told that when the hotel was empty they didn't like to use the 6th floor rooms because the view wasn't that good. So, we went to the fifth floor room, and it was very, very clean and the view was great, decided to keep it. But, no robes in the room, which leads me to believe it really isn't used as a Concierge Room. First night and next two days at the Concierge was excellent. Quiet, good food, clean and efficient room service. But then our third and final day came. It was my daughters' birthday. Up to this point, we had kept a low profile, not bothering the Concierge desk, and pretty much coming and going silently. We paid for the Concierge extras! but, on the last day of our stay we felt really cheated of this. It was my daughter's 15th birthday, and my husband had arranged for a birtthday cake, nothing more, to be sent to the room as a surprise. We arrived back from a hot sweaty day to shower, compose and go from there, at about 2:30 pm. Our room had not been cleaned, so we asked the Concierge desk what happened, and she called housekeeping, got no respone, and didn't seem to care after that. Now my husband knew the cake was to come to the room as a surprise anytime after 3:oo pm. But we couldn't change and shower because the room needed towels, etc. So we waited and waited and no one seemed to give a hoot about it. Finally at 3:30 pm we got a clean room and towels. In the midst of showering and freshening up the cake was delivered. NOW IT WAS NOT A SURPRISE. And it was the wrong cake, which said "Happy Birthday Michael" my daughter's name is Kate!! Also, turn down service, which is included, had not been done at our room the night before, and didn't get done this night until 8:30 pm, after we had already come back from dinner and turned down some covers to sit a minute, before continuing our night. We paid alot of money, and didn't ask for much, but what little we did expect was ruined. No one really cared or apologized.. We felt because it was our last day and the hotel was getting crowded, we were just an afterthought. Very disappointed in that kind of service and attitude from a Concierge. Would think twice before coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: minivanmom
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our August 2004 trip. It was everything we expected, and it was wonderful. We took advantage of an August special and booked a pool view room for $149. I was under the impression that you could still see animals from some of the end rooms on the pool side. When I asked the front desk person about this, she said that the end rooms do have a view of the savannah, but the animals don't come that far down. I asked how much it would be to upgrade to a savannah view room and she said it would be $10 an night. We ended up with a fabulous view and saw lots of animals for only $159 a night. We thought it was a great deal. Disney transportation was wonderful. Buses run constantly from the Animal Kingdom Lodge to the parks. We did get stuck waiting 45 minutes at Magic Kingdom one night because the bus that came to pick us up tried to use the wheelchair lift to load a guest in a wheelchair. The lift broke and then they tried to fix it. A second bus came, but there were so many people that we couldn't get on until the third bus. It was annoying, but it was not a usual happening. Every other time we rode the bus, we didn't have any problems or long waits. The Disney Extra Magic Hour was the best feature. Every day one park opens an hour early for Disney resort guests. We got up super early, rode everything we wanted and then went back to the hotel when it started to get crowded. After lunch, a nap and a dip in the pool we would go back to the parks when everyone else was starting to get tired and stop for dinner. We never saw a parade because of this strategy, but we were very happy. We saw a lot of tired grumpy families. We enjoyed many of the hotel activities, but we couldn't possibly do them all. We spent time watching the animals, of course. We enjoyed the pool and especially the slide. At night we got to use night vision goggles to view the animals. We also got to hear the nightly storytelling. We enjoyed the free cookie decorating at Boma. One negative thing I did hear that you should consider is that the Animal Kingdom Lodge is not "Disney enough." That is possibly true for some people. There is not a whole lot of Mickey Mouse stuff- not even Lion King. That was fine with us. We mainly wanted to stay there because of the animals. After being bombarded by Disney movies in the parks, we were kind of glad to get away from them at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping by Bongos”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wish to extend my unhappiness with the stay we experienced with Animal Kingdom. This just didnt come across as a Disney hotel and its service and standards! Housekeeping was unsatisfactory. We found a football behind the curtain, which obviously belonged to the previous occupants, unless one of the Bongos had thrown it up to our room ! Our room was never tidied ( I don’t expect a full blitz) but to the point that toothbrushes weren’t even put back tidy and if there was a shoe in the middle of the room, it was still there when we got back! No clean towels till the next day, and evening wise, no swan (towel) in site on the bed when we got home with a few chocolates by the side! I requested a crib sheet 3 times to housekeeping, it never came that night, we had to use towels as sheets, I had to ring again the next morning for it! The Cafeteria was a disgrace, I waited by the bakery counter, and watched four staff chatting amongst themselves oblivious to me and I had to call one over for assistance. The tables were never clean, they always had ketchup, chips on floor/table, never saw anyone cleaning the tables down. Service was very slow! This hotel lacked all the Razzmatazz of a Disney hotel, even down to their courtesy “Good morning, have a nice day” from staff, which Disney are so good at! The outlook you couldnt fault, but for the price that was paid, would have expected better service, think one of the Bongos could have done a better job!

Reviews.Title: “Disney's AKL--A magical place”
Reviews.Author: barnhok
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here in April 2004. The setting and the facilities couldn't have been nicer. It was such a special place. Our room was great, too, with a bunk bed for the kids and a lovely view of the pool. We chose to save the $50/night extra that a savannah room would have cost and were pleased with our choice. We saw lots of animals but often the savannahs looked empty--while the view of the pool from the 4th floor was always nice. There were some hits and misses with staff. At check-in, we were told that no room with bunk beds were available as it was 1st come, 1st served. I asked if we could be moved the following day and, viola, we got a room with bunks after all. The person at check in did not, however, inform us and we didn't find out until we got to the room--so it seemed a little suspicious. On the other hand, the maids did great things while we were away with our kids' stuffed animals. They made little dioramas with them, to the delight of our 8 year old. We also were given a "towel animal"--a duck made from wash clothes. It really added to the Disney experience. The animal keepers were very informative, too. Had a great meal at Boma. We all loved the decor, the pool and the animals. . . we would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in a special place for a few nights!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulCrawford
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two weeks in July 2004, and just got back. Hotel was fantastic and would recommend staying here. Staff and house keeping were really great and helped with our problems. Room was upgraded so we can see the animals, which is something that will be difficult to match on next holiday. The only negative things, was to walk from our room to the car park took about 10 mins each way. Disney buses were excellent. A great place to stay if you have small children as there are daily activities. Choice of food was good. Pool could have been bigger, however it was just right for the number of people who used it (saw a black rat snack near the pool, however it was captured quickly!.) Recommend buying the drinks mug, and recommend the hot chocolate. Also, another idea is check out the other Disney Hotels by visiting them if you have time as some of the others sound terrific also.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: MUST STAY!!! My family and I stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge in mid Nov 2003. I have NEVER experienced anything like it! I had learned from another review that when you go off season to book a standard room and that they will upgrade you free of cost. Sure enough...when we arrived they immediately upgraded us to a Savannah view room. Imagine sitting on your balcony watching giraffes, ostriches and zebras casually strolling by your room. It was ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE. My kids and I found ourselves wanting to come back early from the theme parks just to stay at the resort. Bus commute from the lodge to the theme parks was not a problem at all. The only problem....we found ourselves not wanting to leave the resort!!! The restaurant was FAB. Access the African guides. The place is filled with wonderful people who know a great deal about the wildlife and are more than willing to share their stories from their homeland. Also take advantage of evening 'story hour'. You sit outside around a rock pit camp fire in a rocking chair and listen to the African guides tell African folklore stories. I would go so far as to say that I would return to DW again IF ONLY to go back to this incredible resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch and best value in Disney!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at AKL in July of 2003 and enjoyed it so much that we went again in July 2004- and we were not disappointed! It's the best value in Disney luxury resorts by far, and you won't find a hotel in Orlando with a nicer atmosphere or better restaurants. This property is not quite as sprawling as other Disney hotels- it doesn't take 10 minutes to walk to the restaurants or bus stops, like at Port Orleans or Coronado. Check-in was quick and simple, but check-out was more of a challenge. It was a 25-minute wait for a bellhop, which is apparently commonplace at AKL- not acceptable, in our view. The pool is busy but so large that it doesn't feel crowded, and there is a large and alert lifeguard staff, though they go off duty at 8pm. (the pool stays open 24 hours but the slide is closed when lifeguards aren't there- the slide is fabulous!) IMPORTANT TIPS BEFORE YOU GO: If you are getting a Savanna-view room (which IS worth the extra money!), request a view of the Arusha Savanna (that's the inner Savanna). It's the prettiest view, but don't be disappointed if you don't get it- there were just as many animals to be seen from our room on the Uzima Savanna. And ask for a 3rd or 4th floor room- that's the best view. If you can't afford a Savanna-view room, don't despair- there are plenty of overlooks for animal-viewing. If you expect to use the pool a lot, ask for a room on the Zebra Trail or Giraffe Trail- those are closest, though the Giraffe Trail doesn't have a Savanna view. And when you're not in the parks, take advantage of the free activities for kids-lots of fun! By the way, the Disney staff was friendly and top-notch, as always.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Declining Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge two years ago -- with a savannah view room and had an all-around wonderful experience. The view is awesome on most savannahs. On our visit this July (2004), we were placed in a room that was totally different then we requested. When we complained we were told rooms were given on a first-come, first-serve basis -- I wish they would have said this when we made our request, because we would have checked in early as we were already in Orlando. Who would have ever thought a hotel would want to encourage alot of early check-ins and furthermore, punish people for arriving on time? We agreed to try the room they placed us in until the next day. We went out for the evening and upon return turned down the bedspread to find it severely stained. We had housekeeping come see the problem. They somehow then managed to place us in the room we requested originally -- at 11:30 at night -- dragging a sleeping child around, and one half asleep. Compensation for the literally hours of waiting on these two issues was two fast passes and a promise of turn-down service which never happened. At the end of our second day, management did make some arrangements for us at another park after a lot of back and forth phone calls. We finally felt compensated in the end, but very disappointed that customer service did not try to correct the situation right away. It seems the level of attention and service that Disney is known for is declining.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with the Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge with my husband and four year old son in March 2004. The check in service was horrible. We were sent to three different rooms before we finally go into one with the Savannah view (which we had paid extra for) that was cleaned. This took hours and my son was in tears. My husband was threatening to leave. They gave us a free dinner. The room was very small. The view was of a generally empty, muddy area with a fence. The balcony was so small we could not all sit out there together. Even if we could, we wouldn't have because the swampy ground was causing an infestation of mosquitos. The pool was okay, but they didn't monitor the use of the slide and bigger kids were constantly cutting in the line and preventing the little kids from getting their turns on the slide. The check out was horrendous. We waited for close to an hour for someone to come up and get our bags (and that was after much complaining). They would not allow us to take a cart and bring our bags down ourselves. When I tried to speak with the manager, she told me that she was sorry, but they were very busy and they had already given us a free dinner. It was just bad all the way around and I will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back on Friday 7/2/2004 from our trip to Animal Kingdom Lodge. We had a wonderful time the lodge is beautiful! The pool is so big and it didn't feel that crowded. The only problem is the pool is open 24 hours and you can hear the kids all night if you have a room facing the pool. But other then that the Lodge is great to stay even the bus service was fast. The food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “As close as you can get to the real Africa!”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinSunseeker
Reviews.Content: My husband, 9 and 11 year old daughters and myself had an awesome time at the Animal Kingdom Lodge!! We upgraded to a savannah view room but had a room on the outer circle...not as nice as the inner circle rooms. We saw lots of animals, all of the time, but the background was a chain linked fence. Would definitely request an inner circle room, much prettier! We almost didn't book here because of the comments that it was too far away from most of the parks. Don't let this deter you away from this awesome hotel, the time to get to the parks was minimal! It never took us more than 15 minutes to get to any of the parks. With only 300 rooms, the hotel and pool area never felt crowded. The pool is open all night, but no life guards are on duty in the evenings. It's a large, zero entry pool and heated. We took advantage of many evening swims. Boma's was fabulous! The prime rib and salmon were incredible. We ate there many times and were seated immediately every time. The hotel itself was very beautiful with authentic African displays everywhere. It's dark, but this only adds to the decor. The rooms were very spacious and the kids LOVED the bunkbeds. Service was top notched all the way. We've stayed at other moderate, on-site Disney properties in the past but the room accomodations and amenities make AKL well worth the extra price. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Room # 5032”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelcat
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Wilderness lodge and the Contemporary in the past few months. Animal Kingdom lodge reminded me a lot of Wilderness Lodge. I was nervous about staying here since it is so far away from the Magic Kingdom and Epcot (our favs) but the busses were great. With small children in tow it's nice to get on the bus and go straight to the hotel. When you stay at the Contemporay or one of the other hotels on the monorail you have to switch monorails to get from your hotel to Epcot and do it on the return trip. Not a very pleasant thing to do once the novelty of the Monorail wears off and with sleeping children and stroller in tow. We booked a pool view room but it also overlooked one of the savannahs. We could see all kinds of wild animals from our balcony. We were in room 5032. Very close to everything!! The pool and restraunt were so close...it was the best location! I heard lots of people who had paid for Savannah view rooms who had not seen many animals. We were where all the action was. The pool is sooo tropical looking and witht the animals in the background it was truly amazing!! At Boma you have to get the coconut curry chicken soup. I requested the recipe. They e mailed it to me. Can't wait to try it again. The hotel is wonderful...all shiny and new. Not a speck of dirt to be found. The grounds are immaculate and tropical. The kid programs were great. They offer so much. If you want to just stick around the hotel for the day there's plenty to do. Don't forget to do the cookie decorating at Boma! Have Fun!

Reviews.Title: “What A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge the first week of June and we ABSOLUTELY loved the resort. After reading some of the reviews I was concerned about our stay, but we were more than pleasantly surprised at every turn! First and foremost the staff at AKL was incredibly friendly, kind and helpful. Aftering checking into our room my husband wanted to try for a room further over the savannah and the next morning we were able to move to another room with a more beautiful view. Yes, it was further out away from the lobby, pool, etc., but the further out you go, the better the view! The resort itself is so quiet and tranquil that after the hectic days at the parks, we all looked forward to the peace and quite AKL offers. Our room size was more than adequate for four of us (2 adults, a 12 year old and an 8 year old) and the bunk beds were a treat, but it was the animals that had us up every morning at 6:00 a.m.! We sat on our balcony every morning and drank our coffee watching the animals! What a delight! The resort itself is beautiful and the pool is huge! We ate at the Boma and the Mara and both were fine. I would have wished for some more "American" dishes, but we did well with the food the resort offered. Overall our experience at AKL was fantastic. And, the bus transportation, as usual, was exceptional. We never waited for a bus more than ten minutes. We were not planning a trip back to Disney for a few years, but we all decided half way through our trip that next year we were coming back to AKL. Put your worries away and enjoy all this beautiful resort has to offer!! You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “it was lovely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Easter for two weeks and loved it. The hotel was beautiful and you never saw the same thing twice. Around every corner was a new picture or figure. The staff were friendly and nothing was too much trouble. We were not overkeen on the food there but the kids loved the buffet in Boma and the Mara was very handy for snacks etc. The room was very nice and was kept spotlessly clean. We got our refill cups from the Mara and saved a fortune in soft drinks and tea and coffee. I would recommend you use the Disney transport because it is so handy at the end of a long day to just flop on a bus and get dropped back to the hotel. I would definately come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice.. a true Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this was the best experience ever... My children will never forget it... After having a million problems at the over rated, over priced convention center they call the Dolphin, I escaped to the Animal Kingdom... EXCELLENT service, rooms, restaurants... everything... The pool is heated leading to endless nights of swimming... the animals are incredible and close... the hotel is a tru Disney experience with shuttles EVERYWHERE you need to go... I cant thank them enough and after this trip my children have become angels... well I'll take it while it lasts...

Reviews.Title: “animal kingdom lodge rocks!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the animal kingdom lodge was perfect!!! We loved everything about it, the food,the pool,the room and of course the animals!! The bus transportation was right on the money,we had to wait 15 minutes max. My only complaints would be: not enough towel racks to hang wet suits and towels, and a rude and unhelpful staffer who checked us in. the location of our room was awesome and we will definitely request it when we return!!! I without a doubt reccomend this resort!! awc in N.C.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time”
Reviews.Author: Heard
Reviews.Content: We were at the Animal Kingdom Lodge May 6-10 and we had a great time. Lobby is really neat and relaxing. Decor is out of this world. Majority of staff is wonderful!!!! Boma is a MUST for breakfast! One of the best breakfasts I think I've ever had. If there weren't so many different Disney resorts to choose from, I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Commish123
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Stay, Great Service......we have stayed with Disney Hotels many times. This hotel is off the beaten path, but those you want a real treat will love the change in venue. Aminal Kingdon lodge is how disney used to be with the staff falling over you to help you. Excellent pool with a great food service...Boma a big hit with my family. The hotel really feels like a lodge...with the animals in the grasslands.....I loved Beach Club and I like the Boardwalk, Wildreness Lodge, Contemporary, Polynesian, Institute Villas, Cornanado, Carribean Beach, Swan and Dolphin, Yacht Club......But I think this was the best value yet!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: JulieNH57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the concierge level of the Animal Kingdom Lodge (4/28-5/1/04). It was the best vacation of our lives. The smell of the lodge (something between a burning ember and a cardamon pod) is special. The dark ambiance with the African shields on the lighting fixtures and suspension bridge on the fifth floor over the lobby adds to the soothing feeling of the lodge too. The rooms, while smaller than some of the "Deluxe" disney resorts, is hardly noticeable when your gaze is fixated on the Anokole Cattle, Giraffes and Zebras right outside your balcony! Boma was our best dining experience of our trip. Take your server's advice and sample many of the offerings and then go back for more of what you enjoy. We loved Boma!!! Jiko, the fine dining restaurant was very good too. The pool was huge and the mid-level slide fit our 8 year old just fine. Since we stayed on the concierge level, we were able to book the morning sunrise safari and thought this was the highlight of our trip. We were afraid of going to the Animal Kingdom Lodge because the photos on the net did not look that great. Ignore the photos, they do not do this lodge justice! We loved our entire trip and can't wait to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent, but leave yourself plenty of time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge in 2001. The theming is awesome, you really feel as though you are staying in a hunting lodge in Kenya. From the landscaping, to the smell of burning hardwoods in the lobby. The pool is very cool, and themed accordingly. The best thing was while sitting on our small balcony one morning before getting started with another busy day of park hopping I was astounded to see a giraffe sauntering by. The way things are set up, he seemed to only be about 20 feet away but really, he was much further. It made my day. The only negative thing that I can think of to say is that the lodge is a fairly good distance away from all of the parks (except the Animal Kingdom Park) and the only Disney transportation is bus service, which is very efficient but adds to your time schedule. I would certainly reccomend it to anyone who's into the animals, but if your main goal is to just stay at a Disney luxury resort, I'd rather tell you to look at The Boardwalk Inn or The Wilderness Lodge. They are both in better locations, and both have alot to offer.

Reviews.Title: “concierge level only worth it for the sunrise tour”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were at ALK for four days in March. We stayed in the concierge level rooms. Some of the benefits were that the 6th floor concierge level tv and table area was a nice place to take a break. The coffee from the automatic machines was surprisingly good and looked like a great place to park the kids (if we had any) for a breather and some free food (mostly snacks except at around 5 when they had some hors d'oeuvres). Also, it was nice to be able to make a reservation at the resturants the day you wanted to eat there... HOWEVER, even with the reservation, you had to wait (buffet resturant... I forget the name).... Finally, you can only get the sunrise tour if you are already booked into a concierge level room. You still have to pay the fee for the tour as well as admittance to AK, but without this tour, the room would not be worth it. But even with the tour, you may want to think twice. The tour only occurs twice a week (I think tuesdays and sat) so pretty much, the other nights, you are paying extra for a room that is exactly the same as a non-concierge room (in terms of size and view) for marginal benefit. Since the Lodge is not on the AK premises, unless you intend on staying at the lodge all day, the 6th floor really is not worth what you pay. Don't get me wrong, the hotel is nice but it isn't the ritz.... For adults with no children, it may be an experience that you do once.... you could do a lot better for the price.....

Reviews.Title: “Almost top-notch”
Reviews.Author: PaulinNJ
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just got back from Animal Kingdom Lodge. I read all the reviews on Trip Advisor before I went and now would like to add my own. Here's what I see as the problem: Yes, the resort is definitely "above normal" (Trip Advisor's rating) - but it's not above normal for a Disney resort. First, the good: the balcony of our "Savannah Preferred" room allowed us to watch a wonderful assortment of animals - like giraffes, antelope, ostrich. and other birds. Don't expect the "savanah" to be all that large. The work buildings are only a couple of hundred yards away. Plus, there's a dusty work road between your balcony and the fields of grass - quite necessary, I'm sure, to protect both animals and lodgers. Count me among those who prefer a lower balcony (2nd floor) as opposed to a higher one. We really were at eye level with the giraffes when they got to within 50 feet of us - about as close as the animals can come. When we went up to another observation platform, we really felt that we were no longer "in" the savannah. Another good aspect of the resort is the fact that you can view the animals from many observation points. It was really lovely to be walking along a corridor and to be presented suddenly with a view of African cattle at a watering hole. But the not-so-good things did cut in: First, I wondered what to make of those Trip Advisor comments about loud toilets. Yikes, I can't believe Disney was able to find a toilet that flushes this loudly. What's _that_ all about? It wouldn't be so bad if the walls were thicker - and that's the second bad thing. We had crying babies on either side of us and I was, unfortunately, reminded (at 3 a.m.) of how I used to have to get up and feed my little ones during the night. The rooms are a bit small, but not annoyingly so. The two of us managed quite well in it. We had the most delightful housekeeper who charmed us with little surprises each morning, all above and beyond the usual Disney "have a magical day" bromides. And yes, the food is expensive (surprise, surprise) - but it's not bad in quality. My personal tip is to try Jiko if you don't mind paying about $50 per person, including dessert. My 11-year-old (admittedly adventurous) daughter and I loved the gourmet dishes we tried. Boma, on the other hand, emphasizes that great American virtue: quantity - though the quality is really not bad. The swimming pool is a total disappointment, but I'm thinking that this is the direction that Disney is going: get people out of the hotel and into the parks, where money can be made. The hotel pool has a kiddie slide (what are those ads talking about: "a huge slide"?) which the 5-to-8 year-olds seemed to enjoy. So we ended up at Blizzard Beach, which we loved. In conclusion, the best thing about the hotel is its attempt to be a conservation-minded eco-lodge. I appreciate this aspect of it, though it truly was at the expense of spectacular design and architecture. Considering the fact that there are so many things to see in this world, I probably wouldn't go there again - though I don't regret having spent time there.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderfull place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a wonderfull place! We had such a good time there. We have three teenagers and everyone had a great time. My only complaint is that we did not get to stay long enough. The staff is wonderfull, the hotel is spotless,watching the animals, the pool, everything. We cannot wait to come back. You will love it.

Reviews.Title: “The best place ever”
Reviews.Author: Kim1406
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at AKL twice, 12/2002 and 1/2004 and both times it was absolutely magical. The rooms are outstanding, the animals are magnificent, the staff is knowledgable. Some of the negative reviews of this have come from folks who aren't very Disney-knowledgable. The restaurants here are popular and you need to call 30-90 days ahead of time for reservation (especially if you want a princess breakfast, but even if you want to eat at the hotel's buffet). The quick-service food counter is well stocked with hot and cold food to eat in or to go, the pool is beautiful with a zero entry and a neat little slide. You could not ask for more!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: kailouis
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Animal Kingdom for four nights. I must say, my family loved it. My daugher would not come out of the pool. The free-form entrance to the pool is fantastic. You can wade in there for hours and watch the kids swim and slide down the waterslide. Boma was above average, Mara is what it is...a poolside in/out restaurant which served us well for quick bites and coffee. The pool bar does open before 5 pm and even though it rained for two of the days my daughter had a blast with the children's activities they provide. She even earned all of her activity beads and made a very nice bracelet. She is 3 1/2. Overall we had a great time and even saw the giraffes and zebras!

Reviews.Title: “Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We received a complimentary upgrade to a suite with a savannah veiw. Lovely room with plenty of space which allowed us to enjoy a few "room service" meals after long days in the parks. The hotel is incredibly crafted and each of the employees that I dealt with seemed knowledgeable regarding the wildlife and the surroundings. The rooms can be a bit of a walk from the lobby, but still the veiw made it bearable. Note to allergy sufferers - you might want to prepare for this trip. The tendency is to leave the balcony doors open to enjoy the wildlife which leaves you exposed to the pollen and, at least to this writer, the pollen was potent (over-the-counters were not effective). A final tip, take advantage of the valet parking. At $6.00 per day it's a bargain and, when we phoned the valet service before leaving our room, there was never a wait.

Reviews.Title: “loved the animal kindom lodge... every thing about it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stood at the animal kingdom lodge and thought it was amazing! The food was superb at the boma the african food was awesome and the selection was phenominal! I preferred the trip to animal kingdom and the stay at the animal kingdom lodge to our summer spent in Europe. The staff was great and friendly no matter how stupid your question about the animals. they are so helpful in any way. They have a program on the tv that has bedtime stories read to you. the landscapeing is out of this world. and you can take a walk around the pool early in the morning and see the animals being fed that roam freely around the hotels savannas. when you go up to your hotel room for the first time you have a list of animals and you can just explore around the hotel grounds checking off animals that you see. this hotel has something that you cannot put in to words and the closest you can get is african love.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Worth the money. Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Cristine14
Reviews.Content: I have been to Disneyworld at least 10 times. I have always stayed in Disney. This is a great place to stay. Nice rooms. Good food. Pool open 24 hours a day. (July 2003) Eat breakfast and lunch here. Cheap. Good pizza, it is huge. Remember to buy a cup in the beginning of your stay. It is a plastic cup with a top. It is a Animal Kingdom Cup. (Each resort has one.) I can't remember the exact price, I think around $7.00. It is worth it. You get unlimited refills on coffee, tea, and soft drinks. (For your entire stay.) Go down and get a cup of coffee in the morning and bring it up to your room. You get to keep cup, nice gift to yourself. Remember, even in Disney if you don't like your room asked to be changed. If you want a different location ask for it. Don't stay in a room that you do not like. They are great about changing rooms. I like to see different rooms before I even bring my luggage there. By the way, I always keep my luggage with me. Remember, you are at Disney to have fun and relax. Take your time. You do not have to get up first thing in the morning to run around the parks. Eat, relax enjoy the morning. Look at the animals. Swim. Then go to the parks. It slows down later in the morning. Remember, when you take the bus, relax enjoy. It might take you twenty minutes to get to the parks, but remember it's free. You will be walking alot, so enjoy. This hotel is really great. You get your moneys worth. The lobby is breathtaking. Great gift shop. (Tip: If you buy something in the park it can be sent to your hotel room for free. Just ask. It is nice to have a gift waiting for you back at your hotel.) Remember, this is also a great place to stay because it does have a lobby. Some of the cheaper Disney Hotels do not. With younger kids and adults it is a good place to sit around or meet up with friends and family. It is huge. Oh, and the animals are fun to see. They also have a campfire going at night. Balconys off each room. Also, big balconys throughout the hotel where you can sit. They have these big rocking chairs on them. This is really a great place to stay. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: STAYED HERE FOR 5 DAYS WITH MY 3 CHILDREN.Beautiful hotel and service was very nice. Used our rental vehichle as it was much easier than the disney transport. Lots of kids and ambiance is lovely. Room was great and not too small at all despite putting a crib in it. We had a leak in our room and were accomodated and compensated for it immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge is magical”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of five had the oppurtunity to stay at Animal Kingdom Lodge twice in 2003. What a lobby, first of all!! It's spectacular!!! The rooms are pretty large and fit us fine. We never felt like we were tripping over each other. The outside vanity area, seperate from the bathroom, was great!! Two sinks made it easy for everyone to get ready in the morning. They have a large closet that fits a few suitcases and many clothing items. The armoire is quite large and holds a large tv and several drawers for clothing. The decation and theming in the rooms are phenomenal! We stayed in both a pool view room and savannah view, and both were great!!!! We loved seeing the animals every time we looked out the window. The balconies weren't very large but we loved sitting out there at night.The Mara is a fantastic quick service counter restaurant that offers both African and American foods. The price is ok but you get large portions. Definately try the zebra domes!! They have a refillable mug program with cute African themed mugs. They were well worth the money.One of our favorite things about the resort was the pool. We absolutely loved it! The pool is huge and we never felt crowded in. The slide is a ton of fun too!! My toddler loved the zero depth pool! He even loved the children's pool! The two hot tubs are plenty big, even in crowded seasons.The arcade is a ton of fun as well. The hotel offers many different viewing areas to see the animals. Make sure you take the time to look around the resort to see all the animals and artifacts.Boma is a great buffet that we absolutely loved! Definately check this one out for lunch or dinner!!! You can smell the aromas of the food as soon as you walk into the lobby of the resort.There are many different activities to participate in throughout the resort. From cookie decorating to hotel tours to animal night watching..there is a ton to do! There are many animal guides throughout the resort waiting and willing to talk to guests. We enjoyed the storytelling at the firepit every night!We would happily stay here again! Well worth the money!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Boma and the exotic lobby are the hallmarks of this disney report”
Reviews.Author: mcdoodle
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at at the Carribbean Beach Hotel on our last trip, we decided to fork over the big bucks for a Deluxe Disney resort this trip -- the Animal Kingdom Lodge. We reserved a savannah view room. It took several tries and multiple front desk personnel to find a room with an acceptable view. The front desk staff was willing to accomodate us -- we just had to insist on what we wanted. Most of the time, however, the only animals that we saw from our balcony were some birds. The rooms are nicely decorated but our family of three found the bathroom area to be crowded. You almost fall over the toilet on the way to the shower. The rooms in general are small so plan on spending most of your time outside your room in the fabulous lobby. We hit some cold rainy weather. After several hours at Animal Kingdom Park, we were rained out and returned to the hotel in the mid-afternoon. We were wet and cold and wanted a warm spot in front of a fire and an irish coffee. Well, we got the spot in front of the fire but had to settle for nescafe coffee from Mara. The bars do not open until 5 pm. Forget about feeling pampered at this Deluxe hotel. The pool area is large but not very imaginative. We ate breakfast and dinner at Boma. Twice at this restaurant we were initially shown to very bad tables. We found that we had to be pretty assertive with the staff to get a decent table. Once seated, the food is served buffet style. The food is fabulous and a good value. My family of three ate breakfast here for $45 and dinner for $75. We bypassed the Mara which reminded us of eating at a 7-Eleven. I would have to say that on my next trip to Orlando I will NOT stay at a Disney property at all. (We actually found that the Portofino Hotel at Universal was a step above anything that Disney has to offer at a better price). I would, however, eat at BOMA again.

Reviews.Title: “If you enjoy listening to toilets flush.....”
Reviews.Author: bridgitta
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy listening to toilets flush this is the place for you. No need to bring an alarm clock... every morning you will awake at about 6:00 am to the sound of toilets flushing all around you. And occasionally the sound of your neighbors urinating. Other than that, some rooms are VERY far from the lobby (which is the only way in). After a long day in the parks, I wasn't up to a 1/2 mile (just guessing on the length) walk to my room- even if it was a "free" upgrade to a Savannah view. Speaking of the Savannah view, it consisted of a direct view of the rooms accross from us, dirt, and an emply corral. Occasionally there were a few birds bathing in the swamp outside but that was about all. Definitely would not have been worth the money to upgrade to a Savannah view. We asked to change rooms- the front desk attendants were not helpful or accomodating. They were actually rude- I know, that's not the usual Disney way. One the positive side, the pool is quite nice and Boma's is excellant. Needless to say, I won't fork out the money to stay there again- which I expressed to the front desk- and receeved no response.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Amenities and Service”
Reviews.Author: StelAngBocaRaton
Reviews.Content: Having worked in the Travel Industry and traveled extensively, I have had the chance to stay at many resorts. Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge was quite a disappointment. I had visited this hotel property a year ago while in the Orlando area and fell in love with the interior design displayed in the hotels decor. In early February I traveled with a group of 25 people(Freinds and Family) to this hotel. The check in process was quite a spectacle. Half of our group could check in a half hour early(2:30pm). While the other half was told that their rooms would not be ready for a couple of hours. That half had to remain in the lobby. Breakfast is a good hour wait, unless you make a reservation prior to your arrival. If you try making a reservation while staying at the resort, you will be asked to call an off-site reservation company for Disney dining, this hold time is about 30 minutes. The hotel concierge instructed a member in my party to go to a different hotel to use a computer with internet access. Later, we were told the Animal Kingdom lodge had only one computer on property with Internet access. The wait for this computer was over an hour. Room Service closes very early and the hold time, was about 15 minutes. We attempted to order a pot of coffee one morning and were told:, "That could be up to 75 minutes, do you still want to order." So, If you are looking for hospitality Walt Disney Style and do not want to feel like you have wasted your money, you probably should choose to stay elsewhere. Walt Disney prides itself on being courteous, polite, helpful and available. Disney Animal Kingdom Lodge did not fulfill one of these attributes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a wonderful vacation at Disney. Everything about this place was wonderful! This resort is very large and requires walking. We stayed in a pool view room which was the best choice as it is close to everything you will visit on a regular basis (pool, Mara, Simba's Cubhouse, laundry, etc.) Checking in was very easy. They gave us an animal guide and things needed for Disney. This is also when you need to request everything you need. (coffee pot, fridge, etc.) Our bellman was very very nice. We ate at all the restaurants there. At Boma, the chef came to our table to discuss what my daugther (food allergies) could eat or not eat. They had a wide selection of foods American and African. They have the normal pancakes and eggs on the buffet for the non-adventurous. The Mara was not impressive except for the service. The food is mediocre. They feature made-to-order "grill" items and grab-to-go items. The have typical foods like pizza, hamburgers, chicken fingers or you can order specialty items like the tandori chicken pizza or the African stew. Nothing was spectacular. The refillable mug was a very nice touch, but if you have stayed on property before, you know this is offered at all resorts. Jiko was a lovely experience. We met with one of the chefs at the Cooking Place as well, just for fun. He took the time to explain what he was cooking and what ingredients they use. Prior to our reservation we visited the Victoria Falls Lounge whcih was a typical bar/lounge. There are two spas, one large pool with slide, one kiddie pool. There is also a pool side bar. Our room was well appointed. Housekeeping was there everyday. The lighting is not as bad as everyone says it is. But we had a bunk bed room which had a couple more lights, I think. We were a little cramped in the room, but it was very liveable for a week. The only difficult time we had was finding a good place for the crib. It would either block a part of the doorway or you couldn't reach the nightstand. My daugther loved Simba's Cubhouse. She made some crafts and watched a couple Disney movies. They offered her dinner and snacks. The laundry could be a tad bigger. It gets really crowded. There are only about 6 washers for all the resort. There are vending machines all around the resort. I am not sure I would spend the money for a Savannah view room. They seem so far away from everything. There are many observation areas to see the animals up close. I would, however, pay extra for the pool view simply for the location. In closing, I would like to just point out the overall ambience of this resort. You are always surrounded by rich smells, exotic African music, and exotic animals. The sights of the lobby are breath taking. Activities are always going on within the resort. We will be going again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare at the Animal Kingdom never again.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I sent my wife and 6 year old child to the Disney Animal kingdom Resort on Christmas morning as a huge suprise for my little angel. She was just so excited she cried! I was proud to be able to do this for her. My daughter now is permently scarred from the horroble way they were treated and the lack of available reservations for all (ALL!!!) the events that Disney brags of to sucker people into this money making, child hurting fake world of dispair. The staff was rude. The hotel was compleatly overbooked. They could not get in any of the special events they promise children. They could not get one dinner reservation, anywhere!!!!!in the Disney area. They were stuck eating room service every night. In the park area my daughter was nearly trampled. She was ripped from her mothers arms from the exiting crowd. If not for the help from a huge man yelling and pushing them back she would have been injured worse than she was. Not enough security to handle the crowd! At the end of this wasted vacation my wife asked to have a late checkout (only 30 minutes)NO! They were rude. Not just rude very rude about this request. All they needed to do is say I'm sorry but you can not. So my daughter still asks to this day why she did not get to eat with the princeses or why this dream became such a nightmare. I tell her I love her everyday and try to explain why I told her all the apparent lies about this dream world. We still play on the Disney web page. Now that is pretty nice. I tried and tried to get something done about this but Disney is just to big and busy to make this right. I have never recieved any answer to my complaints. They make it impossible to make a complaint. I am not done. I will get results or at the least an apology to my little girl.WARN YOUR FRIENDS. If you were ripped off by Disney feel free to write me.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in mid Januray at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. What a treat for everyone involved. Although the walk to our room was long it was like walking through a museum. We had a savannah view room which I would recommend. Also, the pool was great, and the restaraunts were wonderful. Jiko was a little expensive but my children were paid extra attention to and the staff was excellent. (Come on, you're in Disney! What doesn't cost a lot?) Boma's breakfast buffet is unbelieveable, and the Mara was perfect for when we returned late from the parks. Shuttle service to all the parks was on time, about 20 minutes between runs for Disney, the farthest park. Everyone was great, I wanted to book next year as we left. However financially that won't happen for about 5 more years. When I return, however, I will stay nowhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A worthwhile destination”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a one week stay at the Animal Kingdon Lodge. As just about everyone has mentioned, the lobby is breathtaking. The works of art are museum quality and the representatives from Africa are happy to talk about their homeland and culture. The resort is quite large and some rooms are a significant distance from the lobby and bus stop to the parks. Rooms closer to the lobby suffer from (usually noisy) traffic passing by constantly.
