We were assigned a room in one of the buildings jutting off of the main arc of buildings facing the Sunset savannah. This did offer a good combination of proximity to the lobby yet being off of the main traffic flow. We were given a "complimantary" upgrade to a deluxe room. This translates into a few extra square feeet in the room and not much else. The downside is the deluxe rooms are on the 5th floor, so you are somewhat farther from the animals. I would have preferred a 2nd or 3rd floor room. The rooms are nicely decorated, a bit dark, with comfortable beds. The bathroom is too small and the door to the toilet awkward to close. And watch out when flushing the toilet...it scared the heck out of my little girl it's so loud and forceful. House keeping was adequate. If you would like a coffee maker you need to call housekeeping to have one delivered and it only includes the first day's supply of coffee. Kind of skimpy for a hotel that charges more than $250 a night. Refrigerators are available for rent for a $10 per day fee. We rented one and found it to be very worthwhile for having breakfast, snacks and drinks in the room. Food at the resort is EXPENSIVE. It is well worth it to stop at a grocery store on the way to the hotel and stock up on drinks, bottled water, coffee and snacks. And Disney doesn't seem to care if you do this, no one gave us a second look when we checked in with grocery bags from Publix. The restaurants at the hotel include Jiko which is only open for dinner, Boma, a buffet open for breakfast and dinner and the Mara which is fast food serving all day. Jiko is an excellent dining experience, but rather expensive. We never did try Boma, so I can't comment on the quality. The Mara is decent, especially the "grab and go" fruit plates and wraps. Unfortunately, it's your only option for lunch if you stay at the resort. The pool area is quite large with sloped zero entry section and a small slide. The water is heated to the mid 80's so it's comfortable to swim even on cooler days. There are two hot tubs as well. There are many observation places scattered throughout the hotel to observe the animals and helpful guides at most places. Storytelling is done every evening around the fire just off of the lobby. I was disappointed in that they told the SAME story every night. Come on, isn't there more than one African story?? Activities are available for the children at scheduled times during the day including music, games, animal information, and night vision. Children can earn a bead for some activities and make a necklace or bracelet. The gift shop has a wide variety of unique African handicrafts as well as the usual Disney souveniers. Beer and wine are also sold and are much less expensive than from the restaurants or room service. Transportation to the parks is by bus. The buses run about every 15 - 20 minutes. Commute time varies from 5 minutes to the Animal Kingdom to almost 20 minutes to the Magic Kingdom. If you are going to another resort, your best bet is to rent a car and drive. Otherwise you have to switch buses at Downtown Disney. Guests staying at the resort park free at any other resort or park. Overall, it is a sophisticated resort which is still family friendly. The setting is it's best feature, it's remote location and lack of food service options is it's worst feature.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but problems”
Reviews.Author: SweetFirefly
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at Animal Kingdom Lodge through Expedia after reading the (mostly) excellent reviews here. We had nothing but problems from start to finish with this resort. Upon check-in I was told they had a "system problem" and couldn't locate my payment. The clerk advised me to call the desk in 30 minutes to check on my payment. When I called down to the desk, I was told that they couldn't find my payment. I was treated as if I hadn't paid and I was trying to dodge the bill! Thoroughly insulting. Needless to say, they DID find my payment, but not after causing me endless aggravation. As if this wasn't enough when we decided to go to bed and turned down the covers, there were black hairs in both of the sheets. Not a single person in my family even comes close to having black hair. I was disgusted! When I called down to the front desk the manager did not sound very apologetic. She did send someone up to change the bedding. That was the least she could do. I felt I should have been comped something small for all the aggravation, but nothing was offered. Bad customer service! Also be forewarned that the "Savannah" these poor animals are forced to live on is too small. The animals barely have any room to roam. I think Disney made it so small so the animals would stay close enough so people could stare at them. I found the whole situation sad. That these majestic animals should have to live in such a small place isn't right. I do not recommend a room with a view. Save your money. The lobby was beautiful. The decor of the hotel is awe inspiring. Unfortunately the beauty of the lobby did not make up for the negative experience. We also ate at Boma. If you aren't into spicy, strange food, skip it. It wasn't worth the money. I love all types of ethnic food, so I decided to try this restaurant. The food wasn't good. Even the hummus didn't taste good. How can you mess that up? Well, their chef seemed to think that hummus requires tons of salt. I found the food mediocre at best. Try Jiko, or go out for food.

Reviews.Title: “Really Really Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge Nov. 8th - 15th. It was wonderful. I asked to upgraded to a Savannah room and to my surprise - They already had. I would definitely recommend the Savannah View. It was so neat looking out your balcony and watching the animals grazing. The atmosphere was great. They had just put up the Christmas decorations before we left and it was beautiful. We ate at the Boma Buffet. Food was wonderful. It was something I am glad we decided to do. I hesitated at first because of the price, but in reality not much more than a sit down meal at a restaurant. I would recommend this resort to anyone, anytime.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from an absolutely wonderful 7 night stay at Animal Kingdom Lodge. I have stayed at many deluxe hotels both on Disney Property and off and this one tops the rest. The staff was extremely helpful and went above and beyond 100% of the time. Our two boys (4 and 6) loved the zero entrance pool and the water slide. Housekeeping was fantastic and we returned every afternoon to find everything extremely clean and the kids animals posed in the funnest ways! Although we spent a lot of time at the parks we also spent a lot of time at the resort. We could have made an entire vacation just staying at the resort and never leaving.I would recommend this resort to anyone as it was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge.... The BEST”
Reviews.Author: goingtoeurope
Reviews.Content: Well.... Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge is SO Beautiful! When you walk in through the doors it truely feels like you are the richest person in the world!It may be overpriced, BUT it is SO worth it!My 13 year old daughter and my 16 year old daughter(who dosen't like anything) adored it so much they want to go back. If I ever go to Disney World again my first choice in hotel will be Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge.If you stay here eat at the Boma for breakfast. Their buffet is so good.Their special juice called Frunch juice is the BEST and when I say the Best I mean the best juice you have ever tasted!I would choose this hotel over any other Disney Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just came home today from my week long stay at the Disneys Animal Kingdom Lodge. When I walked through the doors into the lobby I was completely blown away. Everything about the place was wonderful. African dacners and drummers songs filled the air as well as delicious smelling food, waterfalls, not to mention all the animals right outside the windows! Words can not even begin to describe how beautiful this place truly is. My room was clean and the perfect size with 2 beds and a bunk bed. Plus the balcony with a great view of the animals. I wouldnt recommond any place else!

Reviews.Title: “Experience of a lifetime!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned yesterday from a 5 night stay. Took advantage of Disney's excellent Military discount. Wouldn't have been able to afford the hotel otherwise. From the moment we arrived, everything was absolutely beautiful. My family teased me about saying "This is amazing" so often throughout our visit. Got the souvenir cups and filled up often from morning to night. We rented two adjoining rooms with savannah views, located on the second floor middle savannah. Saw lots of animals including giraffes early morning and all evening. We had plenty of room, don't know why previous poster thought they were small. I read ahead of time that the rooms would be darker than normal but they were brighter than I was expecting. The entire experience was perfect, from the housekeeping, the views, the food, the pool, and the buses to the parks. We will be doing Disney again in 2 or 3 yrs but we won't be able to afford the AKL again. Once in a lifetime is enough and well worth the price even if it was discounted.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: kjd469
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an 8 night stay at AKL and found it to be everything we hoped for. Having stayed at several other Disney resorts, I would have to say that this is one of the best. Visually stunning! We had a Deluxe Savannah View Room and it didn't disappoint, although because it was on the top floor, our view was somewhat obstructed due to the trees. A lower level would provide a clearer view. All of the staff was friendly, our room was clean and we had no complaints. There are great crafts and activities for the children throughout the day, if you are not visiting a park. Great swimming pool also. Ate several times at the Mara, and it was fine, but did not eat at Boma or Jiko...didn't feel my kids would eat enough to justify the price...but it looked wonderful. With regards to some peoples complaints about the size of the rooms and the lighting level...ridiculous. There are five in our family, and we found the room to be perfectly adequate in size, and there was plenty of light. Perhaps it was a bit more subdued than in a regular hotel, but it certainly fit the atmosphere and theme they are trying to create. Overall a wonderful vacation and I would definitely recommend the Animal Kingdom Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: leicestersusie57
Reviews.Content: Stayed at AKL for 3 nights in October 2003. We had a Savannah view room and it was absolutely brilliant. We could not find one bad thing to say about the whole experience. Check in staff were polite, friendly, helpful and went over and beyond the expected level of customer service. Room was great , view was brilliant, pool was great. Restaraunt was fantastic, food and service. Would definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Kids Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Woodjeff
Reviews.Content: After a grocery stop (bought too much) we arrived at the hotel and were immediately taken by it's size and appointments. What a place. Check-in at 3:30 PM was quick and the cast member behind the counter was very helpful. There were not many rooms available but we were given an accurate description of the rooms that were available and we picked a savannah view room about as far from the lobby as we could have gotten. The 2nd floor room was quiet and the view was great. The walk was no big deal. Our kids are 8 and 9. The views of the animals as you walk throught the hotel are great. The night lighting outside allowed some surreal views of late feeding giraffes, kudu's and other critters. I have read reviews which included complaints but I now believe they were people whining as we could not complain about anything. Yes it's expensive but for most people it's a huge treat for the kids and it is therefore worth it. We ate at Boma's in the hotel twice. Both meals were fabulous. We will return in a few years and it will be the AK Lodge for sure.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Husband, Myself and my two teenage sons have just arrived back from the Animal Kingdom Lodge Hotel and it was amazing. (Oct 27th 2003). The service was excellent and the Staff so polite. The food in the Boma was delicious but a little expensive to eat there every day. However, lots of other options available. The room was cosy and comfortable. The maid service excellent and the veiws of the savannah awsome. We saw all the animals over the two week stay except for the ostriches. The pool is huge and clean with tropical trees and plants. Two outside Jaccuzi's All open 24 hours. My Sons swam past midnight. It was beautiful. My Sons said it was the best part of their whole holiday and thats saying something in Disney. We would highly recommend it. Especially for first timers to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to Disney for our honeymoon and stayed at the AKL. We had a savannah view, concierge level room. We were there the week of Labor Day so it was blissfully relaxing as most of the younger crowd had returned home to start school. The staff was fabulous, the hotel was spotless, and the transportation was great. We never had any problems at all. We were there for a week and took advantage every day of the concierge lounge. It was a wonderful thing to have available. The food at Jiko was OUTSTANDING. The pork was to die for. The food at Boma was really wonderful too, but some of it was a bit too spicy for my tastes. We also ate at the Mara once, and our cheeseburgers were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous place with terrible service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to say that Animal Kingdom Lodge was visually stunning. The kids loved the pool and the bunk beds. The room was a bit small for a "Deluxe" hotel, but this was workable since we spent most of our time at the parks and pool. My first impression unfortunately skewed my view for the rest of my stay. We arrived at 5:45 on Friday and it took over 50 minutes to check in. We had included my sons friend on our trip at the last minute and the clerk was incapable of figuring out what to do. She would disappear into the back for 5 to 10 minute stretches, repeatedly leaving us standing and waiting. All we wanted to accomplish was to add one 12 year old to the room bill and purchase one park hopper ticket for the length of our stay. 6:30 rolls around and she is still missing. My husband was waiting at the reception counter when I stepped over to the posted restaurant menus to decide where to feed 4 starving and tired travelers. While I stepped away, leaving our suitcases stacked by the sofa area and out of the way, two bell employees walked over to our luggage and started to throw, (and I mean throw) our luggage into the corner! I walked quickly back over and said, wait, we were checking in, and one cast member snapped, We cant have luggage sitting unattended in the lobby. Then they both stalked off. That was it for me. I couldnt even see the beauty of the lodge or feel the excitement from the kids at finally being at DisneyWorld! By morning I had relaxed and chalked it up to our one bad experience but it continued from there. The kids went down to The Mara for breakfast and after ordering were told. "We don't have any more table numbers. Go wait over there." The kids waited 20 minutes before I came down and asked where their food was. It took another 10 minutes to get anyone to help. They had forgotten the kids and just left them standing without giving them a receipt for the food they had ordered and paid for. Not too cool in my book. Finally we get to leave for the theme parks! Guess what? Our Park Hopper tickets wouldnt get us in to any parks. Fault of the hotel claimed the guest relations cast member at each park. You need another room key/pass. I have to mention that most of the people who helped us at each park and hotel seemed tired and slightly hostile. They seemed to almost blame us for all the problems that were occurring, but grudgingly gave us one day passes to get in. The hotel cast members then spent another 20 minutes each morning in the back trying to figure out what was going on with our Park Hopper tickets without any success thought out our entire stay at Animal Kingdom. All and all, we wasted many hours just trying to get things right with these people. 4 days later, I was relieved to check out and move our stay to Caribbean Beach Resort. It was much better. They did an excellent job in all areas. They were polite and helpful at check in and no screw ups with the Park Hoppers. Housekeeping at all three resorts we visited was excellent. The staff in that department was friendly and hard working without fail. Vero Beach was relaxing and really fun for the kids. The pool d.j. was great! I was planning another vacation at a Disney resort in a year or so, but now I have the understanding that Deluxe doesnt always mean great service and choose my resort accordingly. I have to say, when you drop $10,000 on a vacation, you expect a bit more. Universal is beckoning!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Disney World and stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge in May 2003 with a friend of mine that has never been to Disney. I'm a huge advocate for staying on Disey property, because their are extra bonuses, one being early admission to the theme parks on certain days, and guarnteed admission to the park. The hotel is great and worth the price they charge. We were given a savannah view room, which was great, very close to the animals, ask to have a room on the lowest level possible if you have a savannah view room. The room is very nice decorated with african art and furniture made in africa. The hotel itself has the largest collection of African art in the United States. I have eaten at all the restaurants and they are very good. It is not close to the parks, I would recommend having your own car and driving. I hate having to wait for a bus and you can just come and go as you please. I would recommend for sure!

Reviews.Title: “The world's best honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A few people gave us strange looks when we said we were going to Disney for our honeymoon, but I would reccomend it to anyone looking for a fun, romantic, exciting way to celebrate your marriage.The Animal Kingdom Lodge was absolutely incredible. It is beautiful, the music playing throughout the lobby area creates a mood and the lighting and decor just make it feel magical.Our room had a savannah view (a must in my opinion) and upon arrival we had giraffes and zebras right outside our window, AMAZING! Every time we came back to the room the first thing we did was check on who was outside!The staff was remarkably nice, my husband needed cold medicine one night at 2AM! We called the front desk to see if they could help and the Night Manager opened the gift shop for us at 2:30AM so we could buy medicine, I cant imagine any other place on earth doing that!!! Our washclothes were turned into bunnies by the excellent housekeeping staff...it was fabulous.If you can, stay on the concierge level and go on the Morning Safari...but if you can't splurge stay here anyway...its awesome!

Reviews.Title: “AKL ...A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a three week stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. We had a savannah room with bunk beds for the kids which was spotlessly clean & well furnished The view of the animals was fantastic & the hotel facilities excellent. We found the hotel staff to be friendly & helpful and we thoroughly enjoyed the whole of the 21 nights we were there. The Boma is excellent value at $24 for adults & $10 for kids and the food was some of the best we've ever tasted. Even the bar prices were reasonable for deluxe Disney hotel. We had no problems with the buses,travel times were about the same as we've experienced in other Disney resorts in the past. The only criticism - the Mara menu was a little limited & would benefit from a greater choice. We'd certainly stay at the AKL again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge is the best hotel I have ever stayed at and will ever stay at! I would pay two grand a night to stay there! There are not enough dots to express how awesome this hotel is. It is beautiful inside and out. The cast members are so helpful and so nice! Our room was spotless every day, we always had enough towels etc., and the newspaper every morning was a very nice touch. The lighting throughout the hotel makes it feel like you are actually in a hut in Africa. Every guest is treated with respect and the cast members help with whatever they can whenever they can. When I go to WDW this year, I will definately be staying at Disney's Animal Kingodm Lodge!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed by AKL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thouroghly enjoyed our stay at Animal Kingdom Lodge. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. They also gave us a free upgrade to a room with a view when they found out it was our honeymoon, the also gave us nightly turndown service and an autographed Mickey and Minnie Mouse picture. The rates were quite affordable, especially since we took advantage of Disney's military prices (40% off the listed room prices at all resorts). We found the transportation to most parts of the Disney property to be adequate, but the bus to Downtown Disney is HORRIBLE!! It took us almost an hour from the time we boarded the bus until we were let out at DTD West side. We were almost late to the Cirque du Soliel show (which I highly, highly recommend seeing). If you are planning on going to DTD and are on a schedule. TAKE YOUR CAR and save the headache of riding the buses. Jiko restaurant is truely awesome. It is expensive (the bill for my wife and I at dinner was right at $100). It does not have a kids menu, so take them somewhere else if they haven't gotten over hamburgers yet. It is a high end restaurant, so dress nice, but not formal (leave the necktie in your room). Don't miss Jiko, its probably the best restaurant Disney offers. Overall, I was very impressed by the new resort and will definitely stay there again in the future. Where else can you sit in a hot tub and see giraffes walking by?

Reviews.Title: “Maids steal!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well. All seemed fine until it was time for us to leave. I had put my wallet in my laptop bag, and had not taken it out for the entirety of the trip. Also, the laptop case had not left from the room since we had arrived. I took out my wallet once to get my ID, but then replaced it in the bag right away. When we arrived at the airport, I realized my wallet was not in the bag which I had not opened since we'd left the hotel. We called the Lost and Found the next day but the wallet was not there. They were also very rude to us and did not recognize the seriousness of the situation. They only said "Oh, it's highly unlikely that it was stolen b/c that has never happened before." Well, there's a first time for everything and this was it. So, now I'm out cash, checks, 2 credit cards, as well as several important cards I kept in the wallet. DO NOT STAY HERE! The maids WILL go through your stuff and remove anything they feel should be theirs!

Reviews.Title: “best we've ever visited”
Reviews.Author: Oscarwalrus
Reviews.Content: The Animal Kingdom Lodge was spectacular. We were priviledged enough to stay on the Concierge Level with a never-ending view of animals from our balcony. The early morning tour of Animal Kingdom was the highlight of our trip after which we were served the most scrumptious breakfast. The hotel staff were wonderful and fulfilled our every need. Room service is prompt and the food was still hot upon arrival. We can not say there was ever a negative side to the four days we spent at the lodge. Our room was spacious and clean, and the decor was pure African right down to the tile in the shower. Transportation within the parks was excellent. Drivers were friendly and service was on time. We enjoyed our stay and will definitely return again and again. The O'Brien Party

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I do agree that the resort is beautiful but for the price I paid I would rather stay at a Marriott for the amenities and service. The problems started before we got there - I told the Disney travel rep when I booked by phone that I wanted the Florida residency room rates and the 4-day pass. She kept me on the phone for over 30 minutes suggesting other resorts that I knew were not participating in the Florida reduced rates. I asked for a meal plan and got it but was NOT TOLD that I could not get the 4-day pass but instead got the Ultimate park hopper good only for my stay (3 nights & not long enough!) We waited in line 15 minutes to check in @ 9:00 pm. When we finally got to a representative, she was very helpful and pleasant, telling us about the lodge with maps etc. and she told me about the pass not being good for after we left! She also apologized that the only room available had a view of the parking lot. Oh well! We liked the room decor but here's what I noticed: - No brochures about the parks in the room. I had to go downstairs and wait another 10 minutes in the same line to get them. - No comment cards for feedback - Facial tissue and toilet paper were single-ply and rough! - The amenities (shampoo, etc.) came with Mickey Mouse labels but were not good quality. - No in-room coffee or tea (the Mara had tea for $1.79 per bag!) - Vending machines (and parks) have only Coca-Cola products including Dasani water (No Zepherills except off property) because of a contract. Similarly, McDonalds is available at each park. - Our room appeared neat but a bloodstain (mosquito bite?) that we caused on a pillowcase was still there after the room was cleaned - I expected fresh pillowcases with something that obvious. Water spilled on the desk was not wiped up either. The hot food at the Mara is a subset of the food at the Boma (buffet breakfast and dinner - $14.99 and $23.99 respectively without drinks). The Jiko is an a la carte restaurant (~$23 per entree) that used 2 "magical wishes" = meal points. We didn't have time for the pool as it rained most afternoons and we were trying to cram in all the parks we could without collapsing. We enjoyed our meal plan (Magical Wishes) which includes appetizer, entree, dessert, non-alcoholic beverage, taxes, and 15% tip! Very useful for dinner. Whenever we do another Disney trip, we probably won't stay at a "deluxe" resort if we stay at a Disney resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved AKL”
Reviews.Author: ginak
Reviews.Content: We visited the AKL the week of July 4th. The lodge was great. We ate at Boma and the Mara the food was wonderful at both. A little expensive but that is to be expected at Disney. We had a room w/ a bunk bed for the kids. There were animals at the balcony every day and the kids ages 5 and 11 enjoyed talking to the staff about the animals at the viewing area. There are several activities for the children such as a mickey hunt, board games, and cookie decorating at the Boma. They also loved the pool. The only problem that we experienced was that the room was not as clean as it should have been when we arrived and it took three calls before we got someone to actually come up to take care of it. It is truly a beautiful lodge and I think we would have been prefectly happy spending more time at the lodge instead of the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kindom Lodge Staff Stunk”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: OK, where do I start? First let me say that the hotel was absolutely beautiful, from the pool to the shopping, but thats about where it all ends. We checked in at the front desk Monday morning and from that moment on I felt like we were being sent through some sort of machine, these people and their customer service attitude or should I say lack of customer service really was lousy. The rooms were a little small for the price, we had a $400 plus room with a savannah view and to tell you the truth, save your money and get a economy room without the view and look at the animals at the various viewing locations in the hotel, you will not have time to enjoy the view from the room anyway and you will have extra money to spend on other things, i.e. the parks and food. We only ate at two restaurants while we were at the hotel, the Boma and the Mara. The Boma is a buffet style restaurant and the Mara is more of a mini-mart type place. If you happen to eat at the Boma, beware the customer service leaves something to be desired, make sure your waiter is not a fellow named Jeff, because if it is, you are in for a real surprise. The waiter was real friendly while he was seating us and was tying very hard to have us buy some overpriced Hawaiian Punch that Im sure he received commission for, and then came Mr. Hyde, we asked for a small cup of milk and the guy literally threw the coffee pot on the table and said he wasnt sure he could get it for us and he was real busy. He returned 20 minutes later with a cup of milk and threw the bill on the table hard and said have a nice day and no, he didnt mean it. $40 bucks for breakfast and a psycho for a waiter, well, at least the food was good. We also ate at the Mara, which is akin to a 7-11 with even higher prices. The service there was just about as bad as the Boma, the cashier was so busy trying to hit on the female customers that we literally waited 15 minutes in line trying to pay, when we got to the cashier, he too had an attitude and grabbed my credit card with even more attitude after we asked him to please move the line along, we ended up reporting him to a manager. All in all, the hotel is overpriced for the service you receive, if you like animals and are willing to fork over the extra 200 to 300 a night to look at a giraffe from your balcony then go right ahead. If Disneys customer service keeps going down the same path, people will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge is one of my favorite Disney resorts! Not only does this place have rooms with a view, it also has a huge pool that is open 24 hours a day, great food, a babysitting place, workout center, playground, and so much more! Our family loved the resort! The lobby at the Animal Kingdom Lodge was the most spectacular lobby I have ever seen! I would reccomend this resort to anyone and everyone! Great job Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Escape!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent a long weekend at the Animal Kingdom Lodge in a 5th floor concierge room (a great stay - the lounge offered a great place to relax and enjoy a few snacks). The room was decorated in rather dark colors, but we quickly adjusted and grew to love the rich woods. I hardly left the balcony - we were on the Arusha savannah and always had a variety of animals within eyesight, as well as birds. Three giraffes became frequent visitors of the trees below our room.We ate at all three of the dining choices here - Jiko was excellent with a fabulous wine list, Boma offered a great variety of exotic food choices for a reasonable price (and some of the wines too!), and the Mara had surprisingly interesting (and tasty) food for a food court. The pool was large and never really seemed crowded, though I imagine it would during spring break or a holiday weekend. Overall, a beautiful resort that transcends its theme park surroundings and becomes a destination in and of itself!

HotelInfo.Name: Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge
HotelInfo.Address: 2901 Osceola Parkway, PO Box 10000, Orlando, FL 32830
